comments: I respect him as an intellect but he most certainly lacks a sense of humanity. Monotone lectures, if you receive a bad grade on one assignment very difficult to rebound considering you are marked on essentially 3 elements. Content is definitely very difficult, I am typically a mid-high 80's student but I felt like I was drowning in this class.
Interesting introduction to Canadian law and issues surrounding it. Not really a philosophy course at all however. Seems like a nice enough guy, but pretty flat.

Not as good of a class as I thought it was going to be. If you're not into politics, law, the constitution, etc. I would suggest not taking it. Lectures are boring as he's pretty monotone. Makes a few funny jokes but is mostly sarcastic.

Lectures were great, he makes the texts very easy to understand and even uses cute little examples like "Sally" and "Little Timmy" to really clarify things and keep your attention. He didn't mark either of my essays, so I can't comment on his difficulty, but I came out of this class having learned a ton of things I'll probably never forget.

I usually do well in philosophy classes, but I'm really struggling with him and his class!! Philosophy of law is a HARD course just to get though, much less to do well in! GOOD LUCK if you have him in future years!

He could use a little more enthusiasm (tends to be very monotone), but he's clear in explaining the material (so points for that). Not exactly the most fun course in the world but the content isn't too bad (especially if you're interested in legal philosophy). I wouldn't avoid future courses with him, but I wouldn't look forward to them, either.

Waluchow is a wise man. He can be boring but he builds interesting legal analogies if you snap out of your trance. Encourages controversial and sometimes banal in class debates which either spark your attention or deteriorate your care. Your love of legal, political and moral debate will pull you through but if you don't have the passion good luck

Awesome. Focused directly on the quality of the work that you do. Rewards good work with good grades (and consequently gave me the best mark of my undergrad career). Wrote me a glowing letter of recommendation when I asked for one. Facilitates great discussions by pushing students to the limit of their reasoning abilities.

He's extremely knowledgeable and his lectures are clear and to the point. Unfortunately, the lectures tended to be boring and the material for the most part was very dry. Nevertheless, Waluchow is a helpful and kind prof and even though I disliked the class, overall I did like him.

Waluchow is really knowledgable and the way he lays out his lectures makes everything really clear. BUT THIS CLASS IS SO BORING. It really wasn't what I was expecting. I would not recommend taking it unless you are very interested in politics and whatnot.
Easily one of the best profs I've had.  He's clear, concise, and he takes his job very seriously.  I didn't realize at the time, but he's actually on the wikipedia page for jurisprudence.

He is an amazing prof! He speaks monotone and pretty softly but he delivers the material very clearly! I love law but not so much philosophy. having said that this course opened my eyes and made law much more interesting. If you don't like law or writing essays about legal/moral issues, this course will be a struggle. If not, it's a great course
Hated this class. 2 hours to write 2 essays and 8 paragraphs. Unless you LOVE law and have a lot of spare time, don't take this class.
His classes are HARD. Almost impossible if you don't have a strong passion and grasp of law. He is very nice, helpful, and makes lectures as clear as possible. But the classes are hard.

Very difficult class but if it weren't for Waluchow it would be unbearable. He's brilliant and makes great jokes. Waluchow expects a lot and you have to put the work in to survive. He's always been very helpful from my experience, I wish he taught more at Mac.
i asked for help once and he was kind of an ****. He definitely knows his stuff. Sometimes makes philosophy jokes. This class was tough though, but I think it's the TA's fault, not the prof.

Unarguably, the best professor of philosophy and law at McMaster Univeristy.  The professors knowledge in the areas are of great help.  His clarity certainly adds to his teaching style.  Also, he cares deeply about his students, and goes the extra mile to help them.  Overall, highly recommended.
Class was at 8:****ing 30 three times a week, including Fridays, ALL YEAR..Other than that, no complaints, occasionally funny aswell

The best professor that the philosophy department at McMaster has. He is one of a very select group of internationally recognized legal philosophers. If you are looking for an interesting class that is clearly presented enroll in anything taught by Dr. Waluchow.
Great

Awesome prof. :) Goes by the text book a lot but both his law class and Descartes class were good and  he encouraged everyone to think on their own :) Suffice it to say I will NEVER misunderstand the ball of wax example for as long as I live lol :)
No Comments

comments: Honestly the worst prof I ever had. Her syllabus was a her full year condensed into one semester. She messed up printing the midterm so put the multiple choice on projection and scrolled through it once during the test. Irrelevant personal details. Didn't hand back essays because her "husband was waiting for her in the car". I could go on

Her lectures were interjected with irrelevant commentary leaving it directionless. Midterms were unfairly specific, for example "which character said this line?" from a 500 page novel, as if she opened the book and selected facts at random instead of testing on relevant material like underlying themes...oh wait that she didn't teach!
She is really awesome! Very down to earth and fun to be around! Worth going to class just to talk to her

Horrible professor. Heavy reading list which is difficult to handle alongside other courses. Unsympathetic demeanor when it comes to illness or other important things. However if you go to her she will try to help you along. Unfair TA.

Didn't teach much about the genres the class focuses on. Instead, she focused on injecting feminist rhetoric into the lectures.She had a very unprofessional demeanor. Would complain about people getting in late, but then ramble on even after the time the class was scheduled to end passed.
Had a snarky additude..stopped the lecture of ppl came in late..yet she would run her own lectures late so we'd be late for our next class :S Exam was pretty hard..TA wasn't the fairest

An okay teacher, but focuses way too much on Feminism. Yes, books focus on gender...but they focus on other subject matters too. After 5 books, I was hoping that the main topic of each book wasn't going to be about gender.
enjoyable courseware, but lectures end up being useless, opinionated debates, and no notes were posted on web ct.
I liked her choice in materials, and despite the fact that i rarely went to class, what i did get from lectures was very detailed and helpful
confusing and disorganized
Very helpful, and a very entertaining class. Very lively discussions with controversial topics that everyone had an opinion on.

Dr. Merritt has a fantasticly dry sense of humour, which is rare and entertaining. She is an extremely fair marker, and it is evident that she takes the time and effort to thoroughly prepare her lectures. It is never a dull moment in her class and for that I am grateful.

Well, where do I start? Focus on one theory -feminism -very biased and often offensive..plays favourites..does not follow course outline (ex -added attendence 3 months in)..10 pop quizzes..very disorganized..yelled at a student in front of the class..don't ever disagree with her or anyone else in that class.. have no interest in class anymore

Professor Merritt is an AMAZING professor... she is very helpful and actually has fun teaching her class. You can tell she spends time on her leccture notes, and she IS well prepared. definitely one of my favourite profs so far... take her class, you won't be disappointed!
terrible! i did well in the class but due to no help of hers! very shy in front of the class and NOT a good speaker at all
I just love Dr. Merritt.  I think she's a very intellegent, well-spoken individual who is clearly interested and passionate about what she teaches.

distracting physical movements during lectures, sarcastic and offensive at points, wide range of difficult theory used to interpret literature in a first year course--too heavy, not enough time or effort to make the theory clear, and restricts the scope of literature to examples of theory.
zzzzzzzzz.... I've never seen a professor more unorganized than her.  And uncomfortable??  you'd think after teaching for years, you'd have some confidence in your teaching.  Not this lady.
I have nothing but good things to say about her.  She is the best prof I have had so far.
I love Dr. Merritt's class. I like the readings and find the class to be interesting. I'm always awake and alert despite the fact that I have the class at 9:30am on Fridays ;)
No Comments

A wonderful orator who isn't afraid to let her personal attachments to literary pieces show. She approaches the work with enthusiasm, is very likeable, and openly encourages the class to participate and let our own opinions out. Keep it up.
She's a great prof.  Very relaxed and makes note taking easy.  I liked her choice of material too.

comments: Dr. Pope is awesome. His lectures are organized and occasionally funny. He very obviously knows his stuff. He makes every class interesting and the content accessible and memorable. His tests can seems daunting to study for, but if you attend every lecture and take good notes, you'll be fine. Really enjoyed my semester with Dr. Pope!

Amazing prof! Extremely passionate about what he teaches and transfers all of that onto the students. Never a boring class with him! His teaching is a great contrast to the usual boring monotone professors. I would love taking more of his classes!!
This fair gentle for president. That is all.

Dr. Pope's classes are my favourite. I had a night class with him last year, and the night class wasn't bad because it he is so interested in what he is talking about that he gets you interested as well. His tests can be hard, but if you take the time to study, it is easy to get a good mark in his courses. He's young, really nice and funny.

Excellent Prof. by far one of my favorite profs I have so far at McMaster. He is easy to understand and you can tell he is truly passionate about what he is lecturing, which makes for engaging and interesting classes.
Dr. Pope is really good at keeping an interested audience entertained. Everything has a thorough explanation and the content is absorbed rather than brushed off.
Loved him! He was very articulate, and funny too. It doesn't hurt that he is really cute! Interesting assignments and a fair exam. I would definitely take more of his courses.

Awesome Prof! Really into the material and excellent lecturer. Slides were posted on-line so it wasn't completely necessary to attend class but it was helpful. It was a night class but often times we would get out 30 min early and have a break. Assignments were interesting.

Dr. Pope is the best prof. out there. So passionate about what he teaches that you can't help but fall in love with the subject. His expectations are clear and he is dedicated to making sure his students understand the subject. He is definitely the Ryan Reynolds of the Classics department.

Dr.Pope is an amazing prof, his lectures are clear, knows how to use powerpoint, and if you attend his classes and study for tests, you will get an A. And he is very helpful, always willing to talk to students.

Awesome Professor. Taught very well. He's VERY enthusiastic about archaeology, and ancient Greece and Rome. He's super funny and cute and he totally looks like Superman. Like come on, admit it he does. Tests are easy as long as you study and go to class. Thank you Dr Pope, you are an excellent prof!!

I agree, very knowledgeable and helpful, but its his job to be! At times the class was boring and lame, but he makes up for it by being easy on the eyes! He could teach his colleagues a thing or two about powerpoint. Tests are pretty fair if you go to class, slides for exam were wild card. Take this class only to fill your timetable.

Took this course with him in first year, loved it and loved him. Such a nice guy and genuinely cares about his students and whether they understand his material.  Works really hard to make his lectures very clear and his webct pages are excellent.
God I love this man, his class is the only one worth going to most days.  He's so fair and helpful, he should teach the rest of the department how to lecture and use powerpoint.  Good looking too.:)

Dr. Pope is a walking encyclopaedia of information and knowledge. He works incredibly hard and is a fantastic lecturer. He goes out of his way to help students with paper ideas and bibliogrpahy, and he is a lovely person. I wish he taught more classes because he is so enjoyable.
I hope the lectures get better because right now I am bored.  We are going so slow. But this seems to be his nature.  Good think he is easy on the eyes.  And for the record, he is married.
Very engaging prof, keeps class super interesting, excellent dresser, odd sense of humour, wonder if he's married?!!!  I think I'm in love........
Dr Pope is AWESOME!!! Loved the class and him!!! His tests/exams are extremely fair and if you go to class and pay attention you will do well...He's a great prof and KNOWS his stuff!!!
yeah hes hot but you have to wait it out until hes more comfortable to be rewarded by the class. and it IS very rewarding, once he becomes comfortable. He is also the nicest and most polite ever.

He really knows what he is talking about, is very clear on what is to be expected for the tests and exams - it nothing should come as a suprise. Funny and helpful. He is incredibly hot, and sounds exactly like Derrick Zoolander.

Dr Pope is amazing! He knows what he is talking about, is clear, bases his exams and tests directly on the lectures, and is really helpful after class as well. You need to go to his classes to do well, but if you do, it's not hard to get an A. Plus, he's amazingly hot, in a Ross Gellar kind of way. I hope I get to have him as a prof in the future!
Love this prof, at first I thought he was terrible, but as the term wore on he grew on me. Knows his stuff plus makes class go by pretty quick.

Dr. Pope is AMAZING ignore the previous post.  They obviously never went to class.  The man is incredibly nice and always willing to help.  Extremely fair both with marks and anything else.  Sure in the beginning he was quiet, but by the end of the year he was on fire!  :)

Wow, this guy is a shrew. He hid behind his booth and I could barely understand him. Very nerdy and seems full of himself with his knowledge. Did not enjoy this class at all and turned me off of history all together

Dr. Pope is AMAZING. A fair marker when the standards are high. He improved since last term. I enjoyed his style if you go to class it is easy to do well, and the essay assignments were interesting. It helps that he is easy on the eyes! ;O) I am soo glad he is staying. One of the best profs in the Classics Department!
I just would like to Thank Dr.Spencer, he is really good and explian the material very well. I hope you teach us every year. THANK YOU.

Dr. Pope is exactly like Ross Geller! He seems a little awkward, but if you listen he's really funny and interesting :) His lectures are well organized and his tests are straight from lectures. If you take good notes, it's easy to get a good mark.
Very intelligent man, and good looking. Needs to relax a little, otherwise very informative and enthusiastic!
a good guy, get a few beers into him and he'll come outta his shell soon enuf!
No Comments
Tall, moderately handsome BUT unclear, vague, pitchy, not helpful, does not give feedback, one can only hope that he'll loosen up and be actually competant in Greek Sanctuaries.
Dr. Pope was very helpful and accomodating to his students.  He explained things in a clear and concise manner which made the subject matter easier to understand.
No Comments
LOOOOVES HIM

Dr. Pope is fantastic! you have to pay attention in that class, or else you will be lost.  For God sakes people this IS university, you actually have to go to class and do some work!!!!  I hope he stays on, it will be nice to have some consistency in the department.  Ross Gellar all the way!
Two word: Ross Geller.

Dr. Pope is an awesome prof and you can tell that he really loves the stuff he is talking about. He's very funny, you just have to be paying attention to him to get the jokes. I hope he gets to stay on next year.

comments: Best prof for making useful material easy to follow!

Content is fresh - we learn how to use R to do our projects. Do the assignment bonus questions because they will appear on the tests and exam. Google is your best friend. His office is open for any kind of questions. Do the assignments, which will raise your marks to basically 80%+. This is a man who loves challenges so you should too and you will.

Best professor I have ever had. His assignments teach you to use R in RStudio and he provides all of the materials to be successful in the course. You will learn a lot about Econometrics from him and he is the reason many in our class enjoy our program.   I am honestly surprised anyone would rate Racine poorly. They must not do well on the exams...
Whatever on his assignment, will never be on his exam... Remember this and you will do well with little work.

Probably to best prof I ever had! One of the top in his field. His course is meant for you to learn how to apply the right techniques in research and not only simple model that are far from realistic. His exams are fair and reflects the assignments and the course material.  You will learn the theory and the coding that goes with advance metrics.
Oh Vlad, Oh Vlad, where did you go?

Hs doesn't know what is the point. His lectures do not focus on the real material but only some quick slides with funny comments and vugalar language. His exam emphasizes his own interests but not the material overall.
He never understands what is the core part of topics, instead, he only tests material that he finds interesting himself.

Racine is a great lecturer, possibly my favourite professor thus far.  He provides students with four very tough assignments to prepare students for his easy tests, so help each other out! HIGHLY recommend attending class or you will fail. Exam is difficult. Lectures are fast paced but very detailed and he loves to help students.

really cool prof. he is very fast though, you wont have enough time to copy his notes and pay attention. i went to class and payed attention and used the textbook rather than his notes. His assignments are tough but the tests and exam are super easy. Easy 12 if youre a hard worker.

Going to class is essential for doing well in this course. Don't listen to the morons saying it was hard, I had no background in statistics before this class and got an 11. Paying attention is critical as well as asking questions and going to office hours if you are confused. Exam questions are taken right from class notes and assignments.

He refuses to post his notes then makes his notes so long that you can't truly pay attention in class because you're too busy copying. You'll leave class with no idea what you covered - you're better off reading the textbook from home. He's a good guy but he needs to radically rethink how he teaches the course. Easy material - HORRIBLE delivery.

The later half of lectures can be confusing at first, but keep up with the assignments and this course is an easy 12. The prof is very approachable, and goes out of his way to help students and genuinely cares about students.

This course is definitely not for slackers. The assignments are challenging but you get 2 weeks to work on them, so plenty if time to clear any doubts. If you attend classes and keep up with the material, there is no excuse to get anything else than an 8.

You will have a lot of work in this class, at least in comparison to other classes. There are several tests and assignments that aren't easy but they aren't hard either. Understand the concepts (they aren't that hard) and memorize your formulas and you will be GOLDEN!
The course is presented well, he definitely knows the subject, but if you don't give this course 150% it will bite you in the butt.

Basically he makes you copy out a million notes that make no sense unless you've read the txtbook and ur already smart in stats. His assignments and tests are extremely hard. I wouldn't recommend taking his class unless you want to attend every class, work your a** off and still fail.

This guy make 160 grand a year and instead of theaching stats he spends have the class fiddling with his stupid R program. Doesn't post his notes and doesn't tell you where you are in the text book. Overall I don't like him, but if your not stupid its not too bad.

One of the best professors ever. Disregard what the other morons said, If you don't attempt problems or check your notes and book and approach him expect to be told to do so. Midterms and assignment problems were taken straight from the book, it appears some people don't know about studying. Would love to take a class with him again.

Class average is 51 and he still blames students, you should know Dr it is your mark, too. You gotta be real fast in writing to catch up with his slides. Why don't you post those slides on WebCT, they are not top secret documents, right.
If you want a nightmare take his class. Very poor in teaching, no examples at all.
He is awful. I thinks he orgasms when he sees student s are in difficulty. He justt gave one assignment, collected and another assignment same day. Don't take his class if you don't have to.
gave away money for finding errors in his lecture notes...easy tests..just know your stuff

Too many lecture notes, all you do is copy notes in class and have no time to understand what he says. Ridiculous and overpriced textbook. Hard midterms but fair final exam. The course was way too rushed and the TAs are extremely hard markers. Good luck taking this course.

Horrible professor, very inconsiderate, not replying emails. He covered materials he taught on Wed afternoon in the Thurs tests. No chance to ask if there's any question. Tons of lecture's notes, but not posting on web site. Everyone is copying his notes like crazy in every lecture, with no time listening to him.

comments: Dr. Hyman was a fantastic lecturer who spoke with the class, not at the class. He made the texts studied relevant by relating them to current and historical events and created a space were students were able to share their opinions . His assignments were fair and he was flexible with deadlines when asked. One of my favorite first year profs!

Amazing lecture style. My tutorials we're super relaxed and interesting. I would take his course even if I wasn't interested in the content I enjoyed his teacher so much. Really personal and just super interesting. Just be prepared for the many novels you read throughout the course.

For starters, Dr. Hyman is adorable. He lectures like no other; he doesn't even 'lecture,' rather, he DISCUSSES. The class was made up of conversation and discussion. Many students participated, and he makes the learning environment very open and comfortable.

I definitely enjoyed this class. Put the work in, actually read the books (or at least read a few and try to understand what's going on in the others via sparknotes, that's what i did), and unless you're horrible at writing essays i think you should do well. The tutorials are really helpful. Also, Dr. Hyman is absolutely adorable
Best first year class out there.
Not such a great teacher.  Tended to be on the dull side and not so encouraging for students to do well.
He is a great professor. He's very encouraging and never makes you feel like your opinion is wrong.

A very kind and interesting prof who appreciates and encourages student participation and input. If you read the books and attend the lectures you will do extremely well. A Great Prof that got me interested in canadian lit. Take his class if you can!

A wonderful professor and an extraordinary person. Hyman is a gifted lecturer and cares very much about his students. Any class taken with him is sure to be compelling and very worthwhile. Having taken three classes with him, I can honestly say that they were the undisputed highlights of my undergraduate career.
no comment..

Hyman really knows his stuff & I appreciated his very well thought out lectures (his books were always filled w/ very neatly placed & colour coded post-its). But, what Dr. Hyman knows is What He Knows and he (along w/ the class) will know nothing else! For eg, "Klee Wyck" lectures are almost identical no matter what course code. (But he IS lovely!)
Great teacher!
I majored in English thanks to this man. Mac needs more profs like this.
Wish I had more classes/profs like this one.
improved my writing a tonne, extremely clear and well-thought out lectures. manages to get the entire class involved in discussions, despite size. does tend to repeat important concepts ad infinitum.

A born teacher! His class is a comfortable and casual learning experience. I can still hear him explaining the centre and margin, and referencing that no man is an island."I am a rock, I am an Island". Not bad for taking this course three years ago! He is a very understanding man.

I took this course in my first year and he REALLY helped me learn how to write better.  Because of his extra help, I'm convinced it made me a better scholar. He took the extra time, and put HUMAN into HUMANITIES.  Thanks!

Dr. Hyman is not only brillant, but also a very approachable prof.  Even though it is a large class, he creates an environment very conducive to learning and discussion.  I have really enjoyed this class!

I actually look forward to going to his lectures! They're very interesting and thought-provoking. He takes a genuine interest in his students, and somehow manages to conduct discussions in a class of 200 people! Very impressive.
I really like his classes, awesome prof.

Dr. Hyman is, despite some of the comments here, one of the most open minded profs I've met; he truly cares about the material he teaches, respects his students and is simply brilliant.  Even if he looks like Chancellor Palpatine.

Has a habit of pretending he's openminded when he isn't at all... the class is very unfocused and disscussion-based, which can be good at times I guess...course material was VERY dull and he didn't really help it much
Fabulous professor.  Very easy going and willing to discuss issues, debates in class, will listen to what each student has to say
He's still there?  I liked him back in '80!

He's very friendly, supportive, approachable.  Thinks he's open-minded but is not, which is unfortunate.  Very disorganized and unwilling to enforce structure.  Class suffered greatly as a result.  Quickly reduced to an unfocussed, unengaging course.
An amazing, brilliant man.  Not many profs could make me go to my only class on a Friday, but for this prof it is always worth it.  TAKE HIS CLASSES!
He is definitely the best prof i've had as well.  If only all profs were as open and accepting of different interpretations...
Best Prof at Mac !!!  I based my entire schedule around him.  Take any class he is teaching.  You won't be disappointed.
unprepared for class -focuses too much on beginning course material with no time for second semester
Best English prof at Mac. Hands Down!

comments: Honestly this guys a boss. But that aside he set up the course terribly. No one has any marks back and the course is over so I guess we all just cross our fingers.
Such a smart guy. I've taken his 3O03 class as well and he is one of the best profs I've ever had. Take his classes.

Sweetest prof ever! He is extremely intelligent, but also extremely humble. What a joy to find both in a caring man. He is hilarious! Made methods enjoyable. Loved going to his class, but frustrated when most of the class didn't do the readings so we could have some discussion. Take his courses if you can...wish I had taken more with him.
Best prof ever. hilarious. fair. fun.

Absolutely hilarious and amazing professor. Keeps all his courses interesting. I try to be in as many of his classes as possible. Only for this guy would I take an 8:30 class willingly just to have him as a prof.

He is the most pleasant human being on earth. He makes the world a better place for all those who come in contact with him on a day to day basis. He is the best professor in teaching and funniest guy ever. His jokes and stories will make you happy and cheer your mood. He is an incredibly fair person and he is very modest despite his achievements.
The best. Do whatever you can to take his courses!
He is the BEST... PROF... EVER

He is the most angel prof I have met in my whole life. The best prof at mcmaster University, care for his students immensly, provide lot of multiple choice practise exams in class after every chapter, to prepare you for exams, and says funny hilarious things to make you happy and jokes always.
So funny! Seriously, the only thing I didn't like about this class was the fact that it was 8:30 in the morning. Other than that, there were tons of jokes and you learned a lot of valuable stuff too.
He rocks, he is so funny....he is very nice and helpful!
Professor Shaffir should be the next president of McMaster University or maybe even Prime Minister of Canada. He is that good. ALWAYS in a good happy mood

He's the brightest guy in the sociology department and the only prof I've had who actually feels an actual concern and responsibility for his students performance. Never a boring lecture. He always has something interesting and funny to tell you. His classes just lightened up my day. His tests are all multiple choice which is a nice thing. Love him
Shaffir is the best. He'll actually make you love University. Must take his class
Great intro. course. Thank god for no essays, the course was way to general for them. His MC exams were a bit tricky. But I enjoyed his lectures and dry sense of humour.
dr. shaffir is the greatest man in the whole world
SIK TEACHER really interesting and funny deserves a big raise
awesome class. awesome proff. hilarious even at 830 in the morning. very pleased.
Awesome prof.  Really funny.  Kept me interested all the time!

Outstanding prof. Very smart teacher. A leader in his field. He is generous, helpful, flexible and  easy-going. I firmly believe that he is the best prof for Introductory Sociology. His course should be a must for every McMaster student. If you study hard and don't leave your readings until the day before a test, you can get a good mark from him
Best Professor I had ever seen
after 8 years at mac, this 1st year prof still stands out in my mind. excellent... i wish i had appreciated it at the time!
Wicked prof, very helpful.  Has to be one of the best at MAC

Shaffir is one of the nicest guys I have ever met. He is a nice, kind person, and incredible prof, with entertaining lectures. He truly cares about your education and makes sure students get good grades. Attending class is very important because he gives lots of practice multiple choice questions in class. To do well, just keep up with the reading
Best prof at McMaster
Dr. Shaffir is a great prof and a truly wonderful person. He replies to email so fast and is always happy to meet with students. Says funny things in class all the time. He's a very good man.

Really nice guy, but tends to go off on tangents that aren't too relevant. A 6 unit course for 2 mult-choice tests and an exam? sign me up!  I don't find his weird humour very funny at all, but everyone else seems to laugh so maybe you will enjoy it :)

Awesome awesome class.  If you're going to take a night class, this is one of them. He's hilarious and makes sociology extremely interesting. His tests are pretty easy. Go with the text and his overheads.
HE IS THE FUNNIEST GUY EVER! GO TO CLASS JUST TO HEAR HIS JOKES! AMAZING CLASS!

He's a really great guy and a great prof, but his tests are tougher than he thinks. Means well, but the last test was a bit confusing. Maybe it's just that sociology is tough. I like his lectures a lot. He's really interested and enthusiastic about what he's teaching. An all around cool guy.
Excellent professor
So vague...no real notes. Must rely on textbook heavily
hilarious! funniest prof i've ever met. his stories are ridiculous! awesome class.
Such a great person and teacher! Great! Take one of his classes...

Wonderful man. The stories and jokes he uses to explain concepts are awesome beyond words. makes me laugh. This one is the only class  worth showing up for. Course material is quiet dry, but he livens it up
Hillarious prof
Amazing prof!!! Really entertaining lectures. His jokes are so funny.. the only class I can stay awake in. Some questions on the exam were tougher than what I hoped. Very knowledgable prof..
the test was hard
a little unapproachable, I think because he needs glasses, this is a straight forward, no pressure, enlightening course for the non-sociological inclined.
funniest prof ever...so much FUN...love going to class!!!
Lectures can sometimes be repetitive but otherwise an interesting professor
This guy makes the day more bearable.  Very approachable, understands life's pressures.  Always willing to take that extra minute to assist.  Preparing students well for the "real world"
He is really funny, good prof.  Teaches things you actually want to hear about, relates to students!  Take it, it's one of the most interesting classes.
Great class and good prof!! The material is very interesting!!
best class ever
Best when mixed with Haas ...
Still There ? ... Wow I figured he would have returned to Montreal by now :)
No Comments
cool prof...very funny and interesting lectures

comments: This class is okay IF you know how to prepare for his tests. Lectures serve no real purpose (he drones on and doesn't go through ANY examples with the class). Disclaimer: IF YOU WANT TO PASS HIS MIDTERMSEXAM - buy the custom courseware of previous midterms and exams. Learn the theory and then keep doing questions in those past tests over and over.

Most people fall asleep in his class. Hard to hear unless you sit at the front. He does not go through examples well at all and doesn't make an effort to show calculations on PowerPoint or projector. His teaching style for this type of class is terrible.
Has been teaching the course forever but goes through examples that are completely useless and irrelevant for the exam. The textbook is the only way to study for this course.

The best prof at mcmaster, hands down. The course can be difficult but every course material like the courseware, textbook and exam package prepares you. He is the nicest prof I have ever met and doesn't throw random questions onto the midterm. Makes finance seem easy, understandable and interesting!
class is useless. very hard to pay attention to. ended up going for attendance marks but taking other things to work on. could easily destroy the class with his midterms but chooses not to.

it's pointless going to his class - he passes articles around and goes off topic for 15 mins and expects you to get back on track when he starts about finance again. i found the exam package/lecture notes helpful, but skip class and spend the time reading the text/lecture notes and you'll get 7+
Worst prof. Does not explain concepts well. Courseware is also useless.
Class is useless, except to see his sexy face

He is a very approachable and helpful professor, and will go out of his way to help with class questions or other advice. The material is challenging, though his previous exams are a VERY good indicator of how you will do on the current year's exams. If you learn the theory and read the book, not just memorize question answers, you will do well.

Class's were useless, he didn't teach instead had a discussion with us mostly about his family, farm or friends. The exam was as unfair as him, and at end of the class you leave learning nothing, but your memorization skills improve!
second worst prof at degroote behind BUCHANAN...lectures will put you to sleep. he thinks you know everything and does not prepare you for tests at all.

After Brandon hall burned down and people still wrote the midterm on 2hrs sleep he said 'thats life'. When asked to slow down and not skip over things that would "insult our intelligence" his response was "I'm not going to baby you". Saturday classes are a total waste of time! best way to study is to do a midterm WITHOUT looking at the answers.
he was a very friendly prof and very fair on his midterms. his final is killer though -- but if you study hard for it -- you'll get the grade you desire. study study study!
prof was very good at explaining things and if you did not understand during the lecture, he would simply explain it afterwards in more detail
Dr. C is money, worlds away from deaves and his faithful $*$#$ bhandari

Never learned anything from this class. The lectures consist of reading through the courseware, hard to follow. He seems like a nice guy, but can be suprisingly rude. He's been a prof forever, won't update his teaching methods. Tests are relatively easy if you do all the practice tests, he doesn't change the questions!
Amazing
Very nice person and very helpful. Interesting lectures. Easy midterms but very hard final.

Great guy. Class was interesting for the most part. Don't really agree with alot of the people's opinions on here. Maybe get to know him better and you will see how helpful he is. Overall I really enjoyed the class and the prof was great.

This guy is alright. I didn't like how he refuses to make use of a website. I think I fell asleep in his lectures about 1/2 the time, they were quite boring.  This was the type of class where you can just read the text book, practice a little bit and you'd be fien. I will admit however, his tests we
I remember going to him for help and he was very helpful. Very down to earth, very approachable. A bit boring in class, but hey its finance.
Smart guy
Super nice guy, a bit old school
he seemed a little lazy but really seemed to care about his students
great prof
VERY NICE, DOWN-TO-EARTH, VERY INTELLIGENT.  BEST PROF EVER!

This professor has been teaching this class for almost 30 years and does not adapt his teaching style as the years pass on. His methods contradict the text and overall, he is not an effective teacher.
Dude thinks he's the shiznit when really he's the shiznot.  He talks about his benzes like i ain't got non, what he think i sold em all?
Best teacher ever!!! Changed my major because of him!!!
decent but a bit arrogant
lectures were useless for dealing with midterms and exam

comments: Didn't go to class and just studied like crazy before midterms and finals. The bonus's she gave out were great.
Podcasts are detailed
Unbelievably easy course! Well taught, not boring - contrary to what others say! Tests are really easy and fun to write
Easy A, tests are pretty easy
She gives a ridiculous amount of bonus's, course was extremely easy. BUT she is extremely boring professor, be prepared to fall asleep

Very very friendly! Not only is she a great teacher, she makes it very easy to succeed. Plus, she gets right down to the basics, and doesn't bore you with the details. This makes her lectures and videos very easy to follow.
The easiest prof for ECON 1B03. Very generous with mark calculations. If you get this prof and don't get a 90, you're doing something wrong.

One of the best profs I had so far. Lectures and content taught and class were straight to the point. Professeur Holmes is very organized and professional and she also gave out numerous bonus oppurtunities to boost your mark.
Gave a lot of bonus opportunities, easy course if you study and do practice questions and you don't even have to attend lectures everything is posted online.
I will not take this prof ever again

Super fun course, Prof. Holmes is a great instructor. You don't even need to attend lectures because she puts all the videos of concepts you need to learn online!! And If you're too lazy to sit through all the videos, simply getting the textbook and reading it nets you a high grade.  She also scales tests!!! 10/10 would take again
Nicest prof ever! As long as you listen to her lectures and do some practice problems you should be fine.

Very straightforward professor, Don't need the textbook, Gives you clear examples which consist of simple math. If you review these examples, keep up with her lectures to some degree, easy 12. She gives tons of bonus marks, and midterms and exams are fairly easy !
God bless Holmes

2 midterms, and an exam - that's it   exam was non-cumulative! (its basically another midterm)   "lectures have all the required info for midterms/exams" - the textbook is not a necessity (although it may be helpful)  posts all lectures online the day after! (so you can choose when you listen to the lecture)
Hannah Holmes is a great prof. She gives lots of extra credit opportunities. If you actually read the slides before the tests and do the practice she gives, you'll get a good mark in the course.
Good
Good students will find it impossible not to get a 12 in her class. She's a clear lecturer and very helpful

Exams are confusing and the class appears easy and clear, tests are FAR harder then you study and practice for. Really not clear about how to apply the examples in her exams and notes and podcasts aren't provided if you miss class. GO TO CLASS. NEVER MISS the tutorials, tells you what to expect. But it's much harder than she says.

Took 2G03 in the summer, she provides amazing notes along with practice tests and reviews along with answers. Actual exams are twice as hard as she tries to use more confusing equations. Study and you will get at least a 7. Should not be compared with Econ 1B03 as the material is much harder. Has a lot of math. Does not have podcasts. Good luck!
Almost so easy it gets boring.. hard to take the class seriously. She is a lovely woman but not professional - depends on the student pretty much. Still a generally easy course - PODCASTS!

Super easy course, common sense and simple math will get you through. Don't buy the textbook, mine is still in the plastic. Slow lectures but very thorough. Never went to class, watched the podcasts (exact same as lectures) and went into the final with 100.

Nothing special. She would not even lecture (she only read the powerpoints). She could be funny at times, but it seemed as if she did not take us 1st years seriously. Do not take the course as an elective, you will lose interest and receive an unsatisfactory mark. Easy midterms (2), difficult final. The TAs who would host review lectures were bad.
This is not a bird course! Wow was it hard. Exam was brutal all calculations.
All calculations. Many struggled, including engineering students! I dropped the course. Im an Integrated Science major.
This class was so easy, basic math and common sense could get you through. Her lectures were very slow moving though
Great prof, teaches well.
One of the best profs ever! She makes university/class much easier for everyone and gives you so many bonus marks, you can easily get an 11 or 12 :) highly suggest taking a course with her

I really don't know how anybody can think this class is difficult. As somebody who is in the faculty of science and who definitely didn't have hot marks in first year, I can definitely say this is the easiest course I've ever taken. Holmes gives tons of bonus marks and her tests are close to identical to the previous tests she posts. Easy 11-12.
good prof, easy course
For an intro microeconomics class the exams were all calculations. Many struggled, including engineering students! Difficult!

Holmes is such a great professor! Although she teaches from the slides, I don't recommend skipping class because she explains it in a way that you'll remember when you go to study. The course is relatively easy but I wouldn't say it's a "bird" course because you do need to do work and study.
her classes was clear and straightforward. tests and exams all have bonus questions. easy to get high marks.
ONLY Engineering and somewhat science students do well in her class. Exams are very difficult because they're all calculations. Half dropped. THIS IS NOT A BIRD COURSE!
Very detailed notes, can be boring at times but generous in giving examples and bonuses
The midterms were okay, study and you'll do fine, however, the exam was insanely difficult. I bought the textbook for nothing as I never even opened it.
Very nice and informative, gives a lot of bonus marks for the tests.  The midterms were relatively easy but the exam was super hard!

Great prof, explains things well, no need for the textbook, has random bonus questions on midterms and exams about personal things about her which she'll randomly bring up in class. (Like favourite football team, what her cat's names are, does she have a cow named after her). Little quirky, but she's good.

Good lecturer, posts all notes and podcasts online.  Teaches right from slides, so don't feel bad about missing a class.  Textbook is a waste, exam questions taken from Avenue, so focus on those, and you're guaranteed at least an 80.  Would recommend.
Favourite teacher ever
an amazing prof! one of my fav. so far..shez really clear with what shez saying..her quizzes help to stay on task..and shez really nice :D
great teacher - took her awesome slides for granted until i had second sem ECON with O'Shaughnessy (spelling?) shes a great speaker, has great notes, and is pretty much great all around :)
A little too slow

Great Prof, especially her Sports Econ class, shes a huge sports fan so she made it interesting, her tests were easy, but still allowed you to learn and gain knowledge from the course, well organized, and dont have to spend 100$ on textbooks
I do not like her at all.

Very easy prof, lets you out early. You don't need the textbook, read her powerpoints. Not for everyone though: she loves sports/football, and paraphrases from her powerpoints. Many people don't go to classes and still do really well. Personally I didn't like her because she didn't make econ interesting. (and it's boring to begin with)

You don't need the textbook, read her powerpoints. Very easy prof, lets you out early. Not for everyone though: she loves sports/football, and paraphrases from her powerpoints. Many people don't go to classes and still do really well. Personally I didn't like her because she didn't make econ interesting. (and it's boring to begin with)
shes cool

Hands down:the easiest course you will get in university! nice prof, explains stuff well, lectures and podcasts posted online, textbook isn't even required. the one class i can study 6 hours before the test and make an 80+
She is an excellent prof. She always explain clearly.
great course and teacher, but interest is very low :(
best prof of my first semester!
genuinely a nice person who enjoys teaching - you really dont need to go to class; her lecture notes are VERY good. do the assignments online as theyre really similar to her tests.
i seriously love this prof. she is amazing!

she basically reads off the slides . extremely boring class - go if u like to waste time. her notes are excellent however - dont buy the textbook - memorize her notes and u'll get that A+. she cancelled a lot of the classes so that she can watch her football team play...
Nice Prof, extremely easy. Do not need to go to class, nor buy the textbook. Just get her lecture notes and study them for the tests and the final. She loves them Packers too.

If you want to go class and teach then forget about that with this proff.She just read power point slide.Doesn't explain anything.Only this gud about this course is it was so easy.That's why we got marks.Not because she tough us

One of the best profs i had this year. Definetly recommened going to class [although you dont really need to] - but i would go since she really makes the topics interesting. take this class if u are a visual learner and are good with basic math. tests are multiple choice, an easy doublt digit, but have to put in some extra effort to get that 12.
Good teacher

I found her dull, but a 'good' professor. In order to do well in her tests and exam, you need to apply yourself--not just memorizing. For this course, it's not worth going to the lectures because the podcasts and her slides are all you need. The only reason to attend her classes is to get the answers for those bonus questions.
Really nice teacher. The subject itself is boring, but she tries to make it fun and has a good sense of humour!
Very straight forward prof. She won't ruin you. Excellent. Her test are to the point. Very helpful.

Painfully boring class. Only because the material was awful. She's very friendly and approachable and is really dedicated to helping everyone succeed. Her powerpoints are AWESOME, you won't need the text at all.
Great prof. Her lectures are detailed and she makes stats interesting. She is full of life so even though the topics can get boring, she tries to make it better.
i suck at math, but she made it okay. interesting for a boring subject. i'm sure she's engaging if you get math too.. overall a pretty good prof.
overall a great teacher.  she makes the class enjoyable with great examples that the students can relate to.  she also fills us in on her social life.

Her class is really boring like its my least favorite one to go to, but the fact that her notes are so detailed and her test and exam are entirely based on them, it makes up for it. Shes a good prof to have particularily for such a boring class lol
Amazing teacher, makes a boring subject very interesting.  Very clear and concise with examples, highly recommended.
I love this prof. Definetly one of the best profs at mac.
very good instructor
Easy class, and its in part of how she teaches it.  Only 2/3 tests are kept and the bonus questions are free marks.  The class can be boring but her examples are clear and consise.

To be honest, i rarely go to class, since i find economics really boring. but i do occasionally go, and hannah seems to be a very nice person. she throws bonus questions onto tests relating to some random anecdote she has told the class in the last month. out of 3 tests, you only keep the best 3. easy marks. dont settle for any of the other profs.
alot of notes, but she makes the class very easy

comments: Good course. Going to minor in anthro now. It's lecture heavy (2 per week) but lectures are interesting and she podcasts them so if you miss one then you can catch up. The topics covered are interesting too.
Really liked the class. Shes clear, to the point and explains things well. Really helpful in office hours.

She posts all her capture lecture podcasts online so you if you miss a class you can just watch that, or rewatch to study for tests. Class is made up of 2 tests and 2 assignments. I hear shes a hard marker but my TA marked my assignments.

McGarry gives great lectures in class and also posts her powerpoints online which is helpful, as there was 3 lectures/week for this class. She is clear and very interesting. Overall a really good and fair prof

Karen McGarry has really good lectures which she literally podcasts so you don't even have to go to class. She's super smart and you can tell she clearly knows what she's talking about in lectures. Beware that the assignments are pretty stupid, but overall this class is worth taking if you have her.
Took it in the summer and was amazing. Concise and clear lectures, and she uses lots of examples. Half the course was papers and the other half exams. Taking 1AB3 now and really enjoy it.

She obviously knows what she is talking about but other than that she is horrible. She reads off the screen and posts all the slideshows on avenue so you don't have to go to all the classes. She is one of the most condescending people I have ever heard speak, steer clear of her if possible.

The class wasn't super difficult but I barely attended lectures because all of the slideshows were online and she was kind of boring to listen to. I'm taking another anthropology course in my second year but I will be avoiding the prof again. Skip buying the textbook; I never even opened mine.

Lectures are well structured and interesting. McGarry is clearly passionate about anthropology and genuinely concerned about her students. She makes the exams and assignment criteria extremely clear and offers many opportunities to ask questions and get help. Wonderful class and professor!

Dr. McGarry is a wonderful professor, and one of my favourites here at Mac. She goes over assignment and test info in depth (but not in a boring way) and genuinely cares about her students. Her lectures were great, lots of interesting content, and she explains it well. You can tell she has a passion for anthropology. Highly recommend.
Really easy class, I only had two papers and two exams. She obviously cares about her students and wants you to do well. Responds to emails super quickly and really helpful

Nice prof, engaging, covered interesting material, approachable and wanted people to succeed. Short multiple choice midterm and exam, no tutorials. Posted slideshows/podcasts online. One big assignment worked on throughout the semester. Only bad thing about this class was my assigned TA.

This class was phenomenal, she's a great prof who's very passionate about anthro and it shows in her lectures. She's very funny, is always willing to help if you as for it, and makes lectures very interesting. As long as you read the text and go to or listen to the lectures you'll do well!
This class was amazing!! the information was interesting and the Prof made it easy to want to come to class. she is a tough marker but she gives great feedback and ways to improve on your writing
Clear, interesting lectures and the essay structure gives lots of chances to improve. Enjoying this class.

It's sort of hit or miss with lectures, some are interesting some are very dry. She's pretty great as a person, very funny, very intelligent but the content can sometimes be slow. A little bit of a tough marker but you get what you put in! She has office hours and is willing to help if you ask for it.
Her voice is so nice to listen to, she's very clear, straightforward, and open to questions. content is interesting
Class had no tutorials, so no attendance. She always posts lecture powerpoints and podcasts online. Really enjoyed her lectures, she is very clear and interesting to listen to.
Took it last winter. Great course and always ready to help out with assignments.
Great Prof and excellent lectures - I always paid attention because topics were so interesting. Decided to minor in anthro because of her.

Amazing professor! I actually changed my major because of her and made me want to go into anthropology! A well around women and makes the class relatable and interesting! Small amount of projects which is a good thing and a bad thing as you need to do well on project, midterm and final exam. Overall amazing!
Really great prof, she's there for you when you have questions, she's passionate about her teaching. I'm taking another of her course and I'm looking forward to it.
Amazing teacher, really personable! Very funny. Go visit her in office hours will help you alot with essays even email her first drafts and she will go over it
Great Prof! topics were interesting and lots of chances to improve writing

This course had interesting topics that were easy to follow, but I found McGarry SO BORING when she would teach the material.... like the textbook was more interesting... but still an easy AB if you put in a decent amount of work!
great course! decided to take anthro as double major
I absolutely loved McGarry's 1AA3 class. She's very clear and is able to make her lectures interesting!

TAKE ANTHRO 1AA3! Prof. McGarry is an excellent lecturer, she's so funny, and she's always available to answer any questionsconcerns via emailAvenueoffice hours. She cares about the content, therefore making it very interesting to the students.
She was hilarious, always making the class laugh. She also always replied to questions of the discussion board very quickly and throughly. Overall great teacher.

Dr McGarry is amazing! Such a intelligent woman and a great asset to McMaster. She's actually very helpful, and when students ask questions in lecture she is always concerned and gives fantastics answers. She's young, enthusiastic, charismatic and very approachable! Favourite professor, I will take her classes throughout University.
GOOD LECTURER AND GOOD MATERIAL. WOULD TAKE ANOTHER CLASS.
Took it as an elective last fall but ended up with anthro as a minor. She's a good professor and gives chances to improve with bonus questions on tests. Course material was interesting too
Overall a great Prof. Gives lots of chances to improve marks. Fair assignments and interesting lectures.

She was very clear and very passionate about the topics.  Theory isn't the easiest class, but she tried to make it interesting and she provided lots of chances for students to improve and get help. Overall, a great teacher.
Good topics and interesting prof. Exams aren't too bad; all multiple choice. It's important to go to lecture. A lot of info she covers isn't in the book.
great elective class.

McGarry is a great prof, as you get into upper year courses everything becomes more detailed. I learned a lot from her theories course, not an easy class so don't try to stack. She'll give you a mark you deserve, you gotta work for it.
Great class and good content that kept my interest. Good elective course!
Fantastic and easy
Caring and friendly prof. Was helpful when I needed assistance with my essay. Straightforward course and interesting material.
Loved this class. Friendly and knowledgeable Prof.

Great prof!  Definitely the best I've ever had. Her lectures are interesting and she's very good at explaining the subject so that it makes sense and seem relevant. I wish every class I'm taking was this way. Karen goes out of her way to be helpful and is always available to answer questions or help me work through any problems. A++

Professor provided examples that engage more interest for students to learn Anthropology. Great marking scheme, 2 fair and straight-forward MC tests that are manageable as long you study and 2 critical assignments that develops your writing skills. Overall, good class to consider as an elective
She's a phenomenal lecturer!! She makes anthropology so interesting and this is the main reason why I look forward to coming to this class. She's really approachable and friendly!!
VERY interesting topics discussed in class. had 8:30 classes but never fell asleep because she made it so interesting.

comments: Dr. Ernest R Mead was one fine gentleman. He touched the life of every student he taught. He is now up in the heavens teaching statistics to the angels and touching their lives. What a man! RIP Dr. Mead.
Rest In Peace, Dr. Mead
Loved him. May his soul R.I.P forever. Miss him at the University. His teaching was remarkable beyond what you would normally expect from a professor.

I heard the school is planning to make a new statistics building on campus to honour DR. Mead, and it will be called Mead Hall. In lieu of flowers, students gave crib sheets and formula sheets with statistics formulas and proofs, written beautifully at his funeral, that took place at the funeral home near signature spa on barton street. We miss him

The city of Hamilton is going to name a street near McMaster in memory of the Late Great Ernest Mead. It's going to be called Mead Street and there will be a giant picture of his head hanging from all the stop lights.

There is a saying "Only the good die young", Dr Mead proved it's true. A person like him deserved to live atleast 100 years. Everybody is missing him now. Even though he is not with us physically, he is there in our thoughts. We cherish the great moments he taught us actuarial math, and celebrate his life. His teaching skills were second to none.

Who says Dr. Mead is no longer with us. He is very much alive and still with us. He lives in our hearts and is alive in our memories. Everyone, even now, has wet eyes when Remembering Dr. Ernest Roy Mead. We still remember him with the highest regards and affection. He was a true gentle man and his glass was almost always half full. R.I.P
I hope the Good Lord takes care of him.
He touched many lives when he was on this earth.
He was great as a professor. God bless him.

God bless him. May his soul rest in peace. The angels up in the sky are lucky to have such a great and genuine professor teach statistics to them!! Please dont torture the angels with your proof questions like you did to us. All your students in planet earth miss you.

I really miss this professor. He was so kind to us. Although he did not provide a formula sheet and included lots of proof questions, he was still such a nice person. I was very shocked when I heard he is no more. May the Lord be with him. Dr. Mead you were the best actuarial professor that ever taught at Mcmaster!!!

I feel very sorry for this professor. Everybody hated him, but he was such an old man. Now he's left us forever. May his soul rest in peace. He's in a better place now. R.I.P Dr. mead, gone but you will be alive in our hearts.

I took his course in the summer and he was unbelievably mean. He wanted us to learn the formulas of the entire course!!! No professor ever does that. God bless him. When people would ask for information about exam, his standard reply was: This information has not been given out. All topics covered in class are eligible. People had nightmares.
Bye bye. We'll miss you.
So sorry to hear you're gone. Boo hoo!
God bless his soul. may his soul rest in peace. One of the best professors I've ever seen at McMaster University. He is dearly missed by everyone. The whole University mourned for him.

Just passing by this site. Is it really true? Is he really gone? Oh, what a shame. He was the best prof at Mac. Great lectures, clear voice, understandable material, oh yeah, he was that great. Even though he passed away, his legacy will live on forever.
RIP old man. You are very missed!

He turned me away from Stats forever. I decided never to take any more stats after experiencing the nightmare of his class. He provided no formulas for the summer stats 2D03 section and gave such an super long exam. This prof was totally out of touch with reality. Everyone hated him with a huge passion but he was shameless enough to teach still.

I had Dr. Mead as a prof around 4 or 5 years ago. He gave me a TWO in the course (Grade of D) and I had worked very hard. Today I'm doing a PH.D in Statistics from a different University. It shows how unreasonable and unfair this prof is. He does not reward students' hard work and genuinely enjoys failing his students. He wont give out any clues!!
He likes to fail his students. I studied very hard and I am a straight A student, however I got only D-in his class.
His final exam was a nightmare

If u take a course with prof.ernest roy mead u will get F grade 100% guarantee. He told us in class that he enjoys giving F grade!! Can you believe it? He asked us once what is your favourite alphabet, he said his fav alphabet is F with a sarcastic smile :(
He is an incredibly mean person along with being a bad prof with poor teaching ability. He does not give a formula sheet with his exams and expects students to memorize 100's of them
He is a very bad prof and he likes and enjoys to fail his students.
Terrible prof.
HIS FINAL EXAM FOR STATS 2D3 SUMMER WAS THE HARDEST THING IN THE ENTIRE WORLD. UNBELIEVABLE PROF.

Poor quality teaching + Unreasonable demands on students (i.e. No formula sheet provided, LOTS of Proofs and Derivations on exams) + EXTREMELY Boring Lectures + Interest Ruined from the material for ever = A course with Dr Mead

Terrible prof!!! HE wont give a formula sheet with our final exam and there are million formulas to remember. Is he for real? What is he thinking? He has no soul and no heart that's why he is so mean!!!
he is a very mean person and his email replies are brief and unclear. Bad lecturer and writes difficult tests.
HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. HE LIKES ASKING QUESTIONS SUCH AS "PROVE...", "DERIVE..." ON HIS TESTS AND EXAMS. HE IS MONOTONE AND BORING TO LISTEN TO AND HAS NO INTERACTION WITH THE CLASS WHILE LECTURING

Professor is INHUMANE. He has no symapthy. He asks so many proof questions for a summer Stats 2D03 class and his tests are WAY TOO long for 50 minutes. Ridiculous prof! And SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO BORING!!!!!!!
He mumbles when he is teaching. I am not impressed. I want a refund. I had better expectations when I took this course.

He likes to ruin the career of his students that is why he is so boring and so tough. He is so boring that once you take a course with him, you will never want to see the textbook of that course ever again. I feel sorry for he students who listen to him 3 hours at a time during the summer. Boring teaching combined with hatred for students= VERY BAD
OMG HIS FIRST TEST WAS SO HARD!!
He was terrible!!! So many people failed his course or dropped it.
Bad Experience with him! :(

A terrible SHAMELESS man who continues to teach despite the fact he knows that students hate him so much. If I was a professor and I knew students disliked me, I would either change my teaching style or just resign if I can't improve myself. He should do us a favour and just go away. Please retire. That will be the happiest day of our lives!!!!

He is the toughest stats prof in the entire history of this institution. I was happy that he is going to retire but unfortunately he is back to teach stats 2d03 this summer!! aww..poor kids..I feel sorry for anyone who has to take Mead's class. Take it and you will regret it. You have been warned.
He was terrible when I had taken his course many years ago!! He offers no help to his students.

It is mcmaster's loss because of Dr. mead's untimely passing. He will be sadly missed by faculty, staff, undergraduate and graduate students alike. He was a genuine human being that really cared for everyone and was unfailing to polite to students. He would do whatever he could to help a student succeed. He gave out so much information for exams!!

R.I.P Dr. Mead, he was a very good man. His sense of humour, his unparalleled enthusiasm in the classroom, his willingness to go "extra distance" and bend over backwards to help students at any time of the year and in all situations, will be missed by all. He was a great teacher. Very knowledgeable in the field of statistics, a leader in his field

This course was a waste of money time and energy. A course like this was not worth a cent  let alone the $600 I paid, and this instructor truly is not fit to teach. He spent the entire time doing proofs in class, that I bet he has no clue what any of that garbage means, on the final exam, he asked 5 calculations and only 1 proof. Waste of time!!!!

Worst prof ever. No teaching skills. He only has mumbling skills. Speaks in his mouth. hard to hear or understand. Everyone strongly dislikes this instructor because he doesn't want to help students even. He is so rude when you email him "Everything covered in class is eligible" is his standard answer when you ask for information about tests

I dont know where to start even. I am not the type of person who would write bad comments about a prof online, that too such an old man, but he has no sympathy for his students. He doesnot like to give even 0.001% hints about the format of his final exams or what is expected. He takes revenge from students because very few people attend his lecture

MEAD IS SO STUBBORN HE DOESNT LISTEN TO ANYBODY OR CARE ABOUT ANYONE. USE THE ****ING MICROPHONE MAN AND STOP MUMBLING. NOBODY CAN HEAR HIM. HE NEVER SMILES EVEN. WHY IS HE TEACHING US. WE DESERVE A BETTER PROF FOR THE AMOUNT OF MONEY THAT WE PAY TO MAC. ITS ONLY THE BEGINNING OF THE TERM AND HE IS DRIVING ME NUTS ALREADY. MOST GARBAGE PROF SEEN
He is very mean to students

Everyone hates this instructor, and he already knows it that students hate him. He consistently gets poor evaluations from students. If he has any shame or self-respect whatsoever, he should just quit teaching and leave us alone. He probably lives a horrible life and tries to make his students lives terrible too. What a sad excuse of a professor!

Does not give a clear answer when students email him. He likes to make his students sad, both in class, and in terms of marks. His lectures cause sadness, and the grades he assigns will make you cry. He is certainly the worst professor not only in the math department but also in the entire McMaster University. Worst prof in the entire world!!!

My deepest condolences, and deepest sympathy for all engineering students who will enrol in STATS 3Y03 in the coming term with this horrendous prof. This man has no heart, and no human feelings. He will make every course he teaches way harder than it has to be. He won't provide any formula sheets with the exam making life miserable for students.

He is the most unfair prof in the history of math department. If you ask him for any help regarding exam studying he will say 'all topics covered in class are eligible', he hates helping students. He is not fit to be in the teaching profession.
incredibly low quality prof. hates students. seems bitter and angry at the world. gets a sadistic pleasure out of making other's lives miserable.

I had dr.mead last year for Actuarial Math II and oh boy, was he awful. He has no mercy on his students. Chances of failing his courses are pretty high. His final exams are much tougher than his tests, so donot bother enrolling in any of his courses. Emotional scarring caused by his courses may fade away but the big fat F he gives won't go away.
pretty horrible i must say..... ur better off just reading the book

This guy will kill your interest in math. YOU WILL HATE MATH. IT WILL BECOME YOUR NIGHTMARE if you take any course with mead. He does not provide any formula sheets on exams and he enjoys failing his students. All other criticisms about him are true and valid. Look on his internal class evaluations on MUGSI "Instructor declined to give permission"

He is the nastiest prof in the mathematics and statistics department. Rude, unfair, senile, monotone, interest ruiner, doesn't give a **** about his students. If you want a big fat F on your transcript, do enroll in his courses. Rumour has it that he is retiring from McMaster this year. Good riddance! He is way too old to teach anyways.

Absolute WORST professor I have ever had in my 3 years at this school. He is extremely boring and unenthusiastic in lecture. STATS 3S03 would be a very easy course if he followed the text but instead he spends 99% of the time in class on proofs, making the course far more difficult than it should be. Getting any help from him is an impossible task!

If I could give less than 1 out of 5 to this professor I would do it. He is so bad he will make you hate math and ruin any interest you have in studying mathematics. On top of that this he is hard as nails. He asks proof questions on financial math tests which is supposed to be a water down math course, for business type of students. He's so mean.

An overall terrible prof. Monotone voice and listening to him 830 in the morning is impossible and a complete waste of time. Going to his lectures will actually lower your IQ and make you frustrated. If you are insomniac, Mead's class will cure you. He's soo mean he doesn't provide any sample tests and absolutely no hints for the tests. Awful!!!!!

MEAD is the worst-EST-EST professor in math. His tests are extremely hard, he likes giving 'PROOF' questions, going to his lecture will cause you major depression. He is very unhelpful when you email him. Really doesn't like helping students and if you ask him something, he would reply something else, usually some non-sense. Horrendous experience.

worst damn prof ever. seriously. DONOT DONOT DONOT take his courses. He is so boaring and monotone, he comes in and talks to the board, NEVER makes eye contact with the class, no class interaction. Stats 3S03 is supposed to be really easy, but all he does is PROOFS on the blackboard, and includes proofs on tests. Horible experience. Avoid this guy

zzzzzzzz....I slept through all his lectures, he must have been telling bed-time stories.  Seriously, very dull professor.  He puts up overheads and we are always furiously copying while he talks in a monotone.
Ernest Roy Mead is very tough professor.
Dude's a mead-head.
He is really bad
Extremely hard course and the prof didn't make it any easier.  Most boring teacher I have ever had.  And the T.A. didn't even speak English.  Can't hear the prof most of the time either.

This class was probability theory and I found Mead's mean (average) lecture to be "painfully boring" with a standard deviation ranging between "suicide inducing" and "tranquilizing".  Only thing more boring than him was the textbook.  The probability of you enjoying this course is close to 0.
Good prof

The course was pretty brutal... we should have had a formula sheet... concepts weren't hard but deriving formulas (or recalling from memory) and applying them in time to complete the tests was difficult...
Avoid going to his classes (straight outta textbook)... worst teach I've had at MAC.... went up to him for help once and he did JACK SH*T... NOT HELPFUL, stick to research buddy
Mead is one of the most dull teachers you can get. This class is a good one to take a nap in. He's a straight text book teacher and he mumbles like crazy. He's too old to teach!

I never cancelled a course until i came across Dr.Mead. His tests are a little unpredictable and we didn't have a TA, which i think we needed. I think he should retire and give himself and the students a break.

The course is hard and his notes are useless as they have nothing to do for what is on the tests. This guys is so boring, that if you're thinking of commiting sucide this guy will put you over the top.
Mead is not that bad.  He does mumble and he is boring and he could teach better, but his notes are still very good and definately an asset since the text blows.
Good place for an afternoon nap, his mumbling is extremely soothing.
If you would like to be sad go to his class
boring guy.. boring course. This guy could make a math major hate numbers.
The course was pretty demanding
