comments: Kevin is professional, brilliant and clearly cares about how he communicates and imparts his knowledge. I looked forward to every class with him. He inspired me, a non-technical finance person, to do my best. He made Accounting interesting, fun and applicable to my business. He delivered this in a tight timeline - a rare feat. A great professor!

It is difficult to find an Accounting Professor as dedicated to the field as Kevin. Outside of standard course requirements, Kevin spends a great deal of time connecting accounting theory and everyday business happenings with the content of the class. If you want to, you can learn much more than theory.

Prof. Kevin was outstanding. He worked really hard to make a tough subject easy to understand. Not only he encourages to go beyond the basics but also inspires you to apply the learnings in real life situations

Kevin is very fair. He expects his students to do their readings and practice problems. He is very knowledgeable and is able to answer questions of all difficulty. He makes time for his students and goes out of his way to set them up for success. His tests are difficult and taking good notes is very valuable for his course.

Professor Veenstra is a great teacher  especially challenging in a classroom of students filled with varying levels of accounting knowledge - encourages discussion on current topics within the classroom - highlights the connections with accounting - was available for additional one-on-one review on difficult material. I recommend Dr. Veenstra!

Dr. Veenstra is an excellent professor, very well prepared for the classes, enthusiastic, and accessible. He maintains a high level of professionalism and is always able to approach, teach, and evaluate the students in a fair and respectful manner. Accounting requires a lot of reading and practising. Kevin is there to help you.

Kevin was an excellent instructor that demonstrated true passion for teaching with an incredible sense of humour. You could see that he was genuinely invested in the class, and always ensured that all comprehended the material before moving on, even if that meant repeating over the material/case studies over and over.

Kevin is committed to helping his students actually learn and apply concepts. You will learn lots--if you are willing to try. His credibility is sound and rooted in actual corporate accounting experience. What I enjoyed most is the man's brilliant sense of humour. As a professional enrolled in the Executive MBA program I was thoroughly impressed.

By far one of the best professors I've ever had. Kevin is dedicated, supportive and pretty funny! He's very intelligent but modest, very personable and encouraging. I really enjoyed his class and would definitely choose to be in another of his courses again.
If you have a chance take Prof. Veenstra. Veenstra actively cares about your success in the program and takes time out of his schedule to ensure you are on track. Guys an absolute boss.

Kevin Veenstra is a very nice and helpful professor, it's the most responsible professor that I have met.  He always gives lots of additional office hours and also an review session before the exam, he tried to let everyone understand the concept and the real-life application, his courses will benefit students' careers in the future.

Prof. Veenstra is no doubt the best prof. here! He is always there to help. You can feel he sincerely cares about students' learning progress and outcomes. The lectures were interesting and the exams were fair. With years of work experience in the field, he equipped me with the valuable "real world" knowledge to excel after graduation. Thank you!

Kevin Veenstra is a great professor. He has extensive knowledge and actual experience in accounting. Unlike many professors he can use his experience in lecture to give real world examples. He is an interesting person, who genuinely wants his students to succeed in their future careers.

Professor Veenstra is one of the friendliest and most helpful business instructors at McMaster University. He truly values his student's longterm success. Don't be afraid to visit him during his office hours. The midterms and exam provided were fair and reasonable. There's also no doubt that he is extremely qualified and knowledgable in his field.

Professor Veenstra is an exceptional instructor. His lectures and course materials are quite detailed and understandable. His midterms and exams are fair, although they may seem tough at first. Overall, he is a helpful person who is willing to assist students who want to succeed in the course.

Kevin Veenstra was an amazing professor, his lectures was clear and understandable. He takes time to answer any questions you have during his office hour and even try to help you as much as possible for you to do well in the course. He would even sit with you for hours to help make sure you understand the material well before any test and midterms.

In class  quiz are ok, online quiz are way much easier (so he ended up lower the weighting of online portion), classes are not quite useful, disrespected to students, dont explain a lot, full of confusing, thank god I took accounting in HS.
the worst prof I have ever had.  Kevin should be in another line of work . .  that doesnt involve other people

He has the qualifications and possesses the knowledge needed to educate others. He does not however have any qualities that would be conducive to making the material anymore clearer than what is presented as in the textbook. I would avoid ever taking a course from him again at all costs.
Taught new material in optional review, two days prior to the exam. Gave unreasonable questions considering how he taught.

You have to do a lot of self work to do well in the course. Too much reading! He is so knowledgeable but the amount of work required is too much. He wrongly assumes that bad marks are due to the students rather than his teaching.

Professor Veenstra has absolutely no teaching ability, not a single lecture was helpful.  I am sure that he is a kind person but he would prefer to assume that the majority of students are failing his class because they don't study rather than try and improve his teaching style. I learned everything I know about accounting from the textbook not him

Kevin Veenstra is a smart man and knows the material, but he can't teach it, not only that, but his course is not very well organized and the midterm is brutal (hard with confusing questions). He does however provide bonus opportunities, which is one of the only redeeming qualities of the course.
Midterm is not fair at all! In-class quiz always choose the hardest question
Bad teacher but knows his stuff
Does not clarify, takes away online tests when their your only hope in passing. So bad i had to drop the course and take in the summer so i could have a different prof.

This man does not know how to teach, which is a shame because he does know accounting well. He shows you what to do with very specific details and gives vague explanations to accounting techniques. Textbook then is a must which wouldn't be a problem if the test were actually a little bit fair  and didn't require insane levels of accounting exp.
His voice will put you to sleep and his tests are over the top in terms of difficulty. The content in this course is relatively straight forward and he makes it harder than it needs to be.
If you don't pay attention in lectures and skip the chapter review questions, then get ready to fail. If you do those things, you'll still fail.

He is really good at explaining accounting basics and he will go out of his way to help you if you are struggling. Don't listen to what other people said about him here, they are just salty because they don't study and expect 80's.   How to succeed if you have him? USE the textbook, practice questions, past exams, study notes
He good

comments: Amazing professor with a great sense of humour. Murgatroyd has a great teaching style and is super efficient while being very friendly and respectful towards his students

Amazing in every way possible. I looked forward to every one of his lectures. Beware though, the exam is heavy. When he says read the works carefully (Iliad, Odyssey, Aeneid -- I know, it's a lot) he means it. If you go to lecture, read the works, and participate in tutorial you should have no problem receiving an A letter grade in this course.

I find Murgatroyds simple outline notes to be helpful and his use of humour throughout his lectures is a fantastic break from the rest of my professors who seem to have low interest and little to no humour in their lectures. He's obviously passionate and good at his job and lays out his expectations so students are well informed about assignments.

One of the best professors I've ever had. He prepares his lectures well ahead of time and his organization is crystal clear. He is a hilariously funny professor who is clearly interested in the subject that he teaches. I hope to have him again!
I had his wife for high school and then I had him for first year. Both of them were great.
Exceptionally arrogant.

Murgatroyd is simply amazing!!! His lectures are informative and hilarious....he knows exactly how to make his lectures more interesting....He is very helpful!!! He definitly has a passion for what he teaches which only makes his lectures that much better!!!

Incredible prof - the reason I'm getting into classics next year! His lectures are very entertaining and full of substance. If you can, I highly recommend taking at least one of his courses - you wont regret it!

By FAR the best prof that I have ever had! Absolutely hilarious lectures that are vital for the exam and it's obvious that he is incredibly passionate with what he teaches. I will definitely try to get into another of his classes!
funny as hell
Prof Murgatroyd has been a real source of inspiration for me.

Cool prof. He has lectures and jokes for the lectures prepared beforehand. So his lectures are pretty funny. If you miss a class you'd HAVE to get notes from a friend. He tells certain myths and you have to know the general story for the final... Have to write a lot of notes and the final is 6 questions, expected 1.5 pages you should write for each

Honestly, he looks quite scary. But after taking his class and meeting him, you'll never think hes scary ever. Hilarious, his structered lectures make following along and taking notes very easy, and if you miss a class you'll know exactly what you missed. And he does look like Dumbledore!

Amazing prof! Very in depth lectures, but also very approachable if you have a problem. He's friendly and funny as humanly possible, and will offer extra help when you need it. Entertaining, but brilliant: the man knows his stuff and you will learn a ton!
AWESOME class, AWESOME prof...I learned SOOO much in this class, and Murgatroyd has a fabulous sense of humour.

Murgatroyd could be a good prof if he calmed down a little. HIs pace is way too fast, his marking structure leaves no room for interpretation, it's too confined. He tells his students one thing and the T.As to mark for something completely different. I hope I never have him again!

Most amazing prof I've ever had. Most brilliant man, moves at a good pace and he's right when he says "I'm not talking too fast, you're taking notes too slow". Very concise and knowledgable. I hope to take every course he teaches in upper years throughout my time at Mac. I recommend taking ANY course he teaches.

Murgs is one of the worst professors with the worst notes and a terrible pace. I got an A in this class because I had notes for every lecture. This class should be multiple choice/easypie not some crazy analytical exploit of terrible films.
Great Class, Very Fun, Wonderful Jokes
great prof!! interesting lectures and he has lots of great puns.  very clear with his notes.  awesome class!
Interesting and very funny. Loved how he indicates when to take notes. A great first-year prof - he made the transition very easy. Probably the best prof I have had.
Makes class interesting
I would take whatever class he was teaching JUST so he could be my prof!  Great sense of humour.  You won't fall asleep in his class, that's for sure.
Great class, lots of fun. Red pants were the best, his notes were long yet interesting...What was up with "O Brother Where Art Thou"...He looks like Dumbledore...I see an Oscar in the Future
A very entertaining professor with as many puns as there are Greek Gods.  A fairly easy course that is very educational and above all enjoyable.  He looks like Poseidon...

Murgatroyd rocks! He knows his nonsense and has the coolest red pants around! Lectures were great - only problem was the exam. I think you'd need a motor on your hand to be able to finish all that writing in 2 hours! Regardless, Murg is amazing.

one of mac's BEST profs. Armed with his red pants he dazzles his students with his wit, his intelligence, and his extremely interesting lectures. Even his exam was funny...be prepared to laugh and learn!
No Comments
I still regal my students with stories of your red pants and the 'three little pigs' years after. Your ability to inspire others with humor has been past on!! Thanks
The most entertaining Prof ever! Well, at least for now. He makes me want to buy red pants!
Loved this class, this man is halarious! Love the red pants and the silly silly puns!
Murgatroyd is the best!  I loved the class (greek myth - trojan war) he knows what he's talking about. That's for sure! Not a bad exam either.
Awesome class. The jokes are so bad that they are funny. The material is great, its well presented. He makes you want to be there.
Hilarious! Love material...essay....red pants! he is sooo funny, i hardly ever look at the clock

Very enjoyable course, loved the subject material, but his exams are intense. Any hope of finishing, you have to start writing instantly and go as fast as you can until the end. Only the chosen few finish. Other then that a funny man.
VERY well structured, VERY entertaining, VERY interesting, VERY understandable.  The fact that he wears red pants and tells funny jokes doesn't hurt either!
One of the true gems at MAC. Enjoys teaching and wants you to enjoy learning. The only person I've seen make a **** joke and have ALL the feminists laughing.
Very organized, funny, and knowledgeable.  I actually wanted to go to his lectures.  Does anyone think he looks like Dumbledore from Harry Potter?
Really funny guy, good material, nice red pants.
Hilarious! Be forewarned, he has a dislike for small children.
Funniest 8:30am class ever. He rocks.
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Dr. Becker's kindness and approachability match her high intelligence. I like how she motivates us to talk about science, and think critically and creatively. She is in high demand but somehow makes time to meet with every student/group in the class. Would highly recommend her as a prof/supervisor.
very kind intelligent person

In this discussion based class, Dr. Becker taught us how to critically read scientific papers. We also brainstormed cool experiments that could fix any problems we saw in experimental design. She always picked cool articles and amazed us with how much she knows about everything Psychology! Great class if you like to learn!

Supposed to be a university statistics course. However, we spent an entire week learning about mean, median and mode. She is very disorganized, constantly making mistakes in lectures and on tests, she takes forever to hand back marks, and she is just wishy washy.

Dr. Becker is very passionate about her area of research. She really wants her students to do well, but more importantly she wants them to learn. She can sometimes be a bit scattered but she means very well. I think she's a great prof.

I am confused by all these comments about Dr Becker being disorganized and unapproachable. Cog Neuro was extremely well structured and she even arranged 1 on 1 meetings with every student to talk about their presentation. This was a really valuable class for me, thanks to Dr. Becker.
I got a 2 in her course..it was tough!!

Pretty much the worst prof I have ever had. She is easy enough, but takes months to get back marks. That's right, for a multiple choice test worth 20 marks takes a month to get the result. Extremely boring and just the most unhelpful professor as she does not provide her email out to her students. Very disappointing.
not that great
I got my lowest psych grade ever in her class. Thanks for the low grade. Your class was terrible and your exams were so hard and unfair!

not a good professor - M/C tests took up to 4 weeks to get back - assignments over 5 weeks to get back - does not respond to emails - tones of reading - not very clear and tests were very hard - very disorganized course - wish i never took it
she is an amazing prof..she tries her best and you can see that :) you just have to do ur responsibility as a student and really prepare yourself for the tests and you will be fine

I enjoyed Dr. Becker as a professor for this class, however the tutorials were awful and very disorganized. I felt as if I wasted too much time going to these tutorials and not relateable to the actual content of the course.However, Becker was awesome. I recommend this course if you are interested in the field of Neuropsych, but work hard.

Honestly I took the course because it seemed interesting, and as it turns out it not only is lowering my gpa but i have also killed all my time working on pointless projects. The TA's have no idea what they are doing, very few individuals actually knew ANY marks going into the exam, or better yet some didn't know anything.Don't take it.
realllly unorganized, and tries to teach too much new stuff in tutorials.
WORST COURSE EVER! IT WILL LOWER YOUR SESSIONAL AND CUMULATIVE AVERAGE. TUTORIALS ARE A COMPLETE WASTE OF TIME. I'D BE BETTER OFF SPENDING THAT TIME READING THE TEXT AT HOME. HARD EXAMS

While I have no qualms about the midterm, I find the tutorials to be the most pointless thing alive, not only does she herself not know what's going on, neither do the TAs. Berating us as little kids on how to keep eye contact? I took this class to learn neuropsych, not be told how to keep eye contact, makes me not want to take 3BN3

I really enjoyed Sue Becker as a professor. Neuropsych was a very interesting course...the TA classes were very dry and boring, but the lectures Becker had were great.And to all who are still complaining about the midterm.....GET OVER IT!! It was a complete misunderstanding and she did everything she could to compensate us....GREAT CLASS!

Please take my advice and avoid this class if possible.  The mid-term was a complete disastor, students switched rooms with exams in hand and then were allowed to keep that test mark.  Tutorials are a waste of time, lots of group projects like presentations and essays.  Articles were difficult to understand and TA's were little help.
the midterm fiasco is all i have to say
All the best to anyone who has to take her neuropsych class
Take her class if you want to lower your average. She's a nice person, but she should be more helpful, especially when we are preparing for exams
Good

The worst psychology prof at Mac. She never gives you any hints or study tips regarding what's gonna on exams or what are the important parts. There are some free marks in tutorial work but she makes up for it by giving extremely hard exams. She is really unhelpful. Like previous commments stated, never checks learnlink to answer students questions
Really boring and she seems a little out of it.
She's a decent lecturer, but it's a very boring course. Tutorials are useless too. Hard articles.

This is absolutely the worst course I ever took and she's one of the worst profs I've ever had. She is very uncaring and unhelpful. Students had last minute questions before exam posted on learnlink and she nor her useless TA's bothered answering them. If you take her class, you will regret it.

Not helpful. Very rarely answers questions on learnlink. Unclear course expectations. Jumps bits from chapter to chapter. Hard course and a tough prof. Her TA's are even more awful. They marked the essays so brutally like it's a PHD course and they made so rude comments on essays. Worst course ever.
DONOT take this course!!!
No Comments

Although, she is extremely helpful, the class itself is extremely boring. She does provide her note online, but she will go through the beginning of her notes very slowly at the start of class, and by the end, she still has so much left, she speeds through it...leaving you confused.
Tough
No Comments
Hard course...heavy reading course load...

Very unhelpful.  Unclear in course objectives.  Degrading to students.  Changed test material directly before test, then changed what counted for marks after the test.  Often left early to pick up her kids, and usually started late.
She's adorable. This was a brand new course at MAC & she made it interesting & fun.  Tests were a bit unpredictable, but she's open for feedback.  She defintely knows her stuff.
No Comments
Good attitude. Tough course and boring lectures. Hard to follow sometimes but she does her best to explain things. Very approachable.
Very Interesting course!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Interesting lectures. Need to attend class to understand readings and course content.
Dr. Brophy is a good professor who provides very good feedback and suggestions, but she seems to take comments made and conduct in class personally.

VERY unhappy with the fact that 100% of what is done in the class (assignment and midterm-wise) is marked completely by TA's. As english is already very subjective, I feel the TA's should be the one's teaching the class given I can't seem to follow Brohpy's guidelines and score high grades. Such a ridiculously run course.

Dr. Brophy is an incredibly hard marker. She is very friendly, but if you ask her questions for assignments don't expect an easy answer back, she will only confuse you more. There are a lot of assignments, in the long run all of these assignments help. This class is a lot of hard work, and your mark does not change after the first few assignments.

She clearly loves what she is talking about, and seems so approachable. Although she is a tough marker and there are many assignments, she provides many opportunities to ask for help and receive feedback.
Lectures are boring and there's WAY too much discussion, but she's a very smart lady and incredibly nice.

I didn't care for her lectures at all. Too much open discussion with the same 2 people talking. She tended to flail her arms when talking, and stuttered as if she was trying to think of the best way to phrase something, following this with very fast talking. Extremely tough marker, everyone in my class did poorly. Not recommended.
Absolutely fantastic!
Very helpful when asked questions had interesting supplementary material.
One of my favourite profs!

Uh, I don't really recall what the course code becuase I took it last year but I have to agree with the person who mentioned her tendency to flail her arms around haha. Her topics were interesting but then she would just get confusing when she tried to connect them to theory. She seemed nice though and she was concerned with the students wellbeing.
Only class i actually enjoyed and looked forward to this semester. She makes the material very interesting.
Difficult to follow along with.

She is a very bright young woman, who has achieved a professor status in a very short time - does this tell you something? Also, she is an unconventional thinker and critic, interested in the students and the world around her, not too buried in "academia"

Hard prof to work with, though extremely good at what she does. Best 1-on-1, and most interested in class discussion. Hard marker, but explains clearly what she wants from people, if only they'd listen.

The last comment is a typical bs response to an intelligent, confident, successful woman, from someone who hasn't been applying the ideas learned in class to uncover their own sexism. Try learning from this phenomenal,  hard-working and very self-aware prof. instead of passing ignorant judgements.
This professor is constantly flailing her hands and running them through her hair..it is very distracting.  Also she is crazy and doesn't blink
Extremely intelligent lady, and superb professor. She 'makes learning fun' and interesting. She expects a lot, but she gives just as much, sometimes more. Great one on one.
fabulous prof.  she links lectures with associative thought that makes sense. very approachable and always helpful. pushes students to strive for best.
Great teaching methods--very creative.  And beautiful!
Surprised she doesn't teach in front of a mirror.
Smart cookie and a class you will have to work in. Always there to chat or help if you need some clarification.
Very disorganized and an extremely difficult teacher to understand. Way too hard of a marker
A really nice prof!
Nice, Helpfull but sometimes very unclear.

comments: American lit was the best english class I have ever taken. Adamson made his morning classes a lot of fun, and he made the material we read interesting and opened our eyes to so many different possibilities in each text. His class was hard work but well worth it. I will definitely be taking more classes of Adamson's.

Didn't know how to use a powerpoint or computer to help organize his lectures. He spoke all over the place. Made references that no one understood. The readings were so boring and dated. Assignment topics were dull and tedious.

Dr. Adamson was an amazing prof. He made our morning classes interesting and fun. He focuses heavily on themes and literary devices in each text. The texts were a lot of fun to read. His essays challenge you to use critical thinking, but he is always willing to help. I would highly recommend his class, it's the best English class I have taken.
His lectures cover the important scenes of the books that are focused. He was a very nice prof, I just didn't care much about the course.
awesome teacher! made the year a pleasure. super cute.
He is a great prof!! Very smart and interesting and makes lectures worth going to! I really enjoyed his class!

The course was labelled wrong, so we didn't know what we were getting into; He's very friendly, but incredibly monotone so his class is VERY hard to follow/take notes in and the material is boring. If I wasn't graduating, I wouldn't have taken the course, but I do think he'd be great teaching an upper year seminar!
This course was really great. Adamson's classes are super interesting and I thought he was a great prof! Really easy to understand and the exam was a cake walk. It also helped that my TA was awesome.

The greatest English professor at McMaster University.  In six years of education, he was one of the top two.  Very easygoing, extremely intelligent, and not too full of himself(as is too often the case with profs) to go out for a drink with students after the course.  Truly inspirational course!

NOT for the faint of heart!  Tough, but fair-minded.  Very, very bright and knowledgeable.  Clear about expectations.  Great lecturer, fabulous reading voice.  Be prepared to learn a ton! ... And he's cute.
Great Prof.  He is willing to consider things that are not normally part of the "canon", and is an awesome discussion leader.
SUCKS!!!! JUST BAD!!!! STAY AWAY!!!!
Dr.Adamson is an awsome prof. who goes out of his way to help his students. His 2nd year + courses have all been very interesting!!!

This is the professor I have been waiting for during my whole time here at university.  He's extremely smart, easy-going, funny and kind.  He creates a very calm and open atmosphere in the class and is interested in everything.
Dr. Adamson is a fiendly, helpful prof.
Excellent faciliator of discussion. Admirably prepared. Please ignore the comments re: him being boring. It is only bcause you are boring.

After going from Browning in the first Comp Lit, Adamson was a nightmare.  He was amongst the most boring English professors I have ever had (and I've had quite a few).  Nothing changed in his lectures, not even the tone of his voice.  Very tough to make it through a single class never mind the whole semester.
No Comments

A great professor.  Can lecture at lenghth, or lead discussion.  Has the important ability to re-claim discussion when it is going no where.  Really understands the material.  One of the few who actually cares enough to help students improve.
by far the most intelligent prof around
Fabulous prof. Very helpful. Once sat and talked to me for almost an hour about the class and was only too happy to give advice about anything else. Great sense of humour too.
No Comments
Loves to listen to himself, does not respect opposing opinions. Goes on and on off topics.
No Comments
interesting lectures

If you can stay awake, he's very interesting and knowledgeable, but his thoughts are jumbled and he goes off on tangents. Very funny guy, when he's not trying to be, when he is, it's not funny for the reason he thinks.  Laugh at him, he'll like you.
Monotonous, but interesting.
loves helping students :)
does not like helping students

comments: Very interesting lectures and tells a lot of interesting stories. Great prof! The textbook readings are really boring and the test questions are very specific about the readings.

Dr. Day is fantastic. You'd be hard pressed to find a student of his that active dislikes him and his courses. The content is interesting, the tests are fair, and he has many interesting stories to tell.

Dr. Day's lectures are great - clear, organized, and interesting. His tests were typically fair, except the 10% of questions which were based on textbook readings (incredibly specific; you'd have to study the textbook for hours to know the answers, and for only 10% it didn't make sense to even bother with the textbook). But great prof overall.
Dr. Day is a genius. Best prof at mac. He is nice but he will test you and you will learn.

He's a great prof. He is very engaging, and always giving students an opportunity to ask questions. His tests can be tricky but if you study and go to his lectures/watch the podcasts, you'll do really well. There's always his quiz bank as well!! He tells some pretty great stories too

By far my favourite prof EVER. His lectures were so engaging and interesting to listen to! He really does everything in his power to help you succeed! Some of his test questions can be a little tricky, but that's expected with every psych course. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Dr. Day is an absolute gem.  Amazing lectures - I've not once fallen asleep in his class. His tests are not difficult if you use the resources he gives you, which is a lot of stuff (podcasts, test bank, handbook). He is so sweet and approachable, kinda wish he was my grandpa. He knows his stuff and is up to date on a lot of pop culture.

It's great to hear him talk. I read about him going off on tangents and I did not find this true at all. Everything is relevant. Tests are so hard, testing on incredibly tiny details and stats. Prepare to memorize. Very good for providing content - there's quiz bank, podcasts, course handbook (which is basically all lecture material written out).
Lectures were decently interesting. Exams were unnecessarily tricky and hard.

Also took 2AP3 with him. This course has less stats and numbers but still both very content, research, and studies heavy. Know the deets! Overall, would take again though. Podcasted, and he's just SO AMAZING AND INSPIRATIONAL to listen to. Thank you Dr. Day for being an INCREDIBLE teacher and ENGAGING lecturer. Would take again!! 3

WOW! Seriously ONE OF MY FAVE PROFS AT MAC - FOR SURE. Ties with Ostovich for my fave psych prof at Mac, but he's a lot funnier, caring, and wise. Such a cool dude if you ever get to strike up a conversation with him. Extremely lecture heavy, but no group projects haha! Just the midterms and final. The test bank will be your best friend! Numbers!

Just get ready to over-use a test bank for days before your midterm.  His tests are very fair, considering he gives a test bank.  His text book questions are difficult, but that's the only downside. He is a gem.

Dr. Day teaches so well on this course, but the tests materials are on details some of them. You really need to know the stuff well and understand them not just memorize them especially for the data he provides on lecture, it is testable in tests. But I take a lot of psychology courses with him, because he makes the psychology interesting

Dr. Day is an awesome prof. He knows a lot about psychology. I take his course every year because he teaches lots of psychology courses at MAC. If you want to do well on his test, you really need to do more exercises which he provides them on his website and they are really helpful. Also, you need to read the textbook before you go to the exam.

This guy is a great prof. He's funny, kind, welcoming to students. His tests are brutally hard & there is no way I would be able to pass them without the lecture recordings. He asks VERY specific questions, so you pretty much need to know ALL the details about everything. The MC questions are very tricky and at times hard to understand

Great prof, hard tests. The lectures were very interesting. Tests were all m/c and I found them to be very challenging (coming from a student who got As in almost every other course). Be ready to read a lot of textbook.

Dr. Day is one of the best lecturers at Mac and also my personal favourite prof. I took both 2AP3 (abnormal psych) and 2B03 (personality). I wouldn't say these were easy courses because you do need to work hard, however, they were extremely interesting courses. He posts podcasts and also gives quiz banks in preparation for the midterms.

I have taken all of his classes, and he is an amazing prof. Yes, his tests are tricky, but if you study well and hard, you will do fine. I ended up with a 10 in his positive psych class. Highly recommend taking his classes!!!

The content is so interesting - I really did learn a lot!! He podcasts every lecture!! He is a really clear and interesting lecturer too. However, my criticism for this course is the textbook content that appears on tests (SO RANDOM) - that's the only place I'd lose marks on tests. I don't understand what he looks for in the text. Otherwise great.
I think he's pretty vague with what he expects you to know.
Dr. Day is THE best prof at Mac. He has great stories to aid his lectures and he's super helpful. Love him and he's such a cutie!

I love Dr.  Day. He is such a wonderful speaker and is so knowledgeable on the subject that I'd love to take his other classes. The tests were tough and stat-heavy but still worth it, because the lectures (in my opinion) were great and always interesting. Never once fell asleep in that class, and that's saying something.
Dr. Day is one of the best profs at McMaster. He's got a natural talent to be very engaging and organizes his courses really well. I would highly recommend taking a course with him!! (I took 4!)
he was very good

classes are podcasted but content is interesting so unless it is at 8:30, you should go to class. Quiz bank was helpful but you still need to know a lot of information. Textbook readings are tedious. I liked when he brought in speakers on mental illness in abnormal psych. Dr. Day is very on top of things and gets marks out quickly. Very up to date

Dr. Day was fantastic as a lecturer! However his tests killed me and I wasn't ready for the ridiculous amount of detail that would be asked. I literally failed his second midterm even though I went to every class and read the textbook.  Otherwise.. awesome prof.
Great prof, it's clear he knows his stuff. The quiz bank is very helpful, but you really have to know your stuff to do well in his course.
Fantastic prof; I'm taking every one of his courses I have the pre-requisites for because of this class!
Excellent lecturer, but the tests are VERY difficult. Asks for details that are often insignificant.
Best prof ever

This class was actually really hard :( I read the textbooks and attended every class but his midterm questions were very specific in regards to textbook that it was hard for me to fully recall all the details that I've read. He's a good professor whose passionate with what he does but this is definitely not a GPA booster.

He's a great prof that knows his material. The only problem is that the test bank questions glitch A LOT, especially the day before the exam. At least 40% of the test bank questions were wrong and varied each time. He has to fix that, there is no point in having a test bank if there's a chance what you're learning is wrong.
Great lecturer, best prof at McMaster

The multiple choice tests are hard! And half the time filled with errors and grammatical issues which lead you to have a difficulty understanding what is asked of you. If you are not focused on the exam, you won't do well unless you know exactly what he is asking. It is a hard course I suggest if you are taking this as an elective, don't.

Finished personality with him and taking positive psychology right now. Very helpful in answering questions and clarifying details.  His tests are pretty tough because the answers seem pretty similar to each other in that most of them seem right. His textbook questions are also pretty specific and I ended up guessing most of them.
Very Very Very hard. If you do not go through the material with very fine detail, you will fail. His tests are very difficult, and you must study!!

I took 3 psych courses with him and got A+ in all. He is very good at explaining concepts but his tests are challenging because they are unbelievably ambiguous. You have to choose one correct answer but at least 2 answers look correct. I didn't like him as a prof but his lectures are very useful even in future.
This guy loves to hear his own voice.

My favourite professor at Mac. His podcasts are extremely helpful when you can't get to class. Brings interesting guest lecturers. Yes, his tests are difficult but he has a huge database of sample questions which you should do consistently. The sample questions are super helpful and will easily help boost your test marks.

I loved the lectures, he used great examples to illustrate his concepts- but tests were super hard. He provides practice tests, but they don't help unless you really know your stuff. I'd recommend creating a fake test with all the concepts prior to a test, that way your brain will better recognize the way the questions are posed on the test.
I hated that class. Not for the info but because the marking. Ruined it for me
Terrible Prof! He claims he makes his tests hard to make you learn better, but after his harsh marking I never want to take psych again!
If I could warn past me, I would never take it again

I usually excel. I have a very good work ethic, and I even have a good basis of psych. Yet I struggled so hard with his tests. I understood everything in the course though. I even applied it to my everyday life but when it came to tests I felt it was difficult and the answers depended a lot on a single word or practise questions.

He is such an amazing prof to listen to, his lectures are so interesting and he's very well spoken. But if you're looking to get a good grade, you're going to have to work you never have before. Extremely difficult exams. He's really big on statistics...
He is a very nice and understanding prof, podcasts every lecture and his exams are fair

By far the best professor at Mac. His lectures are never boring and he records all of them and posts them online. His exams are a bit tricky, but he provides the class with practice questions and most of them show up on the exams. I've taken all of his classes because they are so interesting and he's such a good prof.
A very kind, helpful and informative prof. His lectures are definitely worth attending. Tests are very difficult.
VERY DIFFICULT QUESTIONS. Mid terms are very hard and it is difficult to get anything above a C-. Prof needs to ease up on the difficulty with the questions

Best prof ever. Interesting course with lots of laughs. Very clear way of teaching. Study hard though and use the question bank for studying or you will not do so well on the exams as they can be tricky.

Everyone loves him because they've never been told to think critically about the DSM by a prof before, let alone on who designs his lectures with laughs embedded in. He is an ivory tower psychology professor teaching a distant and offensive look at psychological problems. He has his strengths, but he refuses feedback on his offensive Freudian crap.
Great lecturer, incorporates hilarious personal examples into material. The question bank is key.
I've taken 3 courses with him so far and loved every single one of them! He is the ideal professor. :)

I've taken every one of Dr. Day's classes because honestly he is the best professor by far at McMaster. He records all his lectures keeping in mind some student just can't get to class everyday and it allows you to make the best notes. He provides practice questions as well. Awesome prof, if you study you'll definitely get a B or higher.
Dr. Day is an amazing prof!! Makes class so interesting! Loved going to class; even asked to do research with him but he does not do any. Loved his classes!!!!

Great professor. I really like that he was able to post all his lecture online. Extremely helpful!!! Exams are not that easy. Multiple choice is confusing and the class average wasn't that great. Class was a lot of fun and I would take another class with Dr Day, anyway!

Extremely difficult exams. Tricky multiple choice. Studied for hours understood the material but the questions were just too complex. Interesting material presented really well, love the online and recorded options, makes it easy for a mature student. Would take his class again BUT PLEASE ease up on the difficult, way too hard!!!!!!Seriously
Amazing Professor! His passion about the subjects he taught made me excited about the material that we were learning. Such an amazing guy as well :)
intelligent, passionate, and an excellent speaker. This man deserves the world.
Amazing prof. Very interesting to listen to. Cares about his students a lot.

One of the best profs I've had at Mac so far! His pod casts are helpful if you've missed class. Make sure to read the textbook because he tests you on random stuff in the text. Answer the quiz bank he provides the class, majority of the questions (or similar ones) on the exam/midterm is on there. Overall, enjoyable class! :)
Amazing professor!
Awesome prof. Very knowledgeable!

He is a brilliant professor with a flawless teaching style. His supplementary quiz questions, podcasts, lecture slides, and lecture handbook ensures we have the material necessary and more to succeed. He is passionate, engaging and wise, and is by far the best professor I have ever had.
the best prof at Mac. His lecture was interesting and helpful.
He is a very good prof,he made the content interesting and clear.
Amazing professor. Crystal clear and very interested in the content.

The greatest professor I have ever come across. He speaks so clearly and makes everything that he is teaching interesting and valuable to you. He is extremely helpful if you have any questions and is seriously rooting for you to get a good mark in his course. If you study the lecture content, the practice quizzes and the textbook you can do great.

He is by far one of the best professors I have come across at Mac. I was really discouraged to take another Psych course after first year, since Psych 1X03/1XX3 is a hot mess, but I am so glad I took his course. Make detailed lecture notes, read the text, (do the quizzes!!) and you're gold.
had him for 2BO3. honestly, so far the best prof i have ever had at mac. so helpful and approachable. always making sure students understand and get good grades! amazing!

Dr. Day is one of my favourite professors at Mac. He is a great lecturer, his tests are fair and relatively easy to do well in. Make sure to do lots of questions from his question bank online as he reuses a lot of them on the tests.

Dr. Day is a great man. He has been teaching this course for over 20 years at Mac. He is tenured and is a National M3 teaching fellow highly regarding amongst his peers. He is very passionate about what he teaches. He is technical. Read the required textbook readings and make notes (they aren't long). Hard exams. Practice Q's!!!
Amazing professor, his lectures are concise, straight to the point and very interesting. Best prof I had in the psychology department for sure. His tests are fair and easy to do well in!
Amazing prof. Explains with so much clarity, his tests are a little hard but you can do great if you study. His practice quizzes are very helpful!
Amazing prof! Even though he posted his lectures online he was so amazing I went to class anyway. Such a good speaker

I loved this course. I took 2AP3 in the fall, and was delighted to have Dr. Day again for personality. Even though he offers recordings, I still found myself attending every 8:30am class of his. Very fun prof, I plan to take another one of his courses in the future.
My favourite professor ever. I always experience "flow" when he teaches (Positive psych students know what I'm talking about!)

Had Dr.Day for 5 courses now, hands down best prof i have had at Mac. His lectures are enjoyable, if there was one prof i ever connected with it was him. All MC tests that can be tricky but he doesn't trick you with course material he is very helpful giving you all the information possible
Great prof!
Best prof at mac so far. Hilarious, interesting and knows what he's talking about,

Really good prof in that he thoroughly makes use of every resource (lecture, courseware, textbook, online notes, recordings, website). Particularly liked how he handled 2AP3 by dispelling stereotypes about people w/ mental disorders.
Amazing prof! One of the best I've encountered at McMaster so far! Extremely helpful and approachable, and explains everything in detail.
He's a great professor - really enthusiastic! However, a lot of questions are drawn from the extremely long textbook. A bonus: he records his lectures and always posts the powerpoints online!

Best prof EVER!! I love psych, and to be honest I'm not 100% sure if I love it due to content or because of him!! His classes are not easy but he gets you so interested it makes you want to study and do well!
I LOVE HIM!!He's a wonderful prof! Makes going to class enjoyable and you will ace this class!

I have taken almost all his classes. - personality, attitudes and believes, abnormal, forensic, positive psych (no longer offered), and he is hands down my favorite prof at MAC. He is a great teacher! The material interesting and the tests aren't too difficult if you have gone to class and read the text book. Awesome prof!
Good prof, sometimes difficult tests, but overall good prof.
best prof ever!
BEST PROF I'VE EVER, EVER, EVER HAD. I love him. And positive psychology was probably the most relevant course I've taken at McMaster. Kudos to Dr. Day for making psych so awesome akfjhlaksjfh

I took 2B03 last term, and now 3BA3. Dr. Day is phenomenal. He is an amazing lecturer. Probably the best I have encountered in my 4 years. His tests are challenging, kind of tricky sometimes. I disliked not having practice questions for 3BA3 but it was understandable considering the course is quite new. Anyways, AMAZING prof! Take his course!!
Best Prof I've ever had. Do his practice questions and you will kill the course!

The best prof I have ever had, completely dedicated to teaching.  Unbelievably interesting, blends the nuts of bolts of the suject with relevant  examples from today. Psych wasn't my major, but I took every Dr Dick Day course I could take. Sometimes his MC tests got tricky considering the time. For example "Which one of these is not unimportant ?"

Taken 3n03, 3cc3, 2b03, 1a03/1aa3 with him. Got an A+ in all. By FAR, best lecturer at Mac. Few would dispute this. Amazingly comfortable up there, very entertaining, and knowledgable. Only prof where I've actually taken a class for the prof. Tests are all MC... not everyone does well, but if you're smart, pretty easy as long as you study

Great to listen to! Very clear and easy to understand. Tells great stories. Makes the class interesting. All you have to do is take good notes, do his practice tests over and over and you will get an A. That's what I did and aced his class :)

He is one of the best profs I have ever had! He was extremely interesting and helpful. His tests were super hard but it still ended up being my favorite class. I am definitely looking forward to taking his personality class!
Very dedicated. Does not actively research in order to focus on teaching which is a rarity in the academic world. One of the most active and engaging professors going.
amazing professors clearly explains all the concepts and theories. makes sure that everyone understands what he he is talking about
Amazing prof, by far the best i've had at mac. Uses his experiences to really make his point. Very knowledgable and passionate about what he does.
AMAZING PROF!!!!

Dr. Day is a great prof!! Going to his lectures is like listening to a story, not like work at all! He records all of his lectures so if you will never miss a class. Material is also very interesting. My favourite prof. I plan on taking all the courses he teaches :)
LOVE HIM!

Day is one of the best profs at mac. Even if you dont remember the materials, it is hard to forget his examples. I am in my 3rd and I still rememeber his examples from 1st yr! His tests are not hard if you study for them. But they are tricky -  Need to read b/w the lines. Overall he is he is simply amazing. I never met a person who d.n like Dr. Day

Dr Day is a fixture at McMaster. He has been here forever and he seems like a celebrity. He is an absolutely amazing prof. He knows what you're going to ask before you even say the second word of a question. And when he does answer he is entirely knowledgeable and always has a life example to offer. Love him

Wonderful professor. Started off as just another elective, and suddenly I formed a new found love for personality, and psychology in general. Extreme knowledgeable and creative individual, who truly has a passion for teaching.
Dr. Day loves teaching and makes the subject matter enjoyable. You got to love his socks with sandels
Richard Barlow Day is the toughest psychology professor at McMaster University. His Multiple choice exams are very very hard especially for upper year courses.
Richard Barlow Day is the toughest psychology professor at McMaster University. His Multiple choice exams are very very hard especially for upper year courses.

Dr. Day is amazing prof but his courses are not for the faint hearted. You really need to keep up with the readings and do your readings well ahead of time not night before the test otherwise you're screwed. If you studied hard you will find his tests challenging but fair. It's all multiple choice and well spread out, not just few questions.

**** is an amazing psych professor.  very knowledgeable and helpful.  even though i haven't taken any courses with him since first year psych (on video), 3  years later, i still keep in touch with him.
Amazing prof. His tests and exams are all MCQ. You have to know the material really well in order to get good marks, must have done the readings timely and not the day before. Great teaching style.
Whatever you're paying this guy, it's not enough.
As the Associate Dean of Science he was AWESOME!!
He's so cute! I love his videos...he makes psych so interesting! I would totally recommend him to anyone
I really enjoyed this course! Dr. Day taught us all the personality theories you can read in all the self-help books on the market right now. The textbook must be read in order to get an A+.

Although the midterms were on the difficult side, the final was a breeze! Looking at previous midterms and doing the online questions REALLY help. As many have mentioned, the videos do get kind of dry, but he's a very good speaker and his lessons are clear and structured. If you use the resources he provides for you, you'll do MORE than well.
This class rocked. The courseware is like a para-phrased textbook! This was the only course where I got a 95% on one of my exams! Dr.Day is a nutbar in a good way.

i had the video lectures in 1a03 as well, and it hasn't gotten much different this semester. the videos allow you to not take as much notes, but then again you're not as interested in class, which is where it really matters. overall pretty good prof and friendly when you meet him in person. maybe i'll actually get the live version in next years.
RAWKS

Dr. Day is a great prof.The custom courseware is super useful and easy to understand,and the website was a big help with studying.I think he did an awesome job on the video lectures, and the transcripts meant that I could get an awesome mark without taking a single note in class!The only people I know who didn't like the course were total slackers.

brutal - stupid video lectures don't keep your interest at all, very scienc-y course. intro psychs suck cause its such a broad overview, but the disconnect with the prof makes it worse. plus i got screwed on the group project both times - got stuck in a group that didnt care and ended up doing all the work just to pass! TA totally unhelpful!

i never had him in 1a03 because i took it in the summer. i had him for 2b03 and he's hilarious! we had 2 tests, and the first one i got 65% (i studied so hard for it) and the second one i got 87% (i barely studied for this one)... but yeah, his multiple choice q's are pretty tricky. he's probably the best prof i've had so far.

Dr. Day is nice in person when you meet him...there is no real problem with him but more the content in his courses. He is sometimes hard to follow in his lectures and texts and is really harsh on his exams...

I'm sure Dr.Day would be a good professor if he wasn't lecturing through those videos.. those vidoes are horrible and put you to sleep. the coursewear is useless.. try a real textbook please.. if you didnt understand soemthign from the lectures you would hope the textbook would clear it up.. WRONG its a repeat of his lecture..and the TA's are usele

I love the MC tests, and I thought the video lectures covered everything we needed to know. I like the way he's set up the course, and I found the custom courseware of much value. He's extremely nice, and super helpful!
His test and exam were trickster and the video lectures were booooooooooooooooooooooring but he was a nice guy and I thought the material was interesting. He should update the videos lol.
How about get rid of the movies?
Even the the video lectures are sometimes dry and an 8:30 timeslot is miserable, this is an excellent class and the prof does a good job explaining material.
A tough prof (his tests are tough) but he is better than other profs teaching this class. His exams are all multiple choice, so you don't have to worry about doing assignments or writing huge answers
his video lectures weren't appealing ... and psychology wasn't exactly for me, but his web site was very extensive and helpful especially when u missed a class or two
No Comments
Interesting to listen to

He is a great lecturer, and if you study his stuff, you'll do well.  However, I went and asked him a question four days before an exam, and he told me to 'get lost' and just do the readings.  Some people I know have had similar experiences; he tries to come off approachable, but he doesn't actually want to talk to you...  He was a real jerk.

Dr. Day is brilliant, clear, organized, and helpful.  His website has a database of sample questions that are invaluable for study, as well as mp3s of the lectures.His sense of humour, concise explanations, and compelling speaking style make the lectures fly. This course, on personality,  is the most interesting I've ever taken.

Video lectures not all that appealing, however the prof as a person is very helpful! I think he goes above and beyond to help his students. How many profs at mac spend 20% of their coursewear on how to study and how to succeed. A very helpful prof!!!!
If you have a chance take his personality course, you get to see him in person! Great guy, even posts recordings of his lecture on the course website in case you miss a class.

I've heard him speak outside of the video lectures and he's a really great guy and I'm sure he's an awesome prof in person but the video lectures bored me! I guess I just don't learn from watching a person on a screen. But the material was interesting and it was a pretty good course overall.
hard to judge him just from the video lectures, i think theyre boring as hell, just try not to get the  830 lectures.
Dr.Day the best prof. at Mac. He is willing to help out his students, wants them to suceede but his tests are very very hard, mind you that they are all MC questions.

Oh, Dr. Dick Day. How I loved it at 8:30AM x 3 in a week! Really the video lectures, I thought, were just bad, didn't learn a thing - except for taste aversion and his experience of peach schnappes as a "youthful university student"! Never going to forget that one!

Took course ~10 years ago... sure you are still watching Martin Short in the same videos!  Created a great system to teach the country's biggest class at the time (1600 or so was it?).  Your experience then (and now) depends a lot on the quality of your TA.  I was lucky and mine was fabulous.

Dr. Day is kind and eager to help his students.  His video lectures are actually funny (be sure to watch out for how he's MUCH younger and less bald in the later video lectures, plus the fact that he SMOKED in some of the videos!! hilarious). his exams are hard but there is no shortage of effort on the department's part to help you to understand.

I took his course so long ago some of you others probably weren't even born yet.  He was amazing.  So much so that I pattern my teaching style after his (yes, I'm rated on this site as well).  Dick, you're the best.
His exams are quiet tricky and hard but he is a nice prof.
Probably the best prof at Mac EVER!  Really great attitude!  You gotta love this dude!
he seems super nice, and like a really cool guy... DICK YOU'RE MY IDOL!!!!!!
good prof
Excellent prof, even though I only see him through a tv screen. Very accessible. Maintains a great website and responds to emails remarkably quickly. Great prof overall, and funny too!
Amazing prof.

If you've only seen him in the 1A/AA videos, you ain't seen nothin'.  As a lecturer Dr. Day is as good as it gets.  He does his best to make class interesting and enjoyable.  Just don't expect a free ride with 3 multiple choice tests, they aren't easy.
No Comments
NO MORE VIDEO LECTURES! THEY ARE 20 YEARS OLD- HAVE YOU SEEN DICK DAY RECENTLY!!! THE CLASS IS GREAT, BUT WE SHOULDNT PAY SO MUCH TO WATCH OLD VIDEOS OF DICK SITTING IN HIS OFFICE 20 YEARS AGO.
great course
get ride of the video lectures, it disconnects the students from the elcturer and therefore has an effect on the learning of the material.
He is awesome, and really helpful
good prof. Tests/midterm not easy but fair. Do lots of online questions!! Interesting lectures.
Amazing prof.  Great lecturer.  REALLY nice.  One of the best I've had so far.
He's cute
Great guy!

I think Dr. Day is one of the best lecturers that McMaster has to offer. In this course (Personality) it is not a video, as in intro psych, and his lectures in person are interesting and exciting and made the course come alive. Personality is a great elective and I would recommend for sure!!
awesome prof, interesting course, and multiple choice weren't that hard. Video lectures could put me to sleep once in a while but courseware was all i needed

Amazing prof!!
Great prof, caused me to switch majors into psych. His questions arent as bad as everyone says if you study his practice Q's

hes okay

the easiest coursee everrrrr. can miss a few classes and it wont matter at all. if u do every question on the online quiz thing ur guranteed a 10.
amazing

I wasn't really sure how to rate Dr. Day, however decided on 4's.  His teaching and videos can be interesting, however there is simply no point in going to class to watch them.  You can get A's simply by memorizing the courseware 2 days before the exam.
Didn't go to class much but I memorized the coursepack.  The exams were pretty tricky and it's a very science related course.

Loved the class so much. Video lectures make this class a breeze. You never have to worry about missing a class or two. Beats reading 100s of text book pages. The videos are hillarious and the exam isn't tricky if you know your stuff.
Awesome prof!
I rarely went to class because the video lectures were so pointless. His multiple choice questions are tricky, so watch out!
A little sciency, but necessary. following psych classes are much more interesting. would prefer that he teaches live instead of videos. nice guy-very friendly. enjoyed the course.
Did NOT like this course, too science related. Don't have to go to class, just read coursepack

The exams are a killer. Course is interesting. Take this course in the summer with a different prof. You have to be very smart to get a good grade with this prof.

Worst prof in the history of McMaster. Failure rate in his classes is incredibly high. I wish I never came to McMaster!! Makes me hate psychology so much. Don't take this prof's classes. You WILL regret it.

After sitting through two whole courses with Dr. Day and writing two of his final exams I will NEVER take a psychology course again. The exams were both extremely difficult, and I found the material to be boring and unhelpful. A big thumbs down.

It's a shame that we have those video lectures because Dr. Day would likely be a great teacher in person. Whenever you are unsure of something, don't hesitate to go ask him questions. He's very welcoming.

Sorta makes the best of a bad situation. Videos and MC exams are not a great way to learn. Good memory and guessing skills will lead to good mark. I got A by studying the stuff on the site the night before...have since forgotten everything.

The best psych class ever, after 1AA3, loved all the personal touches he added to make sense of the material. The info was so interesting that you didn't really have to study

He is very unclear on what is on tests, he gives awful reviews and makes a lot of mistakes in examples. Also gives barely any part marks. And finally does not use textbook so go to class
Good lecturer. Found the quizzes hard sometimes.

This class was fair, as were the midterms and final. You only need to study from your class notes (no textbook) and professor Bruce is very clear with what he expects from students. I feel like he is a genius but he comes across as very laid back and non-personable which can make economics VERY dry. All in all, the class was easy but not engaging.
Excellent notes and really makes the material really interesting. Super nice guy and he's just simply brilliant!
Really knows his stuff. Brilliant man. Attend the lectures and you are set! Godly notes. Just a great prof in general!
what an amazing prof. bruce really knows his stuff and i can't describe him other then amazing
Really good professor..one of the best I've had.
Good prof. other than the fact he makes up examples on the spot and thus they are hard to solve, you end up using some crazy calc. in econ class.
Really friendly, really good at what he teaches. Writes his own notes on the board which is basically what will show up on tests/exam.

Great Instructor with a fun sense of humour! Very very clear in his teaching, no need for the text book just show up to every class. You're paying for it anyway! Fair, clear, concise and knows very well what he is teaching. Every horror story about I've heard about Stats has been dispelled through his class.

he knows what hes talking about and he doesn't fool around... you definitely will not need the text book.. i dont think i opened it once. you basically have to attend class becuase he does not post his lectures and every lecture he will be covering an important topic. over all hes a good prof
Good sense of humor, class notes are basically what is on the tests/exam. Pretty easy course..

brilliant man, don't need the textbook he explains everything well and only tests what he teaches you.  felt so bad for him tho, b/c most of the students in this class were useless and blamed him for their poor grades

James Bruce, What a guy! it's so hard describing how amazing he is in 350 words but here it goes. James Bruce is a man's man, when you learn with james you have to be smart, because he has no time for losers. why you may ask? Simple. He's a winner and always will be. The man is the best professor at McMaster university. James Bruce is Economics

james bruce defines what it is to be a man. His lectures are intriguing and his sense of humor accented the sometimes dull course material. For all you bashing on Bruce: "don't hate the playa hate the game"

his class is not hard, and his notes are useful cuz there's useful info that's not present in the textbook, but personally I just studied from the textbook and read the notes afterwards, u can tell he knows the material but he does seem lost all the time in class...

Pretty bad, my biggest problem is he really wasn't clear. His lectures were so confusing and his monotone voice made it really hard to focus! My friends explained the stuff better than he did,I would have been totally clueless if they didn't help me. I should've paid them instead of him!He was a Waste of time!!

The most easy going guy I have ever met in my life. You would never guess he was a prof by looking at him. Pay attention to his stories about his brother Darren, if nothing else. Watch out though, his tests can be real dousies!
One day, Bruce taught 45 minutes of the lecture where everyone had a very had time keeping up with the material, until midway he says "whoa, this lecture isn't for this class". True story

Prof was okay, although he didn't seem to enthusiastic about his material. But the in-class examples were fun, and a nice way to win some money (yes that's right... MONEY!) Tests were fair. The class only had 1 test and a final, which made the two quite stressful since there were no assignments to fall back on.

Great guy. To the guys saying he's clueless in class, he really knows what he's doing. He might say he forgot something, or "what did we do last class? hmmm" but he really does know I think. Good lecturer, okay course, 80+ if you attend class and do the practice exams.
Dr. James is a very nice person, approachable and helpful. Always replies to e-mails. 2GG3 is not an easy course.

2GG3 is not an easy course per se, but Bruce is an excellent guy. He is extremely approachable, accomodating, and relaxed. If you have a choice, pick Bruce ... He is one of the best in the economics department at McMaster.

Great prof, taken 3 classes with him. ALWAYS available to help one on one. Explains things clearly and in a detailed manner. His classes tend to be a little heavy on the math...he'll help you throught it, but if you can't do math then economics isnt for you. Sample tests are VERY helpful, if you do them you dont even need to buy the text. Great Guy

Soc Sci 2J03- Don't bother going to lectures for this course, his notes are posted online, word for word! Use the online website on how to do the assignments and to prepare for the tests and exam. Most unorganized prof ever, but friendly and approachable.
Sometimes his examples were not clear and hard to follow.  Bad at responding to emails.  Final exam was quite easy.

I can see he's a real econ geneis but he CANT teach.  He always gets lost while lecturing.  Yet, tests r completely irrelevant to what he covers in class + txtbk (like 1/4 questions)  The tests r particularly hard and the class avg was amazingly LOW.  However, I wont deny that his lectures notes are really good despite they arent helpful for study
BRUTAIL
Lazy guy, un-responsible, unorganized lecture, hard test. Never trust his sample test which has no business with the real one. Terrible professor!!
Unorganized. Can't keep track of anything. Takes forever to get tests/assignments back
His lecture is clear and he knows his stuffs, not many prof knows their stuffs so clear, willing to post past tests and practice which others profs dont do
meh...kinda lazy...but do his practice tests and youll be alright
Great teacher...knows his stuff. Anyone who complains about him should sit in on other economics classes!

Can you spell p-a-t-h-e-t-i-c? He is one of those teachers that know their stuff but when they teach it to first years, they address you in language suitable for fourth years. So although he has a clear voice, nobody ever understands what he is saying. This is actually one course where i had to learn it from the text book. He also sweats a lot.
Just go to class, everything on tests is mentioned aforehand
HARD TESTS!!! b on the lookout for unusual teaching methods...he could highlight important material more or help a bit more before the tets
No Comments

Has nice handwriting on the overheads; large print and neat graphs. Good voice. Sometimes explanations are too complicated, probably because he's really smart with economics. Don't blame him if you don't do well, it's the material that's the problem. Make sure you understand the first stuff well.
oh no.. he is losing hair... his teaching on overheads isnt too effective... and his examples in class differs so much from his tests... sigh.
I find that his teaching methods aren't very effective. Pauses too much. Tests a tad on the tough side. That being said, he's a really smart guy and knows his stuff.
I love the last post! Was that him? Either way it's so true.
Man, Bruce is the coolest (i'm so worried i'll gush), he's so funny and un-lame, and really kepts things alive - i second that he'd be a rad dude to go for a beer with.
he's my favourite although his tests are too hard. I don't get the alien fetish.
Bruce is a great teacher and a great guy.  Always available for help.  Very clear notes.  Would like to go for a beer with him.
should NOT be teaching a statistics course!
Good prof.  Really know his stuff - explain material very well.  Very helpful too - always try his best to clarify things.
No Comments
Bruce is awesome!  Any nay sayers just got bad marks and needed to vent.  A brilliant man.
Very hard to understand for this course. Then again this course was horrible to begin with.

Bruce is my hero! At times he makes no sense and if you ask a question and he doesn't no the answer he just laughs. but when it comes to tests, his practice tests are almost identical to the actual test
He is an amazing prof. He tries so hard to help you, and he is also always available. Great person.

Really really bad... he had no clue what he was writing in his exams. We'd go over the exam in class and he'd notice all these mistakes in his own work!! Plus he posed a question he gave us to a PhD student and HE thought it was tough!
Only reason for going to class is to make sarcastic comments with my friends... Read the Book!
He sucks!!  this is a class where you can screw up your chance of going to med or other professional school...what a easy way to do it by having him

he is the worst instructor i have by far, and he's just absolutely unorganized and "craptacular". there is absolutely no way we have to try to work around his schedule since we are all busy with other courses, and labs, rojects and assignments,
needs to get his act together.  his tests are completely unlike what he teaches.  he's a lazy, lazy man.  he's really smart but he's unable to pass that on to his students.
seems like he is on crack sometimes...but all together a good prof....his test are easy....just study for 2 hours...:D
We had a TAKE HOME test and the class average was STILL only 80%. He posed one of our questions to a PhD Econ student and that student got it wrong. A little hard maybe?!
The worst class i have ever taken in my life!!!(the worst teacher, doesn't care about the students, wants to fail us)

Usless teacher who doesn't know what he's talking about-it's all about the lecture notes though.  Don't waste your time and ask him questions in tests or after class-you'll just get: "Ask my TAs" or "Can't answer, don't want to confuse you&

I did really well in this course, but no thanks to him! useless fellow. Classes were alot more useful than textbook. Notes are useful for tests. Asking him questions about test are pointless. Doesn't know material very well. Just study hard!

Be nice to have a course outline for second term. Be nice to have sample tests more than on day before the real test.  Be nice if he could teach.  Be nice if McMaster cared about taking my money and had someone decent teach me.
good teacher.. helps if u have a bit of economics background tho.. meh..
James Bruce cannot teach.  His tests/assignments are easy, but they would be easier if he actually taught the material correctly
Nice guy but he can't teach for his life.  A bit on the odd side.  Tests are easier than assignments.  His notes are good however

A really cool guy. I would love to have a beer with him sometime but that's about it! In terms of teaching,this guy is a complete fool. Know his stuff but can spit it out so students can understand it.
can't teach, can't set a proper test, confuses everyone. Not fair to force us to have him, he'll ruin the foundation and we will fail second year courses
I leave that class more confused everytime. He knows what he is doing, and is well qualified, but he doesn't know how to TEACH. He has problems relaying the material to us and making us understand.
He knows nothing about what he's doing.
Good prof, helpful and easy material
