comments: Paul was a decent teacher, his tests were unfair, and difficult, but his exams are reasonable. He tests mostly HARDER questions which can be made easy with a VERY good grasp of basic concepts, and proper logic. Overall, expect to practice, and read a lot to do well in his class (Organic Chemistry for Dummies was very helpful).
Inspirational man. I was considering switching out of engineering into some chemistry major just to have this man teach me some more.

funniest prof ive had. his tests and exams are i think really fair. they seem difficult but it is because it is orgo chem but he does a sufficient job of preparing you for it. he was my favourite chem teacher. only problem is sometimes he digresses from the lecture content to talk about things like the discoveries of unrelated chemicals, etc.
Brilliant man. I highly recommend this prof, as his knowledge in chemistry is just as excellent as his skills at teaching.

hes a tough prof but really wants you to learn organic chem well. lectures were really interesting and he makes concepts really clear. i didnt even have to use much of the textbook.  highly recommend this guy

I enjoyed his lectures - he jokes around a lot. He explains everything well, but you MUST read the textbook. It's organic chemistry; you gotta really grind in this course to get a high mark, no matter what prof it is. Lol at the people who didn't work hard enough and hate on him afterwards.

He's a funny prof, and explains concepts well. It's a difficult course, so idk why people are blaming him for it. In my opinion, I enjoyed the course. As long as you study hard and devote more time to this course, you'll do just fine.

He's a cool guy, but you learn way more from the textbook than his lectures. Marking for short answers was surprisingly lenient. All his tests are doable if you put the work into it (aside from that one really difficult question every test). Not the best prof I've had,  but the course is not as bad as people say it is.

Lectures--PAY ATTENTION and GO. Don't go to just chat with your friends. Give him the chance and attention and the less you'll have to learn by yourself.  Labs--easy to pass.  GO TO THE CHEM HELP CENTER. THEY WILL BE YOUR SAVING GRACE.  Do the assignments, iClickers and tutorials --it'll make studying for the exam easier.
Horrible man who takes pleasure in ruining peoples GPAs, and an even worse professor with zero teaching capabilities.

Dr. Harrison regurgitates the textbook, at a fast pace. Midterm was fair. Assignments were difficult. Final Exam was extremely difficult, have many impossible questions. Practice problems in the textbook helped understand concepts. However Labs were fun as you got to learn and practice many new techniques.
worst prof i've had

Use your textbook. This guy paces and sweats more than a marathon runner. He does make jokes and tries to be engaging but it is organic chemistry. The midterm was impossible, the exam I didn't even finish. But the labs are great and actually fun. If you are not good at chem, you won't do well. I remember crying over this class a lot. Don't do it.

The tests are extremely hard (it is organic chemistry what else do you expect) but this prof is easy to understand, hilarious, willing to answer questions and genuinely seems like he wants his students to do well. The course is hard, not him.
Paul Harisson ignited my passion to stay in organic chemistry. I am now working for him in his lab where he is testing a novel anti-perspirant. Obviously its not going so well.

Don't take it at Mac. Either take it online at Athabasca with lab component done at mac, or take it at york in the summer.  Harrison is awful, tests are obnoxious. Don't understand how this course still hasn't been changed.  It will kill your GPA. You have been warned.

Contrary to many reviews here, I enjoyed Harrison's orgo lectures. The material itself is quite challenging and readings are essential. I think he does a decent job at engaging the class and reinforcing important concepts. Plus his random jokes lighten up the mood.
Hates aspiring med school & and dental school bound students. Wants you stay forever with him smoknig ciggaretes and eating potato chips.  TEXTBOOK is essential to getting a B
BEST PROF EVER! not no matter how hard you study, you still fail.

Harrison really isn't as bad of a prof as people make him out to be! His tests are difficult, sure, but never unfair. Orgo is a difficult subject after all. He is usually available for questions outside class and is a pretty nice guy. In class, he does a fairly good job at covering general concepts while keeping a light mood. Textbook is a must.

Harrison skips all the complicated concepts while focusing on those that are straightforward (which we already know). I recommend reading the textbook, it was a lot more helpful. His tests are also extremely difficult, and assignments often mis-marked.

Not a very good prof...more useful one-on-one (but still not very good). As the course went on, his lecturing worsened and he became harder to follow. The midterm was not easy, but fair. He writes a brutal final exam, though...He really expects too much out of us. Textbook definitely helped in understanding the concepts, so buy it.

Paul Harrison, in my opinion, is a pretty good professor! If you go to class, and pay attention to what he is lecturing about, you will do just fine.  He is a pretty nice guy, and likes to help out people when they need it, as well as try and lighten the mood in class when things get dull, with a joke or two.  If you just practice, you will be fine

I don't understand why people don't like Harrison! His exams are tough, definitely, but ultiamtely doable. I loved going to his lectures because he is really funny and enjoyable. Yes, you have to read the textbook, because it's a content heavy course and he doesn't have time to go through each detail in class. Overall, great prof.

The course itself has lots of content and necessitates a CONCEPTUAL approach (DON'T MEMORIZE). The assignments and midterms were fair (may be even easy) BUT the exam is very difficult as the material covered is extensive. He is a mediocre lecturer and in retrospect I would have benefited more if I has simply read the book and not gone to class
His lectures were dull and somewhat useless. Reading the textbook was essential. His tests were easy and exam was fair if you put effort into this class. Tutorials were lifesavers!
Skips through slides during lecture. Stuck 2 chapters in on the last day of class. Impossible exam. Good luck.
His tests are very undoable
Very awkward. Makes extremely unfair tests and cannot teach.
BRUTAL prof, terrible teacher & skips slides, skips questions. Exams are absolutely impossible and he purposely tries to screw you over. Textbook is an absolute must

Fair midterm, impossible exam. It's just a matter of trying to get every part mark no matter how much you understand the material. But as a prof, he's enthusiastic which is good but sometimes he goes so slow that he has to rush at the end, and that's when it gets bad.

he is actually a very nice person and helpful in class. i once spent 2 hours in his office, he missed his lunch to help. however his classes are pointless and replaceable by the textbook. His exam is impossible only because it is unfair. like walking into a english exam and finding out its actually a math exam.
He isn't as good as the chem profs in first year, but he is nice.
Disorganized, confusing and hard.
He skips through slides like there's no tomorrow. So I suggest just read the textbook.
This professor simply cannot teach, he just reads what is on the powerpoint slides without explaining any relevant detail. Also, he makes HARD tests.
The textbook teaches better than the professor himself. He frequently skips slides, which causes a lot of confusion. He also makes extremely hard tests.
This professor lacks the ability to teach this course properly and thoroughly. He skips slides very often and he can't even answer questions that were on his assignments.

Literally said something would not be on the final exam and then it showed up on the final. Helpful if you confront him in person but don't try asking "extension" questions with him, he'll simply say "I don't know" or tell you it's not relevant to the course. Lectures are very poor because he skips SO many slides. Textbook is a must.

This professor makes hard tests, confuses people when he teaches because he skips slide constantly. If he tells you something that is not going to be on the test, then make sure you study that. Good luck.
Lectures were disorganized and confusing. His testing is ridiculously hard. Studied very hard but he makes it impossible to do well in the course.
One of the worst.

Not a very good teacher. Would skip several slides at a time and say they weren't important. Always swore, which apparently is funny. His tests were verbatim from old tests, so using old tests as a study guide work well.

Gives a brutally hard midterm and an insanely impossible final. All questions are connected, so if you can't get the first part of a question, and the last question asks you to draw a detailed mechanisms of your final reaction, you're screwed!! A VERY difficult class. Use your textbook because it is surprisingly really good.
SKIPS SLIDES TOO OFTEN during lectures... made me feel like he wasn't explaining things to the fullest. Not a very good lecturer overall, hard to follow his train of thought.

Always at least 1 hilarious moment/comment per lecture. Disorganized with concepts. BUT he does make rounds to the labs/help centres to check up on students. Agree with the other person, can't make tests at an appropriate level for the course. Too hard.

I never heard such dirty language coming from a teacher!  Mac is a great school and I don't expect anything less than professional profs. He's soooo boring and never quite understands when you ask a question.
I thought he was a great prof.  Really approachable.  Nice guy.
Great prof. Course is hell.
Very, very funny - and a fairly decent prof to boot. Love the alcohol jokes. Tough course though.
He's actually a much easier marker than Valliant, gives marks for anything. And very, very funny. I enjoyed him.

Runs around the from of the class rambling on about you don't know what since he never properly introduces a topic.  You figure out what he's talking about half way through it.  God forbid you ask him a question, or he'll ramble on about something unrelated for 15 min.  Helpful after class though!

Unable to make tests at approprate level. *shrug* "Sh*t happens" isn't an appropriate response to a 53% average on midterm. Can't give answer to questions the other prof teching the course wrote-if they only accept one answer to each question, shouldn't the prof at least be able to come up with it?
He confused the hell out of me.  Engaging, with a "devil may care" attitude...but this is one tough class, regardless of the prof!
Worst prof ever!!!
Organic Chem... Need I say more??  EtOH anyone??
No Comments
the exam was death - thank goodness for bell curves
Can't even pass his own tests!  Hard tests.
reasonably clear, sometimes repetitive, hilarious, but gives killer tests

comments: Very good prof. Highly recommend taking this class.
She's the best.
Great professor! Lectures are clear, tests and assignments are straight forward and provides us with helpful stuff online.
Dr. Moro was a great prof. She is helpful and the points she makes in lecture are crystal clear.

Prof.Moro is a very good Prof. She actually make me feel very interested in Linguistics. I also like the fact that she only gives selections of lecture slices, so that we will attend the lecture to learn better. It may not sound good for someone don't enjoy lecture.
Clear instructions. Helps out students by posting exam break down and going through them. Make's sure everyone understands. No surprises on exam. Straight forward. How all profs should be.

My favourite prof during first year.  She explains concepts very well and doesn't pull any punches on tests and exams -- if you know you're stuff, she's not going to trick you like they do in other courses *cough* chemistry *cough*
Clear lectures, important to pay attention in lecture and attend tutorials. Midterms and Exams are straight forward. Gives practice questions and outlines exam. Very helpful and nice.

Amazing prof - really clear with great examples. Attend classes and ask questions. The midterm is fair as long as you keep up with your work. Weekly assignments are also an easy way to pick up marks. Overall, an awesome course and a great prof.
Prof. Moro is a great prof! Though she cant teach 500+ kids at a time, she can get through to those who are actually there for class. I love her 1a03 class and want her as a prof again.
excellent prof - make sure you attend tutorials.
Dr. Moro's lectures are so awesome and easy to follow.

One of the best profs at MAC, shown by her awards!  Very helpful and interesting and knows what she is talking about.  You can also tell she enjoys what she is teaching.  Most knowledgeable prof! Take any course you can with her!
BEST. PROF. EVER! Very approachable, committed to helping her students succeed.
Take any class you can with Dr. Moro.  She goes above and beyond the call of duty as a professor in every respect.  So smart, friendly, kind, helpful, and patient.
Very, very good...I want to keep taking linguistics!
too intense

Excellent prof. One of my all-time favourites. Always fun to converse with, and VERY helpful, gives in-depth answers to questions. Classes are clearly structured and straightforward, exams are fair, and assignments are interesting. You'll definitely enjoy any class she's teaching.
awesome prof
Great class and even better with Dr. Moro.  She makes all of her classes amazing and clear.  Great person to talk with, and you always learn having her as your prof.  Just can't go wrong.
Best Prof I have ever encountered. Dr.Moro was always willing to help me out and without her encouragement and extra attention I would not have done as well as I did. I owe her alot!

They say first year is the hardest, Moro makes it easier in lecture by providing examples and reviewing the material that is in the informative and detailed textbook that accompanies the course. Read the chapters before class & you won't have any trouble.
Very smart lady, kind, helpful,friendly not to mention an excellent prof. Made class fun and intresting. Not there to trick students but there to teach and spread the joy of linguistics...
Great class!! Linguistics is a very interesting subject!!  Dr. Moro makes the class very good!!
She is the best prof. because she is willing to help you and is a really nice person. She is awesome and thank you for being such a great persona and an inspiration.
cool prof..very nice and sincerely interested in her students doing well
Dr. Moro is my favourite professor.  Her clarity makes Linguistics fun and easy.
awesome prof!
excellent prof...i learned how much fun linguistics is
easy to understand, smart and student-friendly
amazing teacher!!
Clear, Nice & Honour B.Smoker!! :P
Excellent prof, one of the best.
why i am i so attracted to her? best prof ever though
she's got the goods
No Comments
No Comments

comments: He's such a good guy, as well as a good professor. He's just one of those professors that are down-to-earth and makes you feel comfortable when talking to.

He's extremely helpful. If you have any questions he's always willing to help answer them. The only bad thing I have to say about this class is that he doesn't post any of his slides, and his powerpoints are very text heavy, so you are constantly rushing to type down whats on the board and do not get to listen to him speak. But overall, great prof.

Dr. Schmidt is an awesome prof. Super nice, super funny, and he actually cares about his students. Going to class is a must, however the textbook really isn't needed. His notes summarize all of the key points from the text and he tells you that anything in the book not covered in class is NOT testable. Overall awesome guy

Drifts off the point. Repeats himself over and over. Doesnt post SLIDES! talks super fast, so you are trying to copy the slides and take notes on what hes saying at the same time so you miss alot and cant learn anything. AWFUL.  looks to t.a for technological needs. can he not turn a video on himself? wow.
Dr. Schmidt is the best!

His course was interesting. BUT it was hard! I read the text, went to classes and still did so bad on the midterms. The midterm questions are tricky and ambiguous at times. The TAs ar dump - they want the exact word (d.n understand synonyms). But overall the material was interesting. Nice guy - just wished his tests wasn't soo awful - lwred my GPA!

i loved this class. the material was really interesting, and the essay was fun. schmidt is a really good prof. he's really hot too. it's not just me -- my friends agree...there's something about him! haha...but seriously, its a great course

Dr. Schmidt is just awesome. I really enjoyed his lecture style -- while there was no notes posted online, but he spoke with confidence and prompted many interesting discussions. Watch for cute/hilarious catch phrases such as "Any questions, other than what time is it?" or "Lets take a healthy....17 minute break!". lol.

the most painful nightclass i have ever had to attend.  don't take this class if you don't need to - the assignments were ridiculous (and the ta's were NOT helpful, and i am a NICE PERSON!), the midterm was fair and exam was very precise.  he's helpful but you don't learn anything useful until the end of the class - not worth it!!

One of the most borning psychology courses I've had..It was almost physically painful to sit in his class and listen to him repeating himself over and over before he gets to a point. Rushed the material towards the end of the course. The midterm and final exam were VERY poorely designed. Don't take this class if you absolutely don'e need to.

One of the worst professors I have ever had. Drifted from the point, couldn't explain things properly and refused to use available technology and on top of that made us frantically copy out numerous graphs while were were trying to understand what they showed.  Absolutely one of the worst!  Avoid him if you can!
Really funny,and easy going prof. But rushed alot of material at the end of the course. Overall, one of my favorite classes.
One of McMaster's best! I loved the class
Excellent class.  Dr. Schmidt is very thorough and interesting.  Take this class or any class he teaches!!

Yeah, interesting, but he guy takes FOREVER to say anything. He repeats himself and generally wastes time. We should have done 7 chps before the midterm but only did 4, so now we're going through material like CRAZY, spending 50 minutes on whole chapters, and not learning about the specifics. :<

Dr. Schmidt is one of McMaster's finest. He is interesting, intelligent, great teacher. READ YOUR TEXT as his lectures aren't thought-out. Talk to him after class/get involved. He envourages free & integrative thinking in-class and in assign.s. GREAT OVRL
No Comments
Had a very odd sense of humour.....but definitely did a good job of keeping things very relaxed in class.  A little too much into experiments which come across his desk.
rather cute and very funny...oh ya and knows his stuff (especially his own)
No Comments
Very good prof. Very funny too!
Keeps a light mood in class. Interesting sense of humour.  Knows his stuff.
Funny and nice!
No Comments
Great attitude towards teaching and students, very fair and intelligent
Stupid course, poorly tested
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Not a great prof at all. SO disorganized. He knows his flaws (in terms of teaching style and not explaining well enough) but he refuses to fix the flaws. Some people do well in the course because he repeats questions from the test banks. I believe he has retired tho, so yay!
He was better at explaining things in office hours. Just read the textbook and go to his office hours, use your friend's help on the in class quizzes. After all that, just hope for a decent mark
dont take it unless you have to.

He is a terrible lecturer but his tests come from the courseware. So his poor teaching is reflected on the tests. he's not like other profs who suck and then butcher you on the exams. I want to have him again, if you study the courseware you'll get at least a 10
He is extremely hard to follow, the amount of mistakes in his courseware is copious, and the exam has nothing in common with midterms/courseware.
Lectures are not helpful at all.  Too many errors in courseware.

If you get sick for a period of time and have to miss any classes you'll be screwed because his evening section has a quiz or test every week.  His lectures are long and monotonous, involving him simply doing the math behind problems for two hours.  He doesn't explain any sort of theory behind the work. He changed the exam format at the last minute
Do not take his evening microeconomics class; poorly run class with terrible instruction.

In short:  1) Lectures are useless and boring 2) Courseware has a multitude of typos that confuse students trying to learn the math 3) He reuses questions from his courseware, yes, but he changes them 4) Work is easy but hard to understand properly, you may think you're right but you're actually wrong 5) His exams are brutally hard
Lol I swear going to class confuses you more... IF YOU TAKE HIS CLASS DONT ATTEND LECTURE JUST READ THE COURSEWARE

There was no structure to his course, let alone his lectures. His courseware was full of errors and he was behind in his lectures. Lost a lot of quizzes, not to mention the amount of errors he made in recording our marks. Overall, too much work for a course I didn't learn anything from. Take it with another professor if you have to!!
Terrible prof, hard to understand and doesnt have any notes or powerpoint slides. His courseware is full of errors.
Worst Teacher Ever..

He is not a greater lecturer but his tests are pretty easy. His test questions are very similar to his practice questions in the course pack. Take his courses if you just care about a good grade rather than learning new content.
please do yourself a favour and get out of this class, such a great guy but his courseware isn't legible and nobody can understand him
perfect
Pretty bad lecturer but he recycles questions and it's easy to do well in his classes. Take it if you're more interested in your grade than in learning the actual material.
No need to go to classes, only need to read the courseware and do the practise quiz and tests, got A+

terrible course with a terrible prof. his lecture is useless as his courseware. the best advice is to drop his class as soon as possible. his accent and his poor clarity make most students hard to understand. REALLY REALLY TERRIBLE.

The most abysmal professor I've ever had at McMaster University. This class was so poorly taught I would recommend anybody who has Khan as a professor to immediately drop the class and avoid the utter waste of time. The subject itself has so much potential, but it is ruined by this prof who is incapable of teaching, organizing, and speaking audibly
disliked the class and the prof. easiest class though, he makes sure you do well

Awesome Prof. Really cares about his students, and will take time to help you if you approach him with a question. Holds a pizza party at the end of the year for the entire class. I understood economics much better because of his class.
Great professor! He explains the materials clearly and the course ware that he published had clear examples!

He is so easy just because he reuses his questions from the coursepack. No need to even read the notes. All my studying consisted of redoing and memorizing all of the previous quizzes and tests.  I studied the day before and I got A-.I probably could have gotten higher if I tried harder or came to class (only came for the quizzes) but whatever :P.
his courseware is whack. lots of spelling, grammar, math errors, and incongruent. not a good lecturer,but the sample tests make it an easy ride.
Easy to get a good grade but the lectures felt like a waste.
Helpful

This professor is HIGHLY ideologically subversive. He essentially lays the course out as a defense of contemporary socialist economic policy. He is fraught with logical fallacy. Aside from this, he is funny and intelligent assist in instruction of class and obtaining high grades.
Easy marks with tons of previous tests. His book is helpful in understanding the materials, but his lecture is a joke. Most ppl go to the class is just because of the bonus quizzes.

Dr. Khan is one of the few profs who really cares about his students. His courseware is really clear and concise, everything you need to do well in the course is in there. He doesn't just analyze things graphically, he does it algebraically too, to help you understand the language of economics.

He's an O.K prof if you want to get a decent mark,bBut you will be teaching yourself the entire course. You will also be behind when you take the extension 2HH3 course. If you are actually interested in learning and being educated, he is a joke of a prof.

Khan really had a way of making relatively easy topics more complicated than they actually are. He seems like a great guy but his teaching skills are lacking. He speaks unclearly and his courseware is vague & has many mistakes. I paid good money for it, so I'd at least expect it to be proofread. He does give a lot of easy bonus quizzes though.
ANY COURSE WITH HIM IS 12 ABLE

Great professor. I dont understand all the negativity towards him. He doesnt make you buy the book, but rather a cheap course ware (even though he published it better than $150 book). Tells you exactly whats on the test. Very open, honest, and kind heart. A+

He's pretty horrible, to be completely honest.  A nice man with a good heart, but falls short when it comes to explaining concepts.  He tells you what you need to know for the tests/quizzes and gives you an opportunity to do well in the class, but I found that even though I did very well, I didn't feel like a learned much of anything.

You will not get a better prof then this guy. I took a class with him about 8 years ago, I came back to comment on this because he will teach you more then economics. You know he gets his questions from the study guide. Most profs get there questions from somewhere. Find out where! Practice those questions and understand the material. Youllaceever
I dont think that anyone should get less than 10 in his class.

He's hard to understand with a thick accent, messy writing and disorganizedish teaching, but that's besides the point. He pretty much gives you what's going to show up on the tests  right from the courseware/textbook and gives you lots of free marks. You can't say he isn't fair, you just have to practice the material and do some reading
Alright guys, you gotta be fair to him.  He is a little hard to understand but he does give you a LOT of sample tests.  Trust me, there are many profs out there who are both unclear AND unfair.
Absolutely cannot teach, if it wasn't for his course ware (which provides a ton of previous tests and quizzes) most people would fail his classes

very hard to understand in class and super disorganized class notes but....he gives you a ton of practice tests in the coursware which are very useful( he often uses the same questions for tests) and if you attend class he does a lot of bonus assignments to help everyone out.. good guy overall will take his classes again
Good guy

A thick accent and tends to ramble, but if you listen to what he's saying and don't attempt to just follow along with the courseware, you'd find that he's actually extremely helpful when explaining things. One of the nicest professors at McMaster.
Do not expect clean, organized class notes. Attend your lectures (gives TONNES of bonus marks from bonus quizzes/tests) and read off course pack, and you will sure get nice grades

Disorganized, inconsistent pace, knowledgeable, scary.  Read the material prior to the lectures to have a clear understanding on what he is teaching. Ask for help when needed--gives clear explanations. The courseware is enough to get an A in this class.

I don't know why people bash Khan -- he's a really nice, genuine guy and his lectures are bearable; a lot better than some other econ profs. He does have a thick accent, and he has an odd style of teaching where he uses his courseware too much and oddly organized notes on overheads, but simply: if you don't go to class, you'll do terrible.

Very nice person, modest and accepts critique, knows his stuff (most of the time). On the down side: quite messy, bad lecturing, inconsistent pace (can dwell long on basic stuff and cruise through other chapters). If you are smart you will not have trouble figuring out everything he is trying to say.
really nice guy and proff

He knows his stuff. Very knowledgeable which sometimes makes him go faster & students sometimes cant keep pace with that. Lectures are important with bonus marks given for attendance on special occasions like test review. Textbook reading is a must. Practice tests in course ware are a must & very similar to actual tests.

bad prof, unorganized method of teaching, boring lectures, basically I learned everything from the textbook, and ignored the lecture notes completely, didn't understand what he was saying in class anyways
Do not go to the class u can understand everything from the textbook and courseware. His lecture has significantly decreased my interest in Economics.

AHHH STOP USING OVERHEADS. if u take notes in class you will find that they are extremely useless. there are 2 things you need to do. 1) read the covered sections in the textbook. 2) do the practise tests in the courseware. you might also get a thing or two out of looking at the courseware notes.
Great guy, hard to understand but you will get the point. His quizes and tests are exactly like his previous tests and quizes, so study the courseware, dont bother looking at the study guide.

Had him for 1b03&2hh3, pretty much the same thing. Everything is in the custom courseware he uses, practice tests/quizzes. He's a pretty bad prof, boring, doesn't explain things well. Uses formulas and graphs without really explaining why we use them. The only good thing is it's a guaranteed A-.. getting an A+ is a BIT harder but still very doable.

If you have him for first year econ, do all of the study guide questions before every test!!! Many of the same questions come up on his tests. If you use your textbook and attend class you will do very well.
HE is one of the best prof ever
his class is the easiest in MAC, just study the study guide and the final guide line, then u will be all fine and get high mark. he give high mark for essays too!
He is a good prof and seems to care a lot. i love the pace of the class. and enjoyed the class bt stressed the**** outta me in the first test. :s ... very helpful
the coolest prof at mac
Easiest A+ you'll get at Mac! Cool Prof...
Likes to string as much jargon into one sentence as he can.  Very confusing.  Use normal words please.

constantly late for class, does not teach the material effectively so you better be willing to read the textbook and learn yourself...university needs to seriously evaluate him and demote/replace him...he is a joke and obviously takes teaching the course as a joke...if you enjoy teaching yourself economics, take khan.
interesting.

I got an A with him in first year but this man should not be teaching at all. He rambles on about his macro models but the only all he does is write formula after formula, introduce new variables, solving for variables. This is not economics. Even if he didn't have an accent, he would still be very hard to follow. Pretty much a self-study course.

Great prof. All his lectures are based on the custom courseware (which has old tests/exams). So easy. Take a lot of questions from old tests/exams. Kinda boring class. For the final he actually gives everyone a review sheet which basically tells you the topic to study. AND neatest of all, he buys the entire class pizza near the end of the term!

Khan is a decent prof. Tries hard to convey the concepts; sometimes he succedes sometimes he doesn't. I think that probably he knows that he is not very good at teaching so this is why he gives easy tests.

I can't understand his accent. He speaks and speaks, but nothing makes sense. When approched, he isn't that friendly and is very short-tempered. His overhead notes make no sense. I would not recommend this prof.
amazing prof. he loves students and cares for their well being. unlike other profs who are just in it for the money (hannah holmes)
Boring,u never know what he is talking about. We don't go to his class because we don't want to waste time. We can passed this course only depending on our self-study.

You have to get into this class he gives you tonnes of bonus marks and he is very easy. He sucks at lectures but you can learn everything on your own. He is very helpful with the final. I was going in with a 12 no problem.

I have Prof. Khan ever since 1st year 1A06, now I'm in 3rd.  I pretty much self-learnt over the past 3 years.  I agree he's nice; but this' not doing any good on u, esp. those who wanna proceed into econ.  His tests are not easy, just b/c he copied frm his past papers, we THOUGHT they are easy.  wait and see his finals, they are tough!

All you first year students haven't experienced the dark side of having him in upper year courses. Absolutely terrible. He is unclear and doesn't even know what he is talking about. Btw, the free pizza is a bribe for boosting his rating.

very good prof, helpfull, easy, funny, classes are optional as he basically tries to make u understand the concepts, read teh study guide and courseware and you'll ace the course. PIZZZZZZZZAAA MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
Midterms are easy but be prepared to get owned in the final.
You absolutely learn nothing in class. Just do the study guide, past exams and textbook. East midterms but kills you in the final.

Khan appears to be nice and pleasant in class but email him or talk to him in his office its a different story. Totally rude! Gives you pizza at the end of semester; wants you to give me a higher rating!! You learn absolutely nothing in class, the textbook is your friend. Horrible prof.
Rashman is the best ever teacher I've ever had. He is so cool!! Very clear speaker, good jokes, good pizza, and excellent teaching philosophy.

just not a good prof.  and he knows it thats where the pizza party came from thats why he cuts us all those breaks he is trying to cover it up.  But he is still an easy good mark.  Great elective for engineers.
Very easy, hilarious prof. Course is designed for you to get a good mark. Lectures are helpful but not necessary.
The man discusses far too often on things off topic, gives you pizza last class to get a better teacher rating. Honestly his tests are retarded "best fit" multiple choice, go to class if you dare!

He is the coolest prof of all time. Hes my favourite teacher ive ever had. He's so funny and talks about the most random things!! I love how he talks about the leafs every lecture! Khan your the man!!!

i wont say he's hard.  just if you guys want an easy mark, go with him.  if u intend to do Hon.E. , avoid his classes by all means.  You WILL NOT learn anything from him, it just costed you pains if you procced further in the economics field if you have Khan for the first yr 06 and both 2nd yr intermediate marco. courses. Good Luck
Economics is very hard
Excellent Prof!
Khan is the man, he sets you up to do well.. you guys are morons if you didnt do well.. its your own fault.. learn how to read and maybe you can pass

The man's a moron, he gives you 5% because he gets 5% of each answer key wrong. He can't even even copy a text book. He jumps around three handwritten transparencies at once erasing and correcting his mistakes, of course you can't understand him b/c of his accent. The man is dazed, confused and lost
Great Prof! Takes the best 2 out of 3 test, and best 3 out of 4 assignments. Lot of multiple choice questions are from the study guide. Exam is fair, but kinda long (100 MC). Overall, a great prof

khan is funny... and because of his funny accent.. i doubt most of the class know what he is talking about... but he gives you "sample" exam questions, and takes a lot of quesitons from his study guide... at the end he also gives the whole class a 5% bonus because the average is soo bad.

All i have to say is STUDY GUIDE. He also takes questions right from his courseware and the tests in there. Apart from his "stories" and his accent he's alright, very helpful. Bad prof, makes up for it with easy tests no doubt. He gives the whole class extra marks lol..Good guy

This class is so easy if you just read the text and actually attend. He offers his students sooo much help and he's a really nice guy! He brought us pizza but that's just the kind of guy he is, he actually cares about his students and wants them to do well.His tests and assignments are also fair!
Good prof. Fair exams. You can ace the course if you go to class.
he's a funny guy
He is one of the best profs in Mc. Easy test and ass. Easy gong person. nice guy. study with him/
He is the BEST~ i love him so much ! ~ his class is really easy ~
hard to understand his accent :(
Okay class. Used a small chalkboard in a huge class, making it impossible to see. Not a hard class though.
i dont like this professor

guys .. stop saying he's easy .. i have him since 1A06 last year and he's getting harder year by year !! the past exam on 2H was the most tricky exam i have received from khan ... and our class avg is dropping ... he's not that easy anymore >.<
I LOVE HIM!!!!!
this guy is the man. how many proffs buy pizza for a whole macroeconomics class
NOBODY DARE SAY NOTHING BAD ABOUT HIM! HE's THE BEST. U DAM FIRST YEARS, I HOPE U FAIL!

this prof is as bad as it can get. for sure ur not gonna learn anything in his class, besides his personal life and what he watched on TV last night.Not helpful whatsoever..sleeps during his office hrs.self-study the text otherwise 3rd yr will be nightmar
This is a review from gr.12 economics for me but its ok. He has a funny humour and tries to get us involved but his notes make no sense.
INCREDIBLE!
Great prof and also took WHOLE class out for beer and wings!!!!

Class was boring but a good mark was easy to get as long as you looked over the study guide & old tests he provided. At least 50% of the questions you practice will show up on the test. Nice guy, feel lucky if u get him for 1A06 other profs much harder!
he is a good prof. care about his student and his test are fair not so hot and everytime he said "it will be on the test" it surely will appear on the test. anyway a good prof.
Great prof--explains concepts really well....always available for extra help...also, VERY nice- took entire class out for beer, nachos and wings!!!!!!!

He's an easy prof i guess... even i'm not doing too well in his class.  He can't really explain well dou, but he really hopes ppl can go to his class, he's a nice man beside his lecture r mainly helpless in study for the tests and exams

Easiest prof ever. Can't understand his lectures at all. Going to class is a complete waste of time. He talks about the Leafs. I'm convinced he purposely makes the course easy so that he'll get good student reviews and keep getting his contract renewed.
VERY NICE PROF!

i dun think his tests r easy beside the first one... the rest are hard.  But his lectures are helpless, he talks about useless stuffs during lecture.  Perhaps a full lecutre explaining how to look at the graph?  We have learnt that early in Gr.9
damn you ppl. I think he knows that his tests were too easy and now they are harder.
Haven't understood a word this guy has said.  If you study the study guide and old tests you'll do fine though.
No Comments
Great Guy, actually got to know my name in a class of 300.  Do the study guide!  EKAHNOMICS!!
Awesome prof!  Very likeable, mix of stories and teaching is great, makes coming to class enjoyable.  Tests might be a tad easy, but material gets covered and you learn what's necessary.
He is a rad dude !!!
Study his old tests if  you  can get your hands on them. He recycles questions  ALOT!
dare iv it ive
hes a good guy...taught me to find the  derivative ...hehe ;)
It doesn't get any easier than this.  Ask him about the Blue Jays.  Better yet, ask him to a baseball game.  He'll get you an A, just memorize the study guide answers.
you like movies??
Open Mic With Papa Kahn...Very Cool!!!!
He is my hero
Ridiculously easy tests & exams, lectures are boring and useless, nice guy
Coffee addicted. Unclear notes and poor lectures, easiest tests and exams ever!
my favorite prof!!  coolest guy ever.
Bad notes, unclear lecture.
Photocopies questions from study guide and uses them on tests/exams
really funny and gave a makeup test when class average was low
Great person!
No Comments
Too fast and speech not clear
No Comments
No Comments
Good guy.  Will reward you with marks for showing up to class.  Class is boring.
Accept Advice, such a nice teacher
No Comments
No Comments
Great Prof. Promised to raise my low mark if I showed improvment in other course
No Comments
Hes nice and funny. But his teaching skills arent the best.
Nice prof, class is so boring, he is all over the place??
No Comments
He Rocks!  Thanks to him passing me at the last minute I got to graduate!
He wishes he was a Mac 1/4Back, easy tests, confusing lectures
No Comments
Spends half the lecture talking about baseball, other half about movies
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Hands down one of the best I have ever had the pleasure of learning from.

She can be very intimidating but once you approach her once, she will remember you for the remainder of the term and help you. Only critique is that during class discussion she does tend to talk over you and doesn't really allow you to fully express what you are thinking. Overall, her class is enjoyable.

She's a great prof! Hard but fair and helpful when you approach her.  She can come off a little intimidating but she's very welcoming once you gather the courage.  Taken 4 classes with her! She's awesome

She is an amazing professor. Hard but fair marker, helps you to better yourself and doesn't let you off easy, helps you become a better student by challenging yourself! Doesn't put up with any disruptive students. Makes clear and insightful points during discussions.
great prof. repeats everthing so you have a chance to note everything.  slides are extremely detailed and posted online.  is also very fair with testing

yes she will embarrass students,if u r not paying attention n playing on ur phone or laptop, u fully deserve 2 b embarassed if u do those things. She is a great prof n is very approachable. Ask 2 speak 2 her and she will help u out with anything. I graduated from Mac, but I still keep in contact with her if I need help with an assignment

Agree that she is EXTREMELY condescending and rude to students. If she doesn't like or agree with your opinion, she will IMMEDIATELY shut it down or say that it's not on topic. She should not be teaching at all. Very uninspiring.

EXTREMELY rude and condescending. I am honestly shocked to read people here say she is approachable. Her class is boring you will be counting the minutes until it ends. She literally repeats EVERY single point 2-3 times. She does not belong in a classroom as a professor. She is demanding and not afraid to embarass an unexpecting student.

Great class, interesting information.  Very straight forward lectures, tests and assignments. Students (if they actually apply themselves..) have the ability to do very well in this (and any of Dr.Joanisse's) classes.  She is very fair, demands respect and is very approachable.  Do not be afraid because of other poor ratings from immature students!

This class changed my life; amazing professor! If you have the chance, take Dr.Joanisse's classes!! She is a huge asset to McMaster University and they are lucky to have her! Great topics for class and excellent discussions.

Prof. Joanisse does seem intimidating at first. However, she is extremely approachable and fair. She will see that your hard work is rewarded. If you don't take your degree seriously, don't take her classes.

I have taken every course that Dr.Joanisse teaches; she is an amazing professor and does not babysit lazy students, nor does she tolerate any BS in her classroom. She is incredibly smart and has a wealth of knowledge to share. Go to class, take good notes and you don't need a textbook if you do that. Highly recommend taking her classes!
I enjoyed her class, she was one of my favorite professors at the University.

I think she is a great professor! I appreciate that she has ZERO tolerance for annoying students who talk or text during lecture. She makes her classes easy by repeating the important points during her lectures. Her exams are also fair. She is quite approachable and happy to explain or answer questions.

The best professor i have ever got in University. She was very easy and helpful to approach. Her tests are straight from her notes you do not have to read the book. Shes the first professor in university that has remembered my name with only telling her once. Pretty impressive professor. I would love to take her class AGAIN!!

not enough characters to even describe how awful this prof is. Does not belong in a university setting, or even elementary school for that matter. Terrible attitude towards students. Very bad at lecturing.

I have had Leanne for 2Q06, 3HH3 and 2D06 and hope to sign up for her 4th year seminars. She is very straight forward and aligns lectures exactly with the text. If you email her redundant questions that are in the syllabus or otherwise, she won't answer them..university students shouldnt need their hands held. If you go to class you'll do very well
I had her 2007-2008, she was awesome. Honestly, go to lecture, if you have a laptop type everything she says. I didn't read the text book at all. Exams were easy, right from the lectures. I got an A.

i also chose her for independent research 4th year class.she is intimidating at first, but is actually nice and approachable afterwards.demands a lot, but it is a 4th yr class.took us also on field trip which is amazing bc no prof's ever do that.gives explanation for grades and how to improve.she's great, but can be harsh at times.

Frustrating. Demands absolute silence in class, constantly threatening to kick people out (5-10 times per class). Her mic feeds back, she leaves the floods on to wash out the projector, technologically incompetent, reads every other sentence twice, basically dictates notes. Unresponsive and aloof. Should not be teaching anywhere, period.
very dry lectures, information is right from the text book.

She takes attendence in class every day. She demands silence in the classroom while lecturing, which is nice b/c then you dont get distracted. If you understand her sense of humour, she is funny too. Does not like to answer emails tho and can be unhelpful when you ask questions. Nice lady tho.

Definitely does get frustrated by students. Expects them to act more grown up and be able to take care of themselves. Can't fault her for that. Doesn't seem very approachable but I haven't tried. Class is already so easy it's almost a waste of time to take it. She also seems to follow the textbook so closely that you don't even have to read it.
BORING AND TOUGH
pretty good professor. very clear, good lectures, made it easy to follow and tells you exactly what to write down
totally boring course, relied to heavely on the students comments and did not offer enough of her own knowledge and opinion. pretty fair marker, though not helpful feedback
Pretty Good i'd say

Dr. Jonaisse is clearly a very intelligent woman with high expectations of herself and her students.  Very organized and highly professional.  Lecturing is pretty boring though.  For 2Q06, she simply sat at the desk and read slides while adding some extra information = not very stimulating!  Approachable and willing to help.
I would take any course by Dr. Joanesse again. It was great and very interesting.

comments: Worst teacher I've ever had. Seriously I still cringe when I hear his name. Basically made fun of my paper and when I took my time and went to see him at office hours. I was basically called stupid. He is very rude and never wanted to help me when writing my final historiography. Bad attitude and bad marking scheme. I do not recommend this teacher.

Dr. Streeter is a good historian and professor.   However, he seems to have a pathological desire to prove this to his students.  Although his standards and expectations are extremely high, they are crystal clear.  If you're looking for a prof to hold your hand and say everything's gonna be OK, keep looking.

Dr. Streeter is a great professor and academic. He is very approachable and is willing to go to great lengths to help students with papers. He has been a mentor to me over the past couple years and I highly encourage students to take his courses!

Streeter was a demanding, challening Prof. whose grading scheme is unwavering and just. His seminars were among the best I ever took, and the accusations of arrogance I find weird, he was always funny and even-handed when I dealt with him. his courses definitely improve as you advance in years, his Vietnam history course was amazing.

Dr. Streeter is not the easiest professor to have, but the role of the university should not be to lower its standards to teaching students who honestly have no business pursuing academic scholarship in the first place.  Streeter is a tough cookie but he has every right to be.  If you can effectively advocate for yourself, he will meet you halfway.
He is a very condescending professor. Does not give professional feedback on assignments nor helpful feedback. When you approach him, he is arrogant when answering questions. CONDESCENDING!!

Streeter will be remembered as my worst prof during my undergrad at Mac. I took his 2ndyr class as an elective in 4th yr pol-sci. For a 2nd yr course, he truly believes it's something more. He was unaccomodating when inquiring about material during office hrs and lconsistantly lectured with arrogance.  Take the class ONLY if he is NOT the prof.
He is a very clear professor. You know what to expect from him.
Streeter is a really great prof. A somewhat tough marker but justified in the marks he gives. Always very clear about what he wants/expects from you. Very intelligent.

I Found him to be an excellent teacher.  Very knowledgable about Latin America and he definetely avoided being over bias against the US, and its very common for everyone to blame the US for everything thats ever happened in LA.  He is very open to questions, the class followed a very organized chronological sequence and there were NO documentaries.
very intelligent and critical. an excellent lecturer. liked his opinions about his own country
He is awesome!! super passionate great material. Great takes and angles.  Fantastic.
No Comments

Great proff!  Very opinionated and leftist, but jutifiably so.  Anti-American yet I did not find so much to an extreme.  Many say he was a hard marker, but I've had much harder.  Over all a great proff to learn from but not to have to deal with.

Very poorly organized, only lectured about half the time and we just watched documentaries the rest of the time (the specifics of which he includes in the exam!) The assignments were the most highly criticized pieces of work I've ever had, with not one single positive comment. This course could have and should have been so much better.

streeter is very knowledgable, but you can barely hear him when lecturing. he does give you the questions for the midterm and exam but is such a BRUTAL marker. He also does not seem to care about helping you as a student. if you can avoid him....do so!

A great lecturer, very knowledgeable, and approachable, in spite of what people have said. Yes he's anti-American, but he also is American, so doesn't that say a lot?  Yes, he can tear you apart in class, but don't say ignorant things...I was in 3II3, and people didn't make the brightest comments!!
HARD EXAM....VERY HARD EXAM...BEWARE!!!!

Had him as inquiry prof as well as large class; was perfectly approachable and helpful in former. Might just be large class sizes. Yes, he has an opinion, but everyone does. at least he doesnt hide his bias. and of course he will defend it - wouldnt you?
Great course, interesting lecturer. Pretty tough marker, and doesn't help students too much. Doesn't allow people to challenge his opinion
Dr. Streeter was an excellent lecturer and had extensive knowledge on events and how they were connected.

Excellent lecturer but not approachable at all.Not accomodating to students needs at all. However, very knowledgable in his lectures. Hard marker - but clear in expectations. Good that he gives you exam questions (but expects more bc of this??)

Dr Streeter is an amazing proff.  Sure his ideas come out in lecture but that's a great thing that we don't often get.  He also interjects about the research process at the post-grad level and as many students are planing on an MA its helpfull.  Overall the best history proff i've had in 4 years

Anti-American beyond what one would expect from a typical leftist professor; says he encourages debate but if you challenge him, then you will get torn appart in front of an audience.  Only take his courses if you must, but be careful.
this person just wants to sell you his ideology and personal hatred of the USA. if you want to be indoctrinated, take his class...

Doesn't learn your name or care to learn. Did not contribute to discussion during seminar performance. His performance during the seminar was disappointing given his excellent teaching style as a lecturer.
No Comments

i wished he'd shown fewer videos in class and lectured more because his take on things is very interesting, being from CT (i think) himself. he puts a good human feel to the events he's telling of. he's a little awkward, but it's sorta endearing.
Seems to be VERY anti-american. entertaining though.

The absolute nazi for policy. Very good survey proff, very ackward Seminar Proff.  Very unapproachable. Would rather do his own research than teach any class...As a student you feel like you are a total annoyance to his greater goal in life.

Wow a revolutionary teaching a history class.  He rules and offers a great view on historical events that isn't normally taught.  He looks at both sides of events and normally sides with the losing parties.  He has visited S.American Civil war towns.
Even when you visit during his office hours,gives you the impression that you're bothering him. Not very approachable. He's more subjective than objective in marking.
No Comments
No Comments
Excellent prof. Interesting documentary films. Fantastic learning experience!

comments: In order of increasing difficulty: Midterms  Graded Assignments  Final Exam. If you do all the recommended textbook problems and do the graded assignments on your own there is NO reason you cannot get 85+ on the midterms because they are textbook-odd-numbered-problem level of difficulty. Final exam is killer. Don't freak out, take deep breaths.

He's a very good lecturer and you should go to all his lectures. Also read the text and do all the odd-numbered questions.   He told us in class not to believe the people on the internet who said his exam was hard. Well, don't believe him when he says don't believe the people on the internet: THAT EXAM WAS HARD. (The midterms were way easy.)

I've heard a lot of bad stuff about his before taking his 2X03 class, especially because of how notorious his exam was. So I didn't expect that he would become one of favorite profs at McMaster and I eventually took his 3B03 the next semester. But be warned: Exam is fair, but study like crazy because that is the toughest part of the course.

The class is full of challenging content, so given the circumstances, he did an ok job teaching. However, his exam was unnecessarily extremely difficult, and every student I've talked to found it really unfair. You really really really really have to work this class, or else you won't get a decent mark.

His accent was SO hard to understand, and the lectures really dragged on because a few times in a lecture a student would point out a mistake that he made on the board, and he would stare at it for a very long time trying to correct it!!  Tests for this class weren't easy, but mostly because we didn't have a lot of time.
He is funny, and his notes are the most useful notes I've ever had.
Very Very Kind.

good lecturer. although assignments for this class is very long and hard. tests are even harder. however it is understandable since this is suppose to be a very hard class, i wouldn't recommend you taking this class if you don't have a good linear algebra background
He is a very good lecturer. he is very good at explaining things in a graphical way
Good prof, gives very clear explanations and teaches in an organized fashion. His assignments are VERY difficult. Tests are difficult but fair.
THANK YOU FOR FAILING ME IN COMPLEX ANLAYSIS. NEXT TIME I WILL STUDY HARDER. HOPEFULLY I WILL GET D- THE SECOND TIME AROUND I TAKE THE COURSE.

Very fair prof. Enjoyed his class a lot. The exams were tough but this is University and his testig level is quiet consistent for a 3rd Year math course. He is a genius in complex analysis. If you want to really learn the material and enjoy it at the same time, please do take a course with Dr. Wang. Amazing prof. Thanxx for the good grade.
Thank you for the great course sir. I really enjoyed your class, and would recommend you as a professor to anyone. You were fair and challenged us fairly and appropriately. Have a great summer.
Amazing Prof
Excellent. very helpful during office hours.
I donot think the exam was easy as all these people point out. It was tough -- but fair. Tested us throughly on the material taught.

Amazing prof. The final exam was SOOO EASY. It was like a breeze. I really expected something more for a complex analysis final exam. I hope he marks hard on the exam, so that those people who deserve A's are separated from those that deserve C's. Amazing prof. His courses aren't challenging enough, but he's a very good professor in teaching.
He is a great professor
This professor was so easy. I failed most of my courses in University but this professor gave me C- in Linear Algebra II

Everybody told me complex analysis 3X03 is a challenging course, that is why I took it. Professor Wang's first quiz was so incredibly easy, that even a student with the lowest IQ in the entire Universe could get perfect. Give us some proof questions PLEASE!!! Make us think deeply. If the professor is going to feed us with a silver spoon it's no fun

I finished his first quiz in five minutes and slept through the rest of it. If Dr Wang doesn't make this course harder the class average will be very high and McMaster will investigate. I hope the test and final are impossible. I need to make myself think for a change.

Easiest professor in the whole Universe. He gives you one month to do one Assignment. We are in University man, not in Junior school. So stop treating us like babies, and make the course more challenging.
I could write this prof's tests in my sleep. They are very very simple. Does he think he is teaching five year olds? Come on, we are in university, we want hard proofs on tests. PLEEEEEEASE.
I think the course is too easy so far. We're not dumb students, we are high intelligence students. Give us some credit. Make the course very challenging.

Amazing prof. Explains very well. Really knowledgeable. The only complain is his homework problems and quizzes are not challenging enough. They are almost like High School difficulty level, or even easier then that. Guaranteed 12 if you take any course(s) taught by Prof Wang.

I guess this prof doesn't care at all about students. He wants to put trivial questions on assignments and the quiz so that we don't learn the subject. Dear sir, we want extremely extremely difficult questions. We NEED to learn complex analysis. We really want a lot of hard proof questions on the assignments, test and final exam. Thanks.
I hope the course gets harder. Assignment and quiz have been a breeze. So far it feels like I'm back in grade one.
He is AMAZING

People told me complex analysis is a hard course and I took it since I want a challenge, but Dr. Wang's class is a JOke. I look forward to being challenged. Please put some ridiculously challenging proof questions on tests and exams, so that people who are looking forward to enhance their mathematical ability donot feel insulted by easy questions.

I am very disappointed so far. I took complex analysis to learn advanced mathematics, to stimulate my mind, not to get an easy credit. Professor Wang is turning it into a bird course, meaning I won't even have to attend lecture any more. Is that what he wants: students not attending lecture because the course is too simple? Make it MORE difficult.
Every course taught by this prof is a Joke. If you want a guarantee A+ I suggest you enroll in either McKenzie Wang's course or Rong Zhu's course
What an Easy Prof!!!
Wang is an excellent professor. He could do some more examples, but his slow pace through the material is much appreciated. 2R03 is challenging. If you don't absolutely need it, don't take it.

Amazing prof at explaining the course material.  But course material seemed pretty rough for a lot of the students. Pay attention in lectures or else there is totally no point (ie, you cant just get by reading off of the notes he gives)

Dr. Wang is an awesome prof.  He explains things very well and doesn't rush through material.  Plus his classes flow very nicely, although with 2R, once you are lost in a lecture, there is no coming back.
Math 2S03 is a very hard course, at least it was when I took it with Prof. Wang.  Don't take this course if you don't need to.. it most probably will bring the GPA down.
I enjoyed taking calc.  Lots of examples.  Was very friendly in arranging to help me outside of his scheduled office hours.  Real benefit in seeing him for more help.  Good communicator.

Spent too much time teaching theory and very little showing examples and practicality. Assumed we understoof too much and by the end, no one was going to class. Very smart and responsible though, language barrier also adds difficulty.
GRRRRRREAT!!!!!!! One of the best profs I ever had at Mc.
He is a super great prof!!! I love his way of teaching!! His class discussions are very beneficious for students. Always willing to answer questions. He is such a cutie!! I love Wang!!
Makes a hard subject easy. Tests and final were fair and straight forward, not neccessarily easy though. If you study and go to lectures, you *will* get a good grade. Explains things really well.
He's a great teacher who cares to explain and is very clear...only problem is the course is hard as hell. Avoid any form of Linear Algebra if possible.

All of the assignments, midterms and final exam are very hard!!!!!! Unbelievalbe! I took his class before & got A, but i got a bad grade in 2S... really really hard!! I won't take his class anymore! :(
Very organized. Good lectures.
He's a good professor, 2A is tough, i found 2R pretty easy, and 2S isn't horribly tough, but challenging.
it is really hard!!! much more difficult than 2R03....
No Comments
No Comments
SO HARD.... CANT UNDERSTAND!!!!!!!!!!!
Very very boring.... z...Z...z...Z......
No Comments

comments: If you're thinking, "I'm gonna take Japanese on the side. I like anime so this should be easy," don't take Iwai's classes.  Learning any language takes dedication. Out of the 50 students in 1Z06, only about 6 make it all the way into 3ZZ3.  Iwai is hard, dedicated and strict, but those who take her teachings to heart end up really proficient.

Never explain the format will be on the test. When I asked her the course information in class, tell me to check syllabus online even though I have something to clarify. When I email her, she said go ask her in class. My question will never be answered. She is not good at English either.

We had another prof to begin who was really fair. Iwai- Sensei didn't care when I was in tears about a test I studied for for weeks, and assumes her students need to study 247 to do well. I love Japanese, I will never take a course with her again. Will go to UofT for their prof though. Tests unfair, she is unfair, strict- but a nice woman.
My favorite prof of all time. My fluency in Japanese is owed entirely to her. I wish her longevity and the greatest comfort in the years to come.

My main complaint is too much time is required for learning how to write kanji which I don't see as that important of a skill to learn given that we can just type on computers, in which case, you only need to know how to read kanji.  She should shift more time to practicing speaking and listening skills.
Good prof, actually cares about her students. Tests are fair but assignments are not.

Very willing to explain however she does move fast. She will leave you in the dust with Kanji if you are unfamiliar with it. Ritualistic study is a must for "non-Kanji" students. Is more than willing to meet with you during office hours but can appear aloof and a bit intimidating.
One of my favourite professors! Very helpful inside and outside the classroom, although her tests are quite hard but fair. Mini quizzes helps me a lot in her class
A little jaded perhaps, but a helpful prof if you're taking upper-year Japanese. Bring back fourth year!

Not very friendly outside of class. Shows unfair favouritism towards non-Asian students (if you pay attention it's very obvious). Never willing to compromise. Office hours are terrible. As the previous poster mentioned, you will benefit a lot from studying on your own outside of class.

Other than being a picky marker, she is very aloof outside of class and has mood swings every now and then. A 12 is impossible to achieve unless you are serious about the language and willing to do some self-studying. The oral test is the most difficult aspect of the course and will greatly affect your mark.
great prof~love her~

After 4 years with Iwai Sensei, I can say that I speak Japanese better than other University grads.  But it was hard as hell!  The tests are usually right from the text.  The assignments are rather arbitrarily marked.  You get a B if you do what she asks.  I'm not sure how to get an A on them, other than getting a Japanese person to proof-read it!
The pace of this class was extremely hectic, but made sure that the student stayed on their toes.  This prof is always willing to answer questions, explain and give more examples.
tough teacher but worth it :P
good teacher
always prepared and willing to answer questions.  test #1 will kill you.  if you survive it, you will ace test #2.  treats her students equally and really loves teaching.
Great prof! Once you pass you first surprise by the fact that to study foreign language you actually have to work, you'll enjoy every minute of class.
Too much for us in this beginner course compare with another pro.
she's awesome!Very hard tests, but always willing to help and totemo kawaiidesu!
Iwai-sensei is AMAZING.  Extremely helpful both in and outside of the class
not ease (after all this is language we're learning here), but fair.
Terrible English speaker! u can never understand her in both Eng & Japanese!!!!!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

comments: This will probably be the last time Dr. deCat teaches this course, which is a shame bc you get a lot out of it. Really enjoyed it & I did well. It's not a perfect course but still the content is really interesting. Thank you Dr. deCat!

I really enjoyed both classes (4Y03 is pretty much a continuation of 3M03), the textbook he wrote was very good and you can just read that instead of going to class, if you can find his previous tests, almost every question will be from there, with some work you can easily get an A

He is a wonderful professor! If you are interested in pursing neuroscience and want to explore it on a deeper level this is the course for you. Dr. Decatanzaro is engaging, helpful and above all simulates a very comfortable learning environment. One of the best psychology professors I've ever had!

Such a powerful yet gentle/kind man! Obvious ultra-genius. Lectures are intense and captivating, course is carefuly designed and coherent. 2 mid-terms, 1 in class assignment. One of the most worth-while courses I've taken.
The course involves absolutely empirical evidences and was very interesting!! Recommended to students with some anatomy background who especially likes to digest many pieces of facts.

the tests are difficult if you don`t study but if you keep up with the material you`ll be fine. He does use short answers but his tests are very fair; they are challenging, but that`s how they should be. as deCat would probably agree, psych majors without a scientific mind should not take this course.

he is really boring!!...the notes he uses are not complete meaning you have to go to class (or read his book, which is also boring). his tests have an unusual format, and are really hard to do well on. i don't feel like i've learned a lot of new stuff in this class either.
Needed to stay on top of things and study hard to do well, but good course for sure.
great course!
Great class!

All I can say is that this class and this prof are both VERY VERY BORING. Save yourself the agony and depression, DONOT take his course. His tests have nasty short answer essays as well. Avoid him or else you gonn regret it.

This class was great! He is enthusiastic about motivation and emotion. Hated the first day but the trick is to sit near the front because he is (unintentionally) hilarious. He looks a bit like Will Farrel imitating a teacher, he stands with his hand resting in the back of his pants and his catch phrase was "Basic emotions" Tests were COMPREHENSIVE
Nice guy, cool lectures! I took one of his courses a couple of years ago and wanted to take another...unfortunately he wasn't teaching last year.

I found him to be the most useless and worthless professor in the entire psychology department. His courses are worth NOTHING. He is pure garbage. His testing is so lame. I want to convey him a message- a Psych degree gets you a good job working as a beggar or working for 8 dollars/hr at MACDONALDs serving fries. do you get it??  TERRIBLE prof

Denys Anthony Decatanzaro is the most boring professor I have ever encountered in my life!!! If you don't like short answer questions STAY AWAY FROM HIS COURSES OTHERWISE YOU WILL SUFFER AND END UP CANCELLING THE COURSE OR GETTING A POOR GRADE. I think of his Psych 3M03 course as pure garbage which is useless and SOOOOOOO BOOOOAAARRINNGG
Great prof! I really enjoyed his course :)
He is a terrible prof. He mumbles and his textbook is so complicated and made my head pain. I dont recommend him to anybody!!!

This guy really sucks, he is SOOOOOOOOOOOOoo boring...and his tests are hard, but if you have a lot of old tests, he repeats some questions. The short answer questions are terrible, and his class will make you fall asleep. I don't recommend this prof to anyone. His textbook is so boring to read as well. I had to cancel his course many years back

This prof thinks psych is some hot shot neuroscience discipline LOLLLL that's jokess man. I found it funny the way he said on the first day some students were trying to get into his class, there will be absolutely no prerequisite waivers. OMG this is the most boring psych course ever. NEVER take it, he lectures SOO boring. He re-uses test questions

Great prof, good lectures, although the short paper was pretty pointless and marked hard. Tests were fair, hard if you don't study. Lectures correlate with the text pretty well (probably since he wrote it.)

I really liked Dr. Decatanzaro even though many found him a tad boring in 3M03. I really enjoyed the course and since taking it have found that the material applies to many other courses that I've taken. I would recommend the prof and the course! His midterms were very fair and his exam esp his MC were tricky but overall great course!
Awesome prof...probably one of the best MAC has to offer. Fair tests and great attitude!
He is one of the best psychology professors at McMaster and his course is interesting.

Awesome prof!!! He get's so excited when students ask questions and he's always eager to answer them. I can tell he loves teaching, and he loves the material - the sign of a truely great teacher. He goes out of his way for us. Thanks!
So kind, cares a great deal about subject matter and about students.  Tests are fair as long as you study.
Dr. DeCatanzaro is a great guy with so much to teach.  He teaches in a way that helps you really learn the material and he tests major concepts.
Great prof, fair class, good texts.  Bonus essay is great idea. take this course.
He is a nice and fair prof. Take his course.
great prof, very smart man, godo sense of humour and down to earth.  Tests are challenging but fair. This guy makes you want to go to class, even if its at 5:30pm in T-28!

Dr. Decatanzaro is one of McMaster's best. He is helful, knowledgable, compassionate, caring and interesting. Marking is completely fair, rewarding and methodical. His text is the best book I bought in my undergrad. ed. You will love this course for sure!
The BEST prof I have ever had!  So smart, so interesting, SOOOOOOO nice!
Great prof! Very Interesting course. Tests aren't too bad if you keep up and actually study the material well
He is one of the nicest guys ever!

Dr. Decatanzaro is incredibly passionate about his field, resulting in the most interesting, engaging, and inspiring set of lectures you will ever have the pleasure of attending.  Exceptional and clever sense of humour, and an all-around great man.  :)
Such a chill prof.  Lectures to a small class with a cup of coffee in his hand.  Lectures are more like conversations.  Good class for anyone interested in neuroscience.
Often quite boring...and monotone but a very helpful friendly man.  The textbook he wrote was awesome
Honestly a bit monotone but overall nice yeah and I agree great textbook. I loved the course
knowledgable about many things, very convincnig as a lecturer, passionate about his work, good sense of humour overall my favourite course ever
Fantastic prof, even with very difficult material. Wrote the textbook for 3M03, which is an awesome text. Lectures incredibly engaging, esp. considering the material's a bit dry sometimes.
One of the best courses I've ever taken...Dr. Decatanzaro is a great lecturer, writes very fair tests - and his textbook is great!
super nice, Greek chromagnan man, material sooo interesting, very moral
Sometimes boring but really nice.
Really nice!

comments: It could have been difficult material maybe, but he made it super-easy by repeatedly giving examples on overheads until it was really drilled in. Fantastic lecturer, really knows how to get this stuff across easily. Tests were reasonable.

got two lessons with him this term, he is super helpful, really nice and always willing to help and answering questions. As long as u go to class and follow all the instructions he give, a 12 should be secured
one of the best profs i had at mac... 2hh3 isnt an easy course but good student will find it reasonable to attain 11-12

So I had him for 2hh3, which was very easy, and so I decided to take 3f with him. It was his first time teaching the course, and he ran it pretty well. The only problem was that he took forever to return assignments, and also he's kind of a tough marker; he won't give above 90 unless you are extremely remarkable. No one got a 90 on presentations.

Great professor, one of my favorites at MAC. Looking forward to taking Econ 3U03 with him. As long as you keep up with the readings and do the practice tests and recommended problems, you should do pretty well
awesome guy!

Very nice guy and an excellent lecturer. His notes are very confusing though if you miss class, and the tests are fairly difficult. Really awesome grade scheme though, things are weighted strongly in students' favour.

Great professor, my favourite course at McMaster thus far, his tests are very fair and he gives you all the slides needed to study for the test and get a 10 or higher, the textbook is also very helpful. With that said though about a 1/4 of the class failed :S He is a very smart guy and is very enthusiastic and helpful!
Marc-Andre is a great prof for graduate and undegraduate students!!!!
he's a nice guy, good lecturer (though I didn't pay too much attention in class...). I like how he makes his requirements crystal clear
He is such a good looking guy!!! and you will fine if you study his notes...no need to read textbook.. love him!

This guy is absolutely brilliant! The course is hard but he is so clear in teaching it, and the book he uses is so concise... he makes it feel like one of the easier courses. Indeed, the tests are a breeze if you attend his classes. Wish I had more classes with him. Or similar profs with solid books!

His course become more and more difficult. His assignment and test are not easy. He used to have a detail review before the final exam but you don't expect it now. But I should say he lecture is good.

first, Dr. Letendre is HOT !! his tests are very fair and fairly marked.  His expectations are clearly told in classes + WebCT.  assignments arent too easy but very helpful.  I wish he will teach more Econ. courses.  I love him !! I just hoped to sit in all his other classes
Great prof, his notes are awesome.  Had him for 2 econ classes, for 2HH3 his notes are key, very effective. But in 3U03 i got to see his only flaw, which is, he's moody.  Get on his good side.

Ohhh it he good looking!! And he is an excellent professor. His lecture notes are key - there's no need to read the textbook if you go to class. (Maybe for Gauss-Markov theorem). It was my favourite class all semester, even if it was stats. ..
his explaination is crystal clear. pay attention on his lectures, review the notes do assignments, you should be fine
very clear and organized lectures
Really spends lots of time of materials. very organised and spend time reviewing stuffs from last class. Great Prof !!
Spends alot of time making sure you understand. The material is easier than it looks. Just pay attention and ull do fine
Great prof., great patient, and excellent teaching, with fun French accent~
Good prof. The course is hard to start with but gels nicely in the end.
