comments: Prof. Malik really opens the eyes of all his students and allows them to develop their own critical thinking skills.  His love for marketing and the success of his students is  apparent as he always brings a fantastic energy and charisma that translates into engaging class discussions.  If you can take and make jokes, you'll get along.

If you're simply looking to get a high Grade in a course that Professor Malik teaches, perhaps try a different professor / course. He has high expectations and makes you work for a good grade. However, with that being said you will carry  what you learn in his class with you for the rest of your life and I think that's worth more than grades.

If you want to do good in 3MC3 don't take it with him. 20% of your mark is participation and its ridiculously hard to get a 70% in it. As long as you have a good group you should be okay but even so he's way harder than other profs. Just know if you say something stupid he will make fun of you.

Hardest marking prof I've ever had do not expect an easy class. Although classes are very interesting and inclusive he at times completely contradicted things he had said to do on assignments in previous lectures. Crystal clear at explaining concepts but poor at helping students to do well grade wise.
Simply the best.

He can be a bit intimidating at first but it's only because he expects you to put in as much effort as he does into the learning experience. He is always there to help, you just have to ask. His passion for marketing and for his students sets him apart from any other prof I have had and he has helped me achieve things I never thought I could.

Professor Malik is one of the best professors I've had during my time at McMaster. His course is not easy but he finds ways to get you to think about the real-world implications of his teaching. His lessons transfer far beyond the classroom, and I continue to apply them in my professional life today. I wish other professors followed suit.

Malik's approach allows us to deal with real world problems in a controlled enviroment. No it is not easy to get an A in his class - yes you actually have to try. If you are looking to build integrity, accountability and humility while gaining knowledge and real world experience Malik is the single most important Prof you need to network with.

This is the only prof. that will make you think for yourself, as opposed to spoon feeding you. He has high expectations, which will prepare you for the real world. An A is very doable if you listen to what he says and put the effort in. He is the only professor i've had that genuinely cares about his students. Talk to him, listen, and succeed.

Having graduated 7 yrs ago from Degroote in 2005, whenever I think of a teacher who made a difference in my life, the name Malik pops up first. He doesn't only teach you marketing, he makes you a confident & effective marketeer during the 3 months of his course. Not a textbook follower, but what he teaches remains imbedded in your brain forever.
Good as a prof and very helpful. Didn't like the grade received on participation in spite of preparation. Recommend this prof only if you plan on majoring in marketing. Difficult to get an A.

I was interested in marketing before this course but have lost motivation. Malik is unrealistically difficult and his expectations are absurd. You don't learn anything from him, he asks things of you without teaching anything. Such a waste of money, I hope other marketing classes are better than this.

Seriously the best professor I've had at McMaster in 5 years.  His guidance and knowledge can get you very far - if you're willing to listen and sometimes fail in order to understand.  If you're looking for inspiration and someone making a difference, look no further than Malik.
Worst Prof I've ever had.

Let's not beat around the bush here. If this were the DeGroote School of MARKETING, Malik would be justified in his expectations. But I don't care one bit about marketing... I'm only taking it because this school cares more about marketing than it does about the other functional areas, and requires it. Lighten up.
Great prof.  Take his class, join his programs, and get to know him.
Hate him soo much. You do what he says for your report and presentations and he still marks you poorly. Who cares about marketing, such a crap course...go to mohawk if you want to do this stuff

Honestly the best prof i ever had. He is tough and will work you. BUt he is very helpful. You have to make the first attempt to do well. He is not as bias as ppl say. He is just tryies to lead you in the right direction
The epitome of all professors.

Incredible class- amazing prof, very helpful. I completely disagree with all other postings, he is a very nice guy once you get to know him, funny, knowledgeable, helpful and motivating! I loved this class. It wa hard as hell but also very rewarding.

This class was a joke. Go there, discuss ridiculous, outdated cases, say the same things over and over -- advertising, brand awareness, market penetration, blah, blah, blah. He didn't even have a class list for us this term of businesses willing to participate in the study; this made the project muc
Very bias and overly critical. Has his class clown favourites, treats everyone else like dirt. I got a good mark too but even i know when i am being biased against.

Overall the class was simple, show up you do well. II took less than nothing out of the class. The prof was a biased, self-centered, baffoon. His ability to lead a discussion were mediocre at "best", and he would send you on wild goose chases for information only to reject it in the end.ITSUCKED

He's definitely a funny man, but I have to agree with an earlier comment that he is biased to his own beliefs, and sometimes seems unwilling to accept certain arguments even though the rationale backing it is solid!
No Comments
great prof!

Good prof. Easy to understand. Only downside is that he is very narrow-minded about the case studies. He wrote them and knows what ended up happening to the company so he isn't open to any suggestions that don't go along with his opinions.

If you get on his good side he'll be the best professor you have ever had.  In 3MC3 I was scared of him, but participated with valid/enthusiastic answers and asked him specific questions - by 4th year sales, he loved me and helped me get my fulltime job

Very bad prof.  Very biased to his personal beliefs.   Had problems throughout the course with him. If you have a problem and want to ask him a question,  chances are he'll give you a long enough blank stare that you'll just leave.
the best prof at mac.
WITH OUT A DOUBT THE BEST PROF IN THE WORLD!!!!
nice guy. knows his stuff and knows how to teach it.
Mean man!!!!

loved this course. the work was not easy, but you learned a lot in the process. excellent at leading class discussions, class always interesting. visit during office hour and ask about his expectations. VERY HELPFUL.
Ask him what he wants on papers and you'll be fine.  Funny prof, as well
No Comments
isn't clear on expectations
mean man
very funny.....
condesending, but hilarious!
No Comments
very hard, almost fair...at least he's funny.
Harsh but fair
Should try to be fair to all students
mean

comments: This prof was so enspiring that I went on to complete a PhD and am now a prof in psychology. She is brilliant.

Go to class! Doesn't post notes (posts lecture 'outline', not v informative). I'd advise to audiorecord/type b/c she talks fairly fast + everything she says is rly important. Often asks to integrate knowl into idea for schooling, keep in mind throughout. TAs helpful. Likes participation, kinda mean when you're wrong, not v good @ explaining

very condescending attitude towards students.  Her explanations are clear, but she has very high expectations and is not afraid to tell you...in a very rude and condescending way.  She's not very sympathetic to her students either.  (dismisses their compassionate reasons for extension requests).

Nice enough as a person, but very intimidating as a prof. Unless you are really into developmental, stay away! Somewhat condescending attitude towards students. If you can't talk to her on her level of knowledge, don't talk to her at all.
My least favourite prof at Mac.
I think she is a nice person as well as good instructor. At the fist year university level she is great. This is university and should not expect anything be easier than in her course.

This prof was very difficult. I had 1A03 as a night class, and I never wanted to go because I knew I would have to listen to her (mostly) useless explanations which 99% of the time has to do with sex or alcohol. Not very amusing. I should have stayed home and just read the textbook (which was SUPER expensive, and she never really used it).
not very good teaching style..
worst prof i've ever had in my entire life

OH.DEAR.GOD!!  This is a NEW low mcmaster university professors have managed to reach.  Dr.(?) Lewis is *THE* worst professor.  She doesn't know ANYTHING!!  If people like her got through grad school, it gives hope for the rest of us.  Psych dept, if you're listening, for the sake of the innocent minds, DO NOT LET HER TEACH!
good teacher

the course had the potential to be great; the material is really interesting although there is a lot of it unfortunately lewis makes the class awful. She is not a good teacher and often confuses herself including everyone listening. It is impossible to do well in her class even if you are interested in the subject matter.

Her lectures are difficult to follow. She confuses a lot of her material particularily when she strays from the textbook. She is unable to teach clearly difficult subjects and often leaves you more confused then you would be with out her explanations.
Mistake Taking this class.
awesome prof :P
i know she's gonna read this..but..i could care less..she's too hard and she's not one bit funny. SHe's just plain HARD. Do not take the course with her, you'll regret it!
Very hard professor. DONOT take her class!!!

Avoid taking this class with her!!!! Course is interesting but she mannaged to make it ill.. Somehow everything was about sex and extremely rude to some people. One would think with her knowledge she could be more sensitive to people appearances, thats says it all. She does not teaches what she test you on. I want my money back!!

objectives and expectcations not clearly defined especially concerning assingments and tests. Tests more on the book but barely sctarches the surface of its content. Know the book more than her lectures
very tough prof
I dropped this class because of Dr. Lewis (and her expectations).  That says it all.

Dr. Lewis lives in the bubble of academia.  She doesn't clearly define her expectations of students, which are way higher than other level 3 courses I've taken.  If you plan on studying child development at the M.Sc/Ph.D. level, her 3ii3 is great prep. otherwise, don't bother with the course.
No Comments
Awesome prof!
The class was okay. Know your stuff for the test/exam though. The exam's long answer question was an integration of the materials learned during the term.

Lectures were mildly interesting, but pointless.  Material in lectures was not relevant to tests.  References to sex were amusing at first, but after the first few times it became annoying.  Avoid this class if possible.
her asiignment is very hard on academic dishonesty, this is the first year reference essay, and a lot of ppl get academic dishonesty.
Excellent prof, I've enjoyed her class
No Comments
she puts too much emphasis on unimportant things, and is condescending

She bugs me so much, puts far too much emphasis on things that are less important and if she makes one more reference to sex... I'm going to snap.. I'd bet everything I have that she's a country club member
Nice lady..always with intresting facts. But very much to know for tests and exams. If you managed to know everything...that is if..you would do pretty well.

Dr. Lewis made learning fun but the exams were very challenging-I swear she stayed up at night and thought of ways to make us go crazy-however she'll be remembered as being interesting and relating everything to sex...
Interesting parallels dealing with psychology.  Made you want to pay attention in class.

comments: Dr. Prowse is easily the best prof I've ever had, 2FF3 is a very small class and she takes the time to help students individually. She is obviously very passionate about her work, not to mention she's adorable. I want to be her.
Prowse is an awesome prof! Her teaching style and personality is great in a sense that even if you end up doing poorly in the course (which I doubt) you'll still end up loving the course regardless.

I took an independent bstidy with her and she is amazing, very helpful with critique and feed back. Always made herself available for meetings, help, advice, etc. Friendly and also peofessional. She is the reason why I majored in anthropology.
AWESOME PROF! Recommended to any first year who wants an interesting class with a professor who makes you feel comfortable and keeps class fun!
Amazing teacher who is passionate about her field and transmits that excitement to her students.

Prowse made class so interesting and engaging. You could feel comfortable talking in her class and asking questions. She is super funny and gets you interested in the material. She used PeerScholar and it is extremely helpful. Take her class!
Great prof, very clear and relatable. Definitely recommend taking her courses.

She's nice, knows her stuff and is very clear. Tests are clear and easy to do well in. Only think I don't like about her is she tries too hard to be funny and she thinks she's being cute, when really she's annoying.

She is an absolutely awesome professor.  Really easy to relate to.  She is funny, super intelligent, and really cares about her classes.  She LOVES Short and Long Answer questions, so don't take her course if you struggle with time limits or do poorly on these types of tests.  You will get a bad, bad mark.  I would recommend her highly though!!
She is honestly one of the BEST profs I've had. She really makes you interested in what you're learning, and she's great if you ever need help, extentions, etc.

Best professor this semester. HIGHLY recommended; I don't think they get any better than her. If you don't love anthro, you will after her class. There is nothing better than a prof who cares and is passionate about the material. You're the best Dr. Prowse!
he is fantastic in all her classes. She is passionate and helpful and clear. She tests as she lectures - no surprises. I love her

I LOVE HER SO MUCH!!! If you have the chance to take a course with her, DEFINITELY do it! She is really engaging and makes everything really clear. I never wanted to miss a lecture! Also, she just seems to be a really nice person in general. Greatest prof ever!
She brought the love of Anthropology back into my life. This class has drastically changed my life. She is wonderful, funny, intelligent and eager to teach all she knows.

The most dedicated and inspiring prof. I had so far. This course really made me decide what I want to do with my life after graduating, and I mostly owe that to Dr. Prowse. She is fun, exciting and engaging because she loves teaching and shows tremendous care towards the students. Her passion for bioarchaeology is contagious. Awesome textbooks!

Best prof at McMaster! Dr. Prowse turned this course into an amazing experience! Very knowledgeable & will always try to find an answer to your question. She designs the exams and projects around what is most relevant to learn and always gives helpful feedback. If you want to learn from the best you should register for the courses she teaches!
THE BEST!!!I loved her because she was so clear with her expectations.  One of the best for sure!
she's awesome
Very engaging prof, made the course a lot of fun. She's also very funny, which makes it easier to stay awake in class ;)
the best prof evey. but this is her last year at mac :(
I'm so upset she's leaving! She's a very enthusiastic and intelligent woman, who really made me care about the class. The school she's moving to will be lucky to have her.
One of the best at Mac---awesome sense of humour, interesting and clear. Mac sucks for letting their best profs leave. boo suckers
great teacher.  visuals are very helpful
She kicks ass
the best prof. I've had so far, funny,and talented.
Best prof ever
She is the best professor I have ever had in university!!!  Knows how to present using Powerpoint (never bores you out) and keeps the class fun with her good sense of humour.

I took this course as an elective but I enjoyed it a great deal. I felt Dr. Prowse was straightforward and made the course interesting and exciting. I recommend it to anyone with an interest in anthro, especially with a somewhat science focus to it!! Great course and prof all around!!

I've taken Anthro 2FF3,3PP3,4J03, G03 and 4R03 with Dr. P.  Excellent.  The reason why I decided to double major in Anthro and helped me realize my dreams of a career in forensics.  She's no push-over, but your mark will reflect the amount of work you do!
Great fashion sense. Funny lectures. Always makes going to class interesting, though she challenges us. What a cool prof!
Dr. Prowse, a very enthusiastic, helpful, intelligent individual with impeccable taste in clothes and fashion.  A fashion icon to most people...peace out!
she's absolutely an awesome person as well as a fantastic leader..... see you in Italy!!

She has the best wardrope!  Her class is not 'easy' but neither is it overly hard - she keeps the material fresh and makes going to class a hobby rather than a chore - a natural instructor...yay bones!
No Comments
She is the best professor in the world. It looks like Indiana Jones has a female counterpart. She is enthusiastic, inspiring and approachable. She's also *oh so* fashionable.

comments: he was funny and very lively, he made you enjoy the course and also made you think for yourself. a lot of group work so pick good group members

Although this course was fairly simple. Marvin Ryder has absolutely no real world experience.  When challenged in class, he has absolutely zero knowledge of the outside world.  Only know what's written in ink. Don't bother going to class.  Just read the textbook. That's all you'll need to do.
It is not an easy course, it is not a give away. But he is a great professor. He engages you and you will not be falling asleep in his class.  I would take part 2 of this course if there was one.

Professor Ryder is a very smart and articulate guy. If you are shy to participate, you will need to change that asap for his class. Discussions are very interesting. He is also absolutely hilarious :)
he will teach you things you never really thought about
Don't bother. You won't learn anything useful from this course.

I'm under the impression that he knows everything. He actually made me like marketing. Sure, he uses scare tactics during class discussion, but I think it's representative of what we'll see after school.

The guy is so full of himself he is unbearable to be around.  He thinks he is GOD.  Push him on his real world experience and he will crack.  He went from undergrad to MBA to teaching  - NO EXPERIENCE!!  Of course the guy likes to attack his students, makes up for his own inadequacies.  Picture Marvin in a skirt, then check out the local gay bars??
Great professor full of insight and information. I always looked forward to his class.

He is overpowering and dominant, but he is very smart business wise. He knows alot and is willing to help you and give you constructive help. He does love his own voice and it can be frustrating if you want to have a discussion with him b/c he'll just keep talking. But its ok, b/c he's right about what he's talking about.
One of the best profs at mac! Funny guy, uses the Socrates method...
Pretty smart guy. Almost right up there with Terry Flynn.

Very dominant personality but is always helpful if you have any questions. Discussions are fun and even though a dominant personality he makes participating fun. Yes he pokes fun at you but it lightens up the mood. You just have to know how to handle it. Take advantage of asking him questions, he will give you tips and constructive criticism.

Annoying, overly-dominant personality. But the class is interesting if you make an effort to participate in the discussions.  Marks quite easy. Talk to him - make sure you understand what he expects. Better than Malik.

Prof is a prick. He gets pleasure in embarassing students in front of the clsss. Is very opinionated and feels he knows everything, but isn't very knowledgeable. Does not like discussion. Likes to argue for the sake of argueing. Should be canned.
i don't like him. very set in own opinions

will kill you on participation, even if you show up to every class and speak once will still get awful, unless you suck up.  Always go last for presentations, he will rip you apart infront of your classmates.  In the cases, it is always the answer he wants, let him tell you the answer.
hot!
The hottest and best prof ever! Smartest man I have met.  Knows what he is doing.
good real world experience, his classes are the best "real world" ones
Made course very interesting, and fun.  Very knowledgable.  Knows more about pop culture than anyone I know.

He doesn't give a**** about his students or his teaching effectiveness...when he is leading a discussion is always just waiting for you to finish so that he can tell you what HIS opinion is...don't like him.

Complete tool. Controls the business simulation even though he doesn't teach the course - is the only reason he's still around, because he knows nothing except for limited case knowledge regarding the steel industry.
No Comments

not clear for what he wants. Not too respectful for his students.  Don't think he has much "real world" experience as he is the only business prof I know that doesn't draw personal experiences to solidify his points
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Best professor I've come across at McMaster University. Very intelligent, passion for teaching and very approachable. tests were difficult but his ability to make every lecture interesting was worth every minute!
would take any class taught by him. tough marker but approachable and fair. took his class as an elective, ended up minoring in psych. best proff at mac
Amazing professor!!! Makes material so interesting, engaging and his tests are very reasonable. Completely changes your mind about first year psych. I would take any course with him!

He keeps class very interactive and interesting by using current disease and conditions in his examples as well as utilizing the TAs to demonstrate specific activities. He likes to perform "role plays" of various conditions during class. A downside is that his tests are too short and there are very few chances to redeem   your mark in the course.
Very difficult to understand, since he speaks very fast. His email explanations are very unclear. He is very approachable after class. His tests are too short

I've taken two classes with Ullal, decided to minor in Psych so I can take more with him! Such a sweet, easygoing guy, and he's so passionate about teaching. His 2NF3 class is especially interesting, definitely recommended

His short answers were marked way too hard. Other than that, the material is interesting and he can communicate it well in lecture. The only thing is that his e-mails tend to be extremely useless if you are trying to understand something.

He is extremely knowledgeable and very approachable after class. The course was really well structured and the content was very interesting. He paces himself according to the class, teaching whatever he can without stressing over time. Defined my interest in clinical neuroscience.

He is very enthusiastic about his material, however he is very hard to understand sometimes - he tend to talk in a very low voice, thick accent, and fast.  If you're going to take a class of his do yourself a favour and sit in a front row.
Designed my career for me. Never had a prof that has had such a profound effect on me. Thank you Prof. Ullal.
His exams will ruin you, you will be lucky to get a C, no tutorials, sometimes one assignment per course, (ive taken more than one of his courses), overall, very difficult.

he does love what he teaches but his tests are ridiculous, and i mean you can study A LOT for them and still get horrible because he tests on the most irrelevant details that have nothing to do with what the main focus of the lectures are about. And this has nothing to do with being whiny, his tests are just plain unfair period.

Dr. Ullal is great prof. Has so much passion for what he does. As long as you understand the slides and you go to every lecture it's not impossible to get an A. He can be quite specific when he's testing you with details, but it's not the hardest course.
Really awesome prof. Makes the subject interesting. Hard tests and exams.
Great teacher. enough said.

This guy is brutal, hes nice and enthusiastic and all but hes doesnt speak loud enough, hes boring as hell and hard to understand. He likes to test the most random things out of his lectures. I don't recommend this one.

A very poor professor. Shouldn't still be teaching. Lectures are all over the place and he can be difficult to understand due to his accent.He also tends to test on the most specific, irrelevant details resulting in test averages in the 50s. Low competence in using online resources.

Interesting class. Memorize like crazy. Not insurmountable, but hard to get 12. Dr. Ullal, however, is a fantastic professor who shows enthusiasm and interest in teaching. Tests and assignments depend on how nice the TAs are, and they are variable. Only about 5-10 people will get 12s each semester but getting 10 or over is possible with studying.

Dr. Ullal is one of my favourite professors ever.He made neuroscience and sensory processes classes so interesting and educative.I got A in both of them and I decided to focus on neuroscience in the future.he is very enthusiastic and nice.But I do admit,you have to study your *ss off to get good marks.

You will rock this course if you memorize the lectures, which is easier said than done as they tend to be ALL OVER THE PLACE! Don't need to read the text because he never tests out of it. Over all, if you're interested in the content, take 2F03 instead, which covers the same content but is structured much more logically.

A disappointment of a professor; he ruined my interest in Visual Neuroscience and Neuroscience altogether. Tests are tough and not very fair. I am not taking any more Neuroscience courses after this. I want to thank him for ruining my interest.

Good man, has passion for what he teaches. A solid criticism is that he tests extremely specific details, often things mentioned in passing during the lecture. Go to every lecture and memorize everything on the slides and that he talks about.

Dr. Ullal loves what he teaches and is always open to questions - very helpful during office hours too. Although his tests may be very specific at times it is by no means impossible to get an A - but you do need to go to lecture as some slides are vague. This is the second time i have had him as a prof and i dont regret it!

This guy is pretty awful.  Simply for the fact that his tests are made up of the most minute little insignificant details that we've learned, rather than covering the bigger concepts we've focused on.  Never taking one of his courses again.
Drop the course if you see ULAL name on there

He has no mercy on students. He teaches useless courses that won't get students anywhere career wise but gives brutal exams. He speaks with an indian accent and lot of times stuff he talks is hard to decipher. You must have done something very wrong in your previous life to have ullal as your professor in this life -- it is a curse to have mr.ullal
There are rumours going around that Dr. Ullal writes his own good reviews on this site.

Everyone who has said bad things about this prof are people who didnt study and go to lecture. His classes are brutal. You have to study your butt off but in the end it pays off. I still remember everything I learned in those classes. People should spend more time studying than whining its not what your paying for.
This professor cannot handle constructive criticism. Period. you see all these comments under review below? This shows what Mr. Ullal's personality is like.

I had him for Sensory Processes last yr. I found his class to be boring and his exams to be unfair. He would focus on tiny details sometimes that you did not expect. I wanted to take Neuropsychology this year but when I found out that Mr. Ullal is teaching the course, I decided not to take it. I was very disapointed. Dont ruin your term. Avoid him

Dr. Ullal is the worst professor in the entire history of psychology professors. I want to thank him for being such a horrible prof with no emotions or mercy on students. His students grades or success doesn't matter to him. The only thing he is worried about is that the lousy psych department should not frown at him, so he doesn't lose his Job

Dr. Ullal is a very intelligent man who expects that his students bring a passion and keen interest towards course material. As long as one puts forth an effort towards studying and attending lectures a high grade can be achieved. Do not leave studying until the night before or concepts will be overwehlming. Questions are always encouraged.
The best prof I have ever had in McMaster. He really teaches you and makes sure you learn it at the end of the day. Just memorize his slides and ur fine! No text book or anything.

MEMORIZE his slides. He tests you on small details, and he may ask you short answers about topics he has never discussed. A main concept or focus area doesnt mean its important. Howevr, it did well in the 2 classes I took with him. If you read the slides over and over you should be able to get a good grade !

The course itself is interesting, but his tests and exams are VERY hard.  You need to know absolutely every single little detail because you never know what to expect from him.  His questions are very random and all over the place.

I do agree completely with the rater below. Ullal IS helpful in the sense that he responds to emails always, he is always happy to meet with you outside of class if you need help. But it's all an act. Professors should not be taken at face value. His tests are very unfair. The easy MCQ are worth very little. The hard SA are worth a lot. Mean prof.

I took the course second term in 2009. I worked for my 12 and the course is 12able if you study and memorize some random number. Dr. Ullal is very helpful if you ask him for additional clarification either through email or in person.

The best prof one could ever ask for. He is truly passionate about what he teaches and has been the source of inspiration for everything I've achieved ever since I took his class. It's definitely not a bird course and I don't think Neuroscience is ever meant to be. Think about that before you sign up for his course and you'll enjoy it.
Worst Psych. Prof. EvERR.R.R.R.

Worst Psychology Professor you can ever get. Speaks with a THICK INDIAN ACCENT and is very hard to decipher what he's talking. He is more concerned about saving his job then the welfare of his students. If many people get poor marks in 2nd year nuisance psych courses, it is fine with him. What a terrible professor. I suppose he has no heart.
Truly loves what he is doing, extremely passionate about the topic. He is always so happy! Make sure you go to lecture and you don't buy the textbook.

Great professor. Always willing to help students. Material is tough (but it is a neuroscience course). He does a great job in teaching the basics. Maybe a little too much detail and specifics of studies. Tests are tough, need to know all the little details.

TOUGHEST PSYCHOLOGY Professor in the history of this planet. He comes up with all kinds of cheap tricks to make sure students do poorly in his courses. He started asking short answer questions since the past couple years to ensure a low class average. He says he wants students to learn. YEAH SURE. All I can tell you is *GOOD LUCK* if you have him.

Dr. Ullal is a very interesting prof who obviously loves what he teaches. Warning: His tests are extremely biased as to what he enjoys (clinical disorders) and not representative of overall course. He does not use the text book, don't bother buying it.
PLEASE MAKE THE EXAMS EASY
Sensorry processes is so boring. He is the worst prof ever. I hate his accent. He smiles a lot, but he will make you sad after his exams
Very nice and polite in talking with students, but the professor is very "hard" when it comes to tests and exams.

I think he is a good prof. Gets excited about what he is teaching. His tests ARE hard (at least for me). Hes very willing to help and doesnt care how much material he covers as long as you understand. He loves discussion in class and would rather that than rush thru planned material
I now work at the Salvation Army thanks to this prof and my wonderful Psych degree. Thank you so much Ullalalalalalala.

Short Answers are very mean and designed to bring down the class average. He teaches the most worthless program in the planet - P S Y C HOLOGY !!! It will get you a job as bartender if you got a degree in Psychology. I graduated with distinction in Psych, and I work in a bank as a teller. I could get that job with my High School diploma itself

This Indian man looks like a monkey from the face. He will seriously make you sad if you take his awful courses. He has no life that's why he teaches 2nd Year Psych HAHAHA even after having an MD, PHD. I guess nobody in Canada would employ him that's why he is still an Assistant Professor. His exams are designed to make sure you fail. His Short Ans

Course is interesting and Ullal is definitely a good prof - very passionate about what he's teaching and eager to help. He does have a heavy accent which can make him difficult to understand sometimes but  follow his lecture notes and you should be fine. Tests were fair - everything comes straight out of the lecture notes so be sure to study those!
Boring Professor.

If I were to rate this prof, I will give him less then 1 out of 5. Negative marks are more appropriate for him. He has an annoying voice and the success of his students disturbs him, which explains why he sets unreasonably hard tests. I suppose McMaster will frown at him, if the class average is too high. Miserable professor. Thumbs down for Ullalu

teacher is nice and approachable but tests are very detailed, he asks questions on slides that he simply skimmed though during lectures and barely ask question on the slides he wasted half the lecture on. his short answers are quite challenging. lectures are also random. but his assignments are easy.overall, READ EVERYTHING in his lecture notes!!

Worst damn professor I have ever had the misfortune of meeting. He is terrible at teaching, speaks english with a very heavy indian accent, and is overall hard to follow during lectures. His lecturing is scattered and all over the place, plus he makes the tests very difficult with his terrible short answer questions. He wants students to do poorly.

it's the second class of his that I took and again he's really a great prof and made neuropsych an interesting class to attend, juz wish the accent is not as heavy....but despite that, great prof, great class, recommend it
He is so boring! I find it hard to focus in his lectures because of how boring he is.
terrible prof. speaks with a heavy indian accent and is hard to follow during lectures. tests are very difficult.

He is very eager and willing to help. I find it sad when people feel the need to berate a professor because they don't put forth an effort and expect easy marks. His tests are definitely fair. It is also ironic when the harshest critics cannot use the English language themselves in written form. Perhaps that is why they can't handle short answers?
He LOVES SHORRRTTT AAANSSWEEER questions
Awesome prof, i love him. Very friendly and eager to help. Gets very excited about the retina!
easy course because he makes his expectations crystal clear. Great prof, although with accent, definitely passionate abt the course material.

He used to be one of the best professors many years ago and people used to take his class to raise their GPA. But NOW he has become one of the toughest profs in Psych so STAY AWAY from any course taught by Gautam Ramesh Ullal. He keeps getting tougher every term. Now he gives "SHORT ANSWER" questions on TESTS AND FINAL EXAM. HOw horrible is that!!
Gautam Ramesh Ullal IS the toughest professor of McMaster Psychology

Dr. Ullal should STOP GIVING SHORT ANSWER QUESTIONS ON MIDTERMS. EVERYONE HATES SHORT ANSWERS THAT'S WHY SO MANY STUDENTS SKIPPED THE TESTS. He also needs to put more questions on the final exam. 60 questions is too less. He is trying to keep the class average low that's why he is using this tactic. Get over it sir, Psychology is garbage program.

Apparently he is a medical doctor but he teaches garbage PSYCH courses that too 2nd year. He should be teaching meds school, not a useless program like psychology. He is so hard on students, his short answer questions are insane, that's why so many students miss his tests and bring medical note so that he puts the weight to the final which is MCQ

Good Professor. Asks everything from the lecture slides. Assignments are very easy. Tests are tough because the short answers are nasty. Final is much easier because it is entirely multiple choice and if you studied you will do very well. Use Judgement here.. Hint Hint...

Definately one of the easier psych courses at Mac..highly recommend taking it. There are 2 assignments..but worth it. His sense of humor makes the course fly by! Very approachable..and open to questions..slows down for the class if you have any questions or need anything clarified..the topics delt with in class are applicable to everday settings.

Ullal is an awesome teacher and very funny at times as well. I thought that his lectures were very helpful and I never found myself nodding off. However, it may take a couple classes before you get used to his accent.

1st: For people that say psychology is not a science should best consider dropping out of university because it is a science in everyway. Dr. Ullal has always been the most passionate and best prof at McMaster so any bad comments evidently just reflect that they got a bad mark. HA sore losers. I would always recommend his course. THE BEST :)
One of the best professors I've ever had.  He really made a difference in my life goals.
He was horrible! I couldn't understand a thing he said! His accent was soo thick and he spoke too fast! I would never take a class with him again

VERY VERY Hard professor. He thinks psychology is a science. The easiest multiple choice are worth very little and his nasty so called SHORT answer are worth most marks. YUCK!!!! I hate short answer questions!!!!!!! Avoid his courses. You can't get NOWHERE in life with a useless psychology degree. Maybe work in macdonald's if you are lucky.
bad prof. brutal tests and exams. makes the relatively easy MC questions worth 0.5 marks and the tough ass SA question worth like 4-5 marks. if u mess up SA, ur done. gets mad at students randomly.
Fun professor, some find him hard to understand due to accent, I got used to it quickly though. Kept classes interesting, even the boring stuff, fun slide shows, humorous.
Makes learning about psychology fun!

Nice person, HARD prof. Brutal exams. SOooo few questions.. NOT Fair. Needs to take it easy on students. Psychology is only an 'Arts' discipline, it is not a science. Or maybe it's a soft-core science, not 'real' science.
explains concepts using confusing diagrams created in Paint; has trouble with sharing information in any other way.

Good prof..lectures are good, but his tests are SOO hard, when I took him for Psych 2E03, he would give like 25 questions on a test and it's worth 30% of the final mark? That's ridiculous :( He gives few questions on tests because then you have less chance to screw up and the class average would not be high. I heard he gave easy tests earlier days!

good course... but i swear he totally freaked out on us many times... complete melt down he got mad at some students and started yelling at all of us and threatening not to teach certain topics and put them on the test... it was REALLY strange..
He cares. If you study and come to class, you'll do fine!

Dr Gautam Ullal is a great professor at McMaster University. His way of explanation is very clear and he tends to explain from Basics. He is a hilalrious professor and has a very good sense of humour :) thats why he is so popular!!
He is the best professor at McMaster University
It is very difficult to understand what this prof is saying due to his accent.  Marked presentations very hard.
Good prof. Before he was easy, but now he has become much more tough. He gives fewer questions on exams now then what I heard he used to some years back, so less chance to screw up.

He wanted you to learn. His lectures were very unorderly. You never really understood in a "smooth" way..Everything was scattered. He wasnt very responsive via emails and had no office hours. He was highly  motivated as a prof though.

He's a good prof, dont get me wrong. Absolutely amazing, compationate, knowledgable - the works. He even wrote us a poem at the end and it was very cute. But the course overall was very hard. THE EXAM WAS TOTALLY RANDOM! Completely Random.
He's a good prof
He is the best prof. at Mac. That makes it all!

Dr. Ullal is the most amazing, enthusiastic and intelligent professor(He's a medical doctor). He is the only prof I have had who actually feels a concern and his responsibility for the performance of his students. He presents information that you need to know, and reading the text is not even required since all exams are based strictly on lectures

AMAZIN PROf. Best prof I have seen at McMaster University. Always smiling, has a good teaching attitude, quiet funny, absolutely puts helping students first and will repeat as many times till you get it. If you plan to take any Neuroscience related course (2F03, 2E03, 3J03) I STRONGLY recommend you take ONLY WITH HIM. Tests are most fair - ONLY MCQ
He is decent, I would only suggest teaching with better flow and explaining the information a little better seing as some of the stuff is new to us.
Please put more questions on tests. 25 multiple choice is too less for an exam worth 30% of the final grade
He was fairly easy for PSYCH2F03 but tougher for 3J03. He's a nice person, and his exams are actually fair, but the courses he teaches are difficult.

An amazing prof. And those that say hes hard to understand and can't speak english (in which case I dont see how his research in known world-wide) ... its called try perfecting the pronounciation of a language at the age of 24 ... Hes fineee people ... lay off
I LOVE DR. ULLAL!!!!!! Hes so funny and sweet, and makes the class so interesting.  But his tests are hard but hes always there to help you.

I think Dr. Ullal is such a genuine professor. YOu can tell he really wants the student to learn and he is so good at what he does. THe tests are hard, however if you go to every class and STUDY, you should be fine.
His Tests are killer. Better watch out if you take that course with him.
2F03 was easy, but 3J03 was HARD! He is such a nice prof, always wanting students to understand rather than rushing material. Great class, but be prepared to work VERY hard.
Way too hard
He's a nice man and all, but his tests are brutal this semester. Very very hard professor
If you want a better prof than Ullal you simply aren't going to find it. Loves his work, speaks japanese, sings and acts. Neuroscience never got better

Dr. Ullal is the ***BEST*** professor at McMaster University. He loves to teach and really cares about the success of his students. He looks so cute when he smiles, and he's quiet entertaining. I hate all night classes but he makes the Wednesday night lecture a pleasure to attend. Other profs should learn to be as honest and dedicated as him.

Dr Ullal is a really sweet person and an awesome prof.  He is the only prof who actually cares about the students.  He is also really intelligent and knows everything!  His tests are hard, so dont be fooled by his niceness, but if you attend all lectures, and take good notes, you'll do fine.  Overall, excellent professor!
A good guy, but his exams are hard. Questions are worded tricky and there are many questions which are worded in a different way from his lecture notes.
The most amazing professor I've ever had at Mac. He's pleasent, rediculously intelligent, and funny. anyone who could make behavourial Neuroscience a fair course is amazing.

taken all of his classes, loved them all.  must say, he defined my career path for me.  best prof ever!  very helpful, very patient, and very funny.  never a boring moment.  is sincerely interested in his students which is hard to come across.
Great PROF!!!
Such a great class. His teaching style is easy to follow and his "real-life" examples are hilarious! He also sings, which is an added bonus!

By far one of my favorite psych classes so far. Dr. Ulall is definitely one of the best profs at MAC. He is SUPER willing to help students and is always willing to reexplain things until everyone understands. He also tries to make the lecture fun and just does a fantastic job.
Dr. Ullal is absolutely ADORABLE!! Now that he uses powerpoint, his lectures are easy to follow and understand...he makes a tough course enjoyable! I think he's just the cutest thing ever!

The course is hard and will require a lot of reading, but if ur prepared to do that u will enjoy it and learn a lot.  dr ullal knows a lot and makes sure every1 understands what hes teaching.  i also agree with the earlier comments about his enthusiasm.  his jokes are funny too.
No Comments

Neuroscience was by far one of the most interesting classes i've had in my 3.5 years at uni.  Dr. Ullal's enthusiasm is highly contageous, and it made the 3 hour class totally worth the time.  I'm really looking forward to a lot more classes taught by him.

wow...what a funny guy!! If you want to take a fun and interesting course, this is the ONE!!  Dr. Ullal has so much passion to what he teaches and he's very helpful & a good singer too :) His tests are really fair. He makes neurscience fun. I recommend everyone to take this class.
Such a funny prof who is passionate about neuroscience.  His tests are fair...straight from his notes.  Remember to take good notes b/c he only posts overheads (which are mainly images).
good guy
Final exam was tough

He's is the nicest man and its very evident that he's interested and excited about neuroscience, which in my opinion, helps the students to also become interested in the course. I would recommend the course to anyone, as long as you have an interest in psychology!! It's straightforward and fun!
Tough!

although i agree that he's a nice guy, his overheads are terribly unclear and he does not post all of them online, and/or he will post some that he doesnt even utilize. he is also unhelpful when trying to study for exams and NO review sessions were offered with the TA's prior to exams.
very good prof, but the second midterm was a bit hard.
No Comments
the 2f3 song made my day!  best prof at mac
wonderful prof.  has lots of knowledge.
The sweetest guy in town!
All around excellent professor. Amazing course. Take the course if he's teaching.
best professor at mcmaster!!!!
At first was kinda hard to understand, but after that it was all gravy.  Very approachable, and answered all my questions.
He is great as a teacher!!
Hard course, good prof, nice guy
Great teacher...very helpful

He is so cute!  He was a little difficult to understand at the beginning, but it got easier.  As long as you take very good notes, you will do fine.  He is also very approachable and encourages questions in class.  Great experience

Exteremly friendly and approachable. puts his students first. if you don't understand anything he will help you and make you understand. makes the class very very interesting and uses a lot of examples to teach stuff which helps a ton!
Excellent prof
he's awesome. he really knows the material and he teaches it well, and he's willing to help if you don't understand.
He's a good prof

Maaan, this guy knows his *ish! I think he's fairly well known internationally for his research. If you go to his class, and take good notes, you will ace the exams as his questions are worded exactly how he talks in class. He IS hard to understand tho.
He is so hard to understand and unhelpful. Worst experience I've had in a classroom.
english speek no good
a little hard to understand but a good teacher

comments: Bloemhof's class (Health Econ) is dry, but Bloemhof is really nice and the course expectations were totally reasonable. She knew everyone by name, and she's really nice. People seem not to like her on here, but I would totally recommend a course with her.

Course was disorganized, no clear outline for triple jump evaluation or group work. Very passionate about the course material, but mixes political views into discussions. Lectures go off on tangents. Book + quizzes was like a completely different course. Would have liked to learn more of the actual economic theory. Posts A LOT of supplemental info
Thoughtful and interactive lectures as well as assignments. Definitely a great professor.

When I learned that Dr. Bloemhof lectured internationally about pedagogy, student engagement, and promoting critical thinking in the classroom, I was incredibly disappointed. She is hands down the worst communicator, worst lecturer, and overall most confusing professor in UG and Grad School combined.
Huge discrepancy between lecture content and evaluations.

If she actually taught economics the course would've been decent. BUT She was always off topic, hated answering questions, assumed we knew everything, and was disrespectful of students opinions. She would go off on tangents about politics half the time, her case discussions were poorly facilitated, and assignments unrelated to content. AVOID HER.
Worst Prof I have ever had. Had her for Economics in my MBA. Most useless professor I have ever had to sit through. She is awful, avoid at all costs!  Soooooooo bad  If I could give her a 0 I would

The slides are dry. Assignments are mostly unrelated to material on slides, had to google everything. Didn't clarify exam expectations till after the last day of class. Assumes economics background and doesn't teach what is tested. Gives too many extra readings as if there is spare time and the only course you are taking

The Horcrux contains the tears of students, it must be destroyed. It makes her angry when people ask questions. Really didn't know what was happening. Huge gaps in teaching material and expectations. Unrealistic expectations with readings.

Textbook required as will assist with weekly quizzes. Assumed everyone in MBA class had economics knowledge. Very knowledgeable professor. LOVED the concept of 1 hour lecture, 1 hour break for group case study, and last hour for discussing it in class. The Triple Jump was interesting; subjective, but interesting. Thanks Barb!
The outline is ambiguous, you cannot catch her words at all. She makes economics a too much complex subject.
I had no idea what she was saying in lecture. Failed first midterm, dropped the class, then got an A with a different prof.
I have  never had a worse professor. Supposedly she teaches grad school economics? Fat chance. Avoid any class taught by this lady.
Can come across like a tough professor, but if you are willing to work she will no doubt help you! Her lectures are great made everything clear, so if you don't attend - good luck to you...
so bad
Worst teacher in the world!!!NO HELP!!please do not take her course
Dont take any advice from this professor as she has no common sense or real life skills. She can read a book and thats it.
My favourite prof!

Person below: you are in a 4th year class. Working on your own and knowing concepts is a given. How else did you make it so far? She's always available and gives you several ways to get in touch with her. There is no excuse for not knowing her expectations. Great prof! Always available. Always helpful. Other profs need to take notice.

She doesnt seem to teach much at all. She expects students to work on their own and know concepts as a pre requisite. Also, classes are more about how to use the library rather than international trade itself
Excellent
Very unreasonable
Great professor once you got used to her style of teaching.  Really rubbed people the wrong way in the beginning but opened up and became easier to deal with later on.  Great class and teacher!

The original prof had to leave the course during the first week.  Barb did a good job filling in on short notice.  I would definitely take a class of hers again.  If you show you are serious she will treat you well - don't appear lazy!

Barb's class was very disorganized with several discrepancies in her instructions (including different instructions for different individuals on the same assignment). She had obvious favourites in the class, and was belittling and unprofessional in private. Overall, Barb was by far my worst professor at McMaster.
Lectures were unorganized and slow! Nice in class but very rude if you go to see her during office hours.
No Comments

Barb was absolutely great.  Challenging course, but she provided plenty of guidance, and made the material thought-provoking and interesting.  The discussion of real-world examples of course material made it a valuable experience for anyone interested in pursuing economics after university.
good
Not an easy course. She was helpful (cared about the students) and took extra time to explain things. She was very clear about the course requirements.
very helpful and always available for questions. one of the hardest courses i have ever taken.
this was a hard course. she was very helpfull and fair.
No Comments
she's no good
very hard tests, covers a lot of material but course is entirely based on theory - not examining pratical applications. helpful in explaining 1-on-1
Very hard class.  Too much material.  Unclear lectures. Brutle tests!!!

comments: The content in this course is so boring, so it's not entirely Stone's fault. I eventually gave up on going to lecture and watched the recording at 1.5X speed because the whole thing went by so slowly.

He's boring, but if you pay attention in lecture then you won't have to touch the textbook and you'll do really well on tests. He makes everything super clear and essentially spoon feeds the info to you. You just have to be willing to suffer through the boredom

He reads straight from the textbook, lectures are SO boring (the content also being boring really doesn't help), then his test questions are pretty random and out-of-the-blue. Seems like a genuinely nice guy but is definitely not a prof I would ever want again.

Dr. Stone's a pretty cool guy, but personally, evolution is just a really boring topic. Multiple choice (though long) was fair. Written answers section was concise (filling in the blanks), but you had to memorize stuff from his slides. A tip for future students: Read the textbook and try to answer the caption questions under any pictures or graphs.

An amazing professor. He has passion for what he teaches and has interesting lectures and genuinely cares about his students. He stopped teaching my bio course halfway through because he was filling in for Dr. Dudley and he is missed very much!

He was a very nice man, and showed a lot of passion and interest in his field. However, he wasn't the best prof because he was very dry and his test questions were too wordy and a nightmare to answer... A lot of the content that is covered on his tests seemed to be testing your ability to catch tricks, rather than your knowledge.
Dr. Stone is truly a wonderful person. His MCQ's were a little wordy, but overall, he is very knowledgable. The material is dry (but nothing can be done about that).
Excellent professor that cares for his students and the courses he teaches. Very clear, and genuinely a nice guy. Loved the course!
Excellent professor who is genuinely interested in the material he teaches, which comes through in his lectures.
Nice guy overall, I just wish he had more control over his class. But then again, our class was pretty annoying and talked all the time, so you kind of feel bad for him.
Approachable, nice guy who has really good overhead notes... I have to admit that staying attentive in lecture was hard though. Oh, and don't get me started on the TAs...
Dr. Stone rocks! His notes are perfectly clear, and in university, that's a massive asset. What more can you ask for?

Amazing prof with a keen sense of understanding & explanatory process when it comes to knowing his stuff. His tests & exams are fair but you have to work for em by knowing ur stuff. Listen to what he says (aka attending lectures helps big time!) & hez a really nice guy who will help students who actively show interest. Great prof for thesis!

Extremely dry lectures, almost fell asleep in most of them. Not entirely his fault as I thought the material he had to teach was super boring. Made an easy midterm but then his exam questions were ridiculous

Loved dr stone and this class. hes a cool guy, easy to talk to. material is quite easy, but he has a very creative way of testing - his exam is open book but it really doesnt matter-no book will help you if you don`t know your stuff. his questions require thought; answers wont be found on a single page. fun class though.

Incredibly clear, thoughtful teacher with lectures based on interpreting images and understanding concepts rather than memorizing text. Cares about students who go the extra mile. A great prof to have as a thesis supervisor too!
fantastic!
awesome course; follow instructor's lead rather than classmates for a rewarding experience!

Dr. Stone is an incredibly interesting lecturer, and makes some of the boring and math heavy concepts this course contains manageable. He teaches the style in a very non-typical and refreshing way. 60% of the course is quizzes and assignments which are dead easy, if you put the effort into them. The exam is hard but not impossible to do well.
really nice person, but horrible lectures and in class organization. It seems that he has too much work to do so he can't successfully lead any one class.

This class sounded interesting. The concepts are difficult, involves alot of math. There is ALOT of material and reading. I did well in the end, but by fluke. Everyone bombed the exam, it was ridiculously hard.

innovative, fun learning; prof is serious in offering a 'different' course (listen to his warning to read and understand rather than follow others and memorise); textbook is great; open book exam is challenging but fair (if you listen to his warning); smoking hot (in a brainiac way)!!!
Although the final was open book, it was quite challenging. Other than that, the course is a breeze...especially if you keep up with the readings
He was a nice guy but his lecture notes made absolutely no sense. The textbook was far more helpful.
W E I R D   C O U R S E
mediocre
good prof, good course, good times
The course itself is very interesting though there is alot of reading. Dr. Stone is a good lecturer, is friendly and approachable. I recommend the class to the ones interested in Evolution!
Interesting class. The lectures are too fast paced ( 3 chapters=150 pgs) a week!! Good lecturer and good attitude towards students.
biggest nerd i've met in my life! his class is unbelievable easy, but he could be a (much) better lecturer
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Class is interesting, I had really enjoyed the labs since the Lab TA was an absolute delight to have. Unfortunately dont expect anything positive from Dr. Cameron.  Always avoid office hours and you certainly can but I went to her office to clarify on questions from the midterm. Ridiculed for how i dressed and and my speech mannerism.

Egotistical, confrontational and overly sensitive. Extraordinarily bad qualities in any faculty, especially administrative.  Don't recommend referring to her for any inquiries if you can help it. Be sure to use simpler words so she doesn't get offended if you find yourself holding a conversation lasting more than 4 seconds.

Lovely lady, very easy to talk to in office hours. The class itself doesn't require a textbook. She basically gives you a similar exam to her practice exam and gives you the long answer question beforehand. I put in minimal effort and barely studied and got an A-.

The prof is very rude specially when you talk about her course and provide feedbacks. She thinks her courses are the best and they don't need to make any improvements. Marking criteria is not clear and they ask you to provide specific details. Labs are very long and lab reports are just pain. It's a good class to take and very helpful but not w her

She's good as a lecturer when you don't want to read through the 50 slides of content heavy lectures. She makes it easy to understand--go to lectures--it'll make studying SO much easier. The labs are cool. She's a lovely person.

Dr. Cameron is nice prof and explains the course materials well. Her lecture is little bit boring, but she will try to make it funny and enjoyable. The labs for this course is sooooo funny, I will definitely recommend this course, because of the labs! you can go to the green house. The tests materials are fair but need to be careful for them.

She's really humble when she teachers, doesn't give off a "I know everything I'm so great" vibe like other profs because when she mentions things not in her field or too specific, she'll say she doesn't know. Really pleasant voice and speed!

She looks for very specific answers in her short answers on the test, but she doesn't word her questions well enough for students to know what she's looking for. Super boring in class, and very condescending when you talk to her one-on-one

Hard class... She requires students to answer things in the most specific way ever. Not fair. Even if you know the material really well, if you don't answer the questions the way she expects you .. you wont get marks at all.

Came off as a little rude in person, but it may have just been a bad day: Her lectures were great and I learned a ton. Got me interested in genetic engineering in plants. Labs were great too, though I'm not sure if those are her doing. Textbook was useless though.

She literally reads of the slides so not every interested in going to her class and every time she says something she will says you dont need to know that its just fyi!! so didnt know what to know, she is really boring and expects too much prior knowledge for a second yr course. Never taking a course with her again...she made plants seem boring :O
Her lecturing style is fairly monotone and she reads off of the slides. Furthermore, although she seems pleasant, she is condescending when you ask for help in person.

Dr. Cameron has this really annoying habit of following every single line of slides with her laser pointer. The textbook was expensive and useless. she essentially reads off the slides. always said "we'll learn this later" and we never did. could be interesting material with another prof definitely.

This was a very disappointing class to say the least. the professor wasn't engaging and was ALWAYS monotone. as far as the work goes it was somewhat hard and her tests are tricky. also the labs were long and frequent.

she pretty much made herself useless since her lecture notes were all that mattered and she just reads them.  you can tell she's really nice, she just doesn't really bring new stuff to the table.  apparently she's much better one-on-one.
The only factor covering for the inability of the prof is the easiness of the course.

The class itself is easy enough, but the lecture notes are sometimes vague, and her explanations really don't help much. A few times it took her an entire class to get through about 3 or 4 slides - for no apparent reason, since they weren't particularly difficult (or important).
easiest class ever. just study lecture notes.
One of the niceest profs at Mac....class was great....lots of examples and she will take time to go over tricky parts...gave hints on exams....good lecture notes and very approachable and helpful....

One of the nicest profs! She was always very approachable and helpful and made excellent notes. Lectures could have been boring at times and the midterm required knowledge of all details on the notes but for the most part the course was interesting and she was an excellent prof.
lectures are soooo boring. other than that it's all right

Talking on her cell phone during our midterm wasn't so cool. Midterm short answers ridiculous-we were asked ambiguous qs., and they wanted answers that didn't ask for. Lecture not very exciting/ stimulating.
she just read off the slide
Cool prof

comments: Dr Dej is always clear and to the point. The Life Science 2L03 course is a new lab course which teaches you many useful lab skills for you to put on your resume. Dr. Dej made this course very easy to understand

I loved LS2G03. Especially the way Dr. Dej taught it. At 8:30 AM she made genetics interesting and I was fully paying attention!  However, she never replies to her emails and is never in her office! I don't blame her though, she is literally handling the entire life sci program by herself. But, easy course and an easy 12!

Dej is a really great teacher. Her slides are thorough & she doesn't just read off them but rather adds more information -but not too much that you lose track. She answers all questions very well and she is just very lovely. The only drawback of the course is the tests (worth 75-80% of your grade) and you always feel rushed like there is too much.

Dr. Dej is an incredibly sweet woman. Always very helpful and definitely cares about her students (and people in general). If you need absolutely anything, this is the prof to talk to. Only downside is she has a very soft voice in lecture but her personality and passion is worth it.

Dr. Dej is a wonderful prof because she teaches the genetic course so well. She explains stuff very clear and organized. The test questions are very straightforward, but if you want to do well on the test, you need to know how to do calculation and the time for the tests I think it is a little bit rush, so you need to know the materials really well

You definitely need to come to class. She is a good lecturer and focuses on that material. If you are confused about diagrams, GO TO OFFICE HOURS! SHE IS SO DAMN HELPFUL!!! That being said, I fell asleep in class because her voice was so soft. Very understanding and has a great sense of style!
She's very knowledgeable but her lectures can be very boring sometimes because she doesn't speak with much enthusiasm.

Dr Dej always provided very interesting lectures, I really liked how she would use case studies to illustrate concepts. My only complaint is that she taught a lot of methodologies and techniques, and the test was 90% calculations... wish she had told us this in advance so I didn't waste so much time studying irrelevant content.
One of the best professor's in the Life sciences department.
You have to go to class because her slides are usually pictures and diagrams that she describes in class. Very helpful person if you go up to her after class  or in office hours.
Great lecturer, and her class notes are excellent (you barely need the textbook). My only complaint is that her tests are too long and pretty hard.

Her online lectures are terrible. Sound quality is next to none and it's so hard to keep awake. She's a nice lady who knows her stuff but the material is so dull and she doesn't make it interesting either.

Very interesting class. Unfortunately the mic did not work very well and if you were sitting further than the first 5 rows, you could barely hear her quiet voice. On the exam, she misprinted a number needed for a calculation, yet didn't tell everyone, only the ones that asked. Her questions are usually rather tricky, mostly fair.

Really interesting material, but it was hard to pay attention in class due to the fact that she doesn't control audience noise very well. Most test questions were fair, some where out of blue, which also happened in Genetics. She's a very nice lady and usually responds to e-mails.

Very nice lady that explained concepts okay... but the course was so, so, so disorganized it was ridiculous. Course readings and tutorial answers put up late, readings didn't match up, slides uploaded 5 minutes before class started... learning ended up being a lot harder than it should have been.
great at explaining concepts and this actually made it easy to pay attention in lectures, even on sleepy days

Best biology professor I've had so far in university. Her lecture slides are very detailed and helpful. An outstanding lecturer who you can tell loves what she does. Tests and exam are challenging, yet fair with relatively high averages.

She explains stuff very thoroughly, and gives students some break. Very understanding prof who is willing to cooperate with students. She raised my interest in virology. First test might be confusing, but doable if you study.

She was great. Went over everything very thoroughly and a lot of clarity. The only issue was that we got our marks late but I think that was only because she teaches many courses each term so it gets hectic for her! but good prof overall.
Didn't get marks back on time and a course was a bit unorganized. But overall good experience and good prof

BEST PROF EVARRR!!! sooo nicee and sweettt, avg for tests are fairly high cuz everyone pays attention in class and it doesnt trick you in any way...study hard and there will be a sure 12! she is amazing btw :P
amazing, very very very very very nice. tests are really easy.

genuinely nice and smart and wants to see her students succeed without having to babysit them. best prof i've ever had in my life!! her tests were good and she was just plain WONDERFUL! dont worry about the tests, having her as a prof is the greatest joy! :D

Kim Dej is fantastic! I'm used to having profs who don't care about teaching or are impossible to understand. Dr. Dej was the exact opposite. You can tell she loves teaching and she's really good at it. The course takes a lot of work, but you'll learn tons if you put in the time.
BEST PROF EVER, HANDS DOWN!!! she is the greatest, the nicest, the most amazing person to have as a prof...winner of the prof of the year award 3 times!
Had her for cell bio & genetics as well. Best prof @ mac. She's amazing! You'll lover
I had her for cell bio and genetics and she's by far the best in the bio department and one of the best profs at mac!
Incredible prof! enjoyed the entire 2 classes i had with her and would love to have her in the future.

Loved this prof. She cares about the students and is very approachable. The subject wasn't interesting to me originally but she kept me coming to class and raised my excitement about the course. I found her explanations always crystal clear. One of my favourite profs at Mac.

She's a wonderful prof to have! Loved cell bio only cause she taught it with excellence. She is extremely approachable and really listens to you. Uses great animation videos during class to help visualize certain things. Very fair questions on the midterms and final! Overall she is EXCELLENT!
Very understanding prof. Don't miss lecture, because she does tend to say more than what's on the slides. Tests are very fair, but the use of CPR fails really hard IMHO.

I love Dej, she's quirky in a cute way and I like how she likes to hear what students have to say for certain things (getting your voice heard is important).  Overall, my favourite prof at McMaster so far!

She is by far one of the most genuine profs I've had up to date. She truly does care about her students and her willingness to answer questions and explain concepts is remarkable to see. She is very enthusiastic in what she does and her teaching skills are impressive. Tests are extremely fair as long as you put in sufficient amount of studying.
Sweetheart of a teacher. Very fair tests ... actually could be a bit harder! I thought I would be doomed after bio 1a03 but was pleasantly surprised.
SHE MAKES YOU DO TONS OF RESEARCH ON RESEARCH ARTICLES... VERY STRESSING. but a good professor

Kim Dej is fantastic. She knows how to interact with students- even if some of the subject matter is dry.   Cell and Genetics with her was great. She made sure that students understood the material and genuinely wanted us to do well.  Thanks Kim Dej.

Great prof - has a teaching [not research] position at Mac and it shows.  Always willing to help - her office hours are useful for clarification and context and details that don't make it into lecture but make the material more interesting.  Tests are fairly easy and she gives you a good idea what's on them... a lot of memorization though

she is very nice,approchable and cute. she saved me the time of reading my textbook for cell bio(my txt was a waste of my money). but you will still need the textbook for genetics due to the difficult level of the course. but she gives hints on what she will be testing on. so tests were fair and practice tests were extremly helpful!!!overall, GREAT
Great at explaining concepts, even though the material is rather convoluted with proteins. Always willing to help and clarify for students. Great prof!!
She's cool and cute
she is a very good prof:)

Dr. Dej is fantastic!!! She is extremely caring and will really go out of her way to make sure you understand. Very approachable. She does a great job of making some of the material that can be quite tedious interesting! Would take a course that I didn't like just to have her as a prof!
Extremely DULLLLLLLLL. But she's a nice prof.
Kim is so awesome that I would marry her if I had the chance (not even kidding a little bit)

She's a great prof. Extremely nice and approachable, and her lecture notes contain most of what you need for the course. She's also really good about letting you know what types of questions will be asked on tests/exam.
she could use more enthusiasm, its extremely hard to stay awake in that class.
Very approachable.  She's always willing to help her students to understand.  Her tests are fair.
She teaches far too fast, but other than that she was ok

she is a nice lady, but BORING.  her lecture notes are EXACTLY the textbook copied on to powerpoint.  attending class just saves you reading over the book.  if she used new examples the class would be much better, but her lectures do cover what you need to do well.

I actually found her lectures very useful and saved me a lot of time teaching myself things from the text.  I found the midterm and exam to be very fair, and she gave us a lot of tips in class that helped cut a lot of studying time.  Dr. Dej always tried to ensure fairness in everything, and is really great one on one if you ever have any Q's.

Sweet lady, but BORING! I learned everything I know from the textbook.  Her lectures were pointless as she chose to focus on the easier aspects and skim over the harder, tougher to explain parts.  I only found her lectures useful as a guide for what to focus on in the text and what not to.
She's very nice and her tests are ok. Now if only she could move past reciting textbook word for word via Powerpoint, we'd be making progress.
I don't think I've stayed awake for a full class the entire semester.  The overhead slides are straight from the text, and often have had errors. Very little enthusiasm when teaching.
Copying the textbook into powerpoint slides and reading it word by word in a tedious tone is not exactly what I call teaching!
I had the hardest time staying awake at her lectures, so I stopped attending lectures after one month. Interestingly, I didn't have any problems in the tests, by just reading the book!
Soooooooo repetitive, dwells on the same stuff over and over again and only focuses on the simple aspects of the text. She's nice, but I'd rather read the text.

Has very nicely made slides but sometimes she seems to care more about how the slides look instead of what it says on them. Leaves a lot out from the text and very repetitive but still a nice prof who's willing to answer any questions
She is a great instructor, has great notes and writes fair tests and tries to answer any questions you have. Awesome professor!
She is very approachable if you need help; very good for the first time teaching.  nice lady
She is okay, she tries real hard to make everyone happy. Very helpful, made notes on important stuff from each chapter she taught to help study for test and exam.
Great effort for first time teaching.  Cares about her students and is good at explaining material.
Good prof..tries her best however lacks experience and therefore confidence. Very caring towards students. Overall good.

very nice prof, but needs a big dose of confidence and a lot more enthousiasm to keep the class engaged. repetitive in her notes, but tests fairly and really cares about her students. All Dr. Dej needs is more experience with lecturing, and along with that will come confidence.
Excellent professor! Clear, thorough and consise! Notes are amazing...though sometimes a tad bit repetitive. McMaster's lucky to have her!
Very good prof. clear and thorough lectures and funny. She is very organized and has excellent notes
Somehow boring, but pretty knowledgeable.
No Comments
