comments: Does not tolerate criticism of feminist theory;  does however accept non-academic, creative writing projects that condone or celebrate radical feminist theory - eg. including Gloria Steinem etc.  If you are an independent, critical thinker - do not take her class.
Dr.Sugiman is a phenomenal professor and amongst the best I've had in my entire degree. I would go out my way to have another course with her.
No Comments

I was gona major is sociology till I had this course. Other soc. exams only had multiple choice, she made ours short answers and multiple choice- gaaaaayest exam!! and hard! Dont recommand it for any1 :)

Shes a great prof who really seems interested in what she is teaching.  Class was relativly easy with only one mid-term first semester.  Tests are moderate in difficulty, but if you know your information, you are fine.

The greatest professor at Mac that I've come across so far. Her lectures are interesting and she's willing to help the student in anyway possible. She's vey clear about what she wants and has opened a door to a whole new set of interests for me. I recommend her to anyone else even slightly interested in sociology. Thanks Dr.Sugiman for a great term
SO much better than Knight!
Nice prof, a little quiet at times, but has made a conscious effort to be a resource to her students.
boring lectures, pretty easy test and not a bad exam. she holds some strong feminist views
Great Class and great prof!
I really enjoyed your class and found it very informative.  I miss you
Great prof.  Simplifies concepts.  Explains material very well, and we are able to understand clearly.

Great Prof.  Better than all those bloody engineering ones.  One test and no assignments first term was quite the fun ride... and I actually retained some of what I learned, too.  (L'Hopital's rule?  Huh?)
Amazing professor, makes very clear notes, and explains things in a way so everyone can understand. I really enjoy her class...
gotta love her!
No Comments

Nice n helpful

Great class notes, barely need texts if you go to class

comments: Well, Professor Brewer does not teach much. What he does in his lectures were mostly reading slides and he  don't answer questions well. The only valuable part of his lecture was the demonstration on actual work on the software.  Basically, if you want to get good grades, he's your man but if you want to learn something solid, do not count on him.

Whoever claims that this prof is good or cares about his students is blatantly lying. I have never felt more cheated out of an education in my life. Lectures are absolutely worthless, extremely bland teaching style and is no non-responsive to emails that there is no point in contacting him. Worst prof by far STAY AWAY
Absolutely worthless going to class. We're being cheated out of an education. Seems nice though.
Very bland during lecture and has practically no presentation skills so there really is not point in going to class. His notes are thorough and he is willing to help so I guess that balances.
Slow, but a nice teacher.  Despite haters, I like him
Says "uhh" all the time and moves through excel without really explaining anything.  My suggestion would be to avoid any class he teaches if possible.
If you have any questions and go to his office, he is very helpful. Super nice guy and super smart. Overall a really good prof.

He is a brilliant and extremely talented man. He comes off as a bit dry in lecture, but his notes are thorough. He is incredibly helpful, and truly cares about his students, and is great in flexibility to meet with students for extra help. In terms of prep for exams, do his previous exams. The nicest prof I've ever met!
This professor is a great person and cares a lot about his students.

i have respect for prof brewer because he tries and is a very nice guy, but i noticed my foundations for finance took a hit because he was my 'intro to finance' professor. i wish you the best of luck, sir..but for the students, try to step your game up!!
STOP SAYING UM DAMN IT
hes aite

Monotone voice reading from his poorly made word slides which are available but in ridiculously large font (making printing them off a pain).  No interaction in class, no explanations beyond the notes useless lecture might as well be taught by computer dictation.

Worst professor ever. Why is he teaching graduate students? How could the school hire such low quality professor? No incentive to go to class. No support. No response to constructive feedback. Not prepared for class. Can't teach without powerpoint. Powerpoint slides are unclear and erroneous anyway.
took it so long ago, yet i still have nightmares about how boring it was. EAsy class though.
Read out OH..boring.. no intentions for students to go to class! worst lecturer!
skip this one, wait for another prof
nice guy, lacks personality though
interesting class... but not taught well by prof. TAs are great. go to Tutorials
I think he is a robot
No Comments
possibly affraid of students/ overall knows the material, not very interesting
I think he's afraid of students..  nice guy, smart, but poor teaching skills

comments: Mr. Jonop was a new prof for section 2 of Western's 3381 class this year. I enjoyed this class very much until his section started. I entered the biochemistry module with great excitement. Because of his "efforts", I now hate this field. As a 4.0 student, I find his material very frustrating because he is inaccurate and always contradicts himself.

To our utmost dismay, this incompetent prof has recently moved to UWO to plague us with his insanely limited understanding of his own field. This lazy person does not spare the time to make his own lecture slides, and instead takes them from a past prof who obviously understood the field better. He then tests material never even mentioned in class.
Very nice prof. Very helpful. Best class ever !!

Dr. Junop is the best professor I've ever had! He wants to make sure that his students retain the essentials of the course long after they finish the course. He uses a mix of slides and writing to explain the concepts and really tailors the teaching to the students and the amount of understanding.

Wonderful teacher! Very kind, approachable, and accommodating. Truly wants you to succeed and emphasizes learning that will actually be relevant, not details that you forget as soon as you write the test. One of my favourite professors!
He's honestly the nicest and most helpful instructor. His passion for proteins and student learning is quite evident.

Dr. Junop was the best biochem prof I have ever had. His interest in protein folding and structure determination shines through in his lectures. By punctuating his lessons with practical observations of the field, he brings a personal touch that you just can't get from a textbook. He will be sorely missed here at McMaster.

Murray was a great supervisor for my 4th year thesis. I could not have asked for a better mentor and teacher. His constant encouragement and guidance throughout my whole thesis allowed me to grow as a researcher and an individual.

Dr. Junop is definitely one of the best professors in the Biochemistry department. For me, he has been one of the most influential, as it is his passion for structural biology and teaching that inspired me to pursue scientific research as a career.

Dr. Murray Junop is the most dedicated and compassionate professor I've had in 4 years at McMaster. As he is a top expert in his field, it's a great privilege that he makes so much time for students. Dr. Junop always has his students' best interest in mind and easily draws interest to his area of study, and to the field of biochemistry in general.
Dr. Junop is one of the nicest prof ever. He cares about his students and is more interested in their learning rather than testing them with time restraints. Very genuine and funny guy.
BEST PROF EVERRR!!!
THE BEST BIOCHEM PROF ever.   He is extremely brilliant and cares about his student. The course is designed in really good way.
Dr. Junop is a fantastic prof.  Very interested in his subject area and eager to pass along his enthusiasm to students.  I wish all my profs were as good!

I was looking so forward to his class, but once you hear him talk and his boring, slow teaching style, it all falls flat. If you try to go to him for help,he's sarcastic and has an all-knowing attitude. After having amazing biochem profs before, he made me hate biochem and never want to see it again. Horrible prof overall, and very boring/tedious

Best Prof every! Makes an effort to relate theory to practice and keep classes interesting.  This has been my favorite course so far at McMaster.  Dr. Junop is a gentleman and is a truly gifted educator.
very good, nice guy, very concerned about his students
The best teacher I've ever had. He opened up the whole field to me and made pursuing biochemistry as an occupation seem approachable... what a great guy. He's known for taking chances on kids.

Dr. junop genuinely cares about his students and his teaching. He's class is designed to teach you the concepts you need to follow through with biochemistry instead of memorizing useless facts, which is very valuable. But most of all, you should take his class for all the life lessons he'll teach you. That will stick with you for life.

He is one the best Prof in biochem department. I had a chance to work with him and he is awesome. I loves his work and loves to talk about it with students. He takes great interest in undergrad courses and help you a lot along the way. he course was a lot of fun. No exam!!!!!. sometime we had open class quiz. i love him as a prof and as a person.

AMAZING PROF!!! Murray is the reason as to why I am specializing in Biochemistry. In my four years as an undergraduate student, I have never met a prof. as nice and humble as him. Everything he taught years ago, still remains crystal clear in my head. I owe it all to his brilliant style of teaching.

He was my biochem prof 2 years ago. Amazingly kind and hardworking. Extremely knowledgeable AND can teach! I worked in his lab for 2 years during my undergrad and he was helpful (and forgiving!) as a supervisor. He teaches more than just amphoteric proteins, you learn about life and how it is never too late to go after something you truly want.
i think he is the best prof in university. course is designed in really good way.

Murray is the best prof Biochem has ever seen! (There's a reason why he won the award 2 years ago!) He was my thesis prof, and I won't ever trade him for anything else. Murray is the reason I did Biochem! He's an extremely helpful guy, and is very dedicated to his research.
He's really willy wonka in disguise! He makes chocolate at his biochem lab.
great prof! gotta love him!

One of the best profs u'll come across.  Extremely clear and thorough with explanations.  Offers help whenever u need it.  Overall, a great teacher.  Quizzes are difficult sometimes, but they make you think and u understand the material quite well as a result.
Excelent prof! But, having no midterm or final is questionable.

Excellent prof! His quizs are a bit tough, but make you think! He's really good at what he does because he is one of the few people at Uni NOT there just for the research! Great teacher and great person to talk to for undergra academic help. Nothing but great respect for this man!

The most amazing prof i have ever had in my life. Simply THE BEST!! His enthusiasm at 8:30 in the morning is splendid. You dont need coffee to stay up in his class, his teaching will do that. Outside the class, he is also a gentleman. Loves interacting with class, and helps u whenever in need. LOVE him!
Wow, this guy loves what he does and it shows!  Great prof, and a great person.  Enjoyed his class very much.
Great Prog, always wants to help students learn and encourages the love of learning.  Always there if you need help or have questions and is patient.  Great prof!
Junop is the best prof at McMaster. Should get a teaching award.
so enthusiastic, very approachable, very fair, made me excited about proteins even at 8:30 am
Never had him as a prof, though know him through the department.  He is a true gentleman and profesional.  Very thoughtful and is an adamant advocate for undergraduate education at MAC.
Great lecturer, although his notes tend to be a bit messy.  He answers many questions without hesitation and gives out a chocolate bar in every class.
great prof very approachable! crazy about what he does!

comments: Bird course. Not offered every year since Hoppe's the only one who teaches it. Assignments: 70% (14% x 5), but with friends, you should be able to get 100% every time. He reuses old assignment questions. Exam was similar to the assignment but is tricky, uses the same concepts, only 30%. His lectures are interesting but people don't show up.

Funny guy, loved his lectures because he was very insightful. The key to doing well in this course is doing all the homework problems since they'll be a subset of the tests & exam, but you should really know your concepts well. Go to his office hours, he'll enthusiastically answer your questions and make sure you understand. 10/10 would take again.

This is class was very similar to stats 2D03; he attempted to be interactive by bringing in dice, cards and paddle boards but at times the material was very repetitive and he wasn't very good at managing his time for the class to cover everything
No real office hours. Graded the hard exam VERY LATE. You could tell he was a research prof and has low priority on teaching. I guess the only upside was that he's nice.
:( - stay away!!!!!
I don't attend his class anymore because he reads off his slides, and his slides are horrible. Have the material isn't on them and when he solves problems he skips many steps. Please explain
Best STats professor on campus. If you want to be challenged and want to learn how to think deeply on Assignments, I suggest you take Dr. Hoppe's classes.
One out of 5 is too much for this professor. He is the most unhelpful person in the whole world.

Even though I got an A- in this course, I think I deserved an A+. His exam was unfair and brought my mark down. I wish he had dropped our lowest Assignment, which he did not considering the one on Martingale's was so unfair.
Toughest Statistics Professor in the History of Mankind. His Assignments were a nightmare and impossible to solve on your own and his final was more challenging then expected.
Very unfair professor. His exams consist mostly of questions you have never seen before. Way harder then the Assignment problems. I suggest that he start giving more fair exams.
Extremely unfair prof. He really does not care about students. His exam was so hard.
Definitely the worst prof ever.
He would put me to sleep in Winter 2005. Early Morning Nap Time was his Lecture. Very Hard Multiple Choice Tests

He was really the worst professor you can possibly imagine. His take home final was impossible and very hard. He acts very cool but he is veryyyy uncool. He doesnot like giving good marks to students.
This prof is really really stale. His lectures should be flushed. They are so stinky!!!
After the first lecture itself I realized he was going to be a terrible prof.
He is the most unfair and unreasonable prof I have ever had. Stay away from him if you are a grad student.
Boring Beyond Words

He was terrible when I took his course in Winter 2005. He took forever to answer emails and sometimes he simply would not bother replying. He is rude arrogant and tries to be nice in front of the class. He is overall terrible. You should take a course taught by him if you want to be turned off the subject material for good. Thumbs down for Hoppe.
Prepared me well for grad courses.  Tough course but fair marking and Dr. Hoppe is great in office hours.

I had this professor for Stats 4E03 last year and his take home final was the hardest thing you can imagine. He really does not want to see students do well, that's why he messes them up in the end. Avoid this prof. His voice will put you to sleep and he uses overheads way too much, which nobody likes really. Very boring and tough instructor. BAD!!
Freddy was really boring for first year stats
HE IS A REALLY TOUGH PROFESSOR

First of all, he is the worst stats prof ever due to his incredibly dull and boring lectures. Secondly he is really tough. He told in class that exams are not supposed to be a war between students and profs, but he lied. He gave a really hard final because the class average was very high in the term and he wanted to lower it. Terrible prof. Avoid!!
I had him for brownian motion and found him to be extremely boring. His lectures will put you to sleep. His Assignments were so tough!!!
He's fair and accommodating.  Explains concepts well.  Not really a hard course if you do the work.
He was so terrible for that course when I had him about 4 years ago. Just couldn't stand him. Most boring prof ever. And to make worse, his tests were hard too!!
Worst Prof Ever. His lectures are soooooooo booorrrinng and he gives impossibly hard assignments that will surely make your head hurt. I dont recommend this prof or his courses to anyone.
He needs to give more reasonable assignments!
Assignments were very hard
AmazING prof

Dr.Hoppe is a bit tough, but he is a very fair professor. Dont get freaked out if you find out you don't know how to do the first couple Assignments in the course. He really cares about his students and their grades and will do everything he can to make sure people who are trying their best get good grades. He has good intentions for his class.
VERY BORING and VERY HARD prof. No kidding. DONOT take his course. You will regret it. His exams are most unfair ever. Avoid him.
Excellent professor.  Tests were marked fairly.

Damn, he was an alright prof. Considering a lot of the inclass notes were not based on his tests. Everything was good until the exam... It consisted of stats questions from other courses (being sarcastic, but thats what it seemed like). SO many people did bad on that exam..... And its not like he bell curved at the end
High fives all the way.  Great prof.  Fair.
fair!  (and that doesn't happen often)
A really great professor. DO NOT TAKE 4E03 BEFORE 3U03 or 4D03. 4E03 is MUCH harder than 2D03. He is a fair professor. Just come to class and do the work. Tests are based on homework questions.
Fairly clear and very engaging. He honestly cares about his students and is very fair about grades and scheduling. Stats would have bored me to death without him!
I agree.  The course was easy even with a lot of work but the tests and exams were fair and just like the practice ones.  I got an A+ and would take a course again with Dr. Hoppe.
Great all round.

Dr. Hoppe is fair and excellent kindly professor.  This is not course for sissies because he covers lot of material but puts notes online and gives practice tests.  Just do problems and you'll get A because tests and exam are fair and based on the lectures. He uses good examples from newspapers.  He knows stats.

stutters and takes too long to explain a simple concept. Just stands up there and scribbles on overhead sheets. pre-printed notes are unclear and he doenst explain the things you need to know. Tests were hard but final exam was easy. I stopped going to his class after a few weeks and still managed to do well

Dr. Hoppe is hands down the best prof I have had in first year. He has a heart made of gold. He is kind, caring, fair, and genuinely cares about his students. I hope to have him for some more courses in upper years. Thumbs up for this guy.

Amazing prof!!! He gave everyone 3 free marks on the second test. Has lot of concern for students. I've never seen such a generous prof before. Will do everything he can to help you. EXTREMELY Helpful on the webct discussion forums.
bad prof all around.  doesnt answer emails promptly.  doesnt even send an email to say that he got your email.  so rude.  thinks hes a good prof which makes him an extra bad prof.

Such a great teacher and a great person. He is more forgiving and caring than most profs at McMaster. Understands life's pressures, treats students well. Let us drop our lowest midterm. Exams are not easy but fair. Lots to study in the course though. He's a very good man.
One of the most helpful profs ever
I cant blame him for how dull stats is! He tris very hard to make you interested in statistics! Although reading the book helps just as much as attending the lectures.
Hoppe is a pretty cool prof, tries to make it interesting, its not his fault he likes statistics...but dude this guy gets paid maddd money!
great guy
The labs take too long to do.  Lectures are fun though.  He interacts with the class.
It's a good course, but I don't understand the need for excel assignments (and they are only worth 10 percent) yet so much work!! Course would be a lot more enjoyable without the boring labs!
Uses good examples.   Genuinely interested in the subject and tries to make it interesting.
Good teacher.
Excellent class.  Tries hard to explain theoretical concepts with concrete examples.  Very approachable.
very clear and patient.
Really helpful prof

Hoppe is an okay proff, even though his lectures can get increadible boring.  However it is his personality that discusts me.  Trys to be friendly but in person he is a complete jerk. I have absolutly no respect for the man.  but go figure he is a statistion and not a real mathmatition anyways.
Nice guy, but incredibly boring. I went to class to sleep. The first 2 tests were easy as pie, the exam was a lot harder than expected. GL.
cant understand what this man is trying to say. can ace class by not going to class and doing his online examples and old online exams. same exact ones are on midterm and final.
Graphs and graphs and sometimes explanations. Understood nothing. Grade went up 20% when I stopped going to class and learned from book only. Is a prof for research, not for teaching.

I still don't understand the purpose of the course. Hoppes seemed like a nice guy, based on the 10 lectures I attended. I learned one thing: you can waste a lot of paper printing his lecture notes, and end up MORE confused than when you started.
never really understood him or what he was trying to teach. like the fact that if your exam mark is better than a midterm, the midterm doesn't count and the exam is worth more. i hate stats.
No Comments
He let us drop a midterm if the exam mark was better...I went up like 20% because of that!!! :-)
All the material is online which is great if you don't feel like going to class.  Prof is witty at times and is fair with marks and exams.   Answers questions on WebCT too.
Sleep inducing class. Seems like a nice enough man. Class in general is terrible. I've never seen attendance drop so fast in my entire life.

says thing implies you are stupid because he gradurated in Princton,and says"do U have more questions to ask me?"make sure U don't want to see him again.Keep a coat in his lecture,room temperature drops when he walks in ,so 90%empty seats ar
In one class some kid answered a question, and he let the kid take his mike and teach the class from the front...even better was when Dr. Hoppe sat in the kid's seat while this was goin on
He gave the best of four wasy to calculate the final mark and raised the final exam.   One of my only profs to tell noisy students to be quiet.
good prof
I had him last year, and he was amazing. Everybody should stop cutting him up, because Dr.Hoppe is the man
I didn't ever want to take another stats class for fear i might get Dr. Hoppe again. I went to speak to him during his office hours and he was rude and mean. You need to work on your people skills.
One of the most brilliant professors I have ever had...classes are a little boring but still, a great class and professor!
Basically a good class.
A boring, boring man.  When he pulls out a coin, take out your pillow.  Don't be shy there are plenty of empty seats to stretch out in.
He sometimes is a bit unapproachable for questions, but overall teaches a good class and makes a fair exam...if you are in his class next semester you should be really happy

Professor is interested in the subject and tries to make the material relevant.  Goes very fast, that's my only complaint, but there is a lot of material to cover.  Web site is very useful.  I liked the practice tests and exams.
He is the best prof I have had at Mac.  I loved his probability examples

Looks like Mario, but a very boring prof to listen to.  Tests are moderately difficult but can be tricky if you do not know the concepts well.  Though he is fair in weighting of marks and will adjust your final grade from two or three options.
Hoppe rocks
Excellent prof.  Tough though.  Gives no credit for assignments that are only a little late.  Great web site.
where do i start??!! Rude, arrogant, boring, unhelpful, unclear...and the list goes on...i LOOOOVE Mcmaster but he's the only prof whose class i loathed!!
Some first year students are the rude ones.  They don't appreciate quality instruction and don't like the work expected.
He is rude and arrogant. A know-it-all yet he doesn't help students.
Very rude Proff. Unapproachable and quite insulting to students. Gives mcmaster a bad name. Yuck!
Condescending man....
Take out your pillow when he takes out a coin. Don't be shy, there are plenty of empty seats.
he looks like super mario
No Comments
No Comments
Tries to make stats fun.
weird man - doesn't understand that most of us don't find statistics  awesome
Enthusiasm made lectures interesting
makes things 1000x more confusing than they really are, easy tests though
He seems to make things more confusing than they really are.
Great class but lots of work
Harder than I thought.  Too much work!
No Comments
easiest course in the world and yet he still confuses the daylights out of you
No Comments

He is a cute guy, but supperfast, the course is tough.

comments: Dr. Kehler's class was very disorganized, marked with high expectations, and given very little in terms of a proper outline for assignments and the final exam. Lectures were extremely dry and boring and so were the readings. I would not take her class again

I would like to reiterate that Dr. Kehler's chaotic lecture do not define her as a person -- she's very nice, approachable, and insightful.  Although she is quite intelligent, her classes just aren't worth it.  She can ramble on for hours, you need a dictionary to understand her, and her grading criteria is not clear at all.  Would not recommend.

Quite possibly the worst professor I've come across in 3 years at McMaster. Her lecturing is enthusiastic but is so off-topic and all over the place that it's hard to get much out of it. She isn't the slightest bit flexible for accommodations (even SAS ones) and isn't clear about expectations for assignments. Avoid this class with Dr. Kehler.

Dr. Kehler is very passionate about broadening learning horizons. She encourages students to think for themselves. Her lectures are both engaging and theory-heavy. While I didn't get all the theories, I worked at it and she saw my efforts. I appreciated that in such a large class. She is brilliant, kind, generous. Her daily apparel was fun to see!

Amazing woman who is very nice and so passionate and knowledgable in her field, but her lectures are very hard to follow. Uses confusing language. I was better off looking up summaries of texts online. Hard exam.
Hardest marker. Rambles on in lectures. Difficult to follow.

Professor Kehler is an inspirational woman. She is so incredibly insightful and kind. She incorporates ideas of compassion  and care for humanity in all of her lectures and invites her students to reflect upon themselves in these ways. If you take nothing away from the course material you will still be left with a consciousness for compassion.

If I could take every class with Dr. Kehler, I would. She is without a doubt my favourite prof at Mac. She takes the time to get to know you, even in a larger class, and is always up to talk, inside and outside of class time.  She seems to click with every TA she works with, which helps a lot. Oh, and it was fun to see what she'd wear every day
Excellent teacher who cares about the material she teaches as well as her students.
She knows her stuff! Sometimes her language is way too intense for a second year course but she seems very friendly!

Amazing professor! She is adorable - incredibly passionate. Her ideas were very engaging and thought provoking. I absolutely loved the course. Only issue I had with the course was the amount of MC on the final exam. Alas, a very energetic, informed, and sweet professor - great material chosen for the course.

Exceptionally compassionate and engaged in her lectures, lives and breathes her subject...sometimes more than you will enjoy.  Overall, a very effective and personable professor and I would recommend taking a class offered by her.
TERRIBLEEEEEE!!!!
Absolutely the worst prof ever! Not helpful! Not considerate! Not available! Not fair! She NEEDS to be FIRED!!!

Beyond comprehensible at times. Talks too face and too much, throwing in huge words right and left. The marking scheme is the worst for this course. While it is interesting, almost impossible to get an A.

One of the best professors I have had at McMaster.  Very familiar with the material and makes it interesting.  Cares about students and has stopped me outside of the classroom numerous times to ask me how I'm doing.  Has the ability to remain energetic even during a night class. Highly recommended!
Knows her stuff, sometimes hard to keep up to her manic thinking, but very helpful and approachable.
She was extremely energetic!  Sometimes she got way to philosophical, but she realizes it usually and will clarify during the next class!
Great prof.  Very interested in students and the material.
Her enthusiasm, energy and passion is incredible.  A wonderful prof.

Very helpful, kind, and always has time for students.  She even remembers student's names from old courses!  Not an easy marker.  Lectures are fun and energetic - especially on Friday afternoons when you need extra energy. Great prof!
Hip, Hyper and Helpful! Dr. Kehler's great; she gives 'caffeinated' a new image!
No Comments
No Comments
The course sucked!!!  In fact English sucks!
My favourite English teacher by far - Dr. Kehler is outstanding.

comments: I took multiple courses with Prof Macdonald and although it took a full semester to get used to his teaching style I appreciated it for my next courses with him. He is thorough, approachable, interested in the material, and always willing to let students redo assignments, he wants to see everyone succeed. I would definitely take his courses again.
Great professor. Always available for questions and very helpful. Just study and prepare for tests and you will do fine.
None
assignment are extremely hard!

This course shouldn't be too hard but Peter makes it challenging. Spends too much time talking about irrelevant topics, spends months teaching "R" and then doesn't test it on the final. This feels like one of those courses where the profs made old and not going to change his way, and you just have to hope he'll retire before you make it there!
a very nice person. a very helpful prof.
thanks for being so nice and easy to us this semester.
exactly, the exam was easy!!!!!
The exam was SO easy!!

His classes are not easy, however it's extremely unfair to say that Dr Macdonald is a bad prof because whenever you need help, he's always there for you and very approachable! He geniusly cares about every of his students. I don't know what else you could expect from a prof?!
I find him to be a really easy and great professor. Probably the easiest prof on campus.

I dont know about other courses but for this course Dr. MacDonald is great. He is so easy. His Assignments are a breeze and I hope the tests will be easy as well. Great prof. Very Personable and Kind teacher.

Completely deviates from required course content in order to plug the software "R". Uses old syllabus and assignments from completely different courses because he is too lazy to teach new content tailored to each course. Very unhelpful. Notes are terrible. Assignments and tests are ridiculous. Shouldn't be allowed to teach or run a course again.
He's very nice and helpful!!
Excellent professor.  Dr Macdonald is very accommodating to meeting with students for help and appears to want the students to do well.

This prof is very tough! I feel sorry for the stats 3Y03 students because that course was very easy till few years back, but he's teaching it next year and he's going to torture them with R language and his brutal exams. Very sad that this prof is still around. I give him 3 for helpfulness because he does answer all emails promptly!

He loves the R language and most students hate it!! Any course with him will be your nightmare. Stay away from this prof if possible. He has good intentions "means well" but his class is hell on earth.

He is a great guy but he expects way too much from undergrad students. He was soo much harder then Dr.Feng. Unless you are really up for a challenge I dont recommend anybody to take his class. R Assignments sucked big time. Otherwise a good prof.
Awesome, One of the best looking profs ever. A pleasure to learn from him. He is the smartest stats prof at MAC
Dont take thsi prof's class otherwise you will go through a lot of pain and you will regret it. He is tough as nails. You have been warned. Proceed with caution before registering in his course.

Worst professor EVERRRRRr If you want a semester of hell and stress, take a course with him. What's the use of being a "nICE GUY" when he kills you on All assignments and exams. DONOT take any course with this man or you will deeply regret it. Wish Dr. Feng taught stats 3DD3, he was so great for stats 3D03. Peter will make u hate stats forever

VERY VERY VERY VERY TOUGH PROFESSOR. The Assignments are done using R and they are ridiculously difficult. He is way harder than any other stats prof ever. He is a nice person always responds to emails quickly and in detail, seems to care about students interests, but a tough prof. He likes using computers. His exams are all open book. Go figure!

ridiculous prof there's no damn R on tests why do we spend so long on it? i'm in engg buddy i dont have time to learn crap i wont ever use! honestly i learned more stats in my gr 12 data class than i did here. there's no flow to the notes, you dont even know wat you're learning half the time. you can't teach man..so maybe you should "do" instead
Stasts for Chem eng.  This guy is a joke...He has a huge ego..."Those can't do, teach" That's what I think of him (garbage).

I have no clue what I learned in this course. It was really easy to get a good mark in the course if you busted your butt studying for the exam though.He is a nice guy, but he asks too much of us, and he covers material rapidly.
very unorganized. you learn from slides he wrote in previous years for other classes <- that is not teaching in my opinion. the program "R" is a nightmare
nice person, but not a good teacher
Nice guy, but tough professor

Where do I start.  A very nice man, always willing to help and very responsive via email, phone, whatever.  However, he's a very bad teacher.  Also, you have no idea where you are in text, ever.  This course is making me switch from stats to app. math.
tough
Good course and kind professor.
He tries his best but he couldn't teach a fish how to swim.  Ridiculous assignments, always lectures overtime.  He's the epitome of "the road to hell is paved with good intentions."
Nice person, lacking organizational skills. He cares about students
Very approachable...ALWAYS reply emails right away! (Unlike other profs!)
hes not bad cares about students very practical
Most responsive Prof. ever.  Always available
No Comments
He's a nice professor, he gives kindly help.
i thought he was an awesome teacher - he is the inspiration for my love of stats
No Comments
Unless it's required DO NOT take the course.  Text is only redeeming quality.
Doesn't teach what's required for students to know inorder to pursue grad. study

comments: She is very helpful and she cares about her students. I would love to take her class again :-)
HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. is not clear and concise. confuses herself, never listens to any feedback. She has no idea what she's saying half the time.

She contradicts herself on what she said during the lectures. She is very confusing and more than often mispronounces words that you need to know for the testable materials. When answering questions, she confuses herself and doesn't really give a clear answer. Talks very fast and doesn't know what a bell curve is. Also writes poorly worded tests.

I had Zhu for second year genetics and died. She talks so fast, and I found myself struggling to keep up with her lectures. One midterm was 75 multiple choice and 15 marks worth of short answer and calculations in ONE HOUR. She asked us what we thought of the tests and she never listened to the class or took our feedback about ANYTHING.
You will do fine if you go to lectures, review the material and go to office hour/ email her your questions. She is not as bad as the review says.

Very hard to follow lectures, often confuses herself in the process of answering questions. Stopped going to lectures a long time ago, easier to follow the textbook. Exams are poorly written and ambiguous, despite being non-cumulative- and also account for 75%+ of your grade.
Her lectures were incredibly difficult to follow - I eventually stopped going to class and taught myself the material. Her tests are strangely worded and honestly more difficult than they should be.
Lectures don't really make any sense. Tests are hard to understand and to answer.
Terrible and condescending.

Lectures were unengaging and she wrote an insanely difficult final exam (poorly worded questions). Her notes were NOT enough to do well in the course. On top of that, she provided practically ZERO practice problemsreadings, and she expected us to apply what we learned on the final exam based on lecture notes only - ridiculous.

For Bio 1A03, lectures weren't particularly interesting but exam questions were fair. I found her more engaging in Mol Bio 3II3 - she encouraged participation and would walk around after the tests to ask how we found it. Lots of memorization, but she makes it clear what she expects us to know. She also held review sessions, which were very helpful
Had a amazing professor for the first half of the course which made getting her all the worse. Difficult to understand. Boring lectures. Confusing notes. Least favorite professor so far.
She's really intelligent and knows what she's talking about but honestly, no one else does. The textbook is your best friend when she starts teaching
Did not teach would just read slides. Tests were poorly written and tested obscure content.
AMAZING PROF! Given the heavy content I wouldn't blame any prof! Really nice and helpful!

Literally one of the worst professors/teachers I have ever had, don't bother going to lectures, puts slides with 5 paragraphs of text and says know all this, then changes slides 5 seconds later. Just teach yourself from the textbook. Good luck.

She knows her stuff but manages to make classes brutally boring, although I do give her credit seeing as the content isn't light. No matter, this does not excuse the fact that she is incredibly rude, even when you go to see her for help as she constantly suggests. She is too arrogant to be teaching, should remain solely in research.

I don't understand all the hate she receives. She's a great prof. In her office hours, she is SUPER helpful and can explain things super clear. People in lecture are rude, walking out in the middle, talking when she's trying to teach. I found her to be a good prof, she knew her stuff. And her notes are really good, you don't need to use the book.

I can understand Dr Zhu in terms of her speaking the words, but she isn't an engaging prof. She seemed unprepared for classes - slides out of order, just repeated herself when asked a question and she read in monotone directly from the slides/txtbook. Thankfully the txtbook was excellent for this course.
It's really hard to understand her.
Very unique prof. Doesn't just spew knowledge at a rate independent of how well students understand. She tries to convince you. She stops class if she thinks you're confused. Great prof.

Great prof. Lecture slides were basically from the textbook, really clear. In lecture, she may have been difficult to understand, but at office hours, she was so helpful. She really knows her stuff and people don't give her enough credit. Loved her!
Very difficult to understand as well. I wish she had done more than just read information from the slides.

I dont understand where the dislike towards Zhu comes from. Her slides are very complete and she goes over everything in detail. Regarding her inability to answer questions, this is completely false, every question i have had she has answered without hesitation or rudeness.

Once Zhu took over for Kajuira the attendance rates went down. SHe just reads off the slides and no matter how hard you pay attention, you just can't. Study from the slides she posts online and don't go to class, spend that 50 minutes sleeping or studying her slides

Worst professor out of all my first year classes. She rambles on about stuff and cannot explain even the simplest of concepts. About half the class doesn't show up to lectures anymore. The ones that do, some of them leave early, and the rest are just on their phones or talking the whole time. SHE CANNOT TEACH and she doesn't understand the material

She is such a horrible teacher. I thought she was nice at first, until I went and ask her questions in person. She was super mean,asking me if I attend to the class. Dude, I did but I couldn't understand, so that's why I am here! And her wording is poor. How the heck she got her PhD degree.

if you want to learn about: chromtin, peefifthee, moanomers, rejurts, shupernatants, turd chromtin, and teeeeelomeres this is the class for you. best part of the class is when the egg timer went off.beep beep beep beep.

This is one of the worst profs I've had at the University. The class was allright until the BRUTAL final exam.. where nobody knew where she got the questions from... Her English is TERRIBLE and she just pretty much reads from the slides.

She seems nice at first, but I approached her to speak to her about a question on my test, and she said that she doesn't care about the students as long as the class average is acceptable to the registrar, so I don't recommend this course for anyone who doesn't need it.  It's too bad, I heard this used to be a great class.

Never take this course with her if you don't have to.  She willingly admits that she made a mistake in the marking of her tests, but she was unwilling to do anything about it, she is unapproachable, and when students ask questions, she is condescending and most of the time she can't even remember the material herself that she expects us to remember

She's by far the worst professor I've had. She cannot teach, and not only that, her tests were ridiculously absurd and hard. The "desgin an experiment" questions were hard, and we were being tested on stuff that were extracted from the paper by ourselves, NOT on what she taught us. And she loves immunopercipitation, almost every paper had it.

This prof made tests that were basically impossible. She makes you design experiments for things she barely mentioned in class and never once explains how to actually design an experiment. She also makes one-word overheads with tons of pictures that aren't explained at all and makes you read 800 journal articles just to semi-figure them out.

One of my worst prof's at this university.  Her tests are brutal and ambiguous, then to make things worse, she arbitrarily assigns marks to questions because nobody got the right answer.  However these alterations help some of the class, while the rest of the class got screwed.  This could have been a good class if she wasn't teaching it.

Definitely the worst prof I have ever had. Does not teach well and her tests leave out things talked about for multiple classes but include questions from slides we barely looked at. Lectures are not presented logically and had I not taken microbial genetics and cellular biochem I would have done terribly. Used to be a good course, she ruined it.

Terrible prof - she called the whole class stupid.  Formal complaints were lodged with the chair of the department.  Also, she dressed like a hotdog all the time.  Overall, she was the worst prof I have ever had.
No Comments

Consider yourself incredibly lucky if you have the chance to learn from Dr. Baetz. If you listen carefully and seek him out, you will learn and gain much much more than what the course is about. He is a truly wonderful person, who is wise beyond words. He has been one of the most influential people in my life, and I am among many.
Best professor I have had, actually makes you want to go to class. Great person and takes the time to get to know everyone in his class.
Baetz is awesome. That's all I have to say. Haven't had him for an academic-type course, though.
He is the best person I have ever met! He can be your friend, your prof, he has all my respect.
Bets person ever, not just best prof.
Amazing Professor. Teaches you like a friend, but allows you to learn what's important by direction.

great guy, and what a nice piece of ass!!
A GREAT prof... knows everyone by name, where theyre from and what they like to do in their spare time. You could still run into him once the course is done and he'd know who you were!
Dr. Baetz is a fabulous prof.  Very sure of his subject matter which enables him to answer all kinds of questions.  Very fun but also commands respect, great combination!
A true Society prof.  He's the real deal.
clear easy to understand. still his tests are pretty hard :(
Hands down the best at mac
Baetz is the best prof i've had all year!
Great!!!!
Awesome professor, you'll actually want to go to class.
Good prof, awesome guy.
nice guy, helpful, easy to understand..
props to my homie baetz!
Best Prof at Mac!
yeeeah dr baetz

comments: Dr. Alama is the definition of what it means to be a great Math professor! He uses great humour in his lectures while giving crystal clear explanations on tough concepts. His notes are done in such good detail you will never touch the textbook unless you're doing practice problems. To succeed do all the practice problems and go to lecture.
Great prof! had him for 1x03 so funny.

He's a good prof. I wouldn't say amazing, but still pretty good. It's pretty easy to get at least a B in this course. If you want that A+ you better work for it. Assignments were very generously marked. Assignments require some extra thinking and are meant to PUSH you. Accept that push to improve otherwise you will get DRAGGED.
Best prof ever Lots of work to do.

"Stan the man!" If he is teaching Real Analysis II, definitely take it. His lectures are very clear and the notes are thorough. His tests are extremely fair and graded kindly. If you're stuck on a concept make use of his office hours, he'll walk you through and elucidate everything!
Best prof in the world! I <3 you Stana Llama.
Best prof ever!! He wants his students to do well. HIs tests/exams are fair.

Great prof, got an easy 12. I wish he was teaching my other math courses as well. His notes are soo descriptive (though tiring to write), that u dont have to use the textbook at all except to do homework problems. Make sure u take it with him, and also he has 2-3 grading schemes and u can easily get a 12 even if u mess up one of the tests.
Best professor ever!!!!!! He is always willing to help, tests are fair, and he makes lectures entertaining. LOVE HIM!
Awesome prof!! dont miss the chance of having a class with him
A hilarious guy and easy to understand/learn from in lecture. Haven't had a better math teacher at Mac so far.
Very good, clear, fun, and explains topics really well

This class was easy, and not pointless, if you think that, you just didn't understand the material and shouldn't be there. In one example he did, you have to solve your equation with the line y=x, and people were lost. That's sad, thats something you learn in highschool. Hes won the best prof award @Mac, and deserves to win it more times.

Dr. Alama is a very fair prof, If you don't think his class is fair, you are not trying or going to class. I found this class challenging, but he never gives you tests which you can't do. If you're having trouble GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS, he wants you to do well. Don't blame him hes fair, for higher level classes they're abstract, and should be tough

I've read some of the comments and Dr. Alama is one of the best prof's ever. He honestly wants you to do well. His midterms/exams are completely fair, the course itself is a hard topic but he does an excellent job of teaching it you just have to put in the effort. DO THE PRACTICE WORK HE ASSIGNS!
Amazing in every sense of the word. An asset to the math department.

Most over-rated prof ever. His exams were hard and unfair. I dont recommend this nuisance course MATH 3DC3 to anybody. You will just be wasting your time. The non-sense you learn in this course is not applicable to real life, and it is a really difficult course. The final exam was much harder then the tests. Alama is a boring prof. OVER-RATED PROF
Very bad professor. He did not even ask questions on the final exam from the easy part of the course (the last part) he only asked questions from the tough part. Very brutal for a useless course.

Dr. Alama is an excellent professor. His lecture style is informal and friendly. Material is very well presented and is as clear as real analysis could possibly be made. Office hours are packed yet he continues to explain without the slightest hint of annoyance... very valuable course if you are serious about math.
He is definitely harder then Professor Lovric. More tougher tests
Dr. Alama please make the tests easier OK ?

HE was my favourite prof. Our final exam was held IN A CLASSROOM (!!!!) Just make sure you sit besides someone smart. Very easy to ace the exam due to the fact that, it's held in the regular classroom everyone writing the same version ;) :)
No Comments
Great Prof! He's so funny but no one laughs in class... I appreciate the humour/quirkiness though. Very helpful and the tests are fair :)

I think McMaster gives teaching awards to profs who just write notes on the black board most of the time without making much eye contact or explaining enough. He needs to type up those notes and put it on his website, or a courseware and actually focus on explaining stuff more. I was not very pleased with my experience in his class.
No Comments
He was great. He holds the final exam IN A CLASSROOM of Hamilton Hall. It was so easy to cheat because everyone sits next to each other on the final exam. I knew nothing still I aced the exam
Nice guy but tests and final are hard

People claiming his Analysis tests are 'too hard,' that's what abstract math is. Real Analysis is a hard subject for 90% of people. Alama explains things to crystal clarity, and he often repeats the necessary definitions prior to proving a concept. If anyone got a bad mark in 3A, it's not Alama's fault...It's Real Analysis's fault for being tricky.

He is very over-rated. He just writes on the board most of the time. A lot of people find that their hand starts hurting after his lecture. Why can't he just type that stuff up and put the slides on the website. His teaching is not great and his tests/exams are unreasonbly difficult. He is not an easy marker either but he's better then Lia bronsard
Your real Analysis tests were very hard!!!
Stan Alama is a very tough prof. His tests are brutal
As a person he is very nice, but he writes tough finals.
He is my best prof
A+
Great prof. Exams are tough but the prof is good.

Honestly one of the best profs at mcmaster, 3A was not an easy course but his teaching is interesting and the assignments/tests were fair if you do the homework you'll do well. GO TO CLASS, he doesnt teach from the textbook, he often teaches things that are relavent to the textbook, he honestly wants you to do well, so ask if you need help!
Very helpful prof. and kind heart person. Always fair to students and more than happy to provide helpful.
MATH3DC3: Amazin proffessor, but the course is more difficult than I had expected. I thought it would be a recipe course, but it's not easy stuff.
He's one of the most awesome math professors at McMaster University!!
Well he did a good job. Very good prof. I cant say anything else except for the fact that I still hate Analysis.
Alama rules. 3A is a very hard course, however with Alama even though you might not get the best grade, you will learn. Lots.
Wonderful prof
Great prof

Great proff, incridable clear and found he made analysis one of the easier classes last semester how ever i am just slightly mad that we were told we could use our text second semester but we can't, there goes another 150!! excellent examples, clear proffs etc,good pacing, good blackboard skills

What a great math professor. The only person who has ever made Analysis easy to understand. Tests are fair and he is a very clear instructor. However, be prepared to be overcome with the desire to shave his mustache during class...I warned you!
Overall a good professor.
He is a very good professor, excellent teaching
Not bad... a little hard to understand because of the mumbling, and constant corny jokes.  Notes are very extensive (however helpful), but occasionally hard to read b/c writing is so small.
really good proff.  one the bests i had
Love the metaphors!  A bit too wordy to be a math prof. though.
good
awesome
excellent professor, very fair!
Well organized. suitable difficulty.
No Comments

comments: He mumbles a lot. My Korean friend speaks English better than Eilers. Also he is not organized at all. He does not even know his room number. I heard a lot of complains, not only from the students, but also from the TAs. The final exam was so easy though.

There are so many resources to do well in this class. Weekly quizzes, daily vocabulary quizzes, and post-chapter exercises means a lot of homework but also a lightly weighted final exam (there's no midterm). Dr. Eilers makes learning a whole new language almost easy. He's a super friendly and funny guy, one of the best profs I've ever had.
AMAZING lecturer, hilarious. If you need help from him, just ask and he will make the time for you. Makes Latin even more interesting than it already is.

Eilers was an excellent and fun prof- I was dreading classics, having taken it to fill up my course load, but he ended up making it somewhat interesting, I now read about classical antiquity for fun. His Elvis interlude is the stuff of undergrad legend. I'd say he's good overall, but that he does not suffer fools gladly.
Eilers is amazing. He really knows how to make the course fun.

BEST PROF EVER. I'm in life sciences and I took Latin as an elective; although everyone says Latin is the hardest language, Dr.Eilers makes it very interesting and easy to learn. As long as you do your homework constantly, you'll do great in the course

Very interesting course. Prof. Eilers is very enthusiastic and goes the extra mile to make it the best course possible. The only downside to this course is insane workload (this is intensive course, you have to work every day and memorize A LOT!). Keep that in mind if you are taking other tough courses.
Prof. Eilers is very smart and devoted professor. He is not the easiest, his course requires lot's of work but this is what all courses should be.           I have no regrets taking latin...

Eilers is amazing.  I hated to miss a lecture.  He must've changed since the other commenters had him, because he never once yelled and his lectures were always clear.  He made Latin fun -- and easier because I was having fun.  The Songs and the tangents about history and the evolution of the language were always a highlight.

One of the worst profs I've ever had. Yells at students who come in late/leave early, tho he did this himself very often. Makes fun of you for getting answers wrong. Mean, unapproachable, unhelpful, unprofessional and rude. Avoid like the plague. His lectures could be decent but he is so mean and unhelpful, the class is impossible.
Not exactly the best lecturer. Very easy class, though. Entertaining to hear him sing in latin

Hated this class.  I was in third year when I took it, which was a big mistake.  Moodle takes up too much time.  Made me feel really uncomfortable because he made fun of his students when they got answers wrong.  Not cool.  Elvis in Latin was pretty good though.
interesting

"Jesus?" Dr. Eilers is hilarious and a great prof. He will make fun of you if you come late to Latin, but he's very approachable. His Moodle exercises are intense, but he gives you a really solid foundation in Latin. As the Undergraduate Advisor, Eilers is AMAZING because he gets back to you really quickly and can get your into classes

Overall enjoyed him. He makes the information interesting and has a good sense of humour. Notes are difficult due to the fact that his slides do not use titles and he jumps between topics a lot. Definitely make sure to attend lectures since it is where most of the exam questions come from.
i LOVED this prof. he was hillarious, and taught in a way that made the material engaging. thumbs wayyy up! ;)

He is often off topic. He has a "no talking during lecture" rule. I got kicked out of class because the person beside me kicked my foot, they said sorry, and I said "that's okay". He yells at people for being late or leaving early, but he was late/left early twice a month. Tests/exams not difficult (if you can follow his lectures)
Dr. Eilers is one of the few profs I actually enjoyed this year. Funny, and keeps what is usually a boring topic entertaining. LOVE HIM!
Hilarious, needs to be more fluid with transition between material. Good Job!
Suuuppeerraabiimmmuusss
Lots of memorization, but really easy.
very helpful...and funny

Off topic all the time. Not interesting, stutters to the point its distracting. Hard midterms/exams. He did give us good essay topics with bibliographies. He never covers all the material. Slow, and boring class. Not approachable, very scary. His slides suck, they give you way to much info, and not enough of what’s important.
Amazing prof, i agree with the comments about the lectures, but his sense of humour makes up for it.  His exam wasn't bad at all.  When he says go to tutorial HE MEANS IT!

Funny prof, makes you want to not miss lectures (just to see what he'll do, hard marker though, and stutters really bad, a 10 mintue lecture takes 50 minutes. Slow paced class, so it's easy to get notes but you don't get alot of information
great jokes, makes learning engaging

Amazing, and enthusiastic professor!  Elvis in Latin by far, and hands down the best lecture!  Apparantly he plays the guitar too!  I say Encore!!  Great lectures, I always go early to his class early.  Awesome prof!!
Good job :)
The "Weimar Republic of gold stars", eh?
No Comments
One word: SEXY!!!!!
Seriously overrated. I found him very incoherent - I actually found myself missing Dr. George. Though intelligent, he often appears scattered. Excellent exam, though - very easy.
Absolutly one of the BEST profs I've EVER had.  SO freak'en funny!  And a really honestly nice guy.  I'd buy his book, but it's too expensive ^^;  I only wish he taught more classes!
Was scared after his guest lecture, but Eilers is cool. Go Leafs! His style of lecturing makes for great notes, and I never missed a class. Smart, funny guy who knows his history!
Knows his stuff inside and out.  Very funny if you get his special brand of humour.  Goes off on tangents, but most of the time they kind of relate.  A great course with a great exam.
No Comments
Best History class yet! Didn't miss a single lecture. Dr. Eilers rekindled my interest in ancient civilizations!!
Dr. Eilers is the best. Loved the Elvis, loved the exam questions about Jack Sparrow and Dire Straits. And if you read this Dr. Eilers, I'm sorry about your leafs.
Never thought I would ever see a Prof singing Elvis songs in Latin. Rock on Eilers! But don't quit your day job :)
Go Eilers Go!
He is a great prof.  His lectures are very enjoyable and filled with many jokes.  He has a tedency to go off on tangents.  But that doesn't matter because he just so great!
Funny prof!  His jokes are funny, when u get them...cause half the time he doesn't finish and makes u figure out the rest 4 u'r self!  But great prof!
Dr. Eilers is fun because of his jokes and the way he picks on the t.as. I was really scared of him when he did the guest lecture last term, but he's awesome.
I stumbled upon this after hearing Dr. Eilers had "googled himself" and I wondered what would come up. Eilers rocks!
Chris told me to fill this out and tell you that I love his pink shirt.  You're great...thanx

extremely helpful - I don't know about "easy" ratings - He makes the class easy because he makes it enjoyable - tends to go off on tangents but they are not totally unrelated.  Excellent professor and he obviously enjoys his profession and lectu
Eilers, you rock! My TA Chris Wallace told me to come on here and rate you. And I am not too sure why, but he said to say something about liking a pink shirt?! well anyways, good class!
My t.a. Chris told me to do this and also something about a pink shirt...great lectures!
Chris told me to do this, and he said something about a pink shirt. Great class though, and he shoots about a 50% on the jokes, which is better than most!
Chris made me do it, but I still think you're cool.
what a grrrrreat prof! i really enjoy how he lectures..it's very clear and easily understandable!
My TA Chris told me to do this. I like his pink shirt!
My TA Chris told me to do this.I also enjoy the class very much, and I even find the professor's jokes funny.
Entertaining, enthusiastic, and interacts with the students. The environment that Eilers creates is a comfortable and democratic one. For the first time I don't feel intimidated by a professor.

Overly sensitive to student opinion... which is different from the norm. Generous and open to questions, his class has a nice casual feel. The "eat muffin while talking" has gotta go, but the coffee can stay.Approachable, a man of the people.An
Cool guy, fun to listen to, definite pepper material.  Go Eilers, go!

He's really not boring. You can tell that he enjoys what he talks about and that in turn makes me interested in what he has to say.  I would be lost in this course if it weren't for his lectures so I try not to miss them.  A great prof!

An AWESOME Prof! A cool guy and really helpful... I now understand the past 13 years of school thanks to this guy! Keep up the good work!     (Hey Eilers, I hope this helps out your chili pepper situation.) ~MA~
He's very funny. Though he gets off topic alot, but that's oaky. I enjoy it very much so.
Love him! He is the best! He sang an Elvis song to the class, then got all of us to join in! What a great prof! I never skipped his lectures!
All I have to say is Latin Elvis! Amazing performance, worth taking the course just to see that! Awesome Prof!
Dr. Eilers is a joy to listen to. The one class I make sure to arrive early to
Needs to be a little more organized, but other than that, Uncle Claude is great!! Loved the class!
Nice guy, but really, really boring.
Lectures are enjoyable to listen to and interesting.  Only class i never skip
No Comments
Excellent prof! Very funny!
No Comments
awesome prof!  Very funny, and very clear lectures.
Knows a lot about ancient history and is willing to help out any way he can
no one can beat him!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

comments: There was an above average amount of reading for a 3rd year history class, but if you do it and you speak in his class you will be rewarded. His assignments can sometimes lack clarity but he is more than willing to discuss his expectations with you. He provides great research recommendations and feedback on prelim theses and on papers! Great class!

A super-friendly, older Canadian History professor with a speciality in religion, particularly different branches of Christianity. His courses had TONNES of reading, and a lot of books- not ideal, but the material was interesting. His grad seminars tend to be tiny, and foster close, positive relationships between participants. Easy grader.

He has fairly high standards for his inquiry class (to do well you need to do all the readings, attend class and actually participate) but I quite appreciated that since I felt like I learned a fair bit. There was A LOT of weekly readings, and almost all were only available on reserve at the library, which was annoying but it did reduce costs

He is a really nice man and a very fair grader. He's also more than willing to help outside of classroom hours. My only complaint is the number of text books that had to be purchased especially since a couple were hardly used.
One of the best profs I've had at Mac! Very knowledgeable, and approachable. I'm definitely taking more classes that he teaches.

He knows his stuff, and is passionate about discussing with students. When he gives vague feedback it is because he doesn't mark for specifics....just truly know something, and he'll mark you for it. Exams are literally your tutorial questions reworded. Luv him, and i've had him for two classes.
ZZZZZZZZZ.....
Worst prof ever !!!

Dr Gauvreau is a very knowledgable/approachable professor.  I do not share the sentiments of the people below(although lectures can be dry). He is fair on exams, and I thought the large chunk of % donated to tutorial to be an easy way to boost your grade.
No Comments
His single piece of advice for the final exam was to ... "know something" very insightful sherlock

Just buy and read the text book. If you have a question, don't ask. He won't answer, if he does, you'll wish he had not! He's not too bad for upper year seminars. (If you like the history of wierd religious fractioning).
If you feel like paying a large sum of money to teach yourself Canadian History go right ahead and take this course. DO NOT expect the courseware or the text book to be much help either.
Read the other comments!

i wish someone had warned me of this guy, i'd've taken it in the summer with a different professor. he seems like a very nice man with very good intentions to make the class entertaining but his lectures are long and boring.
Brutal. Boring lectures and very unfriendly.

This guy wasn't a great one. I wanted to poke myself in the eyes during his lectures. Bring a magazine to read while your in there. History really is alot better than this guy will make you think. Don't give up on it yet!
avoid like the plague! overheads written while he was driving, the worst!
really bad overheads, horrible weekly assignments, not friendly, boring
Talks way to quickly, like he is reading an essay.
Crappy overheards, talks to fast, doesn't live up to his promises on assignments
No Comments
Monotone, notes are hieroglyphics, no lecturing skill whatsoever, avoid if u can
