comments: Worst prof ever. Do no take a class with her. I have never posted a mean review of a professor until now. The previous reviews explain most of the student's frustration with her and her classes so I don't need to reiterate them. I graduated from McMaster over a year ago, and I still regret taking a course with her.

Took her class years ago, thought of her today. Still remember her as the worst prof I've  encountered in my short life. Ruined my experience at Mac. I found her rude, uncaring, unapproachable, closed to new ideas, and not that bright. If she likes you and your ideas, you'll be fine, so get on her good side.  What drives people to act like this???

Where to begin, Fast is a disaster!! Very rude, sassy, unapproachable, never willing to help, and just overall a terrible person. She needs some attitude adjustment courses to help her out. Even participating in class was intimidating because she would just brush you off.  SAVE YOURSELF DO NOT TAKE A COURSE WITH HER!!
Awful professor. Terrible lecturer - all over the place. She also lied to an entire class and TA's about the final exam. Good TA's and easy assignments but Fast is garbage

I didn't find her too approachable but her lectures were pretty interesting albeit very long. Textbook was absolutely necessary and tests were pretty confusing 'cause she's a big fan of the A and C, A and B, none of the above, etc. format. The listening lab was EXTREMELY helpful. If you had any confusions, def. go to those.
No comment. terrible course terrible prof.
Took this class as an elective. Regretted big time. If you don't agree with her you are wrong. If you plan on taking this class don't!! She ruined my semester
Terrible professor. Does not care about student's well being. She should not be allowed to teach period.
Worst class ever. Don't take with Dr. Fast, she is extremely rude and her multiple choice questions are the worst I've ever seen.

Literally the worst mistake I have ever made. Taken as an elective and failed due to her inability to just make tests how they should be and not a test to see who knows the best mix between answers A and B, B and C, C and A or all the above. If she wants to be taken seriously maybe she shouldn't TRY to make material harder than it really is.

Class is in the evenings,  but midterms on Saturday mornings for some reason. Tests are meant to be tricky,  confusing  multiple choice. Almost every question has all of the above, none of the above, a&c only or b&c only. Studying general concepts won't get you anywhere because the midterm questions are extremely specific. Textbook necessary.
This prof has no idea what she's talking about and she does not provide good testing material of the content. RUN

Tests do not reflect the class material. Additionally, nearly every multiple choice question on midterms have options  such as, A and B, none of the above, A and C etc, you get the point. This makes it nearly impossible to prepare for unless  you possess an abundance of external knowledge and time. Overall I would not recommend this course.

Literally spends 30 minutes talking about things completely irrelevant to the course during a 3 hour night class. Midterms are a poor reflection of course material and preparation she says needed. Would not recommend taking this course as an elective.

i think she tries to stimulate discussion and ideas but i didn't find her knowledgeable or smart. after reading her academic work, can't say i'm too impressed. i'm somewhat disappointed to have had her as a prof. the class readings were great tough.

Generally material is presented well and follows the textbook pretty closely (One of the articles in the book is written by Fast). However, Fast herself isn't very approachable, MC questions are purposely misleading, and prof isn't very accommodating at all.

Took this class for an easy elective and ended up dropping it after the midterm. Fast teaches the class thinking that everyone has a prior knowledge of the elements of music. I was consistently confused in lectures. There were constant technical difficulties which cut into class time and lecture. Avoid unless you know music.
No comments..

I took pop music with Dr Fast last winter and sadly it was one of the bigger disappointments of my three years at mac. she seems like she tries really hard to make a functional class but things are always disorganized and you never get your test marks back until the last minute. you also need to study the textbook thoroughly to succeed on the tests

Pop Music post WWII: Dr. Fast chooses excellent topics for discussion during lectures, but she's boring. As a music major, I find the terminology simple. I think the communications students will say the same. There needs to be an essay in the course. I like a challenge and Dr. Fast does not present one. I will not take another course with her.
Loved the course. Dr. Fast makes the material engaging and fun, and is also always available to lend a helping hand. One of my favorite profs of my university career.

I did very well in the course.  Still, I can't believe she's allowed to teach.  Each of the reviews who said you have to agree with her to do well - she doesn't get what it means to be a teacher at all.  The course is easy if you spit back out exactly what she says.  Approachable outside of class, but hostile to opposing ideas in class.

This was my favourite class of the year. The content was amazing, and despite what people say, her lectures make the subjects MORE interesting. I have not wanted to skip class once all semester. Granted, the exams are hard, but fair, as I know people who got 90s and others who got grades in the 60s.

It's really no wonder this course is so popular! Dr Fast makes the material interesting, engaging, and thought-provoking. Yes, this means she will ACTUALLY make you THINK, so if that's a problem just DON'T TAKE THE COURSE. Dr Fast is smart, sharp, and brings cultural context into her classes. Overall, highly recommended!

really cares about what she's teaching. studied countercultures through themselves, rather then from a textbook view. her multiple choice is impossible though, and despite how much i loved the class i felt terrible leaving my hands in the fate of impossibly worded m/c options. kind of killed my grade, but i'd take it again.
fun, entertaining teacher. if you can take music 2II3, do it!the course material is great and pretty essential for any music lover.

What was she thinking!? I think Prof's need to be more self aware about their teaching abilities! I found this course EXTREMELY DIFFICULT! and I took it as an elective! Her mcq questions are outrageously difficult. She is also very rude in emails, and doesn't give you an actual answer. Very unorganized. Avoid this course if you can!!

Lectures were kind of boring, didn't really add any insight, and she spent WAY too much time on Led Zeppelin. The tests were ridiculously easy, though. If you have any kind of rudimentary knowledge about Pop Music, even reading the textbook while you're on the john is guarantee 90% +. A bit of perspective: I DID NOT study for the exam, and aced it.

terrible prof and class. waste of money. her lectures were all over the place and her tests had nothing to do with the lectures. skipped over many sections and concentrated on the areas she liked better...not recommended
She was pretty much the worst professor of my academic career. Sorry.
Kind of boring, tends to ramble

I had her for 1st year music history. She can be difficult - I learned exactly how to approach her. She actually taught me how one should type up their written  notes right after class ends & I would approach her if I had any queries in her office which she didn't mind at all (she would know someone was actually paying attention to her! ha ha!!)

i thought it was rediculous! your right, she didnt focus on the important things- you'd think there would be ONE question on zeppelin since theyre kind of INFLUENTIAL. i swear, shes not a feminist at heart, shes pretty much a **** at heart.

Her multiple chioce tests are ridiculous.  Way too specific - knowledge that didn't always encompass the grander picture, put focused on piddly stuff.  She's a feminist at heart.  Loved listening to all the music in class, but not by any means an easy course.  She isn't the most approachable.

she gave us a test on the saturday of thanksgiving and didn't make an effort to change it...not to mention how often she went of topic; we were suppose to get to up to the 90s according to her course outline...we barely made it out of the 70s...disorganized and condescending
Her lectures make no sense, she never finishes sentences. If your opinions aren't the same as hers, she won't give you the time of day.

she is a pretty fair woman but the tests are specific so make sure that you know the material. it helps to read the text and courseware, but lecture notes should be fine. if you study you can do well, don't think that its  a "bird course" or you'll be screwed over!

She is a feminist at heart... and if you are too take her classes because she will love you.  If your opinions, however, are not related to gender and sexuality then I would stay away from her because her response to your ideas will be "Interesting... moving on".  Oh and do not expect her to be fair

shes an awesome proff!Those who beg to differ were probably the ones who took this as a "bird course" and needed someone to blame when they werent doing well.Shes a great detailed lecturer,and although she does shhhh the class often,she is very passionate about the music, and her lectures prove this

I am very disappointed in fellow mac students. Its pretty ignorant to expect that music has no social or political meaning. You may have been pissed that the class wasnt easy, but you could still have an open mind about the social meaning of historical events and the things that various groups go th

You Guys REALLY didn't join the class to just look at the music at face value, did you? c'mon, really, this is uni, it's all about analyzing the influences that made the music we all love. and if you're sick of the "SHH"...then don't TALK during class about who you made out with during the weekend!

How does absolutely everything relate back to feminism and gender vs. sex?!!  I hope no one ever has to take this class with her. Get out while you still can. If your opinion doesn't = her opinion, you get low marks

This class is an easy class, but it will NOT boost your average.  Fast talks way too much, not enough listening to music so that you UNDERSTAND what shes saying.  Also, too much emphasis on politics....its hard though to teach a course like this, with so much potential info!
Lectures a little long, but interesting subject I guess... Yah, lectures= too much just talking...SHe was a good teacher of it though!
Dr. Fast is a wonderful woman. She gives interesting lectures and is very willing to chat about music, or anything in general. I think she is inspiring.

"Shhhhh, please.  Okay, now I'm going to make music borin-SHHHH, PLEASE!"  I didn't think it was possible to make this stuff uninteresting but Susan does it with pesto. It's not like anyone in the class could care anyways.  A joke class not worth your time.

A good pro, good a lecturing BUT very disorganized and liked to come up with excluses as to why stuff was not marked. We are busy too. Give us a break sometimes. How can you sign in the next assignment, done in the same manner as the firs when you don't have the first one back??

oh brother... another indoctrinator. geez, will she get off her ideology horse and actually try to say something objective? oh sorry -- there is no objectivity, there is no truth, everything's relative, right Dr. Fast? i am female, and silly women like this make me ashamed to be ...
ARHG!!! If you want a class with an annoying teacher who talks about Led Zepplin and their use of guitars as sexual objects... take this class!!!

Terrible. Tests were bogus! Deliberately tries to trick you with them; lectures were a bore. Spent waay too much time on early stuff, didn't even touch on modern music. Skipped the 80's...like, what?! Looks like Dori from Nemo. Why does she always look @ the floor when music is playing? The worst!
that was rough.
Decent prof. Loves her Zepplin. Not as much of a bird course as you may have heard, but interesting at least. Should be required for all. Then again, talking about music is like dancing about art...
fun class
I have never had such a boring class. The issues were not dealt with in a rounded way, they all seemed to be two dimensional.  This class should be called music feminism.
Dr. Fast knows a lot about her work and i think she's brilliant. Very approachable!
She's great. Not many profs will sing to their classes.
She reminds me of a lil pixie! haha... Honestly though, she's fun, and it's a fun class. The info is actually interesting for those who pay att'n. Oh, and I like her attire, always dressed to a T.
I like the class, she's a good lecturer, but... stop saying the word "consume."
You know what, I actually like her. I think she's a good prof who has a lot of knowledge of popular music. She tries to make the class interesting, gotta give her credit for that.
Black Sabbath invented Metal!!!!!!!

She has a somewhat limited vocabulary for a prof. She uses the words "enormously" and "hugely" all the time, and especially "kind of". STOP SAYING "KIND OF"! It gets really irritating after 30 classes.

Didn't end up liking the course too much.  We got behind very quickly and she made no attempt to catch us up on the material. Instead she allocated a lot of time to stuff she liked and skipped over a lot of important groups and periods.
What a useless course
She is pretty nice but everything is sort of dull...I am sick of hearing about Zeppelin!

This class is extremely easy. Dr.Fast's knowledge od the material is limited and her tests reflect a lack of "true love" for her work. As a music lover and teacher, I found the course too basic and uninteresting as a result of her style. It's an
GOOD TEACHER
Makes things very easy to understand, very informative and super nice and cute :) I had fun...
Awesome dresser!!! Super cute and fun!!! Love her
Good prof, sometimes makes the music a lot less fun, but still a good class.
Thoroughly enjoy this class. Not a huge fan of textbook MC questions! She's v approachable and open to asking questions
she has a tendecy to suck the fun out of the music and doesn't give enough attention to the music
loved the course!
lots of music clips and video clips which are great..lectures at a pace that doesnt make writing difficult, tests are easy...but a 3 hr nite class feels long no matter how u lecture :(
No Comments
No Comments
Somebody tell her its only an elective.
awesome prof and very interesting course
No Comments
Another Zeppelin fan...:)
i'm scared of her!
No Comments

comments: Tbh, the cheat sheets were overpowered if you knew what to put on them. I didn't go to class at all and didn't bother buying the textbook (super expensive). I got through the course by going through each of the online lecture slides and making notes. Advice: type up your cheat sheet to fit maximum content on both sides (time-consuming but worth it)

He's a mint prof. Had another (far worse) prof originally on my schedule but ended up attending Lozinski's lectures because of their quality. Cheat sheet midterms/exams are not as easy as you would think, all of his questions are 'synthesis' style. People who think his pace is too fast or his tests too difficult should drop out of McMaster.
Very nice and funny prof. So thorough and caring. Blessed my life. Would definitely take another class with him!
So fast

Dr. Lozinski is a great human being. I really appreciated his class, it was a perfect combination of examples and theory. He seems like he's always around Hamilton Hall if you need help with homework. Do the assignments and understand the theory and you should have no problem succeeding on the tests and exam.

Although Lozinski seems to be a great guy, I found that his lectures really had nothing to do with the assignments or textbook work. His tests are the opposite of straightforward, as he throws in concepts he's never discussed or assigned before. I would spend days studying and still found myself struggling through his tests.

Lozinski spends a significant portion of lecture explaining theory rather than grinding out examples. Be careful because he may ask for short answer theory related questions.  Easy to do well if you are prepared to attend all lectures and supplement with textbook work.
He basically gives an example and proceeds to solve it without explaining how he got there, he just writes out the steps and doesn't give an explanation of what's going on.
His tests are a little tricky but its only because he wants you to understand math and not memorize solutions. He's a good guy, but found that he often goes through lecture very quickly.
He gives a very new approach to math compared to high school level. He emphasizes understanding the content rather than memorizing the formulas. Great prof
great prof. but theory based lectures no examples done in class therefore tutorial  is must

This class was challenging, but if you work hard and really learn the material a great mark is totally attainable. It turned out to be one of my favourite courses of first year. Dr. Lozinski's lectures were sometime's confusing, partly due to the content, but overall clear and absolutely worth attending. He is also very helpful at office hours.
This professor is very dedicated to his students and teaches very clearly. I really enjoyed his lectures.
Very approachable, really cares for his students. Thought he might be intimidating but actually super friendly :)

He was a great prof for Math 2Z03. You could tell he was willing to answer questions, and answered them quite well too. He did write quite a bit in terms of notes, but they were great to study off of and explained the concepts well. The tests were a bit difficult but if you do the practice problems an A is 100% doable.

One of the few genuinely good profs in the department. He truly cares about students and is willing to help and listen to them. Tests/assignments were very fair and you could go ask him for hints/help. You need to study for his courses. Overall great prof
Makes for a good teacher. He's highly intelligent, and great in class. Very impatient with students that slack.
Great sense of humour, really thorough in explaining concepts. His enthusiasm for math and his positive attitude are contagious in class.
Great prof and really cares abt the student.
Really nice. He gives off this feeling that he really wants to help you. Great prof.

He gives you clear notes (also posted on WebCT) so you don't even need the text (provided that you have MathZone to practise with). His tests and exam are very fair (easy if you study, hard if you don't). It's recommended that you attend his classes (interesting, not monotone, clear, organized and so on).

Dr. Lozinksi is a good prof. He teaches in a very organized manner. He does write hard tests, but being my 2nd time thru this course, Ive noticed he's changed a lot this year to make the tests a lot more fair. He is very willing to help students in office hours and with other appointments
Had such a bad experience in Actuarial I so after that I did not even bother taking Actuarial II. His tests are hard.
I
very bad professor his test were very hard. so what if it is a 3rd year stats course, he should still make it more fair.

Lozinski is a great prof! Do not listen to what the people below have said. His tests are hard, but hey it's University math, what do you expect? 1+1=2? And about the whole thing with signing his name "Dr Lozinski", I think he has every right to do that. I mean he slaved throughout his post-secondary education to get his PhD. DR LOZINSKI ROCKS!!!

He is the worst math prof I've ever seen. So many people failed his tests. He thinks Actuarial was the only course we had in 3rd year and no other courses to worry about that's why he gave such hard tests and FOUR tests in a term. OMGGGGGG
He is the most unfair prof I have ever met. After him, I dont think I have any interest left in Actuarial. His tests are ridiculous and so unfair. He needs to take it easy on students

He is the wost prof EVERRR!!! His tests are so hard and unfair. He gave us 4 tests in one semester. That is not normal!! No prof in the math department would make a course that intense. For some people it has been a real struggle to even pass his tests. I strongly recommend you stay away from him. His voice is so soft and he is so boring. Terrible!

He is the best prof in this disappointing math department here at Mac. Most profs have no teaching skills whatsoever, but not this prof. This prof is a skilled professional and is always ready for a challenge. You should go check him out. You will make him very happy!
He is the best professor I have ever had. His teaching style is remarkable and his knowledge in the subject matter is excellent.

Good prof, but he does have a HUGE EGO I suppose! That's why he always signs his emails with "Dr. Lozinski" I have never ever seen a University prof sign his email with the word "Dr" so I guess he wants to tell the world I DO HAVE A PHD and I am smart!! Feel sorry for him if he has that type of an attitude. Even on tests first page "Dr. Lozinksi"
DOCTOR Lozinksi is really tough!!
Amazing prof
He was so condescending to me when I contacted him. It was very unexpected. If he didn't want to be helpful, he could have atleast been politer.
Loved him. He is such a nice prof, really connects with his students, enthusiastic, and helpful. Tests and assignments were fair. Office hours were very helpful. Can't wait to have him again.
Amazing!! One of the best profs at Mac till now. He was really fair with clear explainations and generated interest in the material.
too hard...

Dr. Lozinski is definitely one of the best profs I've ever had. His passion for the material shines through in his lectures, and his explanations are always clear, and frequently hands-on (vector sticks!). Tests were well-done; they make you feel like you're actually applying what you've learned. I can't overstate how awesome Dr. Lozinski is.

He's always open to helping you, and unlike some other profs, going to him actually is worthwhile if you have a question. He's really thorough in class and gives good examples. His tests can sometimes be tricky though.
Amazing teacher, very competent and goes through examples thoroughly and sincerely cares about his students.
Took his course in the summer, excellent prof. He genuinely wants his students to do well, which is always a good thing.

had him for algebra--he's very helpful and clearly wants to do a good job for his students.  i stopped going after a while because you can pick it up from the text, but he works through problems nicely in class.  sometimes a bit fast.  his nerdy jokes are cute and endearing.
if u'r a genius on stats. then take his course otherwise ....a nightmare
Awesome prof for both algebra and calculus. Always available to help and has good sense of humour. Kind of sexy too;)
Very clear,very smart, even though the test was a little challenging, still a good course. Very nice prof, I like him.
lozinski is a good prof, but he goes too fast sometimes, and assumes the class knows exactly what hes talking about.

Always available for that extra explanation on course material. No reason not to do well on tests if one seeks the appropriate help beforehand. Tests are challenging though, but always apply pre-learned concepts. Good Teacher
too difficualt tests
He is a good prof. very smart but thinks every one should be as smart as he is.

comments: He is a really nice guy and he is passionate about frogs, he never stops talking about them. He is inconsistent with what he says he will test you on  and what he does test you on. He says he will only test you on concepts from the class and the textbook but he tested us half on  minor details only mentioned in the textbook.

Ben is a great lecturer. I went into this class with the lowest expectations because evolution seems like such a dry topic, but he made it extremely interesting! He talks fast, but lectures are podcasted so it works out. Didn't read the textbook and did fine on his tests, so he tests from lecture material. Would definitely want him as a prof again!

Ben Evans is an incredible professor and has greatly influenced my future in conservation biology! He talks fast, but is very upbeat and enthusiastic. I applaud him for uploading podcasts of all of his lectures because I do not need to go to class all the time while still staying up to date! I'm going to miss him.

His lectures are very clear and concise. He's clearly knowledgable and passionate about what he's teaching. His questions in tests were tough, but fair. If you paid attention to his lectures, you're pretty much set for any examinations. A plus: he's hilarious! I would definitely take another course about evolution if he was teaching :)

I loved Ben Evans for BIO1M03. He was a very fast speaker and skimmed through slides quickly, which made it a bit hard to take notes, but everything is posted online anyways and lectures are podcasted. He is hilarious, makes awkward jokes all the time, and is a strong feminist so thats always a bonus. And his love for his research is inspirational!

Ben Evans was hilarious and cared very much for what he taught. Followed textbook pretty much to a T. MC questions could be difficult,  there was often no obvious answer. Also he spoke so fast that it was difficult to takes notes, but its okay the lectures are podcasted
He is a great prof. He was straightforward and clear on the material he taught. Although he is fast, he is still understandable and fun listen to, especially when he talks about Bonobos and Gibbons.
Ben Evans is the best, he's so funny and passionate about the material. Tests are tough but it's okay because its Ben

Studying for his tests is really straightforward. Just memorize everything he says in lecture and you're pretty much guaranteed to get really high marks. He assigns readings but they go beyond what you need to know for his tests. If you spend spend 30 minutes a day skimming over his podcasts, the course will feel like a bird course.

Evans is such a nice guy. Really funny, really enthusiastic... loves talking about his research on frogs. Teaching is SUPER clear. Go to lecture, go to his office hours if you have questions, and you're guaranteed a good mark.  Side note- group projects (PBL) are annoying in this course... be sure to get yourself a good group and hope for easy TAs
Talks fast, yes, but I think it's in part because he's excited about what he's teaching. He still delivers the information clearly though, and I'd definitely have him as a lecturer again.
Ben's a great professor,  and exceptional individual.

Very nice person.  He knew what he needed to improve on from the past and is really working at being a better lecturer.  His lectures are very interesting and you can feel his passion about the topics.  You will find his midterm very easy if you understood the concepts he talked about.

This man literally talks at the speed of light. Like you gotta be talented as hell to talk that fast. Anyways, I stopped going to lectures and just watch the podcasts. He's not too bad though if you take your time and pause the podcasts and carefully listen. Love his excitement for frogs tho, always kills me!

BEST PROR EVER!!! He's honestly so passionate about what he teaches, when he's up there lecturing its seems more like he's sharing all the cool things he knows. He's so approachable and helpful, his office is always open for help. He encourages us to ask questions in class or see him right after if we're confused. I wish he taught all my classes 3

I personally disliked this course soo much! The lectures were so boring, Dr evans speaking at lights speed didnt help either. You cant really take notes, And for some people like me, if u dont take notes, I cant focus! He was meh in terms of helpfulness. I found his midterms incredibly difficult, although quinn was much harder!  Dreaded going.

Dr. Evans is a really amazing prof. If his passion towards teaching doesn't motivate you to learn, then maybe his love for frogs will! He replies to e-mails at a much faster rate than most and is always able to answer your questions after lecture. Very quick speaker, don't be afraid to ask him to slow down. He's my favourite prof I've had this year
Dr. Evans was definately the best profteacher i've ever had. He is passionate about his work which makes him that much better as a prof. I enjoyed going to class and his test was fair!
BEST PROF IV'E EVER HAD THE NEGATIVE COMMENTS, DO NOT LISTEN TO THEM!!!!!   hes funny enthusiastic makes sure you get the material and his test is the fairest ive ever had.
Good Prof. Made us laugh. Midterms are becoming fair-er :)
WORST PROFESSOR EVER. DOES NOT TEACH PROPERLY AT ALL AND HIS MIDTERMS ARE CALLED "THE TERMINATOR". AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS.
First midterm was NUCLEAR. I got a 57% on multiple choice.

Very VERY hard teacher. The midterms were really hard. I am usually a 80% student in university, I failed the first midterm. This entire course is very inconsistent. First semester students have easier midterms then the second. He is a good professor, but he talks really fast.
nice guy, pretty good lectures, but needs to make his test questions much more clearer and much less specific!
Enjoyed his lectures, very passionate about teaching, teaches very quickly, must be paying full attention for class and his midterm questions are super hard.

If you ever challenge him, he will take it as a personal attack and will automatically jump on the defence. As long as you don't, he is nice and does care about the students. The class is not as exciting as it could be given the material. He usually just spends the class reading his slides.
Dr Evans has the magic power to make anything he touches turn boring.

Ben is a super awesome prof!! He is passionate and loves what he is teaching and knows what he is talking about. He is fair and takes us to the ZOO! :D He's also a very good looking man. Excellent professor and an excellent class.
Very nice and helpful both in class and office hours, has very clear lecture notes and his test questions were fair.
No Comments

comments: I had him in graduate school. He is knowledgeable but openly hostile to any student learning independently. He lectures by rote, the same each year, and if asked a question (even yes or no), he merely repeats exactly what he said to you on many prior occasions. He does not even listen what he says.

Very intelligent man and I thought his tests were very fair, not to mention he bumped up everyone's mark when he felt any of his questions were too misleading. To do well, you must attend lecture and follow with the readings in class. This guy makes theory at least somewhat enjoyable.

LOVE him! Dr. Levitt is brilliant! He is passionate and incredibly knowledgeable about theory. Yes, theory can be dry for a lot of people but he makes it as interesting as it can be. Go to lectures and you'll do great. He gets a bad rap for using big words..he is smart, get used to it you're university students! AMAZING PROF! :)

he is horrible. do anything to not take his classes. he uses latin words on exams and in the book, he rambles on and on. doesnt stay on topic, his slides are ridiculous, its like he is writing an essay on the slide. exams and tutorials are brutal. dont take him.
The courseware is *brutal*.  I've never dreaded readings more.  Assumes too much prior knowledge.  Unclear explanations riddled with jargon.  Brutal class.
He's Great!

very smart man, sometimes his examples went off topic and made his lecture confusing.  he does speak quite a bit so bringing a laptop is a good idea. exams had a  lot of "blank is to such and such, as such and such is to blank"
HE IS VERY INTELLIGENT AN QUITE FUNNY IN A NERDY OLD FASHIONED WAY...I LOVE HEARING HIS FREUD STUFF
Brilliant man, I'm not the brightest tool in the shed, but I was able to pull out an A in his class.
AMAZING prof. SOOOO smart, very helpful. doesn't need notes or slides, he just speaks for his lectures. He is really really nice and so brilliant. Great Prof

Amazing guy, very eduated, knows exactly what he is talking about, a true professor in all sense of the world, he is not easy and he is not a hip rof, but he is an old fashion guy however, he is very interesting LOVED HIM

This class is pretty hard.. A LOT of information to take in. his lecturing style is pretty old fashion so there is A LOT of note taking.. your writing non stop and no OVER HEADS.. its a hard class but this man is soo smarttt i want his brain!

Lots of notes taken in class and hand gets tired but no assignments all tests which means not a lot of work other than studying for tests. I thought i failed the exams but then i somehow got in the 80s... bumps tests up if low average

Boring content, but the man is brilliant.  He's a bit reserved but is very nice and willing to help.  Also very patient with people who ask stupid questions in class. Tests are fair and not too hard if you do the reading

He is very unclear in his lectures and he likes to jump around a lot. My favourite part is when he goes on for 5 minutes about something and then says "but this theorist doesn't think this". Priceless. I want to throw apples at him.
Very bad teaching style.. can't understand a word he's talking about... very unpleasant and ALWAYS late. ridiculous.

he is fantastic, very knowledgable, he knows more lang than I can imagine, he knows everything there is to know about the things he is talking about, he is very helpful and give the time of day to ppl from all faculties since most of his tudents are not art sci, I loved his class
One of my most memorable teachers from Mac. Brilliant. LOVED his classes. LOVED listening to him
Did this guy get better or something? Snooze City!
I thoroughly enjoyed this class, he is an impressive lecturer and is definatly brilliant.  This although was one of the mandatory classes,was my best class by far.
One word.  Brilliant. He has forgotten more than we can ever hope to learn!! Material can be tedious, but a result of subject matter, not Dr. Levitt.
Very good lecturer.  Made the course a lot more interesting.  He really knows his stuff.  Exams were a bit interesting to say in the least, but he is helpful in trying to even out marks for people.
Makes a very dull class interesting, brilliant man. very good lecturer
Awesome Prof
Dr. Levitt, makes Theory, bearable to learn, and makse some part interesting

comments: Generally I'd argue he's an awesome teacher all around! Very friendly and willing to get to know his students individually. Sometimes his sense of humour can be a little crude but he's lots of fun and willing to help out his students where he can!
Best prof at Mac!! So passionate about what he's teaching and genuniely cares about his students!  I took his class at 830am as an elective!! Hes the only prof I would ever attend an 830 for!!

Dr. Hanley has been teaching french for a number of years, and it shows. This course is highly philosophical, and he teaches it enthusiastically. As a result, the material is endlessly interesting. He is kind, funny and smart, which make for great lectures.

Dr. Hanley is great. Would recommend this course to anyone with basic knowledge of French. He was the only 1st year prof who actually cared about students and the small class size means he knows you on a first name basis. He also loves to make everyone speak as often as possible (for practice and just because he wants to get to know you). Easy A
AMAZING prof. So smart and witty and you can tell he really cares about his students!
His classes are a lot of fun and he really knows his stuff. He's also approachable and he provides you with everything you need to succeed in his course.

Amazing prof. The best Fr. prof ive had at Mac. His class revolves around reading quotes from the novels and explaining them and class diss. The term essay was easy IF you go to class and take notes. He is extremely approachable, you should talk out the essay with him. The final was 2 of 3 essay questions. The course itself was really interesting.

One of the best French teachers I have ever encountered. He loves his job and it really shows. Attend his classes - he loves to make jokes but also gets the job done. He makes the material very clear. Do your homework and don't forget to study vocabulary for his quizzes. Trust me, you want this prof!

Seems like a sweet old man but can sometimes become quite rude. Make sure you do your homework or he'll blacklist you from the get-go. Gets frustrated easily but is an easy marker. Definitely self-righteous like most french teachers i've encountered.
Dr Hanley is the best prof ever.  Explains everything super clearly and makes French interesting again.  Loved all of his classes and the books he chose.  All around excellent prof!
Hanley is one of the best professors ever.  He is very sweet, truly cares about his students, is devoted to his area of study and his enthusiasm carries you along with it.  Highly recommended!

The man does not teach.  His classes consist of nothing more than discussion that encourages the polemists to persist in fruitless argument.  This is accurate, and not libelous. Good if you love to hear your own voice, and don't care about the Truth.
We called him "Manly Hanley" ... he rocked and made French rock too!!!

Dr. H was a very caring and attentive listener. There were many occasions when he allowed me to vent to him or just chat with him during his office hours. I am a teacher now, and I strive to treat my students the way he treated us. Merci pour votre aide!
This guy bugs me. He's a nice guy but a really overenthused teacher. No one cares and it's a good place to want to sleep, but he's so in your face!
A wonderful man and terrific educator. His intellect is astounding as is his generosity.
He is the BEST prof EVER!!!
Nice man, perhaps too much spoonfeeding

hard marker but an incredible and friendly teacher.
Dr. Hanley has high expectations, but he is a very nice man and is never rude.

comments: No other McMaster prof with 100+ ratings is rated lower than 2.9. That's still twice as good as Deave.
still traumatized

Where do I even start with this disaster of a class. I've never had a prof that tests ur knowledge from the FOOTNOTES of a textbook and ignores the rest of the content. I srsly have no idea how this embarrassment is still at Mac. His quizzes are brutal and final exam is straight from hell. So good luck to all of you, I promise ur gonna need it!

Day 2 after the exam, blood pressure is steadily dropping however anxiety is at an all-time high. Drinking water to stay hydrated. Have committed to daily prayers until the grade is posted. In the case of failing, have considered dropping out to be a male stripper. Not the best but atleast my soul will be at peace.
Holy all these reviews are cracking me up. Keep it up guys. I agree that the prof is terrible. if he was Dr Disrespects wife, he'd get cheated on asap. Terrible exam.
Whoever gives him a good rating is either trolling or has EXTREMELY bad luck with profs.

He'll briefly mention the most insignificant thing in the textbook, and won't return to explain it. He'll also make it a question on the exam. The textbook is more like a diary. Countless facts stated but not elaborated or justified. Lectures are even worse, they're summaries of the text and he'll do calculations without explaining what's going on.
Horrible prof, textbook is useless and pulls questions for the final from out of no where.

An unaccommodating, boring, and pretentious professor who teaches from a self-published, poorly-written book full of grammatical and numerical errors. Shameful that he has been disliked and critiqued for many years and makes no adjustments to his teaching style. A true embarrassment to the commerce department.

People constantly complain about how hard this course is, but I liked Deaves as a professor because he taught me discipline and didn't spoon feed me the course. I just wrote the final exam and it was very fair and in my opinion it was easier than it could've been. I think he's a great guy.

do not recommend, run away if possible, he will make finance haunt you for life and no matter what you do you will fail, i've been crying for 4 days and my final is in an hour and i have accepted that i will fail and it seems like everyone else has too

He expects us to know so much about Finance, regardless that he's teaching an INTRODUCTORY course! I went to lectures and didn't understand a thing. His resources don't help at all since his questions are much harder than what's taught in class. Exam is in 2 hours and everyone is stressed about failing. Says a lot.

This course should NOT be this hard. His self written book is full of errors, doesn't explain various concepts, and if that wasn't enough, his lectures are even worse. This year the online quizzes were a blessing, but at the same time 2 hours was not nearly enough time to complete them. But the exam... Yikes. If you get this prof, run.

Okay please avoid at all costs. His course is all over the place, his textbook is overly complicated, his quiz/test questions are extremely difficult and involve lots of tricks to try to throw you off. This class will have you googling which M/C option is most commonly chosen. If you are an average student, you will struggle to simply pass.

He is such a difficult professor he doesn't teach well at all nd the textbook for this class which is his own is wrong and needs to be thoroughly re read and re edited by him. The questions he gives not tests are 10 x harder than anything in his textbook, discussed in tutorial or taught by him in lecture. he is a nice guy but such a horrible prof

Im only gonna point out two thinsg, if your gonna write your own textbook, at least edit it first, and secondly if your gonna put your picture on the back dont make it an ugly ass picture where you look like Mr. Bean

Only resources available in the class are by him. His lectures suck. His textbook sucks. There is no other prof. And he doesn't explain anything properly, you have to teach yourself the class through google, khan academy, Investopedia, Wikipedia. This is not intro to finance, his textbook is meant for advanced classes. Not easy to understand.
Why does richard deaves look like a turtle???

This prof truly believes that he is gods gift to finance when in actuality he doesnt know a thing. I get almost daily notifications about corrections in the textbook, his powerpoint slides, or his quizzes (which are ridiculously time pressured and next to impossible). Ive never met a more frustrating prof. He doesnt deserve to teach at a preschool

I took this last year. He does not prepare you for the final exam at all. over 200 formulas to remember and the "textbook" is terrible. It's full of mistakes and does not go into detail on the solutions for the questions. Took me a while to realize that some of the solutions were wrong. I RECOMMEND DEFERRING THIS EXAM OR YOU WILL FAIL. TRUST ME

Dr. Deaves was honestly the best prof I have had yet. I learned everything through him, and the finance exam today was a breeze. He taught me a lot and everything I would need to know to major in Finance. This guy truly is a REAL professor...
This prof has made me hate not only finance, but also my life. just praying i pass. i cant go through this fresh hell all over again. good luck to all

Richard is the worst prof ever, he doesn't even deserve to be called "Dr." He does not know how to teach first and foremost. He is not enthusiastic and I still do not know why McMaster has not fired him. Secondly, his textbook feels like a four year old child wrote it. It is full with mistakes and the funny thing is that it is not even published...
This prof is made reason why Im severely depressed

Over the past 10+ years, this prof has been consistently garbage. Just scroll down and you'll see. Lectures are poor, textbook is poor, and additional resources are poor. If you want a good grade, you're on your own. He cares more about profiting from textbook sales than he does about teaching. Surprising that he hasn't been fired yet.

His textbook just spits out a bunch of formulas, and talks about random concepts unrelated to the actual calculations. It phrases things in a confusing way. To compare two things, he will use the words "former" and "latter" instead of the actual terms, forcing you to jump back to a previous part of the text. Lectures are just example calculations.

i was studying for my exam and got frustrated at this haram textbook that requires a rosetta stone to understand. i have accepted fate that I may not pass the final exam. his formula sheet needs another formula sheet to actually understand, and none of it is actually labeled. good luck everyone i hope you are on the other side of the bell thank u
this guy is literally satan incarnate
What a joke prof. Sucks at explaining his procedures, boring, the textbook sucks... the only good thing about his class was his TA Will. WILL DA BEAST!

Richard Deaves is one of the best professors I have ever had! This man is my idol. People have to take it easy on this guy! This textbook is the most engaging piece of literature I have ever had the pleasure of using! Im surprised his textbook isn't a worldwide finance staple.

I'm in engineering and this is by-far the worst professor I've had at McMaster University. His lectures are useless, full of mistakes, and he doesn't bother to explain anything or properly answer students' questions. His textbook is so poorly written that the university won't sell it - and you will be tested on it. BEWARE
Fire him pls. This guy can't teach and write textbooks. He has too many errors and don't really bother with teaching and knowing what it is going to be on the quiz and exam.

This guy does not care, his lectures are boring and not engaging, all the questions on the quizzes are impossible to figure out in the time provided, and on top of it there are so many errors in his material you can never fully understand what is right and wrong cause he just writes stuff down and doesn't explain.

In a large bowl, mix together flour, salt, baking powder and sugar; set aside. Preheat waffle iron to desired temperature. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs. Stir in the milk, butter and vanilla. Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture; beat until blended. Ladle the batter into a preheated waffle iron. Cook the waffles until golden and crisp.

Half the grade is dedicated to 5 online quizzes of which you are given an insufficient amount of time to complete them to the best of your capabilities. The other half is for the exam of which the number of preparation materials you can use also is insufficient. The quiz questions rarely have any relevance to things you would've used in preparation

this guy is the worst!! the text book sucks because he does not explain a single example. Also the company that published the text has only ever published one book, his. This is because his daughter is the owner of the publishing company. This guy should be let go.
Worst prof !
please fire him and hire aadil juma
This guy needs to leave. His powerpoints are in a different order than his textbook. Its all out of order all over the place. It literally makes no sense.
Guys make sure to bring a sleeping bag to class. You'll need it.
Taking his class is like being handed an incomplete puzzle, except none of the pieces fit together. Plus, you have to independently use the puzzle to build a rocket and fly it to the moon.
Failed the course last year with a 49.2%. Went to Richard Deaves begged him to let me pass. He told me no and that I should put more effort next time
Horrible Prof
I brought some snacks to his lecture one time. Apparently I was making too much noise and he kicked me out. Awful prof

I consider myself a good student with a good work ethic and strong grades. However, i have never been more frustrated with how poorly structured and taught a course is. The lectures, as well as the textbook,are utterly useless, unclear, and full of errors (textbook). In order to keep up grades I've had to google every concept on my own. Good luck:)

Horrible professor, expects you to learn from his self-published, error filled textbook which won't fully explain concepts, and then tests you on concepts not in the book or lecture notes.. Finance has become the worst and hardest class I've taken at McMaster, and it's purely because of him.
Get ready to not pass his course. It's like he only teaches you 1+12, and on the quiz, he asks what's the distance between Earth and Mars. LOL. Interesting experience.

Tip for his lectures, bring a pillow because you will fall asleep and you dont want your head to slam on the table. Bring another pillow because your pillow will fall asleep and you dont want that to slam on the table also.

Took this course last year in the fall, midterm were reasonable. However, the final exam was absolutely brutal. For the first 10 minutes everyone was speechless during the exam. Ended up barely passing the course when I got 70's on the midterms. Would not recommend taking this course with Richard.
TERRIBLE PROF WOW

Rumour has it that if you rate Richard Deaves a terrible score, you'll pass this class. You'll need all the luck possible to pass this course. This is exactly how this course is structured, online quizzes that rely on luck with easy questions. Exams that rely on sheer luck. Goodluck, because you'll need it.
SO BAD WOW
Richard is all over the place. Not qualified to teach this course in my opinion. The dean should really look into revamping this dreadful course
this prof ruined my life
Taking this course is like playing russian roulette.
Awful prof. Seriously do not take this course
Do not take 2FA3 with richard
The gatekeeper of commerce second year. He has a 60% final exam fail rate. If you pass his course, you're guaranteed to get into third year.

This prof is the example of someone who does not care about his students. His only goal in life is his research in which he always advertises. His textbook has no been updated for the past 5 years and there are full of errors. His lectures seems like he just wants to get it over with so he could get back to his research.
Wow, what a terrible prof. In all my years in my academic career, I have not seen a worst instructor than Richard. He will make you dislike finance very much.
Terrible instructor. Really need to change this course. Made me have a really bad first impression on finance.
Deaves' lectures are very disorganized and complicated. He is really really sweet guy but he is not really doing a good job teaching 2nd year finance.
He is just too bad!

Horrible prof, doesn't realize he's teaching an intro class and thinks everyone has at least 2 years of finance classes. Doesn't teach any of the basics of finance just bs formulas that make it look more like a calc course than a finance course. If you've never taken a finance before you will struggle as he only teaches what ever is in his bs text

The textbook is poorly explained. It often just gives you the equations and answers and random concepts and expects you to figure out how everything fits together on your own. In lectures, he goes through examples, but he expects you to already understand all the steps he is taking even though the textbook hardly explains steps. It's a mess.
He needs to stop using his full of error, self-written book. He is that prof who'd teach you ABC and ask you to handle Shakespearian literatures, with B and C switched in order probably.

Deaves is an okay prof. I found that when I put work into reading the textbook it was actually really helpful. It just took a bit of work to pull it together. He's a lot better than Brewer! Don't even bother going to Brewer's lectures.
Textbook is full of errors, entirely written in first person. Tests contain errors, course is unstructured and hard to learn from. Boring and confusing

A lot of people seem to really dislike Prof Deaves, and I'm not really sure why. I thought he was actually pretty good; the most interesting Finance prof I've had so far to say the least. He has his own book, with some typos here and there, but otherwise I thought it was useful. Overall the course wasn't too bad, better than 3FA3 in my opinion!
make sure to read the footnotes in his book will ask questions on exam that are taken from them
By far the worst prof. Enough said.
worst prof ever seen in university. Force you to buy his terrible textbook which dont even have a step in example.

Dr. Dick Deaves is easily the worst instructor, at any level of education, that I have ever had. He requires students to buy HIS textbook and workbook for the course, which conveniently seems to change by the year. He is disrespectful to students, careless, and worst of all his textbook is filled with mistakes and is incredible unclear. Horrible.
The worst prof. I have ever encountered. His book is poorly written, he doesn't explain anything and makes exams difficult and unrepresentative. I used to like finance, now I hate it.
Horrible prof, tests are not representative, his practice problems are fraught with errors and formulas not covered in lecture or his (pricey, and poorly written) "textbook"

I loved finance, until I had this prof. He is very rude to students. His text is full of mistakes and he expects way too much from students in an introductory course. His textbook for the course wasn't even endorsed by a publisher due to it's poor quality. His midterms are definitely not representative, so make sure you know everything..
His textbook is not great. He expects people to already know finance. His examples are not clear, we have to figure out how to do certain questions on our own. Not an easy course. Torture.

only way I passed the course was  because he made the midterms similar to the practice ones. other than that, extremely boring, confusing, and his textbook might as well not be written in english it's that difficult to understand

Don't buy the textbook, it's full of useless junk and he just wants to make a buck off his classes. He's smart, but he can't teach at all. Definitely a self teaching class. He needs to explain more in his lectures!

Thinks he invented Finance. Makes you buy the textbook that he wrote so he can profit. The whole this is chalked full of spelling and grammar errors and written in first person like a children's book. No respect or concern for his students.

This guy is the worst prof i've ever had. His textbook sucks, he expects people to already know finance (its an intro course), and worst of all he is disrespectful towards his students. BORING and ANNOYING. Fire him already mac.

Lectures easy to understand and follow. Textbook sucks though - does very little in explaining concepts. Ended up googling most things. GO TO TUTORIAL.. you learn a lot more as you apply concepts in assigned questions. The TA I had was very helpful.
Oh geeze what can I say. Ridiculously useless proff, just as bad if not worse then the stats proffs in 2nd year Buchanan and sproul

completely useless textbook which he assumes people ALREADY have a background in finance, WHICH WE DON'T!! its an introductory course FOR GOODNESS SAKE!  Lecture is somewhat helpful, but not overly, lecture is A LOT more helpful than the textbook, but that doesn't mean much.
His textbook is absolutely horrible, needs to provide a real textbook and then it make his mediocre lectures actually help

His book is not that great on its own but if you read it and go to class everything makes perfect sense. All you need to do is read and do practice problems and your are set for exam. His true or false are extremely tricky but calculation questions are very straight forward if you know what you are doing.

Didn't think he was that bad. Huge bell curve helped. A solid math/problem solving background helps a lot in this course cause many questions test problem solving skills rather than straight memory. Course pack + textbook a bit $$ and redundant.
Incomprehensible, not very helpful, always busy, more interested in his publicity, never gave enough examples, not a good prof.

Talks and talks and talks even though no one understands. The only reason I passed was b/c the profs switched for the final exam- just passed each midterm b/c class average bumped up 5% and 7% on each- then does not allow contact before 2nd midterm even though no one knows whats going on.

A class that could have been fun and interesting was completely destroyed by brutal exams. We got easy Qs in Class anyone could solve and brutal webs of a numerical mess on the exams. Geez..balance it out

Wooooaaaaw you know you have a bad prof when his M/C tests dont even have the right choices on them. He doesn't know how to teach... he should stick to writing books. Worst professor I have  ever had, hands down.

WORST PROF EVER in my two years of school. He talks gibberish in class. I dont think he has ever heard of the term "EXAMPLES". How does he expect us to learn how to do maths without doing examples in class??? His coursepack is useless. Not to mention he has no concern abt any of his students, NONE AT ALL!!!

Sucked.  So insecure, he attempts to treat MBA students like freshmen by talking down to you.  Heaven forbid you ask a question or start a discussion.  He prefers it to be a lecture course in which he can stand at the front and puke up info at you with no exchanges whatsoever.  Do yourself a favour - take Macro with ANYONE else.
Worst Prof ever, does not help at all, and finds joy in failing students with ridiculous questions on the midterm and exam. This guy should not be teaching finance!!
His courseware is good so you can buy the textbook but dont worry about buying the study guide. He is sort of an annoying little man but not a bad guy, thoroughly interested in what he teaches.

Probably the worst prof you will encounter in 2nd year commerce. More interested in using pretentious words than clarifying concepts. Courseware is horribly written and this guy honestly just doesnt seem to know how to teach.  Rarely in his office, doesnt do examples in classand makes every test question loaded with ****. its intro course relax
Uptight!
Extremely horrible prof. Definitely should not be running the course.
Examples??? It would be nice if we saw some.  Just because you have a PhD doesn't mean that you are any good.  Let Adrian Lawson run the course.
What the heck is this guy trying to teach? Hard to understand. Doesn't do enough examples. Needs to use the chalk board more and stay away from his damn laptop!

Tons of useless crap in courseware. Stupid test format. Hard course made even tougher by a bad prof who seems more interested in preaching how GREAT finance is instead of helping students understand the material and do well.

Not as bad as everyone makes him out to be.  He made a test that was designed to actually test our knowledge (instead of our memory), and everyone whined.  Didn't like the seating plan  and random calling of people to answer questions though.
Very Very Hard tests.. Unforgettable!!!

uses excel for math equations - very confusing. no office hours, but if you can catch him he explains material well.very hard exam. has a seating plan for 100+ students. overall didnt mind his class but he only taught half the course
what happens when excel isn't used anymore?
Better off if class was taught by the REAL Ned Flanders!!!
No Comments
Bring a pillow to class. Regurgitates handbook by using transperencies.
very orginized prof,
No Comments

comments: Hard but fair marker. Lectures are pretty good with his German humour, but sometimes the proof is too tedious.  PS: Do not expect bell curve to save you ass in his class.

Cryptography is a really cool class. The material is a favorite among many students. The class was typical Kolster; a bit tougher than his other classes. The format was the same - single midterm, many assignments, and final. Teaches you to do things 'smart, not dumb'. Gives bonus questions on tests and exams - so marks over 100% are possible!

Kolster doesn't insult your intelligence. If you study the material WELL, you will not only get a good grade but also learn the material very well. His lectures are peppered with jokes which lighten up what can be somewhat dry material sometimes. He believes in a single midterm, and instead gives assignments which are decently easy to do.
Great prof. Good lecturer, helpful, funny and approachable.
Tough but fair.  Very enthusiastic and really knows his Cryptography.  You need to work hard to appreciate this course

Best professor at McMaster!  Very fair, very consistent.  I began this class with no knowledge of the subject matter, and over the course of the semester I grew to not only udnerstand the material, but now I enjoy Mathematics in general.  Congratulations to Dr. Kolster for making a better student out of me.
mean marker. hard final exam. He would look like ron jeremy if he had that moustache on his face lol

He is the best professor in math. All these negative comments written below appear to be posted by some low life losers with no life. They need to go outside and get a hobby rather then slamming professors on this anonymous website posting false comments.

worst prof. in the whole dept. he gave me F grade in linear algebra III then i retook the course with a diff.prof and received A+. it tells you how bad this so-called-professor is. nobody uses the script that he created for math2s03. other profs consider it trash. he is a very hard marker i'm telling you. he says his exams are so easy. they are NOT

I had this horrific instructor many years ago for Number theory and oh boy was he horrible. He spoke with a thick german accent and his handwriting was impossible to decipher. He is extremely old but still takes his courses so seriously it's unbelievable. At this age people should stop worrying so much about students and marking hard on exams.

His hand writing is the worst among all professors of the math department. My 2 year old daughter can write better then Manfred Kolster. He told us the exam will be so easy; it was not easy. It was pretty brutal. I was expecting an A+ in this course but walked out with an B+ because the final was pretty tough. I think Raza marked brutal on it.

Very Unfair prof. He has very little knowledge of what he teaches. He makes so much mistakes on the board and then laughs about it and makes dumb jokes. It is OK for him to make mistakes on the board, but when u make mistakes on his exams, he will nail u hard, and give u very litle part marks. What a Hypocrite. It's unbelievable. Very terrible prof
I think this prof does not deserve even 1/5 for his rankings. He is the WORST PROF IN THE WHOLE UNIVERSITY. I have never seen a more multi faced prof before.

Very Tough Professor. He looks so intimidating. He always writes "Best Wishes" at the end of his e-mails but he does not really mean it. He doesnot want best wishes for you, he is so fake that it's unbelievable.
He was a great prof but a bit of a bitter grader. He has a very thick voice and smiles all the time during lecture. Good teaching attitude.

Very poor at explaining even the simplest mathematical concepts during lecture. I can't even read his handwriting. When he writes an s it looks like an r. How does he expect students to learn math with those kind of teaching methods?

He is so boring. His lectures cover so much theory and irrelevant proofs that he does not even test you on. He does them in class just to waste time. His writing is so bad. I recommend he go back to nursery school so that they teach him proper handwriting.

His face is frightening, it's hard to get past that, but he does wear sexy clothing. I especially think he looks very handsome in those military pants. Apparently the look is catching on as many McMaster students are now wearing them.

I warn everybody who is going to take a course by this prof, DONOT believe him. He is the biggest liar born on earth and he likes to see students do poorly. He is the biggest Hypocrite I've ever seen. It's OKAY for him to make countless mistakes on the board, but when you make a tiny mistake on the exam, he will give you 0 on that question. Awful.
He is the worst math grad chairman McMaster has ever had.

THIS PROF TALKS VERY NICELY AND POLITELY AT YOUR FACE BUT HE IS A VERY UNFAIR MARKER. HE DOES NOT MARK IN THE FAVOUR OF STUDENTS. HE IS VERY DECEIVING AND HAS MULTIPLE FACES. BEWARE AND WATCH OUT IF YOU HAVE HIM. YOU MIGHT THINK YOU DID VERY WELL IN HIS COURSE ONLY TO FIND OUT YOU DID VERY BADLY, BECAUSE HE IS VERY UNFAIR. GET A LIFE OLD MAN.

I had this prof for Linear Algebra III many many years ago. You should see the expression on his face when he is marking tests and exams in his office. He seems like he is hungry since ages and wants to eat your paper. He seems very angry when he marks exams and rips your paper apart if you give him a wrong answer. Very few part marks if at all.

Poor teaching skills with a very big ego. He is also a very difficult grader. If you don't give him the answer for which he is looking he gives you zero. Stop taking your courses so seriously, old guy, and give your students credit when they have worked hard for it.
Most Worthless Professor Of The Math Department.

What a sorry excuse for a professor. He did not even update his web site. That would have been so helpful for final exam preparation, but NOOOOOOOOOO, this prof just tells us in his lion voice that the exam is easy. Well it was not easy and I am so happy I gave him a poor evaluation at the end of the term.
The final was so hard. He told us to relax and said it will be easy. It was not easy.

He tries very hard to be funny, but let me make it clear that he is NOT FUNNY AT ALL. His Jokes are stupid and ridiculous and he is a very hard marker. He is a mean person, although he may seem nice and polite from his face.
He was really bad.
He's one of the worst prof i have. He assumes alot. If you go to his office hours hes going to explain the same way he did in class so its useless.
Worst Professor I have ever had.

He shouts: "Will somebody give me the answer?" He thinks he is the smartest prof on campus and everybody else is dumb. This prof is so stuck-up that it's not even worth having a conversation with him. Avoid Manny.
His Assignments are so hard
Lectures are kind of confusing
Very old prof. Looks like someone from the stone age.
Remember, his name is M Kolster. LOL LOL LOL LOL LOL
I think it's time for you to retire already, okay??!!
His lectures are garbage. All he does on the board is proofs and they are worthless. Try teaching something!!!
He is a very rude prof. I went to his office and his breath smelled like fish. He was breathing fish all over me. Not nice.
this guy is awesome, first day of class i said i could not see so he wrote a huge proof out 1 line per chalk board. Plus his name is Manfred!
I have had many profs in university, but still I think I least enjoyed going to this prof's lectures. His teaching is of lower quality than the junk they sell at the dollar store.
Very hot
Bad prof. his lectures are so boaaaarrinng. Will make you yawn and fall asleep. Does ridiculous proofs on the board and his hand writing is so bad.
I had this professor for MATH 2S3 many many years ago. He was boring, difficult, and a very mean marker. He grades your paper so harshly with no consideration of your feelings. Terrrrrrible proffff
Worst Professor in the history of Math professors. Terrible teaching. Poor quality.

He was a really bad prof. He needs to improve his handwriting and mark easy on students. If your solution doesn't match his template, he will not give you many part marks. He is a harsh grader with no mercy whatsoever. That is shameful. But other then that, he is a nice person.
Disappointing prof. His lectures are terrible and he has the worst handwriting in the whole world.
HE IS A VERY HARD MARKER
Best Prof. Lectures are very interesting. Lots of Proofs
GOOD PROF BUT VERY TOUGH
He was OK
Good prof with clear explainations but needs to do more examples in class.
VERY GOOD PROFESSOR
good prof
Tough prof, lectures very boring, the class average was VERY low on the midterm. I didn't enjoy his class, but I know people who did.
He is a very harsh grader
Good prof. He is pretty funny, although sometimes his lectures lack examples. Simple tests and assignments! Interesting course as well (all computational stuff!!)
Great prof. Handwriting is very sloppy so I could never figure out what he writes. Tuff exams...plus a bit mean marker, likes others have said.

He might be intimidating to students when they "take too long to think". But he can never be as bad as Dr. Haskell. He should teach 3E03 every year. I dont know why the department makes them alternate. He knows whats important, she doesn't.

Kolster has okay lectures and after you get used to his writing, some things can be taken out of his lectures.  His test was loosely based on what was done in class and was difficult.  If the textbook was good than having this sort of test would have not been a problem.  Unfortunately, the textbook is terrible.
Utterly useless. I couldn't get anything from his lectures. I don't recommend him to anybody.
Talks very sweetly but marks very bitterly. Don't believe any nice comments about him because he is the worst prof ever, even though he might seem like a nice guy.

Dr. Kolster is the man. If you don't know anything about math like the 1B students you really can't appreciate his teaching. If you are a math student you will love him; he has clear proofs, enthusiastic teaching, relatively short assignments and fair tests. He also has a great sense of humour.
Kolster is the most horrible math professor I have had!!

Kolster is a very helpful prof. He has lot of office hours and is available to help outside class. His lectures were very difficult and boring because he scribbles all over the board with proof questions, but final exam had very few proofs and mostly numericals, but the solving questions were like you've never seen before. I learnt more from the TA

Dr.Kolster is excellent at teaching. Obviously, if the only thing you know in Linear Algebra is row-reducing a matrix you will be diappointed in Math 2R03 with any prof and not just Dr.Kolster. For those saying Math 3E03 Dr.Kolster just did proofs, well it's obvious. Math 3E03 is a proofs-based course. His tests are not so bad and he's friendly.

Genuinely enjoys failing students. Loves the letter grade F and assigning it. Very mean, stern, and unforgiving prof. If you ask him for more marks on one question, he would remark your entire assignment and reduce marks on another question that you think was marked fairly. School and the city of Hamilton would be better off without him

Horrendous professor. Awful at explaining concepts. You will hate his voice. Out of every prof I've seen, Kolster's handwriting is the worst. Never provides any sample questions for exams, so they are quiet unpredictable. He's a two faced liar, that sweet talks on your face but gets a sadistic pleasure out of failing students or giving low marks.

His classes were quiet boring since he mostly did theory on the board. Midterm exam wasn't that bad (Class average 75%) but the final was absolutely brutal. He told us the final exam would be easy. Lied to us.  Lot of people dropped his course. The assignments were very theoretical and tough. 55% average on Asst 1. He was too tough on summer class.
Terrible prof. Just terrible.

***WORST*** professor I've ever encountered. This man is an extremely harsh grader. He marks with no mercy whatsoever if you don't have what he wants as an answer. You write so much and he gives marks like 0/5 if he's not happy. You try to reason with him, or beg and plead for 1 more mark, he ain't gonna give it to you. A very stubborn prof.

In all honesty Kolster is the WORST math prof I've seen at McMaster. His handwriting is extremely unclear...scribles on the board...his accent is really annoying. He does only theory in lecture and expects you to learn a lot of stuff on your own. Don't believe any of the good reviews about him. If you're not REALLY smart, you will fail his class
BORING
Excellent prof
he is great
Great prof. Course was pretty easy, as was the exam. His lecture notes are also a great supplement to the book as he often does things differently (but in a better way).
Hard course but good prof
only one word to describe him: "MARRRVELLOUS!!!!!!!" and same with his chalk.
he's jokes, and notes from his lectures are great, which helps bcuz the algebra textbook is useless.  and the accent = awesome
This guy is a good teacher and a really funny guy.  Love his accent and love his witty remarks to people!  Strongly recommend you have him as a prof!
Great prof!He's very funny.My favourite class.
Manfred Kolster is the funniest professor of math at McMaster. Very helpful, very clear and very interesting. Take any course he is teaching!
This guy is a star!
Amazingly funny, smart, gentle, and good at teaching.  I admire him a lot.
HE'S THE BEST!
THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER!!!
This guy is great, he's so ridiculously funny. He told us that life is not always continuous. great accent too.
Good prof.
No Comments
best at mac for math
No Comments
i love calculus classes n the prof. makes it all the more interesting.
sometimes gets so involved he writes on three boards at once. funny, cool accent
great prof, knows his stuff, insecure about his diagrams

comments: Dr. Armstrong is a fantastic prof. Her lectures and the readings that she chooses are almost all interesting. She's humorous and a fair marker.

One of the best professors! She was very knowledgeable and her lectures were well organized, which made it easy to take notes and understand the course material. A very friendly woman! Can't wait to have her again!
She was great at relating ideologies and philosophies with the present. A lot of righting but the course was fun.

Complete crap. Her lectures are not organized in such a way that you can easily understand the concepts or information given. I had to reformat all of my notes and resort to the text book to make sure that she covered the topics that were important. She is also extremely slow not when speaking, but the pace of the lecture.

Not a very good teacher. Didn't really catch the material in her class too well because she was not exactly the best at explaining it. Not that I'm a slow learner or anything (I'm a straight A student, her class included), I'm actually learning in all my other classes. Didn't really get my tuition money's worth from her class, to say the least.

She is friendly.But her outlines are ridiculously confusing and her lectures are all over the place. Took too long to hand back essays (said she'd have them done by Tuesday, then Wednesday, then finally got it back Thursday). Handed back essays during final exam - very distracting. Gave us exam essay questions before writing the exam, which is good
good
Brilliant professor- easily one of my favorites.

She clearly loves what she does. I look forward to her lectures and they never disappoint. Although she does go off on the occasional tangent she uses her time well and is organized. Her clarity as to what she expects from assignments leaves something to be desired as the majority of student's first essays were done "incorrectly."

She'll go through all the topics with you, but she'll focus on just one common thing throughout all the topics and that's religion. If your not big into religion I really wouldn't take this class. Note taking is awful because she verbally expresses all the information, so make sure your either a fast writer or typer.
i looked forward to each and everyone of her classes. She's very passionate about history, and every history student has to love that!

It's amazing how much enthusiasm she can fit into her micro-sized body.  She's got a quirky sense of humour and is incredibly helpful.  Good with constructive criticism and uber-friendly to speak with.  Be warned though - even if you're talking at the back of a 500-seat lecture hall, she sees all.
can you say "tangents?"
Brilliant prof.  Nothing more needs to be said.

Really enthusiastic professor, who emphasizes some things in the course way too much.  Bad class for taking notes as every that is expressed verball seems very important at the moment, but an interesting class nonetheless.  Tough class too fall asleep in.
Amazing prof! She is so nice and helpful... and you can always tell that she really loves her field of study! Very enthusiastic speaker!

At first her enthusiasm is overwhelming but then you realize that she just LOVES history! I really like her and she seems like a prof really interested not only in their topic but in teaching too! She's is particularly nice and easy to talk to!

I disagree w/ the previous post. I can see your point about the cost for 2nd text since isn't req'd reading, but I found it very useful.  And, her lecturing is only boring if you do not enjoy the topic... I like her a lot and find her lectures clear and informative.  She's also very helpful if you talk to her after class.

Has anyone that has already written taken her class? She is dull and boring. She completely hijacked this course which was supposed to be on Medieval Society and changed it into a course on the Italian Renaissance. The req' book also came with another book that we do not use ONCE in the class. SHAME SHAME SHAME Dr Armstrong... WE ARE POOR STUDENTS!
Take this class if you want some unfactual information, and are interested in seeing a prof murder the French Revolution.
Enthusiastic and passionate about her work.  Super friendly and funny while in lecture.  Really makes the class and topic fun.
Super friendly, very enthusiastic and passionate about her field.
Interesting and entertaining lectures. Very friendly unless you are caught talking during lectures, then she is slightly scary with her scolding. Really helpful essay feedback.
Dr. Armstrong is very funny. she makes the lectures entertaining and interesting.
She is very funny and explains everything well.
