comments: Not the most charismatic but a solid prof. Underrated. Exams are easy if you can manage to study the boring material. Very nice man who has all the time in the world to help his students-IF-you show him the respect he deserves; if you treat him poorly, well, what do you expect in return? A good professor.

Worst professor I've had at a university. Hard to understand, what he says makes little sense, and useless when it comes to providing good answers. Anyone who thinks highly of him has never had a real economics prof.
Firms vs. Farms.. Fred Aswani is a pure genius when it comes to economics.. He teaches well and is really approachable

Whoever said that he is a nice professor doesn't know what teaching is really about. Professor Aswani is really unreliable, misses classes without giving a notice. It feels like he is just there for some kind of attendance that the dean of the faculty takes. Otherwise he would not be there and you are the last thing that he cares about. Everything
Horrible teacher, repeats the same thing over and over but doesnt clarify. Cancels class without any notice, in the summer when people go to school for 1 class.

He's the worst professor I've ever had. His accent isn't the reason he's hard to understand, it's because what he says makes no sense. Very unprepared, and his boring, slow, lackluster style of teaching makes attendance very low in his classes.

In my four years at three different universities, I have never seen a professor as bad as Fred Aswani. He's often late, cancels classes last minute, is unprepared, ignores good questions, and is difficult to follow. Worst of all, HE WALKS AWAY FROM STUDENTS WHILE THEY ARE TALKING TO HIM. He has no business dealing with any people at all.

I have a few complaints. First off, he is not helpful at all. He is rude and inconsiderate to students. When students speak up in class he shuts them down with sarcastic remarks. Personally, I had gone to him seeking advice after receiving a low grade, he was rude and sarcastic. He is extremely inconsiderate.
DO NOT MISS CLASS, PERIOD

Hard to understand, late for class about once every 2 weeks, and I don't feel like he prepared us well for the midterms. I was NOT expecting that level of difficulty. Although, his notes are useful if you bring them to class, but otherwise they are hard to follow (ie: if you didn't show up). Ended up dropping the course after the first midterm.

Fred is decent prof. His notes are very useful making the textbook completely unnecessary. Most importantly he gives out lots of practice questions and quizes which are really helpful to prepare for the tests and exam. It's sometimes hard to understand certain words he says,you should be able to understand what hes saying if your paying attention

Dr. Aswani is very knowledgable about economics but has an extremely thick Jamaican accent which some students find hard to understand.  However, if you listen really closely, he is not that bad at all and you can understand him.  Some words to beware of: He pronouces firms as "farms". He makes pretty good notes too.

This guy is the definition of horrible. Why McMaster employs this man is incomprehensible. He's late, hard to understand, unclear with course material, writes somewhat hard tests while not preparing us well enough for them. Teaching is SIMPLY not his best quality.... not even close.

Fred has clear student expectations, presents the material well and an entertainer (guarantee to make you laugh). Textbook is useless (notes sufficient). He posts practise questions that makes it easy to get full marks on short answers for tests. Understand the material for the multiple choice Qs, don't memorize. Go to him for help, not the TAs.

He knows what he's talking about, but he's completely incomprehensible. He has a thick African accent and even mentions in class that he refuses to change it because he is proud of his heritage. That's fine; but he shouldn't be in a career where communication is important because you can't understand anything he says.
Very energetic and cheerful professor.  His enthusiasm for economics helped maintain the attention of the class.

Aswani is an amazing prof.  He gives you THE BEST notes and helpful quizzes. He explains concepts very well on the board with excellent examples.  By the second or third class, you'll get used to the accent.  Aswani is VERY knowledgable in economics and most importantly, he knows HOW to teach. Exams are fair but most of the theory is from the book.
Recipient of the Baller of the year award 5 years running. Very funny man.
Fall08: Not an easy course. Couldn't understand what he was teaching. The beginning of the course is easier than the latter half. Final was really tough. Easy to do well in online quizzes (Aplia).
No point to being in the same room as him. Utter waste of time.
His exam and tests are hard but if you go to class it shouldnt be TOO bad overall. Watch out for him skipping steps - he does this alot.
Fred is great! go to class, I didn't buy the text, eng and mgt will find this easy with knowledge of derivatives/math. commerce beware of math content fred is not always clear on steps

Very hard to understand in the beginning. Go to every class - he often teaches things that aren't in his notes. The texbook is completely useless. He will give you hints about what to expect on the exam, but he will change the numbers so you probably won't recognize the problems. The course gets easier, but the beginning is very difficult.

I really enjoyed Fred's lectures, he is such an enthusiastic prof!!! Way more interesting than any other econ course I've taken. Although his tests and assignments were tough, if you use lecture notes and textbook, you'll do fine. Although his accent was sometimes strong, I found that it doesn't take long to get used to it.

Terrible experience with this guy.  During the mid-term reviews he would tell us not to worry about certain sections only to have them show up on the final!  Thanks a lot Fred. His lectures were lousy and poorly prepared.  Stay away!  This is the worst prof I've had in my 3 years at Mac.

I think he's a good prof. His tests and exams are fair. His notes and practice quizzes are very useful. Read the book, study his notes and his quizzes, try to do as many math problems as you can, you'll end up with a good mark.

If you want FREDDY in your life take his class, otherwise take it with someone other than FRED. His exams are hard and poorly prepared; his accent is terrible. He skips many steps. He is very lazy. Worst prof in McMaster. If you have to take his class you should visit econ clinic, those guys are very helpful and better than FRED. GOOD LUCK.
Funny and a good guy but a terrible teacher and his tests/exams are the hardest you'll ever have to take.  SWITCH teacher if possible or prepare for the worse mark you have ever gotten

He love to teach,very patient when you ask for help in his office hour,so he is great!His notes help a lot,but the testbook is a crap!Do all his practice quiz &test,it will help you to get through the tests.But the final is very tough!

Fred's a nice guy, but he certainly can't teach. If you try  learning out of the book-it's crap and he even told me that. So you have to resort to his lecture notes which seem fine, until you write his exams and realize that he skips sections in his notes. IF YOU ARE in commerce and have to take this class-trust me!- don't take it with FRED!
Poorly prepared exams, you don't know what he is asking. Book is not helpful. Aswani is the worst prof that I've seen in my life. Avoid to take his class or you will struggle a lot.

He is real jerk. I don't understand why faculty still keeps him? He thinks he is our boss but wrong, we are the bosses, we pay his salary. His accent is terrible. His exams are very hard.He told he is going to pick questions from book(BIG LIE).He has many mistakes on his exams. I bet if he is fired from McMaster, He can't  find a job in Tim Horton.

Couldn't understand him through his accent.  Cut corners explaining stuff. On the final exam (and midterm) he marked me wrong on an answer, that I proved was right in the textbook, but refused to give me even half marks on the question(s). I re-took the course the next semester in a night course, and got an A.  *5.5/10*
Easy peasy
He had problems in explaining the theories clearly.More importantly. he should've made the tests easier if he couldn't explain them to us.
amazing teacher, best first year econ prof there is

I went to 2/3 of my classes and didn't even buy the text book and I still found the class to be fun and reasonably easy. I loved how he makes you call him Fred. And don't forget that you can't leave early, he will say goodbye as you leave if you do.

Not sure about the bad ratings becuase he's a fun guy. However, I find that he cuts too many corners teaching and dosen't fully explain things... he shows 1 example of something that has 5 and then decides to summarize. I wish he was more detailed in his explanations and didn't use short forms. However, he is one of the better 1st year econ profs.
hilarious. i didn't go often, but only cuz the course was too easy. takes a bit to get used to his accent, but he will repeat or slow down. incredibly nice and approchable and often let us go early
great teacher cared alot about our success
No Comments
Avoid him like the plague!!!
Aswani is the best econ prof, he actually makes class fun and worht going to.

great prof!! yes, he has an accent but you get used to it.  he tests you on exactly what he teaches in class.  he clearly loves economics.  he really should turn off his celly during class though.  especially when it rings like 5 times.
awful prof. can't understand him. easy but he is so lazy.
very slow class but he talks too loud for you to get any sleep which is pretty annoying
Awful prof. U cant understand what he talks about. "firm" and "farm" for him is the same. if u ask him questions, u will die becasue he will complain u or mad u/ trust me, dont take his couse/
dont ever take his class. He always blames ppl when they went asking him questions. Told us to focus on the graphs and didn't test any at all. Used only 15 minutes to teach one chapter.

It's kind of funny seeing someone complaining about Prof. Aswani's English (two below this) when he or she doesn't know the difference between "you're" and "your."  "Your" is possessive and is not the contraction for "your are" that you were seeking.  Irony.
Fred is a very approachable guy who loves what he is doing. This made the class much more enjoyable for me
This guy can't speak english and is probably one of the worst teachers ever at mac. I highly suggest you switch out of any of his classes because your going to hate life.

some people are just stupid. i never had an easier prof. perhaps if some of you actually OPENED the bloody book and read it, then you would have done fine. so stop complaining and maybe your GPA is as low as it is because you shouldnt be in university. find yourself a job in McDonalds.
Very **** prof just because you're black doesn't mean you have to make fun of other people.  Learn to speak like a mature adult. Do not recommmend this prof.

Really awful prof ! First of all you cant understand what! Second of all he makes economics seem so complicated when it isn't that hard! Third of all his tests are hard!! and some of the questions make no sense. He has to lie and say the computer made a mistake in order to boost up marks by 5%!AWFUL
worst prof, at Mac... if ur in commerce and get him for 1st year try to change ur class
Bad prof ever! can not teach!

He is impossible to understand, my section has the lowest class average in econ 1b03 at mcmaster, and his inability to speak english is obvious on his tests too. Lowest mark I have had in my entire life in one of the easiest first year commerce classes. My 74% is bringing the average WAY up!

Funny guy, but cannot teach to save his life. He relates everything back to Math b/c he used to be a math professor and is not able to seperate math from INTRO economics. Lots of mistakes on his tests. Funny but bad @ teaching.
lectures are ok
Fred is a good guy. Needs to buy a faster car tho cause he's late a lot.
Awesome prof... very funny!... Online notes were a big help!.. very approachable and very reasonable with tests!:)
sucked...  judges you b4 anything...
I still have no idea on what he's talking about.
this guy is worst professor to ever step foot on university soil...
Funny prof, he has tried his best I believe.  His materials are reasonable and he stays on track for what he has taught! One of the coolest economics prof at Mac
Cool professor, but diffenetly can not teach
fred is a great guy, always joking and trying to make lectures more interesting. online notes are great! overall i would consider his class and tests fair, but boring.
very fair with tests, hard to understand at first but u get used to it. Very approachable and friendly, and pretty funny in lectures, but is pretty unorganized. online notes a big help!!
NICE GUY!
One of the nicest profs you'll find!  Accent was tough the first week, but you adapt.  Honestly, great prof!  Very fair testing.
Fred + The Hulk = AWESOME micro & macro economics life lessons.
Really nice guy whose tests are more than fair. OK so the accent can be a barrier at first, after a few weeks you learn to adapt. Overall, Fred's a champ.
Poor organization, hard to understand and overall a poor teacher. Shame on you Fred, shame on you!
doesn't go into enough detail, covers material too fast, expects students know it all to begin with
sooooo hard to understand, crazy hard tests...
not a very organized mofo
HE IS A NICE GUY!
No Comments
Dropped this class the first day, couldnt understand a word he said...but he seemed like a very nice man
could hardly understand his speech..

comments: Our 4A seminar was amazing. Kubursi is such a great professor. But he is always gone and cancelled alot of classes.

simply brilliant. He is just an awesome guy; great speaker, tough but fair, very engaging. Except, he's always off in Lebanon when you need to meet with him...Mac's most famous prof, take him if you can

I've posted before. Now, having taken 3T03 and 3HH3 (development and trade), i URGE anyone interested in taking 2F03 to first take one of these two courses. Kubursi does not go over HO or trade models well. These two courses are so helpful this course.

Being in my fourth year, all I can say is that by far it's one of the best courses I've taken and Kubursi is definitely one of the brightest and smartest profs at MAC. He is an excellent teacher and material covered in the course is extremely interesting.

Amazing prof. Really makes you learn the material. Probably one of the best profs I have had at mac, if you are thinking of taking this course and want to be challenged definitely take it with Dr Kubursi!

To echo others, Dr. Kubursi is one of the best profs I've ever had.  He's challenging, but fair. If you are interested, you will learn a lot from the class and will not regret taking it.  He is very student friendly, smart, helpful and an interesting person to talk to.
If he spent as much time teaching as he did promoting himself, then he wouldn't have a single negative review. I definitely wouldn't take another class with this guy.
Not helpful at all
Great teacher who knows his stuff.
very unhelpful; not recommended
Definately not the easiest prof around but I must say, he is a brilliant man. The BEST professor I've had so far.

One of the best teachers I have ever had.  You want a prof to be "hard" - that way you'll learn something.  He is brilliant, accomplished, passionate, and honest.  What else could you ask for?  Ignore the unqualified comments - Kubursi is top-notch.
No Comments
Just dropped the course. He's mean and sadistic. Too old-fashioned. Needs to start showing more respect.

The best Prof I have ever had. I was lost before meeting Atif and have now done an MA in econ and gone to law school.   He is political, but if you have a good argument, he will respect you. And some have mentioned that he doesn't know his stuff. They are undergrads... He is very, very accomplished
He's awesome!  Very enthusiastic and engaging.  And did you know that he was the economic advisor to Sadaam Husain in the 80s?  I love this man!

He really knows his stuff and his lectures are very interesting but his tests have very little to do with the lecture material.  He will ask you questions like "In 1969, who said this...".  And worst of all he never mentioned who said it!
Really energetic and interesting. Tough marker but gets you thinking. Who says he's not cute?
actually knos nothing
my favourite prof so far. knows his stuff, delivers it effectively.
the worst ever. Even NO course website !!

Awesome lectures. You'll learn a lot from him. Not open to other people's opinions. More like a preacher than a prof. Marks hard on tests. Crazy hard multiple choice questions. He never gives you full marks for short answer questions. You won't get an A.
A brilliant man I must say. This guy is extremely resourceful. If you want pull get in with this guy. He was a former chief economist at OPEC and has done a number of other substantial things.
Most politically biased teacher i've ever had. Has little tolerance for different opinions. In his defence - he is very energetic and gets his point across although not in an academic way.
nice guy but i think he seems like he knows more than he does.  fundamentally...
Guys...you must undastand..he was great!!
good class.  wish i had his energy!
excellent course, great teaching, entertaining, lots of reading
A great orator and truly inspiring professor
Great Prof, very interesting lecturer, never a dull moment. Truly involving.

comments: Dr Valliant is someone everybody can aspire to be more like. Chem is chem (we all know its no fun) but I enjoyed every single class with him. He's knowledgeable, caring, and very approachable. He even helped me with some chemistry questions I had in a different class. I wish he could teach me every class! Plus he's a total stud; Dr V can't be beat!

Awesome prof, he's a very funny guy, and makes the material interesting which is hard to do with orgo.  His tests are brutal, but you can't really blame him since the registrar has decided orgo is the weed out class for second year.

Dr. Valliant is truly one of THE BEST profs at mac. Very helpful and was easy. Excellent teaching style: stressed all the enthusiastic, made the course fun, despite its difficulty. Exam main points with his voice and emphasized through repetition.
a bit cocky.  Try Harrison's class. Valliant's overrated.

A really good prof. He knows how to teach orgo and makes it easier to understand for those who despise it. very nice voice. Its not his fault if anyone does bad in this class. Watch out for the second test, and do tons of practice frim the back of the book. Make use of the help centre.

Dr. Valliant is a great teacher, just too bad he has to teach such a difficult class.  I hate orgo but he made it bearable.  And he is absolutely THE cutest prof I have ever had.  There's just something about a man who thinks orgo is fun....lol

Dr. Valliant is a great lecturer...he just has a very nice voice.  The notes were really clear and everything, I just think the purpose of organic chemistry is to screw you over, so it's not a bad reflection on Dr. Valliant at all in my mind, it just sucks that we were required to take the course.

THE worst class ive had the misfortune of taking in my life!  And that says a lot in itself.  Though Dr. Valliant may make a wonderful public speaker, the course itself was so horrible.  I cant wait for the end of the year so that I can bury my organic chem books and never look at them ever again!!!
Clear examples and explanations in class, but watch out for the second test and final!
very tough prof

Very eloquent speaker..highly impressive...good flow of lectures and followed textbook quite closely which was good. However the tests did not follow the textbook???? Therefore he tests did not reflect the lectures appropriately?

Very good prof, explains things stepwise.  Very effective way of teaching class despite the difficulty of the course.  Tests were hard, but the lectures were awesome.  Many things were learned.  Candy is great too!
I just had the second test of the term. The hardest thing I ever saw. Discussion forums on the course web site are full already! Aprt from screwing people over, good in class.
well he's just too HOT to not go to class. So good looking. also very interesting to listen to. I can't help but feel in a trance when I hear him talk and look into his eyes.
Not as clear as other profs.
Whoever said he enjoys screwing over his students is bang-on!
Terrible
The tests and exam are killer. I don't really understand what's his appeal. He seems to enjoy screwing his students over.
he's an absolutely awesome professor. Not only is he good at teaching, he also gives out candy, takes class pics, and is SO FUNNY ! i luved going to his classes
True, it was a hard class... but his lectures were awesome and he was always willing to help!  And he is soooo hot!
His tests were brutal, his lectures were very fast and he discouraged people from asking queistions because it slowed him down.
Nice guy - his tests are killer tho! Sometimes he just bulldozes through the material without really seeming to care that more than half the class doesn't have a clue to whats going on
The man teaches well, however posts blank lecture notes, which are off no use!  The tests and exam weren't great either.
he's great and always makes the effort to make his students laugh. and it is true, he is very hot!
he's a great professor very helpful very approachable! and sooo damn hot!!
Yo Da Man !

comments: It would be nice if he could go through at least one lecture without insulting students to their face about their lack of intelligence.
One of the worst profs I've had in university!
very good prof, but you really need to be able to listen and think at the same time when attending his lectures...
very good professor, he will really help you if you ask for help....

This guy is absolutely awful.  Goes off on tangents constantly, which is very distracting.  He is an atrocious lecturer, his blackboard notes are piss poor, and his organization of the material is abysmal.  Very social but his comments are sometimes off-putting.  Having stats with him will most likely turn you off the subject permanently.
Great teacher. He is insanely smart and has very insightful ways of thinking about math. People who don't like him, care too much about marks and less about learning.
He is very intelligent. He's too smart to be a prof. (I think this is why many people dislike him. ) I respect him a lot. He's great.

This man loves what he does, that's for sure. Great guy but tends to lose students in class by going off on tangents; get ready to use your textbook a lot. Also, I have to say that I loved his breakdowns of midterms/exam - straight to the point, fair, and quite helpful.

I love his philosophies on life and little quirks that goes on in life. He also makes jokes, which I find really interesting and helps me keep interest and awake. He is a genuine nice guy who wants his students to succeed. I feel you just need to hang around his office and just ask questions in his office hours.

Good: Enthusiastic, Tests/quizzes are fair and exactly what he says they will be. Bad: His teaching is disorganized and extremely confusing (seems as though he doesn't prepare enough for lecturing), Goes off on useless tangents about philosophy/life. Suggestions for students: Read the textbook, Do the practice tests, Hang out around Min-Oo's office

Minoo has some very teaching superior abilities which are never recognized by the students. Students who think Minoo is a bad professor should not be studying at University level. Minoo is a true mathematician who deserves all the fame and respect than a lot of other math profs at McMaster. I am very surprised that this true genius is under-rated.
god bless him
Very bad professor
It's so easy to get a good grade in his classes, without knowing anything. He rocks :)

Amazing professor. Thinks very highly of his colleagues and talks about them on their back about how great they are, and how much he aspires to be like them. He often talks about how much he loves the math department at mcmaster and his colleagues, who are true mathematicians. He said he is very lucky to be working here. Very respectful professor.

His classes really make you think. If you want to learn how to be a deep thinker, be sure to take every course taught by him. Excellent professor. He has a great social life. He is very friendly with students. When you go to his office, he engages in lengthy conversations about intiutive mathematical concepts. Really a pleasure to know him.

He was a great prof. He really wanted you to learn. As long as you were willing to learn things, he did an excellent job of teaching it. He was very approachable, and always seemed to be in a good mood.
He's my favourite prof.

excellent professor. For me he is # 1. The # 1 Math Prof ever therefore I'm giving him all 1's in his ratings because nobody is better then him. Hope to take his 3rd and 4th year courses in the future.

I am a straight A student. Every math mark I received was either an A or A+. I took Minoo's math3Z03 course since people said it was so easy, a "bird" math-credit, and he gave me a B+ even though I got excellent marks on the assignments, did great presentations. It was very unexpected and came off as a huge shock. He even gave B's and B-'s to some.
Ken is a greeeeeeeeeat prof. Ooooh yeaaaah!

Best prof ever. Has genuine interest in teaching. Teaches like no other prof. Challenges students to think, creates an interactive and dynamic learning environment, engages in mind blowing stimulating discussions. McMaster is lucky to have such a genius prof in their faculty. His geometry course is the best math class I have ever taken. A+ for mino

greatest professor I have ever seen. I salute you. You are worth an honarary degree. He makes mcmaster proud and mcmaster is lucky to have such a genuine and genius prof like maung. Keep up with the great work and all the best for your career.
The final exam was very hard. I get A+ in every course but he gave me only A.
Professor Min is an excellent Prof. I love him.

Minoo is an excellent professor. His love for the subject is very admirable. He was always willing to help students out... even if it meant going out of his way. I spent many hours in his office and developed a much better understanding of the material as a result. Minoo is truly a genius and deserves a great deal of respect.

I hated the course because Min-oo never explained well. He set unreasonable demands on students and was condescending and unhelpful whenever approached for help. He hates helping students. Gives them dirty looks outside the classroom as if he does not know you. His Assignments were very unreasonable and difficult and he offered no help to students
He Assigned us random grades based on his overall impression on the student, and not based on his/her work and efforts in the course. Huge disappointment in the end.

Extremely Boring. Turned me off the subject forever. After him, I don't think I'm intersted to take any more math courses. I got A's in first year math, but this prof does not how to teach. His handwriting is so bad!! I suggest people to take Math 2X03 instead of Math 2A03. Take 2X03 and 2XX3 so you can avoid Minoo

Low quality lectures combined with hard exams and a poor attitude towards students created an all around bad learning experience. Taking minoo's math course is the last thing I would recommend someone in the world.

This professor was horrible. He has low teaching ability and will make you hate the subject material. His lectures are so annoying and I most definitely donot recommend anyone to take a course taught by him.
Minoo is my favourite professor. I LOVE HIM!!
I completely agree. My math skills have been honed big time after taking his course. It has honed my problem solving ability. Taking his course will make you the next einstein!! He is that good.

AMAZING Prof. If you are a serious math student who wants to HONE his/her problem solving skills, I strongly recommend you take a course taught by NONE OTHER THEN KENNETH MIN00. He will teach you how to think like a mathematician and hone your problem solving ability not just in math, but also in "real life problems"!!Brilliant prof. Very helpful!!

He's an amazing prof and such a good helper for his students. He's always available to answer questions any time. Overall he's the best prof at McMaster university and even among top 10% in North America !!
Very helpful,very nice,very smart.always care about students.His lectures are enjoyable for smart students. He's such a great prof.McMaster should be proud of him.

He is very intelligent, so it is difficult for mediocre students to understand what he is teaching. He is aware of that and is trying to "dumb down" his teaching style to accommodate the "weaker" students. Good luck Min-Oo!
Terrible prof with bad teaching. Mumbles when talks. Unreasonable Assignments for this course and not very helpful either. Has a lot of attitude
He was very Unfair. He is very rude outside class room and unwilling to help students.
perfect prof.He cares about his students and he's very helpful. he's such a genius prof. I am really enjoying his lectures and learning a lot
Perfect prof. Always helpfull and he's very smart.
He is very cute and very SMART.
Awesome professor. He is a great mathematician and seems to enjoy teaching, especially this course. Excellent job Dr. Min-Oo. He is Genius, Clear, very Faire, and Interesting.

Dr. Min-Oo is one of the best professors I know at McMaster. His style of teaching is great. He explains the subject very clearly and makes you interested in the math. He is also very funny and has a good sense of humour which makes the class even more interesting.
He's the best, better than the rest
perfect prof
I have never understand math the way I do now in Min-Oo's class. He is really unique. I like the way he explains.I rate him amoung the best 10% prof in north America!!
A perfect prof. I am learning something new after each lecture. He's amazing. you enjoy math with him
Extreeeemely helpful.Very nice guy and super smart. I really respect him.

Prof Min-Oo is the best prof I've ever had at McmMaster he's very helpful and really wants us to learn the course material he's genius and very smart and maybe guys who complain here are just finding it hard to pass or to have a good grade so they blame the prof. I am very lucky to have this term such a great prof. I am learnig a lot in his class.

One of the only math profs at MAC who takes the time to understand and help his students.Great teacher and very approachable.teaching style is unique and motivating!Min-Oo is very open to questions and is a great prof to go to for quidance!would def recommend taking this course with him, a great experience!

Dr. Minoo?s 3Z03 is probably the most practical class among other math courses. His class is not easy, yet gives you an opportunity to apply/use mathematics in real world. At the same time, many of his lectures make you think, not memorize formulas. I did not get a high mark but I think at least it gives me a different aspect of mathematics.
I'd give him negative marks if possible. He does not deserve 1 out of 5 even. He is really that bad. Go Figure!!

Dr. Min-Oo is very enthusiastic about the history of math and genuinely cares about his students.If you put in the effort you will be happy with the results.Receiving a bad mark is not a reflection of his teaching style but more of your dedication as a student.Very approachable prof and always willing to go the extra mile to help his students.

Dr. Min-Oo is very interested in the topics covered in 3GP3 and it showed in every lecture. The homework was very challenging but he was always willing to give his students useful hints (for any problems - not just 3GP3!) both in and out of office hours. He inspired me to apply to graduate school for math to continue my education.
This prof is totally WORTHLESS in all aspects. That one words sums up everything about his teaching and about him.
Boring

You're all just too used to being spoon fed. Min-Oo holds insightful lectures and connects the deeper aspects of the theory to their current use and significance in other areas of Math. and Physics. Min-Oo has results in geometry that the entire world uses. In his class you are expected to read the book and learn the 'easy' stuff on your own, he wi

He was horrible for the 2nd year calculus course. He has no teaching skills at ALL!!! My friends who took 3rd year history of math course with him have told me that he was the worst prof ever, who assigned grades based on whether he thinks you are a smart student and your overall impression on him. He is a terrible prof and he should be fired.
he was so unfair
Hilarious. I loved going to lecture with him, because everything seemed as if it were really exciting.... Not the best at clear explanations or organization. I learned everything from the textbook.

The professor was always available during stated office hours and enjoyed the subject he was teaching. There was usually clear demarcation between knowledge that was required for tests/assignments and knowledge that was not. The only real flaw with this course was that there was no assigned textbook; this was the result of a departmental snafu.
He hated me and gave me B even though I deserved A-

I took 3Z03 with him and loved it.  He always talked about things that made math sound fascinating.  So I took 3GP3 thinking it would be fun, especially since the class had no physics prerequisites I was sure I could handle it since I took geometry.  Wrong!  Every lecture I had NO idea what was going on!  It was actually INSANE

Prof has no teaching skills. He kills time by going off topic about various things irrelevant to the lecture. He thinks he's very smart and degrades his colleagues. He thinks he's a genius but he is not. His handwriting is so terrible!! Don't bother enrolling in any course taught by Min-oO

Dr. Min-Oo tends to drift off the point too much, which obscured his oft-profound insights. He basically GAVE us the test questions beforehand, which is good for the grades, but I'm positive it's going to come back to haunt us all next semester. There's no doubt he's a brilliant man, but he's not much of a professor.
Horrible prof, goes on tangents about irrelevant things. Very mean and impolite outside of classroom.
I made Min-Oo for both 3g and 3z. Great prof. and great teacher. Very smart and makes the students think like real mathematicains.

WORSTEST prof ever...shame of the math department. Lowest quality professor of our math department. Feel sorry for all students who have to deal with this idiot. He's a complete tool. He talks to himself and mumbles. Doesn't have any teaching skills. Awful handwriting. Likes to get salary for free, without doing anything. Bad attitude prof.
WORST TEACHER EVER! He doesn't even talk about math in lectures, he just complains about something random that he chooses for that day. It's horrible.. I've had 4 classes with him =(

Be careful if you wanna take math 3z03 with him. Minoo will only give you a good grade if he liked you as a person. It doesn't matter whether your paper is good or not. Trust me on this one! This year Minoo decided he will not give A+ to anyone.  If you want to avoid a surprise mark avoid him! If he happens to like you, he will give you an A or A-
I'm 99% sure he read the papers, just so you know.
mean, unfair, goes of on random speeches that have nothing to do with the course but just feed his big ego. does more complaining than teaching.

EXTREMELY UNFAIR MAN. GIVES GRADES WITHOUT ANY JUSTIFICATION. I CANT BELIEVE MCMASTER UNIVERSITY KEEPS THIS MAN EMPLOYED. A TOTAL DISGRACE TO OUR EDUCATION. MAUNG MIN-OO IS  A CERTIFIED LIAR. A LIAR WHO TOLD OUR CLASS ON THE LAST DAY THAT HE WOULD E-MAIL EACH OF US OUR INDIVIDUAL GRADES BUT NEVER DID,  BECAUSE HE NEVER READ AMY PAPERS. HORRBLE PROF

The most lazy and unfair professor at mcmaster university. He's a shame for the math dept to have him here. He randomly assigns grades to students. Doesnot even have the courtesy to answer students emails. So lazy, rude, and lied to our class.

He doesn't really know how to teach; really likes to talk and get all the attention. In the term he picks his favourite students, makes sure they get an A+. As for the rest of us, he just gives a random mark (usually very low) without justification. unfortunately I had to also have him for analysis in 2nd year.
he is very mean
Dr. Min-Oo inspired me to notice the beauty in mathematics. He is the best prof at Mac! Very enthusiastic, he loves math!

Easy class. Good prof, cool and laid back, will give you extensions. He's reaaally into math and seems to know a bit about everything even if it's not his area of research. No midterms, no final. What can be better?
Very unclear teaching, but willing to help.  Still doesn't make up for the fact that pretty much no one really learned anything. ANALYSIS SHOULD WAIT TILL 3RD YEAR!
Excellent class.... you made me love math again!
Best Prof at Mac.

Great guy but he just will not shut up! Easy tests, but his lectures are bizarre. They are comparable to going to watch a stand-up comedy act that is not that funny. There was one class where he didn't mention a single thing from the course...he just rambled on about his person life. Oh my.
It is a very interesting course and a very funny pro
A very enthusiastic prof.  sooo much passion for math.  very nice and glad to help you if you ask him for help
Dr. Min-Oo is extremely enthusiastic about math and he is great in his office hours (if he will stop talking), but his classes are just an hour of total randomness.
WOW!  It took awhile to find an amazing prof, but here he is.  Min-oo is great, and anyone who didn't understand him really was sleeping in class.
All my real analysis I learned from him! Min- oo rules!!! It should be written on a big poster at the entrance to Hamilton Hall.

Nice personality but has a thick and unsual accent which makes his speech difficult to understand.  Also he alludes to many stories about how he is viewed as poor by others, and has a tendency to put down himself.  On the whole, study from the text book!
trying way too hard to be cool, lose those sandles!!!

A DOG IS A FUNCTION!??  you see a dog once, and it's like any other dog so u know it's a dog! just like that, u see a function, it's like any other function, it's a function!  THERE I SAVED YOU THREE CLASSES! Just read the book on your own, will y
Nice guy but sometimes I didn't know when he was teaching or just chatting. Interesting stories though...
The most fun and helpful prof ever
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Got to work on your organization!
No Comments
brilliant prof, sometimes gets a little carried away though, but fun.
interesting ramblings, learn more than just math, no reason to do poorly
Total genius, but terribly confusing and messy notes!

comments: Great professor. Everyone likes him.

HEATHORN! Where to begin. You literally made my first year 10000x better. You are amazing and your lectures are great. Those jokes are on point. Real talk tho, will you marry me because you are mighty fine and I'm really into that accent of yours. Oh yea but if you're thinking of taking this class do it because Heathorn is obviously incredible.

favourite prof 1st semester of my 1st year he is an amazing lecturer he makes everything so engaging. You can really tell he's knows what he's teaching and loves history. Honestly the textbook is a bit dense but if you good a lectures you don't have to read it. Plus he makes jokes sometimes and is really approachable. No way you wont love him
Everyone likes him. Amazing lecturer!

heathorn has such a soothing voice and accent that it makes it easy to fall asleep in class, but his interesting, well structured, hilarious, and useful lectures keep me awake. can't wait to take another course with this dude!! definitely hot in an old guy way

Amazing course! Dr. Heathorn is one of the most helpful teachers and makes sure you understand the content. The assignments are hard but he always allows students to do well if you put in the work. Lectures are a must - he bases exam questions from them!
Amazing lectures. He presents content in an engaging and straightforward way.  Passionate, knowledgeable and articulate. One of the best history profs out there.

Dr. Heathorn is a knowledgeable and enthusiastic prof. His expectations are clear and he will reward you for your work. He is also very fair and understanding. I had difficulty completing some assignments on time for a number of (real) reasons, and he gave me a fair chance to attain a good final grade.

Awesome prof! Really made the lectures engaging and interesting. He was very straightforward about what would be on the exam. Going to lectures is essential because he covers a lot of material. Definitely my favourite class of the semester.

The classes were interesting and engaging. The depth of his knowledge on WWI was astounding obviously a close personal passion of his and this shows through in his lectures. Using some a great mix of both videos, pictures and songs. Sets long tough assignments but this is usual of level 3 class. Overall throughly interesting.

Brilliant guy. Lectures were riveting. Hilarious dry sense of humour. The 3 papers were challenging, but definitely reasonable. No midterm. Final exam was half true or false statements (50) which were fairly easy if you showed up to class & 1 essay question of your choosing all of which were straightforward. My favorite course and professor so far.

I took this class because I needed a Humanities course to fill my schedule, so I half-heartedly chose history. But Heathorn is an AWESOME prof! This man legit made me fall in love with history lol I'm taking any class he teaches. I remember I missed one of his lectures once and I regretted it because they're mad interesting. His accent is adorable.

He's amazing, interesting and engaging. I hated history until I was in his class. He pulled an April fools joke on the class, and I lost it, it was hilarious. He's super awesome, super clear and really great. Take his class- you will certainly enjoy it, history buff or not.
He was a great prof, he really knows what he is talking about. He was also very approachable and charismatic.

Fantastic Prof! He's hilarious, pulls pranks on April fools and knows what he's talking about! The Registrar constantly ticked him off, but he was really open to changes based on student body vote and gave resources to help us achieve the highest score we possibly could! The only complaint I had was the TA meetings, but he's among the best!

Amazing, humorous, very intelligent. He barely looked over notes while lecturing, illustrating his immense level of wisdom pertaining to history. There's so much I could say, but I will keep it short and sweet: the most down-to-earth and humane professor you will ever have at McMaster. Truly a privilege to be taught by him. I highly recommend.
I love attending his lectures. His accent is what I look forward to. I never feel sleepy in this class!

THE HEATH!!! Probably the best professor I had in 1st year. Lots of reading for the course but Heathorn's lectures are very informative, engaging, organized and worth attending. My TA was not the best, so my mark (B) is not indicative of how much I really learned from him.  History majors; take any course he teaches!
An excellent professor. He's clear and concise and makes lectures enjoyable and easy to understand. Would highly recommend him.

The only problem with this professor is that if you are not taking history as a major he makes you want to. I am not sure if that is good or bad, but needless to say he is very very good at what he does! He is very inspiring.
if you don't like History before, you will after listening to his lectures - he is very good
If you have a chance, take a course with Dr. Heathorn! He is excellent!
Wonderful! Knows his stuff, goes out of his way to help you do well, and to make sure that you understand the information. He is really friendly, and just overall awsome.

Heathorn is one of the best profs Mac has to offer. Take any course you can with him and you will learn how to expand on your research skills; an asset in later years. Lots of work but if you work hard you will be rewarded. Very knowledgeable and helpful. He really cares about his students.
Hard class but excellent lecturer
He is prepared for class and obviously knows what he's talking about. I don't mind working hard for him, because he works hard for the class.
This prof really knows what he's talking about, and his lectures are absolutely full of information. He makes you work, but he's the type of prof who you want to work for. I enjoy his lectures.

Good class, but you work ur ass off.  Even when u do it doesn't matter.  I found it difficult to do well in this class.  Having different T.A.'s mark assignment sucks! He makes u have a work ethic, if you don't have one, u fail the course.  The textbooks were useless so be prepared to find out alot of info on your own.  And the Microfilms Just wait
fun and full of info, much better than first half of europe course
i love his accent.
dry british wit.  really smart.  helpful, but will burn you if you try slack.

Now that I've taken some more history at Mac I realize just how good Heathorn is. Don't be fooled by his easy-going nature and dry humour, this guy knows his stuff.  An excellent prof. Take whatever he offers.

Dr. Heathorn fair and very intelligent. He is very honest and direct. He also has a great sense of humour, if you "get it."  He can, however, be misunderstood--one example is the negative entry below? This person has NO idea of what he's tal
The person below doesn't know what they are talking about; maybe they only got a 'B'.  Heathorn rocks. He is the best prof in the history department.
Heathorn is arrogant and mediocre really. Not very helpful or inspiring. He takes the fun right out of history.
Had him at IUPUI.  Do yourself a favor and take a class--any class-from this man.  Be prepared to read a lot, however.  He has high, yet attainable, standards.  One of the very best.
No Comments

Ok it has to be said, he looks like the side-kick guy from that tv show "Relic Hunter", you know with the girl from Wayne's World. Anyways class went a little long sometimes, but the course was interesting, would recommend.
Took this class 'cause he was cute; will take more with him 'cause he's smart
Cool Dude; fun class
Awesome prof!

comments: STATS 2B03 is not an easy 12 but if you do the midterms he gives you to practice and really take the time to understand the material, an 11 or 12 are very possible. His questions are usually not surprises however he may try to trick you so read carefully! He's really funny and gives great notes :)

love him, hes funny and so helpful! If you ever email him, he responds so fast even though there are 800 other students in the same class. his notes are amazing, and super helpful! If you study his notes and practice tests you will do good in the course!
HE IS SOO AMAZING. makes jokes during class and makes confusing concepts seem so simple! One of the best profs I've had

Aaron Childs is one of the MOST thorough, articulate professors I've ever had. He is able to explain even the most confusing concepts with clarity and his course is designed to reinforce key concepts over and over again. From the repetition, plenty of examples and slow pace- you don't feel rushed in class to take notes. The mould for the perf prof!
Funny guy.
Childs taught the material very well  however he does not post notes so you must come to lecture to get the material.   Assignments and textbook work supplement the lectures

Prof. Childs was an amazing instructor. He was able to explain many of the new concepts in the course effectively and was very clear in process during lecture. I really enjoyed my time in his class. However, missing lectures is not really worth it as he doesn't post his notes. But there were quite a few destroyers on that exam, so know your stuff.

Dr. Childs was the most amazing and hilarious professor. His teaching style is exceptional. The Assignments were very helpful for tests. His notes are clear, concise and easy to understand-- no textbook needed to understand content. His midterms and exams were very doable without problems if you try all the provided practice tests. A definite 12.

Childs is probably the best teacher I have ever had. He essentially writes out your note with you during lecture -at pace you can follow- while explaining what it all means. The assignments are helpful and the tests are fair. If you learn the info and do the practice tests this course is a guaranteed A. Also wow so funny
great prof
Made a dry course fun with his jokes. Go to class, take notes, and do the practice problems and you should do fine.

He is amazing!!!!!! Very clear explanations, just practice all in class examples and assignment examples and you are golden for the exam! Dr. Childs is very helpful during office hours as well. TA's were fantastic.
He's the best 3
Dr. Childs was my favourite professor first year. If he wasn't a prof he would probably be a comedian.

First midterm was fair. Second midterm was full of tricks. Exam was definitely a bit too long for the given amount of time. Having taken Math 1A03 and Stats 2B03 with him, I can say that he definitely taught 2B03 much better. I feel that this course did not need much understanding so long as you were good at math.

Childs uses humor to keep his lectures relatively full of students. His notes are very well organized, so if you take the time to go over all his examples you will definitely understand all of the material. He gives you plenty of practice questions prior to a midterm or exam, so if you practice then you will be satisfied with your final grade.

makes subtle yet hilarious jokes about math that gets the entire lecture hall laughing. By the end of the term the classroom was FULL every day with people ditching their other sections to come to Aarons.
He has some sense of humorous
Hilarious. Can't wait to have it again. The course is really not that hard as long as you keep up and do homework questions. Not many surprises on tests.

Funny, good, prof. He knows the course content like non other and does exceptionally well in answering questions. Teaches at a decent pace, sometimes too fast but I guess it is expected since there is a lot to cover.

He was pretty funny, but really intimidating. No one would ask questions in his class because he would really make people feel bad! People were clearly struggling. For me the lectures weren't really helpful, and the exams ended up being really tricky ! If you aren't into his teaching, do every single homework question. Fall behind and you'll fail!
Very straightforward professor. Do the practice tests and go to lectures and you'll be good!

Aaron Childs is a usual professor. He taught out of the text book, however - his notes were almost verbatim from the text book and so there was a lot of writing to do in class. He is hilarious, but often unintentionally. Assignments were annoying because they were online, but tests were quite easy. Very straightforward.
good teacher. tough course

Everyone seems to like him for some reason. I don't find his joke funny. His explanations are cloudy and unclear. Some are long and tedious when there are better methods to doing things. Does not do math using a pure math way, but then again he did his BSc, MSc and PhD in math at McMaster, so I guess it's expected.

Awesome professor. He's super clear with concepts and answers any questions in class, and really well too. His jokes are hilarious and always relevant. Best first year professor I've had without at doubt. Made math an enjoyable experience.
Dr.Childs is a great prof, his tests are really easy.

I loved this prof. Straightforward but that's what was great....Thorough explanations at perfect pace, constantly held review sessions, answered questions eagerly, tests were fair but still university level.He isnt necessarily too exciting but I am taking a class from him not trying to friends ;) Take a course with him!

Childs is a very strange man. He tells the same jokes every year (his dad is Venn, and his fish is Poisson). At first it's funny, then you're kind of concerned for him. Great teacher though. Very thorough in explanations and helpful. Does review periods before tests, and tests are very similar to practice tests he posts. Very fair!

The absolute best prof I had in first year. I skipped all of Dr.Baker's classes and went to his instead. Actually liked this course and found it easier than 1A03 because of this man. Funny. Clear. Helpful. Can't ask more for better math prof.
i died in his class. died laughing. he's too funny. material is not easy but he makes them clear, and makes the test easy.
Good prof. Has a good sense of humor but I hated the fact that he taught straight out of the textbook.

Dr. Childs is my favourite professor at McMaster. He is very good at explaning the course material, and his notes are clear and easy to follow. He speaks very clearly and does not rush while writing notes. He is also absolutely hilarious. Making jokes during every class made me actually want to go to class! Such a boss!
Great prof. He goes over the material so slowly and he writes SO SO slowly that you actually want to sleep in class but nonetheless he was an amazing math prof!
Best first year eng teacher! Extremely clear and his notes are amazing. His tests are very fair and always similar to the practice questions. Very funny as well!

Dr. Childs is an excellent teacher.  He has the ability to make complex material seem quite clear.  He always says that the material is incredibly hard, but this is just a tactic to make people work harder.
Anyone saying Childs is a poor teacher doesnt pay attention in class. He has excellent lecture notes and his tests were hard at times, but always fair! Favourite prof from first year eng!!!
very good teacher but he does not want any1 to pass and loves to see people fail.
Dr. Childs is one of the best teachers I've had. He is extremely funny, explains concepts well, and is a really nice guy :)
great prof, great sense of humor and fair tests
He was the worst professor I have had in first year engineering. Decent in explaining...but very unflexible and very unhelpful...when you need him.
Awesome teacher, he know how to explain in simple way.

Good prof, but as the head of the engineering math sections he schedules the date/time for all the tests.  every single one of the tests we had this year was on a friday night at 9:30pm, we even had a test on thanksgiving friday.  after much complaint from students and the faculty he still wouldn't consider changing any of the times.

The guy is awesome, has a great sense of humor, explains the material like no one else, although the material is hard but he made so simple, answered questions clearly, usually provides hard sample exams and solves the majority of them but the real exam is away easier. This is how a real teacher should be

An excellent prof; has review sessions every friday and on the days before tests; class consisted of lectures only; labs are generally easy; will answer any question you have during class; a good sense of humour; and a nice guy all around.
Teaches important lesson in the shortest and efficient way possible. Never waste time. Probably the best professor in Mcmaster.
Dr.childs is an amazing professor. He knows how do easily teach new material to student.

I honestly don't know what you people are complaining about... Childs explained things with extreme clarity and just didn't want to put up with students' bull. Everyone complaining here seems to be the whiney, marks-oriented, "cry to mommy and daddy" type. Just because you couldn't pass the course the way intended is not the prof's problem.

I don't know what all the bad comments are about. I didn't meet a single person in first year whose favourite math prof was not Childs. His tests aren't hard either, I have no idea what people are talking about.

Everyone seems torn on this guy.  I like him, he's funny, covers the material very carefully and is incredibly methoidic.  People either hate him or love him so try him out! don't bash him cause you failed math!

Best Prof for first year engineering for sure. Lectures are a must go. At the end everyone was going to his lectures instead of the other profs. However, beginning material (for 1Z04) can sneak up on people, class average wasn't that good but was bell curved in the end. Definatly choose Childs at the beginning as it will fill up fast.

He is a mean person with so much attitude. He never considers any alternative grading schemes and on his web site under the FAQ section he responds with an emphatic NO to every question. Such a conceited person.
he is really nice guy.Also lot helpful on the exam day in review session

I hope that his own children (his biological children that is) fail in University when they become big and attend post secondary institution. Then he will feel the pain that he inflicts on students. He writes unfair exams (all MCQ for a math course) because he is lazy and does not want to hand mark the long answer problems. What a l000zer.

I agree to the latest comment. He is really not a doctor. His main hobby is failing students and getting happy after that. What a sad prof. I hope his kids fail in University when they become big then he will know what it's like to give grief to first year engineers.

I don't know what some of these people are talking about... Childs is amazing! He is very good at explaining things in lectures. And he can be really funny too, makes coming to class semi-worthwhile. And I'm obviously not the only one who liked Childs, for the first few weeks, his class was extremely overcrowded (aisles were even packed with people

By Far the worst professor ever. He gives multiple choice questions on exams because he is too lazy to get them hand marked. Multiple choice is really bad, because you either get it right or wrong, and no part marks. This prof is HORRENDOUS at teaching. He makes extremely dumb jokes and is good for nothing else. The man is ultra-worthless. AWFUL!!!
He made so many mathematical mistakes during lectures. Do you call that a math genius? Not even close. Don't take any course with this prof.
Good notes, entertaining lectures - he's the man. Honestly, he's so funny I wish I had him for my other courses.

I'm in first year Engineering. He is an amazing prof,  one of the best the math department. He has good pacing of the material and explains very well. His class is always full for the first week or 2 of the semester, but only until people start dropping out, which is a common thing in Engineering :P
The BEST PROF in my 1st yr Engineering program. If I were not in his class, I don't think that I can get "A". I love U SIR, "ONE MARK"!!!
I've never had him personally but i heard hes an AWESOME teacher.  Too bad his classes are always full.
he is the best prof for math......
The course evaluation is not negotiable i.e. Individual requests for alternative weightings will NEVER be considered.

I saw him or someone who looked exactly like him at Solid Gold few days back. He looked very happy. THE COURSE EVALUATION IS NOT NEGOTIABLE. IE. INDIVIDUAL REQUESTS FOR ALTERNATIVE WEIGHTINGS WILL NEVER BE CONSIDERED.

he is the one of the best teacher i have ever had..n definitely THE BEST for math..for 1Z04 i didnt go to most of my class..but in childs class now u actually feel like going cz FINALLY I UNDERSTAND SOMETHING..HE ROCKS!!
Very arrogant prof. He thinks he is KING of the math department. Please. He's more like KING OF THE TOILET. So far my worst experience at Mac was having this guy as a prof.
Best Math Teacher at Mac!!
His lectures match his name: childish.

We just called it my dad's rule. Childs is the most popular first-year Eng prof, and for good reason. He knows what he's talking about and answers people's questions well. You'll like him even better if you an appreciate his odd sense of humour. I've fallen asleep in almost every class, but Childs manages to keep Calc interesting every lecture.
He keeps a large collection of Rocco movies in his office.

He was the worst among all profs I had in Fall 2006 when I took his Stats 3D03. He was so bad I don't even have words to explain how terrible his teaching methods were. Please avoid this prof for any course.

Notes are very helpful. I didn't even have to buy the textbook. Did very well in the course just using the notes. Sometimes says awkward things.. but overall great teacher! PS I liked Canty, but to say that Canty's more knowledgeable and passionate is def false. Childs LOVES stats, know much more.
this guy is a good prof.   he sticks to his timeline and makes some pretty good jokes.  He is easy to understand.

Compared to Canty, this prof was nothing. Canty is the stats genius and the most fair stats prof ever. Canty's knowledge and unparalleled enthusiasm in the classroom makes Aaron childs look like a small 'child'
I had him in Fall 2006 for stats 3D03 he was really tough for that course as well. His Assignments were brutal and worth only 15%

This guy is really the worst prof EVER. He is incredibly stern arrogant and unforgiving with regards to the course policies. Highly Inflexible and he's got a major attitude issue. Annoying voice too. Try to avoid him if at all possible. He is apparently a specialist only in first yr calculus, teach uper year courses, then we'll know if you're smart
Best professor in the math department (at least for Engineering). In addition to his excellent teaching ability, he also has a great sense of humour.
Awesome prof! Great explanations, always willing to answer students' questions and he's hilarious during lectures :)
HE IS VERY TOUGH PROFESSOR I RECOMMEND U SWITCH TO DR.CANTY SECTION HE IS THE BEST OF ALL STATISTIC PROFESSORS
Easy to understand, good examples. Excellent teacher.
Really great at explaining and answering questions, while still following timelines...
Excellent prof
superrrrrr amazingggg
Amazing prof!
You cant help but take great notes in his lectures.
great prof., helpful and funny. one of the best profs at mac
He is great.
funny and easy to understand
He's awesome!  Best prof!  So helpful, funny...
Awesome prof.  He will destroy you.
i never thought i would enjoy calc. great job!
very funny.
Childs kicks ass.  Great explanations, clear voice and writing.  And he's pretty halarious.
Great prof, soooo funny.
Best prof!!
Cool prof! Definitely the best math prof I had so far
Good professor.  Extremely anti-social outside of lecture though...
The voice bugged me...but hes a good teacher
He was a very good teacher. He made jokes when he knew that we all needed a laugh to keep from crying at the complexity of the problem. All in all a very good teacher. Best yet!
Childs is a sweet prof. Makes us laugh, AND understand maths :)

omg hes such an ass but an amazing professor the "i just realized you guys have the most courses and the hardest courses! i guess that means when youre done you will be really good engineers... all FOUR of you!" kills me, when i cant get into my lecture bcuz everyone else comes to my class since their profs suck kinda makes me mad tho
Best prof I have ever seen. If he is teaching stats3d03 you need to take the course immediately. He is really fair and not tough.

The best prof! Very loud, nasal voice (doesn't use a mic) and huge, clear printing on the board. Although he seemed to be arrogant, he's actually a really nice man. Funny guy too, with a few corny jokes up his sleeve. Points out people who sleep in class. Answers questions patiently and clearly, no matter how difficult. Tests weren't hard at all.

Very good prof. If you failed a course that's your problem.  All profs have certain rules they have to follow and if on top of raising everyone's mark you still fail the course then it's kind of too bad. You didn't deserve to pass.

a great prof, makes everything clear and easy to understand.  If you do your work you are guaranteed a good mark, it's not even hard either ...if you go to his lectures because he explains everything so well(calc and algebra).

I think it's unfair to judge him based on his policy of "not considering individual requests for alternative weightings" I mean that's a rule that pretty much every prof has, and the reason why he puts it under "post exam FAQ" is because engineers will never understand unless he makes it crystal clear. He's an excellent prof & a very sweet person.

you MUST attend class and take awesome notes because for both courses I took with him I'd skip class and try to get by with the textbook and ended up with a D+ in both courses. he gives everything in the notes. very clear. wont trick u. he repeats same jokes every year and they're cheezy but still funny
very good

After exams he posts a 'post exam FAQ' list indicating that if you ask him to increase your mark by one point for whatever reason, he's just not going to do it, no matter how badly you need it. That displays how unhelpful this guy is. Don't know why people give him good ratings.

OK he is very helpful (being sarcastic) because he always says this "The course evaluation is NOT negotiable. i.e., individual requests for alternative weightings will NEVER be considered" I think he deserves less than 0 for helpfulness
excellent, funny prof. keeps stats interesting. tests are pretty easy if you study. no problems here.
just too good! and he makes fun of science kids

Very clear with tons of examples (that actually help when the test comes!) Sure his jokes are corny, but the feebleness is somehow still funny. Basically if you have Childs, your going to get atleast an 8 in the class, no question about it.
good prof
he's awesome. Really taught the class well. And really easy to understand
Best and funniest prof in ENG 1 so far. keeps it up straight to the point and very helpful.
sweet, scripted jokes, but amausing enough.  very clear.
Funniest prof, takes time out of lectures to talk about kicking asses and the like. Excellent coverage of the material, although a little non-chalant

Best prof ever.  If you go to his algebra class 3 mins late, prolly u have to sit on the stairs or floor, b'cuz pp dont go to other classes and come to our class.  If u get his notes. Just redo them before u take test( if u dont have the time to do all suggested problems).  This is is the only 2 classes i feel reluctant to skip.
The BEST Level 1 Prof in Engineering by far! He's extremley clear and his notes complement the textbook EXTREMLEY well. His jokes are acutally quite funny and keeps you interested in learning.

What can I say about Dr. Childs? He's the BEST math prof at MAC. SERIOUSLY. He knows the stuff by heart, and more importantly he can TEACH it! I don't know what this subtely condescending crap is about! GOD PPL he jokes around so u don't FALL ASLEEP! Take a hint there arent many profs that do that! He is open to many questions so u can understand.
very funny, easy to understand

Childs is the man! Enough said. If you didnt like him its your own problem and didnt get to know him. Maybe show upto class once in a while and you might pass.. I got a 60 in high school calculus and got a 12 in his class.. very nice guy!

He makes the final exams of all the courses that he teaches and his final exams are not so easy.I got 75% in term tests but after writing the final exam my final grade was 60%.You can easily judge his difficultness(open your dictionary) in final exams.
Great prof, great notes, great classes. Makes math class extreamly enjoyable.
good prof.. he sounds like Big Bird.. listen for it next time you hear him talk.. lol
Great prof! Very clear lessons, easy to take notes, comfortable atmosphere. Can't help laughing at the lame jokes, at least they brighten up an otherwise dull calc class.
Not bad, but he is subtlely arrogant and condescending, masked as a lame sense of humor. personally dislike him, but the class was decent.
Difficult course, taught well, funny tidbits of information to keep the class intersting.  Good lad.  The person who posted below this post is crazy!

U can't find anyone worse than this guy in your whole life.You may not know what is "WORST"mean,Just look into the dictionary,U can find Aaron Child's photo right next to "WORST".U can't get anyone worse than him.

Has a wry sense of humour...kinda approachable, clearly very bright.  Straightforward teaching style...copy down his notes, do the assignments, and you'll ace the class.  Had him for 2nd year Stats..nothing out of ordinary in regards to his expectations.
I was actually supposed to go to Jopko's lectures, but Childs is a much better prof.  I like his repetoire of about three different corny jokes, and his straightforward explanations.
A really nice teacher. knows his stuff really well and makes the class very interesting by those funny jokes he puts up. got an 11 on his course and i really like the way he teaches.cheerz...
:>
-Great professor, difficult course.  Very helpful, and clear

This course looks easy but have lots of work to do.Looks like he is helpful but did not well prepare for the lecture though. If you dont have many free time, dont take this course. DONT TAKE 5 MATH COUSES IN 1 TERM!!!!

a GOOD TEACHER! only need to pay attention and take good notes in class, and u'll do really well. appreciates hard work. very FUNNY! very organized so have questions prepared b-4 going to see him for help.
super nice and funny, however, not laughing when it sounds like big bird is teaching you integration by parts was very hard
nice and funny! good teacher too
despite the fact i might have failed the final, still a really good prof, clear and really funny, cornyness only works when ya do it right, and this guy did it right
I wonder how many famous mathematicians are his mom?
Explains things pretty well, and the jokes keep lectures interesting. Leave his door open "that much" or he'll kick your ass.
childs is two bowls full of hilarity
couldn't stand to be in this class, and his corny jokes were not funny, they were just corny.
very good teacher!!

Amazing professor...he provided such a thorough introduction to statistics in first year that I ended up with a 12 in second year while watching other students fail miserably because of their poor background in stats. His corny jokes were hilarious.
He's too sexy...He always keeps a straight face when he makes jokes, which makes it even funnier. He is the most organized prof I've ever had.
Great teacher and a great class
Shouldn't be a course co-ordinator !!! Some test versions are way too hard than others.
An absolutely hilarious guy who made learning Algebra easy.
Hilarious guy who keeps kicking everyone's ass.
No Comments
No Comments
Great sense of humour.  Like when he makes fun of people.
its like high school with 400ppl in your class
I doubt his math skill, usually did wrong in lecture even just easy example.... !!!
really goooooooooooooooood
Can't miss his class. /* I am not Childs myself */
good guy
funny guy
funny as heck!
Very good prof...keeps algeo interesting somehow
made first year stats fun, one of 3 best profs had at Mac
He can write clearly and talk loudly, so everyone can hear and understand.
at least he can effectively use the chalkboards and explain his tea habits
Without Question an excellent teacher. A proff that still teaches without ovhd's
ridiculous tests
The best math prof.
Explains problems with ease, and has a very clear loud voice.
