comments: She told us for our final she was going to post exam information online. Not only did she not post anything, but didn't answer any student questions two weeks prior to the exam.

I kind of feel bad for Humphreys because nobody shows up to class anymore. The content of this course is very interesting and she tries to make lectures fun but they end up being kind of useless and she doesn't give any useful info, just shows us what illusions are like. Nice lady though and tests are fair. Read the textbook!!!!!!!!
Horrible prof. Doesn't really care about the students. More interested in making sure that the class average is a B-.

Useless lectures + notes. Very dependent on txtbk which itself isn't easy to read. TAs equally useless. Go to lecture regardless, helps to know what's worth reading in txtbk. Weekly readings require summaries, easy enough, reviewed with TAs in tutorial - useless, don't bother going. Lecture notes posted irregularly, usually many wks after lecture.

Interesting class, terrible teacher. I had her for 2H03 and she was awesome, this semester it's a total 180. She relies on the textbook way to much. Be prepared to hear "ohh look this over in your textbook" all semester with no reference of where to find the information and what chapters you are covering in lecture. TAs were of no help either
This course was kind of dry at times, but Dr. Humphreys is engaging and funny.  The tests are challenging, but fair.  I'd recommend the course as an elective.

Great prof. Her midterms are tough, but fair if you put in the time, thus far, I've gotten an 85, 75, and a 90. Attend every class and start studying for midterms a week in advance and you should be fine.

She's nice... and a lot of justin bieber jokes... but something just doesn't click when you are in her lectures. When you write the exam you will literally be wondering if you learned what she's asking... VERY TRICKY EXAMS. Horrible first mark, but I learned my lesson and studied and got decent marks on the next three... GOOD LUCK!

I have never even look into any of cognitive psychology neither linguistics, and took it for fun. Simply amazing, and the grading scheme is very well balanced for students to be able to moderate to very high mark. keep up with the textbook reading (50 pages /week)

This course is hard, but Dr. Humphreys makes it worthwhile. She is very charismatic, funny, and helpful. She keeps her lectures interesting and holds your attention. She has high expectations, so don't let her down because she's awesome.

I'm usually an A student, and have never had to drop a class before. Class ave for midterm was very low. I wanted to look at mine before the drop/add deadline to get comments. She told me to e-mail her right after class, which I did. I had to drop the class for spring 09 because I STILL haven't heard back from her! (it's now august!!!)
She is awesome. If you are going to take cogntion make sure u take it with her only. She is good looking and has a nice accent too. Her husband is so lucky!!
One of the best prof in psych department

Good prof. I liked her. I wish I had studied harder when I took her course. Tests are a bit tough but fair if you read the chapters 3 or 4 times. They test understanding, so to do her multiple choice you need to read the chapter quiet a few times. Final exam was easier then all the tests. No short answer questions asked which is awesome!! nice prof
Read the textbook and her notes a few times and you could do well.

She is a terrible prof. I learned everything from the textbook and Webct. The course has too much going on for a 3 unit. 4 midterms/final+ weekly posts+ assignment and experiments. Her slides don't make any sense and her explanations are even worse. Doesn't like answering q's in class and skips thru material really fast when she is behind.Nt recomm

I had psych of language with her.  Maybe it was because she was pregnant, but she did not seem to be the most pleasant prof I've ever had.  I had high expectations from people who took cognition with her but I was disappointed.  She tested on obscure topics in the text and she was tough to please on the final essay.  We all regretted this one.
I love her accent.  She's a good teacher too!

Not bad at all....She lets you drop one test, and believe me, out of all the professors who teach cognition, she is the most fairest one. Her tests are not easy (but they are still passable) if you read the text and her notes SEVERAL TIMES (Not the night before the test or the weekend before) Study very hard and you should get around B atleast
Karin is really good. For the people complaining - newsflash - she was pregnant! I though she was a really good sport. I would take classes with her again!

Let's be honest here. When she taught this class the first time, I heard she was very helpful. Answered every students question on webct, spend time helping people on webct the night b4 the exams etc, but when I had her, she never even answered students emails. Her exams are TOUGH! BE warned. Study well ahead of the test days or else you're doomed
just don't ask her for reference letters...otherwise, you're in for a real ride
I agree with the last comment. She has a bit of an attitude and really does not like to help students outside of class.

She's nice in class, but if you go ask her questions in her office hours, she'll make you feel like you're too stupid to be in university.  She should seriously work on her attitude.  So even though the material was interesting and the tests were fair, I was left with a bad aftertaste of the course.
this would've been the best class if her tests weren't so brutal. cognitive psychologist + professor = not a good mix. lectures were fun and interesting, but the tests raped my mark.
Does'nt really like helping students. Her exams are just brutal. Double meaning for lot of questions. Very tricky.
Well, you've got to do the work to do well...but welcome to university.  Nice lady! Light hearted lecture that brings a little be of interest to a some bland material.

Her PSYCH2H03 class is the *HARDEST* Psych course I have ever taken. So many students getting bad marks on her tests, the class avg on her tests is usually around 19/30 or sometimes 20/30, and she writes on webct that she is very pleased with how "people" did. She calls students "people"...Her lectures are so brief and simple, but exams HARD!!!!
This is the only class I look forward to going to this semester.  Funny, clear, concise, answers questions well, amazing accent, what else could you want in a prof?
Her lecture notes over simplified and everything seems easy. Exams much harder with tricky and confusing questions. Don't believe anyone who says Humphreys is easy, because she's not.

She is a terrible prof.  Her lectures are so fast, doesn't even give you time to think.  Her tests are unfair, very unclear questions.  Pretends like she is there to help her students, but really does not care.  Aviod her, if possible!
Really repetitive saying the same thing over and over again and makes lame jokes all the time.
The first test was hard with some ambigious questions

She comes off as a nice, funny teacher but she's two-faced. She loses it if anyone is talking in the class and her lecture notes are very vague. She seems to put her efforts into being young and relatable instead of acting like a teacher.
dr humphreys is amazing. she's sexy in a magnetic, strange kind of way too... her classes always seemed to end too quickly!
She made the course bearable. She's a great prof.
dr. humphreys is smart and fun. she's not condescending, just witty. really sexy too...

Has a horribly condescending attitude. Won't give extensions to her undergrads but her grad students aren't held up to the same standards. Complains waaaaay too much.  Profs should be thankful they even have a job!  There are so many PhDs out there who would love to teach at Mac!
A+++ prof
Simply the best!!!

If you are going to take Human Learning and Cognition, Dr. Humphreys is the best professor to take that course with. Her lectures are great and she is always happy to help students. She even gives sample questions before the exams and she answers each and every question that people post on webct.
Awesome
Best prof ever!! Nice to look at, and her accent is really cute. Explains things in a way you can clearly understand and you won't feel bored, even though the textbook is a bit boring to read.
Amazing Prof!  Awesome examples in class, super energetic about her research and the class in general!  Take this section!
Great attitude, funny, and knows her stuff.  Available to students outside of class.  You'll laugh a lot.....and learn, too.
Nice prof, interesting, she's pretty
Very interesting class - the accent is cool too, seems like a fun person to hang out with :)
so funny ... love her accent ... she's good at explaining things in simpler terms... doesn't get all complex on you
Not an easy class

comments: An excellent professor that will always consider the students first. His quizzes and tests are fair, since you have seen a VERY similar types of questions before in tutorials and in lectures. He is very nice and his lecture slides contain enough information for you to pass the course with an exceptional mark.

Overall, I like his teaching style and the arrangement of his tests and quiz. He always puts the quiz about a couple days the test. To be honest, this helped me a lot.  The quiz covers about the same material as the following test. I was able to keep up with the material due to this. I did not like circuits until I took this course.  Easy A- or A.
Willing and wants to help students. Nice guy.
Always there for you and amazing personality!
Goes out of his way to make sure you succeed in his course and learn.
Excellent prof, really help a lot~
Good prof. Have reviews for each midterm and quiz, very helpful!
Lectures can be a bit boring, but professor is very helpful and friendly.
Great prof, he provides all the midterm review for the test, you know.
Very passionate teacher that always wants to help out with any problems his students might have, very easy to talk to as well!

Great Professor, hands down. He is genuinely interested in teaching you the material well and seeing you succeed, a trait not common in academia today. Offers plenty of opportunities to ask questions, and to learn concepts, couldn't ask for a better Professor!
Prepares the students well for midterms.
Extremely caring and helpful professor. He always has the students best interest in mind
Good guy, seemed genuinely interested in us doing well. Very approachable and willing to make exceptions for any problems you have. Cheers

Great Professor. Always willing to help out the students. Goes out of his way to set up an extra review session for the class prior to quizzes and tests. Tests are fair. Content is difficult but he teaches it very well and makes everything crystal clear prior to any testing.
Interesting course and good layout with quizzes and midterms. Midterms reflect important material from course, very helpful professor.
It is a really easy course, all tests are same as review questions. The professor is very good and willing to help

Totally awesome! Loves to joke around and willing to help with ANYTHING. It is clear he is genuine about how each student does in his course. I takes a lot of breaks in class to simply remind everyone to stay motivated!
Very helpful and invested in class. Review lectures very helpful and Prof is very approachable.
Great prof, really cares.

The professor is excellent at what he does. He helps us students greatly by posting review lecture slides before every quiz or midterm. They are an excellent source of information. He tries hard to make the course as easy and simple as possible. He has truly invested a lot of time in his students through out this semester.
good prof, loves to go over things plenty of times

Great professor; Fair and very considerate of students. Evident not only in time he takes to help students after class but the time he dedicates in preparing and presenting the review sessions. Competent in all scopes of the course yet capable of focusing on fundamentals, making the lectures very clear and succinct.
All around great teacher. Glad I retook the course, great new prof.
Great Prof, really helpful.
Only went to a few lectures, but he is very helpful during exams and outside of class. He wants students to get a high mark.
Fantastic prof, very detailed full notes. Really cares about his students and wants the to do well. Takes time for review lectures and does all he can to accommodate students!
Very good and helpful professor. Nice and easy to approach in person and e-mail.

Currently taking this course and I have to say Dr. Howlader makes the material easy and clear. No need for the textbook, his notes are enough. Takes the time to hold review sessions and answer emails. Overall excellent prof.
Very interesting course and the professor very helpful and friendly. He shows a lot of interest in his students. Great course! I enjoyed it

he is very approachable. very friendly to his students but i dont know about his teachin skills. alot of students complained about his english but i think i was ok. he was one of a few profs who was actually willin to help his students
Even though it was his first time teaching at Mcmaster University, he was way better than other professors. He helped all of my friends even on short notice for exam. Very good professor.
Very friendly, one of the best professors That I have had. Finally a prof that cares about students.
Very helpful, best prof anyone can have. You just have to be sure to talk to him about your problems.
Although it was his first teaching year at McMaster and he didn't teach well, he at least try to be fair with the grading by helping us with the exam.

Dr. Howlader is extremely approachable and very willing to provide personal attention and ensure full comprehension of course material. He demonstrates  great patience and really helped me to achieve a good grade in his course. An excellent professor.

Can only understand half of what he says, and when he writes on digital podium, cant read a word he writes (and clears the screen too fast!).. Tries to be nice, but comes off as condescending on students. Very unclear grading scheme for assignments!!
Very nice person. Easy to approach and willing to help. Hard course to teach cause most of the students aren't interested in electrical stuff.
Never learned a thing from any of his lectures.

comments: A man among men.
Bob ROCKS!!  Such a fabulous wonderful man.
He's awesome...he just presented in my school today....it was cool...this is the secind year i've been here and he's been here...wow
I'd give him 10 out of 5 for helpfulness...
Very supportive guy. He's amazing beyond words, once you get to know him. A great director for sure.
McMaster University can never find a better and more caring Director for first year Engineering, than Bob Loree. He loves students, and cares about them soo much. He is a great person.
The nicest man I met at McMaster

When we were stepping into this new world of engineering and quite lost I might add, Bob was one of the only ones there to lend a helping hand and guide us through it all. One of Mac's greatest losses was loosing Bob Loree.

Bob is not only an excellent director but a true mentor and friend.  He is extremely dedicated and committed to helping and working with students to excel.  He is always available to offer valuable advice and truly cares for the success of his students.

I have known Bob Loree for many years (High School & University) and is truly one of the most helpful and resourceful individuals I have come across.  His constant drive and energy to better himself and those around him is amazing.  He has a knack for sol

Bob is a fantastic director: he's incredibly innovative, intelligent, and friendly.  Bob consistently goes above and beyond his job to do what's right and what's best for the department, faculty, and university he's a part of.  An asset to any program.

Bob is an exceptional man. He almost-singlehandedly takes care of 700+ first year engineering students; and at that he excels. He makes sure to meet every one of them. He is also a very nice person. I wish there were more people like him.

Bob was the first to offer support, assistance and expertise to students in need. He provided opportunities to students both academically and beyond, developed top notch programs and served as a role model and friend to all who were in contact with him.

Bob is the most caring/kind person I have met through my engineering studies.  His dedication to his students goes WAY beyond what his job calls for.  He has honestly been a mentor to me and was honoured when he bestowed my iron ring on me. A+ in my books
A wonderful Eng 1 director and friend--I have nothing but good things to say about Bob. Keep up the great work in the future!
Always available to help students.  Goes far out of his way just to help a bit.

Bob Loree has been a fine mentor to five years of Engineering Students at McMaster.  He has made it clear that it is a challenging program.  However, he is the author of many innovative programs which make a sure that committed student can be successful.

The time, programming and kindness that Bob gave to his job were above and beyond what I believe was in the job description. I am grateful to have had such a fantastic role model and advisor for my years at McMaster. His dedication will be sorely missed.
Always there to help you when you need it. Never told me or steared me into the wrong direction. A great person to have around. Good job Bob

Bob Loree was the best part of the ENG 1 program.  He knew (and still knows) my name even though I am one of thousands of students.  He was always helpful and encouraging through first year and beyond.

This man should get an award for fooling students. He encourages students to enter mcmaster engineering, then he puts you on probation after first year. After level one, if you fail one course, you go on probation for whole year.
An excellent advisor who greatly improved a terrible year 1 program. Who were the brains behind letting this man go.  Idiots.
Awesome person
awesome guy
Excellent advisor!
Dr. Loree is a great guy
GREAT guy!!!! Really makes everyone in engineering 1 feel like a family.
Really good dude
Excellent man. Fair and dedicated. First year is a Joke for me. But then I went to a gifted High School so I'm a bit different than most people here.
good stuff
ACADEMIC STANDARDS ARE TOO HIGH
A really great and understanding person. McMaster is tough but he is always there to help you and offers good advice. Best person to speak to if you've got ANY problems whatsoever.
Very Nice and helpful but tough. Expects students to be very smart
Very Good guy! He is the perfect choice for Director of First Year Engineering. He can understand the way students thinks and feel. Provides very good guidance
The Best person to be the Director for Eng 1! I found First Year bearable (not easy, but can't say tough either)
McMASTER ENGINEERS RULE!! SUCH A SPIRITED FACULTY WITH AMAZING STUDENTS! BOB LOREE IS SUCH AN INSPIRATION! SUCH A COOL PERSON!!Bob Loree Is the BEST person at Mac Eng! You Rock Our World
Words can not describe this man.  He is always there when you need him, he is very easy going and helpful, and his  Snacks with Bob  sessions are very informative.

The Best Person I have met in 1st Yr!!A great inspiration.In such a stressful environment,he is always there for you. Because of this guy, I love engineering even more. He's a nice person, but I wish all profs were as nice too (which isn't always)

Hey bob!1st Year is Intense-Particularly the Computer Programming course sucks BIG time!I hate it!I found the math courses to be the easiest and most interesting. Chemistry was a joke too and physics courses were bearable. Your so nice Bob! Thanks a lot!
No Comments

Haha...Yeah he s very Nice...I should say he definitely is dedicated...and i dont think there are a lot of Directors for First Year Engineers..so I was wondering if his job is to make students feel happy even under the strain of exams ;-)

Down to earth guy, good natured and open-minded.  Cares of the students first as if he own children...a quality missing in the university setting and society as a whole. Keep on bringing warmth Bob <-- doesn't minded being called by first name :-)

Like everyone else, I also share the same opinion about Bob. I doubt if any other school has such a caring person who would have open testing schedules(Mon thru Fri) for easing off the stress on students!! Words fail to describe this humble man.
Amzn guy, very friendly, keep it up BOB.
Very Helpful, Cares most about students.  He is out there in cold weather giving out soda crackers to students.
amazing guy.........very easy 2 talk to...gives good advice......keep up the good work bob!
he is a cool guy and he is very helpful ... have any problems go to him and he will make it so much clearer ... light bulb in the dark :D

The most helpful person I met during my first year in Engineering at McMaster. Snacks with Bob, actually made us do the countdown to that specific date. Wonder if next year we would be  promoted  to have Lunch with Bob!!!
Bob was always very firendly and helpful. Having him as a first year director made the year much less stressful and frantic than it could have been with someone else in the position.
bob, never had an in depth conversation with you, but let me tell you...you're the **** big guy.  ERTW!!!!
Overall great guy, super friendly and actually cares about us...we appreciate it Bob!

Very SUPER nice and kind hearted man.He supports you and motivates you to do well in a stressful environment.Has concern for students and wants to see all students succeed.He's an excellent advisor too.You can easily talk to him about any concerns AT ALL!
Great Director, Good helper and an all round good guy
No Comments
Thanx for all your help Bob! It is so nice to have you helping us through first year! Makes it better and less stressful for us! Thankyou so much!
Thanks for everything Bob! You seem to really care for the students and I really appreciate that!
Wonderful, wonderful person. Bob truly shows an interest in students, and genuinely wants them to do well. Way to go, Bob!!
Great Guy...... Wonderful Level 1 Director...
Great Guy! Snack with Bob was awesome.
No Comments
Great man! ENGINEERS RULE THE WORLD!!!!!!!!

Nice guy, but mcmaster engineering regulations are very tough (harder in upper years) I think you people should be more flexible like other engineering schools in ontario.I found first year a breeze compared to upper years
No Comments
BOB's done a great job this year and has been soo helpful to get first years involved in th faculty he's helped make first year a blast in Engineering. Way to go BOB!!  ERTW!!!!
Very Professional, and easy to talk to.  Thanks BOB.
The Best!!
No Comments
Bob is so nice and helpful.  It's really great of him to dedicate himself to just first-year students, in a way that seems beyond the call of duty.  Keeping giving it all you have, Bob!  :)
excellent spirit and support for first years!!

it was very helpful to know that there is a supportive figure that is available for ANY kind of help that was needed. it was really nice of Bob to show up b-4 our exams just to wish us good luck (& give us cracker to  reduce stomuch acid ).NOT ENOUGH SPC
No Comments
Well, what can I say, years of support already! :)  Helpful, kind, tries to accomodate as many students as possible.
No Comments
The nicest guy I have ever come across. Has genuine concern for students. Just awesome!!!
No Comments
Helpful Man
No Comments
You're awesome bob!
No Comments
A great guy
No Comments
Well rounded person.  Made transition from highschool to univ a breeze.
No Comments
No Comments
YOU THE MAN!!!!
He is very good to service us!

Hes da MAN..!
No Comments

A very very nice and kind hearted man. He supports you and motivates you to do well in a stressful environment.Has concern for students and wants to see all students succeed.He's an excellent advisor too. you can easily talk to him about any problems
Bob Loree owns.
Too Cool!
awesome guy .. wants to help students
Bob is all over making first year engineering rock
This man is why I'm here.  Period.  He is Mac Eng.
I wish this man was my dad.
excellent person, best resource for anyone in first year

comments: Dr. Campos demonstrated poor teaching ability. Attending her lectures weren't helpful, the information were disorganized, the way that she conducting the information did not following a logic manner. In order to achieve a good grade and study different lab techniques, you'd better to study all the lecture slides on your own again.

Dr. Campos is very smart and care the student a lot. But her lecture is so hard, sometime is hard to follow. And the test materials is killing me, if you want to get the higher mark, I will not recommend you to take it. And the labs are interesting, but you need to do a lot of work. Overall, I do not really like this course.
Really interesting class and labs.  It helps to read the textbook for clarification but she only tests on topics discussed in class. She is a really cute lady too. Very approachable.

Very smart instructor, very passionate about genetics however her teaching method isn't the best. Very confusing lectures. Notes are merely textbook diagrams with little explanations and captions. You must read the textbook to supplement her notes and lecture.

Her notes-ie. figures from text- are supposed to help you understand what she's saying, don't rely on them to study. Make your own notes. You should read/skim the text before class, it makes the class infinitely more useful. Very nice lady, available to help you.
Her notes suck and so does the way she teaches. It's useless to go to her lectures.
Very scary lady.
Repeats things in class and genuinely wants to help her students, but is difficult to understand.  Notes are useless.

She's difficult to understand at times.  She's quite intelligent but her ability to teach is lacking. I relied largely on the text book, and her "notes" are simply text figures without much elaboration.  I would dread having her as a prof again.

I felt that though Dr. Campos is intelligent and interested in genetics and biology, she isnt a very good lecturer. She was often unclear and off the topic and I often left lecture hoping that the textbook would be able to explain things better. She was, however, willing to help students.
No Comments
although anna r. campos is smart (very evident), her lecture style is very confusing. She's all over the place and her notes are not condusive at all.

mumbles through much of the lecture and is often more concerned with the elegence of an experiment's design than with the concepts themselves. knows her stuff but does not know how to convey it effectively to a class.
She's knowledgeable...but has a "anywhere but here" attitude in the classroom.  She's very bipolar with her behaviour...the textbook was far more effective.

I never heard a prof tell me "... I can't really explain this well..." then give a tired look and move on with the lecture before I had Campos as a prof.  Should not be teaching this class as it is evident she has no joy for teaching.
I thought she was just fine. She's a good prof, and she DOES give clear explanations, if u pay attention - too bad most ppl in the class won't shut up long enough to listen!

You can tell she's really smart, knows what she's talking about, and cares about us learning.  BUT she's hard to understand, talks fast, and jumps all over the place. I feel sorry for her though, barely 1/4 of the class attends now.  They're missing out.
hard to understand didn't care about students
Very tempermental - can be pleasant sometimes and downright rude other times. Uses good materials in class, but all from the textbook's CD. Also sometimes unnecessarily complicates concepts.
I think i had a better understanding of genetics before i went into her class!!!
Scary lady...makes you wanna go back to bed.
She provides a mere regurgitation of the Textbook
She is not clear at all and she's sometimes downright rude when asked a question
She is terrible at explaining things!  Don't understand a thing she teaches!

comments: He is one of the best Professors I studied and really glad I took that course. I would recommend students interested in Network Engineering to take the course.

Very nice and helpful Prof. His way of teaching made this course  eve more interesting. When needed, he will extend assignments and labs. Labs and assignments are very interesting, challenging and a bit long. His "inverted classroom" style of teaching helps a lot! Great Prof overall.
He is a very good prof. Cares greatly about his students and goes the extra mile that other professors do not when it comes to recording his lectures and emailing useful information consistently.
Interesting subject, interactive prof, u come out of lecture understanding the material. Very practical course, nice labs. Midterm labs and assignments are straightforward.Final was tough.
Great class, great prof.

You won't miss one of his lectures because he makes them interesting, and he'll change the course time if it's before lunch.  Labs were very hard, so get help from the ta's.  Cares for students, willing to answer questions.  Hard to contact through e-mail.  Screwed me on a bonus project though, I think he took off to climb Mt. Everest or something.
Wow I'm glad I went to McMaster and was challenged.  I certainly would of never been challenged at Waterloo.
Very Easy Prof for a very easy school. Wow engineering is so easy at McMaster. I wish I had gone to Waterloo for a challenge. I love this school sometimes they just give away marks.
Interesting Course Material.  Exams are way too long, and class was pretty disorganized.  Nice guy, you can always twist his arm to get an extension, but he needs to be more organized.

This man is obsessed with Apple.. If he could marry it, he would.. Szymanski is a nice guy, but he made all his midterms & assignments TOO HARD. Everyone goes into exam 50%. Unsure with his own material, needs to reference "The Book" all the time. But did let us watch "The Matrix" on the projector.
hard, long assignments. long, boring lectures.  easy midterms and finals.  other than that, "i'm not sure, i'll have to ask my TA"
can be aloof, in own headspace, can appear a little slow off the mark, but bright none the less
No Comments
Prefers abstract material, and only seems to consider the highest level of students when teaching material - good prof but should take all student levels into consideration.
Good prof.
A pure teacher, wants students to learn and succeed.  Provides excellent perspective on history/future of CPU industry.  A lot of work but fair.
Nothing worthy, hard assignment, poor lectures
notes always post min. 3 days after the date he said he'll post but gd prof
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Dr. Goldreich is amazing. The content is difficult but he does a lot to help. Weekly assignments really help and he is great at explaining. It is a night class that you need to attend because his lecture sides do not explain much and he does not podcast but he makes it enjoyable. The tests are very fair but to do well start studying a week before.
Great guy, very useful and accessible, with clear grading and expectations, made the challenging content more doable and easy to understand

Hands down the best prof Ive ever had. His tests are clear and fair. He's funny and makes you want to attend class. Super down to earth and really goes out of his way to help his students. The course content is heavy, but he provides lots of resources for you to find help.

Dr. Goldreich is my favorite prof of all time. He is so excited about neuroscience and his passion shows through his teaching. He makes really amazing puns at the beginning of every lecture. He also will come up with rhymes before your midterm to make you less nervous. He is very helpful at office hours. Just an overall nice human being.

Dr. Goldreich is an amazing prof. He is extremely knowledgable about a wide range of neuroscience and general science topics, and genuinely cares about his students. Attending lectures is pretty crucial, but he makes them very fun and engaging. There is a decent amount of work in his class but if you keep up with it you will do well. He's the best!

My favourite prof. My attendance sucks, but Goldreich makes you go and you will thank him for it. Grades are well distributed and fair. Lectures are clear. Class attendance and participation is a must. He seems to genuinely care that people learn and do well, despite it being a hard course.

Despite it being a three hour night class, Dr. Goldreich managed to make every lecture engaging. He's a brilliant man, a caring professor, and an entertaining lecturer. His weekly assignments were great for understanding the material. His tests were difficult (a lot of memorizing pathways and stuff like that), but always fair.

Everyone loves this prof. The topic of neuroscience is hard, but he makes it better. Assignments take time to complete. Help is provided on Facebook group. You HAVE to attend class. It being a 3 hour night class was pretty awful.

I loved everything about Dr. Goldreich and 4KK3! I don't come from a math or psych background, but I found the material interesting yet intuitive. He really loves what he's teaching, always has a smile on his face. Word of caution: homework is very time-consuming if you don't have programming skills.

Dr. Goldreich has to be the best professor I had during my entire undergraduate career! He was engaging lecturer who was passionate about what he taught. He was friendly and easy to approach, providing crystal clear explanations for challenging concepts. He's also the punniest pun master around!

He's awesome. Reminds me of Robin Williams. Such excitement about what he's teaching that I look forward to going to class even though it's hard. Exams are thorough, but extremely fair. Class is very well organized. Favourite prof!

I took Bayesian Inference as a PhD-level grad course. Dan was a lot of fun, and very fair. The course was pretty difficult and very labor-intensive, but I found it rewarding. I use the techniques covered in the course often in my own research. If you do psychophysics and want to learn about Bayesian inference, you should take this course.

He is a very humble and approachable prof, good sense of humor. His midterm was very fair.Exam was brutal, thought my head was going to explode and he tested the most miniscule of details, the material was just too much.  Brainteasers during class were not easy, great presenter, just hate how his class is so late &rushes material at end of lecture

Nueroscience on the best of days is always labor intensive but i haven't yet met a prof who was more interested in what you understand about your material rather than what you crammed hours before the exam.

It is a lot of information to digest. He is a very enthusiastic and fun prof, but even his jokes make a 7pm 3 hour lecture hard to sit through. If you do not have a good understanding of biology, physics, and chemistry, this course is a huge challenge.

This class has a lot of material, but it was very interesting. Dr. Goldreich demonstrated applications for every topic that made class more engaging and made the information easier to understand and remember. He really tests your understanding, not just memorization. High quality professor - I learned a lot.

Course material was interesting, and Dr. Goldreich was engaging in lectures, but the testing for this course was rather unfair and not representative of the material learned.  Personally, I wish I had taken 2N03 instead.

Took the class a few years ago, TA'ed it last year. Dan is a good prof, wants you to learn. Great course for anyone genuinely interested in neuroscience. Assignments/in-class are relatively free marks. Tests are relatively harder than many profs, make you think, but fine if you know it and are a critical thinker. note: He loves math, as you'll see.

Content was really interesting and testing was always fair. It's hard to keep a three hour neuroscience class engaging but there was never once a boring class. You can tell he puts a lot of thought and effort into his tests and his assignments.

Interesting course! His course is three hours, but never lets the class early - I am not complaining though.  It is obvious he loves the materials and teaching - very engaged with the course and students. Extremly friendly and helpful. His teaching style is absolutely great, i mean it is a lot of work to take his course, but it is worth it!

Awesome Prof. He's a cool prof and is pretty easy with his marking as well. Overall I think he turned what's not necessarily the most interesting subject (neuroscience) into a pretty enjoyable course. Would definitely recommend.

He's always willing to help students and is quite enthusiastic. Very approachable, and is able to keep me awake even for the three hour class with his interspersed class interaction and brain teasers--great teaching method =).
very inspiring!!! just amazing. his tests are not easy, but fair

WOW! He is a phenomenal professor. You really need to attend class, but its never a hassle. I always skip my other classes - but will never skip a class of his. He keeps the class motivated and laughing and really gets you interested in what you are learning because you can tell he LOVES it! Would never hesitate to take a clss with him!

Great prof. Very clear, very enthuastic, And very very very helpful. A nice guy too. To excel in class, just attend his lectures and read his notes. Also, remember any number he says...he loves numbers and they appear on tests.

One of the kindest, most patient and cheerful profressor I've come across. He's an AWESOME addition to the faculty, and a great lecturer too! He makes the morning classes something to actually look forward too, even if his jokes are a bit lame (but still funny!) :) I'm glad I was in his class!
Such an intelligent man. He was so cheerful at 830am. One can learn so much just by talking to him. Great professor!!

comments: Veyr helpful professor, easy to understand, you need to attend his lectures to do well in test and exmas. Gived you notes and exam summary.
No Comments

he is the best prof i ever met, even tho da test and assign are a bit hard.. but after all, he teaches clearly, and u will understand everything b4 u read the book.. notes helpful.. nice and friendly prof~!
This prof is very smart but tends to give maybe not so much difficult assignments but they take a long time with hard tests

If you have this prof, switch now! His test questions are worded in such a confusing way. This is first year econ and he's making it a really hard course. The assignments which are worth 3-4% take literally 13 hours to do. Other class averages are in the 80's. In Khan's class a lot walked into the exam with 80's and 90's. Muller's class avg: 60%.
No Comments
I have no idea about this pizza talk, I had him for natural resource economics.  He is extremely old school (including hands outs with sentences in latin). The course was a little jumbled.
Fin is the worst TA ever. Avoid him like the plague
the TA I had is crap...Fin is crap. waste of my time

This guy is a great teacher. His tests are fair, and if he feels the questions are bad, he'll remove that question and scale the test. His lectures are interesting to listen to, and he always makes jokes. He also has a knack for hiring good ta's. Overall, excellent excellent teacher.
This guy bites the big one. RUN FOR YOUR LIVES! His test are way to long and his questions are very example based with little emphasis on key concepts.
Old man muller... always good for a laugh... yeah he's old and he lives in KTH... ha

Many errors on the test. Sometimes I wonder if he even proof reads his own test. But pretty good teacher, helpful when asking him questions. Yup always uses either Pizza, Donut or Butter for his examples...
His first term test is usually easy, but the 2nd and  3rd are hard. However, in the end he will finish this course with an easy final.
pretty fair teacher. always uses pizza, beer and butter as examples. sometimes a little unprepared but very helpful
Well he just beat his own record, my estimate was about 110 in Thursday's lecture.

All he does is talk about pizza. Please talk about Economics and not the price of pizza. I made a friendly count with my friend to see how many times he says pizza in one lecture, and he topped off at 47 in 50 minutes.
nice guy.  one of those nice guys finish last kinda guys.. but in a good way!
No Comments
Not specific enough when teaching. Get to the point! Digresses very often!
Tests are too long but exam is easy
Nice Prof. !! But Pretty Hard Exams....
Always makes mistakes!! Long tests that u can never get them done on time~
No Comments
great prof!
ok

comments: I really enjoyed going to Dr. Atkinson's lectures, even though I found him a little all over the place and very difficult to follow for those handwriting (which I prefer). Genuinely nice man who loves doing what he's doing. Even though I had some difficulties with his slides/lectures I did very well in the class. Fair professor, great man.

Professor Atkinson is by far the BEST prof i have ever had.. he is soo laid back and his teaching method is great!! i came to class jsut to listen to him talk becaue his class is so interesting! and hes soo smart and to top it off hes pretty hot.. i'll admit it i have a HUGE crush on him.. to bad hes leaving for western:(
smokin'. seriously people, but he's also ridiculously smart.
JUST AMAZING AND OH SOOOOO HOT  best prof at mac

Can not think of any complaints, except why can't he teach all the classes?! So interesting and one of the few reasons I stayed in the program. I'm hoping to have him again in the future. Not an easy marker, but I did well in comparison to other courses simply because I enjoyed his courses so much. BEST PROF! Really cares about students & his work.

This prof is the by far the best teacher I have ever had.  He is soooo intellegent, and able to make sense of whatever you are trying to say.  He is so helpful and really seems to have an interest in students success.  His opinions and studies are sooo interesting, and I feel it a privelage to have been in his class

The class was so much better than expected, and only becuase He was the Prof. He is insighful and intelligent and very captivating. He is extremely accomplished and yet, not cocky like most professors at Mac who are so brilliant. I really enjoyed his class, and love love love him!! (Hard marker, but fair, and very encouraging)

An amazing young professor at McMaster. Approaches teaching with excitement, brilliance and considerate engagement.Do not want to miss this class. Very approachable and understadning. Not the easiest marker but definitely very fair.

He IS cool & UBER intelligent. Theoretical understanding is astounding, teaching methods infinitely interesting and his approachability makes him one of the greatest profs at Mac. An accomplishment for a prof so young!  He's going to be a super star & we got to take his class, how lucky are we!

In a word...brilliant. Has opened a whole new way of thinking to me. Not the easiest of markers, but he is extraordinarily fair. Doesn't try too hard to be cool (this person get a bad mark?). Would be a mistake to miss taking his classes....especially 4GG3. Kudos & thank you Dr. Atkinson..u rock!
awesome prof with great insights about the real world. totally cool with great teaching strategies! i really enjoy going to his classes!
Seems to be a good guy but he tries way too hard to be cool. It doesn't work for me.
Teacher is amazing and very helpful

Miss his classes & you are deprived! Never met a prof with such a visible passion for his work! Friendly, brilliant & most interesting prof ever, anywhere! Lectures are NEVER boring, innovative & fairly marked assignments. You will actually learn something in his classes! Doesn't hurt he's SOOO hot!
Cool prof
Was a great help in this class and made is fun and interesting.  Love the ink..wish I could see more ;)
Great Prof, excited about the topic.  Very encouraging and respectful to students.  Congradulations on the award!  Couldn't happen to a nicer fellow!
Great prof.  Michael is always available to answer any questions and really takes the time to help students learn and become interested in his material.  Congrats on the big award Dr. Atkison!!

He is a great prof, I love his course, its interesting how everyone shows up, he is easy to talk to and very well informed about many situations, he is a true reseracher and he knows and loves his stuff, take his course for sure
Awesome..lots of tattoos...good prof
He definately made the course more interesting. His research is facinating. I can't wait to take another course with him this year.

I have taken one of his classes, and will take several more next year. He makes potentially dry material incredibly interesting. He gets you out doing fieldwork, what great experience. Can't recommend him enough!
He's the man....take the class, no better prof in the world
No Comments
totally AWESOME!!!!
He's awesome!!!

comments: Great guy tbh

Professor Nejat is the cornerstone of the physics department. He loves the subject and really wants his students to succeed. However, his classes are by no means easy. You have to definitely be willing to put in work to do well. He expects you to read ahead and do homework that in addition to the labs and Loncapa take up a lot of time.
Cares about the class

caring prof that you can tell he truly wants you to succeed. Although lectures are hard to follow along, and when you try to go home and read them online, none of the questions have any solutions to them. tests were very difficult and multiple choice was impossible. wouldnt really recommend as a prof,but seehim in his office hours is really helpful

Nejat was a legendary prof to have his random in-class pop quizzes kept everyone on their toes, but you could tell that he really did care that his students succeed and inspired us to a high standard.

His accent is really hard to understand. He rushes through the whole lecture and only gives a minute to solve questions that would take at least  5 minutes to solve. Therefore, You end up understanding nothing. I studied off youtube for the whole course and my grade wasn't too bad. The only reason I went to lectures was for the iclicker questions.

Studied for his class more than any other ENG1 course yet barely passed... the way he taught was confusing and learning on your own from his slides is very hard because of the way the slides are. Also puts important questions in lectures but doesn't provide a solution to them. Wouldn't recommend
Physics 1E03 : Introduction to life choices and lessons xD. Honestly Nejat is one of the best profs you can have for year one Engineering.

"Find your knowns, find your unknows, the rest is math, and do you want a microphone?" are what you're gonna hear from Dr. Nejat. Dr. Nejat is easily the best physics a prof a student can have who really cares with all his heart that we learn and do well in exams. Really accessible outside class and appreciates it when someone works hard.

Great prof! His classes are quite entertaining and engaging. You won't ever dreadfully stare at a clock waiting for his class to be over. He's funny, passionate about physics, and good at explaining concepts. He picks on people to answer questions so be prepared for that!! It's great that he does that, makes you pay attention.
Dr. Nejat is an incredible professor. He is inspiring not only for physics but also for life and dreams.

Given the complex nature of the nuclear physics, his explanations were very clear but missing depth. Nejat is an amazing professor and a human; very friendly, doesn't try to avoid you, and reasonable.  I respect him a lot.
I go everyday to watch him say the words "and the rest is math"
His accent and very interactive teaching style take some time to get used to, but you can tell he wants you to succeed in his class.  Labs were meh.....
ONE MINUTE READ, ONE MINUTE ANSWER - proceeds to allow 2-3 minutes for iclicker answers while hovering over the end poll button in anticipation.
Great professor. Lectures are hilarious and usefull. Test are quite tough,  but if you do the wrong,  they're not impossible. 10/10 would take a class with him anyday

"Draw Free Body Diagram", "Next by you" are only a few of his catchphrases that I will miss from this class. He really engages the students and tries to make the lectures funny and less intimidating. Enter his class you would not only learn physics but just life in general. Awesome prof. Try to have physics class with him as much as possible.
Really knows what he's talking about, and really loves teaching. I looked forward to going to class.

Hi All (C05, C06)  Nejat was my favourite prof in first year. He was always so caring and so genuine, and so helpful in office hours. I'm honestly going to miss sitting in ABB 102 and having Nejat teach me physics. Even though the course was hard, he did a great job.  Bottom line, he's an awesome professor and an even better human being.   OK!
Very caring professor who genuinely cares for his students to do well in the course

Never met a professor like him. Coming to uni, I had some difficulties and he changed my opinion of what it means to be taught by someone who cares. He has the biggest heart, and has been almost a father figure to me. Always willing to help, he will go the extra mile to make sure you understand, and does anything he can to help--with anything.
his mustache gives you a better understanding of Newton's laws.
You have to go to class because of the iClickers, useless prof who thinks that if he yells at you enough it will make it through your thick skull
This professor is very rude in my opinion. Very unapproachable. Luckily, this was just an elective; unfortunately, it was a waste of money.

Amazing Prof! He loves to engage the class and picks on people but it enhances the classes learning! The best physics prof hands down! Definitely recommended as he prepares you the most for the brutal midterm and exam!
Very helpful

Dr. Nejat gets a lot of flak, but I think most of that is misplaced frustration with the course itself. Physics is not easy by any stretch of the imagination, and it takes a lot of self-directed learning to get a good mark in this class. That being said, Dr. Nejat is always willing to help, and does his best to clarify even the most trivial issues.
Hard to understand him, he makes mistakes in lectures and expects you to be a lecture ahead with loncapa and quizzes. Not a fan.

Extremely difficult to understand in class. Asks questions before teaching concepts. I had a really hard time in this course not taking physics in high school. He is a very nice man though, if you go to office hours, you may not learn more, but he will help you with your grades.
Very helpful! Love him! I think he is the a very responsible prof.
Recommend dropping this course if you have him. Goes through useless material and is reluctant to help students.
useless.

He was a good prof! He def loves teaching n wants his students to get the best. I took physics 1L03 n got a good mark in his class :) He is very help, although indeed he does speak funny and unclear sometimes
Nejat's a champ
very attentive.. realizes that in this course most people either hate or have trouble with physics so he tries and effectively makes the class interesting... 'oh that's a good one!'
Coming into this course without any background in physics proved to be quite challenging; this course is not as much of a bird as everyone says it was and it was in fact my lowest mark this year.
his english is bad, he talks funny and he is so boring.
I am not a fan of phsyics at all..in fact i hate it but this prof made me actually want to come to class and learn it..hes good at what he does and his tests are fair!
He is very interesting and funny.
Nice guy, funny, engages the students and does his best to make it easy without insulting your intelligence. My favorite prof this semester :)
Funny man, but not very clear as a teacher and not very good at answering questions and helping people to better understand the content.
only class where i learnt shat and still managed to get a decent grade.
Had him for engphy 2d03. He made it hard and interesting at the same time. Really enjoys forcing you to think
Good prof. loves to grab students out of the audience to answer questions. some accent difficulties. slight organizational issues with regards to capa
Great professor, funny guy, and loves his students.

A very enthusiastic and caring professor. Assignments are helpful, tests challenging, exam quite easy. I think more focus on assigning selected homework problems rather than "just do the ones in your book" would have been helpful. He really loves his students and loves teaching.
Very enthusiastic and willing to help, but can be very unclear. Weekly assignments are relatively helpful but tedious. Participate in his class and he'll love you.
I love him! "GO AHEAD!!" "Hello guys!"

Great Prof. Has high expectations of students, but does everything imaginable to help you attain his high standards. Extremely approachable and helpful, good sense of humor and friendly. Highly suggest taking his classes. A+ for Nejat

Funny dude, fully did a pendulum trial in class and nearly got knocked down by the flying pendulum. Picks on random people in class, and gets disappointed if low test avg for his class. Do your work every night and he'll be impressed!
Quite simply he is just my favorite professor this semester.

Best professor at McMaster. I got an A- in his class and most of the credit goes to his friendly teaching skills. His demeanor is very simple and that makes it really easy to approach him. He helps students a lot, makes photocopies of exercise sheets for students, post solutions promptly, has a clear voice and very interactive.

I absolutely love this guy. He's such a little cute old man with the funniest accent ever. He likes to single people out so sit in the front to avoid be asked questions. Rather than lecturing he prefers to lead class discussions which is very helpful. If you go to his office hours he is very helpful, he helped me the day of the exam and I did super
A good prof, definitely keeps you paying attention otherwise he will ask you a question.  One of the few classes that I liked.

Dr Nejat is awesome!  I never really like physics, but he made it interesting, fun and easy enough for me to take both semesters!  He's so kind, and really cares about students.  He makes university courses feel like high school again - class interaction and compassion for students!  "Please turn off your cell phones, nobody wants to dance now!"

If you somehow land in his class, quickly try to transfer into Hughes'.  He is sweet but he doesn't take the time to answer questions slowly and clearly and he wastes too much time asking people if they've done their work.  The english is a little problem too!
The proboblity of Lyowder!
Communicates ideas very well, with a lot of useful analogies. Tests are reasonable. Very nice to students, he printed about 30 pgs of notes for not being able to find it on the website.

fantastic instructor a fan favorite but also serious at the same time.  He will help no matter what he is doing at the time but also brings the material to life.  He points and asks people questions but that is to get people involved and never done with malice.  Best class I have had at mac and best prof.

Animated teaching style and frequent class interaction definately keep your attention focused on the material.  Goes out of his way to explain things for the art students who mistakenly applied to science. <evilgrin>
Best Physics prof!
An awesome prof. Very understanding and encouraging. Tries to help poor students in spite of them clearly not having read material. Underappreciated many of his students
He is just great
If you are not very good at physics, he is the guy for you! He makes you understand! But if you do have some insight into physics, you might get bored in his lectures!

Very good prof. Tries to help poor students in spite of them clearly not having read material. His lectures highlight the shortcomings of only understanding application. Very helpful as he shows hidden relationships in physics. Underappreciated because majority of his students are stupid and lazy.

Very good prof. He gets the class involved in most of his lectures and is very helpful if you don't understand something. He also cares for his students, one example is he changed a test date because he knew that we had 4 other tests in that week.

He's a love or hate kinda guy, and I think he's great. Got me to understand and appreciate basic physics much more thoroughly than in high school. And he's really helpful if you want a recommendation letter or some extra help. Volunteer in class, too.

It might seem like he's picking on you when he singles you out, but don't take it personally - he just wants to get everyone involved.  Very effective as a teacher.  Taking his class even helped with understanding other classes.

Not only did he explain the physics really well, he also taught us the necessary math months before we learned it in our math class, and did a better job of it than the math prof. He absolutely loves to talk to students (for hours if you go to his office)
Please class, have a discussion, I've never been picked on so much in a class in my life. Although he's really smart, he needs to understand that we're really not.
He totally reminds me of Saddam Hussain...in a good way. For the first time ever, I dont sleep in Physics class....he really sticks his face in yours to get an answer...makes you think

Terrible.  I saw him yell at a student for not knowing the answer to the question "what is force?"  If you've got him for 1E3 - attend a different lecture.  Having the word element screamed over and over won't help you understand area integr
I have no idea what he was saying. Tests were tough and exam was easy, but it didn't really test understanding.  Marking made no sense and he was uncooperative regarding a remark.

Extremely enthusiastic, interacts with the class and explains concepts better than any prof I've had. He taught us differential equations so well we asked him to come teach our math class! Best prof ever!
Dr. Nejat is great!  He makes difficult concepts easy to understand.  He loves to teach and it helps you learn more.

This dude would tower above all profs if he was not ESL.  His enthusiasm is contagious.  He loves to teach.  Don’t be scared of his interactive style.  Once you realize there is no shame in not knowing the answers to one of his on-the-spot questions, you
Great Prof! Enthusiastic and cares for his students! Full of energy and knowledge. Might be a little hard to understand but is still one of the best proffs at Mac :)
A lot of fun. He WANTS you to learn and understand his passion, PHYSICS!
This man loves his physics!  So intense, but so good.... WHAT IS FORCE!?!&#6
his english is not so good, but he know
Cannot understand a word he says. That's why I got a 1!!! Damn guy!
I was intimidated at first but you come to really like the guy.He LOVES Physics!
He scared me at first. But I like him after I attended more letcures.
I can't understand a thing the guy does

comments: I really enjoyed this class quite a lot. I found it quite easy to follow and I didn't put that much effort in in order to get a good grade. I would recommend skipping buying the course-ware; I never looked at it once. Better off saving the $20.
Great lectures, but extremely hard marker! Studied hard and I am great at essays and only got a C. I am majoring in classics and this class was very hard, but very interesting.
She is disrespectful, drudges through lectures wasting time chatting about God knows what and honestly has no respect for anyone besides herself.
She's the worst prof i've ever had in my entire university experience. So rude, I literally dropped her class. Avoid at all costs.

If you think you can pass intro to classical arch without going to every class then don't bother taking this course. Dr. George is bearable if you sit down and shut up. Don't expect to pass without studying your butt off either.
Horrible professor, never stayed on topic, and has a very scattered way of teaching.
very high expectations

I hate to start off this way but, George is easily the worst professor I have had to date (3rd year). Her lectures are absolutely painful and she veers WAY off topic far too often. If she used her hands to talk any more I'd swear it was a sign language class. Don't expect any help when going to her. She's also subtly rude via email. Please avoid!

Dr. George is fantastic. Yes she speaks quickly, but she doesn't expect you to remember everything. She's a brilliant scholar, fantastic lecturer, and very passionate about academia. Always go see her about papers, she's very helpful. I was terrified about taking a class with her, but she turned out to be my favourite professor.

Uninspiring, arrogant and difficult.  Avoid her at all costs!  She is very unapproachable and condescending .  She would be better suited for research which would free her from the drudgery of interacting with students which she is ill-suited to do.  BEWARE!

Dr. George is a huge disappointment for many, many reasons.  First, she carries herself as if she has no expectations, but when papers are returned her expectations are so high that they become unrealistic.  She is more preoccupied with her own agenda and does not make any time for her students.

An excellent, brilliant professor. It's obvious that she loves what she does because she's so enthusiastic. By gushing over pieces of art she made me love them as well. She definitely made the course, it's the only class where I didn't look at my watch and where I was disappointed when it was over.
A very intelligent professor, very engaging and incredibly kind.  She makes the already interesting course material even more intriguing...  Slow down, though!  We can't write that fast!

I loved her, absolutely.  She knows so much about the topic, and although she can speak quickly, there is so much history to cover it has to be that way.  Just write faster ppl.  I wish I could have had another class with her.
Great prof. But what I don't understand is why she tries so hard to fit in when she was born to stand out!
No Comments
She is an excellent professor.  She really knows her stuff.  Her lectures can be rather fast-paced but are still very enjoyable.  Just wish she would be more fond of the Ionian Revolt.
Fast speaker, but not too fast. Lectures packed with information and excellent examples. Very clear and obviously loves what she does.

I always enjoy her classes b/c they are organized and well presented. I wish all of my professors were as straight forward and clear. She is the ideal professor who is a good teacher, honest and always helpful.
she works it
Good speaker, very clear explanations, adds humour to lectures
VERY Clear, Not so concise however...
slow down
Not too fast. Not too slow.
she needs to calm down...
Her lectures are always fascinating and packed with good information
slow down!
No Comments
No Comments
Yes, but she teaches you GOOD STUFF fast!
She needs to start drinking decaf, it's like listening to 3 chipmunks on speed
