comments: Even though I did well, this is a hard course to succeed in. The weekly quizzes can be tough and ambiguous, especially if you don't do them in groups. I recommend you do them in groups, but make sure you participate (be an E). Participate in tutorials, it's a free 10%. The exam was hard but not undoable, it's all about application.

Joe Kim is the best prof I've had so far. His lectures are clear, concise, and interesting. The course content isn't bad but the wording of some quiz questions can be a little tricky. BUT you can do quizzes in groups. The final is fairly easy if you understand the material. You can also get an easy 10% off your exam if you do SONA and Peerwise.
Online quizzes and tests were SO hard and difficult to prepare for

Dr. Kim makes lectures super interesting (fav prof I've had so far in first year) - this was my favourite course this semester; I enjoyed the content in the modules (although they can kind of be long-winded) and found the tutorials very helpful (helps you practice applying what you learned irl, which will help with the weekly quizzes)
I HATED THIS COURSE BUT HE IS A GOOD PROFESSOR
this course literally made me change my entire fricken major. the exam is NOTHING like the quizzes or lectures. i'm actually switching my major because of this course
Great prof who really cares about the content and makes sure everyone understands and is always available outside of class

Lectures definitely were not mandatory, but there were an additional experiment or two to remember for Friday's quizzes. That was probably so people who showed up to lecture got a free mark. Additionally, you get iClicker points if you show up to the lecture and answer the multiple choice questions, which can be used to drop lowest quiz grades
Amazing professor, ver well structured course, would definitely take it again
Course too heavy on quizzes and not much else. Could be done online.

Dr Kim was an amazing prof, and especially in first year where you're not used to big lectures and professors. His lectures are very interesting and engaging and the quizzes and exam were very reasonable.

Most structured course in McMaster University. He has everything organized to make you succeed. Watch 30 min module before monday lecture (make notes if you can). Go to tutorial to practice what you've learned. TAs are the most trained charismatic TA's at McMaster. Then do the online quiz on friday with your buddies. Impossible to do poorly.
Joe Kim does everything he can to help you succeed. The course is really relevant and well structured. Just take advantage of the practice quizzes and you'll be fine.

i loved joe kims lectures, he did a good job of keeping the class engaged and i found the material of the course itself (both in the modules and in class) to be really interesting. this was definitely my favourite course of the semester and joe kim was easily my favourite prof of first year
He needs to spend more time listening to other views. He is busy telling people only what he knows.

Dr. Kim is a great professor. The only complaint I have about this class is that it is unclear which material you are supposed to know from the textbook, as sometimes new information that is not brought up in lecture or the web modules is found in the text, rather than supplementing what was already learned. Also, you should be prepared to study.
Have weekly quiz and you need to study for it. Need to study before the tutorial.

Joe Kim's lectures were sometimes a bit off topic, but were still a lot of fun.  The tutorials were especially useful since they were a chance to gain a further understanding of material from lecture and online modules.  Lecture attendance is important since iclicker points can be used to drop low grades.  Highly recommend this course and prof.

I LOVE DR KIM, he genuinely tries his best to make lectures as interesting as possible. Weekly quizzes aren't easy but they're not impossible either. The only thing I didn't like was how the exam was worth so much, but it was alright at the end because other marks are fairly easy to get if you try your best. I'm looking forward to Psych 1XX3!

Overall, I enjoyed the content of PSYCH 1X03 but Joe Kim isn't by any means my favorite professor. Lectures were entertaining (and his daughter gives me life) but the content felt thrown together and ended up being almost completely unnecessary for the final. Textbook pretty much optional as well. 30% quizzes, 10% tutorial, 50%-55% final.
he real cute

Worst class I have ever taken!!! The lectures and tutorials are useless and the course coordinator and prof is no help. A waste of time and stress, definitely do not recommend, I'm never taking psychology again.

If you are taking this class as an elective, don't. The weekly quizzes are tricky and tough, and the exam content had the same level of difficulty. Attending lecture should be done, since there are iclicker points that you can obtain and a certain amount will drop your lowest participation grade/ quiz grade. The tutorials were very helpful.

If it is a core course to you. Just go for it. But if you are taking it as an elective. Dont bother to do so. The benefit of the course is there is no midterm but every friday quizzes. When it comes to exam, the questions are so tricky that it is unlike your quizzes questions. And basically you wont have time for a such a  ' time wasting' elective

Joe Kim makes the lectures easy to listen to and the grading of the course is fair. There is lots of room for extra credits, including extra participation marks which help you to drop your lowest marks on the quizzes at the end of the semester. He also offers SONA experiments that can be done to lower the stakes of the exam from a 55% to 50% exam.
Good course, he's definitely not a prof to be afraid of. This course is not an easy 12 by any means though; the questions on the tests can be quite ambiguous.

Joe Kim is one of a kind. His online modules are littered with hit or miss jokes, as are his in class lectures. His tests can be difficult if you don't read the textbook and practice using his online quizzes. He seems to care a lot about his students, but don't let the relaxed atmosphere fool you, you'll need to put in the work to get a good grade.
hes awesome
Amazing Prof

Too much content in the modules and does not clarify module information during lectures which is what is actually tested on the exam.   Only goes off tangents from actual material.  Ambiguous quizzes and poorly written textbook (probably by himself). WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
you can never feel not interested during his lecture
Not great. He's a joke. Lectures don't really cover much material, and he doesn't bother posting the slides before the lecture.

Great Lecturer, makes lectures engaging and interesting. Majority of the course is based on 10 Quizzes worth 3% each and final exam worth up too 55%. Questions are designed in a rather difficult way, which requires a keen understanding of the course material.
Joe Kim is my fave, gets you involved and thinking. MC can be tricky but you'll do well if you attend lectures & read textbook (semi optional)
Makes lectures fun, great course structure, his TA's are well trained and very accessible... Overall, WOULD REALLY RECOMMEND HIM & THE COURSE!!

Unless you already know everything beforehand, expect to be completely puzzled by his 'expertise' on Neuroscience. I was so disappointed by his teaching methods which were so dry and incomprehensible that I switched my major. He gets a D- for that
Great prof

Questions on quizzes and exam are somewhat unclear. Assigned textbook for the course sometimes contradicts information for web modules and in-class lecture. Material is generally interesting but also vague, making quizzes hard. Only did well because I took psychology in high school.
Tip: Doing the quizzes by yourself/without looking at your notes will do wonders for you when it comes to the final exam.

He is hilarious! Psych 1X03 and 1XX3 were my favourite courses in first year. His lectures are very interesting and doesn't just reiterate the online modules. I have definitely never fallen asleep during his lectures--he's the best!
Questions were ambiguous. Course was not written well and vague interpretations. Teach research that they are not even sure of. Psychology is not a science and should not be taught as such.

I never read the textbook once and still did great! However, on the quizzes there are questions from the textbook, but if you have a textbook handy, it shouldn't take that long to find the answer. I also don't think the exam covered anything from the textbook. So mostly focus on the modules and lectures.

Dr. Kim is an all around great prof. He really loves what he teaches and it shows during lectures. He makes the content fun to learn, and I rarely find myself zoned out during lectures. I would definitely take this class again.

Always take really good notes. Didn't really read a lot of the textbook but when I did it was 100% helpful and goes in depth and over a lot of topics - because there is concepts/theories that you learn that isn't in the module or lecture that is super important! The Exam was fair and just like the weekly quizzes format wise.

Dr. Kim is hands down my favourite professor. The material in lectures, modules, and tutorials is all connected which allows for deep understanding of the concepts. His lectures are interactive, fun, and absolutely fly by. It is obvious that he is very passionate about his field and even though Psych is a huge  course he cares about his students.

you do need some deeper level of thinking when it comes to the content/weekly quizzes. you'll be tested on stuff beyond what you learned (you have to know more than what was said in the module/lecture)... you're expected to know it thoroughly even if that's not how it was taught. the bonus points for iclickers are extremely helpful and generous

1-His daughter is adorable 2-It is NOT a bird course. I am in medical radiation sciences and this is my lowest grade (80-83%)  3-weekly quizzes are very tricky and require you to be 100% comfortable with the material  4-Lectures aren't boring since he is funny and usually entertains us  5-Tutorials are mandatory and a BIG help

Have to watch weekly 30 min web modules that are kind of boring sometimes, and there are weekly quizzes which have tricky questions. If you pay attention and take good web-module notes, you will do fine on the quizzes. Overall, I enjoy the class
he uses his daughter as an example sometimes and its adorable. The lectures are interesting. He does a good job of keeping me focus. Lots of discussion with others around us though.

Interesting concepts are taught but overall a very difficult course with hard weekly quizzes that are timed. Do not take this course unless you are required to or are majoring in psych. Be prepared for a lot of readings and spending hours watching the modules.

He was an okay guy- he had some humour in the online course, but he was all around pretty bland. I was rather bored by his lectures, and his tests were incredibly tough. 60% for the final, unless you do some extra stuff. Multiple choice. If you're taking this for an elective, you better be amazing at trick multi-choice. Otherwise, don't.

Awesome prof! Lectures were hilarious and unique. He explained things really well. Keep up on the textbook stuff because he asks a lot of questions about them. The exams are pretty tough and specific but if you understand the concepts you should do well.

i LOVED THE COURSE MATERIAL AND THE SUBJECT. BUT THEN THE EXAM COMES WORTH 55 PERCENT AND YOU FEEL LIKE YOU WASTED ALL YOUR TIME STUDYING FOR NOTHING BECAUSE THE QUESTIONS ARE SO HARD AND EVERYTHING SEEMS LIKE ITS THE RIGHT ANSWER. I WOULD NEVER TAKE HIS COURSE AGAIN.

Psych 1XX3 is much easier than 1X03, but it isn't a bird course. The last 2 units were from the textbook so it's worth it to invest. Weekly quizzes with some questions taken from live lecture. Don't fall behind with the modules even though they're online and do the SONA studies. No midterm. The exam was more than fair.

The set up of the course is a little weird, with an exam worth 60% and the rest from weekly quizzes and participation, but apart from that he's a great prof with amazing lectures. The overall content of the course is really interesting but his lectures made everything more relatable and easier to understand. Would take the course again, not doubt.

Dr. Kim was always clear and concise in his explanations on the online modules. His quiz questions were challenging, but when done in a group and efficiently greatly helped in applying and understanding the concepts! Exam questions were not as hard as the quiz questions, and were fair. Great Prof, would love to have him again!!!

I haven't seen his final exam yet. His quizzes are literally the hardest thing ever that I've ever read. His weekly quizzes are insanely difficult , tricky, confusing. If you are not planning to go to the faculty of psychology, don't choose  this course. It is a GPA KILLER. This is the first time I feel studying psychology is irritating.

Not a fan of the way the course is organized... its not engaging at all. Its tough work to make psychology boring, but those modules do an excellent job of it. Lots of easy concepts with pretentious, specific jargon.
This class was very difficult

Online modules are fairly straight-forward, and the chapter readings are long but clearly explained.  Most people have trouble with the course because the online quizzes mainly involve applicationcritical-thinking questions as opposed to straight-up knowledge.

Avoid his class if you can. There were several modules in which there was incorrect information provided which confused students immensely. The lecture on Psychopathology provided information on an old, outdated version of DSM. In a university setting, you would hope that lecture material is updated as the evidence is updated.
Avenue to learn allows you to go at your own pace to keep up with the class. But the avenue quizzes are just so hard!!! Most difficult first year class I have ever taken.

Puts zero effort into helping his students.  Never even met him.  Basically just makes the web modules and now he'll probably keep on using those for years while continuing to get paid for not teaching.  My TA was great but a 50 minute tutorial per week isn't enough to be effective.  This course weeds out the people not commited to studying psych.

The whole course was basically an experiment for Dr. Kim, where he asks to keep your grades and such for data - felt like the course was taught for all the wrong reasons. You were not told this at the beginning of the term (ironic considering we learn about ethics in psych experiments). Do not take if you are not a Psych major.

The course is delivered by online modules, a textbook,  and a weekly tutorial. Weekly quizzes were challenging because they require you to understand the content vs simply memorizing but helped tremendously by exam time. Keep up with the readings, modules and use your tutorials effectively to ask questions/explanations, and you'll be fine.

This course had interesting topics, but the modules made the content boring. There is no help provided, inexperienced TAs, and unbelievably tricky test questions. Don't take this course unless you are required to. If your average in the titanic, this course is the iceberg.
Its an online course I absolutely hated it. The weekly quizzes were horrible. And Dr. Kim sucks.
Not in psych major? DON'T TAKE THIS COURSE, period.

I really liked this course. The quizzes are not that hard - the questions are based on how well you can apply the concepts you learned to real life. If you follow his and your TA's advice, you should do well in this course.
Are you as smart as Stephen Hawking? if not, don't take this course. You cannot get help anywhere, no profs and inexperienced TAs

Terrible prof! I never saw him in person only through web modules. Questions on weekly tests were brutal. The questions were worded to trick students and bring averages down. Worst mark first year. Don't take this course with him!!

TERRIBLE!!! I love psychology and I'm in the PNB program now but first year was a struggle...online lectures DON'T HELP! All his test/exam questions are tricking you so watch out for it...seems like he's trying to bring people's marks down. if you aren't trying to get into a psych program, DON'T take these courses

i personally liked him despite his oddly worded questions. He added in cool jokes and the course content was very interesting. His weekly tests were a little tricky but you get the hang of them by exam time
he should try asking straight forward questions on quizzes. do NOT take his class unless you dont mind working hard for a poor grade.

Great prof! To be honest, I was going into psych so scared, because I read the reviews about him from previous years! But DON'T WORRY. As long as you stay caught up in the online modules, read every now and then, do experimetrix and study hard for the final, you can get a good mark no problem! The workload is quite favorable too.

Pretty entertaining and fun prof! Clear lectures but he covers way to much material in one module. Also, his modules should be lectures! I hated watching the modules every week! Tutorials helped a lot but make sure to have watched the modules before hand or you will be lost! Never gonna forget how much torture studying for that exam was!

yes, his tests were hard but he makes the modules really interesting. i ended up liking psych by the end of the course. eventually though youll get used to his question style and you should be ok for the exam. he reuses some questions so review the weekly tests well

Why don't people like Dr. Kim? I thought he was great! The weekly quizzes/lectures are tough, but he has little jokes and makes them more entertaining. There are plenty of resources for help, and the course is organized great!
Just when you think your done with those painfully boring 1x03 web modules...... boom! heres 14 more. Joe takes interesting concepts and makes them boring. Could be way better. Sorry Dr.Kim

The web lectures were ineffective, and the website only worked a quarter of the time. The final exam is written in riddles and worth 60% (can be lowered if your willing to be a guinea pig for experiments at Mac (not ideal for conestoga BScN students). Oh and if you're going to make your own text/handbook, EDIT it!

1X03 & 1XX3 were my easy 12s in 1st year and it helps if you see them this way. Ideally, you can go into the exam with 100%. Make sure you understand why your answers are right/wrong. Buy and read the textbook at some point in time! DO NOT go into the exam never having written a quiz by yourself. Don't memorize! Understand! Elaborate rehearsal.

Interesting concepts, but some quizzes and the exam were ridiculous. Each question is a like a riddle and it doesn't matter how well you understand the content. I felt like I was in a experiment during the exam and was waiting for someone to rush out and place an EEG on my head to measure my brain activity.

Excellent web module lectures and well run tutorials. The case studies were very useful. This is not a course people should take if they struggle with understanding concepts. You will not do well in this course if you memorize information. The quizzes are tough, but this is a rewarding course with genuinely interesting content (esp for 1st year).

One of the worst classes I have taken. Almost nothing is learned the entire term because quizzes are open book and almost everybody does them with friends forcing the average person to worry about a 60% closed-book final. Quizzes are ambiguous and don't seem to cover course content. Tutorials are high-school-y at best.

Horrible class, do not take this unless you want to do something with it in life. For an elective this is an extremely poor choice. The prof does a test 1 week before the exam after classes have while there are exams going on so you have no time to study for it. The tutorials are a complete waste of time and the case studies are insulting.
did not like that course. :( but the material was interesting. Did poorly on quizzes -_-

The prof is funny and interesting guy BUT he makes the course difficult. His web lectures as his part of teaching method is ineffective. Tutorials supposed to be longer. He has some issues on giving information (particularly on the grammar) that confuse students to grasp the material. Tho psych is super interesting, I wish he'll be like other prof.
Ok prof, hard quizzes

I really liked Dr. Joe Kim, had him for Psych 1X03 and 1XX3. Quizzes were hard but not unreasonable (I'd recommend doing them with a friend or two) and live lectures for 1XX3 were very interesting. Exams were fair, much easier than the quizzes! Although difficult, I really enjoyed his courses
his course 1x03 was quite difficult, it required so much effort for a first year course.
Weekly quizzes are HARD!!!!!!

Never knew what to expect from the weekly quizzes, sometimes I felt I did very well on the quiz, but end up doing terrible...and sometimes felt I did very bad on the quiz, but end up doing very well....
Weekly quizzes are very difficult and time limit is very short. Content is difficult to comprehend. Professor is good but quizzes require a deep comprehension of all the material.

Content was very interesting, but the way that the content is presented via web modules was very poor. The weekly quizzes were a very poor way of testing students,and very ambiguous. Dr. Kim also tries to be helpful during his office hours, but the way he teaches and the way he tests are two very different things.

Quizzes are hard, but overall fair - as long as you actually study (not just look over and memorize). You can't just read, you have to be able to teach the content - explain it and apply it. It forces you to do weekly/daily work and prepares you well for later courses. Highly recommend it.
He's the hardest prof ever, quizzes are completely unreasonable and the final is terrifying , i'm scared for my life :( discouraging when you wanted to go into psych :(
Not as difficult as people have said that he is. Psych 1XO3 is an awesome course, and he goes out of his way to prepare students with study aids.

Not a bad course, but his wording, especially on quizzes, was a HUGE issue for me. There's a difference between testing for comprehension and wording questions in such a way that you INTEND to fool people, and Dr. Kim toes that line very finely. Definitely not the easiest course to do well in.

Worst course ever! No matter how you try u will fail. It is elitist ,with a bunch of snobby undergrads as you T.A's that only play fun games with you.Don't ever take it..wish I could have dropped it...
I Feel that the quizzes are unfair no matter how hard you study you will FAIL!!!!!! :'(
Famous
His quizzes are extremely unreasonably difficult, no matter how much effort you put into it, theres no way you can get a good mark because the questions are difficult and UNreasonable
i don't recommend anyone take this course. dr joe kim makes his questions extremely difficult and purposely words test questions to fool students.
i don't recommend anyone take this course. dr joe kim makes his questions extremely difficult and purposely words test questions to fool students.

he is the worst professor i have encountered of my four years at Mcmaster. He makes his quizzes and test extremely difficult. The content it self is easy to understand but he words his questions in a way almost as if he wants us to do badly.

any class that is marked by attendance is ridiculous. I have never seen my professor once, which is pathetic considering this school is costing me $10,000. the quizzes are written in a way where you can argue that your answer is correct....although it is marked wrong. it seems as if kim is trying to fool people in his tests.
Too many contradictions in the material (Avenue, eBook). Lots of spelling and grammatical errors in the eBook.

Great prof. It seems that people I know who didn't do so well in this course really dislike him. However, I found his lectures very clear. His midterm was tough in a sense that you really have to think. If you try and understand the concept instead of just memorizing, you will do well.

Well thought out and planned modules, lots of team to review the lectures as they were online and only tested on online lecture material. Allowed experiment participation for free marks. Presents his material in an easy to understand way and tutorials are set up well for answering questions. Great prof. I want to be a Psych TA!
hes the most useless prof ever.. makes midterms and exams so hard

I can respect that he took a lot of time into constructing this course but his methods aren't working and his class averages are proof of that. I felt like the students were just a part of an experiment of his. His tests were hard mainly because his wording was confusing. Tests are all application which I'm not sure is the best for 1st yr classes.

He's class is way hard. It's kind of cool how the lectures are done online but I've never actually seen Dr. Joe Kim in person (I don't even know if he's real)! I don't think he should be teaching the first year pysch classes. I switched out of psych thinking it would be too hard after his classes.

LOVE him! A very funny and engaging prof who made me love psychology! His midterms and exams aren't bad at all if you actually understand the concepts and aren't just memorizing everything, I've aced all of them so far. :)

Lecture content and online quizzes/module "checkpoints" were consistently NOT at the difficulty level of the midterms or exam.  Also, there can be serious admin screw ups given the large course size - my exam was marked with the wrong answer key.  Only because I stuck up for myself was it double-checked - turning a 28% mark into a 64%.
He was awesome. He told jokes that were actually quite funny and entertaining.
Class was brutal; alot to remember. Allowed a cheat sheet for final exam, but didnt refer to it. Too much wasted time to read through a page.. I liked him
Deceivingly hard. Even when you study you struggle with his midterms and exams. Good idea on web modules, I appreciated the Idea of watching lectures on my own time.
He makes psychology interesting!
Exams and midterms are very hard!

Useless prof. Completely unapproachable when you have a concern regarding his course. Online delivery is fine, but the course is not user friendly because the lectures dont work in all browers. Exams/quizes etc are hard and studying for them barely helps because they are not based on lecture content. Considering Kim uses the same lectures term afte

His exams psychologically test you rather than testing you on content. He wants to see if you take the mental-shortcuts he lectures on. Sadly though, Kim uses shortcuts in his lecturing. He stereotypes the average student as white Canadian w/ ADD. Lectures filled with misinformation. His academic standards of himself are highschool level at best.
Exams are way hard
He sucks..

I really enjoyed Dr. Kim's live lectures and I found that the web modules were also set up well.  I didn't find either semester to be all that challenging, but then again I'm going to major in psych.  Definitely a fair prof.

I was very interested in this class. The web modules were very informative. I found the format very engaging. All that said, the exams were incredibly hard. I felt as if I were being tested on the psychology of the exam rather than psychology, the subject.

Monotone, organized. Sometimes his explanations are too wordy to understand and other times, they're right to the point.  Quizzes were easy, test and exam were fair (although they could have been worded differently so that they were easier to understand). In the end, I felt the marks were intentionally lowered.
LOVE joe kim! he's so jokes. web modules were clear & interesting. the course was extremely organized & instructions were always clear
wow, I totally disagree with the last person (I guess they didn't do well on their test!).  This course is amazing and really practical.  That's my favourite part.
Quiz and assignment questions are riddles with mistakes that make it difficult to answer the questions

Joe Kim taught the class through online lectures, which were really interesting. I was lucky to get a gr8 TA (anton) who was really chilled out and an easy marker. The exams are tricky, you have to think a lot. However, the review sessions before the exams (held by Matt) are really helpful and give u a clear idea of wht to expect in the exam!
Online lectures very clear and very helpful. Very interresting material, fair test questions.

I'm a third year student who decided to take both intropsych courses as electives.  I can tell you that these were the best organized courses I have taken.  Really interesting material, TAs were great, and i liked the convenience of the  web modules.  with all that in mind, it's still up to YOU to do well in these courses.

Joe is a good lecturer in person, but the web modules are BORING. Course content was interesting, but the way it was presented needs some serious work. They lost my exam, and papers were unfairly marked. Tests were very fair.
really, really cool.  students are challenged and my ta was great.  this course has got me interested in psych.
i thought this course was very organized with excellent use of online tech resources.  if you've ever been to visit dr. kim's office hours, he's amazing!  really down to earth and funny.

Kim's video lectures are very convenient and allow you to go over concepts which you may find difficult several times. As long as you make good notes you should receive a great grade. Be careful of the group projects, which can lower your mark. Be sure to stay on track with all material and assignments.

He designed this course to fail. TA's are goofs, I write very nicely, but the TA did not understand my expressions and said I had bad grammer. Kim sounds like a robot. THE HANDBOOK IS USELESS, I suggested that he remove those outlines and place diagrams which are time consuming to replicate, was a bit rude about how it helps some people, yeah right

Kim is a nice guy, but his tests are hard.  materials are really interesting, and Kim does try his best  to be a good prof. He is interested in running the course, and tries many innovative techniques to improve learning. It is unfortunate that the course is hard. But that is no reason not to take the course - most 1st yr courses are hard anyway!

His lecture are too easy to understand; however, they don't match the level of his tests, his tests are unclear and very hard comparing to the lectures and tends to attempt to trick you with a lot of frustrating similar choices on MC section.
Lectures are convenient, yet rather boring at times. The midterm was ridiculous, but the material in the course CAN be interesting.
Good prof overall. Made a lot of changes to the course, mostly for the good. Never met him in person, but the lectures - video - were very clear and for the most part well put together

First year psych is great overall. Material is interesting and easy to relate to. Online lectures are incredibly convenient and Dr. Kim explains most things very well. The textbook is a waste of money. Attend the tutorials, take good notes, and you're set!

A little tougher than first semester, but still found the course incredibly easy. Prof is very fair when it comes to assignments and quizes etc. ALWAYS drops the lowest so you have a chance to redeem yourself. LOVE the online lecture style.
Best prof i had and easiest course i took in first year. would recommend Psych 1A03 to anyone (unless you're really biology challenged).

I found this course to be amazing! It was well organized and easy to succeed in if you put in the effort. Some of the group assignments I did bad on, and the midterm was brutal. However, if you work hard on keeping up, you will do well!!

took psych 1a03 and 1aa3 with this prof. makes the course very hard and unorganized. try to avoid his class if possible or take it in the summer. summer prof is much better. they should change joe kim ASAP

Very bad prof, messed up the whole course, i took psych 1ao3 with the old prof and psych 1aa3 with joe kim. such a big difference, joe kim kills it. and the assignments. very bad, they should bring the old guy back
Great prof, his lecture is always clear and to the point. I love his teaching
Very good and knowledgeable prof, however he insists on using videos online to teach which makes it a pain sometimes. Easy to do well if you watch and make notes on videos. TEXTBOOK IS USELESS
No Comments

comments: Too open-ended and very uninspiring. Overall, a very dry course.
Way too much reading, hard to balance. Also his exam was way out in left field, and did not give you any proper preparation for it.

Super nice guy but the course is waaaay to reading heavy. With a full course load i found myself swamped with readings. I don't know how people read all the books that were supposed to be read. Personally didn't enjoy the lectures I found them dry and not very point focused. The essay topics were also incredibly dry. But again super sweet.
The man is near impossible to follow during lecture and gives the most uninspired assignments.  Other than this he was a great guy and love his students was always willing to help.

Dr. Weaver is a great prof there is no doubt about that, however if you are in first year  you may find his lectures slightly dull and hard to follow. If you are taking 1CC3 rise of empires READ THE BOOKS. I got 90's on both papers because I read the books - the people who failed to read the books got 50's and 60's on the papers.

Dr. Weaver is a great professor, if you do the work.  You definitely must pay attention to his lectures as they are somewhat disorganized, but he does give you the necessary information.  Readings are a must-do for the final exam.  His rep as a tough marker is unfounded; do as he says, ask for clarification if you need, and you will do just fine.

Dr. Weaver is one of the smartest men I have ever met in my life. He's an old-school professor with a speciality in the British Empire. His reading load is INTENSE, do not take his courses expecting a bird, but they're insanely informative and he clearly cares about his students. Attendance is 100% necessary for a good grade!

An excellent professor.  He frequently repeats important themes to focus on for the final exam as well as essays.  Unlike other professors, he is also extremely organized.  Without a doubt my favourite professor in my first term at Mac.  Others do not like him because he is quite traditional, yet I enjoy this.  Very friendly too.

Dr. Weaver is an excellent professor. He was extremely clear and to  the point in his lectures, and is clearly very knowledgeable about the subject that he teaches.It's crazy important to go to lectures, and do all the readings, it's not an easy class, but Dr. Weaver makes every effort to help students understand the course.

His assigned workload is by no means easy, however if you do your readings you will understand the material.  Dr. Weaver seems to be a little disorganized in his teaching-style but he is a very, very intelligent man!  If you attend every lecture it will benefit you for the exam!! You will learn more than you think by listening to him lecture.

All around great guy - he cares so much about his students and is always ready to help. Incredibly intelligent and knowledgeable guy, but I was easily able to get an A in his course. He is very open to different opinions most of the time although he has high expectations for participation.
easy classes but very dry
Dr. Weaver was a fantastic professor.  If you ever have the opportunity to take a seminar with him, he comes highly recommended.

JCW is truly a man beyond compare.  As I always say, if JCW doesn't know it, it's not worth knowing.  When he takes his glasses off and closes his eyes, you had better be prepared with your pen and paper to take down what comes next.  It's not WWJD, it's WWJCWD.

Dr. Weaver is the GREATEST PROF TEACHING AT MAC. You have to take at least one of his courses. He cares about the learning of a student, as well as the student. He is clear in his lectures, and he has an undying passion for what he teaches. He makes you laugh, understand and gives his students a little bit of his passion for history. HE ROCKS!!!!!!

Nice prof. Dr.Weaver alway volunteers to help and he'll always reassess your assignments if you're not happy with the mark. However, he could try to organize his lectures more efficiently, and he should definitely pick some better TAs.

Awesome prof, one of my favourites now that I've had him. Truly concerned about and interested in his students, wants to get to know you. Well organized and interesting lectures, easy to pay attention. Can ramble a little, but it's always something informative even if not relevant to the exam. Very fair marker. More than willing to help!

Dr. Weaver is by far one of the best profs ive had.  The subject matter of the anti cedents course is soo vast and Weaver explains it very well.  Weaver is down to earth and genuinly cares about what his students get out of the course.  You know hes about to explain something in detail when he takes his glasses off and starts by saying "well. . . "

At firts I found the lectures difficult to follow because he doesn't use any overheads or anything. I had barely no notes by the end of the course but he's a very fair marker. He's also really nice and interesting for a history professor.

Dr.Weaver is a pioneer in the history department at mcmaster.  His Anticedents of globalization course is absolutely unprecendented.  And, im sorry if you dont understand his vocabulary (person below) but he is probably one of the most brillian profs at mac right now.  (Swett and Horn also!)

Dr. J has to be the best prof at McMaster.  When one thinks about the history department, Weaver is right there.  The man is a Rhodes Scholar from Duke, but yet a very down to earth individual.  I teach history at the grade 10 level and i hope to be like him someday!

This guy is hilarious!!  He has got a voice like Jimmy Stewart (Its a Wonderful life) and he has some serious facial expressions that use every muscle of his face (including his eyebrows).  Honestly, down to earth, passionate (about his subject) and quorky...in a good way.
If I understood his vocabulary, I would have had more patience in his class
The most amazing professor. Who else could get excited talking about civil planning history. Dr.Weaver has to be the most wonderful professor that Mac history department has ever seen.
Awesome prof, quirky sense of humour. Take any class you can with him, but be prepared to work. An interesting course with a prof who knows and enjoys the material.
BEST PROF on campus. helpful, friendly and knowledgable on so many topics. Take his classes - he is inspiring and approachable. The best part of the History dept.

The comments thus far have not done Weaver justice. He is an amazing prof AND definately the hottest male prof in the history dpt at Mac. He is the most knowledgeable professor as he is great in many different areas-not just ONE field of specialization.
Only one thing can be said about Dr. Weaver: a true gentleman in every sense of the term!
Dr. Weaver inspired my love of social history.  I currently teach grade 12 Canadian history and I find mysely relaying stories from Weaver's weekly seminars - 16 years ago.
One of the GREATS, He taught me for 2 years,. I am indebted to him.Excellent!!!!
good prof overall
He speaks like an encyclopedia.

comments: Second worse professor in econ at Mac. No consideration for students. Test questions are an absolute guess. Why is this man even allowed to teach? Class averages around 60%.

Course has nothing to do with economics. Courseware is worthless. He says it changes like 40% each year but all the articles are like 10 years old. It will take like 4 times the amount of work you thought if would to get a high mark. He can literally ask anything that he said in lecture. About 75% of his questions are face palm worthy

Bad prof, so lazy canceled 1/3 of 830 lectures with no notice given, no online resources, course material is garbage as well useless and uninteresting sports trivia, he also grunts while he talks A LOT!
Lazy, Test Questions are like trivia questions, no class website/electronic resources, Not a bird class as everyone thinks it is!

summer 05, he didn't really seem to care to make an effort maybe because he was retiring.. althought i did well in his class, material did not make sense at all until i took the intermediate level micro
lazy prof
Lazy prof. Tests ask obscure, pointless questions - focuses more on sports statistics rather than economic concepts. Terrible course - not easy, not interesting, not useful.
Too fast. Obscure questions. Lazy and misses classes.

Smart guy but has flaws as a teacher. Goes fast thru material. Skips a lot of classes, which I wouldn't mind if he had a website to let us know. Course is not hard but there's a lot of info to retain, names, dates, numbers...study and you should be ok. Interesting class!
good prof..if you need help he's available..just need to study from lecture notes..tests are based around them...anyone can end up with a good grade..
He lectures way too fast and asks the most obscure question for his tests.
Very interesting class.
Went to all the summer classes. Made the mistake of studying from the courseware instead of the lecture notes.  Just studied lecture notes for final, went from an 8 to 11.
averaged in the 60s during the semester, went to every class, made all the notes - ended up with an A!
If you're a varsity athlete you're set, he's the team councellor for football.
rushes through material fast and often cancels classes and lets us out early... instead of going through the material slowly and thoroughly...

He still cancelled class 5 or 6 times.  He coughs way too frequently.  It's simple though:  go to class and you'll get a good mark. It's hard to respect a prof who enjoys wrestling so much and knows so little about the topic he's teaching.
good prof, easy if u go to class as everything is contained in lectures
goes really fast, cancels class very often...
GOOD GUY

He is a very lazy prof!Rush through the chapters,cancle class as always.There U go,he is sick.Bad attidue "Don't talk to me,talk to the TA".IN order to catch up with him, I have to read the text book all the time, all the time.It is a terrible n
No Comments
So funny how lazy he is. Will manipulate marks like crazy. Got 50% on first test then 95% on second.
Always coughs, and cancels half the classes because he is lazy and "forgot his notes".  He is bilingual however... Speaks English and COUGHese!
If you go to his class and take good notes you get a good grade.  Cancels class way too often though
I really regret taking his course.
He is such a jerk and he just reads off the slide.
No Comments

rushes thru material. Covers 3times as much as other 1A06 classes in same time
BEST COURSE EVER!

Can u read his overhead? Do u bring enough color pens?

Enthusiastic, loves a good debate
No Comments
has good info, but he is incorrect a lot and won't admit it, nice guy though
Helpful if you have a specific question.  Exams are multiple-guess. Loves WWF.
overheads written like a 5 year old, cancels many classes, interesting material

comments: Amazing teacher. Really knows his material. At first, I was biased by what others said, but mots of it is not true.  He teaches using many aspects of problem based learning.  Lectures are clear and materials are assessed sequentially. One of the best ECE professors and great teacher. Thanks for an exceptional learning experience.
This guy is terrible.. His lecture slides are not easy to look at.. very disorganized and all he does is read from the lecture slides. He never shows in-class examples

Exceptional teacher, with superbe  knowledge of course material. Encourages you to become better student with regular iclicker evaluations. Taught well and punctual to classes. Shows up almost all classes and let you know few times he is absent. One of the best EE profs at Mac.

Pros 1. When he does come, he gives clear explanations and tries to make you understand. 2. His test are somewhat fair. 3. Responds quickly to emails Cons 1. Misses nearly half of the lectures 2. No answers to the multiple choice questions he puts in the lectures and tutorials   Overall the cons heavily outweigh the pros.
This is the best guy in the universe. Clear and nice. He is a good guy. I r8 8 out of 8 m8. If only I could take this course all over again.
Shows up half the time yet expects students to never miss a class. Doesn't post any answers to the problems. Although it may be tough, avoid at all costs.
No supportive

Amazing class - lectures have helped a lot in my practical work. Outstanding lecturer - well-organized, clear explanations, motivates students to learn and fair exams. However, to excel, attend lectures, do assignments and iclicker questions and practice questions. Appreciates class much more now.

Great course. Must attend lectures to better understand course material and how the exams are made - but do not expect repeat questions. Exams are fair. He is a master in analog electronics and provides excellent examples. Loved his  regular short questions and lecturing style. Important tip - read lecture materials before class.
One word. AMAZING!
miserable spending my time in his  classes.

One of the best ee profs. Before this course I had little interest in analog electronics. But he made things very interesting. He is passionate about the subject and getting the students educated. His teaching is superbe. Attend class and do icliker questions to keep  up. Highly recommended.

Outstanding teacher for analog electronics. Well organized, brilliant and fun to sit in class. Presents course material clearly and answers questions in detail. Great sense of humor after class, but serious when teaching. Kind, approachable and response to concerns of students. One of my best courses at Mac.
Great lecturer. Kind teacher and very helpful. Learnt a lot from course and exams. Amazing knowledge of subject.

I attended most of the classes. The lectures were well organized and delivered. Prof Deen is exceptional in explaining the material and also why we do the topics in the order. Exams are very fair, but you should attend the classes and listen to the explanations. iClicker questions helps much in understanding. Look over material before lectures.

Exceptional teacher and professor. Kind and considerate when interacting with students. Tries his best to bring you to level so you can answer your own questions. Do not be swayed by handful students who do not come regularly to classes and criticize him for being consistent and fair.

One of the best teachers who cares that we learn and become self learners. Teaches material in coherent and logical way. Gives lots of examples and practice problems. iClicker questions great. Thanks for your efforts and helping me.

well prepared lectures. teaches to educate students. great at explaining concepts and presenting practical examples. very useful course. revise second year devices and circuits. learned at lot including from exams.
excellent prof…  teaches well… great at explaining… very fair exams… attend classes
He tries to make this course easy, but fails to teach properly to prepare for midterms. Terrible Professor for 3EJ4
horrible prof, stay away at all costs.

Explains material well. Fair exams. Go through exams and shows how questions relate to class or laa material. Attend class to learn material well. Honorable and ethical teacher. No pushover like some other profs who give free marks.
Horrible teacher,lies while acting to be caring
High expectations, says "learn and marks will follow"           -yes if you make the midterms do-able.

Horrible professor, extremely hard midterms, lies about iclickers being only on participation (so get them right or you lose marks!). iclicker answers are wrong on the slides, so dont rely on them during revisions. he made the beginning seem so interesting, and the course is nice, its him who makes you hate everything about it.
Good professor, horrible teacher. Avoid at all costs.

His tests contain 4-7 questions, each question contains 6 - 10 sub mc questions, and each mc question contains 12 - 20 answers. Oh and if that's not ridiculous enough, each mc question depends on the previous mc question, in other words; if you got question 1.a wrong, you will automatically get b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i wrong of question 1. Good luck.
If you want any hope to passing this course. Hope harder, cause you're in for one helluva ride..

I had an interest in analog electronics, but Deen killed it. If you are taking this course, I suggest printing out all the lecture slides before hand (yes, do waste paper), read them before coming to class, and correct the slides when he goes over it, because half the equations are wrong and/or not given to you.
1 word for this course if you have him. Miserable.

He goes on about how he has taken courses on teaching, that he loves teaching and yet everyone i know in this class despises his teaching method including me. If you print the lecture notes before hand and fill them in during lecture this will help you a lot.
Outstanding teacher. Very supportive of students. Brilliant man. Picks very good tas. Fair exams. Goes over exams. Teaches practical material also.

Excellent course in analog electronics. Lectures are coherent and logical. Exams were fair. In-class questions helped keep me on track with course material. This is important since the material is sequential and builds on prior lectures. Prof. Deen rocks.

Exceptional professor. Well prepared for classes. Approachable and empathetic to students. iClicker questions helps a lot. I attend all classes as the text and notes are sufficient for a good understanding of the material and the practical aspects of analog circuits. Exams cover material in class & labs - reinforce learning. One of  best classes.

Goes over simple material slowly, skims over complex new material. Test are unfair, covers material not explained in lecture. Textbook is terrible, very wordy and focuses more on quantity than quality. Clicker questions are bad, he displays an equation on the slides, then takes it away for the question, so you HAVE to bring notes to class.

He is truly excellent professor - the best I have had so far. He is very smart, crystal clear in lectures, always well-prepared and organizedlogical. Tests are fair, and are not repeats of examples or assignmemts like in some other courses. Students who do not do well deserve it - do not whine. Attend classes and revise second year material.

A great professor, true gentleman and exceptionally gifted. Always tried to impart the material clearly, concisely and with passion. His office door was always open, and he was considerate and encouraging. Loves teaching. Told us this was one of his best group of students in past decade.

This is most exciting course I took. The prof was very good at explaining concepts. However, revise your second year devices and circuits analyses courses. Not fair for him to reteach these materials. He does go over related background second year material. He explained, his focus in on teaching analog electronics. Exceptuional prof. Thanks.

the best ee course i have take  far. exceptional in explaining difficult concepts for us to understand. liked the regular iclicker questions. suggest you read the lecture material before classes. helpful and professional in interacting wit students. prepare well for exams as questions are fair, but all new.

Outstanding professor. Spent a lot of tiem preparing lecture nmaterial and problems to guide and enforce learning. Exams were on the whole very fair. And as he explained, he cannnot reteach the second year material. Very knowledgeable and approachable. One of my best classes so far.

Somewhat unfair with delivery of material. As someone right said important points are not emphasied such as Is in BJT which was revealed after it was tested on the lab test. Lab 4 does not even have soutions. Prof or TA's dont know how to do the analytical part themselves. He should definately put solutions online for students benefit.

teaches well. some students pushes him to reteach earlier courses. good that he has ethics unlike some other profs who give exams using problems covered in class. exams are fair if you attend class and pay attention. great at explaining/teaching from basics during office hours.

I attened 99% of lectures, and all the labs, but it turns out a lot of the information is withheld from the student, which ends up being tested on. Make sure to ask a lot of questions about the Current sources and Oscillators-PLL as they are very important. Not really a fair intstructor.
Explains well on bb. Very helpful in explaining in office. Builds on 2nd year courses. Fair exams if you attend classes.

Tries to explain, but assumes too much knowledge which is not good because if he really wanted to teach, he should start right with earlier courses such as CI and EI. He does his work on blackboard, BUT he skips so much content relevant for the tests. Don't be shy to ask him a lot of questions in class to make sure you understand else u can fail.

Too much content was forced into the 4 month course. The prof was usually not accessable during office hours, even if he was there he rudely continued working on his computer. At least one question on final exam was related to another course, communication systems and radio.

This professor makes questions unnecessarily tough. He does not teach a lot of things he tests students on. Goes too fast for students to understand. Final exam was long and tough  with 7 problems total.

I am international student who did not pass this course. I feel sorry. The teaching was good and exams fair. I plan to attend all lectures next year. I plan to be a more good student and work hard - sorry professor.
Interesting to listen to. Great at explaining concepts in detail. Overall awesome prof. knowledgeable with good practical explanations. However, assignments are difficult and long.

Great explanations. Good sequence of topics. Should give handouts so we can keep up with material. Tests, in retrospect, were quite fair, even though averages were not as high as in other courses. Learn ur circuits and 2ei5 class materials well if you want to get high grades in this class. Very helpful during office hours, but gives no hints.

Amazing memory and understanding of analog electronics. However, should provide on-line materials students. Should also make exams a bit easier and allow for more marks for homeworks and lab reports. I know that he wants tu us to learn well, but having only exams degrades our marks. Is very helpful and polite to students.

Clear and concise lectures. Very good explanations of analog circuits. Good information on practical aspects of course. Labe very useful. However, did not like the  cahnge for lab exams as this addss too much stress. Other that that, great course.

Outstanding lecturer. Clear explanations. Got a good grade in this course by attending lectures and following his teaching. Great job. However, his waqy of teaching may not be best for weak students. I am much better in analog electronics becaise of his course. Thanks and keep up the great job.

Excellent at explaining analog electronics and teaching. Understand well is class, but have difficulties doing problems on my own. Helpful prof. Keeps to his course outline. Changed evaluation from previous year to more emphaisis on individual efforts. Make sure to do labs yourself as there are now lab exams. No pushover and study for exams.

One of the best courses I ever took, and I have take many courses with excellent grades. Excellent communicator and teacher. Motivates students, is well organized, but is a bit demanding in his assignments, even though he explains the rationale. I learnt a lot in his course. I recommend it to others interested in improving their reserach abilities.

Very decent prof. Encourages you to learn. Has to keep up with material or you may be overwhelmed. Follow his advice and attend lectures. Do not listen to the handful of students who gripe because he challenges you to learn.
Great teacher. Excellent course. Lots of work, but worth it.
Horrible professor in every aspect.  Pretty sure any good review on here was written by him. Embarrassing that he has to do that.

This course was an utter disaster. There was no structure or outline to the course, and Deen essentially covered material sporadically with no logical flow from one lecture to the other. His response to material covered on the midterms was essentially "read the entire book". I feel as if I learned nothing new from taking this inconsistent course.

with 10 being the best, he would get 3. His lectures are incomplete, labs are disaster and he lacks focus. Tries hard to be entertainer, repeating (and waiting on answer on) "have you seen this before?" and staring at H(s) trying to recall if it is correct, instead of just deriving it. makes many mistakes, sometimes corrects himself. Sloppy...

This was one of the best courses I had as a graduate student. The lectures were clear, well organized and the key points were properly emphasized. The assignments were hard, but fair. While the project was a "killer", I must confess that I learnt a lot. Prof. Deen cared about us learning the material - great job.

I took this course in Fall 2010 and I worked over the surrer. On looking back, the techniques learnt - circuit analysis and design and intuition on analog electronics is proving very useful in my communications course. Thank you Prof. I appreciate you not spoon-feeding us. I am now a better student for your hard work.

Some comments on the site have said that students are spreading lies about Dr. Deen. I can only imagine he wrote those as this class last year was the worst experience of my academic career. I did well in the course but didn't learn much because rather than spending time explaining material he focused on how amazed he was we didn't know it.

He is one of the rudest professors I have ever had to deal with. When I went to see him for help he told me it was a waste of his time. He understands the material and is knowledgeable but can't teach. I learned very little from his class and it was an important one so that is kind of sad. Avoid him if you can.

Now at end of third year, my impressions of this course has improved significantly. Professor was clear in explanations, made up interesting problems and examples and his quizzes were fair. Must attend lectures - explanations and some material not in text, plus  taught second half of course on chalkboard.

Fantastic teacher - great at explaining concepts and helping students. Open office hours and available to help students individually. Very courteous. Need to study rgularly to do well. Exams challenging but fair - not a pushover. Now I have a summer job, I really appreciate his style of getting us to learn. A master of electronics.

outstanding treaching and course - if you want to learn analog electronics. exams were challenging but fair, unlike other courses that had test questions that were minor variations of exampls or homeworks. i recommend this course to others interested in learning and not only in passing. great job and thanks.

I enjoyed this course very mush. The professor was excellent, despite a a few students making unreasonable demands for him to reteach most of their 2nd year circuits and devices course materials. He explained well and posed interesting problems. He also did not give tests that were minor variations of examples in class. Thank you for teaching us.

It has been one semester since I took this course. Now I fully appreciate the efforts of Prof. Deen. Teaching us to manage our time, build on our fundamentals, reasoning and analyses, doing creative problems, have been very useful in my other courses. Please do not be sway by weak or non-industrious students. Many thanks for teaching us.

A few students with poor backgrounds spread false information about this course and the prof. He is one of the most helpful and tolerant profs. His exams are very fair. If you attend class, yu learn a lot. His lectures are clear and he taught the second part of the course from memory on the chalkboard. He posted all his slides for the first part.
Overall, terrible professor. Does not care much for his students, makes exams incredibly hard which in turn makes getting a decent grade incredibly difficult. FAIL JD, FAIL.
the worst the rudest prof ive ever seen . average for final exam was around 25% , and for the last midterm it was around 24%. hes really arrogant and my advice , do not take any course with him

Outstanding lecturer - explains well and thoroughly. Very helpful, but class is not as easy as other graduate courses. However, you will learn a lot and can do reserach in this subject after taking his course. He treats students consistently very well.
Very professional and really knows how to teach. Knows his stuff. Creates challenging problems. Helpful and kind to students.  Clear in expectations.

I took ECE 740 last semester and now I am taking ECE 741 - Analog ICs. In both courses, Prof. Deen was an exemplary teacher. Even though his assignments were very challenging, I learnt a lot. Thse are two of the best courses I ever took. However, you have to work hard. Also, he is a tough, but very fair  and extremely knowledgeable.

One of the best courses I have taken in my academic career. Prof. Deen explains very clearly, challenges us to do better and creates a rewarding course structure for all students. I wish other profs were more like him.

One of the best professors of all the courses I took. His knowledge, intuition and practical insights are fantastic. The project forced us to learn to apply theory to create useful ICs. While is not easy, he is very fair and helpful.

Outstanding prof with superbe background. Extremely helpful to students. One of the best courses I have taken - excellent combination of theory and practice. Course objectives are clear and course project forces you to apply theory. Exams are not easy, but are very fair. Liked the aplications of the theory he taught.
Tooooop notch professor in a toooooop notch university doing tooooooop notch research. Even his students are toooooop notch.
Superb professor. One of the best courses ever taken.
Superbe professor. Knows his material well. Well-organised. Cares about students´welfare, but is not a push-over. Excellent knowledge of practical aspects of course
Simply great, very helpful and always eager to give answer to the questions asked. Always advices students to be punctual and finish the works in scheduled time.
Excellent professor. Treats students well.

I think he is a very nice person, brilliant prof. n really really knows what he is doing. Loves his work, very motivated. He just always expects more and pushs his students very hard to make them work harder. That’s his way of work n ppl r different.
horriblr prof, even worse as a man. No honour, no integrity, no ethics
Recycles tests.  Be sure to get last years!
good guy, is totall concerned about your marks..can't diss him.

comments: Love the course content, found content I didn't attend lectures for to be difficult to catch up on. It was also difficult to obtain a great grade on assignments due to how broad the rubric and criteria were- however, this depends on your TA.
My absolute favourite prof at McMaster! Her lectures are great and she speaks about concepts so clearly that helps everyone understand. Love love love this prof.
Would not wanna take again

Dr. Colavecchia is simply one of the best, if not best profs. I have come across at McMaster. She is insightful and explains theories and content in her lectures in a way that gets students to think outside the box. Her classes challenged my own views of society and I am so privileged to have been taught by her. Amazing person.

By far the best prof that I've had to date. Very clear teaching style and she has a way of taking terms/theories and explaining them in a way that is easily understood. Simply fantastic! Should of received higher grade but I procrastinated on the term papers but aced the tests.

People say her lectures are boring but I didn't find that. Loved that they were podcasted! I will say - I got a very high grade on the research proposal but did not do as well on the paper itself.. I think the expectations could have been clearer for that portion of the assignment. Overall, I'd take her class again.
the driest, most boring class that was hard for no reason. Her material barely made sense, and the lecture attendance proved it.

Her lectures are insanely dry, and her quizzes are either extremely easy or overly hard. There is no in between. I never go to her classes because her lectures are podcasted. That is the only good thing about her besides there being no exams. I really do not recommend her.. I don't like her whatsoever
Love this prof. Realistic, straightforward, and intelligent. If you do the readings and listen in lecture, you'll do great.

Her lectures are super dry. Considering Sociology is such a popular subject, I was disappointed by how boring classes were. (That being said, I appreciated that she also posted podcasts of her lectures).  Also, the multiple choice questions she takes up in class are very misleading. Test/quiz questions are much harder than the practice questions.
I hated her as a prof, lectures were dry, the TA's were badt, it was unclear (I found) what she wanted for her essay. Her tests I need a dictionary to figure out some of the words.

She's a great prof who explains concepts very well. Her lectures are a little dry, but you'll be fine watching the podcasts. Her quizzes aren't too difficult, as long as you make good notes during lectures, and read the textbook. Definitely possible to get a 12

Great prof! Her lectures are very clear, and podcasts are SO helpful. She covers very interesting material, and sets you up with the potential to do well. The only thing that I didn't like about this course was the way the essays were structured. I would absolutely take a course with her again!
Amazing prof! Podcasts are super helpful and she clearly states how to get an A. Would take any class with her!

I am in love with this Prof. Her lectures are SO interesting and relevant to real-world concepts and ideas, barely do the reading (except Becker) and am receiving a very good grade because I am actively engaged in the lecture material. She's very nice, speaks very clearly, no surprises on tests (very clear questions), no final exam, awesome course!
Amazing prof!

The podcasts were extremely helpful, especially for students who only had sociology that day. If you take extremely detailed notes (really important if you want to do well) and do your readings, you should be able to receive a double digit score. In terms of the assignment, I found the teaching assistant extremely helpful in guiding me.
Shes a great teacher. Kinda funny but really sweet :)
This is the only class of my semester I genuinely enjoyed learning about - all real-life specific and easy to understand. SUCH AN AMAZING PROF to listentalk to, plus her podcasts are a LIFE SAVER

She is very well-spoken and articulates her ideas well (super helpful as this course was also podcasted for students listening from home). Provided many practice questions for her quizzes. The best part was there were no exams for this course. Merely, six quizzes throughout the semester each focusing on 2-3 chapters of material and a big paper!
I really like her! Super professional and non-emotional which I think may get misinterpreted by some. But she knows her stuff and discusses interesting content in a  well organized, clear way.
A professor that will not respect answers that may seem silly and has no patience, even when she is in the wrong.

Really explains expectations clearly, I loved the podcasts because after lectures I listened to them at home and this helped for reviewing at exam time. She was extremely compassionate with some struggles I was experiencing. I loved her class and would certainly take all her other courses in upper years. She's strict with talkers but very fair.
favourite class by far, super easy just go to lectures and you'll be fine, lowest grade for me was an 80. rarely did you need to do readings if you attend class and tutorials were not mandatory.

EXTREMELY clear. Talks with the most clarity I've ever encountered. Her enthusiasm and interaction with the students is quite uplifting. The way she delivers her lectures are worth attending to. You can easily get an A- or B+ with minor effort. But note, I still said EFFORT!! She's great!!!
very interesting lecturer makes course material interesting and fun. She clearly goes through concepts and things we should focus on for tests, exams and assignments.
great prof. never went to her class, never read any of the textbooks, just listened to the podcasts and made notes and got a very good mark. i like the fact that she podcasts every lecture.

The only textbook that was useful she recommended was New Society. The rest like SIQ and the writing book were useless or you can find them at Mills. Her lectures were interesting and easy to follow along. She talks quite fast and expects you to write. Also, don't talk to your friends or she will call you out and will really kick you out.

If you attend or listen to all of the the lectures there is no reason you can't do well in this course. She gives very clear instructions on the assignments, all tests are multiple choice. I finished the class with a perfect grade.

Dr. Colaveccia was an incredible prof. Her class is very much one in which you should attend both lecture and MAKE SURE TO READ YOUR TEXTBOOKS THOROUGHLY. You'll do fine if you do both these things, if not, you'll fail easily. Tutorials were boring, and not necessary. As a prof, though, she's interesting and quite funny, I loved going to lecture!

She is rude when you talk to her one on one. She is also very difficult to follow durring lectures because she is so dry. Her questions are poorly worded and uses trick questions. She talks a lot, and makes the course hard to be interested in, she through me away from sociology for good.  Did not like her as a prof at all.
Brutal difficult class

Honestly, if you love listening to older women babble on about their children and friends then this is the class for you! Also she speaks so slow, I could barely keep my eyes open.. lectures are almost wholly derived from the readings. Her quizzes were easy to ace but probably as a result of her repetitiveness.
such an amazing prof!
Good, easy class. Puts up podcats and powerpoints online. I ended with an A and decided to major in Criminology(at York University) following this course. Recommend it.

Was intimidated by her at first, but shes a very sweet lady. Interesting stories, great presentation. Clear and concise. I attended all her lectures, took VERY thorough notes in class and did not read the textbook...I ended up getting a 90%. There is a midterms and exam ( multiple choice), 4 or 5 short quizzes worth a few percent and a paper.

Prof Colavecchia's way of teaching is extraorindary compared to many other profs. While i cant always attend lectures due to work conflicts, i appreciate her use of podcasts. She is extremely knowledgeable and approachable. A++ in my books!

Very engaging in her lectures and tries to keep the class participating. One of the few profs who relates academics with real world scenarios (essays, timelines, punctuality)... Can sometimes treat students like they are younger than they seem, but not intentionally. Very fair and a great professor overall...If you wanna talk in class, then leave!

Amazing professor, really loves her job. ALWAYS replies emails. I love her way of teaching, it's like a talk show. Also we learn how to apply the theory in creative ways which help me remember all them, although i took this class 2 years ago
Her exam review slides were helpful to me but every class she put me to sleep.
Did not enjoy class. Could have been the material, could just have been her.

She is a good prof who seems to really enjoy teaching, however can treat her students like they are children. Its amazing when she kicks people out because they are talking!! She stands at the podium the entire class and reads off of her notes. Hard to keep my attention because she doesn't move- would love it if she walked around.She seems nice tho

Great Prof! Can seem a bit intimidating during lecture, only because she doesn't waste time with annoying or disruptive students (rightfully so). But in person she's very sweet & approachable! You can tell she loves what she does which is what sets her apart from a lot of other profs.

Dr. Colavecchia knows her material and her interest is genuine and infectious. She does move slowly sometimes but if you pay attention, it's easy to figure out what will be on the exams because she emphasizes points repeatedly. This professor genuinely wants her students to do well and with some effort and good attendance, double digits are easy.

great professor, VERY interested in student input. wants to hear feedback and opinions from everybody. her exams aren't overly difficult if you study for them and keep your notes up to date. overall, i totally loved her and am looking to take more of her classes in the future.

First year sociology: makes it EASY to get above 6 with her syllabus. Doing all the small assignments takes maybe 5 minutes each, some are helpful in learning the material, but all are an EASY MARK. Her lectures can be a little dry, but   are important. Her midterm/exam questions are fairly lengthy. Overall, very helpful and ENJOYS student input.

Shes always willing to listen to stories and help anyone who has any question. Her knoweldge of the material is quite profound. However her lectures move really slow and she treats her students like were all complete idiots. I also didn't find it very entertaiing but thats a personal thing.
Very slow at speaking, can be very boring, tends to repeat things WAY too much, and her ego is a bit inflated...even after that all, she is an okay professor.

Very cut and dry teacher - what I thought was going to be an interesting class has been totally ruined by her. Her exams are difficult and confusing because she doesn't word things very well. Be preparedif you are going to take this class
