comments: Dr. Donaldson himself is a lively professor and extremely humorous. Sometimes I had troubles relating his dialogue back to the course content, but his lectures were nonetheless a good dose of food-for-thought. TIP: If you dislike your TA, better to switch sooner than later because they mark your essays  45% of your mark.
Tough to get good marks but Donaldson is a great prof.  Lectures are interesting and engaging. Take notes on his interpretation of poems and stories; it will help you for essays and the final.
Best professor ever! Hilarious, engaging, and very passionate about what he does. The class is beyond enjoyable. Wish it was a full year course.

Dr. Donaldson is a great professor! He's very humorous and his insight into poetry and short stories is invaluable. Take notes during the poetry unit - it WILL help you for the final exam - but I found the short story unit to be better discussed in tutorial. Heed all the advice you can from your TA as they determine your essay marks!

Donaldson's enthusiasm is great, and his lectures are fun.  Harder to get a good mark, as many things are subjective, open to interpretation. Donaldson uses metaphors and examples in class that will come back to you in quizzes ... even if they only make sense to him. Many upper year science students take this course (required), making avg higher
Dr. Donaldson can be hard to follow sometimes, he uses a lot of metaphors and digresses a lot, but his enthusiasm about the subject matter makes up for it.

his lectures aren't necessarily helpful for the course but are really interesting. he appears to love his job and loves class participation! he listens to every point of view. however, if you're someone who needs clear instructionstraightforward guidelines you will not find them from him, he's really open to interpretation and not always clear

English and English major are two different languages. Drop the class if your tutorial TA isn't getting back to your emails, or try to transfer to a tutorial with one that will. You're going to pick up a little bit of what Donaldson likes when you go to his classes but ultimately you need a more competent and communicative TA to do well.

A very disorganized and confusing professor. Made it difficult to understand the assigned readings and to pull any meaning from them. Without the help of your TA you are completely lost in this class.
Quirky sense of humour, but very interesting. Goes off on tangents very often but they are always interesting. Very approachable and genuinely nice.

Cool cat. Interesting and interested. His lectures are conversational in nature so he'll often go off on tangents or just say a lot of interesting stuff that isn't directly useful for your exam or essay or whatever. Thus it's hard to take notes, but I sat back every lecture and just took it in, and I did fine.
slides are engaging. He's got a good sense of humor. The class times were annoying though 8:30am. He does tend to ramble but overall he's a good prof and the course was easy.
He was alright

Great prof :) quirky sense of humor, and easy to get off topic. Lectures were engaging, although a bit disorganized. He frequently read the poems aloud, which was interesting at first but became annoying rather quickly. Very lengthy readings, and impossible to figure out how he markes. Overall, approachable and funny, but a bit disorganized.

Very nice professor with a quirky sense of humour. He seems to be a little detached and scatterbrained, but those just seem to be the traits of a true professor. Offers great analysis on the style and craft of writing. He can however be a little disorganized, and his marking scheme is pretty unpredictable.

I think he's awesome! His powerpoint slides for this class were really engaging and he is a nice professor, he is approachable and very sincere. Just you have to pay attention to whose your T.A, they are ummm lets say not too nice. But his exam was a fair game too
Dr. Donaldson is the greatest!

Great teacher and a great person. Donaldson really cares about his students and is very engaging. He was sometimes unorganized but is well educated and knowledgable about what he's teaching, so I never felt like I was missing some key information. Did a great job of teaching Frye's four variations.

He is my favorite English professor. I had him for British literature (2I06) and children's lit. He knows how to engage the students and because of him I've learned how think way outside the box and deeply analyze. He's funny and interesting. His exams for both classes have been easy. However, they do require you to do all of the readings.
Dr. Donaldson is, and will always be, my favourite professor. I often think that those who criticize him just don?t get him or what the humanities is about. He is brilliant!

It is a man's MIND that determines where he is "Hot" or "Not" - Donaldson's sears. He is scatterbrained, a rambler, off topic almost always and absolutely BRILLIANT. Does not use traditional methods of teaching &, in a class of 300, will still listen to every student. Friendly. Genuine. Dresses like a bum but I adore him - favourite professor.
Dr. Donaldson was a great prof! He is really open to everyone's ideas and likes to let the students run the class. He is a very interesting and smart person!

so, donaldson refused to use a microphone even though myself and several other students were unable to hear him in lecture. when asked why not, he repsonded that he "likes to feel free" - meanwhile, even sitting right up front - his freedom let him wander the class so we missed half his lectures.

Pointless class, subjective marking on creative writing assignments, had to do it his way or the high way.  Hardly any constructive criticism offered, no organization or structure.  Our group workshops were a waste of time.  He sat there doing nothing and hardly any of my group members showed up or bothered with the class.  Never again.
Pretty average prof. Half the time I got the impression he was making his lectures up as he went. Good for an first year course.
Stupid course but the prof was good.  Very thorough on essay marking
Great class, knows his stuff, fairly interesting lectures, and makes cute references to outside culture. take any class of his that you can

the class was good, and he was a very detailed lecturer, but the materials themselves were not that exciting.  i liked the class but i did not like the choice of poetry at all ... still, that might not have been his fault

This prof is absolutely AMAZING! Take any class with him that you can! He really cares about his students, and is more than willing to help you out if you need it. He is also really interested in students' ideas not only about materials, but also on how the course is run.
alright teacher, tends to ramble.
No Comments
Had him back in the day, but I still attribute most of what I understand about poetry to his lectures. A brilliant prof and scholar. Had him for a grad course too, and it was tough but rewarding.
this guy rocks.
Very fair marker, good constructive comments on essays given back.  My inquiry class with him was one of the best classes I have had thus far.

I really like Dr. Donaldson.  I had him in first year too...and he was good then for shorter genres.  He is very passionate about poetry and he seems to like teaching.  I found him a very fair marker and he gave helpful comments.  I am pretty shy, but he made me feel comfortable speaking in class.
took short genera. tue and fri 8.30 in the hanngers... no nice. ended up with a B but i still didn't like the class, the tutorials we far more better. his notes were strange, sorta like him. oh well
Brilliant man - - interesting methods of lecturing and assingments.  Really enjoyed the course.

comments: His lectures are very unorganized and you can never tell what he is going to do. Essay based lectures. He jumps all over the place during lecture.
Best prof. for those willing to work hard and do some independent work on their own...If u want to learn the basics of the science, take his class.

He gave me a incorrect final grade from miscalculation (a failing grade when I had actually passed), which, in turn, has screwed up my graduation process. It took me forever to get him to admit his mistake and he has yet to change my official record. He never apologized. He was off by 14 percent.

STAY AWAY FROM THIS MAN! He is the absolute WORST professor I've ever dealt with in my entire school career. I've never in my life received less than a C+, and I've managed to fail both of his 25% tests so far. I've never studied harder! He is useless, unhelpful, and you either get it exactly as he does, or consider yourself a failure. RUN AWAY!!!!
He is the HARDEST Professor in the world, but that is why he is the BEST Professor who ever lived!

Prof. Budros is helpful and very passionate about his work. His tests are heavily weighted but you will do well if you listen to what he says you need to know. The tests really aren't difficult if you understand the material and how to apply it.

Probably the worst professor that I have ever had. Very rude and does not listen to his students! His tests are extremely hard, probably the hardest I've had in university. Not because the questions are hard but because there is no  time to finish the test in the little time given with what is expected.

Useless as a lecturer (drifts off the point and spends way too long on the simplest of information without moving on to testable material), tough as a marker (has told us that his average is always a C), and clueless when putting together an assignment (he wants a 5 paragraph essay, 3 of which are to be "lengthy"... but you only get 450 words???)

Dr. Budros is awfully intimidating, and if you have specific needs (ie. CSD) be prepared to put up a fight. While the tests are heavily weighted, you can still do very well if you attend lecture and go to tutorials. Don't bother buying the textbook either; everything you need is in tutorial.

Awful, intimidating and bitter. He gives tests that are heavily weighted, and does not properly explain things. His tests are very unclear the class average is extremely low. If you can take this class with another prof, I strongly recommend it.

GET OUT OF HIS CLASS ASAP. He weights simple questions on exams wayy too heavy. If you choose to stay in his course, i hope you can write fast because he gives such little time on exams. He basically ripped the exam out of my hand and wouldn't let me finish my sentence. GET OUT NOW.. unless you're okay with a c

I thought the course was going well until the prof gave us an exam that covered specific examples that we weren't told to study or take notes about. This wouldn't even be a problem... but when an entire class does poorly on the exam and requests for an appointment to view the exam are ignored, I begin to question Dr. Budros as a prof.
best prof ever!

He is a very difficult professor.  I am normally an 'A' student and I just barely passed the mid term.  The tutorials are a must to even get a passing grade in this class.  If you need to take the class, take one by another professor.  This has been one of the worst experiences of school yet!

I think I am one of the few that really enoyed him and his class. He was always willing to stay after class to help those with questions. Attending lectures is a must to understand the material. Do not be scared off by the bad reviews. I was worried, but in the end the class was great.

I will soon have this prof and from what I have heard, I am already feeling very anxious.  I hope this will be one of those situations where in April I can stand back and say "don't believe what you hear"  I really do want to have a positive experience.   Will keep you posted!
he is not only boring, but can come off as really rude, it seems like he's the KNOW IT ALL type prof. didnt like him very much. avoid his courses as much as possible!

I found he was rude to me and didn't offer any help. I"ve had some boring prof's in my day, but this guy takes the cake. His mono-toned voice coupled with pointless stories of his apparantly pathetic grad years made me lose complete interest in the topic. All in all, he sucks!

I found this class totally useless.  The textbook doesn't match the lecturing.  The lecturing is on irrelevant material, mostly personal stories.  Unwilling to answer questions from students, or help students outside of lecturing.
Put it this way, half way through the year, he still had no clue that his class had different textbooks.  His lectures are outdated and dull.
Very boring class. Very basic material. Professor drags on although he shows interest in the subject
he had a lot of good stories and sometimes i wanted to laugh louder than i felt i could in a lecture hall.  all around good prof.  go to tutorials for this class.

Very enthusiastic prof but notes are often confusing.  Textbook is no help so you have to attend every lecture.  I think he doesn't understand why the class doesn't get as excited about social research as he does.  Really funny dresser, should go on the show What not to wear.
One of the best profs I've ever had.  He spends extra time and effort on helping us and he is extremely enthusiastic about the material.  The course is challenging but you learn A LOT.
when he gives examples and when gives you the definition, he just confuses you even more than you started off with
Great prof...makes researching actually seem almost fun.  However, is sometimes confused when students don't understand.  AND never figured out which lightswitch to use the entire term
very disrespectful professor, needs some diversity and sensitivity training; why is he still teaching?

comments: Can be rather dule, but he is clear and informative. Tough marks on essays and exams, but is more then fair.
arrogant and outdated, needs to do some relevant reading ... in strong need of self introspection, he may think it is still 1985
dead boring and arrogant.  students with great grades will have their GPA drop, while B students often excel.  does that seem right to you?

I do not attend McMaster but  Azoulay taught Canadian History Course York U., which I took and managed to get an A. However as a prof., Azoulay was not aways fair and he viewed and for the most part taught Can. Hist. from a white male perspective, which many of my collegues had complaints about.
does not have the scholarship to back up his arrogance!

I can only describe D.A as fair, he tells you what his teaching style is and he  explains assignments carefully. His lectures play out like a well organized essay, complete with argument, facts and conclusion. After receiving what I thought was an undeserved mark from a T.A, he offered to remark it, and would only change my mark if it went up

His lectures are interesting, he speaks quite clearly and gives mini breaks.  His marking was fair and his assignments were well explained.  All in all, I would definitely recommend taking one of his classes!

If you are an A student or critical thinker do NOT take a course with him.  Arrogant, banal, outmoded, and boring lecturer.  I  rec'd A to A+ grades on my essays from other profs. and was told that I should go to graduate school.  What did I receive on my 1st year Can. History paper? -- an impressive B-!!

I've never had to rate a prof so low. Boring lectures, no discussions, no interesting reading. Went into final with A- came out with B. I thought the TAs were to blame, turns out he failed my essay question. Asked about it and he was arrogant, rude, & extremely vague. Avoid if you want good grades & enjoy real historical analysis.
arrogant.

I LOVE this man. He makes lectures enjoyable and interesting. the one minute break is great because you do tend to write a lot of notes in this class. Since its a survey course, he did an excellent job of covering a lot of area in such a short time. DJZOU rocks my american history socks off.
Excellent professor, certainly knows how to make subject interesting. My only problem were the TAs.
No Comments
C'mon....seriously, I didn't think "Bird courses" actually existed at Mac.  If you want an easy grade take this course - but the lectures are like boring as hell!

i'm a sci student and i LOVED this class.  SO interesting, he talks fast so you need to take good notes. one essay and one reaction paper thing decently marked (i assume) and a really easy exam.  definately take!

Dr. Azoulay was the worst history professor I ever had. His lectures were boring and his exams were tedious. And I was a history major! I went to talk to him about my exam & he was offended I had any questions. I felt put off and devalued.
Dr. Azoulay is sweet! Easy exams make my life sooo much easier! He's super interesting, but talks sooo fast!
LOVE this prof. Had him for three classes now and I have enjoyed every one of them. One of my favourite history profs at mac.

I love Dr. Azoulay. He seriously rocks hardcore. He's interesting and his essays and tests are fair. I love the one minute break so I can relax for a bit. I <3 This Day in Canada. If he ever leaves Mac, I will cry and leave, too.
Awesome professor, knows his stuff, if you see his name next to a course take it! A lot of writing, but the 1-minute break is helpful!
Azoulay rocks my world.....if I were a women, he would be the father of my children........

Excellent prof, as were the lectures. He knew his stuff, and made a lot of the material very interesting. Lectures were great, one minute breaks are VERY helpful! The exam was perfect, covered the whole course without being stupidly hard. Highly recommended prof! (and strangely hot too)

One of the best profs at mac. Witty remarks while lecturing, follows his notes and leads a great lecture. I've had him for two classes now and he's been great both times. Definitly take America in the 1960s with him. Good job DJ-Zou!
he gave a good lecture.. AND i had probs with a mark, and he was extremely helpful to me.
great teacher, dry humour, one minute breaks, "on this day in history"... doesn't keep you longer than you need to be

This is my second class with Azoulay, and I love his classes.  I love that he gives essay questions on the first day, and he puts difficult words you encounter on the overhead, so you cn follow along.  And you have to love the sweaters!

Honestly, one of the most amazing profs that MAC has.  If you have the opportunity to take any of his classes you should.  He is so intelligent, and makes you interested in the topics that he is discussing.  The one minute break during lecture is the smartest thing a prof can do!

I wasn't even registered for this class and I still went because Azoulay was amazing-ay! So interesting, spoke like a baptist preacher, and oh man, don't even get me started on the one minute break - genius!
Amazing. Smart, interesting and oddly hilarious (the **** lecture will long be remembered). Great tutorials and course readings. A definite favourite . . and the one-minute break is much-appreciated.

comments: Dr. Haley is the last bastion of American freedom! He is the man! His lectures usually go over time, but the tangents in which he digresses are absolutely hilarious. You have to read the text and go to class, but a good grade is very attainable. Keep doing you, Haley!
Worst professor I have ever had! Rambles on about god knows what and writes rude comments on papers. Not approachable.

Dr. Haley is a very intelligent man and is a decent professor. He is bad for responding to emails and goes off on hilarious tangents sometimes. A bit quirky, but his tests are rather fair and I did very well in his classes. Not the best prof at Mac by any means, but provides some entertainment value as well as decent clarity in lecture.

Dr. Haley is an example of what I often refer to as an "old school" prof. This man is incredibly knowledgeable about his field and will give students an intricate look into the respective subject. Being said, sporadic episodes of blatant rudeness to students and humourous anecdotes make him an acquired taste

Dr. Haley was a great prof to have, and he is one that I recommend having. He does talk quickly, and he can be rather eccentric, but he's also very knowledgeable and easy to approach. His tests and exams cover only the material that he has given in class and through readings.

The best prof I have ever had.  If you have an interest in ancient Greece and Rome this prf really knows everything about the topics.  He may eccentric bt he's interesting and very knowledgeable.  Thank you Dr. Haley.

Worst prof I have ever had. His lectures are almost impossible to follow, he's rude to students (although most deserve it). He can't keep his thoughts straight and gives tons of unnecessary info. He takes 10-20 minutes to answer some of the most basic questions just because he goes off on tangents. Seems to resent that students don't like him.

DROP HIS CLASS NOW. Not only is he a terrible professor, he is an unkind man. Since he teaches classics, he should be familiar with Julius Caesar syndrome. The superiority complex this man has  seriously inhibits his ability to do his duty as a professor. Seriously. Run. Now. Faster.

I'm impressed with his knowledge and passion for academics, but I think he forgets that many of us lowly undergrads have no background in Greek or Latin and limited prior knowledge. The overheads don't help much so I'm forced to take notes phonetically and try to look up the terms later (and the tests make this necessary). Hope you can write fast.

He is a very knowledgeable professor, but he is extremely disorganized and can't process his thoughts clearly enough for his lectures to make any sense. He goes on tangents, and makes annoying and unnecessary noises during the lectures which lead to frustration. For those reasons it is next to impossible to take meaningful notes from lectures.

Attended every lecture, completed all the readings, took extensive notes, and almost failed his midterm. Memorize useless, minor facts and dates and you might have a chance. Attending lectures is pointless. Stay home and memorize the textbook instead. Very intelligent, but should not be a professor.

Worst prof i've had to date.. could not understand a word he said. Tended to backtrack and re-state things he already went over in 'Latin' - almost seemed like I should have taken Latin as a prerequisite.

Haley is an excellent professor. For the student who wants to learn he is more than willing to help and I never had a problem meeting with him to ask questions or to clarify a topic he had discussed in lecture. He is a serious academic and its too bad that students today aren't more concerned about learning than being entertained.

Although he is very knowledgeable and funny, his lectures are essentially him reading and not explaining. He goes off on little tangents that make writing coherent notes nearly impossible. He also doesn't respond to e-mails, which is rather annoying. He could be a great professor, but he isn't right now.
Very intelligent and very knowledgeable about his subject. One of the nicest profs I've ever had.

Possibly the worst history prof. I have had. Incomprehensible lectures, followed by evaluations that are based upon obscure facts from readings and lectures. He also brings roles of toilet paper into class to blow his nose with, I guess that is a teaching aid, either that or he wants to be repulsive to his class on an academic and social level.

I had this guy over 10 years ago and the comments are reflecting what I also experienced.  This guy is smart as a tack, he knows the topics inside out, he is incredibly enthusiastic but he goes all over the place, he's a little like a squirrel crossing the road. I loved the information I got, but his lessons don't flow in a logical manner.

It's clear that Haley knows what he's talking about and wants to share his knowledge with his students. Although it's easy to do well in his courses, you have to look out for irrelevant details since he cares more about obscure facts than key themes or concepts. He's also difficult to approach and frustrating at times.
he's frustrating to listen to.
He is a very kind of helpful professor. Seems to be very intelligent and knows his stuff.
He sometimes goes on tangents but he's extremely entertaining and very very nice. **how entertaining his class is depends on how close to the front you sit, get as close to him as you can**
Great Prof, very straightforward. Makes very clear what you need to know. Explains and clarifies very well the material.

Great Prof, really loves what he teaches and it shows. If you can't get at least a B in his class, you probably don't belong in university. He tells you exactly (and I mean EXACTLY) what you need to know. Know it, write the tests, and you're in the clear. You might even learn something along the way. Why anyone wouldn't like his class is beyond me
Run...don't walk away from this one.

This guy is the most boring prof on earth.  I went to class every morning and fell asleep.  His sentences never end and he never makes any sense.  He just jumps from one topic to another and never has any connections between topics.  I was lucky that i already knew allot about the topic.  If you know nothing about the material don't take his course

What an utterly terrible professor. How he got into teaching is beyond me.. he's horrible. His incoherent speaking patterns are abysmal, and are only matched by his boring montonone and hard tests. He doesn't use WEBCT or use anything but an oldschool overhead that is impossible to see; he's terrible for help and overall the worst Prof at Mac. RUN!

Dr. Haley is quirky but he has a vast amount of knowledge that he seems to desperately want to share. If you listen carefully, his thoughts do connect coherently with the occasional frayed edge because he just doesn't have time to say EVERYTHING he knows. His tests are difficult, but fair. Attendance and readings are required to do well. Nice guy.

Basically, Haley is smart, but unapproachable, and is not a fun professor. He is virtually impossible to follow in lecture. His sentences never end and therefore, taking notes is very difficult. His tests are horrid. They ask ridiculous things such as the name of something you might read once in the textbook. His lectures are dull. Keep away.

Mid-terms were fair. Exam had extremely difficult questions (requires you to know irrelevant details) outside the essay. Go to all your lectures and somehow force yourself to pay attention to his incomprohensible style. He's very intelligent he just can't teach well.

I actually LIKED Dr. Haley.  Yes, he can be quirky, but he doesn't leave one wanting for detail.  He's honest, fair, and does seem to care about his students.  He is very helpful if you see him after class to clarify anything that was confusing in lecture.
I didn't even buy the text because it was like a million dollars, but it didn't matter cuz he always read to us directly from it. Boo-urns, man. What a bad trip.

The worst prof/teacher I have had at any level of schooling. The class would not be particularly difficult if he knew how to lecture. Sadly he knows his stuff and clearly is well read, but is the WORST lecturer I have ever met. Routinely reads lectures from the text and talks as though he is on the verge of soiling himself.PLEASE AVOID AT ALL COSTS

This man is a mess. His voice moves up and down like a yo yo as he delivers a completely incoherent "lecture". When he not on the verge of picking his nose he is nervously moving his pen around on the desk in front of him. He is a disgrace to Mcmaster University and it is truly a mystery as to how this man was ever allowed to lecture.
No Comments

I had to leave lectures on a regular basis because I get annoyed by repetitive motions, which was bad because Haley once moved a pencil 67 times in one lecture before I had to leave. He was well-educated, and I'm sure he knows his stuff, but I had a difficult time concentrating and his frequent voice level change startled me a lot.
The man can't teach, nor speak and almost ran me over on his bike.

Admittedly, his lectures are tough to follow, but he does seem to know what he's talking about. His courses compliment the textbook very well to ease the burden of following the lectures, in his defense.
Horrible.  Quirky.  Idiot Savant.  Stay away

Good prof, he knows what he's talking about. BUT AMAZINGLY BORING. There will be 20 minutes left on lecture and I'll manage to fall right asleep in front of him. Avoid him if you want to keep your passion about history, he'll bore the pants off you.

HORRIBLE PROFESSOR. AVOID PROFESSOR HALEY LIKE THE PLAGUE. Anyone who claims this guy is brilliant obviously didnt come to class very often, it was like hitting yourself in the head with a brick repeatedly. Haley has obsessive compulsive little quirks, like he moves the stuff on the podium around 600 million times in a lecture. DROP THIS CLASS.
No Comments

He is very passionate about his work, and that is nice to see.  Hard to follow most lectures because of his distractive jumpiness, but I was told that he gets nervous speaking in front of large groups, so perhaps that's why.  Be sure to keep on top of your work because if you get behind...you will be VERY behind.

I WILL NEVER TAKE ANOTHER CLASS WITH HALEY AGAIN.   He has sudden volume changes, jumps around, is obsessive compulsive, rearranges his books and ultimately is very unnerving.  I have no doubt that he is intelligent, but he stresses me out!  SAVE YOURSELF THE STRESS!!!
Yes, Dr. Haley is definitely a genius. I still had a hard time in lecture. However, I like the assignment, quiz and midterm he gave us because they were fair.
All over the place - intelligent but unnerving and a stressfullecture

This guy is horrible!  He cannot lead a lecture, and is completely unwilling to help out the students.  I do the readings over and over, yet I am still unable to understand what is going on.  He is honestly the worst prof I have ever had!

You have to be on your toes to do well in his class.  He's brilliant, knows his material, and if you try to feed him a load of crap he will totally call you on it.  He is the superhero of the dept., and genuinely CARES about his students' well-being.  He rocks!

Seriously, it doesn't seem to matter if you do the readings - he still wants you to fail. I don't think that anyone can defend his lack of compassion and the fact that he repeats himself about 5 times before moving on. No matter how smart a man is those who can't teach shouldn't. And Haley can't.

Haley is absolutely brilliant, and if you take the time to give him a chance his quirks become some of the best things about him.  He wouldn't be teaching if he wasn't truly phenomenal.  For those ignorant haters out there who negate his every move I consider it their loss. Hint: do your readings.

Very brilliant dude.  He was looking especially frazzled today.  I saw in in the library and was going to say hi, but he was on a mission and I didnt want to get run over.  People might be angered by him because they actually have to be attentive and read the text.  That last test was torture though
Because of Haley's refusal to put up overheads, the majority of class has given up on his incomprehensible lectures.  My condolences to those who are required to take his course.
No Comments

love the vests and the bike.  kind of an oddball.  has trouble modulating the his pitch when he speaks, and sometimes it seems like he's trying to hold in a burp.  otherwise, a fair marker with easy assignments/exams, and a brilliant man.  i recommend him.  entertaining (somewhat) and informative.

I just dropped Haley's class, not because of the material, but because of Haley. It is simply stunning how inconsiderate and unclear Haley can be. I didn't know you could be that inept without trying.

I think Dr. Haley is a really intelligent professor.  The only thing i want to convey to you all is that he sounds and acts like william shatner in star trek.  With short choppy bursts, you think he is going to yell out "spock!" or "Bones" any second! lol otherwise, great prof

Dr. Haley is very eccentric and at first hard to follow - but if you stick with it, attending his courses will be one of the most rewarding experiences in your University career.  Show respect for him and he will do so for you - a truly brilliant man with an interesting sense of humour...  Go Haley!

He has high expectations from his students. Or, he has low expectations, but still not easy tests. He makes himself available for extra help, and he works to make sure you understand the answers to the questions you ask.
No Comments
Way too cool. This guys knows his stuff. If you want the real deal, no BS, he'll give you the goods.
Terrible professor. It is very hard to follow him and he tends to just follow the textbook. I don't recommend any courses taught by Evan Haley.

A different type of proff. VERY intelligent and eccentric. Classes can be unpredictable. Far more helpful than most think. Dry witt, an excellent story teller if u can follow him. A character but a good man if you speak to him one on one.
Very eccentric, but also extremely bright.  His exams are freakin hard, but the rest of the his classes aren't.  He's quite humourous.

ECCENTRIC...COMPLETE WEIRDO BUT BRILLIANT.  nOT AN EASY PROFF BUT DEFINATELY NEVER SHORT OF HUMOR.  dEFINATELY BOX FULL OF CHOCOLATES...CHOCOLATES YOU HAVE NEVER SEEN IN YOUR LIFE...GREAT PROFF THOUGH
the smartest prof i have ever seen... you never know what he is thinking...
Really good class, great guy, very entertaining.
He just reads from the text...and he's freakn' weird. Apparently his blood tastes strange...he told us this in lecture.
Weird guy and very smart. No middle here, you'll either love him or hate him
my second run with haley was a nightmare...his lectures are so overbearing
He CRAZY!  but he gave us the exam questions so it is okay!
one of the best profs ever! actually takes time to learn everyone's names!
Smartest man alive, great prof, He knows anything about everything
Amazingly knowledgeable, cares about students' understanding
No Comments
horrible lecture style, but very smart
Knows everything about everything...facinating man
Extremely witty and very knowledgeable
No Comments
No Comments
one of the nicest profs ever but he does take some getting used to
FUNNIEST PROF EVER,
This man is brilliant, a non-stop thrill ride of historical evidence.
smartest man i have ever met, very eccentric
lectures are quite boring, but he's a good guy and teacher
Seems to lose his train of thought every 30 sec, then takes 2 min to get back
Poor lecture style; hitches up his pants too much

comments: I always looked forward to attending Dr. Penner's lecture. They were fun! You do not have to be a "good" writer in the grammatical sense, but you do have to put thought into what you write. Dr. Penner always gives wonderful feedback on a rough draft to help you do well on a final submission. I strongly urge people to take one of his courses! :)

Dr. Penner is an inspiration individual. I cannot stress this enough but he is one of the greatest professor that Ive come across. I thought me to think different about the world. I would take another class that's offered by him in  a  beat.

Dr. Penner is a great prof. He puts on engaging,  thought-provoking lectures that make you think about things that you've never really thought about before. He is very clear with instructions. However, I find if you are taking one of his courses you must be a very strong essay writer. Overall great prof though, he really seems to care.
Penner made my university experience meaningful.

You can't ask for a better Prof. Penner is so fair, interesting, deep in thought, and passionate. No surprises when it comes to assignment grades or guidelines. His communication skills and feedback hit every target so to speak of every point he would like to get across and appropriately he takes your feedback and thoughts into humble consideration

You can easily pass without even going to the class and just referring to lecture notes. Reflections can be tricky but you just need to focus on one thing from lecture and reflect on it deeply, thinking about it in a bunch of different ways. 4 reflections, 1 take-home exam so it's a fair course load. Gives extensions on every reflection. Great prof
Very inspirational! Great professor. Really pushes his views on you though, not a fan of that.

Penner is self aware of nuance and diversity. He makes a grand and successful effort to communicate controversial material effectively in a thought provoking manner. He assigns essays with the evident goal of making you critically think about the material studied and marks them accordingly without any personal bias. He cares about your success.
AMAZING Prof! Great lecturer, makes the material come alive. Not exactly an "easy" A, but certainly not difficult. He makes you think.

Dr. Penner seemed to be very interested in the course content which made lectures tolerable, although the reflective essays were extremely unclear. If you are not a strong essay writer, do not take the class!
great prof, very engaging

This is my third class I have taken with Penner and I am taking a fourth one next term. Hands down best professor at Mac, so passionate and one can tell that he Genuinely cares about the students success in not only school, but life. He is not like other proffs who pretends he cares. Easy going with work load and fair marker. Great individual
A really wonderful prof who engages the students and is clear about assignments. Loved all my classes with Dr. Penner.
Lectures never as long as they are supposed to be. the entire class is 5 of the easiest reflections you will ever write-- one page, informal, no citations

Truly one of the best educators I have ever had. Has a passion for what he does and it shines through in his lectures. This is what all teachers should strive to be, encourage students to think for themselves rather than just exercise their memories. I wish there was more space here to express how much he has positively influenced my outlook onlife
What an amazing prof! Take-home exams are very straightforward, and he's really cool with deadlines. Will take more courses with him!

This guy is THE MAN.  He is so engaging and ACTUALLY interested in the words he is saying.  I had him for an evening class and that was probably one of the only evening classes I actually enjoyed going to.  A++
Most understanding prof at Mac I think....especially when it comes to deadlines..... very nice too!

Absolutely amazing! Makes you really think about issues in class discussion and will captivate you with his lecturing style, and a great course breakdown. Looking forward to taking more of his classes! :)

He is the definition of perfection as far as professors go. Absolutely amazing. Love his smile, his lecturing style, his sense of humour. I'm taking an evening class, I walk in half asleep, and within the first 2 minutes, I find myself captivated by his speech. I can't think of a word other than "perfect" to describe him.

AMAZING prof who obviously loves his job!  He is clear, concise, articulate, has a great sense of humour and really wants his students to understand and do well.  He makes himself available for assistance and is very fair.  This guy is a keeper.  I'm looking for another course to take with him.  :)

I have had him for 3 classes and he is absolutely the greatest professor I've had at Mcmaster. This man is so compelling, you actually become upset when lecture ends! his tests are not the easiest, but he is super fair and goes out of his way to make sure you understand everything and have the greatest chance to succeed. Superb
A-W-E-S-O-M-E prof.
He is an amazing prof who gets you thinking and cares about your opinions.
AWESOME professor!  So easy to follow, so willing to help, so quick to bring humour, so effective that you listen just because he's so captivating!  EXCELLENT!
Amazing prof! I've had 3 classes with him and actively look for courses that he is teaching. Very helpful and funny and is fair.
Ive had this prof for two courses - Best prof ever! So funny and clear that you enjoy going to class!

I am in the midst of taking the course and he has been every helpful and lenient towards me. He sees that I am struggling sometimes with the papers and gives me extra time to sort my thoughts out. Usually responds to my e-mails immediately. Def. an interesting prof!
D-PEN YOUR THE MAN! awesome prof! all his classes are awesome!
Penner is probably the best prof I've had at Mac. He cares about his students and he understands real life. His classes are usually pretty entertaining :)

I have had 3 classes and will be taking a fourth class with him, absolutely amazing! Super helpful.. I've heard people complain about getting the same marks on assignments.. go in on his office hours he's absolutely dedicated to helping his students and makes the effort to get to know his students.

I've taken Religious Studies and Health Studies courses taught by D.Pen. I love him! His lectures are interesting and informative. He's hilarous and he never goes off topic (everything relates somehow). Great Prof!
Honestly, one of the best profs at Mac!
Every class I have ever taken with D-pen was amazing!

Interesting lectures, the more you read the course package, the more interesting his lectures will be. It's nice to see a prof with a little humour! Definitely go review your tests after to see your errors, he's pretty good about changing marks if it is necessary and for good reason. Inspired me to take more healthst courses!
Amazing professor! Very compelling and will make you learn, laugh and have a great class overall.
He is very helpful and he is very interesting! Excellent.

DEFINITELY an awesome prof! He makes class interesting and makes me actually look forward to it. Unlike other profs, he doesn't just teach you info that you go home and memorize the day before the exam... he gives you material that triggers ideas upon hearing it. Very engaging and awesome learning experience!
He is an interesting prof, but sometimes is a little out there and takes the course material to the extreme
Cool prof. Easy exam and midterms. Watched videos for the entire semester and really learned something from each lecture.
The most encouraging man alive! He challenges the role that the university plays in the world and expects us to think for our very own selves.

comments: Rudest prof I have ever had. Unapproachable. She showed complete disinterest in her students. Talked down to her students. Half the time I didn't go to class just because I didn't want to deal with her attitude. Students were made to feel like they were putting her out if they asked her questions or went to see her during office hours/after class.
I really enjoyed her teaching style. She was an excellent prof but also a nice lady:) im glad she taught me!

I LOVED HER! She made me laugh with her snide comments. At least she had a personality. I talked to her a few times after class and she was kind and accommodating. Didn't talk down to me. She's one of my fave profs at Mac.
It was a good class, interesting material, and Dr.Arratia knew what she was talking about. However, she's not the nicest most approachable woman I've ever met...she's actually pretty rude!

I love Anthro, as it's my major... however, I really lost my interest in cultural anthropology. She is a good prof, but a lot of the students talked ALL of the time, making it hard to learn. I didn't go to a lot of the classese because she read off of her slides and it was boring. Overall she was a good prof, just a little... over the top at times.

personally, i really liked doctor arratia. i have a lot of respect for the path she's taken to get to where she is, and she's clearly a woman with a passion for anthropology. i think that a lot of undergrads are rude, disinterested, and disrespectful in her classes and that may lead to some of the distaste people feel for her.

Dr. Arratia is a brilliant, strong, inspiring woman that has led the most interesting and respectable life. She is a wonderful lecturer. What is unfortunate are the young students that take any anthropology course thinking it is a walk in the park and are not willing to put in the work to unlearn, as consequence they end up blaming the professor.

Ugh. I came in quite excited for anthropology, but now I hate it. Thanks. Prof. Arratia needs to be more clear in her instructions, rather than sounding condescending to her students on course discussion boards online.

This professor honest to goodness needs to be fired - I have no idea how she is still working after the way she addresses students on the discussion boards and in person. Her instructions are completely unclear, the class was confused and disorganized all term and she had no responsibility for why that might be - especially considering it is 1styr.

she was extremely rude. never responded well to questions. read off the slides in lectures. treated students like they were stupid. easily distracted. worst class ever, totally turned me off the subject.
shes extremely rude & EXTREMELY boring
I find her to be useless when faced with a question as well as completely rude and belittling.
She is unfair.

Honestly, I loved her! I know I'm in the minority, but it was the one class that really grabbed my attention and held it. She was interesting and funny - if sarcastic at times. But that was a nice change from the humorless, cut-and-dried profs you sometimes encounter. She had a passion for what she did and it showed; how could you not respect that?

Lectures useless.. all info is straight from the text. Honestly my best advice is to read the readings thoroughly before the test and know it in pretty good detail. She puts trick questions on her tests..

She was a kind teacher who allowed questions in class and didn't mind going over questions students had in class. It was a pretty easy class and both the textbook and the lecture notes were important but not difficult to understand at all. I highly recommend.
it was good

Not what I expected from a cultural anthro course... much more theory. Tests were hard but she did care that students did poorly, and made things easier for the final. Big essay on an ethnography at the end of the semester.

Most of the time I found lecture boring. Almost everything was on the slides, so not much to add. She did not like students asking questions in class (thats what tutorial was for). Tutorial was manditory (aka you got marks for being there). Be prepared for a big essay at the end of the semester.

Quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had.She is rude and arrogant.She expects way too much out of her second year students.Her midterm was impossible.She is not very acessible or flexible, nor is she helpful or clear.The textbook is horrible and she expects you to understand it without help.She was so bad I couldn't even finish the class.

While she is a very nice woman, her TAs are pretty harsh and their instructions are not clear.  Her exams are hard and very specific (even when you have read the material).  She gives big assingments worth a very small percentage, which doesn't make much sense.  I wouldn't take this class again.

WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN.  Tests were hard, lectures were dry. 3 ridiculous assignments worth 5% each and a major essay on top of that. TA's don't know what they're doing. Merely read off the power point and showed movies that were not engaging at all.
Very boring and makes the midterms way harder than other anthro profs (who give out multiple choice midterms while she has essays) Very unfair for people who are unlucky to get her as a prof.

Its the 3L class, not the prof...she used another prof's material, I love this prof in another seminar, but hated the material in 3L...also, her TA was  Phd student who was super harsh, she graded our work like it was a Phd dissertation, not 3rd year undergrad assignments.

This has to be the most boring and long class I've ever had to sit through. Her movies are AWFUL and the midterms are hard. She also lets her TAs mark 1% assignments out of TEN. Damn, it's one percent. Just make it pass or fail.
BORING!
No Comments

comments: Her lectures were not very informative, but she tested exactly what she lectured.  Every once and a while she wouldn't show up to class, but wouldn't tell anyone that she cancelled class.
very helpful when you have questions about program or grad school
good and caring prof
Pretty boring but easy mark...
She does not spoonfeed students but she speaks a bit as if she did. She thinks we are grown ups and have to be responsible. I have no problem with that.
She's very Italian but in the psitive sense. Enthusiastic and opinionated but fun and very caring. I liked her a lot. And she is very helpful if you want to do better.
really cares about students and what we learn
is unclear, bad at explaining lessons, rushes too much
can explain things very well
If you're a great advocate of homophobic literature in the classroom then you'll enjoy this prof.
there is a lot of truth to the comments listed below... made me laugh! However, she is a great prof who knows her stuff and if you need help she welcomes a visit to her office. Great course.
ummmmmmmm, she talks really really slow, and she doesn't explain things very well.
i agree with everyone who thinks she's a horrible prof!

She over-ennunciates all her words, writes the most unclear notes ever, says "uh" 10-12 times every sentence, speaks to us as though we are children, and whips through her notes at breakneck speed.  I think she's a terrible prof.

Last semester linguistics was my favorite class, this semester I dont even want to go to it,thanks to Dr.Cecchetto. I leave the class feeling more dumb then when I entered, maybe its because she talks to us like we are children, and over annunciates.

She's great; VERY friendly and always willing to help! I disliked her at first, but my opinion changed completely when I visited her during office hours. She does know what she's doing. :) Her tests are a little tricky; don't be afraid to ask questions.
She's a cool person, a little loud at times but, she's italian..what do you expect...very hard marker..i dropped her class.
my 'favourite' prof.  "best ever"  She is one in a million
Awesome Class and great prof!! Really makes Italian fun to learn!!
She speaks loud and as if we were children. Learn the material a head of time because anything can be on your test that she calls Quizzes. Good luck

most encouraging professor i have encountered so far in my experience at mac...made the learning environment helpful and fun...confirmed my decision to continue in the selection process for a major in linguistics...thanks dr. cecchetto
Speaks as though we were children.

comments: awesome professor who gives lots of opportunities to do well

This class is easily the worst class at McMaster. I would please advise all students reading this to make sure you fully understand what you are getting into before you take this class. His lecture slides are disorganized and absolutely horrific, he is not engaging and the course is so misguided. If its not a requirement, run the other way. Its bad
Really enjoyed the class and the prof regardless of other ratings

Dr. Kolasa was a good prof, but the course content was so boring, especially the first half. Later on, the course got less boring. He really tries to boost your mark, there are lots of opportunities to do well in the course. The exam is very fair and you can easily do well on it if you study for a few days.
a really good proof, very nice and helpful. easy class
He is an amazing Prof, a little disorganized but he gives a lot of opportunities to do well on the course.

Class was extremely straight forward, if you went through the notes he gave the midterm was easy. Questions were really straight forward, labs were easy marks. Overall, class was ok and interesting if you like ecology.
Best professor, caring and passionate about his work
Great prof, notes aren't great but he is very caring and knowledgable. I learned a lot from him, attended all lectures. I would love to have him teach me again.
Pretty cool guy overall, I just wish his lectures were a bit more interesting (ie. include more videos, apply it to real life, etc.)

Lectures had absolutely no structre and are impossible to follow. Fake textbook written by him is full of grammar mistakes and incomprehensible. In lecture he is soooo boring and very difficult to hear if you aren't sitting in the first 3 rows. Waste of time going to class.

Nice man, monotone voice so if you have trouble paying attention its probably not worth it to go to class. But if you do listen you'll get something out of it. Test questions can be a bit unfair, like random textbook examples we never talked about in class, but the main textbook is really good. Overall a decent prof and an ok course
Probably the worst prof at mcmaster university. Absolutely cannot teach, notes are garbage, his book notes are full of mistakes. The TA's in the course were awful. Worst experience ever.
i took 3dd3 with him..and OMG it was BAD.So much disorganization and the grades were low in the midterm..and his method of increasing the grades was incomprehensible. It was a disappointing class.

Wow, I don't even know where to begin. Taking his class was about as enjoyable as sleeping on a bed of nails. Horribly organized, tutorials were chaotic and marks weren't given back to students until after the exam. The course material follows basic ecology from 2F03, however, without any structure you never really know what the main topic is..

Just a piece of advice, this PROF has become a NIGHTMARE both both courses he was teaching this semester. He has literallly screwed over EVERYONE in both classes. The midterm and exam were extremely hard and he was unfair in his conduct. I know that he has all good feedback from others, but trust me and DONT TAKE HIS COURSES.
Brutal midterm. Questions are too specific and ones you can't get unless you read super carefully. Most boring classes in life and no useful notes.
Im sitting in his class right now, and im soooooooooo sleepy. this guy is mad boring. brutal having him 9 30 in the morning. going to skip from now on
Easy midterm and exam written by him. Classes = BOREDOM x 123421412. If you could stay awake and attentive for an entire lecture, well then kudos to you! Nice guy, easy work but boring material.

Course material was so easy. As far as lecturing goes, was boring and the guy mumbles but since it was an 8:30 class, it was nice to not be screamed at. tests were easy, gives you a hint for every single question. study specific examples and case studies.

Real nice guy. very helpful, friendly. BUT....extremely boring. had a big ass large ICED CAP from tim hortons...felt all energised and fresh just before class...go in that class....passed out within 3-4 mins. if u cant fall asleep...you know where to go

He is a great guy, enthusiastic and cares about his students and the material, he was also quiet funny. Got to say, a little bit disorganized though, the midterm had no real structure, and your mark depended on what TA marked it- also took FOREVER to get the marks back. But it was a super easy course, and interesting for those who like ecology.

the course was a disaster.  His first test was an essay and had no guidelines.  UR marks really depends on the TA that marked the tests/ assignments.  He's ok as a lecturer...but he was boring.  LEctures didn't really matter...just use slides as guidelines. Half of the exam was from course website.  Know your stuff for the exam...pure memorization
Classes were very boring and the midterms were kind of difficult however, the exam was easy

Good prof. Should make tests Multiple Choice instead of the essay. Essay doesnt really prep for exams. Unclear expectations in the first test. Second test was somewhat difficult because we had to remember an exact case study for the particular ecology concept.

Gives Ecology a bad name. You learn nothing. How to get an A+: past years tests, practice mc qs from text web site (for exam they are identical), be witty, funny and entertaining when answering his essay qs like "imagine you are a fish, what kind of fish would you be/ where would you live?" Waste of tuition money, cant teach, we need real ecology.
great prof, he makes ecology so interesting

The prof is very boring, but the class is interesting, and some common sense. The midterms had about 20 questions, exactly from last years test, and the other 10, about 4 were very easy. Their were some really tricky quetsions in the end. However, if you study you can easily get an 85 and 90 if you know your stuff. Exam, is more memory than underst

Although you can tell he really tries, his lectures are so boring you feel like he sucked 10 hours out of your day in 50 mins. He's merely reading the textbook to you, I make better notes than he does on my own
such a great prof.  His jokes are awesome, and he's got a great attitude.
Awesome class, incredible prof.  Interesting, helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly.  Very nice to talk to and does cool research too.  Class was one of the best i've taken in university.

The prof is really friendly and passionate about the material.  He makes lots of jokes that are usually not really funny but cute nonetheless.  The tests were easy, the exam contained some questions that were quite tricky though.  Overall he did a very good job, and Mr. Gunderman is really cute.
Good prof.  He makes the course a lot better than what it would be.  His jokes are really funny!!
Boring and useless class! Horrible prof-notes are a mere regurgitation of the textbook, lectures are VERY monotone and uninteresting. What a waste of a class.
Good prof. A bit monotone, but he is nice. His tests were good, but the exam was NOT! Good course overall.
This guy is so good. The course isn't the best, but he made it better. And the jokes: priceless.
tests were super easy exam was nothing like it no way to prepare for it really passionate about his research though
Very interested in what he is teaching...such a cutie

comments: He doesn't know how to teach a first year class. He doesn't even keep a avenue page so students have to go on his blogspot to get information. He didn't even put up a final exam outline!! During the review class (3 weeks before the final) he told the class that if we didn't know what to study now, we'd be screwed. TERRIBLE prof for first year.

Good, interesting professor. Shows lots of movies and TV shows and clips and relates it to the class for better understanding. Some things go over my head, but he has no problem clearing anything up or talking further about it. Seems like a great person aside from just being a great professor as well.
He's funny.  His research focus is obvious and he is passionate about the Baroque period.  Overall ok.

i love his passion for the material. I took a couple of classes with him and never cease to keep your intrigued with the material. I love his sense of humor. And not to forget his charm. He's like the older version of RYAN GOSLING! mm..mmm..

I've had Davies as an art history prof for three years in a row, and his classes have never disappointed me. He always engages in very interesting topics and discussions and really values the opinions of students. His essays and tests are always very straight forward and perfectly reflect the lecture material. Great prof, interesting classes!

Professor Davies is a hypocritical, arrogant professor. The man can put up the wrong slides, show up late for classes (or just not show up at all),  and can whine all about his personal troubles, yet can not give his students any sympathy or leniency when life gets weird.
Great prof who knows his stuff. Found the material in this class very interesting.

I've had Davies before; certainly classes with him are tolerable, not Art History 3A03. He doesn't lecture and just asks ridiculous questions. There is little talk about actual art and art work. It's all theory and history, which would be fine if he actually gave you something to study and know. Horrible class.

An amazing teacher! Really knows his stuff and his passion for what he talks about makes you much  more interested in what he is saying. Has interesting stories behind some art and I found most lectures to be pretty interesting!

His classes are clear and concise he tells you what he wants you to know and gives an overall general idea while the tutorial help you to further understand everything. If you study the text and notes it should be a fairly easy class if not then you'll bomb the essays on the final. Overall alright teacher.

A great prof.Knows his stuff well. this semester he didnt use a mic and if you sit at the back you wont hear anything. he spells the names of the artists.to do well you need to read a lot on your own. i hardly had time to read and did decent. The mark was divided on a test, quiz and final exam ( Art History 1AA3)

worst lecturer so far. when you go through the image works of art he only tells u artist names sometimes spells them out. wish he would just put the name of the work, arthist, date of production on the powerpoint slide like my last term prof Allison McQueen. Did not enjoy his class at all. Didn't know if what he saying was important or interest sak
Great prof, lectures are great - like stories, except a fairly hard marker

Awesome lecturer. Very calm and collected, knows his stuff and says it in a way that's easy to understand. Spells out artists names for us so we know how to spell them correctly. Sarcastic in a funny way

I have had good experiences and bad ones with Davies. He takes some getting used to. There was as others have said, repetition, limite one Davies class per term, they tend to cross over. As for the Contemporary art class he was pretty general. Baroque is the best, even if you hate Baroque like I do.
He expects a lot but is pretty fair in his marking.  Also, he lectures entire night classes from memory which is pretty wicked.  Oh, and of course the highlights are the best part of class/

I had a lot of classes with this one. He is good at his speciality "The Baroque" but outside of that, he tends to relate it back to the Baroque (even when it is a stretch). Clarity is a problem. Try not to disagree with his theories or develop up your own, or your mark will suffer. Do not to take more than one class Repetition, repetition "Indeed"!
Lectures are pretty interesting, though repetitive. He asks for a lot on his midterms and assignments, so you have to make sure you really really know your stuff.
Are you kidding!? Not only is Davies interesting and well informed... but he is hot hot hot. Have you noticed his regular haircuts each week?? And the au-natural highlights? Oh mama!

Okay, obviously I'm in the minority here. I find Prof. Davies to be incredibly pretentious, boring, arrogant, and more interested in promoting his own work than giving an interesting lecture. His assignments are often overly ambiguous and complicated. Boring as all get-out. Will I ever get another mark other than a 78% in his class? Probably not.
similar theories in lectures, however interesting.  fun.  informative.  evoking somewhat.  nice guy, not intimidating-no suprises on his tests-very fair.  good guy!
man... forget Tom Hanks for Robert Langdon in the DaVinci code... not only does this guy know his stuff but he's a sophisticated hottie!

All his classes feel the same. Mannerism was identical to baroque which was identical to renaissance. Visual lit was very similar to canadian art. Likes to apply the same ideas everywhere. Good classes,interesting, just a bit repetitive for thos in art hist who take them all.....

Davies is incredibly nice.  He is smart and passionate about his work.  He is very fair and very helpful.  If you're in his class to learn, he will do all he can to help you.  He is very intelligent and certainly knows what he's talking about, yet he's humble too. A great prof.
Very good Prof. Fair and clear.
Ugh. He is way too hard and very unclear, especially about his midterm. TERMS? WTF???
This man is a Great prof, he is brilliant, his lectures are like fine wine

He should try spelling out all the names he keeps dropping 'cuz we aren't all fluent in Italian.  And he isn't very organized...slide after slide than back to the first one, then to a new one.  All over the place!!
Amazing, well versed lectures - spontaneous and quick.  Great interaction with audience, which permits students to reconsider their opinions.  Nice guy type, but still waters run deep.
An incredible professor.  Prof. Davies is very, very intelligent and is able to speak on length on any topic. The course is VERY, VERY, VERY informative with him as prof. yay davies!
He's alright, he always gets mad at the slide girl ... and goes off topic often
He's smart and sweet but it's hard to take notes in his class

Take her class if you want an easy credit, but not if you want to learn anything you can't from a few hours with the text book. There are a lot of stellar philos profs at mac but she isn't one of them

Be advised, Dr. LeBlanc is a bad professor. She makes little effort to hide her feminist agenda, and has trouble understanding any perspective that differs from her own.(note. if your a tree hugger you'll love her)
Wow! Leblanc knows her stuff, and makes it interesting, even the tough material. I dig the big black boots!
The words incoherent, and awful come to mind. Do yourself a favor and do not take any of her classes.

Good for the most part. It's not her fault it's a crappy class that almost everyone has to take. She explains things well and has a good sense of humour, which made the dry lecture material a little more palatable.
Can't teach worth****e, stop playing with your hair, we know your doing this to sell your own book.
She will try her hardest to help you understand the material, that is, if you ask for her help.  Great and funny prof!
Awesome prof.  She really seems to enjoy teaching, especially this course.  Excellent job Leblanc.
Shes alright, nothing special
great teacher. knows her stuff.
while class is an easy 10 she is an awful prof
She looks like someone who belongs in a Quentin Tarantino movie.  2 thumbs up!
She was an alright prof...kinda scattered.  Beware the dirty blue overheads!
Genius....Clear,  Faire,  Interesting.
Once and a while you find a philosophy teacher that manages to keep you awake, she's one of them!
She is super great!!!
Very interesting, made me think...

She teaches well enough that you dont need your text book(well at least i didnt)

comments: Ball's lecture style is dry and will put you to sleep. He knows a lot about anatomy, but not a whole lot about teaching apparently. He makes inappropriate jokes which are kind of funny but a little awkward. Also his pants never fit him right. I usually listened to a different lecture recording because he fumbles his words and talks too fast.

He is VERY knowledgeable, and I think people just don't like learning about the CNS in general. Sitting through lecture is difficult because there are too many slides and too much material to cover in 50 minutes. I would usually just sit and listen without taking notes, then listen back to the lecture and take notes.

Anatomy itself is a very hard coarse. So no matter if you get waiman, helli or him, if you want above a 60, you have to rewatch the lectures. He is very knowledgeable but besides that he goes very fast, most of his slides are pictures, but after rewatching, what he says does make sense.
He's a nice guy but can be very unclear in his lectures, bounces from topic to topic quickly. Makes it difficult to understand the concepts. He knows his stuff but does not teach it well.
he can be unclear and a bit all over the place in lectures. he knows his stuff but he is just a very bland person.

all his slides are pictures. you really have to listen to what he is saying to fully understand the information. he goes too fast and i feel like i have to read over the material 3 times before understanding it

Dr. Ball is not a very enthusiastic lecturer but he does know a LOT  about anatomy. He brings in extra models of what we are talking about in lecture as a visual aid, which is helpful. He has a very monotonous voice and is hard to follow. Be prepared to re-listen to his lectures to take good notes.

Anatomy and physiology is by no means an easy course. If you are taking it as an elective, be prepared to work hard. That being said, best course I've ever taken. Dr. Ball dedicates hours to students outside of class and lab. You'll hate him at first because his lecture are crowded and dense. But by the end, everything will click and it's awesome!

Extremely knowledgeable in his field and very approachable. Definitely the best professor to go to for help if you're in Chem Eng and Bioeng or Elec and Biomed Eng. Spends a lot of time in the anatomy lab and will ensure that you have the core concepts down before moving to anything else.

This man knows his stuff! Makes terminology mistakes in lecture, but all lecture videos are posted online after. Dense material, difficult exams but highly informed and eager to meet and go over concept in the anatomy lab.

Amazing professor. Extremely helpful, and is willing to meet at any time to go over concepts in the lab, a level of helpfulness I have never seen from any other professor before. Yes, he was covering a lot of info, but that doesn't mean it was 'incomprehensible', just DENSE. An UNFORGETTABLE experience. Best prof in the course.

Very frustrating listening to his lectures; his lectures are inaccurate sometimes; very unorganised; tests are fairly hard and very very specific. His lecture slides only contain pictures and the content he presents is very dense. Thus, it becomes kind of hard to keep up.

Dr. Ball is not clear during his lectures, his information on slides is disorganized, or not present, meaning that you have to listen to his lectures several times in order to write down the information. The other professors in the course had very clear and easy to follow lecture slides, perhaps they could teach Dr. Ball how to make a powerpoint.
Such a great prof!

Dr Ball was not the greatest professor in my opinion. I was in the nursing program and he seemed to really dislike us, which made the course that much more difficult. I found him pompous and rude, and overall a poor teacher.

You start hating Dr. Ball by your fourth lecture with him, and keep hating till after you get Wainman back, and you realize that Alexander Ball was annoying, cracked stupid jokes and covered way too much info in one lecture, but he was so damn good anyway. When you relisten to the lectures, everything becomes crystal clear. ps.doesn't like nurses.

very expert&knowlegable prof,can talk closing his eyes,he's that xpert!His teaching is most nicely worded,organized with best language&explanation.He could stop anywhere if I went to him(class,cafeteria,lab,busstop)anytime for hours devoting himself&caring for his students just like his own kids!He's always there for helping with all his time!

My most fav.prof.an xpert teacher.I will never forget how he answered my questions all day&night on lrnlink.He was available whenever I needed,could stop anywhere, anytime for hours.After I listened his audio,it was a nice notebook as it's so well described,organized,worded just like a language specialist.Very caring,devoting& kind to his pupils.

He is extremely intelligent and knows everything before the slide is up. It takes a very patient man to teach this kind of material, especially with the interest he shows. Whoever says that he is a bad teacher probably failed because they are retarted.
Great professor who is always willing to answer questions and help students understand the information presented. Plus he's hella funny!

Dr. Ball was one of the best profs I've had. Great lecturer (quick at times, but there was a lot of material to cover), and very clear. He was always very, very helpful in clarifying any questions (esp in the lab). On a few occasions, I asked simple questions, and he took about 20-30 min of his time going into detail, explaining important concepts.

A mediocre lecturer (talks way too fast) and the slides are designed solely for bell-ringer/diagram questions so watch out for MCQ that come out of nowhere! Incredibly helpful in the 1R1 lab (even in 2nd term, when he wasn't lecturing at all!). A good guy but a less-than-stellar lecturer.
Made great slides and did a great job lecturing. Never had the opportunity to talk to him...

His lectures are organized well...the powerpoitns are pretty decent...and he most definitely knows his stuff. However, he is NOT AT ALL approachable, and he very clearly favours the BHSc students in the class.  In contrast, he can be very condescending to/critical of nursing students
Smartest man I know.
Alex you are a great lecturere, and hot to boot
excellent
No Comments
Damn sexy man... Oakley's new spokesmodel.  He's da bomb!
lookin' good!
awesome!!
Great teacher, very passionate about the material he covers.

comments: I really enjoyed having Dr. Shedden as a professor. She was funny and her lectures were always really interesting. Her tests were quite easy for the most part, although I found the final exam challenging.

Dr. Shedden is an awesome prof! The content of the course is really interesting. Her lectures are engaging and very applicable. Her midterms are fair and so is her exam. You'll be lucky to get her for Cognition! She is very helpful and approachable.

Dr Shedden comes across as super nice and provides lots of multimedia examples in lecture that relate to material. Format of slides is confusing, easier to follow along the textbook. Test questions are incredibly hard. TA's marking on papers very subjective. Felt like no matter how I studied, I'd get a bad mark.

Best class I took at McMaster. Switched majors in 3rd year and felt like I was thrown in the deep end - Neurophysiology of Vision. But it was one of the most rewarding classes and highest mark I achieved. A lot of hard work, but worth it. Once you understand the grading system and what Prof. Shedden is looking for you will do well.

Her explanations of topics are very confusing and at times unnecessarily long. She tries to make an effort in relating to the class but she comes off as unprepared and nervous. She was a horrible lecturer for this class and I hope she'll be better prepared for the next time she decides to teach it.
she can answer your questions clearly which means she knows her stuff but her class is just simply too boring, give me no desire to go to that class at all.....the final exam was kinda a killer
Prof Shedden explains concepts well.

She can explain the material well but her class is juz sooooo boring, I couldn't help looking at the clock several times during every lecture or instead of looking at the clock, I would juz fall asleep....but since it's a mandatory course for a lotta students, we juz have to suck it up I guess
Best prof I've ever had.  And I had her for stats!
Unclear explanations, and horribly difficult tests. Overall, a terrible experience :(

Don't get to excited over that first midterm grade...it gets a lot tougher after that...study those SPSS charts and know what those variables are she does NOT explain those well. She provides a lot of help and is a really NICE prof, but should make the test more similar to text book questions. Maybe then the class avg wouldn't take such a beating?!
She is a very helpful prof. However, her tests are difficult and challenging.

difficult course for ppl who are not comfortable with math, but dr shedden did everything she could to boost class average, put in extra office hours, and went with the pace of the class. really caring prof.
Good prof, very well organized and clear, but needs to take it easy on midterms and exams. It's not nice to have such low class average. Many people found her boring.

Helpful but hard makes no sense. Helpful should be fair too. I don't think she likes to give good marks. Not a good prof, but you can't even avoid her because she's the only teaching in Fall and Winter. She thinks it's cool to screw over the whole class. Just awful.
62% class average on the final. That's BAAAD! This prof is really difficult.
Hard but helpful
Very nice and helpful, yet screws over the class with extremely hard tests....we need to get into grad school!
Tough
Class was a waste of time, she goes horribly slow through lectures and then throws a test at you with material that even she couldn't do in the amount of time given.
AWESOME PROF!! made stats fun. expected to hate the course ended up really enjoying it. definitly one of the best prof i have ever had!
Excellen prof! Always willing to help.  Dr. Shedden made Stats barable.  Thanks :)
excellent
Awesome prof.
Dr. Shedden works very hard for the students.  If you're having trouble, she will not let you go by the wayside.  There is no better person to take this mandatory course from.

She gives hard tests and doesn't really give enough time but she is always ready to help you and I found her lecture notes and examples to be as clear as possible for stats. She is also willing to help weight your grades to give you the best mark possible
the class average is quiet low for all the exams. She's harder than your average prof. Wish we had someone else teach stats!

She didn't teach at all.... just let students run class. To be fair she attempted an inquiry-exploration style of learning for the students... but her expectations were unclear and she taught us nothing... my opinion of course.
I found that I learned better from the textbook.  She made simple things look so complicated and I found that I needed more time for the tests and I could have definately used more time on the exam.
Great prof!
BRUTAL exams
Makes the course a LOT harder than it has to be
her lectures are all over the place and she is not very helpful in preparing for her impossible tests.
Genuine interest in seeing students do well
I think Dr. Shedden rocks stats sucks but honestly she motivates me to study good job!
