comments: He is a very nice teacher, with very amazing lectures. His lectures contain lots of information so be prepared for full concentration.
Great professor! He lectures are really great and he is always looking to help the student!
Great prof! Good at teaching! Can teach you everything in electrical engineering and physics. Best prof ever in McMaster.
Great prof, should have more like him for other courses, he can teach you anything related to electrical engineering.
Amazing Prof!
Dr. Li is a fabulous professor with great review sessions who really cares about his students! One of the best professors I've had.
Dr. Li IS THE MAN!!!!! WOOOOOOO!!!!!

I have no idea how this prof comes to class all pumped up every single day AND TEACHES THE WHOEL FIFTY MINUTES WITHOUT EVVEN ONCE LOOKING AT HIS NOTES OR THE BOOk. A pure genius, really cares about teaching, always keeps telling us that we should get a proper education since we are paying so much,really really smart guy,hard working,on time,helpful
Dr. Li is a GENIUS! Knows the material inside out. He taught the ENTIRE course from his head. Really helpful during office hours as well.

Dr. Li DOES NOT give the same midterms as previous years. In all hontesty, you do have to work hard in order to do well as 3EJ4 is a challenging course that covers a lot of material. But overall, Dr. Li is a really good teacher. Very very energetic and provides a ton of applications. He really knows his stuff!

the midterm and exam were EXACTLY the same as previous years. I just copied the answers from previous years to my 4-page cheat sheet, FINISHED THE MIDTERM in 5 minutes and EXAM in 10 minutes, easiest A+ evar
Easy exam with cheat sheet. Easy going person with helpful personality.ONly that I dislike is the notes on blackboard (not organize) !!!
one of the best profs., very responsible, very organized, clear lectures
The man is a genious, but cant teach.  His lectures are very hard to follow but in the end it doesnt really matter because he gives lots of help and marks ridiculously easy.
so much for today

Good lectures and tutorials, gave tough assignments but then gave us TONS of help and extra time to finish them. The final was not overly difficult, just too long. My favourite line re: the exams: "One cheat sheet, letter-size double-sided, don't bring a postah!" (done in Mandarin accent)
good
he's a very good prof.  Very approchable and cares about the students.
very great and nice prof, in his class, 50% of students get at least A- !!!  as long as u write the final exam, u will not fail this course!!
nice guy. easy course, easy marks.
No Comments
I have had this prof since Elec Eng 3EJ4. He is always nice to students. He is willing to give u a nice grade as long as u are willing to learn the stuffs.
you will be luck to have him
No Comments
cool prof, but fast.  really fast.  hard midterms, easy final
smart guy, but he's too smart. gives you a 10 hour test to finish in 3 hours.

comments: Kajiura is a great professor. He midterms and exam was basically memorization and if you studied the material you'll be fine. Make sure you come to class because you need her notes to do well. Her home study tasks are annoying but not an issue. Watch and read supplementary information, she tests from that too! She saved my mark from Dushoff.

Her exam isn't hard, but its super detailed. Most of her section was pure recall and very little application. Her midterms were easy, you just need to memorize everything. You must look at the new info in the readings and you must go to lectures for her supplementary info if you want a good grade. She is a very nice prof and super helpful.
She was an angel of a prof! Super caring and inspirational. It is much easier to do well if you regularly attend the lectures.

If you don't go to her lectures, you WILL NOT get a good grade. Your mark often depends on the notes you make off her speaking and not from the lecture slides. If your notes aren't complete you will miss out on a lot of testable content. She definitely makes you work for the mark but show up and do the work and you'll be fine.

She was a great prof, and I took her for Bio 1P03. The course content wasn't very heavy, but she took the time to explain it very thoroughly and answer all questions very respectfully. She really has a passion for teaching, which is always a boost.
Great prof. Kept my attention in class. Organelle song my fave.

Best prof I had for first year! She would incorporate videos/animations especially during applied lectures which I found helpful. Midterm SAs required you to know the nitty-gritty details from web modules and applied lectures but overall they were fair. Only complaint I have is that she would play the Organelles song one too many times before class

She's a very optimistic professor that's highly passionate about the course she teaches. Her midterm mc were fair and not difficult, however her long answer does require you to attend and throughly understand her lectures.

Dr K understands the needs of students and gives great advice. She's enthusiastic. Her tests questions are challenging but fair  they make  you to think about content and solve problems. If you attend lectures and follow her advice, you'll do fine.  I like how  she gave us  opportunities to help with research projects.
I liked the iClicker questions ,they helped me to do concept applications. Gives good advice.

Kajiura was an amazing prof! Her test and exam questions were super easy and weren't tricky at all, if you pay attention in class and use her lecture notes as a study tool, this class is an easy A! I didn't even make my own notes, just used hers and did great! An overall amazing prof!
Good prof! Lectures showed me different perspectives and applications related to ecology.

Lectures -- the more you go and pay attention, the less reading and catching up you have to do.  Reading- DON't read the whole textbook JUST read the graphs and figure legends and things you DONT understand.  Tutorials- Amazing in giving you a broader perspective  Overall, easy course--not too much effort.
I liked Bio 1M03. The course is interesting, relevant, &  valuable to me even beyond this term. It revived my passion to take more Bio courses.

Very good prof for first year. She goes beyond the course and gives tips on how o survive first year, and the material on the test is made very clear beforehand. She's a great prof, but this course is so boring.
She makes you get use to solving application style questions, which is good . I'm a  Science Society rep and she  lets me promote our events before her lectures start and I appreciate that.

Excellent prof this term ! Provides the fundamental concepts with linkages to applied  research, which I absolutely love! Tests are challenging but clearly worded and fair. If you follow her advice, you'll do well in the course.

Still early in the course. Good so far. Realizing that I have to come prepared to Kajura's lectures  by reading the textbook and looking at her lecture resources or I won't understand the content. Just started following her advice about the learning objectives and its working okay and  glad I'm in this classtt

Impressed me with her enthusiasm and patience. I enjoyed group lecture activities. Made some new friends that I otherwise wouldn't have. Final exam was challenging but fair coverage of the lecture information.
Good prof with a positive attitude towards students. Held my interest in bio, especially ecology.

Dr. Kajiura doesn't just spit out an endless amount of information. She provides concise lecture outlines of what she will discuss in class, so you don't have to mindlessly copy every word she says. Horrible Lecturer and very passionate about herself! However course material is very dry.
She's an amazing prof who gives clear guidelines about how to study. If you come to class and pay attention to the concepts she emphasizes, you'll be fine for the tests

Dr. Kajiura doesn't just spit out an endless amount of information.  She provides concise lecture outlines of what she will discuss in class, so you don't have to mindlessly copy every word she says. Great Lecturer and very passionate about what she teaches ! However course material is very dry.

She was a great prof, loves teaching biology and loves her students. She always advertised her office hours, and the projects that she's involved in outside of class for students. Great opportunities to get involved, she's very slow paced in lecture, goes over concepts too clearly if anything! Her tests are also very straightforward.

Great prof! I like how she encouraged me to take responsibility for my own learning and apply conceptual knowledge. A facet that I particularly liked about the lectures was that Dr. Kajiura  helped me with all of my questions and made me work to find the answers to my questions,  which helped my research skills and self directed work ethic.

I really connected with this course! Classes covered lots of research examples, which were totally helpful. Home study questions were tough but rewarding to solve. Exam review was based upon what topics we had requested. Ecology requires looking at things through multiple ways, which is exciting. Already thinking of taking 3rd ecology courses.

Heres the thing, she was super helpful! But her lectures, hellful! All she had were images and then shed ask us a question and then not answer it. Random facts everywhere (they showed up on the exam) however very enthusiastic and ready to help you. Very sweet lady imo. Easy midterm! Easy to do well if you keep up!

Lectures were organized with clear learning objectives with strong links to research applications in ecology. Final exam review was the best of my courses. Dr K and Marvin helped us who were nervous to raise our academic work ethic  by encouragement. Exam was a thorough evaluation of the concepts and fair.

Loved Dr Kajiura's lectures and her teaching activities since the in class discussions opened my mind to research and biology. I'm more focused on my academic career now. I started out being passive in class but quickly found myself participating more and learning things more quickly with her lectures.

Kajiura is a very approachable prof. She is kindhearted and is definitely there for her students. Although she lacks a good teaching ability. Her lectures are often boring and I found that I could read the textbook and get the same out of it then going to lecture.

Really like the 2F03 course, she helps me during  and outside of classes, her office study sessions are the place to be where I get  extra help. I went to all the midterm test prep sessions and did better on the midterm test because of them.

Lectures are well prepared and interactive. I particularly like that Dr. Kajiura  covers several supplementary case studies and interesting examples outside of the textbook. I noticed that a previous posting incorrectly said that just using the textbook is sufficient, that's so untrue. I enjoy lectures and being able to talk to the profs.

This course is a great experience for students in their final year of undergrad! There is no didactic instruction in this course, only major projects and small assignments completed in your group. Dr. Kajiura and her TA are always present if you need clarification or guidance.
Like the interactive lectures with class discussions and linkages to ecological concerns that living animals and humans are currently facing.  All's good !

Love Bio 1M03! Thrilled to be finally learning about biology with real world relevance that will affect my life and future generations. Really intrigued by course content and engaged by her teaching methods. Great prof- student interactions during in-class discussions.

Awesome professor!  Dr. K does a wonderful job teaching the course. She motivated me to want to learn about biology. Fun learning about the notable classic experiments. Yeah, Meselson Stahl experiment is classic!  I agree with her that it's important to acknowledge the amazing scientists of the past and the present.

It was a pleasure having Dr. Kajiura for Biology 4A03. Her course has given me confidence in my research abilities. I loved collaborating with other research team members but also know that these classmates will remain my friends forever. I have a much greater appreciation of advanced topics in ecology!
was boring and talked more about her office hours and her experiences more than course content. her tests and exam questions were really hard and confusing! would NEVER take her class again

Go to her lecture, and expect to learn nothing. She is advertising her office hour all the time and teach nothing in class. In tests she gives you a lot of unreasonable questions asking you to memorize everything like researcher's names. She does train you to learn everything by yourself and how to get good grades. I guess can be good and bad.

I like how Kajiura took me out of my comfort zone and encouraged me to take responsibility for my learning. By being more focused and self- disciplined , I now work better and solve problems with more confidence.   My only regret is that I should have visited her office hours sooner. Like my CA said, she's a great prof and very helpful.

Dr. Kajiura made going to lectures interesting,. can't believe how much I've learnt from her. I wasn't into Bio before I took this course, but now I am.  Her study questions are a big help, so are her study tips , since I'm  better with managing my time.

Her lectures help me identify and focus on the important concepts. She is clear about what is testable information for  midterms and exam. With all the material we have to know I appreciated that she shared study tips.

She doesnt really teach that well in class. She spends more time talking about what you should know instead of what the actual content is. Like she keeps saying this is the way you should study and so on.
Like the lectures. Full of enthusiasm at 8:30. Wonderful!
Enthusiastic prof. Like her case studies. Tests are tough, but fair.
She's a nice person but her classes are a little dull. I have a hard time staying awake...

Excellent professor!  Has high expectations for students to study hard and prepare for tutorials, lectures, and tests.  Her study tips work and finding out about her research was inspiring as I participated in the IMPACT Project that helped , Brad, who had suffered from a stroke.
Great prof! Definitely changed my perspective regarding biology and how everything relates to it. I followed her study tips and did well.
very nice person, does a lot around the community! but would not want her as a prof... would not take the course again.

As I reflect upon my studies at McMaster University, I am grateful for Dr Kajiura having been my mentor.  I know that my next stage in graduate school will be exciting with new challenges and opportunities, I will embrace them since I feel confident that I have the research skills to succeed, thanks to Dr K!
Dr Kajiura is very helpful prof. She answered all of my emails and these were numerous!!! I should have followed her advice earlier, finally did and I got better marks.
My fave course and prof first term. Course exposed me to the relevance of Biology. Course requires lots of skills, teaches work ethic.  I liked being motivated to high expectations.
Great prof. Liked the topics especially the real world examples and case studies.

She honestly does everything in her power to give you all the resources you need. She truly cares about her students and its really sweet. She couldn't make biology interesting for me though. I don't think anyone can.
I'm going into my 4th year and she is still one of the best professors I've had! Very passionate and interesting! Her note outlines are very helpful
She makes bio interesting and is clear about what we're expected to know like applying concepts.
enjoying 1a03 lectures, they're at 8:30am and I haven't missed any of them since the lectures are so interesting, pace has been good. iClickers are helpful

I like how Dr Kajura teaches using several sources for her lectures such as videos, case studies, real world examples. Not sure about the previous posting, since she told us on 1st day of lectures that we would be reading only certain sections of the textbook, def NOT the whole thing. She helps a lot during her office hours.

Dr. Kajuira has her heart in the right place but she manages to spend more time telling us how to do well in her course than actually teaching course content. She assigns too much reading (the entire textbook basically). She does a good job of elucidating the thematic content of the course.
enjoyed her course very much but what impresses me the most is her humanitarian work and she is humble about that
really great prof, made me love bio, really cares for her students

She is one of the few profs who have inspired me to think beyond myself  and how I can contribute to the future of humanity. The biology-related knowledge that she has helped me to gain has provided me with these skills.

Bio 1M03 opened my eyes to how important Biology is. The case based study approach that Dr K uses challenged me to take ownership over my learning. I rose to her high expectations for us to grasp the course concepts. I now can confidently apply concept to problem solve. A skill that was honed in this course, thanks to Dr K

So kind :). She was so caring towards the students and definitely wanted everyone to do well. Her style of teaching keeps you interested in lectures, and a lot of the times I didn't realize how quickly time flew by! She includes videos and applications to relate the course material to the world around us, and it keeps you engaged. Solid prof.
Great Prof. Recommend Her.

Liked Dr Kajiura's part of 1a03. I think her real-world examples helped me retain the material being taught because I had to put it into practice. No problem with high expectations good prep for next year.
Great prof, love her teaching style ,she posted questions early which motivated me to start working way in advance of the midterm  amount of work was just right.

great teacher. kept things very interesting. she actually cares about what shes teaching. she is there for the students. overall she was my favourite prof at mac, but she overwhelms you on midterms and tests. i havent wrote any tests yet but there is so much to know, i wish she would cut that down. but anyways, still a great prof
amazing prof she cared about us & how we did in the course & what we got from it, real life examples were sooo helpful

Very much enjoyed Dr Kajiura's lectures. I have  a new-found love for biology and found the information was made relevant and interesting. She engaged me as a student with her methods of teaching and motivated me to succeed in my studies. I now want to learn about all the diverse fields of biology.

even though sometimes she might not be very clear on what she is exactly saying, she still has a great level of teaching. she is very organized and plans everything ahead of time. she provides the students with chapter outlines which can easily become helpful notes.

I attended everyone of Dr Kajiura lectures. Loved them!!! She's very organized, approachable, and friendly. I wasn't worried about asking her questions during lectures. The supplementary resources were good too. her practice questions & homework it showed me how to study better.
She was so nice! She made my first term at Mac better!

Kajiura used a lot of real-world examples during lectures that were very interesting and relevant to the course material. She always encouraged class discussions and she was very clear in her expectations. Great prof and very friendly outside of class as well!
I've learnt so much in every bio class. I like how her classes are interesting,fun & interactive.
Very interested in what she teaches, which makes me even more interested in biology! But she overuses the word "inside" rather than "in."  ex: "you will find this diagram inside the textbook ..."

When Steve Jobs died we were all sad, Dr Kajiura helped us by relating the course topics to his pancreatic cancer and that gave us hope for potential research and cures. That was an inspiring lecture.

This professor was literally the best professor that I have had at McMaster as of yet. She really cares about her students and will do anything thing she can to help them, as long as you as her in person for help. She made this course even more enjoyable for me, though I already loved the course. She has lecture outlines to follow and puts them up.
I like this course a lot, class notes are really nicely organized, topics esp. medical conditions are interesting. I can tell that Dr. Kajiura enjoys teaches us : )
4L03 is amazing.Best organized course by far, workload is tough but well worth it.
As a special needs student (auditory), she  makes me feel welcomed at McMaster. I feel less worried  now. Thks Dr K

Her teaching style suits me. Nice that she lets me ask questions in class and answers all of my questions after class...lol even when I saw her in bookstore. I asked her about transgenic mice research sounds complex & interesting!!!
Really friendly prof. I like how Dr K links class topics together with research.
Thrilled to have Dr K. Went to her office hours this week and she was a tremendous help. She's great to talk to, which is a blessing and appreciated :)
Excellent course! I've learnt valuable research skills on two levels: group and self-directed.So grateful to have experienced her mentorship.

I'm a teaching assistant for this course and attend her lectures. Dr. K asked the class about "DNA Bioinformatics" (not DNA), thought I mentioned that since I noticed that an earlier post was incorrect.   I've enjoyed having her as a prof and mentor.

I'm really surprised that more people are not commenting on her extremely patronizing demeanour. I've only had two classes so far, but she actually asked the class if anyone had ever HEARD of DNA. I was insulted as much as I was laughing. Crazy.
I appreciated how she genuinely cared about us in 1st yr
I found 1m03 lessons easier to learn.  Dr K made learning Hardy Weinberg way more meaningful.
She's soooo helpful with career advice.
I recommend this course. It prepares you for research & grad school.
Spring course was really intense, but seriously good. Kajura made bio fun to learn. LOL I'm "an informed scientific citizen" now!!!

Her lectures and outlines are very helpful. I really enjoyed the real-world examples she provided as it helped me connect with the concepts.  I went to her office hours and she was very helpful in further explaining difficult concepts to me in a new way than she had done in lecture, which shows she really can TEACH!
I loved this course that dr K taught. It had everything!!! Best moment was the our Research Team's seminar presentation. Dr Kajiura was always there to guide us, Lol even on weekends.
I just graduated last week. Sooo grateful to have had a prof like Dr Kajiura for 3 undergrad courses. 4L03 was my capstone experience!

I will keep this review completely neutral so as not to incur the wrath of those who would not see anything unfavourable said about the professor in question. Biology is moderately difficult. Kajiura is moderately good. The course was moderately interesting, moderately difficult, and moderately stimulating.

I like her teaching style...bio is not easy its challenging and interesting,  I'm not exactly a morning person, but I attended all of her summer classes and enjoyed them. I listened to her advice and was able to land a lab position.

1. Bio is NOT the hardest course in first year. Try first year chemistry, any artsci or isci course, or first year physics. 2. Kajiura is the worst prof I have ever had. She spoon-feeds her students and treats them like they are in grade 9.

Although everyone knows bio is the hardest course in 1st year, it was my fave class and subject, outlines and suppl stuff are organized  it was fun attending Dr Ks lectures. I think that I'm a lot more skilled about analysizing info now.
She's really nice. She tries to be really helpful
glad i took this course, it opened my mind to biodiversity, good course taught by a great prof
Really good course:) Best group work experience that I've had at mac. Def helped my research project. Thks Doc K.

Amazing class! I really enjoyed this course. Like all her courses, they are well structured and she wisely allocates plenty of time towards the end of her lectures for us to ask questions related to the course and beyond!
Top class professor. Incredible experience from start to finish. Dr. Kajiura is immensely organized and I liked the effective layout with the major project. Plus I learned a lot!

I've had the pleasure of having Dr K for 4 undergrad courses and can attest that she is a great lecturer and her mentorship was key in guiding me to graduate research.  She provides well-organized lecture outlines and supplementary resources to reveal the significance of the concepts. I enjoyed how her evaluations tested conceptual/applied info.
Doc K is an amazing prof she really made me understand bio, everything was clear to me. Defintely helped me make the move from highschool to U. I hope to have her as a prof in the future.

Dr K's an excellent professor. Bio 1a03 was my best mark in 1st year, due to her amazing teaching. I LOVED how she incorporated active learning exercises in her lectures. University is about deep learning, not surface. She inspired me to think in a conceptual and applied way. I definitely feel prepared for Honours Biology !
Great teacher! Easy to talk to and explains fully all concepts, new and old.
Interesting course, learnt how crucial biology plays in our lives. Great prof. Final exam was fair.
Needed the class for psychology; no comment.
Dr K is great.  Bio 1a03 covered more concepts  in more detail than I had previously . Good that theres lots of resources which helped
Gr8 course, exam questions were tough but fair.
this course relates to the real world , good lectures , hope to have her again for other classes

Dr K is caring & friendly.  Treated my friends & I  with respect and encouraged us to take responsibility for our learning. As the guest speakers said Dr K will help you even after the course is done. How many profs do that? Dr K does !
Love Dr K  shes always enthusiastic and cheery to our class , review sessions really helped me prepare for tests
I took this course only because I had to, but Dr.K was a great lecturer and I ended up really enjoying the class.
good prof, taught well  & made Bio interesting
personally, I think this class is 1 of the best is 1st yr Dr. K is awesome, wouldn't change a thing
Dr Kajiura , def one of the best profs , very clear, thorough and uses every lecture efficiently and wisely .
Most self transforming course I've taken. Issues are real. Doc K rocks!

I am a McMaster Alumni, who recently started medical school. I had the pleasure of taking several of Dr. Kajiura courses in 1st year and 4th year of my studies. I developed communication and research skills, which continue to benefit me as I pursue my MD.  All thanks to Dr. Kajiura.

1M03 was my fave 1st yr course, so much so that I'm now specializing in Bio. Dr. K made the material relevant and struck an amazing rapport with us.  Excellent study sessions and helped us find lab jobs.
ok prof, but teaches the class as if there were 13 year olds sitting in front of her.
She's an amazing prof. Helps in so many ways & inspired  me to be a better person.
Good having the written questions on tests they were really helpful. Now know that  I'm better prepared for 2nd year courses & tests. Excellent prof!
Very positive attitude, enthusiastic, friendly, well-organized. You can tell she loves what she's doing. Notes were helpful, but the fill-in-the-blank style was annoying. Very fair tests.
Lots to know in this course but if you attend lectures ,follow Doc K's advice and don't procrastinate things go GREAT! I'm gonna take more bio courses next term for sure, interesting stuff
She hooked my attention during lectures. Gr8 videos and real world examples.
Dr. Kajiura is an exceptional professor and she made my 1st year bio experience so intriguing that i now want to go into the field of ecology :)
Great prof midterm & exam were challenging, but questions were all pretty fair. She didn't baby us that's for sure! Impressed by how patient she is.

She's an AWESOME prof.  Liked having her as my prof for the whole spring term, she was always there to help us with the material. Lecture discussions were thought provoking and directed me to think about integrated things in a broader deeper perspective. Can hardly wait to take another course with her!

I LOVED 1M03, it was definitely worth going to Dr. Kajiura's lectures during the spring. She went above and beyond to help us and direct us to improve as students and as members of the McMaster Community. Biology is my world now!
Liked this course immensely because it made me apply what I had learnt, especially with case based studies. Dr. K kept me interested throughout. Homework and clicker questions were helpful too.
Explains concepts well and gives many helpful study tips.  One of my favourite profs in first year.
Thanks Dr K ! U made me use analytical thinking skills & that's what university all about. Luv ya!
outstanding  course was a reality check that our planet is precious. i now know what has to be done for sustainability thanx Doc K.
She's the BEST prof that I've had at McMaster. She's approachable & teaches with sooo much enthusiasm that it's fun to go to her lectures.
Dr. Kajiura is a great prof!  She made you apply concepts. She's the only prof in 1st yr who actually teaches you how to study and helps you learn.

I enjoyed 1a03. I'm completing a 2nd degree and can really appreciate  how Dr. Kajiura patiently facilitated us to search for answers, shift through the references, and become smarter "science citizens".
Dr. Kajiura was by far my favorite prof in 1st yr.  She cares cos she always stayed after class to answer my questions. Liked how she made bio real & relevant!
Great prof, made you actually want to come to class. Lecture notes were immensely helpful. Tests were very fair. Enthusiasm was contagious.
Very nice and so sweet to everyone, even us obnoxious first-years, all the time. She may be the most organized person I have ever met in my life. Also, I hope I age half as well as she does!
Cool prof, but she the last cookie in the day of the orientation date.... I want that cookie! But she was a one good prof!

I'm in 4th Yr Honours Biology. Looking back I'm SO VERY THANKFUL to have had Dr. K in my 1st Yr. Her advice helped me tremendously & to get a research position in LSB. She teaches, but she also mentors her students!

Dr. K is AMAZING! I LOVE her lectures!!! I like that she encourages everyone to think positively & to help others. I participated with her Team Miracle Cures in the Run for the Cure for Breast Cancer Research. She's genuine & very compassionate!

Dr. K.  is a WONDERFUL prof!!! She's is always willing to help you with Biology and other things, like finding jobs. I love her lectures since there's lots of student-prof interaction, especially the iClickers questions & Battle of the Brains game.

The course material was very useful and it was enjoyable to learn the material. Usually i see some people sleeping in my other classes, but in Dr. Kajiura's class i have never seen anyone fall asleep, because the material was well presented and kept the student interested.
Dr. K. is good! - Of course, I don't want a "rating under review" so I won't exercise my true freedom of opinion here.

Dr.K is the best proff I have ever had!!! Shes makes everything seem so simple even when it isn't! Also, her lecture outlines are sooo helpful when studying and I love how she talks about why the stuff we are learning is important and uses real world examples.
You are an amazing and helpful professor whom truly enjoys teaching. Your love for biology is contagious!
Dr. Kajiura is one of my favorite profs. I find it refreshing to have a professor who is so approachable and enthusiastic about teaching.
Excellent teacher, always there to help.
I've had her for 1m03 too. Solid prof. Really easy; she fills the lecture notes so you barely have to right anything (which can make lectures really boring).
good prof, readily available and enthusiastic in lecture
She's a great prof & makes us work hard. Negative comments posted don't reflect the attitude of majority, only the unhappy few.

Do not take any of her classes unless you enjoy being talked to like you are 5 years old.  That said, she babies you and the class itself is very easy.  The few times I actually attended class and had to listen to her almost made the easy A not worth it though.
Dr. K Rocks. Liked her cancer model 'cos it links molecules, cells, genetics, evolution, stems cells, plus nanotechnology.

Dr. Kajiura's an EXCELLENT prof! I enjoy her interactive lectures. She challenges students to APPLY concepts.  I've had her for 1st yr and 3rd yr courses. Her generous  advice has helped me succeed at university!
Dr. Kajiura is always cheerful and polite to students. The McMaster Biology Society named an award (The Kajiura/McIntosh/Stone Award) to acknowledge how much she helps students.

Dr. Kajiura is known to be very nurturing to some. However, she does get upset easily when students don't understand material covered. She has been known for ridiculing her students in class. For example, a girl put up her hand as Kajiura was finishing a thought. Much to the class's surprise, Kajiura snapped and made fun of the student. Nurturing?
good!
awesome.... sexy ;)
Great notes. Posts the notes online with blanks and then you follow along in class and fill them in. Really clear in what you need to know. Best first year bio teacher by far.

Very clear and willing to help. Incredibly detailed but sometimes rushed due to lots of info and lack of time. Has interesting examples and answers lots of questions. Tends to spoonfeed but the exams are fair. Overall, an enthusiastic and knowledgeable prof!

Dr. Kajiura was an awesome prof. Simply follow her class notes/fill in blanks sheets and you're good to go! She made things interesting by playing "battle of the brains" with an incentive of a prize pack going to the winner :) She's the most helpful and approachable prof I know of!
She is a very helpful prof.  Her tests are very fair and primarily from her notes.  By far, one of the best and my fav first year prof.
Very good instructor, Very passionate about biology. Good lectures and notes. Can't really ask for much.
she is a really good prof and her notes are good and are what comes out in the test. if you go for all her classes ur guaranteed to do well
Amazing first year teacher. The most helpful you'll find.
No Comments
I love your lecture!!! it's fun to go to biology class!
Really great and detailed notes. Provides interesting examples.
Boring
Worst professor ever, all she does is read the captions from the textbook, very poor teacher.

Doc Kajiura is awesome.  Never before have I had a prof who was so helpful in my chosen field of study.  Sometimes my interest lags, however I always learn and simple exposure to the subject has improved my abilities greatly.  Thanks Ms. Kajiur.

Definitely not as good as Davidson and too enthusiastic for my liking. But I liked how she engaged us in her lecture by having us fill in the blanks in her notes...although you could have just skipped and filled it in from the text yourself. Not the best but not the worst either.

Very clear, helpful and happy to be teaching. She engages you into the lecture. If you're not there to learn new things and just think lecture is a boring waste of time, you may not like her, but for those who enjoy biology, she's great

Wonderful notes that will prepare you for the tests very well but still requires you to read the text a bit. Very clear and willing to answer any questions. Very involved with students in person or over the web
good prof

expectations and objectives clearly defined: you know what to exepct. Fair and resonable on tests. Lectures aren't too bad; she has a good control on the class, and her lectures notes are very helpful
I come to her class now-a-days... she does a much better job than Bedard... i really like her class.. she knows what she is doing... and her notes are clear
lovaye is great teacher.  i hear she's good at street hockey too.
Excellent prof!
Good teacher, very helpful
A ver nice prof, but she reiterates points a little too much.
great and approachble prof. She's there to teach and very enthusiastic!

Nice lady, and seems to love the material too much. I never seen her in a bad mood, always smiling.  She has great notes and she is easy to follow through lecturing.  Her tests were easy in 1a03, but were increasingly difficult in 1aa3.
great teacher, really there for students
I used to think I would love Biology... *sigh*
Great Proff. Sometimes not too helpfull since she redirects you your Webct Notes. :P. but other than that, great clarity and entusiasm! YAY!
SHES great!! very helpful and most of all, she cares SOO much about her students..Dont be afraid to ask for help.
a vertical red line indicates this is not in your notes, you should copy this down, because you are in first year and are so stupid you will not realize this on your own... Really though a good prof
Excellent, very clear, too much reference to upper year courses
Can be annoying @ times but nice Good tests MUCH better than Davidson/Schellhorn
as ur classmate has correctly identified... make it stop! :) So true.
Good prof, good notes but babied first year classes
She was definitely worth going to nightclass for! SO much better than Davidson!
Good teacher, very helpful.
boring as all get out, but nice lady though
Try to be helpful prof! but the terms that she used make me confuse and unclear
Awesome prof, super friendly and always willing to help, she's great
pretty good
Tries to be helpful and supportive of students.

comments: Horribly disorganized, tutorial exams (8-9 mini midterms) were very vague and hurt learning more than helped it, with beyond useless TA's that followed his equally useless answer keys, and end of semester marks were very confusing nice enough guy, but a bad course

Work each week: One chapter text book reading 3 * 1 hour classes 1 online quizes -10 MC questions 1 tutorial quiz 1 pices of note Way too heavy of work load, and very confusing tutorial quiz questions. Lectures are good. Does not let us know how much each tutorial weight, nor how much does fianl weight until the end of the semester.

Well... To start with, the class is entertaining but I found also it is very disorganized. He will show you a quite of few models and provide opportunities for you to try in class. Lots of reading, assignment and quizzes. I wouldn't take this course if it wasn't required course but unfortunately it is.... Good luck for it!

Difficult class. Learned a lot and really remember most of it. lectures are entertaining. Tests are hard and make you think. don't go to the test memorizing stuff. you really have to understand the material.
loves to hear himself talk and condescending attitude, also very disorganized

The material is presented as scientific, but many questions on the midterm are worded ambiguously and have no place in a class that is mandatory for some people seeking a Bachelor of Science. On the rare occasion that he admits to his mistake he refuses to rectify his error because "it would take a lot of work and it wouldn't make a big change"

Although he can be confusing at times, it works for him. There is a method to the madness and in the end I became a better student. His LIFE revolves around the success of his students. He really cares and wants all his students to succeed. If you are struggling, talk to him (without blame  in your tone) and he will be more than receptive.
Dr. Shore is a nice person. However, don't take his classes unless you want to be part of an experiment.

The  most arrogant prof I've ever had... Super full of himself!! Makes you think the tests will be straightforward, but they are extremely confusing.. He doesn't appreciate student feedback and is horrible at his job. The end.
Great prof. He really cares about the students and their success.
So much respect for this man. Great lecturer, makes content interesting, and always has an open mind and is willing to explain himself. Really heavy workload, though.
Awesome prof, very interesting lectures, but his tests are hard (although manageable) so study hard for them!
Amazing course. You rely learn skills-writing and presenting. Cue cards rock!  The lectures are cool and the tests reasonable. Lots of fun.
Very interesting class. The material will keep you coming back. A lot of work though, not for the faint of heart. Prof was very nice and enthusiastic, never had any problems with him.
Very interesting class. The material will keep you coming back. A lot of work though, not for the faint of heart. Prof was very nice and enthusiastic, never had any problems with him.
An amazing course. Who knew that all of the senses combined. the demos are very cool and the lecture material is great. the textbook sucks, but it is a work in progress.
Awesome demos. he keeps you engaged in the material by making you involved in the research.
excellent use of demos!  i love the clear tie between the ideas and the experiments.  tests are hard but expectations are clear.
he is an ****..he sucks u in on the first class is a total dick the rest of the year..the material is interesting but the fact that he is a jerk really made me hate the class
one of the worse classes ever taken.

The podcasts were a great help -- thanks.  Lectures are dynamic and exciting. The textbook is very dry and not used much.  Tests are very hard, but listen in lecture and you can guess most of the material. Overall a great learning experience.
Fantastic lectures and demos!  awesome speaker. Really hard tests, but fair and what was expected based onlecture.

tests are easy at a glance, but he tested a lot in your understanding..Lecture materials were really interesting..really nice prof...he really care about his students' marks...assignments, quizzes and extra marks help a lot in the final marks..

Excellent Lectures with very clear expectations.  The quizzes are a joke, but the tests are very hard!  He is really interested in helping people, so go up and talk to him.  I did and it totally changed my attitude in the course.  He has great demos and tries to tie the material to real life.  Overall an excellent experience if you're up for it.

quite difficult, even if you attend class and read the textbook.  quizzes and assignments are easy, but midterms + final exam aren't.  the class itself though, is interesting and dr. shore prepares fascinating lectures/demos.

Man this guy is so full of himself i want to vomit. This class is pure memorization of mountains of cases and graphs from studies from decades ago. lame self-endorsing stories,sets a quiz standard but constantly cancels or alters marking scheme for worst. if you try planning for which quzies you want to take/miss he will screw you over by cancelling quizes day of ( best 7/ 11 some people miss a quiz but get screwed when he cancels next weeks as well ) .unorganized. gone a lot, hard to get help or get in contact with. Other prof's tests are 100 times easier with no graph memorization or much regergetation required. take the other cog prof . way better and easier.

this is NOT an easy class. there is ALOT of material that is covered. However this class generally incompasses our everyday "cognitive abilities" in the REAL WORLD! take it if your in for understanding just HOW you LEARN and the fundamental processes that go along with it. There are ALOT of experiments, some are interesting while others are boring.

Podcasts are awesome.  Thanks for all of the hard work!  The textbook was not used.  Lectures are great. dynamic, energetic, clear.  The tests are hard, but managable if you attend class. He never tests on the textbook other than in quizzes which are a brease.  Overall I learned a lot.
Hard tests. Shore is a good teacher though, if you come to class and tutorials you can usually tell what is going to be on the midterms.

Often doesn't know the answers to his own multiple choice quiz and/or exam questions when taking up answers. Poor or illogically phrased questions frequent. Lucky he has good TAs which provide excellent study notes. Lots of graph questions. Mixes up concepts, but otherwise good public speaker. Still overall taking this course is not worth it.

The last student is wacked. Shore is clear and tells you all of the questions on the tests and even some of the answers. You just have to attend class and listen!  Obviously, the previous student did poorly on the last test--a real zinger, but other than the multiple choice totally fair!
Probably one of the worst prof's I have ever had. He knows his stuff, but cannot communicate it in a way that facilitates and correlates his exams. Terrible. RETIRE!
TOUGH

When I first took the class I thought it was a doozy, however towards the end I quite enjoyed it. Dr. Shore knows his stuff and is a great professor, but his exams are a little tough. Overall though a great course and very helpful TAs.
amazing demos

Dr. Shore taught an extremely difficult class with confusing material, however, I loved every part of it.  The tests were hard, but they asked questions in really different ways, rather than just relying on multiple choice.  I think most ppl didn't like being asked to think about and reinterpret the material, too much thinking involved i guess.
He is a prof that teaches tough material. I think he did a good job of it. Although his lectures totally have a lot of info, he basically tells you what will be on his exams
Dr.Shore is a great prof!!! He explains things very well and is willing to answer questions. I really liked taking his class and suggest other students take 2H03.
Dr. Shore is hard, but takes feedback and modified the test in response to feedback.  The last person clearly has sour grapes because she did not do well.  This is a fun course where you learn lots

Avoid Shore if possible. Tests are rediculously hard, esp. for a 2nd year intro course. Crams in way too much info and experiments. It all just gets lost on you. He is also rather indifferent to student feedback regarding tests and assignments. Looks like George Costanza, so at least you'll have that to laugh about... and that's about it.
OH MY GOD!!!short is HORRIBLE, and whats up w/ the tests? He is THE WORST PROF EVER!
He was way too hard. Unreasonably tough.
Good stuff!  Dr. Shore had high expectations and cares about what his students know.  I totally respect him for it.
Shore is the worst professor in all canadian universities. He should not be a teacher. He gives impossible exams. His course homepage will indicate how low the grades in his class are.

This guy is the hardest prof at McMaster. That is a guarantee. DONOT enrol in any class he teaches. You have been warned! His class average is always extremely low. He apparently went to some gifted highschool and thinks all students at McMaster are equally gifted as he was. Terrible and awful prof.

These previous comments don't know what they are talking about.  Dr. Shore gives great lectures. Interesting, engaging, and full of good demos.  His tests suck!  Way too hard.  I leared lots but almost failed the course.
Most terrible prof ever!!!

I'm glad he knew what he was talking about because I sure didn't. He raced through the material and there were no questions in class. The final exam was a head shaker and he was the worst prof I have ever had at Mac.

Tests were extremely hard. What the correct answers were supposed to be were poorly explained, therefore improvement was pretty much impossible. Experiment question on final exam was stupid and shouldn't be worth 2%. Questions were too specific and didn't allow for elaboration. I am very disappointe
Horrible prof.

Course material and lectures are really interesting. If you are willing to work hard than it is possible to do well on his tests! And there is always lots of help available from TAs that really know their stuff!
The class itself isn't too bad but the tests are very hard and he expects you to know an insane amount of information! Good lectures though and interesting demos
No Comments
worst prof at mac. Dont' believe it? Look at the grades on his course homepage
Hard stuff
Terrible

Good prof. Fun demos. Tough and LONG tests.  He's a good guy who is willing explain things if you're lost. Not my most favourite class, but of the 2 profs who split this class (him & Dr. Brooks) he was better.  Overall not too shabby.
Immature for a professor.  Unreasonable expectations.  Unwilling to compromise. Extremely passionate about his work though, which is admirable.
No Comments
I cant understand why the tests are so hard!

It's true..he is VERY smart and knows how to explain stuff so that you understand it..but I find this only when you talk to him one-on-one. His class is brutal...his multiple choice exams are mind boggling. I appreciate him making us think..but g-damn!!
Friggin hard class. Studied lots and got a 1. Good lectures.
No Comments
Demanding, but so god damn sexy!
One of the best profs I have ever had - if i had more profs like him I would be much smarter!
No Comments
Arrogant, arrogant, arrogant.
Asking us to label the axis of a graph in the test.... those axis are not just one word... they're paragraphs!...Get real guy! He's worse than Brook!
expects a lot but  willing to help, taught me lots - I love him!
he challenges students...makes you think instead of regurgitate.

condescending, rude, poor explanations...avoid this man

comments: Very hard class, exam was pretty brutal. The material was so boring, and Jopko wasn't that excited about it either. I don't think the demos worked once. Also Writes really faint. Only went to class for the clicker basically, taught myself. Highly recommend Okon, much more interesting.
I don't like this guy.if you like some enthusiastic teacher then he is not one of them.His class always boring,His demos most of the time don't work.

i had him for a mechanics. i didnt understand a thing from what he was talking about. he is almost 2000 years old. and if you say the wrong answer he will be sarcastic. his in class demonstrations are awesome though. i got a C in that class. but i tought i would fail. i only got that grade cause i did my work.
Jopko is tha man..all i gotta say..higly recomnended...he is a so funni and a veri nice proff..
No Comments
He's so cool. Its like having my grandfather teach me physics. He's so nice and actually kind of amusing some times. My fav professor by far.
No Comments

I had him during the year, and ended up dropping out. But then I had him in the summer, and he was much better. He makes easy tests, and explains well. It's Mckay who screws everyone over. He's the one that makes the hard test during the year!
Jopko is the man. most bad ratings on here are just people who are bitter because they suck at math.
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Jopko is AMAZING! I dont know what ppl are talking about. I took this course in the summer and ACED it! He told us his teaching evaluations during the year were low so he really tried his best to do better in the summer, and a prof doesnt do that unless he really cares!!! AWESOME JOB SIR!
This is the worst prof for anyone or maybe tat was jus his teachign physics that sucked. U could tell he didnt want to be there all he did was *sigh* and sounded jus monotonous.
He's Crazy... Eventhough i passed his classes.  I had him for 5 classes, can you believe it.  My luck.  Both physics classes and then 3 math classes.  What is wrong!!!
okay prof, sometimes boring or unclear
Terrible prof
No Comments
Guy makes you fall asleep. Has easy quizzes, then proceeds to**** you on the final.
Something is wrong when you get a 4 in one calculus class then in the next, and harder one, you get a 10.
Dr. Jopko teaches a good course with lots of important math to learn.  But let it be said... this course is not for the faint of heart.  Jokpo... for teaching this course this long we salute you.
maybe it's because i had a jopko overload (3 courses with him in 1 term) but I think he just regurgitated the text book.  does have a good reputation though, engineers even did a musical about him.
I rated him a 3 4 5 at the end of last semester, and want to modify what I said. :P
Parts of the course were simply too hard to understand, and it was supposed to be high school level finite!  Used overhead markers to teach.
I don't really think he is hot.  He motivates people to try harder to not turn out like him.  I find his style very effective and easy to learn from.  He's quite the funny guy.
No Comments
Brutal. Just Brutal

pay attention, take good notes in class & u'll only need the textbook to copy questions from. appreciates hard work, try to participate in class. not looking forward to the 50%worth exam covering the ENTIRE year. let's see what the next semester is like&#
Jopko is a great prof and knows his stuff very very well.  Can't wait to see what he has in store for us next term
i go to his class when i'm feeling stupid.  i say if he can do it, then it'll be a cinch for me.  lol
Hmm... probably should leave the rating until _after_ the final tomorrow.  JOPKO!  Hehe.  He's got the name you love to shout.
He's a legend.  (He even has a Santa Hog song!).  I like calculus in the first place, and I'm glad he's going to be my prof second semester too.
DO NOT GO TO CLASS...its USELESS

Had the best slumber of my life in his class. The dreams were so real. The funny thing is that i dreamed of being in class and of following it attentively. I only new i was sleeping from the laughter of my friends....

courses is ok. jopka makes it easier, tests and final is hard, but if you work alittle ull do well!>...guranteed. funny guy, his brian seems like there's nothing in there but equations. i could see the letter X on his hat.
His lecture is really easy to understand. Great examples in classes that make you dont need to look at the text at all, but quizes and assignments almost every week.
smartest man alive....the only reason i go to class is because of this guy......jopko's rule....bus rides to zone 6
pretty solid teacher.  does step-by-step examples, which are very helpful.  could lighten up on the weak jokes though.  needs to be slightly more approachable.
You better make it 2M12!  EVERYONE failed the final!!!

Amazing power of teaching. Cracks smarts jokes and well. d/dx(ln-mower).. remember? After having him in the first term, Calc. prof in the second term sounds so boring. Just attend all his lectures and you get an A. Guarantee !!
He was VERY hard to follow in lecture and I am not sure if he actually completed an example from start to finish at all during the term...
If you can manage to follow along, he's an excellent teacher...although it's not so easy to follow along.
not cool....didn't understand a THING he said...not approachable...not helpful...not even entertaining..:(
Best dressed professor yet!  If I could pull off the comb-over, I'd be sexy too!
not too tough a course
quality entertainment
Very condescending and unapproachable
Good foundation at Mac!!!
is that still the same example... what was the question
My best two years at Mac
This guy is all jokes, I go just to be entertained
No Comments
All i do is copy but his jokes are too fun
constant shaking, heavy breathing, jokes are so corny and always about food
Funny at times but a good teacher.. some jokes are really really corny, watch it
run as fast and as far as you can
An excellent teacher - very demanding, but is clear and concise - no joke
He's funny to listen to
Jopko has no business teaching with such a bitter attitude.
Just as everyone else is saying... horrible. Simply horrible...
No Comments
dont ever take this class
Very dry. I fall asleep a lot.
tests are like scratching your bum with your elbow, you just cant do it
best jokes
rediculously difficult course
bad,bad,bad
never went to his classes, but never got a grade lower then an 8, can't complain
Snore...
Just read the Plumbline...
this course should actually be called 2M12...
He should be in next episode of X-Files. (Try Eng Handbook P.44)
What the hell was with that 2nd test?!
EXTREMELY HARD EXAM!

comments: I didn't ever attend his lectures but ended up doing really well in the course. Marks easy and his exam is really easy and he pretty much doesn't change the exam from year to year so you'll be fine if you study off the old ones. Was really easy to excel in his class with minimal work. Not sure if this is other students experience but I liked him!

As a mature student, Dr. King was a breath of fresh air; He was so knowledgeable and made poetry interesting to learn about. He was very receptive to all his students, and his lectures were very interesting. He is very respected within the McMaster student body as their favorite Professor. He certainly is mine, and I look forward to taking hisclass

Dr King's lectures are boring and unclear. He rambles off a lot and talks about irrelevant topics which wastes everyones time. He is quite rude and demanding at times when asking a question he makes you seem stupid. Tough marker even for small assignments and as a second year course. I do not recommend him as his course is dry and boring.

Dr King is hands down one of my favourite profs at Mac. He is really funny during the lectures and is super easy to take notes from. He can be a bit scatterbrained and sometimes just gives plot description, but if you need help with essays or marking he is there for you.

Dr. King is one of the few profs I didn't interact much with, but I can't say he's  entirely distant. When I spoke to him about deferring my final essay after surgery, he was accommodating and he asked how I was recovering. He has a rather laid back way of speaking and teaching, but isn't boring. Nice guy, wish I'd gotten to know him better!

A distinguished professor. His level of wisdom is unsurpassable. I looked forward to every one of his lectures. Even though I finished with an unsatisfactory grade (from my point of view), his class was one of my favourites. Had I had a TA who was not overly-critical and miserable, I would have enjoyed this class even more. Overall, exquisite.

Dr. King was an excellent professor, who made lectures fun, entertaining, and easy to comprehend. He was very organized and approachable. The class isn't too difficult as long as you keep up on readings. I had a horrible TA who was very critical of writing styles, otherwise I would have had a better grade in the course.
Great Professor. I really enjoy his class, he in actually quite funny.  He is very easy to listen to and easy to follow! Love his class!
Great Prof. Easy to listen to, made it much easier to get me to go to class.

Great Prof! I have taken several of his courses because he was tacking them! He is truly passionate about his job and makes you want to read the works (which could be quite dull at the hands of another prof). I strongly recommend taking his courses and getting to know him as a person. A truly remarkable man!
Approachable and knowledgeable.  He is clear and knows what he's talking about.  Open to discussion and ideas.
He was very enjoyable to hear.  He was knowledgeable about his topics and he inspired me to learn more about the field.  I wish more English profs at Mac were like him.
Great prof.
extremely helpful

Dr. King knows what he is talking about! His 20th Century Modern British Literature Course was interesting because he was so knowledgeable, although I felt he could have cut the reading list and focused on less material to have a more comprehensive and clear understanding. Overall though, a great prof!
Dr.King is the best English prof at Mac! He is so organized and coherent, his lectures are fun to attend. He is witty and clever, very up to date with popular culture. Overall a great prof!
He is super nice, and super easy!!

Hes good...but there were better profs at MAC for english,  he was clear..but repetative the exam was easy if you read everything and went to class...my TA was a terrible the books were good and the the time he gave you to read the was fair...You hav to read the books and pat attention to small things but he points them out a lot during lecture

Heavy on student seminar presentations and a lack of actual lecturing, but he's a really nice guy when you get to know him.  He has insightful readings of the texts and is quite helpful if you see him for assistance.  I really enjoyed the texts that he chose to work with and the workload was reasonable.

The tenure system at its best: he teaches 2 courses a year, gets nearly six months off, makes $150K, has research assistants to do his work, is an atrocious scholar, never shows up to class, and, finally, is the most selfish and small-minded man I have ever had the misfortune of studying under.  "Third rate--at best," to quote his oft used phrase.

At first he can seem rather intimidating, but don't be scared!  When I was having trouble with my final paper, I approached him and he was eager to help.  A very smart, friendly, approachable prof.  Don't expect easy marks though!  He also makes you work hard on the exam, no easy rhetorical questions folks! ;)

6 weeks of unbelievably boring student presentations. he hardly lectured, and when he did he was constantly name dropping.. talking about the authors he personally knows. lectures were the biggest waste of time - didnt learn a thing. seemed like he didn't want to be there. hated this class and do not recommend taking a course with him
DISTINGUISHED PROFESSOR?? NO WAY!!!

I dreaded his lectures each week. He would cancel classes for now reason and we had 6 weeks of student presentations. Super boring. He would talk about his accomplishments in life and how much he hated mcmaster. We had maybe 10 lectures in a full year class. Its almost as if he didnt want to teach.

The pure disinterest of this professor was astonishing. He joins the club of "worst professors at McMaster." Aside from cancelling class for whole weeks at a time throughout semester, he spent the remaining time talking about his assorted accomplishments in life or arbitrarily grading papers that I don't believe he had read. Never once lectured.

I loved this class, he did not tarnish the high regard I already had for Jane Austen, which a crap prof might have done. He is a good lecturer and sticks to his schedule, and looks a bit like John Malkovich?
good pics for reading, not quite the easy marker though! very interesting and flexible, good class disscussion, and SMART
Amazing Prof! Brilliant...I would have paid to take the course just to hear him go on one of his rants. Opinionated...passionate...Best Prof I've ever had.
Awesome prof!!!

comments: Dr. Gray was one of the best professors in the department.  It is a tragedy that she is gone, but she deserved so much better than she was getting at McMaster.  She is greatly missed.
She's great if you approach her with a problem but her classes are unbearable if you struggle with memorization.  It was by far my lowest mark because of that.
One of the gems of the McMaster Classics Dept. She will be missed!

Goes too fast, with too little information. Gives her personal opinion rather than historical fact. Why make us buy a textbook you completely disagree with? Quizes you on things that aren't important. Thank god she's leaving MAC.

She is a good teacher BUT her idea of testing is to screw you. Test you on the insignifigant things to separate the knowledgeable from the anal. Instead of focusing on what will be important for future courses she makes you work for marks that are unnessesary to your degree. Good Classes, BAD tests.
HOT prof!!

Amazing professor, very easy to talk to.  She has experience in her field and makes it sooo interesting.  She never knew my name but always said hi to me, whenever she saw me on campus.  She took the time to answer questions and help gain an understanding of the material.  Don't slack off in this class and pay attention to everything she says.
horrible
You have to work hard, but the material is fascinating. She really knows her information, and is easy to talk to both in and outside of lectures. Great prof! Great person!

I think that Dr. Gray is a great teacher; it's nice to have a teacher who has real EXPERIENCE in her field.  I don't think she takes pleasure in failing people at all; she makes you work for your mark.  This ain't like high school history classes!
The BEST Prof in the entire classics department at McMaster! You definitely need to work for your grades in her classes, but she is an endless source of knowledge and an all-around great person.
Best prof I've ever had.  She cares, she's knows her****, and she makes you work for your mark.  Great prof but don't even think about slacking in her classes :)

God, the worst professor I've ever had the displeasure of "learning" from! She takes pleasure in failing people and makes no effort to make the material appealing or interesting. Dull, mean, and simply not worth the effort.
She is a good prof and knows what she is talking about.  Sure the quizzes are hard but Greek art is a rather large topic!  Cool to talk with.
she makes my life hard :( but shes an ok person

Professor Pedley? or Professor Gray? I think Pedley calls the shots. she seems to take pleasure in the misfortune of the class. could give two****s about the students. you know what? i don't care what date "you" would give a vase or a temple,just give me the right date.
it seems she gets off on making our lives more difficult...she takes pleasure in people not doing well, it seems to amuse her...

The lectures are rather rushed, almost as if she wants to show us as many slides as possible just so that she can quiz us on them. I think the quizes should test us on more than 5 slides seeing as we study over 100. It would be a better class if more time was spent on explaining slides.
she is really interesting and fun, but her quizes cover too much info that is scattered all over the web and the text. more structure would be nice
No Comments
Awesome professor. Very funny, clear and concise. I love that she doesn't make us stay till 10.
Such a good class, and so much fun. This is the best class of my day.
I loved the class! Very helpful and nice, always a joy to come to class. Enthusiastic and fun!
Excellent excellent prof! Highly motivated and super fun!
She's a good teacher, but goes kinda fast
