comments: Lovric is the GOAT. He is my favourite professor so far and honestly he cares about all 1000 of his students. I even watched his videos on youtube. I love this guy. Coming out of high school I didn't love math, but he made math interesting to learn. The content is not too difficult, show up to class and tutorials, study well and you'll do fine.

Miroslav is a legend. He is hilarious without even trying and his quirkiness is lovable. Fantastic prof and the tests were all very based on assignments and previous practise tests. Extremely easy to do well if you go to class and keep up. Miroslav is actually my favourite and he cares so much about students. He's a gem y'all!!

This is one of the best profs at Mac. Beats everyone else by a long shot. He's so kind and humble, and really cares about the students. Super easy to approach and helpful. Would take all my courses with him if I could.
simply AMzing

Amazing professor, best course I have taken so far and would recommend it to anyone- truly is the best math course that can help with real life ! Very caring and tries his very best to make sure everyone has a good enough understanding of the concepts. His attitude towards math and his professionalism is truly inspirational !
Will continue to be one of the profs at Mac that truly care about the success of the students and makes the content interesting & understandable.
Amazing professor. Would love to take another class with him.
How did it feel to hold a Koala and look like it too?
Favourite Prof at Mac so far! really nice and approachable made the concepts easier to understand would  definitely recommend taking one of his courses

Nice guy. Makes a lot of funny comments. Tries to really explain concepts. However, he all over the place during the lecture and is kind of hard to follow along. His midterms were straight from the homework assignments, which i should have done..  no wonder i failed the course.

Probably my favourite professor so far! Absolutely amazing guy! He really cares about his students and  is funny too. Easy to talk to and explains things very well and a lot of the testing was similar to the homework assignments!
He is the nicest!!he is one of the best prof in math, not like some new stupid prof this year urhh
He's amazing

Dr. Lovric is wonderful. He explains math concepts extremely well and doesn't skip steps when doing calculations. He's very approachable and doesn't make you feel stupid when you ask a question. Make sure you do all the homework assignments because very similar/the same questions will appear on the tests!

Lovric is one of the nicest, most wonderful profs I've ever had. He's easy to listen to and really tries to get the concepts across effectively. The class is pretty condensed so if you miss a lecture, you really do fall behind. I highly recommend you go to tutorials aswell, you go through a lot of examples, many similar to the ones on the midterms.
He's a really good prof. Makes the learning environment during lectures so stress free and helps so much with explaining his steps as he goes through problems.
He makes every concept so easy to understand. his test questions were similar to the homework assignments. so if you do all of them, you're most likely to do well in his class.
God amongst men.
Dr. Lovric was one of my favourite profs in first year. He's really nice and funny and he clearly cares about his students. His lectures are very clear and prepare you well for the tests.

MATH 3G03 is a great class. The assignments are tricky, but very doable and rewarding. Miroslav recognizes students will work together to solve the problems, but definitely take the time to sort out the concepts for your own benefit. The course will give you good intuition for problem solving in mathematics, especially through computer programming.
He's the best professor ever. My life is not complete without him. 3

Problem Solving was an easy course. Lovric's approach to problem solving makes learning problem solving easy. Great lecturer, learned some cool things, lots of neat tricks which were helpful in other classes. Many assignments. Both tests and the exam were take-home. There was no text book. Great class!

Another prof told me that he is the best teacher of math in the department - that is why they always put him with the first years. He is. Easily the best TEACHER of mathematics. Tests are easy. He said he tested poorly as a student, so he often gives take home tests and many assignments. Stresses heuristic and problem solving - great for math.
Very willing to help students and gives very clear explanations. Everyone loves Lovric :)

Amazing guy. Best prof I've ever had so far. He's fun and knows how to teach. Even though English is probably his second language, he can explain material a lot better than other professors whose first language is English.

Lovric is an incredible prof. His lectures are very clear and he does his best to make sure that his students understand the content. Definitely one of the best profs I've had in first year.   He is a naturally funny and adorable man who manages to maintain my attention during classes. Everyone loves Lovric. :)
One of my favourite profs in first year. His lectures are as fun as math can be and he cares for his students. He's great at explaining concepts so I found his lectures helpful.
The best prof at Mac. He explains so well and he is so caring about his students.

BEST PROFESSOR IN MAC!!! Love his lectures, he makes hard knowledge easy to understand. Tests are easier than assignments and practise test covers everything on test. His classes are REALLY worth taking.
Best professor in the school. Hands down.
BEST PROF YOU WILL EVER HAVE!
really good prof.  teaches proofs very well.  midterms are fairly lengthy, but fair.

This man is amazing. He cares sooo much about his students and he goes out of his way to make sure everyone is happy. He uses the classic overheads and it may seem a bit confusing at first however it really works well and he provides you with good and clear explanations. If I could I would switch to do a math major/thesis under him!
Awesome guy, great teacher. Do not know how anyone can dislike him
Absolutely incredible guy. So helpful, loves his subjects and genuinely cares about all his students.
Best professor at the university and it's not even close. Takes time to ensure you understand what is going on and does whatever he can to help as long as you ask. He was awesome!
Amazing Prof. Naturally funny. He knows what he is teaching. Happy that I was in his class.
Def cares for his students. Its possible to get As in his class as long as you study hard for his quizzes and tests by practicing those assignments.
Probably the best math prof in the university.

Lovric was a very good prof. Although most of the material was high school review, he made the class very interesting to attend. His tests were very reasonable and he cares for the students. This class is an easy 12 if you did well in high school Calculus.
Best prof at Mac!!! He makes the hard stuff look doable. Hoping he teaches higher level math courses!! :D

he is probably the best professor  at mcmaster university, the best i ever had, he makes difficult thing easier to understand; you can tell he loves what he does and really wants the student to understand and like his class;  he will always be open for questions... he will ask you for feedback

He is a good prof, but quite overrated.  Sometimes he fails to communicate important information that would greatly help student understanding.  Very informal teaching style, but very learnable.  Funny prof; tests and quizzes are difficult, but the assignments really help.  If you don't spend a lot of time studying/practicing, you may

Definately recommended! Notes are clear and concise, with lots of relevant examples. Very friendly and helpful during extra-help sessions. Didn't used to textbook that much, but still good for review. Overall, excellent professor! Take his class if you get the chance!
Absolutely incredible prof. Very clear, organized helpful and actually cares about his students and wants them to do well. Best prof I have had so far.
One of the better professors I have had thus far.  Very clear with his explanations, and very thorough with concepts.  A good sense of humour as well.

Best professor/teacher I have ever had in my entire life. Having him made me consider majoring in math just so I could have him again. Genuinely cares about his students and is amazing at explaining difficult concepts. He made me see math in a new light. You are so lucky if you get this professor!!!!
Definitely one of my favourite professors. So glad I had him for this class! He is the cutest man ever, and so unintentionally hilarious. The tests and exam seemed fair. TAKE HIS CLASS!!
Deserves to win professor of the year. AMAZING TEACHING STYLE.
My favorite professor so far. Very clear and concise, uses overhead notes unlike most profs who use power-points. Fairly easy course, tests accurately resemble homework assignments.

Dr. Lovric is an outstanding and brilliant math teacher. He goes through problems one step at a time which really helps everyone understand. By far my best prof for first year. You will be so lucky if you get him!!

consider yourself blessed if you get lovric as your prof. the way he uses overheads instead of powerpoints means that he can work through questions with the class. you can follow along as he explains and does the problems. he is very clear and very good at explaining concepts. he is also very funny (even through he doesn't try to be!) AMAZING!
What a boss... lectures are well detailed, clear, and concise. Is there anything more you want?
Amazing professor
There isn't anyone who doesn't like Lovric. Clear, funny, and knows his stuff

Lovric was probably one of my favourite first year profs. Although the accent did take a while to get used to, by the end I loved it! He's funny and good at what he does. If you pay attention in class and actually study for tests you'll do really well! :)
He doesn't try to be funny...he just is! Does a very good job in explaining concepts.
cutest man ever!
Great professor

I had him for 2X and 2XX I loved this prof. I nominate him to become the future president of McMaster University. Most intelligent man I have ever seen. His love for calculus is infectious and it rubs on students. Very easy to do well in his courses. Just do all the homework and understand every one of the examples in his text. Study. Guaranteed A-
He is the only teacher I've had that has explained math in a way that made sense to me.  He's a fantastic prof -- enrol in his section for sure!

Dr. Lovric did a great job in both lectures and tutorials. Reflecting on previous comments, I imagine that supervising a graduate course of 10 students would require less expertise than organizing a large first year class where you must recognize and reconcile differences in backgrounds and deliver a course even non-math majors will find valuable.

Unbelievable Prof. He was so amazing. He has this aura and his voice is so so sexy! Love his accent. His tests and exams are totally fair and no surprises. Just do all the practice questions that he assigns and understand them carefully, and you will have no problem getting atleast A- in his course. Sometimes the final can be a little long though.
GREAT
he is an awesome prof who really gets the concepts through to the class.
He is a great prof, and hilarious too!
Min-Oo is the man. He taught every prof in the math department what he or she knows today, especially Dr Lovric. I really hope Dr Lovric appreciates the man they call Min-Oo.

I agree with most of the previous comments. Dr. Lovric is a good man, but from a fairness perspective, I have to be honest and say Maung Minoo is far more knowledgeable. Lovric is here at Mac today because of Minoo. Lovric should consider Minoo to be his mentor and develop a more live and spontaneous teaching style the way Minoo does it.

The textbook Lovric wrote for vector calculus is very bad. It has poor examples. Dr. Minoo is not using the textbook Lovric wrote for Math2X03 because he knows what is better for students. Minoo deserves to get all the hot girls going after him. Girls are wrong in liking Lovric. Minoo is far better looking and has better personality then Lovric.

Fairly good prof but not as great as Dr. minoo. He should consider minoo as his role model and hone his teaching skills by following minoo's teaching style. He is not as great a mathematician as minoo is.

Amazing professor. I agree with the previous comments. He teaches very difficult courses. Some of the most challenging courses are taught by Professor Lovric, so he deserves all the prestige and awards that he receives. His courses like Math 1LS3 are more difficult then Real Analysis or Partial Differential Equations. I got A+ from him twice.

Such a great professor. He really knows his stuff inside out and can solve any math problem you throw at him, on the spot. He is a serious mathematician. He teaches some of the most difficult/challenging courses at McMaster (like math 1LS3, Math 2X03, Math 1A03) These courses are for very high I.Q students. He has very busy schedule. Amazing prof.
wowowow amazing prof. he was my life!

If you want to open the doors to your future, take a course taught by this professor. If you want to permanently lock the doors to your future, take Chris McLean's courses. You will know the difference. This prof is quiet fair. He had a really nasty TA once upon a time, but generally speaking his exams are similar to practice problems in the book.

Excellent professor. He can answer any first year calculus question, but beyond that he gets into trouble. However, he is very caring. He will cuddle girls whenever they are stressed. Tries to make them feel comfortable around him. That really helps.
No Comments

Lectures are interesting and concepts are clearly explained with excellent examples. Prof is helpful, thoughtful, and puts alot of effort into the course. Alot of ridiculous, immature comments here with zero relativity to the effectiveness as this professor as an instructor.

he was a great prof, funny too!

comments: Honestly, avoid this professor like the plague. His lectures contain no information of value, nor do any of his thought processes when speaking to him about course work.  He is incapable of replying to emails, and does not mark assignments until the last day of term, which is unbelievable considering later assignments are based on previous ones.
Helpful and wants to see students succeed. Can come off 'rude' at times but its his humour. If you can take criticism you'll be fine. Good guy and overal a pretty good prof.

Wonderful and friendly professor. No idea why people say he's pretentious--he's probably the nicest professor in the department! Is slow at marking, but that's really not the worst quality in the world.
Our class was small, about 40 students. He was great. I enjoyed the class.

Gives interesting lectures and knows his material inside out. He's a fair marker, though be warned he can take a while to return grades, and can also take a while to respond to emails. He's laid back, funny, and knowledgeable.

Completely pretentious, does not hide the fact that he does not care about teaching.  Consistently rags on people about the usefulness of their projects when in reality, he researches video games.  Horrible at replying to emails and takes over a month to give grades back on simple assignments.
very smart, totally pretentious, rude..what else is there to say?

I agree, it is important to be on his good side.  He can be very funny and nice but, at times, he can be very rude and unhelpful. He's much nicer in front of the class than he is one-on-one, which is odd.  He is a smart guy though.  You will gain important information in his class.
No Comments

awesome prof!!! he is fun, funny, AND interesting!  The nicest prof at MAC. you can tell he's a real family guy, and also totally devoted to teaching and getting people to actually discuss interesting issues in class. way to go red beard!
Seems to be easily annoyed with students and once you're on that bad side, you're there for good. Can be considered funny or pretentious, take your pick. Not advised.

Watch out about the favorites thing...you don't want to be on the wrong side!  He is a little slow with replying to emails and meetings...so be paitent.  But keep on him.  Otherwise...he is a good guy.

Watch OUT..IF HE DOESNT LIKE U THEN U ARE OUT!!!  Clear and precise with ideas, lectures, and presentations...infact impressive with explanation of his course material...clever when makes a mistake.  Definitely an asset

comments: Professor Sorge is a great lecturer, both passionate and informative. I only regret that I did not take his class in the first year. So if you are ready to transform from ordinary into extraordinary students - this course is a MUST.

The professor is great, yes, a little self-absorbed at times, likes to make jokes, very knowledgeable in his field of interest, hard marker and tough on exams, very good looking though! He's kind of hit or miss with people, you either like him or dont like him at all. I liked his class.

Overall he is a nice guy, will help you if you need it. But when it comes to the exam, it might be tricky. Although it is a take home exam the questions need a lot of though possessing, readings are an essential. There is a ethnography at the end of the course that is just too much work, along side an exam.
Dr Sorge is one of the best profs i have ever had a class with thus far; his lectures are always extremely interesting, and his exams/assignments/essays/midterms are always fair

Makes innapropropriate jokes during lecture and is very self-absorbed. Took this class a while back and never got on here-lone behold everyone's in agreement. Takes off huge chunks of your grade for late submissions, nice enough until it comes time for exams which he is completely unhelpful for. Don't take a class with this guy.
Excellent, passionate and accessible prof. He taught me an upper level course in my undergrad and I would recommend him to anyone.

Not a good prof, a very unfair exam and very egocentric and self-involved. Not helpful and bases examinations off of very small and insignificant details from the textbook. I do not recommend taking a class with him.

Avoid this prof if you can because although there may be worse profs out there he is not worth your time. He acted like he didn't even want to be there half the time and made things really awkward at times. His research was not interesting to hear about, overall I was just disappointed with the course.

I must shamefully admit I did not attend a single lecture, nor read the textbook at all.  I managed an A- in the course, of which the main assignment was to write a mock-ethnography while citing key-points from the course text.  98% without even owning the course text:)  His tests are straight-forward and I only skimmed notes from other people.

Really great prof, very sympathetic if you need assistance and a good speaker in class. I learned a lot, and the course was challenging, but the grade you got reflected the effort you put in. Recommended.
The lectures cover some material that would be on exams...but the professor is a nice guy, helpful and instead of lecturing, in a way talks to you

Sardinia. Seriously, that's the only thing I learned from these lectures. The textbook is heavily relied upon for exams rather than lectures, and his habit of near-constantly bringing up his own research --you guessed it, Sardinia-- makes me reluctant to attend class. He does, however, seem committed to research and is great at answering questions.
Has a sense of humour, answers any questions you have and crammed a lot of learning into 50 minutes a lecture without it being even slightly confusing.
Amazing prof! Loved lectures and he is easy going, very helpful and pretty funny!  Not arrogant at all and doesn't make you feel beneath him as a student! He loves what he does and it's clear to see!

Excellent prof! Its rare to find a prof who has a good sense of humor, gives informative and interesting lectures, and definitely has a passion for the field. A bonus--he's good looking. Like any other course, attend lectures, review lecture slides, pay close attention to textbook material, and you will do fine on the exam.

such a boring prof, it was hard to pay attention in his lectures b/c he tends to go off topic. Just make sure you read the readings before lectures,b/c his midterm and exam cover very specific points from the text book.  exam was hard and his slides are not good, when studying u need to study from the txtbk, only a few slides are useful for exam.

Really great prof untill exam time, doesnt to exam review, and many questions on the exam where very minor details from the text book, if you take his class make sure you pay attention to the minor details. majority of q's were from txt book, exam was very hard.

AMAZING Prof! Professor Sorge is a very good lecturer and covers very interesting material in his class. He is very well informed and knowledgeable. Very nice to his students, and also funny. I learned A LOT of things from Anthro 1AB3, and highly recommend this course to anyone who's considering taking it.

Just terrible! Seems very disorganized, self conscience, and unsure of himself. Does not communicate well to the class, or one on one with students. Class readings were to be posted on student portal, he never posted them. They were listed on syllabus with incomplete bibliographical info making it hard to locate articles.
So funny and extremely good looking. But seriously a great teacher who is very passionate

Sorge is a good prof who is quite passionate about his work. He can be quite funny at times but tends to go on unrelated rants. The material in this course was easy to grasp and the tests/assignment were very fair. As long as you read the text book and know definitions you will do quite well in this class.

Sorge is a committed scholar by all appearances, goes out of his way to help students, and brings A LOT of material to lectures (all of it interesting as he has traveled widely and has lots of cool stories to tell). This is not a bird course, but he wants students to do well and is eager to help. I will take more courses from him, most def.

Although he can be boring to listen to, he does crack the occasional joke and he's a bit of a cutie which doesn't hurt. He taught directly from the textbook, and I managed to get amazing marks on the tests/assignment while generally only going to one of the lectures a week, but I read the textbook and took good notes.

comments: She is a very nice person but her lectures are pretty difficult to follow since she speaks slowly but she posts the slides on-line so I hope this might help you.

Her lectures are great and the course is arranged without any surprises. That being said, philosophy in academic terms is not a particularly easy subject, so the amount of work required varies by student. This prof is engaging and the course isn't difficult. Less stressful than other courses in the department but you'll still learn something.

Her humour gets funny by the second semester, but it takes awhile for it to catch on.  You can avoid doing the readings because her lectures get you all the material, but you should do them anyways if you want to do philosophy.  Extremely friendly and honest if you go to her and talk to her.

I really enjoyed her class; most people in my section felt she was unclear but I disagreed. I found her to be very clear and able to simplify complicated ideas in such a way that the content could be understood more throughouly with little room for personal error. She always made me laugh or smile at least once which made coming to class fun.
She was very understanding and would often give extensions for papers. Her lectures were a little unclear but you could tell that she's really passionate about the topic and that she knows her stuff.

What many call tangents are actually necessary interludes in a liberal arts education. Going to class just to systematically take notes and get grades for a specific endjob has nothing to do with growing intellectually. Dr. Sassen is the best prof I have ever had, hands down, and her classes are also not at all hard if you care about doing well.
Her coverage was extensive but did not focus on the important facts. Her tangents while funny, were a bit distracting. She a bit of an odd duck but very approachable.
They need to stop letting her teach mandatory courses. I learn nothing in any of her classes, she interprets many things wrongly, and she's just annoying.

She seems to simply regurgitate what the studied philosophers are saying. This turned what is an interesting topic when read from the book into a boring, frustrating topic when I heard it from her. I don't know why. Granted, I ended up not going to class nearly at all, and this could have ruined my perception of her further.

Horrible lecturer. Does not deliver information clearly. Couldn't get the class engaged for tutorial classes. Not helpful and rude. Makes it obvious that she doesnt care about teaching as the syllabus was missing crucial information and was obviously done last minute. Needs to take lecture more seriously. Shouldn't be allowed to teach at this level

It's so difficult to take notes in her class because of how often she goes off on a tangent. She doesn't complete a full thought, and tries a little too hard to be funny, but no one laughs, so it's just awkward. I wish she would just get her thoughts together before class.
This teacher knows her stuff.  Very perceptive and funny too.

Very nice, gets excited about the topic, but can trail off into incomprehensible and VERY SILLY/STRANGE topics, like the intricate details of a bicycle or how much she likes cold plums. Weird lady. If you can put up with that she's fine... We read The Metamorphosis and she wouldn't shut up about how creepy-crawly bugs are. Must have a tolerance.

Nice Prof, but very slow and very confusing. Also is not well prepared, lectures were very monotonous and being an 8:30 class, lack of attendance was evident. Marking is very fair in this course, somewhat discouraged me from philosophy as a major.
worst prof I've ever had. TERRIBLE lecturer. tries to be funny but is not. doesn't take class seriously, unprofessional
lectures are useless, any info you need is posted online.  also, careless erros on slides and admits those erros are from having prepared the slides just before class
i love her accent. she is a nice prof and kind of funny. interesting course.
Good readings; good lecturer if you're listening...sometimes you think 'she's confused' and you realize later 'oh, i was the one who was confused'...if you know the subject, she makes sense.
Scattered and full of tangents that take up all the lecture time...
Sassen is smart and totally sweet

Her lectures are completely scattered. She will say one thing, completely contradict it and then contradict that. Material is presented in an unstructured, unclear way. Tries to be funny but isnt. This class has removed my interest in philsophy.
I pity all those whose duty it is to assume Dr. Sam Ajzenstat's courses; the immortal Ajzenstat taught Kant and Hegel for years at Mac.
No Comments
seems like a nice person, but scatterbrained and repeats herself far too often. tries too hard to be funny

Great Prof, clear lectures, entertaining at times, and humorous, and very interested in the material, which is always a good thing. I just wish the class wasnt so early!! Kant is hard to digest at 9.30am
Excellent teacher, lots of fun, very considerate
very reasonable marker, extremely nice, sometimes her lectures could be more clear, but overall a good prof!

comments: She is supposedly open to feedback to her teaching style, however whenever feedback is given she goes 'So a few students said this and this, however i'm not changing anything'
This course was OK, prof was OK, tests were OK, it was all just OK

She has no belief in students knowledge and abilities, some people might actually know something. However, she treats everybody as if they are elementary students and she loves to indicate a lot of her personal stories during the lectures which are very useless and makes u feel stupid about yourself. The harder you try the lower your marks will be

literally tells you exactly what to do in order to get an A in this course... people who rate her badly have obviously not put in the work. Although I will say that the report is terrible- should count for less of your mark.
Dry mat but what you'd expect from intro course. Cossa is picky but exams are easy compared to other courses.

Wants to see her students do poorly. Interrupted every lecture i attended just to call someone out and make them look bad in front of the class. Tests are so vague that you could know the topics and still get them wrong. The 1E03 report is an excuse to lower your mark in the class.

reads off the powerpoint and cannot effectively teach a class, constantly takes marks off for not attending tutorials and expects us to use MSAFs for tutorials we cannot attend. THIS LADY IS WILLLLLLLLLDDDDDDDD.
Follow the instructions and attend class, it's pretty easy stuff, if not all that exciting

Rita Cossa managed to take a rather simple course (content wise) and made it impossible to master. The group assignment for example is a nightmare not for the content but format error prone it is. "Deduction" is a word you will here alot as you don't gave marks but only loose them in assignments. The midterm and exam are fair outwise

The course content itself is light, a lot of it is common sense (i.e. Business terms and concepts) but you my friend, you're in Rita Cossa's class! The 10% report is absolutely brutal and unnecessarily toughly graded.  She started the semester off by praising herself and her abilities in school, if the annoying teacher's pet became a prof, its her.

I love her. I have so much respect for her as a person and as a professional. I was scared to take the course with her because of my experience in 1E03, but I now realize that what she does in that course teaches attention to detail and following instructions.

One of the worst teachers and courses I have taken in my academic career. I have learned nothing from her. The course should be called how to write citations and not Business Environment. It has done nothing for me accept add stress and useless assignments to my already heavy workload.

I dont get how people are saying her lectures are "well structured" when she spends half the class talking about student feedback, why shes choosing to ignore it, and then reads directly off the slides for rest. She claims that she cares but she never accepts feedback. Guys dont get fooled. Needless to say, loads of work on useless material.

To be fair, Cossa does have really well structured lectures but she is incredibly nit-picky about things. Most of the tutorial work is worth nothing but if you don't do it, you get deductions. If you don't wear the proper attire for presentations (even if just 1 article is off), deductions. Still not really sure what the course is about. Good luck.
"1% deduction"

Rita is very personable and you can see that she genuinely cares about students and their performance. She gives everyone enough opportunities to earn maximum marks and marks very fairly. She is very knowledgable, therefore her lectures are very well structured and easy to follow along.
Great prof, very easy to talk to and she gives great explanations and examples during lectures.
My favourite teacher so far. Midterms (mc) are extremely fair, the material is all from lecture content. Obvious she cares about her students and their success in university.

I personally love her teaching style. Even if she is strict, she still cares about her students and you can clearly see that when you ask for her help. The only reason this class can be considered "hard" is if you do not do the required textbook (and PowerPoint) readings or hate group work. If you work hard, you are bound to get good grades. ^^
Tough - no surprises there but was a big help when it mattered most!

The course and her are both useless. All this course teaches is stuff us commerce students already knew from taking other business courses except its 100 times more broad. They should have just called this class, how to write a report and fail due to citation errors.

She is an amazing professor, her class is very hard, but hey, we come to university to learn - not to mess around. I really respect her as an educator because she makes you learn your stuff, and thats what professors should do.
Not as hard as some suggest - pretty accommodating if you get into a jam
- Tutorials are useless but mandatory - "Power points" are terrible. ( not in point form) - Make sure you get a good group - Projects are not well explained  - Too much emphasis on citation
She does not care about her students. She says she is there for you but i could have a long debate about that. Not inspirational or motivating what so ever, and is frankly not likeable.

Tough grader, focuses on little details on assignment so watch out. Has a very unlikeable personality and atmosphere to her. Makes people uneasy in lectures when they have laptops by hovering around them like she's some sort of distraction vigilante. I really disliked her.

I had Rita Cossa in first year for 1E03, the content is boring but midterm/final exam were fair. However, her assignments focuses mainly on formatting rather than content. As a lecturer she is rude, I was using my laptop and transitioning from another courses notes to her notes through the university website and she asked me to get off my laptop.
Still don't know what the course is really about
Not bad. Do your work, read the textbook, and the tests aren't too bad.

Not a easy marker, don't expect easy tests/quiz/exams neither, lectures are just reading her ppt, need to read your textbook. However she is really helpful when you encountered with problems, she would more than happy to help you. Overall, not  too bad
Hardest Marker ever. Expect no greater than 70 on the first group assignments
Not rocket science, if not the most exciting course.

I took this class in the Fall of 2013. It is true that she is the devil, but I am very grateful to have endured this class. Formatting a paper properly is what this class is essentially all about, which is where stupid marks can be lost in future classes. Although you hate your life while in the course, you secretly thank Cossa in future courses.

you are better or just reading the text book all year as she tests on nothing from her lectures. she also expects you to memorize all details of the textbook and test on thing like which of these is most correct
The group report is a killer, tests are based on memorization and easy to get a good mark in if you read and study the textbook.
she aight
Great prof very realistic
Sorry but this professor was one of the hardest graders I've ever had. Be ready to study your butt off in order to achieve a B... A's are extremely rare on her assignments.
make sure you pick a good group to do good
Proof read your work just as long as it takes to do the work. You can fail assignments by losing a mark for every little detail out of place.

Rita's expectations are completely realistic for a university course. She is by no means a difficult prof to have but you need to be putting in a good amount of effort to do well. You won't be able to slack off in her class but it's university after all! Rita is really good with helping students with the transition into university level courses.

She knows what she's talking about. Not horribly boring, you can tell she really loves her job. If you're thinking about passing the course without the textbook- good luck! She likes to pick specific, unimportant bits from the text to be tested on. Honestly, textbook  lecture slides.

READ READ READ! basically 34 of what she tests you on is from the textbook. her powerpoint is vague and her lectures are such a bore. she takes 1 mark off for every mistake you make in the report (which is funny because the textbook has spelling mistakes too; -1 mark cossa). Her midtermsexams are tough but is willing to go over it with you.
If you're taking this course as an elective: GET OUT If you're taking this course because it's required: JUST PULL THROUGH I pray for you

Rita is a very organized professor who's extremely passionate about her job. At the same time,  her test questions are often overly detailed which make them difficult to answer. Definitely read the textbook as she write her MC midterms  exam based on key terms and concepts in the book. The group report is a killer, make sure to edit it well.

Rita is very passionate about her job . She preps you very well for her exams as well. Pick a good group for your group project! Overall, she is probably one of the most helpful profs at Mac. She really wants her students to succeed and is there for help when needed! The content is not hard, there is just a lot of it. She also writes the textbook
Good class. Bunk prof

Professor Cossa was easily one of my favorite professors in my 1st year at McMaster. She is both passionate about the course material and genuinely wants to see her students succeed. Also, her tests are quite fair. The difficult parts of this course involved the group projects (but they are worth little overall). Hint: read the textbook!

A lot of people get scared of Cossa because of this class. First of all, she is a super nice person. With relation to the class, if you do your work, read the textbook, and attend the class, you will succeed with a good mark. Yes, she demands a lot, but this is University.

As a first year, I found this class to be extremely demanding and time consuming in comparison with my other courses. At times, she can be demotivating and condescending during lecture therefore leading to my lack of interest in attending class. Reports are graded harshly and only focus on formatting which is the least important component

Many people do not like her because she is very demanding and expects a lot from her students. I thought she was a very good professor. The class requires a lot of effort and work, but she is very clear of her expectations and you must put in the work to succeed. Reading textbook is a must,she wrote it. Id take one of her classes again in future.
Ridiculously picky marker. Her multiple choice tests questions were confusing. The class average for our first group project was 34%. Do not recommend this prof.
she scares me
Boring videos, too much expectation, fail to build connection with students by playing random and noisy music at the beginning of the class which makes the class horrible from the start. ;(
not good at all. Making me hate this course.

Was my first year, first term and she made me terrified for rest of university...she is very particular and the reports and assignments are hard.. with a bad group you can tank them like I did until doing all work myself, exam was easier if you studied hard for midterms, she was OKAY at best felt she had unreal expectations from first year students

1. purchase the textbook. 2. If you go to class and read the textbook you will easily do well on the exams, they are very fair. 3. The group report and company overview are hard to do well on with the little details but they arent worth much and they teach you a lot. 4. Rita is the greatest prof you will ever have and I luv her <3

This was my second course with her. Unfortunately for me no other prof was available. One thing is for sure and it doesn't matter how hard you work on projects, she will always find some stupid reason to cut marks. Extremely demotivating!

Rita Cossa tries to teach 1st year students who are straight of high school a lesson; that you cannot skim by in this program and you'll have to work to get those As you got in high school. Reports and tests are hard but she is more than willing to help struggling students. People tend to dislike the business class, not her.
Worst professor at Mcmaster. Unrealistic expectations of groups, especially when she makes a lot of mistakes herself.
Was expecting it would be brutal, but Cossa was easier than expected. Anyone who can't do OK in this course should probably consider another line of work.

With preparation it's NOT hard to do well in this class.MEET with Cossa before you hand in your reports i guarantee she will be more than willing  to help clarify things that will help you do better.I got a 57 on team contract and 63 on report but still managed to get 10 in the course. You study and memorize in detail the textbook. ATTEND LECTURE

Cossa was my favourtie first year professor. People are scared of her because she is to the point and makes you work hard. Read the textbook, go to class and work hard on your report and there is no reason you should get a bad mark. If you read the textbook and go to class, you shouldn't have a problem getting a good mark on her midterms.

she teaches stuff that is not even relevant to the course, her midterms were tough, the group report was brutal! i advice you to arrange meetings with her. she is so over herself. worse prof at mac! shes not one bit considerate or one bit understanding.i dropped her class after studying for her midterm for 5 days and failed. soo good luck!

Not a good professor. I know she is trying to teach a lesson but when students are trying their hardest and still failing her reports for pointless reasons there is an obvious problem. Then in 4th year you can clearly see when every other proffs cores are full and hers arent. poor people stuck with her. luckily i escaped

Very unrealistic expectations for group projects, you are guaranteed a low mark no matter how well you do it. Her tests are fair but her lectures are very boring and she can be quite pretentious. Midterms and exam is heavily definition based.
Loved her class, very interesting.
Horrible Proff made me dislike, a subject i really liked and was interested in. Avoid her if at all possible.

I am disappointed that so many students feel so negatively about Cossa. She is one of the most influential profs a Commerce student will ever be taught by. Sure the reports are hard but they teach one thing that is critical in life "detail". Her lectures are spot on and even interesting to watch. If you find her intimidating, toughen up.
I've never had a teacher, instructor or professor that I disliked as much as this professor.
Made me want to continue in Commerce. She is the only one that teaches because she like to and not one of those programmed dull profs that just want the day to end fast

second year report easier than first, lectures kinda useless if someone can give you the blanks unless you're watching a video or etc. Reports are hard if you can't follow instructions to the letter. Midterms and finals are easy if you memorize notes. Not as bad as everyone makes her seem. An overall helpful and fair prof.
She can be very helpful but is extremely strict and authoritative.
Not a fan
one of the best profs in business.. yeah the reports are hard to do well in ..but not impossible... the tests  are fair i love her testss.. none of the ALL OF THE ABOVE/NONE OF THE ABOVE CRAP!

aah! She has some seriously unrealistic expectations. The report-no matter how hard you try, you WILL do horrible (POSSIBLY FAIL IT). Midterms were okay, and the exam was VERY FAIR.. that's where you're going to get your marks from (also, the presentation). memorize the textbook and her notes, and stay on top of ur work! COSSA MAKES LIFE MISERABLE!
Not bad but talks a bit quick.

I heard a bunch of bad stuff about her. In the end, I came to the conclusion that she is a VERY fair prof. Just do what she asks for the report and you will get a decent mark, even though a lot of people failed (most likely b/c the did it the day before). Her mid-term tests and exams were very fair and overall she is a good teacher.

Her teaching style is great! You don't HAVE to show up but you really should. When it comes to the report in first year, spend minimal time on it, even if you pour your heart and soul into it, you WILL fail. But do well on the presentation. Study hard for the mid terms and exam, that's where the marks come from!
One of the better profs in the business program
You know what she wants from you. It's your job to do it.

Rita thinks she knows the real world despite teaching the last 10. She is a good proff in the sense she will help you with the expectations necessary for writing reports in commerce. Study from the iStudy questions some a repeated all tests are straight from the textbook.
She's a little bit on the stern side, but teaches clearly and efficiently. Expectations from the class are ludicrously high, though.

She tells you her unrealistic expectations from day 1 so there are no surprises later. Her midterms and exam are not that bad but you really have to study for them and memorize a lot. The report is killer.

Fall08: Classes were sort of interesting. Reports: tough to pass if u don't have a hard working group. Expects you to memorize the textbook and powerpoints. MCQ based exams + limited time = low grade.

Memorize the textbook and her lectures and you will do fine in the course. Also, most of her questions appear to be on iStudy, so use that to study as well. She is a hard marker in the reports, but it helps you in the end when you go into 3rd/4th year.

I never asked Cossa for help because she gives clear notes, instructions and expectations. She gives interesting lectures and once in a while, she'll make you laugh. Her tests are easy as long as you study from the text and her notes. Reports are really easy compared to previous years (no negative marks, small emphasis on format).
most arrogant proff. thinks the world revolves around her, lucky the students who dont have her next year!!
i dunno
She is a great teacher!
such an annoying professor!!! She is needs to get off her high horse! She is one of the worst business profs I've ever had!
Her reports are hard, but if you study the textbook, you'll do fine. She's one of my favourite professors. I wish all professors were that clear in what they expected.

Cossa is amazing, don't listen to anyone that tells you otherwise. No other prof spells out EXACTLY what she wants for full grades. Memorize the textbook, and you will ace the exams. Find a good group, and you will ace the reports. It worked in 1E03, and it works again here. McMcaster needs more profs like her. A 12 in her course is very possible.

She is very clear with what she wants. She teachs everything thoroughly. Sure she uses the textbook a lot, and marks pretty hard.. but come on, she askss you exactly what she wants... so what do you expect. its freaking university not college. :P
prof will take off points for the spelling/formate error and you could ended up getting zero for the major project/assignment
a word of advice for a A+: MEMORIZE THE ENTIRE TEXTBOOK!! even if you fail the report/proposal because of bad partners, being more familiar than her with the textbook will save your grade

Took her course 2 years ago, and hated every minute of it. But seriously, go into her class with an open mind and don't listen to all the negative comments. Sure, her reports are killer, but when you get to 3rd/4th year you realize that they her reports are VERY valuable and wish more profs gave such clear guidelines. SHE'S GREAT!

The assignments got better than first year/ but the group assignments can still cause a bad mark if you get stuck with idiots in your group. Go to class/listen to lectures/review material/ READ THE TEXT. Lots of qu's are taken from textbook and she knows it by heart cause she wrote it.

one of my worst experiences in first year. Her tests are fair if you study but the report is what really screws you over! i personally think this course was a bit hard to be a first year course all thanks to proffessor COSA so good luck all first years!

Everytime i tell someone about this prof/class they think her class and expectations are ridiculous. These are people who have been through university themselves too! There are some nice, and useful parts. Work hard, and you'll still do fine, it just won't be very much fun.
hard professor, especially the first year report where people get negative numbers below zero on it. tests are fair though if you study, its straight from the textbook
blah
She's on a major power trip.  She needs to stop over using her authority, and demeaning students by making them feel worthless with her pointless nitpicking on minor formatting errors.

The course is challenging, namely the report/proposal, but as long as you study hard, you will still end up with a 10/11/12.  Doing badly in the course means that a) you had a horrible group for the report/proposal or b) you're just not the greatest at business, which means you get an early wake-up call to study harder.
Challenging, but very helpful
She's a crazy ass teacher who is very strict! Even though i got a high mark from her first proposal, she's really tough! Have fun first year students next year
brutal teacher

Her exams questions for the most part lack clarity. She has an aloof marking scheme for the report, and ambiguous expectations for its contents as seemingly fitting research results in a zero mark. And, she punishes those who do not attend class by not including 90% of video lectures to those who miss a class, and the slides are riddled with blanks
all the good comments stated about her was probably from her!
im pretty sure she doesn't have a phd and is still teaching as a normal prof...someone should book her for plagiarizing the text

get a life!!! sits in her office, trying to kick as my people out of commerce as possible but spending at least 2 hours on every report, to see if its sentences matched with any from previous years...GET A LIFE and leave people alone!!!!
at least 24 hours working on a project to get a negative mark..... her grading scheme is terrible and her tests are basically trivia from the textbook and 0 on application.

I had her about five years ago. Her expectations are legitimate, just not in a first year course. She needs to give students an adjustment period. Her style should be saved for a fourth year or graduate course when the maturity level has improved. I hope she reads this and takes note.

She is the most difficult and irritating professor I have ever had, and I'm in engineering! Her obsessiveness when it comes to formatting in assignments is insane (Be prepared to receive a NEGATIVE percentage). While her course is supposed to be just a 2nd-year intro to marketing, she mixes too many upper-year requirements. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS.

The thing that most people complain about is the lethal formatting which is decisively killer. Honestly though, if you studied hard for the tests and are able to apply the knowledge, then you should do fine, regardless of your report mark with the formatting marking scheme from the abyss. The lectures made sense and the tests were doable.
Wow, cossa almost won prof of the year...did h e ll freeze over

Lectures are okay, but marking is horrible. Focuses 10% on quality of work, and 90% on the formatting. You can write a excellent paper, but if you use commas instead of periods in your citation you fail. This nit-picking marking made the class incredibly frustrating and time consuming. Her expectations are clear, but  foolish.

great prof. u actully learn from her class. and can see urself apply it in the real job field. her instruction n expectations are clear. who ever doesnt do well in her class obviously doenst pay attention. she is very kind and helpful.

Arrr!!! A very frusterating class indeed.  You work your ass of for formatting and it still doesn't matter because you'll get a zero on it anyway.  Might as well make report all in Times New Roman size 36 and underlined with single spacing.  Other than that the class wasn't terrible.

tests as you useless questions, useless questions and useless facts. Who cares about statistics....Rita Cossa thats who...should give marks for doing good and not taking away if not attain expectations (sometimes too high)

Very limited. Cossa encourages work, but not understanding or initiative. Course in general not really very good. Many innacurate, misleading, or just plain useless points/aspects of the course. The textbook she co-wrote for it is also mediocre - far too much filler in it.
Her marking system is way off. You're supposed to give marks for doing a good job, not take all of them away for one mistake.

Terrible prof. Does not understand even the simplest economic theories, teaching them wrong. Exams rediculously easy, and have nothing to do with course (anyone with common sense could pass) I am now dumber for taking this course.

I liked the course and prof. cossa.  She spends a lot of time with students and she is interesting to listen to.  You need to get to tutorials on time.  Too bad there are students that don't pull their own weight in the report.

Cossa is terrible. She rewards people for QUANTITY over QUALITY.. very degrading and condescending person as well. If you want a good mark, make everything up, seriously. They dont even mark you on content.. She also just reads things right off of her slides, anyone can do that haha.

A professor that has a reputation of being biased towards engineering students.  She also does not tell you how she marks, the idea is that she cannot repeat her frame of mind.  This is ridiculuous, it makes an inconsistant marking system.  Horrible prof.

Project is hard, but I got like 50% on it and still manged a 10 in the class through her easy M/C tests and exam. The non-cumulative exam is a huge plus. Just study her course notes, and do any extra credit stuff. 2% bonus probably bumped me to an A.
First year stories about her are not true. Stay ahead on your project and you'll be fine.  Don't even have to go to class.

Rita is extremely helpful and she spends a lot of time with her students.  Those who don't do well are not following instructions and are spending more time complaining than doing the work.  This is university, not high school.

Rita's well organized, is willing to meet with students to help and does not believe in cumulative finals, which is a definite plus. However, she is extremely anal when it comes to marking assignments and her expectations are often unrealistic.

comments: Dr. Grellette is the best prof, he is ridiculously smart and it is so obvious he knows what he's talking about. He makes lectures really interesting and its a comfortable environment for everyone. The exam is on anything that was covered in lectures and his slides are brief so you have to go to class and honestly he's so good you don't want to skip

Best professor I've ever had, makes lectures incredibly interesting, cracks jokes all the time which is great, tutorials are helpful with material, super caring if there is an issue, always takes and fully explains questions, wants to make sure everyone succeeds.
Great to listen to in lecture, very interesting how he breaks down each philosophers theory. Go to class though because the final exam is on stuff only covered in class.
Best prof I've had at Mac.

Grellette is a solid prof. His lectures are probably the best I have experienced as he ties reading material together well, and is incredibly detailed in his explanations - while being entertaining and thought-provoking. Sometimes, he is too quick to dismiss student ideas, but I believe that in a one-on-one setting, he is far more approachable.
Fantastic professor

Dr. Grellette is a fantastic professor. Absolutely amazing, engaging lectures, which are clear and build on readings well. His assignments are tough yet realistic. Final exam is always fair if you have attended class.

He is an amazing professor. He really makes sure to engage all his students and his intentions on what he wishes you to take away are clear. He is open to having a discussion in class about tough issues and rebuts in a way that is both respectful and eye opening. He is very passionate about his class is was a joy to learn from.

Is never unclear, and if he is, creates a safe environment for questions to be asked. Clear on marking schemes. So passionate about the course material, that you want to be passionate about the course material. Gives a clear practical use of what we learn in class.

Prof with a wit and a drive to be as straight forward and understandable as he can with the material, and excels in this end. A fair amount of reflection papers and one cold call meant specifically to engage you in the weekly readings provide a good balance of push to read ($ free) without any real stress or tension. Rigid, fair,realistic, balanced

Dr. Grellette was the best professor I had in my whole undergraduate degree. He is able to articulate complex issues in a simple, engaging way. He is great at maintaining a high level of engagement from the class which really helps the learning process. I would recommend taking anything he teaches regardless of the content.

He was by far the best prof I have ever had in my four years at Mac! The material was super interesting and he teaches it with such passion that it's hard not to be interested in it! He lectures clearly and even recaps what he talked about last time. Only prof I've ever had that would get an applause at the end of lectures because they were so good

He is an amazing professor! once you have him, no other prof can compare to his level of awesomeness. Not only is he super chills, he is so passionate about what he is teaching that all his lectures are  interesting. He's great because he's friendly and nice but you do have to work hard in the course to get a good grade. i want to have his babies
Once you take a course with Grellette, no other prof will be good enough in comparison.

Dr. Grellette is by far the best professor I have had EVER. Many profs know their subjects but couldn't teach their way out of a paper bag. This prof is different - he finds ways to illustrate the theories, principles and ideas he wants to convey in a way that is engaging and fosters learning. He is an exceptional prof and I learned a ton.

If you do the readings for this class, you'll find that his lectures are just summarized forms. Having said that, the readings are tough and you really need the summaries. The TA will tell you that everyone does horribly on the final exam in this class and you will find that to be true - prepare for your grade to go down at the end. Essays are fine

He is really funny and pretty clear, but he reads off of his paper! The lectures really do sound like long essays and you have to develop a taste for them !  He was pretty busy this semester and asked students not to come to him unless as a last resort. He tried really hard to make skippers do badly, he didn't put a lot of stuff online.

I had him for two courses- Political Philosophy and Metaphysics & he's got to be my favourite prof at Mac. He presents information clearly, but keeps the class moving at a good pace. He doesn't dwell on things in a way that kills everyone's interest, but he's very careful to make sure everyone understands. Funny, interesting &  a good guy.

Clear, helpful, and overall a decent professor, but he does have high expectations - after handing back our essays, he flat out said, "no one got a 90". He doesn't give super low grades or anything, he just doesn't give super high ones, either. He was also a bit harsh marking the final exam (I'm still bitter about that).Everything else is great. :)

Amazing. Grellette is more focused on political and legal philosophy from his educational background, I had him for metaphysics, which he admitted was not his best area, but he was fantastic. Lectures were engaging. He made sure every single person understood the material--RARE quality. Super friendly and approachable too! Great guy!

Very charismatic. He's funny but doesn't try too hard, he's nice but not fake, and very approachable. All in all, he's hard not to like. Lectures are actually fun to attend - he's a great speaker and delivers information very clearly.

Prof. Grellette is a teacher of the highest caliber. He has an obvious talent in teaching and uses brilliant examples to underpin his  memorable delivery of material. He is always available to discuss and debate, and he offers fantastic feedback on formal class assignments and casual philosophical exchanges. I only wish the class was still active.
Dr. Grellette is one of the best profs I have taken classes with. His lectures are clear, his assignments are fair, and the course content is interesting.
The material was difficult, but not his fault. He's great. You can tell he's really passionate about political theory. Despite the class being in the evening, he made lecture really interesting.
I loved the lectures.  They were fun and you're really learning.

This prof is THE BEST. He is young but knows what he is doing so his references are updated and not stiff like some other profs I have had. Metaphysics is difficult and I probably would not like the content as much if Dr. Grellette wasn't the one explaining it!
Excellent lecturer, exactly what you would look for in a Philosophy professor. I Would take more classes with him.

comments: While her demeanor is kind of downbeat and muted, she is very knowledgeable. The class material was delivered in an uninteresting manner but was pretty fascinating in and of itself, with the readings being captivating. Frager is quite nice and remembers individual names. Values participation and writes exams based on class interest

Frager's assignments were tough, but her exam was very fair! Encourages discussion & conversation, and values that thoughts and opinions of every student. Very knowledgeable, respected, accommodating, and REALLY knows her stuff. Assignments are based on the readings, so if you read it, you'll be fine. Would take again.

Taking a minor in history and this class was one of few that fit into my schedule. I would not recommend Frager because she is tough and even though I asked for help and thought I was able to do better on the next assignmentexam I was wrong. She is nice, the course is interesting but you have to be liked and adhere to what she wants to do well.

Dr Frager was an absolutely incredible professor.  She is probably one of the nicest, most down-to-earth, professional, and intelligent people you could meet.  Her assignments weren't easy, but if you put time into it and did what was required, you would get the grade you deserved, as Dr Frager is a very fair grader.  You can't find a fairer prof!

Dr. Frager is very shy when you talk to her personally -- but when it comes to history that woman is a professional historian. I was afraid to take her class because of some of the things written on this site, but I'm glad I went along and did it anyway. It ended up being one of my favourite classes, and she's really great!!

I thoroughly enjoyed the class and Frager. She's not the most enthusiastic speaker but her lectures were clear, interesting, and very informative. She's a fair marker and wrote a very doable final exam (and actually gave us enough time to write it which many history profs don't).

I really liked the class and Frager. She's very helpful, very diplomatic,   truly cares about your opinions and tries to make sure she teaches both sides. The exam was also very fair. Perhaps not the most enthusiastic speaker but if you pay attention her lectures are very interesting and well structured. The readings were well chosen as well

Great professor. Phenomenal Social Historian. I know some people think she has a dry tone but actually listen to what she's saying! She knows her stuff. I would take another class with her in a heartbeat. I learned so much. I have somewhat of a disinterest in Canadian history but she opened my eyes and made me take it in, proved its relevance.
I had her in her first year at Mac - and fought to get in her class. Loved it. She gave me profound advice on post-grad schools and advisors. She went out on a limb for me and I thank her.

Sure her expectations are clear but sorting through 6 pages of instructions for an 8-10 page paper is excessive. An interesting class, awful teaching technique. Test me on the subject, not whether I pick up the minutiae in the sometimes contradictory instructions. ex: "(Don't use parenthetical references)". Not kidding.
Very organized.  Clear in what she was saying.  Sometime a bit boring, but that comes with lecturing on the Canadian working class
Not the most exciting prof. Repetative... esp. when it came down to the deskilling of Shoemakers.

She seems to like to show you how little you know rather than teach you.  I am very disappointed in this class.  She was a tough marker and had this terrible tendency to make a face whenever you said something she did not agree with. She did not try to enlighten her students.Also, the class was small but she never bothered to remember names.Avoid!
Ruth was very knowledgeable about her topic. Some of the content did get a little dry.

Really disappointed. It's all labour history, very dry, biased against gender and cultural history. Unfortunately, she wants her own lecture ideas in your papers and discussion.does not reward individual or cultural interpretations,not very helpful in emails/office  - just smirks at your suggestions. Definitely avoid if you want anything over a B!
INCREDIBLY BORING, IMPOSSIBLE TO UNDERSTAND, TERRIBLE TA. OVERALL, A MAJOR DISAPPOINTMENT. I NEVER THOUGHT CANADIAN HISTORY COULD BE EVEN MORE BORING.. DR. FRAGER PROVED ME WRONG.

She's a wonderful professor to have in a seminar format. She ignites conversation easily and is very easy-going about where the discussion goes. If you've only had her for a lecture-based class, don't just judge her on that as she's awesome in a small group setting! She's now one of my fave profs.
No Comments

I appreciate her intelligence, but I could not warm up to her class.  The presentation of the material is unbearably dry.  Very nice lady, however, and I hear she is very friendly outside the class setting.  She seemed uncomfortable with lecturing.
Got the best sleep of my life in that class

Boring, yes - but get over it!  She is VERY intelligent.  She gave me excellent advice for post graduate work - and altered my life.  She also let me research a topic I was genuinely interested in.  She appreciated my passion for learning.

At first I was distracted by her odd pronounciations and dry tone of voice - she seems boring and uninteresting.  The thing is, she's very precise and clear in her lectures and presents the information well even if it's a tad dull.  --I'm tempted to sign her up for what not to wear.
Her seminar is run well with good discussion and interesting readings.  She is always willing to help after class a during office hours.  Good prof.  Good class (4A06)!
Worst prof ever.  She is so boring.  She has no interest in being there.
Dr. Frager at first appears dry however, the bright students learn that she is simply an introvert. Take her fourth year seminar classes, you will see a whole different professor! Great Prof!
ONE WORD "BRUTAL"
Shy but excellent.
Dr. Frager has a delightfully dry sense of humour. Her class was an excellent learning experience.
Seminar, Does that mean people other than me speak?
Holy snore Batman
This was the worst class I have ever taken...way too boring!
No Comments
No Comments
For the love of god this prof is soooooooo boring. She has no zest for teaching.
ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ

comments: Engages students in class, does what he can to make it interesting. Always makes himself available to help outside class. It's HARD but amazing if you love logic. Before tests he held study sessions to answer our questions and most of the class went because he really helped to clear things up for us. I Wish I took more of his classes

Super interesting, one of my favourite profs! My first class with him was logic, and though the class was super hard, he did his best to explain it. The Philosophy of War and Peace was also great, mostly a class-wide  discussion for two hours, but I think hes a great prof, I learned so much from him! Nothing but thumbs up!

The best thing about Mark is that his tests are always fair. He's a funny lecturer, digresses quite a lot but definitely one of the friendlier, more approachable professors in the department of philosophy.
Course material is very difficult but it is not his fault. It is the course itself that is difficult. Awesome lecturer and makes time to meet with students and provide extra help. Really nice guy.

So. Annoying. Way too much jargon and random ranting. I'm sure he is attempting to make class fun.....but it didn't work, to say the least. Relies too heavily on textbook. Incomplete examples in class. Just annoying beyond belief.
best prof i've ever had. very helpful and approachable!!
Smart, engaging, tries different learning avenues in the classroom
Amazing professor! I actually learned a lot, which is more than I can say for some of my other classes! He is so helpful and cares for his students!!! I LOVE VOROBEJ!

Best professor ever. Helpful, Compassionate, and knowledgeable about the material in all of the classes I have had with him.  He is very down to earth, and seems to genuinely enjoy getting to know his students.

he is simply a fantastic prof... so funny, so helpful, and he really challenges you to think.  the course is one of the most useful ones i've taken at mac, but it's not easy--just awesome.  he is a super nice guy and goes out of his way to help his students.  vorobej fan club!
No Comments

interesting how all the reviews from students in his 1b06 course are positive as opposed to his other classes. just to reaffirm this theory, i liked him -he was a helpful and intelligent professor.  his weakness, however, was being too lenient with his students and letting them get away with more than they should.
Amazing prof!
OK, this guy was all over the place, he even answered one of his own test questiosn wrong when my buddy inquired about his poor mark after a midterm.  Enough said.
Simply amazing.. very clear and teaches in a tutorial fashion, which is very very helpful.
Phenomenal Prof. All 1b06 students love him...Others just haven't experienced his greatness!
Nice guy. Easy to follow.
vorobej is god.  he outdoes dr. alan mendelson (boo) tenfold!     - THE HYBRID ARGUMENT
No Comments
He was an okay prof. The lecture was more of a tutorial style, but I found that it was the best way to learn.

Dr. Vorobej is a great prof.  He explained concepts clearly and he made logic fun.  He was always available after class and was passionate *and* compassionate about teaching.  I will miss him next year!
dr. vorobej is amazing! he is interesting and funny, and he really will help you out as much as he can, in any way possible.
don't you just love how the examples in the text book, from which we can actually learn from, are left out of lecture but the extra stuff thats not in it is emphasized??!

Dr. Vorobej is clear, helpful and compassionate person.  He genuinely commits to his students and aids them in their success in anyway possible.  He also makes logic as simple and relatable as possible--I think the quintessence of how philosophy is about.

brutal, bad text, apparently saying things in the most complicated fashion possible and using excessive jargon = explaining clearly. the key to education is communication.  phd maybe, next stop..teachers college

Arrogant and condescending. Ned Flanders evil twin. The catch phrase, "Bueller...Bueller.....Anyone......" comes to mind. And that was just the "tutorial", (he claimed there were no real lectures...bingo!!!). But how about that textboo

comments: Was very approachable and always understanding and flexible on deadlines. Open to lots of discussion and interesting ideas. Would take again!

Worst teacher I've had this semester. I wish I could have dropped this class. Extremely unorganized, no grading criteria, expects things to be read too quickly, dismissive, will sometimes ask for more stuff to hand in for projects after projects are complete, and interrupts you. Bad experience overall.

Well, I'm glad I learned so much about gay men in Germany this year. Except that I'm really not-- this course is supposed to be about sex and gender in popular culture, but it's just about gay men and Germany and also structured horribly-- Dr. Bruce was very erratic in sticking to her outline (or, more often, not doing so at all).

Worst prof ever! Makes up course names that sound interesting then only talks about germany and the holocaust badly!! Can't use technology at all, summarizes for half the lecture the previous lecture then rants until the end. No content, learned nothing, terrible marker. DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS PROF! you will be disappointed and hate class
Absolutely horrible. Dismisses students. Not organized. Late to class. Wastes time. Pleases favourite students. HATED EVERY MINUTE! DO NOT TAKE CLASSES WITH HER!!!!

Terrible professor. I was so excited about this course before taking it, however she made me hate it so much. Very disorganized, wasted too much time handing back essays. She actually put down some excellent ideas that students brought up in class. Don't take class with her.

I was really excited to be taking a class on fairy tales, however, after the first lecture that instantly vanished. Horrible does not even begin to describe her. Her lectures are summaries with little to no analysis, she does not speak clearly, instead mumbles into the mic. Worse prof I have ever had.

I've had a positive experience with every English Prof I've had at Mac... except this one. SO much plot synopsis and very little analysis. In fact, some times when a student shared a GREAT thought she would dismiss it completely. Also provided an A+ essay example that lacked a proper thesis, which I thought was just shameful.

Thought the Children's Literature course would be interesting, but she was sooo unorganized and scatter-brained. Also, unclear instructions lead to a poor mark in the first assign for the majority of the class.
I enjoyed her classes. She has chosen very interesting films and in overall she is quite pleasant.
Great Prof! Really interesting and fun! Passionate about German...
Awesome teacher. Very interesting and well prepared. Found her fascinating to listen to and I thoroughly enjoyed her classes.

This was the worst comp lit class I have taken! She's a difficult marker! Also 3 books AND an anthology had to be purchased ..made it an expensive course to take. She does not follow the outline says it's only "tentative", however expects you to keep up with the readings listed on the "tentative" outline...quizzes on material before lecturing on it

Horrible prof. She will shoot down comments immediately, and routinely tells students their opinions are wrong. She makes ad hominem attacks against students. She'll use your previous comments as examples of 'bad comments'. She mostly looks for students to parrot her ideas. Truly the worst professor I've ever had. Avoid her at all costs.

I've had her twice now and I have way too many negative things to say to fit in this little space. She DOES favour students, I have documents and witnesses to back that up. She will shoot down everything you say if she doesn't like you. If she can't deduct marks for grammar or content she'll take marks off for how you use commas. The list goes on.
I've had Dr. Bruce several times, and have learned nothing from her.  She chooses interesting texts, but her lectures are not so great.  Uses presentations instead of teaching.

A excellent prof with a zeal for teaching.  DOES NOT pick favorites (anyone with something meaningful to say would be a favorite).  Keeps discussions open to any topic of worth and importance and values input from students.  Top notch prof.

Dr. Bruce may seem bizzare, but if you want to get over that impression, go see her one-on-one! She is a fun prof, in her own ways, especially when it comes to Mann and Kafka. Also, do talk to her while you are working on your essay - run by her the topic, your arguments and ask her for suggestions/resources. Read the texts! Think and analyze! You
terrible professor

Dr. Bruce's lectures are boring and she often doesn't make clear what she expects of you on an assignment until you get it back and you've done poorly. She also picks obvious favourites, which is discouraging. One of my least favourite profs.

Dr. Bruce's lectures are bizarre, and the material included in them is often weird, incoherent, or not even remotely relevant to the topic under discussion. Marks depend on whether she's in an A-mood or an F-mood. I dreaded going to class.
No Comments
Dr. Bruce is friendly, approachable, and knowledgable on her subject.  Her passion for Kafka throughout the class was evident and greatly influenced and inspired the students.

She taught me that Kafka was into body-building and chewed his food in a very interesting fashion. I must commend her for that sort of thing, and whilst I hated the Dangor book, Dr. Bruce still remained an awesome professor.
