comments: great prof who LOVES to eat and once, he dressed up as Mozart during a lecture on Mozart (it was during Halloween time). A shame he is at Carleton! Very organised teaching style yet his office was cluttered! I got at least an A- in every course of his. None of his classes were boring. Loves his work. I should of taken his Wagner course.

Great prof!!! Really nice guy who loves teaching; has a  wicked sense of humour that will make you say "God, why isn't it (insert day here) so I could go to Deaville's class!"  Awesome class too.  Music + Movies = BEST CLASS EVER!
Wicked guy, fun class. He rules.
Great guy, helpful, funny but knows his stuff... Makes difficult material a little easier.
Best Prof Ever... PLEASE COME BACK!!!!
Must take this class if you want a bird course!
Don't change a thing, Dr. Deaville. This is one of the best classes at McMaster! Whoever said learning can't be fun clearly hasn't been to one of Dr. Deaville's lectures. What a great class!

Good Class! Quizzes were hard, but later became open book and neighbour! I liked the material for the most part. Was helpful after my exam when my mark turned out to be wrong. He ended up dropping the test mark that had disappeared! Good class and good prof. Thanks for your help!
Quizzes are somewhat hard, but they are open book, open neighbour.  Exam was a joke, finished 94 questions in 20 minutes.
No Comments

This class was awesome...seriously the best course I've taken at Mac so far!...and whoever is complaining about the hard tests and quizzes...uh, are you in humanities or something cuz they were easy!  Try taking a science course and you'll see what hard tests/quizzes are!
Great Class, Great Prof....and the TA is SOOO FUNNY...GO DAN!  Pop music is NOT a bird course, but this class is....plus you actually learn alot!
Tough quizzes, but fun prof and class.  Interesting movies too!!!  A class that must be taken at MAC....but only if Deaville is the prof.
Funny class.  The video clips are awesome. His comments can be pretty rude at times but because he is just so jolly it doesn't seem to really bother people.

Sure, if I went to class to entertained this would be a good one! This prof is over the top, hard to take him seriously, and try approaching him for him...ha ha you would have to catch him first.  He runs away from students, and avoids comfirtation at all cost! hard to take such a person seriously!
This class is a blast, Deaville has always got a witty comment to share and he can dance too. The quizzes were hard to start but then he let them be open-book! Great fun.

Great prof.  Great class.  Quizzes are extremely hard.  Would like to have the class in another lecture room...maybe MDCL would be better.  Other than the crazy quizzes I recommond this class to everyone.....A prof who actually cares about his students...super funny too!!!

He is a wonderful prof who actually cares about his students.  One of the best profs and classes Mac has to offer.  His quizzes are quite difficult, nevertheless, I highly recommend this course to everyone.  Woo Hoo for Deaville!!
He's a funny guy and keeps the students entertained. The quizzes are harder than his tests.

Hard quizzes and tests, now that he's not allowed to give "too many A's" but still, an amazing class unlike any other I've taken here at McMaster. Very funny and doesn't take himself (or the course for that matter) too seriously. I'd like easier quizzes, but it's still a great class!

Despite the fact that he greatly resembles Gimli the Dwarf from the Lord of the Rings, this guy is absolutely amazing!  He's extremely funny, and his quizzes are sooooo easy!  Keep it up, Gimli!  LOL.
AMAZING PROF, but his last few quizzes have been really hard, so I don't know why everyone is saying he's really easy. He is, however, still one of the best profs at Mac.
No Comments

What can I say about this prof...except that he is the absolute best!He is funny, entertaining, interesting, knowledgeable,he is one of the few profs at mac that make learning fun!And one of the few who give you a break with the work load.Love ya Deaville
By far, the EASIEST class offered at Mac.  The tests/quizzes/viewing tests are set up so you cant do poorly.  And he does have a very positive attitude and is very funy!
Fun class
One of the best profs at MAC.  IN a league of his own on when it comes to positive attitude and niceness.  He'd be fun in a bar.
I'm not a fan of the movies he picks, but the class is great! Really interesting and he's really funny!

comments: Hard grader and few chances to do well. Material not that interesting.
Dr. Carter keeps every lecture interesting and engaging (even when they're 3 hours long). Great sense of humour and really passionate about his teaching.

I've had him for multiple classes (Anthro 1B03, 3K03, 3E03, 4E03) and he is one of the best profs (if not the best) I've had throughout university. If you pay attention in lecture (and in the lab) and do the readings, you should do great. Super helpful, so if you have any questions, just ask him!

Very energetic and engaging prof. His lectures are interesting and informative. Only problem I had was that when he would get too excited he would speak quite quickly and I would have a hard time taking down notes. Tutorials were easy and tests/assignments were fair.

The best professor that i've had to date. He's fun, entertaining, and obviously loves what he does. The exams are easy as long as you study the material. He uses Avenue to post his slides plus his notes on the readings to elaborate on the info. Didn't need to attend all of the lectures but I did because he's such an interesting professor.

Dr. Carter is a very interesting and dynamic professor. He is very passionate about his work and has many interesting facts to share. However, he can be a bit hard to follow sometimes when he gets excited and starts talking quickly. His power point slides are also kind of disorganized. Fair tests though and a great prof!

He is a very educated professor! Just google him and check out his resume, mind-blowing! This class was my elective and I liked it so I'm sure anyone interested in Anthro would find Dr. Carter WAY more helpful than I did. I had no idea what anthropology was before coming to class. LOL

Wonderful professor! It was not necessary to attend lectures, but I wouldn't miss one. Very interesting to listen to. Midterm/exam were easy enough if you studied. I definitely want to take another one of his courses!
Loved Dr.Carter so much! Funniest prof ever. I'm probably gonna take everyone of his courses cuz I love being in his lectures.
Dr.Carter is a wonderful professor. I really enjoyed his class and attend almost all the lectures.

Very interesting and entertaining lectures! Dr. Carter is a very helpful prof who clearly wants all his students to succeed. This is a very challenging course, and the lectures are fast paced, but he really does all he can to help us all understand the material (ie. Avenue discussion posts = EXCELLENT, and podcasts)
Dr. Carter is an entertaining professor, his class is very interesting but he has too many negative things to say about other students as well as his co-workers, and he shares this with everyone.

Dr. Carter is a fantastic professor! His lectures are very engaging and interesting. He posts all the podcasts online, but I would still recommend going to class. Loved this class and will definitely take his classes in the future.

I absolutely loved Dr. Carter! He is not an easy prof, but does all that he can to get you to succeed. Podcasts and notes are online. Is a professional in his field. My favourite prof! I told him I loved him. Will be taking another of his classes for sure! Also, the British accent helps

A good prof that really wants to help students learn. His midterm was EXTREMELY hard, but exam was a lot more fair. His powerpoints were a little convaluted, and posted 2 different types of lectures online which made it confusing. Overall I really enjoyed him! :] But he's HARD! NOT a bird course!

He talks very fast, and goes through his power points extremely quickly. However, he is entertaining.. but throws a LOT of information at you at once (Studying for exams / mid-terms has been extremely hard. You have to sift through a bunch of random facts.) I found this class to be lots of work!! But overall, a good prof.

+Very fun prof who knows what he's talking about. Fairly good review sessions for exams. Great use of sources for lectures -Powerpoints were too cluttered & lectures were too unorganized. Course overall has little focus. Use of webCT cancels out the need to go to class (posts every exact word he says online).

It was so nice to have such a cool professor for my first semester of university. I couldn't have been happier with the course. It was nice that the notes were posted online, and delivery of the lectures was enthusiastic and clear. It made early mornings totally worth it! :)

He is awesome! His british accent is so nice, worth waking up to listen to. And he has piercings! Overall he's awesome. I'm for sure going to try to get into another one of his classes again in the future.
a very interesting class! lots of enthusiasm.
Very entertaining
Wonderful teacher, loved going to class and hearing everything he had to say. Always explained things well, overall great instructor and class!

Dr Carter is AMAZING!!!!!! He knows his stuff and has first hand expierence about the majority of the places he talks about in class. He also posts all his slides and even his FULL lecture notes online. The class isnt difficult if you keep up with the readings and honestly if you dont understand something just ask him and he makes it perfectly clea
Great prof, easy to talk to and an exciting person to listen to
always an interesting lecture to attend!
Best professor I've had, awesome class. Dr. Carter is awesome :D
The greatest class of my life!! :) Definitely going to miss it and Dr. Carter!!
He was great. Was very easy to understand, and made his midterms and exam extremely fair.

exams/midterms were fair. You just need to know your stuff and understand it. Nothing extremely specific ever asked. More knowledge based than tricky. Also for this class posted all slides and all lecture notes (what he said in class) online. Really cool guy :) made the class even better
He was my favourite prof of the year!
I loved Dr. Carter... Bless his cotton socks!
This prof was great- I loved this class and his teaching style. He's really enthusiastic and interesting
he is ok.
Amazing Prof- I really liked him. He has a great teaching still and puts a lot of effort into his presentations/slides- makes the course material really interesting- easily my favorite prof
Awesome professor! Was enthusiastic and made awesome powerpoint presentations/slides which made the class very interesting. Best prof. I've had yet!
ABSOLUTELY amazing prof! His lectures were interesting and informative, and he definitely knows what he is talking about. His enthusiasm draws you in, and i've never been bored during his lectures.

Did not enjoy the class very much, but he taught well. We was funny and made it as interesting for me as it will ever be. The book was pretty useless since he said most of the dates were wrong. SUPER easy midterm and exam .. tough quizes(2), and easy easy but long (8-10 pg) essay :)
No Comments

comments: Many people didn't come to lectures because whatever he covered in lectures was pulled from the book. Although I loved the lectures as he gave specific examples and related the terms and theories so our lives and made them easier to understand and remember.

This class is a hit or miss, I think it just depends on whether you intend on majoring in Communications or not. I loved the class and found Professor Sevigny to be interesting, to be fair everything in lecture is pulled straight from the textbook, but he does add in personal anecdotes. Great prof to have if you want to work in the industry.

How can you say that Dr. Sevigny says nothing? His experience as a PR pro is extensive and successful. I hung on every word and went to his office - he spent an hour with me talking about politics, PR, my future. Gave me great tips for an internship.

Really surprised by his high rating and quite disappointed by the fact that many won't believe my rating because it's shrouded by more positive reviews. Extremely boring speaker. Not captivating in the least bit. Like the other reviewer, i stopped attending classes as i found them useless... don't think I learned anything from this class.
Don't know what the last commenter was thinking. Must have attended a different lecture. This was my best course in my whole first year at Mac. Dr. Sevigny is awesome.

Really terrible prof. never really said anything important, all material was pulled from the textbook, and most was common sense. I stopped attending lectures because they were a waste of time since the notes were posted online, and he really had nothing to add that was useful.
Best. Professor. Ever.

Really enjoying Dr. Sévigny's 4N03 seminar. He makes it all seem so effortless - doesn't speak from notes, always knows the answer to your question. I really feel that I have learned a lot about agenda setting, framing and the news industry. His guest speakers are great, too.

he is by far my favorite professor yet.. I love his teaching style, the way he approached the course material and his interaction with the class... I seriously wish we had more like him, he's such a fascinating and knowledgeable guy and it certainly shows in his lectures... I enjoyed his class so much that I took the 4N03 seminar that he teaches.

Quite an amazing professor. This social media class is the most useful one I have taken yet. Dr. Sevigny brings his own experience to the classroom. Also one of the best public speakers I have ever seen. I think he should be Prime Minister. Busy man - catch him in a free moment and he'll talk to you but can be hard to find him outside office hours.

Intriguing man. Seems to be a lot to him, but seems to be strangely sad sometimes. Sevigny's lecture style is amazing and he has the best real-world examples. But I am always wondering... who is he? A mystery. Fantastic professor, though - scary smart and cultured.

Great speaker, engages class extremely well. Gives several assignments that only take a couple hours to complete and have small weightings which helps ease first year students into university expectations and allows for steady improvement over the semester. Very passionate communicator and wants the best for his students.

Dr. Sevigny is an inspiring person. He makes you feel safe and secure when you are with him in class. When I talk to him after class, or in his office, I never see the time go by. He's a very good man. It's a shame few of us get to know him well. I'm jealous of his lab manager - she spends so much time with him and he obviously really likes her.

Sometimes, you are lucky to run into a professor as talented and passionate Dr Sevigny. He cares a lot about his students' well-being and he focuses on students' development as individuals. He also does his best to promote students in their careers. Be careful though - he will ask you to be honest with yourself. That can be a hard thing to do.

Extremely passionate and the most brilliant professor I had in 6 years! Extremely knowledgeable and his market experience differentiate him from other scholars. Fair marker; he probably can't stand stupidity. If you are a serious student and that you take learning seriously, i.e. actually read your textbooks, you'll love him.

Bad communication skills, difficult to reach for help, goes on a useless tangents about self and therefore does not have time left for actual course material. He still test on topics he did not teach and is a hard marker. Low use of communication textbook which he co-authored and made us buy for the sake of royaltees.

Alex is an excellent prof. Really knows political comm/elections. Wish I got to know him better. He's so busy and in-demand that it's hard to catch up to him. He doesn't suffer fools well either so if he seeks you out, that's a compliment - be thankful. His lab manager is a very lucky woman to be able to spend so much time with him. I'm jealous.

Alex is a overall great guy. He knows his stuff and doesn't try to shove it down your throat. We would stop for coffee breaks (8:30 class) and he would come ask everyone how the weekend was. Classy professor that deserves his good reputation. He is still friends with the majority of this older students, always a positive sign.
A truly decent person and a pleasure to have a professor. I learned more during this course than in any other of my undergrad. My favourite course of all the ones I took at McMaster. Period.
Dr Sévigny is, quite simply, a true gentleman and superb professor. He is my model, now that I am in graduate school.

Dr. Sévigny was one of the most approachable and helpful professors I've had at McMaster. He was always willing to set aside time to see me and answer any questions I had, and was very enthusiastic during class when teaching.

I really enjoy the news analysis class. Alex is a mysterious guy - there's more to him than meets the eye. Both he and his subject matter fascinate me. A little intimidatingly smart though. Don't know what I would converse about with him - I would be shy.
Alex is a very clear speaker and makes quantitative content analysis understandable. He's quite friendly too and very fashionable. It's a pleasure to come to class. I look forward to it every week.

What an amazing man. I learned so much from Dr Sevigny - how to measure and analyze the news. It was only when I left Mac and met a PR agency owner friend for coffee on Yorkville that I realized how active he is as a strategic consultant. Such an unassuming, gentle man but amazingly influential. Everyone who's anyone seems to know him.

The class was so useful. Professor Sevigny was very helpful. He made us reflect theoretically, but also emphasized public relations strategy and tactics. I am using EVERYTHING he taught us in my first job after graduation. Dr Sevigny's got style, too which is cool...
Friendly and caring. We talked about McLuhan at the bus stop once. Great lecturer - lots of writing in the course though. Inspired me to major in comms.
I found every lecture very interesting and entertaining. I couldn't help but listen.

The class is pretty interesting, but it is also greatly impacted by your T.A as well. Mine didn't teach me or the rest of the class anything. So it made the assignments a bit of a challenge. But overall it's a fair course.

Dr. Sevigny is an excellent professor. He explains the methodology very clearly and walks the class through the work in a confident and easy-going manner. I really learned how to do a content analysis in a professional fashion in this class. He also brought two PR professionals who discussed how content analysis fits into their work.

I was in Ottawa and saw Alex across a room at a Halloween party full of media people and political insiders. I didn't think he'd remember me so I didn't say hello. He was there with a very beautiful girl. I was jealous. He was such a calming presence in class.

I graduated in 2005 and have bumped into Alex in a bunch of professional occasions (luncheons,etc). You have to be killing yourself in the workworld, achieving things painfully to start admiring what Alex has achieved. Everybody who's anybody in Canada knows him-in the biz, in politics, in government, activism. Be his friend-his network is golden.

Let me put this as simply as possible - I graduated from Mac three years ago. I recently ran into Alex at convention. He is, quite simply, a beautiful, beautiful man. You do not know what a treasure he is until you leave Mac. One in a million.

Took 1A03 with this guy as an elective in first year engineering 4 years ago. Easiest course at McMaster (that I know of). Went to 3 lectures, a few tutorials, spent a grand total of 20 minutes skimming the readings, ****ted my report, and got an A. Highly recommended for filler value.

I don't what people are complaining about - Alex is fascinating. It totally hooked me into CMST + he only used the f-word once to illustrate a point about using "shock value" in communication. It obviously worked, since people seem to remember that he did it. He set my internship up for me this summer - he didn't have to do that for me.

I had him last year the class was huge but he is an excellent lecturer - he brought in a guest which I found pointless - also the blogging was a little pointless but simple - really enjoyed his class & did well - reading the text isn't too necessary just make sure you attend lectures - doesn't reply to emails quick but always available after class

I am a graduate of the CMST program. If people don't like Alex, it's because they are jealous. He is brilliant, kind and nurturing. He has taken time to keep in touch with me since I graduated and helped me get my first job through one of his friends who runs a communications business in Toronto. Alex is a class act and a great friend.
Worst Prof EVER! Totally over-rated and he is SOOO BOORING and tough. And I would never recommend anyone to take any of his courses.

Alex is just amazing. He crackles with energy. When he enters a room, the room lights up. I was so in awe of him during class. He brought guest lecturers from the media biz as well as corporate comms. I actually got a job with one of them because I kept in touch after the guest lecture. I just love Alex - he has a wonderful, soothing voice too.

It is cool having a professor who is always being interviewed on TV or in the newspaper. Also, he brought Gerard Kennedy in as a guest speaker - I was so impressed! Gerard and Alex took time to talk for hours afterward lecture and then I got a ride with them to a reception. It was AMAZING!!!

I loved taking his class. He does begin speaking french randomly which gets annoying, but overall his class was super easy with the 1pg. assignments that you picked topics for and only 4 blogs. My TA was really great though. I honestly read hardly anything .. but went to all of the lectures and ended up with an A- .. I would take his classes again.
HE is SOOOOOOOOOO TOUGHHHHHHH
By far the worst professor I've come across so far at McMaster. Ignores your concerns expressed directly to him. I am simply ashamed that I spent money to be lectured by such a man.
umm isnt he supposed to be a good communicator? randomly swears in class and talks about random stuff. very boring still.

In my 4 years at Mac, I have never been so disappointed with a professor as I have been in Dr. Sevigny. Disorganized, egocentric, unfocused lectures, poorly facilitated discussion and assignments, clear favourites and unprofessional conduct. Avoid his classes at all costs--it'll save you time, money and the frustration of being taught by him.

Who are these negative reviewers? Alex is the best professor at McMaster, bar none. I am in fourth year and have had many. He's a fantastic lecturer, intellectual heavyweight and incredible well connected. These children should realize the kind of person they are lucky to have teach them in first year!

Dr. Sévigny is a pretentious, condescending prof. Sure, he brought 'industry experts' in, but when they're his politician buddies, days before election, you question his motives. Forget organization, his website reflected dates of years past and course outlines conflicted with other requirements. The text, never used, but coauthored by Dr. Sévingy.

Alex is AMAZING. He brought guest speakers from Industry & Government & knowledge about pol comms, which is his specialty. Of course he talks about his experiences! Just chatting with him is an education. He is also extremely kind - he would stay for an hour after class to chat and encourage. He's single too - he would make a great, cool husband.

I understand the positive comments but should not teach a 4th year course. 3 hour seminar, talked 90% of the time about himself and his accomplishments. Had a bunch of assignments, the topics of which he would conveniently teach after they were due. Openly criticized students. Favourtism is apparent. Could have been amazing, instead a huge letdown.
I just sat there in class, listened and thought about how much he would be a great husband... smart, cool, successful. Ireally enjoyed this class... super organization and great material.
This professor is magic. I had him in the summer class. He's so intriguing too... I have a huge crush on him.

I agreed he was the best in 1A03, but he is also the worst in 4N03. Nothing was taught, keep rambling on something that aren't fit into the discussion. A Full 2 hours lecture on the discussion of duration of grad. studies & on President George. Eventually, our textbook has never been used, such a waste of money.

Dr. Sevigny is a wicked lecturer. He brings comms to life. I looked forward to lecture every day. He had us mesmirized, even though he often lectured for 2 hours or 3 hours straight. He's easy on the eyes too. His eye sparkle when gets excited.

These people are crazy. Dr. Sevigny is the best researcher in the department and we finally got a high level of discussion from his "rambling on". What twits these people are. The class took advantage of the fact that he is a nice guy and tried to get him to dumb down the assignments. I enjoyed his discussions - he's brilliant and makes sense.

Took over for a professor that fell ill about a month into class. Did a very poor job, did not explain assignments well at all, did not lecture, made the class very boring. Rambled on and on about things unrelated to class topic and we did not have one single mark until the last day of class. I think we should all get our money back.

Dr Sevigny is amazing. I am a fourth year Poli Sci student and am wishing that I could now switch into Communications. He gives very high level commentary and is great value during lecture and during office hours. THe first-year students don't know how lucky they are to have a Prof. of this quality who likes teaching them.
very good prof ! very down to earth and helpful

What are these people talking about? Dr Sevigny brings a ton of personal experience into the classroom! What do they prefer someone who doesn't enrich course content? His examples are amazing. He found me an internship with the Liberal Party. By the way, he has no political aspirations - he is a communications consultant, not a politician.

very good teacher, but he says "right" and "you know" after every sentence. tends to get annoying. Also talks very fast. otherwise, his explanations are very clear, the examples he uses are VERY helpful.

how can people like this professor? he's terrible!  he talks about his dreams of being a politician, goes over class time, and then gets frustrated when people start to shuffle their belongings to go to their next classes.  his lecture speed is way too fast, in my opinion.  there's no other professor for cmst, so i guess you're stuck with him. :(
He is an incredibly hard marker, is of no help when needed as i emailed him several times and had no response, isn't direct with what he wants out of his papers...rarely bell curves....
He's great. So smart and funny. He's cute too... I always find a question to ask him after lecture. :)

He is an amazing professor who makes the course interesting.  He has an immense amount of knowledge and knows exactly what he is talking about.  He is a nice guy, a nerd at some points but overall he is great.
Self-absorbed

Very pleasant person. Nice to talk to. Will take time for you if you go to his office and search him out. Although his intelligence is sometimes a little intimidating, he is very gentle in face to face contact. I went to his office once and we talked for 1.5 hours about cognition, politics, life, etc.
Alex is just amazing. I felt that I was in the presence of greatness. He should be Prime Minister.
i was bored in lecture, but the material was always interesting ... he made the class very accessible and so i enjoy

There is something very special about Dr. Sevigny. He is a cognitive scientist as well as a communication specialist, so his classes are packed with fascinating information about communication and cognition. He also knows an awful lot about politics. To me, these were amazing things to see. They opened up a completely different way of seeing the me

dr. sevigny is very passionate about linguistics. he enjoys lecturing and solving problems with the class. he's also very approachable and encouraging. one of the best linguistics profs i have had yet. particularly knowledgable about speech and language pathology since his research has to do with language and cognition.
No Comments
great prof. very informative and fun to listen to. take his classes if you can - you won't be disappointed!
Good prof, although he needs to try and avoid going off topic, for example: a little less about cats, politics, and france and a little more on communication. :)
Loved SEvigny--wish him good luck.
Dr, Sevigny is soooooooooo nice. I love him!!! Keep it up:)

Amazing prof! Is so smart and intelligent...he has inspired me to take more Communication courses. He is funny and adorably cute! He makes the lectures innovative and fun. Everyone I know loves him...good job!
Amazing prof!! Definitely one of the best, if not the best prof that I had during my whole time at University.  If you can, try to take his classes, no matter what they are!!
very good teacher
No Comments
he is an amazing prof! he really cares about his students and makes lectures interesting! if you dont get him as a prof, you really missing the fun!!!!

dr. sevigny is amazing. i was depressed and down on the world. i went to his office to ask a question about syntax. he answered my question, but in his answer there was this quiet gentleness and emotion. he loves language. i left his office feeling like i was in a dream. amazing that just by telling me about a technicality, he made me see beauty.
good
Dr. Sevigny is brilliant, engaging and amazing. He truly cares about his students. Amazingly smart too.  Lectures are like an event!
No Comments
I really liked his class. He loves what he does. Cheers :).
If Dr Sevigny were a rock star, he would be Bon Jovi. Alex is amazing.. brilliant, smart and really attractive. He looks shy and vulnerable sometimes, though.

Dr. Sevigny is an excellent lecturer who helps you understand the "why" as well as the "how". He always describes concepts in a way that situates them in the larger cognitive psychological perspective. He is also very thoughtful, gentle and a real ego-booster if you have a personal chat with him.
best professor yet.. extremely intelligent and his lectures are actually a lot of fun. he's quite funny and very engaging. always very helpful.
another great prof @ mac frm CMST

I don't know where all the hard comments are coming from, but anyways this class sucked for the first half. He is a good prof but the material bored me. Second half of the class picked up, but unfortuantely I was through with going by that point. The lectures I did attend he was very good at explain
very good prof, keep it up, but have to choose his t.a's wisely, since some prefer girls over guys cough cough ammerman
Awesome prof! keep up the good work, the class is great.
sooo sweet....and cute website...
i look forward to his class like i look forward to going to the theatre. every lecture is a masterful performance.
Fantastic lecturer, really knows his stuff and communicate so well.  Very helpful in and outside of class.  Tough course but a great foundation.
I think I'm in love with this man.
Extremely nice person in general, great prof and very helpful. Hires cool TAs and makes classes enjoyable. Some boring topics but overall a good intro class.
This guy is amazing. He's friendly and funny and cute! Oh, BTW, he's also brilliant.

Amazing prof. Gives interesting lectures. Loves to teach, really cares about his students. Hard to find many dedicated profs like him in a University setting these days. Best prof I had when I was in first year. Didn't find the course too easy though.
Seems like a nice guy, but the course involves lot of reading. The courseware he wrote is HARD to understand!! Too much writing in this course.
he was a GREAT prof!
Great prof. He brings real-world issues into the lectures. He's also a lot of fun to talk to during office hours. He always has time for you.
Alex's one of the best prof at the school.  He's also the CMST dean, really helpful and he gives u lots of advices in both academics and the program itself

Also has a good rep outside academic field; was hired for consulting during election, etc.. Textbook self-explanatory, courseware a bit hard but he explaines text + courseware w/ excellent notes (put online) & good speed in speech.

The classes are informative, but not necessary to attend as he posts the notes on the web.  A really nice prof, and the lectures are easy to understand.  My only complaint is that even though the course material was easy, for some reason the exam was hard
I had him as a replacement for Killingsworth and he was amazing.  He made the concepts clear and the lectures enjoyable.  He is dedicated and passionate about his work.
No Comments
THE VERY BEST!!!!!
He seems like a really nice, approachable Prof.  He posts great notes on the web, which makes it really easy if you miss a day.
No Comments
He uses the heading right from the textbook! I find him boring and his classes are useless, you might aswell read the text!
Alex is amazing. Period. Take his classes. He is erudite, energetic and funny. Really brilliant guy.
yah, he's aight

Dr. Sevigny really cares about students. If you ask for a letter of reference, he will have it ready for you overnight. Sometimes he will stay very late to explain points that you might have missed, if you go to his office.
Some clarity issues...but you'd expect such from a brilliant mind. Nice enough guy though...I'd second the opinion of him being a model prof. most definately.
Dr. Sevigny is great. He will be my practicum advisor this summer! I'm excited.
Alex is thorough, smart and understanding. He helps students and gives really freely of his time. He is very encouraging and lively.
No Comments
Dr. Sevigny explains things very clearly.
good prof. good explanations
Alex is a communications poet! Take his class. The best prof at Mac. Metarep!!
Dr. Sevigny is a great lecturer. Alex, your little stories are soooo cute!
amazing prof... very engaging public speaker.
Dr. Sevigny is a great prof. He's young, more like one of us. He's cute too.
alex is so cool. Yay for the Representational Theory of Mind!!!
Dr. Sevigny is extremely helpful and kind to students. He a model prof.
I am in love with Dr. Sevigny. He is pretty cute and quirky.
No Comments
Alex is sexy in a quiet, logical, funny way. He's mysterious.
Isn't it ironic that the communications prof has the WORST communications skills
Really likes cats & fencing, but helps students out a lot...really young too.
Alex is an inspiration. He's brilliant.
For the course being totally new I was impressed
No Comments
Makes you think...
He's a kewl and hip dood.
No Comments
No Comments
a great prof - makes ya think!
No Comments
No Comments
Not that bad, he's pretty funny
yeah hes not bad. good for a laugh (both with and at him)
My best profesor yet. An inspiration.
No Comments
Ok. He tends to go off on tangents and tell stories about his cat and fencing

comments: MY FAVOURITE PROF EVER! Dr Hughes was the dream physics prof: funny, great at explaining, always available to go over any questions, and cared so much about her students. She's the only first year prof I've had who learnt my name. Definitely this course requires work, but it's so fun it doesn't even feel like work. I looked forward to this class

best prof in the world. not only is she sarcastic and hilarious and the strongest baddest b ever she's so caring and helpful. knows her whole class' names!! i failed a quiz and went to see her and she sat with me as we went over it and ended up changing my mark to 80

The BEST prof I've ever had. Honestly, although her class was difficult and the final was hell for many she really makes you work hard and love physics. Thanks to her I'm going into physics as her lectures were so interesting and different from other classes.

One of the  best profs I have had. She is sassy and super fun to be around. She really cares about her students but YOU have to take the initiative to be a good student. The marks will not be handed on a silver plate but they will be most definitely well deserved. She is nothing if not fair. Worth taking this class as a challenge.
She's super funny and she's so chill with the students!

Very tough tests. No notes were ever posted and lots of homework assignments. Didn't like her teaching style at first but got used to it and enjoyed it on the end. Pushes understanding not memorizing.

Amazing prof that really shows how awesome physics is. Upon coming to university I hated physics, but after having Dr. Hughes as a prof for two first year physics courses (only took the second because I knew Hughes was teaching it), I'm probably going to end up going into physics now.

No lecture or overhead slides at all. She expects you to read the textbook before class and does quizzes on the material before she teaches it. She also tends to randomly pick people in the class and asks them questions which is intimidating. Do not take this course with her!

I don't know where the hate is coming from but definitely THE best prof for physics first year. So many people from other profs ended up sitting in on her lectures. Ask around! I'm not lying. And she is such a sweet person. Really cares to see you understanding the material. Will even know your name by the end of class!
I love her teaching style, she's funny and interesting. She always keeps me awake by making me constantly take notes.. Unlike some of my courses where the profs just read from the lecture slides.
most terrible professor if you are new to the apparently "univeristy" method of teaching that involves "no notes, no powerpoints, no overheads"

Dr. Hughes is an absolutely incredible physics prof. Her lectures are clear, engaging, and insightful, and she is always open to helping students and answering questions. Her style, no doubt, is not for everyone, but if you are seeking an intellectually gratifying physics experience I would highly recommend taking a class with Dr. Hughes.
She's way too quirky. No lecture notes provided at all. No powerpoints, only overheads which she never copies for us. 53 average on first midterm.
Karen Hughes is really good at physics and teaches it well. However, she gives homework almost every class as if this is the only course we have for the term.

She is a nice lady, but I hate her lecture style. Basically, you teach yourself through the textbook and ask questions during the lecture time. If you are not good at physics, I would suggest another prof. The midterm was ridiculous, 50% average, and she's surprised we did so bad.
Good prof, tests are fun and challenging, but gives too many boring assignments.

Absolutely hated physics after the first class I took, but Hughes was a huge improvement. She made the class interesting with all the demonstrations and such, and was great at explaining things. I do wish she would post notes online, and the tests were EXTREMELY hard.

I absolutely loved Dr Hughes! At first, I was quite disgruntled by her lack of note making, but she is be far the best prof I've had so far. She really makes you understand what you're doing, instead of just giving you equations and telling you to use them. If you ask her for help, she will make sure you understand the main concepts and is thorough

Dr. Hughes is an EXCELLENT prof, I had her for both Physics 1B03 and 1BA3. She is quirky, yet clear and VERY interesting. Don't come to class asleep though because there is some serious thinking required. Her midterms and exams are also BRUTAL, but she is very eager to help if you go see her.

Difficult tests, but SO much fun. Physics isn't really my forte and I was initially upset that she doesn't post notes on avenue, but I found that you don't really need them in the sense that she really makes the lectures worthwhile. Class was almost always filled with discussions, and she (somehow) made physics really fun to learn about!

I had Dr. Hughes for 1B03 and 1BA3 last year. Her teaching style did not revolve around equations but rather on concepts. She did a great job keeping the class engaged, and lectures will full of discussions. I did not sit through one lecture without thinking extensively about a problem. She is very clear in all of her explanations. Excellent prof

She is honestly the best prof i have had to date and i am a biopsych Major. But don't confuse her amazing teaching style with the level of difficulty. She is awesome but if physics is not your cup of tea the class prolly wont be the highlight of your day

I had Dr. Hughes for 1B03 and 1BA3. She was a great prof, well I thought. A lot of people hated it cause they didnt like the difficulty of Physics. She was always so helpful, whenever I had a question or concern I would just ask and she would help. I got a C+ in 1B03 and a B- in 1BA3. The courses were tough but, she made it fun to learn

Our class got KILLED on her midterms but she is a super nice and funny prof who explains things so well that I felt stupid for not understanding stuff after she went over it...she makes it look so easy!

If you are looking for a traditional physics teacher that just puts formulas on the board and gives you problems, you will not find this here. She is always interactive with her class and is always keeping you thinking. People may complain about her not giving out class notes, but you don't need them! She makes everything easy to understand and FUN

Professor Hughes had her own unique way of teaching, which I don't think is for everyone. She did not provide notes, but instead taught a lesson almost in a story format. You really have to pay attention in her class and take really good notes. She keeps you engaged and is very approachable after class. I personally enjoyed her teaching style.
She's not for everyone and she admits that. I didn't like her just because she didn't give solid notes, admittedly i skipped classes though. She's approachable, usually answers any q's after class
If you are hesitant about taking physics, DO NOT take it with this prof

Honestly the best professor I have ever had. Rather than giving a list of equations and boring notes she uses the lecture time to explain the concepts to us. Generally, a class will consist of a quiz or two, her telling us why we're wrong, us arguing, and then her proving us wrong again. This helps us learn alot. 10 out of 10!
Knows her stuff very well! Always answers class questions and actually makes an effort to learn people's names! The class is not easy, but Dr. Hughes makes physics *gasp* fun!

Well the last person probably failed physics....   still hughes is a great teacher, she is completely willing to stay after class for however long to help you, and she explains everything crystal clear, plus she makes physics more fun that it probably should be.
A terrible professor. Doesn't know how to teach, and has bad attitude toward students.

Still the person from the last comment. It's absolutely untrue to say that she does not help, or belittles you. No. On the other hand she will always provide help, and she understands what you have problem with and knows the exact words you need to hear to understand. Her classes are engaging and interesting. Serious phy people always liked her.

She was the best prof I've had in 1st yr 1st sem. Wonderful teaching style. Some would prefer the stupid "slides" or "formal notes". But physics is not organization, structure, information. It's about understanding and applying in the problem, and she makes them crystal clear. You won't get anywhere with the "slides" and "organized" presentations.

Just like other people say, she is very enthusiastic and makes physics seem like fun. However, physics is a very tricky subject and needs a lot of time and effort, I guess formal course notes could have been used. Don't know if that would have changed difficulty though.

The rating for this professor will vary drastically from person to person. Her teaching style's different. There are no 'formal' notes. You have to make the conscious effort to study on your own and discuss those concepts in class. If you don't like her way of running the course, then you will HATE her. If it suits you, you will love her class.
Just when you think you understand physics, well a thing or two always goes wrong. Her lectures are really interesting and not to mention her "physics jokes" really make the class more enjoyable.

Not a bad prof, I liked how she explained things although I was annoyed at how she randomly picked people to answer. The in-classes quizzes were good for showing how much material we should know, and she was so funny... "What is the floor made of?" *silence* "Floor atoms!!"
A little intimidating to approach, and can belittle you somewhat. I think she does care however, because she makes an effort to be clear and thorough with her explanations.
Average Prof
No Comments

She teaching concepts well in class, but she does like to pick on people, and many don't like that. She is also very hard to approach, and can make you feel very stupid when you ask a question. She teaches well, but she stops students from asking for more assistance.
Her teaching techniques are definately different. Class notes were useless, and picking on random people was pretty nerve racking too. Hated it.

Very clear! She would explain things so well, you would understand and then ask you a question that really makes you wonder if you do in fact understand. When she solves the problem the world makes sense again

her teaching style is based on self-learning. she will make u do questions and then give u the answer. Randomly picking ppl was kinda annoying (but thank God) she never picked on me. yeah, did someone mention that she doesnt wear a bra.. which is more annoying than randomly picking ppl. u cant concentrate in calss bc of that!
Worst prof ever.
if you don't like being randomly picked on in class, I suggest you do not have her as a prof
sooooo hard. wont help you out at all. worst class everrr. if u dont absoluteelyy loveeee physics then dont take it with her.

She often assigns a problem, goes on a coffee break during lecture for 10min, and finds that she has to solve the question herself wasting more time.  Lecture notes were garbage, and yes the random picking of people in class was very annoying.

Shes a Great prof (10/10)  She helped me a lot!!! Go to her office if you need help and shell help you a lot!  You have to stay awake in her lectures too cause she does throw randome things out (which are good!)
Even though I failed the class, I have to say Hughes is a very good prof. Very engaging, and you always have to pay attention in case she randomly picks you to answer a question.

the hardest and most traumatizing course i had to go through...it was actually worse than calculus! she used to pick random ppl, which was so embarrassing, especially if u didn't know the answers. and omg! her style of lecturing was just rediculous :(!!!
great prof, very patient, doesn't have set office hours which is a pain, she randomly chooses people to participate in class, doesn't have notes-gotta make your own. 50% of class will fail the exam.

OMG..the best thing ever was the gun, the gorilla and the hat :D I heart hughes!

Great Prof! Engaging and helpful. If I had any doubts about ever taking more physics courses during university, she abolished them!
Good prof...Hard tests if you don't like physics + she needs to learn that there is a thing called a bell curve! Apparently she doesn't know about it...
Physics is annoying yet she somehow made the class interesting.  Quite impressive indeed...
amazing prof

A bird course. I know of no one who got less than an A... he sounds like he's fresh of the boat from the "Iron Curtain" but is full of good intent, although he seemed obsessed with redefining engineering!
This guy is awesome! "If de computerrr ees stewpid peese of metal..."
VERY enthusiastic and entertaining. He's a good guy with a really unorganized course. Kudos to the crazy cows. And people "More questions, please!"

all i have to say...slow down with the over heads and teach something that i haven't heard in a thousand other classes
Nicest guy ever, really cares about students. Wants to see you learn. Best accent ever.

I feel bad for him, he's a good, nice guy...he's not very good at lecturing (extremely boring and useless material), but he does try...

comments: His teaching style is very hard to follow. He constantly jumps among topics and gets off track frequently. His lectures were basically a brief summary of the textbook. Going to class wasn't useful because the exams were purely from the specific details of  the textbook that he did not cover in his lectures.

You NEED the textbook for this class or you will fail. Dr Cummins teaching is pretty disorganized. His stories and personality make me want to attend class, but you don't need to attend to pass. I would suggest doing the quizzes online and reading the chapter summaries & Key words if you can't find the time to read everything
Awesome guy. I have had him for two courses, and both of them were relatively small. Very engaging prof, good videos, and funny character. Nice guy. Exams were fair as well as how he marked.

Good stories included in lectures however, teacher is very disorganized. Lectures are poorly taught. He jumps from topic to topic. Very confusing. If you don`t use the textbook you will fail. Simple as that.
A very engaging lecturer.  I learned a great deal and enjoyed doing it.  He brings character and enthusiasm to the subject matter.  Two thumbs up, I would like to take more courses with this prof!

Hard to hear in a big lecture hall, but his stories were wonderful.  Very humourous and always showed great passion for what he was speaking about.  His stories made you remember the concept he was teaching.  When the lecture it done, you're outta there and I appreciated that.  Nice guy, great speaker, loads of experience.

terrible proff. Doesn't use power points or even a microphone so its really hard to hear him and therefore pay any attention. his lectures were exactly what was in the textbook, so the only plus is i could just do my readings and not have to go to class. i have no interest in taking anthro again

The worst professor i have ever had. Expects the student students to comprehend and discuss the readings in the exam but does not even mention any of them in class. He tests at a level well beyond his the level he lectures at and assigns readings that are at graduate level comprehension. avoid him if you can.

Best. Lecturer. Ever. A storyteller who seems to go off-track, but he's not - he's telling stories to help you remember the point. He doesn't waste time - if the lecture is over, you're out early. You must attend class, and you must do the readings. One of the most enjoyable courses I've taken, although my major is Sociology, not Anthropology.
Really have to pay attention to the readings that he assigns.Also, he had to make the exam short answer because most people did so poorly on the midterm (which was all multiple-choice)

He is a cool person, but in my opinion not a very great prof. He tends to use trick questions on the exams.Read every reading he assigns or its game over (and he assigns ALOT.  He has a tendency to make student who ask questions feel really stupid...good luck!
I really enjoyed this class. He is a great prof, that expects high quality from his students

lectures were decent, but you had to attend to get the notes, have to read the text to get all the info. i went for help once, worst experience of my life. he was rude and very unprofessional. I will not be taking another of his courses

In all 4 years of my university career Professor Cummins is by far the greatest prof I've ever had. He is very friendly, his lectures are clear, and his exams are fairly easy (multiple choice). The exams definitely do require you to do ALL of the readings in the main text book.
Clear about content in class, very unclear about what is expected in assignments and what you are expected to know for tests. Interresting material though and well taught.

Loved the prof and the content from the classes was interesting. I loved Cummins! Hes sarcastic and says things that are very unexpected. The midterm was hard because the content on it was mostly textbook, but would have been alot easier had I known what to focus on. The 1st paper was unfairly marked by the TA (2nd ok) BUT WOULD RECOMMEND COURSE!!

took his magic witchcraft course. Wow, it doesn't really appear he knows anything regarding this subject. he made us watch a considerable number of history channel documentaries. Is this what I pay to attend university for? the history channel? he does not read the texts he enforces you to purchase.

love him!he is a genius. he lectures wonderfully. i actually enjoy going to his night classes. he is extremely passionate, fair and open. unfortunately this year he changed the midterm format to make it more 'fair' to those who can't write essays but the midterm was rough!!
Dr. Cummins is not only an incredible teacher, he is one of the best people I have known. He brings this humanity to his teaching and understanding of the course content.
Best prof. around!

Wicked class! <3've it! he's a vry humorous teacher and is passionate about what he teaches. alot of readings, the midterm and final are easy if you take good notes and attend class. assignment was challenging, and a waste of money though for the book, which i won't read again =) recomend you take the class as an elective if u get the chance! =D
Very passionate prof! He is very hard to keep up with but he tells good stories

He was a fun prof and overall he was pretty good, however it was often impossible to keep up with taking notes. He provides little or no notes (only some on the blackboard which was hard to read)other than oral.
Too many readings..it was impossible to keep up...but his stories were interesting

Dr. Cummins is incredible! He's a a great lecturer and also evaluates fairly. He's very knowledgable and passionate about Aboriginal issues. His classes are quite eye opening. I encourage everyone to take ANTHRO 2B03.

I thought Dr. Cummins was an amazing prof! He was very helpful and non-judgmental. I loved the way he spoke with sarcasm especially when he wanted to get the point across!  He also tells great stories of his past whihc are fun!  His lectures are long but powerful, interesting and most of all educational! He is worth the $400 class;)
hilarious guy and so helpful if you ever need help
Funny, intelligent and off the wall, a good Prof!
never ever take a class with him. especially one where you have to read something written by him. his book only god can own the land is horrible, boring and badly written.
horrible prof do not take him.
This Prof doesn't have a clue what he is teaching. His classes are horribly boring and I didn't learn a thing.
Great prof. He worked hard ot challenge his students.  I really admire him.
the guy is brilliant and passionate about his subject--not arrogant and rude.
No Comments
This is the most arogant self-centered prof.yet! Bordering on rude, he is loud and unclear. Would not recommend taking any courses with him...he's a total goof.

comments: Great Prof, Much easier to follow in class lectures if you have read the selected textbook section before hand. Midterm, Quizzes and Assignments straight forward if you have kept up with the work. Labs were fun if you have prepared, don't be afraid to ask your TA questions. Final Exam was worth alot and was hella hard ! Prepare yourself

Dr. Brock is a great professor, in every sense of the word. He takes care to explain difficult concepts and make them seem easy. He also blends his lectures with a good balance of humour and clarity. My favourite chemistry prof so far.

Wonderful professor, actually cares for his students and can connect with them on personal levels in and outside of the classroom. Very clear and concise with his teaching of material and can present it in a very sustainable, easy, and funny way. The best professor I had in first year.

Dr. Brock is the best! He explains things very well, is very nice and super helpful. Even if you don't have an interest in chemistry, he makes you enjoy lectures! And  he's such a cutie and makes nerdy jokes that are awesome!
Good at teaching first years, not so much an upper year class.

- gave a pure memorization mid term after stating the mid term would not be memorization based - If you followed the rubric you still got a 60  - When asked for clarification on quizzes TAs did not help/know the answer/care - iClickers Brock did not make clear and when asked for clarification responded with "it means what is says" - subjective
Most disorganized course I've ever taken. Every grade was very subjective and unfair. Learned nothing from him or the course. The only thing I took from it was a lowered GPA.
Absolutely my favourite prof in University. Genuinely cares about his student and makes the content fun and easy to digest. Amazing prof and amazing person, wish he could teach all of my courses!
Hes a great guy.

He is a great professor, he really knows how to teach and he is always there to help and encourages people to come to the help centre and many people do go, because he is really good at explaining. He is an inspiration and always has a smile on his face :)

Great professor, but he talks too quickly and assumes class understands the content. I enjoyed that he made chemistry interesting, but had to self teach myself a lot of the concepts in  order to fully understand.
Very helpful prof. Loves his students. Makes chemistry interesting and easy to understand.

Come to class, be dedicated, and you will get amazing grades, and make sure to go to the help centre and tutorials if you are not great at labs take advantage of these tutorialshelp centre hours but I'd say if you attend lectures, tutorials, you can get an easy 10! and prep for labs, there really isn't enough lab time without prep! AWESOME PROF!
He's the reason I went into Chemistry.
He is a great professor. I wish he taught more upper year courses.
He really cares about the students.

hands down the best prof at mac. SUPER helpful - i actually never liked chem but his lectures  made me want to GO to class and actively participate - haven't had that happen in any other class so far.

Dr. Brock is amazing! Makes bad jokes sometimes but keeps the class light and enjoyable. Also, he's always smiling and cute as a button! I don't usually enjoy chemistry, but I was always excited to go to his class. Sad that I won't have him next semester.
Really helpful, fantastic professor.

Brilliant professor & definitely one of the best ever.  However, ironically, he's almost always the one to contribute or to be involved with the most difficult midterm/exam questions... Nonetheless, if you attend class, you hardly ever need to use the textbook at all!  He explains things clearly, and he's a funny and enjoyable guy to have teaching.
Best chem prof ever!!! He's a really young, enthusiastic prof. He does a lot of demos and is really funny.
Best prof in first year hands down. Explains stuff really well, always replies to emails, and was really enthusiastic about the course(s).
Always available when you need help, overall amazing prof!

Incredible, INCREDIBLE teacher! Definitely the BEST teacher I've ever had at McMaster! He explains everything so well, makes the course very interesting, he's very enthusiastic, very approachable, and very humorous. He's been getting teaching awards at the university, and I think he absolutely deserves them.
Best chemistry teacher I've ever had.

He explains concepts clearly and makes them interesting and funny. Very helpful after class and answers questions in class clearly as well. He is the best teacher I have ever had and has won teaching awards to back it up. You should do whatever you can to take his class you wont regret it!

Dr. Brock was a saint, compared to my highschool teacher. I went to Mac totally unprepared for chemistry, and I hated the subject. However, I attended all of Brock's classes and he was tremendous in lectures, and definitely delivered the content in a very understandable way. Loved this man, and I missed him 2nd semester! Also, attend his reviews!
Had him for chem 1a03 and 1aa3, amazing prof, helped me learn a lot! I was never good at chem in high school so I hated chem but brock's demos made class interesting!
amazing prof! very interactive with the class, really tries to make you love chem as much as he does. very helpful, honest about exam difficulty, and really funny! one of my fav profs at mac so far
An amazing prof! Only reason I was able to wake up for 8:30 class was because he was teaching it. Really funny and makes the material interesting.
Great prof. Super nice! You can tell that he really likes what he is doing and wants everyone to understand the material! One of my favourite profs at Mac!
Great prof, lots of interesting experiments and demos. Funny and very helpful.

comments: THE best professor you can expect

McLean's lectures were the highlight of my week, and I wasn't even officially in his lectures. I went because his teaching style was so good, it was engaging and logical. He answers student's questions well and clearly.
Great lecturer keeps you interested and sometimes sings
Excellent prof. Even though he posts all his lectures online, his classes are always full. That should speak to how well of a job he is doing.

I would recommend Prof. McLean over and over again. His teaching ability is outstanding especially if you have trouble in calculus. He is always available for help and questions. His wit and hilarity make lectures not only fun but something to look forward to.
wastes alot of time cracking jokes, but I dont mind it that way. The less material he covers, the less ill have to study

hes a good prof, available after class for help. teaches well and makes the material really understandable. Also makes lectures "fun" and entertaining. For some reason, i still didn't do TOO well in the course, maybe cause it stats lol but overall he's an awesome prof.

Dr. McLean is the best and there's nothing new about that. The entire uni and math department already know that by now. Dr. Mclean makes 8:30 classes so interesting that it's worth going to. Moreover, his lecture notes are heavenly. Easily the best math prof the uni has ever had.
This guy will teach you math that you will remember in your 50s.
This guy will teach you math that you will remember in your 50s. Amazing professor, will take him again!

McLean is a great professor, I took him in my Engineering first year for Math 1ZA3. He is the best professor I have ever know. He teaches so well and maintains a friendly atmosphere in class. He has a lot of funny jokes. Due to his teaching I changed my complete Winter schedule so that I can get McLean in Winter too.
He's hilarious and great in lectures. Explains things thoroughly and sets fair exams. Just do all the homework and it's not bad. MSAF the second test, trust me lol
Mr. Mclean was a very entertaining and sometimes slightly cringy proffessor

Favorite teacher in my first year. I had him in MATH 1ZB3 and MATH 1ZC3, he really helped me a lot. As long as attending his class and put a bit effort, an A is totally doable. Even though his classes are on the morning, I strongly suggest you guys to attend. Teaches very clearly and is very funny and easy to talk with. 6 out of 5 on the rating!

McLean is the best. He explains clearly and chips in jokes every now and then. The only bad thing about his class is that everyone wants to be in it so it's usually very full. Get to class early. Trust me  it's worth the 8:30
Easily my greatest prof in first year engineering
Best prof I met so far. The classroom is always full even when it is close to the end of the term
Definitely an amazing prof, I am so glad to have all the math lectures he teaches in first year.
He's cool and really makes an effort to make the class interesting. His jokes can be out of the line at times and a little awkward, but is very open to questions during lecture.
Awesome lectures. Very thorough in explaining concepts, pays close attention to detail, passionate, never a dull moment. Wish I had him for future courses.
He loves math sooo much!!! Best teacher for this class!!

He is SO funny and has SO much enthusiasm!! I had him for a summer course, so lectures were SO long and our room wasn't air conditioned, and he STILL got everyone to come! He explains everything really well. He is also the most helpful one if the math help center. Switch cores to have any math class with him if you have the option!!
Chris is a great prof. Love the enthusiasm! Very inspirational!

He's Very Engaging and uses plenty of visual and cognitive examples and models to get the course ideas across. Tests are not easy, but usually stuff you've seen before.   I failed the first time I took the course (1ZB3) but I took it again and got an A so if you pay attention and keep up, you should be fine, the material isn't overly challenging
Amazing Prof!!
Sole reason I passed first year calculus.
awesome proff
Such a good professor!!
Really interesting lectures. He somehow manages to make over 300 students interested in calculus at 8:30 in the morning.
Extremely clear. One of the best professors in McMaster by far!
Easily the best prof i've had
I didn't think I would ever say that calculus was my favourite class to go to until I had this guy as a prof.  Great guy, fantastic prof.

This man is a god. If you have not had the pleasure of sitting in one of his lectures, you need to do so ASAP. Even though I'm not in his second semester math class, I will definitely be going to it regardless of what my timetable says. He is loud, hilarious and actually teaches you what you need to know in an entertaining way. Absolute legend.

Great Teacher. He makes class much easier with clear explanations. Does not complicate things. The things he writes on the overhead are excellent notes. He was able to make people laugh at 830 am . At the end of the last lecture everyone stood up and gave him a standing ovation. absolute legend.
Best prof for first year eng you can have. Even when I wasn't in his class, I would rearrange my schedule to make to to go to it. I've had 4 math profs at Mac, and this guy is far and away the best.

Probably the best prof I've had. He does a really great job at keeping lectures entertaining and informative. A difficult task-- especially with a course like stats. I wish he taught all my courses, honestly.

One of the most awesome profs you could have as a first year engineering student. Entertaining lectures, usually overcrowded with people from other sections. Very helpful. Tests and exams typically follow sample test format.
Amazing clarity, effectiveness, and enthusiasm. Great character!

He is so nice and helpful, truly has such a passion for teaching. I SUCK at math and he spent almost 15 minutes with me explaining special triangles and pie. He genuwinely cared that i didn't understand the concept and spent time with me to help me understand. I dont think anyone has his level of patience at the the math help centre! Thanks!

Great professor, knows his audience really well and is more than willing to assist any student struggling, you just have to ask for help! Tests are fair and assignments are easy if you go to class and pay attention. Highly recommend him as a 1st year math professor especially.

Great teacher! Really funny and all you have to do is ask if you don't understand. Tests we're fair and so were the assignments. Super easy to talk to and will even go out of his way to talk to you if he knows you!

Made tests incredibly more difficult than the work done in class. Kept lectures too simple and didn't help me at all. Had to teach myself Stats at the end of the day and my mark suffered because of it.
Many of his in-class examples failed, so they became very unhelpful. I wish he was more organized. Exam was rather hard compared to rest of material.

I love this guy...hes so helpful and willing to answer any questions math related.  His tests are fine and not that difficult if you understand the material.  Just work hard in his class and you will surely succeed.  He's the BEST!!!
Really great prof. Only time i did well in math.

BEST prof of 1st Year Engineering, imo. Hilarious, helpful, and humble. Very understandable, lectures are interesting and engaging. HIGHLY recommended, switch course cores until you get one with this guy!
Great prof
No Comment
Favorite teacher. And this feeling only grew stronger the other day when he mentioned the big bang theory in his lecture :)

Very entertaining professor, and made the easy boring calculus more enjoyable. His midterms and exam were quite easy, despite a low class grade. He spends extensive amounts of time explaining simple concepts, but should have been very helpful for those not understanding the content. Practice problems given in class or website were similar to tests.

Very entertaining professor, and made the easy boring calculus more enjoyable. His midterms and exam were quite easy, despite a low class grade. He spends extensive amounts of time explaining simple concepts, but should have been very helpful for those not understanding the content. Practice problems given in class or website were similar to tests.
The best prof ever! Very enthusiastic about math and always helpfull!!!
I loved him! He always talked about his lizard haha. He never made me feel stupid either, plus our TA that he set up review sessions with was amazing!

I can't figure out why Dr. McLean has a low overall rating! He is awesome. Lectures are easy, he's excellent at explaining things, gives great practice problems, very fair tests and is great with the assignments. I was worried about uni calc because I hadn't had it since the beginning of grade 12 but he made the transition seamless. One of the best

Fantastic. Very funny in a super cheesy way but it keeps things interesting. Very clear and consist, I would never have gotten through calculus without him. Passionate about math, and loves to make fun of himself - it's great.
Very humorous, which keeps math class interesting.
Funniest dude ever!!

ONE OF THE BEST MATH TEACHERS I'VE HAD. Because he taught me calculus, it's not as scary and hard as I expected.. i might even dare say it's quite easier than advanced functions! love love love him. Full of positive energy, consistent mood, funny mentions of his lizard Hector, same different coloured hats and same different coloured shirts!

A brilliant man that is incredibly passionate about his subject. I really don't think it's fair that people condemn him for writing "hard" tests. This is university, where we are supposed to be challenged. Easy tests leave students unchallenged and with a superficial understanding of the material. This isn't highschool. You have to WORK to do well.

Hilarious, animated, and at the same time clear with his explanations and analogies. I haven't had a test in his class yet but he seems more than willing to help people out as best he can both in class and during office hours.

He's an amazing professor! He tries his best to help everyone that requires it and always answers all his e-mails, even with fully explained solutions! He's dedicated, very very passionate about what he teaches and loves to crack jokes to make us grin. He tries his best to make his students learn as much as they can while still being extremely fair

His doors are always open for "math help" but he closes the doors to your future when he gives you a failing grade in his courses. His exams are the most unfair, tricky+ ambigous. Why is this Joker teaching engineering students? He doesn't understand we have other hard courses already. He increases our stress level with his ridiculously hard tests.

This prof does not even remember the combination of his own locks at the math help centre. Then how can he be suited to teach University level math? A lot of students witnessed the scene he created when he could not open the cabinet because he forgot his lock's combination. Wasted so much time of students that day. Gives poor grades to students.

Amazing Prof. VERY Helpful prof. He is the Number 1 prof in my books, that's why I'm giving him top ratings all ONE's. He is so easy on the eyes too. I go to class, just to stare at him. My summer is going so well this time, just because this prof is eye candy. I would love to make out with him ;)

he takes teaching very seriously and thinks he's all that, and what not, he thinks he's such a great prof. but he does not take the grades he assigns to students very seriously. giving low grades and UNFAIR TESTS makes him feel happy. what a sad excuse of a C.L.A instructor. Hope mcmaster doesn't re-hire him.
XD at all these comments

I saw this Big Boy shopping one day, he had so much food in his cart. I guess he loves to eat. He writes very unreasonable exams and the failure of his students gives him happiness. Mean sadistic proffff
Great prof, great gut
He makes his midterms very challenging. HE seems like a nice guy but he really needs to learn that a test is a test NOT A CHALLENGE.
I want to go on a date with this prof but I am too shy to ask him out. Hopefully he will be my Valentine. That would be a dream come true.

Amazing Prof. Dr. McLean is AmAzInG. He really knows first year calculus. He must be a very smart guy. I mean, think about it, HE KNOWS FIRST YEAR CALCULUS which is the hardest thing in the whole Universe. He teaches people how to take the derivative, how to take the integral. Those big big words like derivative, integral make me very VERY scared.
He's cute! :)
awesome prof! very funny!
nice beard! and his cap is nice too.
Fun and slightly crazy. Good teacher too, though gets sidetracked at times.
Lots of energy and great examples. He makes for a fun class!
he iz a kewl dude....awesome teacher
Makes good (and constant) use of cheesy pop culture analogies to math.
Great prof. Explained PDEs very well. The silly math dept only gave him one course in the fall. Fools!

Oh Chris McLean, where would we be without you?  Uses great examples, often involving some sort of horrible death, such as a molasses silo breaking down and covering a whole town in sticky goo.  His pacman analogy made me understand f(g(x))!  Great guy.

Spends way too much time doing useless derivations, and he makes each of three multiple choice questions on a test worth 15% of the test mark with no part marks.  Could be doing better in the course with a better prof

Best Math prof out there.. actually.. best prof all together! HALARIOUS TOO! He even beats childs! Very funny.. I've never missed a class.. and i actually understand calculus! He's the best there is!                                               ps. If at first you don't succeed, re-define success! LOL!
jokes guy...knows his****....great prof
Amazing prof. Knows the material, explains really well, and is just a cool guy. You can tell he loves the stuff he teaches.  Expect hilarious lectures.
He's so funny. his lectures are intresting and he makes math so easy. great professor!
