comments: Has favorites, vague marking criteria, unwilling to explain or adjust marks - definitely would not recommend
Not an easy class, but a great professor!

Professor Stockton is very good at conveying material. Where she lacks is interpersonal skills. My experience found her to be rather offensive and uncompromising. She was an extremely difficult marker when it came to the presentations. If you care about your grades and can take this course with an alternate professor, I would highly recommend it.

Great Prof, she worked her way up in the real word. She stresses a lot that the students are future managers who is bringing values to the workplace so we have to have a sense of responsibility and our business ethic will have to be on top. She does have very high expectations so be prepared to work hard. It was the most work I've done in a class.
No guidelines, does not compromise

I have never written a review on a prof, but I had to for this one. Had the opportunity to take it with another prof and I should have! She thinks 70 is a great mark so anyone that needs marks i.e. Accounting, good luck! Hopefully you understand your final grade, I know I didn't. 1st midterm opened 3rd week... fair warning.
hard marker. Don't know how she marks the presentation but everyone in the class was getting a really low grade

Pours her heart and soul into her teaching. Is there to  help when asked. Enjoyed the course. Lectures engaging. Tries to include everyone. Lots of work but worth it for what I learned. Lots of stories help you to remember the material. Knows her stuff well. Keeps it current and interesting. Tries to link with what's going on in the world.
Shes cool.
The Worst professor at Mac.
She is a good prof and is willing to help you if you ask her. Really enjoyed the class. It wasn't difficult but the work load for assignments is too high
great prof, really interesting, but hard. you will learn a lot in the class but prepare to work hard!

Linda is an excellent professor. The only one I've had in my 4 years at Mac that makes 3 hours not totally unbearable. Most of her stories are funny and when you study, they actually help you remember things. Since participation is key, and the lecture size is small, make sure you put some time and effort into making a connection.
Great professor, very helpful! One of the best!

Actually a great prof. Yeah, some of the marking can be hard but it makes you work hard for a good mark. She is always willing to help any student out if you go by her office and ask her questions. She's tough, but for good reasoning.
Very disappointed
Worst required course ever. Waste of time with all the country presentations. Marking Scheme is extremely vague.
She is full of her self. She has her favourites. Her course outline and expectations are not clear. She is one of the worst profs.

Worst prof at Mac. She marks things with arbitrary marking schemes which you do not see until after the assignment is handed back. She is not willing to discuss or adjust marks. The course outline does not tell you want she is looking for. She has favourites and if you're not one, you won't do well. Take the course with any other prof if you can.

This was by far the WORST class I have taken in my four years at McMaster. It is a complete waste of money and I am embarrassed this is a required course. I did barely any work and got a 12, but can't say I learnt anything. Half of the things she says are wrong or out dated. WORST CLASS, TAKE OTHER PROFESSOR!
She has obvious favourites (and these people give here the 'good' reviews...). Otherwise, she's a terrible prof. Please take the other IB prof's class if possible.
Linda pwns whiners.  She's super-fantasmotastic and her TAs are hawt.
awful class. worst prof. EVER!
The professor, for the mandatory international business class, that didn't know which political party Obama is in. I think that says enough about the level of knowledge she holds.
Terrible. Absolutely terrible.
arbitratry marking scheams
Worst prof I've ever had in 4 years in the program.

She does have favourites. She will give you advice on things you don't need to include in an assignment and then you lose marks for not including it. She will not give you an indicator of what to include in your work but will expect you to include it at an MBA level. (How are we to learn if we don't have some sort of benchmark startingpoint?)
One of the worst profs I have encountered in my 4 years at Mac. Grading system is completely arbitrary, based on random variables like if she likes you/pities you etc.
Very helpful and really cares about us.
I liked her, she has much real-world experience and punishes bad group members (one of the few profs that is stern with not rewarding social loafers).
not the best prof

Lectures are engaging, but information is sometimes inaccurate or outdated. She can seem very nice, but grades are very arbitrary. I have compared work with other students on hand-in assignments and different people lose different amounts of marks for same thing. DeGroote deserves better (sorry, Linda)
Needs to update her slides and movies which are from the early 90s. Case discussions always go off topic into talking about politics, her family, her old job, her and alcohol, etc.
Can be nice but do not be deceived by her smile. She marks based on how she likes you and not on content.
Great Prof. Very helpful and good sense of humour.

Prof is a ****.  If you are of asian decent you are automatically Chinese and born in China.  She renamed foreign exchange student Nacho instead of pronouncing his really name and thinks thats amusing.  Berated other professors infront of class to show her lack of class and professionalism.  Made ****s comments constantly in class.

Thinks she knows everthing, Facts are usually out of date and she has the typical extreme pro-business bias. Globalization is one of the most important ethical dilemma and all its cons were just brushed aside.  She tells lame jokes in class that infuriate me. Bought the $130 textbook and never opened it. Case Stude was useless, overall bad course.

Great person, great friend. Always willing to help, but only those who ask! Anyone who rates her badly never tried to engage her. I'll be keeping in touch with her for years to come - She's wonderful.
awful. just awful.

Has favourites. Thinks she knows everything and better than everyone. Her laugh is a huge turn off. But at least she isn't boring and makes funny comments throughout class especially about her family to make that three hours not seem too long. Not the worse prof but far from the best. Try Vilks.
Enjoyed the course and the prof. Good sense of humour. Kept me engaged. Looked forward to class. High expectations but fair.

1.Useless course 2.Why is it a required course? 3. She has no background in economics or finance 4. Why is a marketer teaching economics (supposedly)? 5. She should take ECON-1A06 (She'd probably fail it though) 6. Should learn about international environment first before teaching it 7. My dead grandma has more upto-date data 8. Go back to retail!
Great prof. Easy to approach. Makes time for students and is willing to make exceptions in certain circumstances. Well taught course. Good  style.
She is always prepared for class and has high expectations for us. Has a great sense of humour and cares very much for her students. Is always available for help and advice. Has time for us.
****y personality. She makes the course seem harder than it is. Some of her info is outdated. The course itself is good and interesting - could use a better prof or better teaching method.
No Comments

This class is a required course but is basically intro marketing with the phrase, "with an international emphasis" attached to everything said. The assignments are like high school assignments but marked at an insane level with no fairness. Told us not to use bibliography but deducted marks cause we listened to her. TA's never give marks.
Well after reading the rules, I think I can say that she is a total ****. Thank You.

Terrible Professor She is rude, unsympathetic, treats all students with no respect, especially international students. Doesn't really know what she is talking about. Does not answer your questions, or responds to you but treats you like an idiot. Her material is very dated, created years ago. She just regurgitates info she may have researched once.
At first seems fair but is not. You think you know what you are doing on assignments, etc. but when you receive them back they are marked unfairly.

She is a very unfair professor.  It's completely obvious that she favours certain individuals over others.  Very unclear about what she expects and so you never know how well you did on any assignment's and presentations.
don't really need to follow class until exam, country presentation, group work and company project take up time
She is a great lecturer and very personale person, who's door is always open.  My only beef is how you are graded in the course.  Some things are free marks, and others, you get killed.
She pretends that she wants to help, but then you ask her a question and she treats you like an idiot.  Go to all the classes and participate in case discussions.  She is obsessed with "so whats?"
No Comments
No Comments
linda is a very fair prof, but you have to keep up!
Personally, I think she is a very unfair teacher. Very !!
Make sure you go to every single class, and say something even you do not know what the say.
No Comments
stupidest course ever.  It's all about her brother in law.
a nice woman, helpful and funny.. but her courses are tough like hell~
No Comments
keep pushing those walls!

comments: I love Dr Anderson, she is a real gem. She is so nice to students, in lecture and when meeting for extra help. It is obvious she really cares. While she does post all lecture slides online, I would definitely recommend going to class as some concepts you can't teach yourself.
She's an amazing prof! Very open to students and genuinely wants everyone to do well in her class! Would definitely recommend taking any of her classes!

What an amazing prof! She offers every opportunity for success from short helpful youtube videos to weekly checklists. Also, many iClicker questions (that don't count for marks but do count for bonus points!!!) And MANY opportunities to receive bonus points. Also very funny and approachable

I've never had such a hands on lecture before.  Dr. Anderson does not teach new material -- she simply reiterates and puts further emphasis on short, assigned online lectures or textbook readings.  I have never learned so much before. Her method of teaching is amazingly effective and she constantly questions. Great learning experience.
She was a great professor but not willing to discuss grades or exams or assignments with students. Not very nice.

Amazing prof! Her given lectures makes sure that you understand what you are doing in the course. Her course modules/videos are key and what helped me pass the course. Bird course but still definitely have to do the work for it to be a bird course. Passed using the videos given w/o reading textbook. Great prof, great course.
I like Dr. Anderson's linguistics class, both 1A03 and 1AA3.

She is very passionate about her subject, and I enjoy her lectures because she constantly expresses that passion for her subject. Of course, I am biased, since I take her courses as electives, due to my love of the subject.  I have found her to be helpful, encouraging, and interesting, and I hope that you will, too.
Amazing proff :)
She is very clear, but midterm and exam was pretty tough

She has very interesting lectures and I love attending her classes.  However, her tests extremely challenging and she requires you to answer questions exactly as she wants, even if there are multiple ways you can answer the question.

Dr. Anderson's teaching method is not great. She goes too quickly and just spits out information and experiments. The exam questions are difficult to understand, and require answers that have not been taught or prepared for in class. Her assignments are irrelevant to the course, and she is not helpful in her office hours.

Dr. Anderson is very enthusiastic. She explains concepts very well. She's also very helpful during her office hours. A tough marker, challenges her students through her tests which are fair. You must attend class to understand her lectures. It's worth it, she's very energetic and gets you interested.

Dr Anderson is cheery, even at 8:30am. She explains things very well and encourages questions and discussion. Watch out though - she has high expectations and usually marks pretty hard. Attending class is necessary because she explains complicated research.
Not a huge fan of her. She seems very nice and energetic to the class as a whole, but one-on-one she tends to be a little dismissive. She doesn't seem to like answering questions.
Her way of teaching is excellent, but her personality is a little...meh. She is not the most friendliest person one-on-one.
Midterms and final were extremely hard. She is extremely confusing in the wording of her questions. Textbook wasn't necessary, but it is important to attend lecture. Class Average was about B-.
Very clear and helpful. Gets you interested.

Very approachable prof who makes the class fun. She sets up the course in an extremely organized fashion. If you do the homework and keep up with the readings (which is not a lot) as outlined, you can easily do really well.
Really helpful, very clear!
taching the phonetic alphabet and how to use it all in one term is ridiculous
reallly helpful and made the class fun
her voice is really annoying
She's a great prof!  Yeah she marks hard and looks at you funny sometimes, but she's clear, organized and calm about things.  She explains syntax really well.
great prof, made class interesting and clear

She's awesome. Covers everything in detail, goes over questions the students ask in class, and really makes things clear. She doesn't seem to engage all the students, though; they're always ready to pack up at the end of class, so it might not be everyone's cup of tea.

3xo3 got really hacked up -- used to be a 6, now only a three and crappy text. Canders totally makes it okay though -- explains everything very well. Uses clear slideshows and graphics very well in almost all the courses she teaches. Great sense of humour, smart and fun.
No Comments

As a function of the linguistics I presume, this prof is very articulate. She uses power point presentations; the majority of which she posts ahead of lecture time. She might however post just before class and not the night before, making it impossible to print out the notes. She nearly always reviews what has gone on in the lecture prior.
No Comments

comments: Very interesting course. As a prof her lectures were easy to follow and had my attention for the most part. However, I just finished writing the final exam and it was horrible. She gave us an exam outline in class that she did not follow, and she picks the most trivial details to quiz you on. It's definitely difficult to do well in this course

Swett is down to business and understanding. She wants controversial thinking and your best effort. When she gives you feedback on an assignment, she expects you to follow it up on the next one. Expect to discuss every chapter in excessive but thorough detail during each class.

Dr. Swett is an engaging and inspiring teacher.  She has high but clear expectations, wants her students to work hard but is available for help or feedback.  She can be intimidating, but is fair and gives good feedback.  You will learn a lot in her classes.

I had Swett in my undergrad and graduate experience. She's an initially intimidating professor, but she warms up to you in you show dedication and ask the right questions. She's an excellent moderator in seminars, but if you slip up, that glare can really do some damage. I rate her highly, and would suggest taking thorough notes in lecture.

Nice woman. Great lecturer. Engaging material and person. Horrible exam writer though. It's a universal complaint with this particular class. Just wrote exam hour ago, she likes to pick the more obscure ID questions making studying difficult. No need for that...
Amazing professor and great class/subject in general!  Also had her for 2P03.  Very helpful and interesting!  Actually emotionally connected to the subject!  Amazing!!

Totally unhelpful, emails were unclear, and she was very condescending on top of that.  Definitely plays favourites.  When you go into her office she looks at you with disdain and then brushes you off as quickly as possible.  Perfect example of how an ivy league school doesn't always produce a good prof.  Bad experience all around.
One of the best professors I have ever had - interesting material, fair workload, fair exam, and extremely approachable.
Swett is the She-Horn of Mac History. Great prof, intimidating as all hell, but a damn intelligent lady.

An absolutely amazing professor! She spoke energetically and occasionally humourously (always a plus). She was considerate of our other responsibilities but at the same time not really a pushover. Her class made up for my other not-so-exciting lectures!  The exam was easy with a fair amount of choice.

I cant believe so many people liked her so much! Her lectures were sometimes interesting but lingered on really small details and went fast over important parts. The essays on the exam were horrible! They didnt hit on the big pictures but again dealt with trivial detail. She should really have done a midterm.
i liked the fact that she extended our essay due date by a week. that is all.

very approachable. takes an interest in what her students think about the material and how its presented. its obvious she wants her class to do their best, and is willing to help. she is great with discussions, and her classes are very interesting. def. got what i paid for
One of the best Profs I have ever had.  She has always been very helpful and I would recommend taking anyone of her classes.  Although she may be hard she is very fair.

"Leader in the German history field?"  How would an undergrad know that?  If that's not suspicious enough, how about *three* reviews in one day?  Students say she writes her own reviews.  I'm beginning to see why.  Not terrible, but not good either.

Dr. Swett is a leader in the german history field.   very approachable and spends a great deal of time fielding questions.  Always answers emails same day.  Whoever said her office is a lair is an idiot. I have never had a problem talking to her. She plays favourites in that she doesnt like slackers

I love her, she's one of the best profs in the history department. She knows her stuff and is very organized with her overheads!!! The pictures she puts up are great too!!!She very nice and sweet when you approach her too!
No Comments
Awesome teacher. Very interesting, fair and fun. She looks like Tina Fey!
If your looking at preparing for life out in the real world(especially if you are thinking of pursuing graduate studies), you will do yourself a great favor by taking her classes! Thanks!

BEWARE, she does not offer bird-courses! She’s tough, but extremely fair, and will grade you based on both your achievement in relation to the class and to your own abilities. I have performed better (mark-wise) with other teachers but have not learned ha

This prof. has one thing in mind: to provide those who take her classes not only with knowledge, but also with method. Attending her lectures, one senses that her main objective is to enhance her students understanding of the different historical events i

This prof is wierd. She is not very approachable (her office always dark and lair-like). She does not take real interest in students' work because she is too preoccupied with her own career. She also plays favourites. How did she get a hot pepper?

Somewhat organized lectures.  She jumps back and forth between a lot of topics and rarely goes in chronological order.  She also leaves out a lot of details in certain areas (WW1) and includes too many details in other areas.  The readings are very bland.
good, interesting lectures.  Lays out assignments nicely, good TAs.  Some like Horn better, not me.  Heavy reading load.

Best professor I've had in years. She loves the subject matter, she is very well organized and is incredibly intelligent. The reading load is a hassle with 4 other classes, but I don't blame her for my schedule! Go Swett!

Enthusiasm for subject matter is great.A bit too in-your-face and pushy with directing questions at the class.Very clear and easy to follow,but needs to understand that students don't have the time to read the pile of stuff she assigns for a 1/2 yr class
Great, clear, and interesting lectures.  And she can be pretty funny, too!!  Plus, the assignments are fairly marked.  Her classes are both enjoyable and educational!!  Yay!!

She is definately a great prof. She is helpful and you can tell she really loves what she does. The TA for this class is all over the place -- a common complaint in this class, but luckily she looks over everything.

U will miss out if you don't take her unbelievable classes.  Very energetic proff, puts an exclamation mark on our history department.  truly cares about her students and always available.  Democractic and understanding.  Young professor with ZEST
TOO LOUD!! Geez.  Nicely organized lectures, not as entertaining as Horn...energetic, err...she's alright, I guess.
Clear speaker, overly engages class in discussion.  Deviates from lecture material often, however, effective and enjoyable teacher.
She seems like she really cares about you doing well
awesome prof!
No Comments
She is a great professor who is both helpful and encouraging.  Thanks very much.
She's okay, not too memorable. Many find her clearer than Dr. Horn though

comments: She doesn't post useful powerpoints/notes during lectures nor does she post anything online. Students are forced to write notes purely on what she says in class. She reads of a paper with no enthusiasm in her force which doesn't help to pay attention. Not only that she goes off track and we're not sure whats useful notes for her midterms/exam.

Prof stands in front of class reading notes. Power points are not helpful. Makes easy topics very difficult. If you want to pull your hair out trying to figure out the essay questions, then enjoy the haircut. Very difficult to understand her teachings regarding the philosophers. So skip lectures and get info on the web, to earn an easy "C+".
Sweet woman. Very approachable, kind and my impression of her grew more and more positive the more we became more engaged in the course.

I liked her, she was passionate about the subject and she wasn't afraid to argue and share her opinion - which really makes us, undergrads, feel like we're being taken seriously rather than being treated like children. She's also approachable and very sweet. I would definitely recommend taking her class.

No clear grading criteria for essays. Course contains confusing readings and her explanations don't help. She expects participation but doesn't make the seminar a comfortable environment for us to share our thoughts. She just seems bored, annoyed, and like she just doesn't want to be there at all.
Regret signing up for this course. She assumes that all Philosophy students are also interested in and already knowledgable about History.

Dr. Enns thrust her own perspective into every comment she made on my papers without recognizing my own perspective, particularly if my perspective held closely to the readings the essay. Apparently supporting the readings  my own ideas doesn't count as engagement with the text. She also frequently didn't understand my use of specific terms.
Dr. Enns. This kind woman handed out the final exam on the last day of class so we knew EXACTLY what to study. Bless her gentle soul.

Dr. Enns dislikes capitalism but can`t accept the alternative. Like most philosophers, she allows the perfect to be the enemy of the good, and so her arguments have little practical utility. She should learn to take her own side in the debate. But, on the other hand, she`s nice and reasonably attractive (in a professorly sort of way).

I loved this class and the way it was taught by Dr. Enns. The topics were always interesting and she really wanted to hear the opinions of the class. She encouraged debates and presented varying points of views regarding topics. She was very friendly, and exam and essay questions were straight forward and easy to do well on.
A wonderful professor: engaging, intelligent and concerned. Challenging, in all the right ways.
Chooses topics excellently; very interesting class, good discussions. Very easy to understand and follow. Great course syllabus, guaranteed to succeed! Amazing Prof, amazing class.

Dr. Enns made the course fun and interesting, and you could tell that she wanted us to do well so that was great motivation when it came to assignments.  She is also very smart and that intimidated some Womens Studies students but, to ask a rhetorical question, what are we at university for, to be catered to or to be challenged?

Dr. Enns is one of the only profs I've had so far who asks tough questions and doesn't let people get away with lazy thinking.   I guess that's why some students may not like her, but I had her for philosophy 2G03 and she was awesome.

What does this course have to do with Women's Studies if the prof. discounts any feminist commentary when it is brought up?  Her grading for participation was cruel especially since I was always there and AWAKE.  I think she knows her stuff but nothing outside of that limited realm.  I am exercising the only agency open to me to vent.

The courseware was ridiculously thick and expensive. She went on and on for days without really putting any passion or life into the material. She used good lecture time for pointless debates. She favoured students. If you're not on her good side, you're screwed. Participation in a class of 50 students? Ridiculous. Save your money.

Dr. Enns makes a great effort to help students understand the material which can sometimes be difficult to read and/or discuss. Responding to a previous comment, Dr. Enns does lecture for 50 minutes but what professor doesn't? She is very receptive and welcoming of debates and comments in class.
Enns put together a really amazing course.  It is interesting, challenging and has a coherent theme.  Not for someone who is not ready to work hard with philosophical texts though.
Professor Enns is wonderfully clear and insightful.  I enjoyed her class immensely and hope to take more courses with her!
Course material was challenging and lectures did little to clear up points.  Tutorials were more helpful.  Not a tough grader though and exam questions asked were fair and straightforward.
Basically stands in front of the class reading notes for 50 minutes. Very slow pace and unispired lectures. Do the readings, skip lectures!

I find Enns to be redundant and boring. If you understand the text there is no point in going to lecture unless you want to fall asleep. If you didn't understand the text, there is still no point because she does a very poor job of clarifying concepts.

comments: He was really the best Statistics Professor at Mac. Patient, kind, very knowledgable in Statistics. University of Waterloo hired him and he has gone. Too bad for Mcmaster students and it's a shame for the University to lose such a great Professor.
Very hard marker. He told me like this "I MARK IN THE FAVOUR OF STUDENTS"
He was my favourite professor at Mcmaster. He was fantastic in teaching and explaning.
I hear he is now the CLA at Waterloo University.
"Hello, my name Doctor Akhundov. Yes, that's right, my first name Doctor." LOL!
HE MARKED VERY HARD ON MY FINAL EXAM. VERY HARD MARKER
He was good. Wish I had studied harder.
What a mean marker!!
He was alright, not too great
He had marked my exam SO UNFAIRLY!!!!!!!!
Had him while he was at Mac. Explained concepts well, easy course if you do the practice tests. He's a funny guy, makes stats likeable. Uses examples relevant to tests. Great Prof!
excellent prof his test were so straightforward
He was terrible

Ugh! Seriously, I don't know why Mac students liked him.  He has NO CLUE what he'd doing, none at all, makes multiple mistakes each lecture and confuses people more than anything else.  I feel sorry for the people who don't know math well enough to teach this course to themselves.  He doesn't even know that calculators have a factorial button!
Thanks Mcmaster for letting him to come to us! He's so kind, so nice, so helpful. Very easy to approach too.
He was a super star statistics prof of mcmaster...dont know how they let him go....big loss...

Highly disorganized notes on blackboard. Teaches DIRECTLY from the textbook and still makes multiple fundamental mistakes each lecture. Unable/Takes forever to answer students' questions. Remember this is an introductory statistics course, so either he's not prepared or just doesn't care. Don't understand why McMaster students like him (easiness?).

He was THE BEST PROF EVER EVER IN THE MATH DEPARTMENT. MCMASTER MATH DEPARTMENT IS A LOSER DEPARTMENT FOR LOSING SUCH A GREAT PROF AND A GREAT MAN. IT IS MCMASTER's loss and waterloo's gain that he has gone there!!!!

He is a great prof. He has always offered kindly help whenever students asked at any time. He gave lots of hints and informations about his tests and exams during the summer classes, almost told us what questions are coming. His marking is fair always.
"e is 2.18281828.... it is also Leo Tolstoy's birthyear."
Great prof!! Too bad he has left mcmaster forever and is teaching at Waterloo now. He was great for McMaster students. Very knowledgeable, fair tests

Funniest prof I've had! Writing on Chalkboard and overheads was sometimes a problem, otherwise a very clear and helpful professor all in all! I recommend changing profs if you have stats and Akhundov is not your prof meaning you've got someone else!
He's there to make sure you get a HIGH grade! You still have to study, but if you do, you're for sure going to get a good grade! And.. he's sort of funny, in his own way. lol!
Exams are difficult
This prof is really tough. Very hard marker too. Exams are fair but you have to do every single question that he assigned.
great prof. One of the best so far. The people who mark his tests are very hard markers thou!
Extremely nice professor!  I called him twice before a test and he kindly explained answers over the phone.  Very approachable and a fair marker.
He gives fair tests and exam. Lectures are clear. The examples he gives in class are similar to the questions in tests/exam.
He is my favourite professor. He is fantastic in teaching and explaning.
Great Prof, interesting class, made stats interesting
Excellent prof. One of the most fair math professors of McMaster University.
No Comments
Great, helpful prof. When I needed help, two hours before the test, he stayed with a group of 4 people (myself included) and helped us for half an hour after the lecture. Very nice man.
One of the best profs in the math department. Always there to help and very nice. Gives sample test and if you study everything you can do well. but you must know your stuff

Dr. Akhundov was amazing! Such an easy-going guy. He prepared us well for tests (which were generally VERY easy if you studied well, as they were composed of mostly practice questions) and adds a bit of humour to lectures. I hope I get him for upper year stat classes! Oh and the accent was great!
Dr. Akhundov is a very good man

For some reason, not a lot of ppl showed up to his class, but hes actually a really good prof.  He'll teach you a concept and then immediately follow it up with an example to clear things up.  That's rare in a lot of profs.
Great PROF!!!
Pace of this course is extremely slow. The most important thing I learned from him is: "...the probability of...getting head is 3/8"  Good times
good professor! kinda hard to understand sometimes because he'll make mistakes but KNOWS his stats well! and very helpful and willing to help! his tests are fair if you've studied.

haha akhudovv,....wat can i say....KASES thats wat he says instead of cases, and the time where he wrote CHEBYCHUFF rule where its literally written as "TCHEBYCHUV" yea thats how bad he is in english lol, fun class, funny, jokes, him and his candy haha, we have 2 canddyyyy lol.....good, explains well..
Amazing professor. Makes learning easy, and his tests are fair
AMAZING prof!!! He made summer school stats fun and fairly easy going. Attend lectures, do your homework, and you will be fine on tests and exams

where the hell is this guy from??<<<thats what i ask myself throughout the whole class. But on the real, the man knows his stats and even though class gets pretty slow sometimes (comes with the territory, i guess) his notes are very clear and tests not so bad. Best of luck!!
I cant stand him! He will write 2 and say 8! i hate stats!
No Comments

Dr.Akhundov is an excellent professor. He is very intelligent and knows statistics upside down. He gives good lectures and demonstrates lots of examples with concepts. The tests and exams are fair if you keep up with the course. Also very helpful and patient when you see him during office hours. Strongly recommend that you take his class.
Very good prof. Clear typed notes.
Good

Free tip to software people: take 3Y intead of 3N. Not only is 3Y easier (I failed 3N), but Akhundov is MUCH better than MacDonald. He occasionally runs overtime, but the tests are doable, his writing is legible and he's less condescending towards his students.

Ahkundov is the man, apart from calling the class a bunch of grade 7s. Even though he isnt the best teacher, his tests are incredibly easy.. and he re uses all of his test questions from previous years.. so make sure you get a copy of those.. even his exam haha..
Not an easy course
Sometimes difficult to understand, but otherwise a very approachable and dedicated prof.
Dr. Akhundov is an amazing prof. He explains the concepts extremely well.

I switched to his class to avoid being In Prof. Mead's section. Akhundov is great, doesn't throw up slides, actually writes examples on the board so you can follow along. Quite approachable during office hours. I think Mead wrote the exam but Akhundov prepared us well.
Excellent class. He tries hard to explain concepts with  examples and very approachable.
Really nice guy
àlright guy, helpful, but lectures are torture. Hard to follow. Tests are fair.
The excel part of the course was really tough
great prof

I found his lectures to be quiteas useless, but the way that the course was set up was perfect for me, you do the assignments, and the test became dead easy, so, don't goto lecture, and just do the assignments. ;)

He's a really good professor. He's always there to help students. Explains problems very well and his tests are very fair. He's very helpful and I recomment that you take Statistic class ONLY with HIM he's really good. His class is always fun. I took a Stats1AO3 with him and I loved it. AWSOME Prof.
Awesome prof with cute jokes.  I guess the people who suck at stats give him bad ratings...its the only explaination.
Akhundov was the best Professor I could have asked for and made class enjoyable
No Comments
Awesome teacher. Tries very hard to make students understand. Very funny, slides in jokes to make sure you are listening!
Can't understand anything he teaches
Horrible prof.
I like his class and way how he teaches
No Comments
The best Prof at Mac!!!
Nice guy but his class is definitely not very interesting. I guess it's just that Stats is hard, not really his fault.
Hes the terminator of the stats world
Really boring prof. Nice accent though.
No Comments
Hard prof!! He goes way too fast. Makes stats harder than necessary. His in-class examples are much tougher than the textbook examples. Seems like a nice guy though.
Very boring, and very hard to understand. Wish we had another prof teaching stats. Most people are confused when he's lecturing.
No Comments
Accent's a bit difficult to understand, but he's very helpful and very intelligent.
Great prof!
His speech isn't great, however he is a fairly reasonable professor and his tests are not too difficult. Keep up the good work Ilham!
Great guy, his class is fair and easy if you keep you. Tho, once in a while he says one number and writes down another.
Great job teaching first year stats sir!

An excellent stats prof (compared to the one i have currently). Like others said, Dr. Akhundov is one of the rare math profs who actually prepares you for his exams through his lecture notes and examples. I wish him a long and successful career at Mac!
Extremely hard to understand!
Best Statistics Prof at McMaster. Awesome!
He is a great prof!Bad prof tell,but he insprites you because he always gives you helpful hints to solve the questions.He has a sence of humor.He is my favourite prof!
This is your answer...
Great class and Great Teacher

great teacher.  the questions on tests are actually based on questions from class or from the homework (which is rare among so many idiot professors), except slightly harder.  easy to talk to, and willing to help people learn.
Very helpful. Nice guy. Very approachable.
great prof...uses good examples
Wish he was the course co-ordinator. The best thing about him, is his detailed examples for each theorem, whatsoever. This is so unlike his other collegues !!
Perhaps one of the great algebra teachers like Dr. Childs. His examples in class get u prepared for tests.
You know how to do this...
hes the funniest prof i've got!  Makes me smile in calculus..cant beat that!!!
Very good instructor.
He's the most helpful and sets clear instructions!! Very approachable. :)

comments: He's very organized. Sometimes does NOT answer your questions during class which I hated. I raised my hand one time and he refused to acknowledge me or others on other occasions. Overall, clear and concise professor.
Dr. Young gives amazing lectures. Great prof!

Dr. Young is my favourite prof. He is extremely reliable, consistent, and fair. He lectures at a slow pace to ensure everyone takes good notes. His lectures are CRUCIAL for doing well in the course b/c his slides are skeletons. IF you attend every lecture, expect to get an A range grade b/c his tests are super fair. EASIEST A+ I've ever earned.

He is very structured and because of this I was able to take great notes and I understood everything the first time he explained it. However the tests/exam were very hard. They were based on the readings and lectures but you literally needed to know EVERYTHING. He had direct quotes from the textbook so you can imagine how stressful that was.
Dr. Young is an average professor, but i find he puts too much info on slides and expects you to know so much info for tests and exams.  I wish i didnt have to take this class!

Lectures are very organized and easy to follow and he lets you know exactly what you need to write in your notes by repeating himself and talking slowly. He genuinely cares about his students' learning and his instructions are always clear

The way he teaches is extremely clear and basically explains everything like you have no previous knowledge. His feedback on assignments are very detailed which is good and he takes his time to really give you guidance. This is not an easy professor and you have to work super hard to pass his course. Don't skip class AT ALL and pay attention.

He's tough and strict, but he's honestly one my favourite prof. at MAC. He's very rigid and follows a guideline but in this sense you are able to know exactly what to expect. He gives off a cold exterior, but he means well. He's one of the profs. that actually challenged me and taught me how to become a better student (e.g. writing shops.)
Worst ever! Not approachable at all. Unhelpful I suggest you avoid him.
Worst ever! Not approachable at all.

He is a very structured prof. but he is clear in what he expects from his students. I found that exams fair, and mostly studied from my notes. attending class is crucial since his slides are just skeletons, so make sure to make a friend in case you miss class. Overall I enjoyed his class, and most likely would take another course of his.
DO YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS, OR CLARIFICATIONS!?!?!   hot prof.
Really enjoyed his class.

Dr. Young is a very structured professor. Structure is good, but not to the extent where there is no autonomy or flexibility left. Especially when it comes to papers, he is very clear what he expects which can lead people to rewrite their papers 3 times. He is not very considerate when it comes to discussing about issues regarding about your marks.

Dr.Yong is crystal clear on everything. His lectures are clear, his expectations are clear, even the procedures he follows in resolving issue related to marking are clear. This man is extremely structured, and I love that.  In other words, If you follow Dr.Yong’s instructions and attend his lectures you will most likely do well in his class.
All of his exams are based off his overheads. I was sick and attended class he was rude and made me move to the back of the room because I had "too many germs".

Worst Prof ever. If I had it my way he would be fired. He is not helpful or accommodating in any way shape or form. Do not take this as an elective. He is rude and inconsiderate and on a major power trip. Does not post notes so if you miss a class you're screwed because his exam is everything from lecture.

Hands down the worst professor I have ever had. Impossible to contact, never clarifies his explanations and consistently made me feel stupid for asking questions. Don't take his course if you're not a Sociology major, either.

Very good prof, concise. Doing well in this class requires regular class attendance but tests are very fair. Most questions on the test are recognizable if you takes good notes and tests are only based on lecture notes (tutorials are based on textbook readings)
Extremely clear and thorough. Fairly graded exams. I enjoyed his class.

Dr. Young is an AMAZING professor. He is by far the best professor that i have ever had.  He is so clear and makes it extremely possible to do well in his courses.  Any class that you get a chance to take with him... do it.  Even if the material sucks he makes it interesting and makes it easy for you to do well!

Took 2S06 and 2Z03 with him. He made what could be very boring topics quite interesting. Lectures at an easy pace, so easy to write notes. And exams are VERY fair-right from the lectures. Learned a ton from him! Favourite prof, hands down!

I love D.Young. i tried to take all his classes, had him 5 times. all time fav professor. His classes can be a bit boring but he teaches at a great pace & his tests come directly from his notes he gives in class & he provides good notes & allows for u to be able to note take well. I think u have to be super lazy to do bad in one of his classes.
extremly clear and concise and made learning ineresting and fun
Subject was interesting, he wasn't. Not helpful

Sometimes the lectures can be boring, but I loved his organization. He makes studying for exams easy. His exams are fair. I actually learn in his lectures. If you truly have questions, don't bother to ask them in class though, ask them privately after class or in his office hours. He may miss your hand or not hear you fully, respect that.

Second class with him, this one was also incredibly easy. However, he is unbelievably boring, and his answers to class questions leave a lot to be desired. Also note: textbook is 100% non-testable with him.
He's amazing. If you attend lecture and study what you've written down its an A class. He's great.

Dr. Young is am amazing prof! Ive been in many of his classes and like the way he is so organized with his lectures-it makes it easier to study when it comes to exams! I will definately be taking more courses with him in the future.
Worst prof ever..very unapproachable. Not understanding AT ALL about ANYTHING. Avoid his classes if possible.

He has his pros and cons but overall he's a good prof. His lecture notes were very helpful and easy to follow and he takes his time and fully explains things. The course material in itself is a little boring at times. The exams are fairly difficult but if you go to lecture and do the readings you will be fine.
he is very organized in terms of his lectures. he is awesome in his teaching style. and very thorough, his is a pretty hard marker tho. he is good on exams tho. :) i am taking his course again.
Clear and organized. Tests are very fair. Questions on tests all derived from lecture notes, so don't skip lectures. Don't talk in class, Dr. Young has NO patience for this (rightfully so)
clear and organized.  Very helpful

I had him last semester and this semester as well... his lectures are very structured and i find that you have to write everything he says down. overall i feel that he's fair with his tests... but what is up with his orange cup??? lol
very hard to make notes from his lectures! difficult to understand the material taught from lecture

Dr. Young was one of my better professors @ Mac.  Always organized, clear expectations, available when needed, a fair marker....  Only problem with the class was that the text (which was $70 used) is only needed for the essay, and only one section of the text at that. GOto lectures, but tutorial is kind of useless.
WORST PROF.VERY ANAL ABOUT EVERYTHING! evenhow your paper is placed on your desk!!

Everyone who says hes unapproachable and scary is absolutely right but I don't think that takes away from his teaching capabilities. I found him very fair, clear and easy. I mean the guy didn't even make us read the text book, how much easier could it be? He may not be a ray of sunshine but he's a good prof :)

I absolutely LOVE him!!! He's very fair and helpful. He's also incredibly organized which makes taking notes easy! Even with his hearing problem he still tries to engage us in discussion. I plan on taking as many classes as possible with him!
worst ever!

definiteLy not the easiest Prof ~ but wouLd consider he as a fair one.  what showed up on the exam are reLevant to everything he outLined in cLass.  aPProachable to those who'LL actually go n' seek for his heLp.  if u attend every Lectures, the exam will definitely Look fair to everyone.

Dr. Young may look tough to ppl @ 1st.. he's very nice if you go talk to him.  PPL thought he's mean and tight on the markings but actually he's very helpful if you go talk to him.  He spent 40 minutes going through my midterm with me and gave me useful tips on the finals.  Afterall, he's just like other profs ~ who wants their students to do well.

Dr. Young is very willing to assist students. Lectures are to be silent because, as he outlined within the first week of class, he has some sort of hearing problem so he would have difficulty hearing you if you raised your hand. His exams, while tricky, are reasonable, and his lectures are very well organized and facilitate easy note-taking.

Very unwilling to help, lectures are to be kept completely silent without any questions, and repeats every point 7 times, which I guess some people see as "clairty"  Avoid his lectures if at all possible, there are tons of other amazing profs at Mac.
No Comments

Very fair. Not really any give if you screw up something. Which makes sense... He seems intimidating and unapproachable but he is easy to talk to if you need/want to chat. Lectures are straight forward. Pretty good overal.

Once you get past the fact that he looks like Stephen King, he's a pretty good prof.  He's kind of a no-nonsense guy, which may be taken the wrong way by some students.  His lectures are very clear and easy to follow, and the exam content is fair as well.
He seems mad at the world and takes it out on the students. The content he chose was horribly un-interesting and he made going to lecture a chore.

Don't listen to the other comments. This prof is the****! Dr. Young's so helpful and approachable. Ask him questions after class and he's more then willing to answer them. This prof is the real deal. He's straight forward kinda guy.

This was one of the most unaaproachable and scariest human beings i have ever come into contact with.  His consistant monotone voice and very BAD attitude were a detriment to the course and i would NEVER take a class with him again
Had him in summer school and regular semester. Crap both times.. very unapproachable and seems mad at the world in general.... ridiculous.
this guy is definately mad at the world so don't try asking any questions cuz he might make u an enemy
Yuck! This guy is really funny...but you are laughing at him, not with him. Don't even bother with one of his classes!
No Comments
Ever wonder what a lobotomy would be like? Well, give this class a try... or invest in a 30¢ in a coat hanger.
After the midterm he drew a clock on the board to explain how much content you miss for each minute you're late in class... funniest thing ever, but horrible prof

The class seemed interesting in the undergrad book, but this prof doesnt do it justice! He is very snobbish, won't reply to emails and asks questions on tests such as "in chapter so and so, what was the subtitle used"...who cares? Not a good prof.
No Comments
No Comments
very boring, monotone voice - easy class thought - just write down exactly what he says, memorize it and regurgitate it

So let me get this straight... We can't ask him questions about his lecture due to his "hearing difficulty".. yet he can hear ppl whispering and gives them dirty looks? Perplexing logic me thinks. Tosser

He's pretty distant, hard to talk to and a snob.Easy marker though     As far as delivery, it's a cross between william shatner and adam west. (Now we'll talk ABout marxIST theory....*dirty look at someone* marxIST theory is...
Boring, BUT very straight forward, just memorize what he gives you.  Easy B.

HOnestly, what kind of class can you not ask questions in? This one, he is very anal in the class shoots dirty looks when you move and dear God help you if you are late, you will be black marked for the rest of the semester. As for testing memorize
No Comments
topic is boring but I don't blame the prof. He does what he can.  He is speaks well and explains the concepts clearly.

Great definitions...NOT!!! Lets read a text...for a lesson...WHATEVER.  Why is there now entertainment...very dry...feels like I am in a desert.  Brutal class...interesting topics made boring.  Thanks for a crappy class!
Needs to relax, but works hard to be a good teacher. Helpful; not like other prof.
Made me consider suiside. The most boring prof ever. Reads Right out of the book. Very esy though.
made a boring course interesting.
excellent
Sooooo boring! Makes me not want to go to class, EVER!
No Comments
He reminds me of an alien who wants to suck my brain
Boring, too much repition, too many hand gestures
good prof, very clear, but too much repetition
very enthusiastic
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Truly skilled professor! I wish she taught all my classes! Expert information, personable, clear expectations. All the negative comments came from students who thought uni would be easy..Not so.always available for questions and easy to relate to. Thanks Dr V!
Possibly opposed to the use of fertilizers to treat clinically depressed foliage herba.  Seemingly opposed to the use of soap to wash cars, but undoubtedly a capable professor.
Dr. Vaillancourt is quiet beautiful. I think her husband is so lucky :)

She is not the best prof I've had.  Though she was entertaining and seemingly an easy going prof, she was actually very difficult and borderline unpleasant because of her attitude towards the class.  Her tests were tough to say the least.  Her personal experience in psych makes her an interesting prof but it's not quite enough to redeem her I think
Useless worthless experience. Donot recommend her to anyone ever. Her final was brutal. She doesn't like the class average to be more then 70
Tests were hard but OK still. Final exam was brutal.

She was clearly the worst professor ever. She told us once that if the class average was very high she would lose her job. I guess she already has even after the class average being low. She often made false promises and her finals were always very hard.
mean, arrogant, selfish prof. Never keeps her promises. Overall sad combination

Worst professor ever.  If you can't see through her fake skin, then university hasn't taught you to be critical enough.  She is deceptive, selfish, narcissistic, and could care less about the success of her students. She does, however, give a great example of what a FAKE person is like - right to the dot.

Very Funny Prof. Made 8:30 class worth going to. Past comments are blown way out of proportion because if you went to class you would do well as she gives hints to her questions. One of the most interesting classes I have taken here. Loved her and sad she is gone.
She makes Lame Jokes and is SOO TOUGH!!!
She used to be nice many years ago but not anymore!!!! One of the toughest profs around now. Avoid her otherwise you will regret it.

VERY Impersonable. She replies to emails like this "Hi,", I have a name alright....what is "Hi," ?? She is soooo tough...she hates the class average to be more than 70-71%....she will kill the whole class on future tests and exam if the class average is high. Terrible attitude towards students. It's only a garbage PSYCH course!!! get a life!!
Great prof!! She was helpful, understanding, clear, and the tests were very well organized. Learned alot!
VERY HARD SHORT ANSWER QUESTIONS ON THE FINAL EXAM TAKE IT EASY ON MCMASTER STUDENTS PLEASE. STOP ASKING SHORT ANSWER QUESTIONS IF POSSIBLE. THANK YOU.

I took both 3CC3 and 3N03 with Dr. V.  I received an 11 in both.  You can get an A in her class and I don't think she is any different from other profs when it comes to grades.  She is just up front about what is going on at the university.  Loved her classes.  Take them if you can!
What a great prof, and a really interesting class. She cares about the material and is a very engaging speaker.

She is a nice lady but her tests are kind of tough. Still her multiple choice are way easier than Dr.Day's multiple choice so quit complaining!!! Just read the book multiple times. Dont know how bad her short answers will be since didn't have the final yet. She always answers emails and is helpful if you talk to her after class.

I totally agree with some of the comments people have posted --- She does not like the class average to be more than 70-73. Last year I took Forensic Psych with her and the average on both midterms was high (76-80) so she gave a deadly final with very specific multiple choice and brutal short answers. Not every psych prof has her type of mentality.

Dr. Vaillancourt is a very good prof.  Profs are told by the university what the class averages should be.  If a prof's class averages are consistently too high, their employment is terminated.  So she should get fired so that you get the A+ you don't deserve?

She was very easy few years back. She NEVER ASKED short answer questions on any of the exams and her exams were entirely multiple choice few years back. Her exams were NEVER CUMULATIVE, they only covered second half of the course. Now she has changed and become tough as hell!!!

Don't know where to start...this prof REALLY REALLY SUCKS. She has a bad attitude. When the class average is high she says things like "Good Job", but she gets PISSSED from inside...she hates the class average to be more than 70. If the class scored high on one test, just watch you, she will throttle all of you in the 2nd test. Bad attitude!!

She is an amazing lecturer. Stories are highly entertaining not to mention she has more jokes than chris rock and larry david combined. She knows the material very well and cares alot about her students. Overall one of the best classes ever. The tests are tough but fair.
This prof is really tough. AVOID HER.....Her SHORT answer questions are nasty.
great class.. interesting lectures and a great prof.  Her class was one of the best psych classes at Mac and shes one of the best profs! New stories and great energy every day.
Very nice, makes learning fun....always has helpful hands-on learning examples due to experience. Would take any class she was teaching.
Very unresponsive to students
Nearly an entire lecture of her outfit not matching is not what I call higher education. She cared so much about us liking her that she forgot to teach - her narcissism went too far!
She was someone that was very dynamic at first and then by the end of the term you realize that her door is not always open and she had given you a lot of false promises.
excellent course. so interesting. the prof has alot of clinical strories that she shares. i recommend this course highly.
Love her.  She is tough but seems to really care about her students.  Be sure to read the textbook several times before the exam.

Her so-called 'SHORT answer' questions on exams are so disgusting EWWWWWW. This prof is way too serious. She jokes around in class, tells funny stories but don't let that fool you. She's tough as nails. She's very impersonable when answering emails. When you write Hi Dr.Vaillancourt, she replies like this "Hi," (???????) What is Hi,?I have a name!!
I highly recommend Abnormal.  Great lectures, fun professor although she is pretty tough!

This prof is really hard I dont recommend anyone to take her section, she likes the class average to be around 70. She gets pissed if the class average is high. She says they'd kick me out if the clas average was 80's. This shows she got a bad attitude towards teaching and students! It's only PSYCH, Psych is NOTTTT a Science. It is an Arts program.

Great prof, take abnormal psych with her and no other prof. Her exams are straightforward if you read the chapter multiple times, she explains very good and is funnny. But READ THE TEXTBOOK carefully and study all the lecture notes. No problems then.
Loved Dr. V and loved the course!
Excellent prof.  Take this class.
Really fun class.  I highly recommend it.  Dr. V. makes the class interesting by linking the material to clinical cases.
Best prof ever!
Great speaker! I really enjoyed her lectures and she brought in some amazing guest speakers. Very helpful to her many students. I highly recommend this course.
Excellent course.  NOT at all cndescending but is actually really nice and seems to care a lot about her students.  Not sure what the idiot below is talking about (BTW the prof is a she NOT he).
incredibly patronizing and condescending... wouldn't take a class of hers again just because of that, despite the fact that when focusing on lectures, he makes a good prof.
Good prof. She gets 5/5 for clarity, that's for sure.
Good teaching ability, but not very helpful to students
Great prof. the test was tufff though, but still the class average is high. study hard for her tests!!
Good teaching ability, but very poor response to helping students and to emails.
She cant teach.  Tries to get brownie points by telling us which celebrity broke up with whom.  Not needed, Dr. V.  Get back to what we need to know.
I don't think her sense of humour is funny :(
No Comments

I would rather be impressed by what a prof can teach me instead of their knowledge of celebrity news. I dont think providing horror story examples are an effective way to teach students about sexual disorders. I did not find Dr. V to be very intelligent or articulate.
No Comments
She was extrememly helpful and knew how to dress well!!

She's an amazing prof...makes the lectures really interesting...but if you think this is going to be a bird course, you're in for a surprise...it's not easy simply because there is so much material (this is advice from someone who got an A in the class, believe me). Anyway, one of the best profs at Mac by far.

One of the best prof's at mac.  The only thing is her tests are quite tricky. As long as you know the text book inside out, and her notes, the tests are fine, but she tends to ask a lot of detail questions from the text.  Overall she is a super nice prof, and very enthusiastic.
Best abnormal psych prof ever! A+++++! As long as you do the readings weekly, and enjoy learning Abnormal Psych, you're pretty much guaranteed a 10

She's the most helpful and nicest prof. Prompty answers emails and tests aren't that difficult. Her course evaluations are higher than any of the other profs in the Department of Psychology, Neuroscience, and Behaviour. Just check under "Course Evaluations" on MUGSI. You will see her teaching performance is superior to all other faculty members.
No Comments
No Comments

I hate most of my profs, but I don't hate her at all. That tells you something about how awesome she is! She is always fair, never out to get students, and is super nice and personable once you get to know her. Dr. Vaillancourt is the only fair (or perhaps, the MOST fair) prof in the psychology department. Wish she taught every course.
No Comments
Awesome prof!!!

One of the greatest profs at Mac. Nice and easy going. She made Abnormal Child Psychology in summer school a fun and enjoyable class. The course was seminar style, but I liked it. Just read every chapter atleast 3 times and you'll get a good mark in her class. I strongly recommend everyone to take any class taught by her
No Comments
Interesting material. Intersting lectures and stories but yet test do not reflect anything taught. Would be an fun class to come to on your own time but not if u r looking to do well

She is an excellent lecturer, and obviously intelligent, however needs to stick to lecture material and not her experience since that's what she tests on.  terrible attitude towards students outside of class.  too many cases of lost term papers and that's unacceptable.

Very good teacher, great at explaining concepts and getting individuals interested in abnormal psychology. Essay was fair.  Test were terrible.  Too much reliance on memorizing relatively insignificant details and not enough testing on concepts. Test were poor indicators of understanding.

The material was very interesting and the prof has quite a lot of knowledge on the topic, with good stories.  However, tests do not cover that material.  Was also not present for the exam to answer questions...which would have been helpful for many questions which were confusing.

Her lectures were really great, and definitely made class interesting enough not to sleep through, however they got off topic WAY too easily, and her exams were not really fair...if you expect me to memorize the textbook teach more from it and not personal experience, and students papers were lost!!

For whatever reason she didn't even attend the exam to answer questions that badly needed to be clarifed as a result of a multiple choice exam that appeared as though it had never been reviewed for errors.  Kind of disappointing.  I lost a lot of respect for her. Even some questions of moral nature.

Interesting class, interesting material, lecturing is a bit scattered and she is not easy to follow when taking notes. She seems nicer in lecture than she really is when you meet her outside of class, and no I am not narcissistic!

Very Enthusiastic and funny, but that´s often her problem. She gets off track and just tells you about her private stories. A bit more facts, like Dr. Roberts gave in his guest lecture would be good. Papers were delayed, admission should be limited.
She's the BEST!!!
My fav prof by far
Dr. V really makes her lectures interesting.  I really enjoy the real life examples.  This class is great!

One of the only profs that looks as good up close as she does from the back of the lecture hall :)  I love her stories, they really make the material relevant to real life...incredibly smart, looks at things from lots of different perspectives.  Great prof.
Dr. Vaillancourt makes her 2 1/2 hour evening lecture enjoyable to attend.  Sometimes things get a little off-track, but that's part of what makes the class interesting.

What an awesome prof. It's inspiring when a prof is passionate about what they do and actually care about their students. Going to night classes always seemed like punishment to me but I actually look forward to going to this one. She seems like a wonderful person (inside and out).

I think Dr. Vaillancourt is one of THE best proffessors at Mac.. she is such a good teacher.. i enjoy her class.. and she makes the material seem soo interesting...her jokes are great! i commute for three hours to get to her class and i would hate to miss a single class... she makes all the effort a

she is a fantastic prof, class is very interesting and eay to undrestand, she is very easy to follow and very interested in her work. Her tests and essays arent easy, she is very fair but dont take the class for increasing your average. she is funny and help ful outside of class. way to go
No Comments

Great course to take (esp. to bump up your mark)..class is very interesting!!..prof is funny and enthusiastic....BUT outside of class, it is a little hard to get help from her..probably because she is so busy..she seemed a little more nice in class than when we went to her office..

She seems interested in the material but has an awful time getting the main points across to the class. Answers redundant questions from the same people every class, which is why people get distracted!
Very cool prof. For sure one of the best. Makes things easy to understand.
An overall great prof. She's very clear in explaining stuff plus she's nice, pretty, and she has a sweet and sexy voice.

Best prof in 3rd Year, I thought I did better on the essay than what I expected. She actually raised my mark from what the TA originally assigned. She is really helpful, replies to your email the very same day!

Essay was marked too hard. Honestly though, who knew we had to APA the title page and that it would be marked out of 5? That was ridiculous. This is a third year class...not a PhD class. Great prof...but needs to take it down a level.

midterm was really tough...why do i get the feeling she is trying to knock us down from last term.  and stop bashing Ms.Owens, just because she was structured and followed through with her promises doesn't make her an easy prof!
Seems tough
Seems like a really nice lady, but a bit of a dissapointment as I used last semester as a yardstick to guage this one. Will see how I feel after the grades come in.
very good lecturer

She seems nice but she really needs to post the lecture notes online. It's stressful trying to copy down all notes from the overhead and listening to what she's saying at the same time (Only one thing can be done properly) Copying down notes makes lecture less enjoyable than what it could be.

Great prof! really enthusiastic, personable and fun. Essay is hard, but she expects alot from her students and i completely respect that, it challenges us to improve. Test were reasonable, and she tailored the course to what we wanted to learn.

Good stuff
The term essay was really hard
Excellent...simply the best.
Best course I ever took...way to go Dr. V!!!!
Dr. V should be commended for her hard work and dedication that she has put forth in both her lectures and commitment to b&b. Mac is lucky to have such an amazing prof!
Good class, even better prof!!!
Excellent...very nurturing and smart!
Interesting last comment considering she is not even teaching this term.  It is unfortunate that she is trying to do someting good for others (B vs B)and this is what you write!
Tracy is a captivating speaker, but comes across as rather narcissistic and self-absorbed. Fairly shallow, as well..
Tracy is amazing!!

Dr. Vaillancourt is a great teacher. Enthusiasm and humour resound. REALLY READ YOUR TEXT. Always laugh at her jokes. Set yourself apart by talking with her-her marking isn't unbiased. She is completely meticulous re assignments-ATTN 2 detail will help.
Amazing!
Good prof. Interesting lectures. Exams are fair, but she marks hard on the paper (atleast that's how I found)
great prof.  wish every class could be like hers.
Does her job as a prof, but can be really ****y when you talk to her outside the classroom......but knows her stuff well overall.
Excellent professor
Dr. V is amazing!  She makes you think, and obviously passionate about what she does!  Top 2 profs I've had in my 4 years at MAC! Highly recommend!
I don't think anyone can teach Abnormal Psychology better than Tracy. She's great.
Awesome prof! Makes everything so clear and easy to understand. One of the best profs I've had at McMaster....that should explain how awesome she is. TAKE HER CLASS!

Amazing prof, best one I've had a mac by far...she knows what's she's doing and knows how to teach it!
Dr.V is the best prof I have ever had in university.  She is incredibly intelligent...and obviously loves what she does.  I would recommend her to anyone.
Dr. V is awesome I'm studying for the final now and it's so easy to remember everything
BEAUTY WITH BRAINS
very funny, caring and smart
overrated.  anyone teaching abnormal seems interesting.

She is simply the best....super amazing teaching!great person... Dr.V Rocks!!

Dr. V, We Love ya!!!
BRILLANT, DEDICATED, FUN AND V.COOL! THE KIND OF PERSON I COULD CALL MY B.F. SHE MAKES UNI A BLAST AND PSYCH A TREAT!!!
One of the best professors I've ever had. She's VERY intelligent and an extremely good professor!

fun lectures - fair tests - great sense of humor - tries hard to satisfy

comments: Great guy, super funny. If he has kids they are definitely hilarious and probably almost as hot as he is. Also makes fun of Italians waaay too much.
Great prof who is both funny and great at explaining difficult concepts. The course itself is very very difficult. DO NOT take this course unless you ABSOLUTELY have to.

Very funny guy. Definitely hard to fall asleep in his class. He teaches the concepts well, but his tests are very, very difficult. He always tells lots of jokes about his kids/wife or being Italian.  I wish he taught easier courses, because I would take them all. Also, 15% of the class fails on average.

Most hilarious prof ever! Kept me laughing throughout the class and made thing interesting. I think this was the course in which I went to class the most, since he made it interesting. The tests were hard though!!
Funny guy! Crazy difficult tests!
My favourite professor of all time. He is really funny and I learned a lot from his class. Organic chemistry was really interesting because of his class.

Not only the most hilarious prof i've ever had, but i've never come out of a class learning so much before! TOUGH course but Capretta explains things thoroughly. He was not lying when he said you may puke during the exam.
TROPINE TROPINE TROPINE TROPINE... Epic final exam written by this man. Otherwise, probably the funniest prof at mac. Good teacher too!

his class is awesome, much more fun than any other chem class

He's hilarious ! He's a pretty good prof, but beware of the final exam ...he's out for blood.

his sense of humour is the reason that i went to every lecture. So entertaining. the course material was dry, but he made it better.
