comments: It's been a few years but I remember Rodde as being tough but really intelligent and his lectures were fascinating. I remember him fondly for shutting down know-it-all wannabe philosophizers using his lectures as an opportunity to show off- but used their points to illustrate his lecture material. Won't mark you well often but class was informative
Did not like this prof. Drawn me away from philosophy. Boring, stuck up, poor marking, biased heavily on his own views. Will not take again

Most terrible philosophy professor I ever had in York. Whatever the grade you receive in his course will be one grade lower than the other courses.  He is a nice person and a good lecturer, but not a good professor. He never encourage students. Even you attend every class and particpates in discussions, you won't  get a higher grade. Avoid!

Made the course enjoyable and I actually learned. He gives you the grade you deserve so don't try to hand in last minute papers and expect an A. He does a lot of in class activites which help you understand the content he just presented. His lectures usually end 30min-1hr early but nonetheless his persona (reminds me of Sheldon from TBBT) is great

Whether you are looking for a bird course or looking to learn and get adequate grades, avoid this prof. He will not appreciate your efforts or knowledge. Stuck up in his own ideals and fails to grasp reality. Be prepared to write a lot and get downgraded on everything. He will mark you down. Zero flexibility or appreciation of student needs. Avoid!

Not recommended at all. Ok as a lecturer, but terrible marker. Assigns insane amount of work. Over 15000 words worth of papers for a 3 credit course. Lectures get boring quickly. Steer clear of this one, at least until he comes back to reality. Does not realise that students have other courses and things they need to do.

A nice person and lecturer, but excessive marker and does not fully appreciate the workload he assigns. The course load included one paper (around 3000 words), 2 summaries (3000 words total), and stoic week (3500 words written within 7 days). All for 3 credit course. The grading is also harsh. Your average will probably suffer. This is for York Uni

One of the best professors in York university. Clear outline of the material and provides clear slides in every lecture. Break things down so it is easy to understand for everyone. Course has some homework, which is easy (provided you read) and provides bonus marks to boost your average. Need more profs like him at York University!

Good prof, explains everything really well. Content of the course seems simple and homework questions are easy but the quizzes are very hard. Gives chances for bonus marks to add to the quizzes. Overall interesting course but wouldn't take it again. PDF version of the text online so textbook isnt needed
He's lecture is amazing! and he is very fair and very inspirational but there are homework and readings. if you really wanna learn something. he's the man!
There are many different classes for this course. Try to take Dr. Rodde's if possible. Clear, passionate, and fair.  And he's a savage.

My favourite lecturer so far. He's engaging, has a good sense of humour and he is very smart and committed to teaching everyone. Excellent  lectures. Don't be afraid to ask questions. Do your readings, attend tutorials and you'll do well!

Quirky dude with a clear and concise  understanding of the content material .  The potential list of readings themselves are literal philosophical paper, so get ready to understand them and read a lot (However, Stephan makes the content SO much more clearer). The class wasn't hard, but if you don't  put in timework, you won't have a fun time.

Archaeologists recently found remains of the philosopher Aristotle. They extracted his DNA and with help from 3D printing, they reconstructed this great brain. Stefan Rodde, 6ft, 100lbs, with jazz style, (known on the streets as phD-rod) made history that day by having the first human brain transplant. Yes, he is the reincarnation of Aristotle.

Rodde is an awesome prof! He really cares to make sure everyone understands what he's teaching. Even if he doesn't agree with you, he will give you full marks for properly arguing - rare for profs! He always provides a full page of feedback on your assignments which are so helpful! Really great class and an even better prof!
Very approachable!
Very relevant lectures, intelligent, knowledgable, accommodating, professional, funny, helpful.
This class killed my GPA. Marking is very subjective by TA's. Exam worth 35% that they also mark hard. Avoid with your life. Worst decision I made in first year.

Rodde is great, his lecturing style is crystal clear, he always lets your know what is expected. For essays, exams, or roundtable discussions, the instructions are always clear and he was always around to help! The lectures were interesting, the class was fun to go to, and he is the reason I decided to get into philosophy!

Not sure why everyone is complaining about this course...the readings were interesting, my TA was a good guy, and Rodde was a great lecturer.  He does a good job of laying out all interpretations of the readings/issues and letting students take it from there.  Would recommend.

An amazing professor! Funny and he clearly knows his stuff. The lectures were extremely helpful, and he provided all the information necessary to get a good mark on the exam and the papers. An excellent professor, I can't wait to have him again!

The absolute best professor (and course) I had first year. Very funny, helpful in and out of class, and extremely engaging. I might be a little bit biased because I love logic, but.... how can you NOT love logic?!
Awesome prof. Really clear and VERY helpful when you ask him for help. He is not an overly easy marker but he is fair.

Was not excited to be in a philosophy course to begin with but Rodde made me love it. Went to every class. The content of the course was always relevant. He's awkward but funny. His expectations in regards to assignments are crystal clear. He's a great professor and well versed in his material. Definitely recommend taking a course with him!
Good teacher, funny guy. Could be a bit more interesting within class. Very quiet and sometimes hard to hear. Course has taught me things I would have never learnt before.
Avoid him. Incrediby difficult. I got a 50 for a first year philosophy course when I'm an A student getting A's in everything else. He is brutal.
Regret taking this. Brutal class and TAs. Average is a C.

He's an okay prof, but never posts any of his lecture notes. The courseware pack readings are long and super boring--I never read any of them fully. TAs tend to either make or break you, as they mark everything. I also hated how 1B03 basically became environmental philosophy, nothing to do with law (or whatever the misleading course title says).
Avoid this class. I had a 3.7+ gpa and got a D. The TAs in this class are terrible. I had Noel Iverson. Worst mistake of my life.

He is very organized and very intelligent. He doesn't post his slides, but I find this very helpful as it forces you to come to class, and doing so I ended up doing well in a subject I don't tend to excel in. The essays were difficult but the exam was fair. He is a great prof!
Great guy, crazy smart. Essays were tough.

Really nice prof and always very willing to help. Very approachable. I noticed earlier comments that complained about him being disorganized, but I have found that his class is run very smoothly - he posts good lecture notes and assigns regular practice problems that are later taken up in class. I think he is an excellent prof overall.

Funny, engaging, and extremely insightful. He thinks quickly of the perfect answer to your question, and marks very fairly. If you think you were marked badly, prove it to him- if you can, you'll get an improvement.

Best prof at Mac... his courses are extremely interesting. He gets right down to the point, and always has an interesting remark after every idea is presented. He has inspired me to pursue philosophy. He is also awkward, and makes hilarious jokes. Take his classes if you can!

Love him! He's kind of awkward, but that's part of his awesome personality. He has REALLY helped me out by providing to my special needs. He gave us the questions for the exam, which is always helpful. Really interesting prof. Although, he answers a LOT of student questions which takes away sometimes from him.

He's amazing. He never stutters and never goes on tangents; he gets straight to the point and is interesting and compelling. He may be awkward but that's what makes him so down to earth. Really enjoying his class, even if it is a bit tricky.

Rodde is the best Prof ever. A lot of my professors are concerned with people talking/attendance.. and stupid things like that. Rodde just gets down to business, delivers what you need to know, keeps it interesting, engages with the class, and throws in some lame jokes! His classes are highly enjoyable.. .definitely my favourite prof.

Comes off as sweet/eager to please most of the time; hard to dislike. Enthusiastic about material. Marking more subjective than you'd expect seeing tests/assignments. Can be a bit out of line w/mockery (i.e. using past student's desperate begging to pass class as logical fallacy example for class to laugh at) but seems more awkward than malicious.
Although I found the course material interesting, Rodde was disorganized and unable to explain concepts clearly. Avoid if possible.
if u are smart u will do good. ps waht a sexy man

He taught this course for the first time, and he screwed up a little bit. But he accepted his mistakes and tried to make amends for it. And that is characteristic of a good prof! If you put forth a GOOD argument for why your test answer is plausible, he would actually accept it. His notes were detailed and he posts really good summaries of them.

PROS: He is very knowledgeable, and came to class well-prepared. He is down to earth, likable and identifies with student concerns easily. CONS: He is a young prof who had not taught this course before, and it showed. There was poor organization and planning of tests and assignment. But I am confident that he will quickly improve in these areas.

Dr. Rodde is a great prof who is passionate about his course material. People who tend to dislike him are usually just people who tend to dislike the course, or are themselves at fault (IE, I encounter people who accuse him of not making expectations clear, but never themselves paid attention in class).

This professor destroyed my interest in the course material. He made several offensive comments. He was unorganized and unable to explain concepts without being confused by the question being asked. He taught directly from the lecture notes, but these notes often had mistakes. I would not recommend this professor, although the course is required.

He's good at teaching- he explains concepts clearly and keeps it interesting. However, he is extremely disorganized when it comes to planning tests, assignments, etc. Expectations regarding tests and assessments are rarely clear, which is unnecessary and nerve-wracking. Sometimes his marking is far too difficult, subjective, and unfair.
awesome prof. loved his lectures and discussions even though they were regurtitations of the courseware.

I had him for a technology philosophy class first year as well, and I must say he is the best professor I have experienced so far.  Since he is young he seems to know how to explain things to students very well.  Never does he say anything which is unnecessary, yet his teaching style is not boring, but very interesting.
Rodde was pretty good. New, but good. I liked how every class, and I know you all noticed, began with "let us begin"!
Rodde is funny.

comments: I loved this class because he teaches it well and the material is interesting. It's not hard but it can get tricky if you don't thoroughly understand everything he teaches in lecture. Each time you skip a class you risk missing an important concept because the text only covers the theory which is difficult to apply to test problems without example.

Awful prof. For one of the midterms he said coverage ended at "chapter 7.6" and then on the midterm, he asked us about something from "7.7" (which he specifically said and wrote down would NOT be covered). I ended up with an 8 in the course, but this guy is just awful.

Honestly one of the worst professors I've had at Mac. He gave no indication of what to expect on the exam and midterms, and expected unrealistically specific answers for them. He also does not seem to care about his students. The lecture notes are not posted online, and if you miss one lecture and don't get the notes, it's extremely detrimental.

This guy is honestly one of the worst profs Mac has to offer. He's not helpful, he gives no specifics as to what will be on a final or midterm and he lectures as if he is explaining a documentary to you (ie: he doesnt stop). Avoid any class with him if possible, you'll be happy if you do

Terrible prof. Really does not care about the students and does not bother to be helpful at all. Confuses himself plenty of times during lecture and simply does not care about his job. Makes the class so much worse.

He except U know a lot& alot.He doesn't seem to enjoy what he teach now.The lecture is very borning, becz lacks of interaction with the class,and those two textbooks are totally useless!He talks through the whole lecture, it shuts everybody out.However,he is knowledgeble and extremely polite.In fact,he did a much better job in 3B!
Professor will fail to help you, expects you to know too much and does not provide enough examples (WITH ANSWERS!!!!!)

This guy is the most bitter, meanest prof I have ever encountered in my entire career at mac. This guy leading up to the exam was not approachable, never smiled, and did NOT want to answer students questions that were relevant to the exam. His classic response would be "it's in the book" or "we did this in class, it should be in your notes"...
Simply really, really bad prof.  Can't teach and has been recycling his own**** for years.
This is one of the best class I had at McMaster. Professor Leach is such a nice prof.
The examples in class are the midterm questions. It was a joke of a class
Okay prof. Too old fashioned.
No Comments

Don't listen to the other comments, this class is terrible.  The lectures are boring, and the examples are terrible from (surprise,surprise) a book he wrote.  He basically expects you to know advanced algebra.  There's rampant cheating on assignments as a lot of people pass around their work. Lousy!
Have to go to his lectures, otherwise sends out threatening emails :). Otherwise, he covers little material in the class and explains it in great detail, so not a very difficult class.
Worst lectures, very hard to keep up as he changes slides quickly.  Hated his teaching style. Must go to class if you want to do well
hard tests, no assignments to pull up the grade. And while you spend all your time to copy the notes, you can't listen effectively to him and analyze what he's saying.
No Comments
No Comments
go to class, learn the stuff
all right, i go to the class, just don't send out those  threaten email
Interesting and easy cousre. Gotta go to class. Not alot of material to study.:)
must go to his lecture
He is a good professor! His lecture is very clear!

comments: She is very strict and expects a lot out of you but she ultimately cares about you and honestly wants you to learn and gain something valuable from the course. She is like a prof who is also your mom.  Bio2L06 was by far my favorite class in university 10/10 would recommend.

This professor is one of the rudest, most conceited, and annoying lecturers I have ever witnessed. She always changes up deadline expecting that she is helping when intact she messed up the entire schedule. Also took her 2 months to grade a 2 page paper, btw it was a class of 28. Very rude, useless lectures, and very annoying. Labs are interesting.

Conceited prof. Discourages questions because she replies very rudely, and speaks only to the question asker. Then she'll ask THEM to answer their own question. Has a very specific marking scheme for test, every bit of info is worth only .5, meaning a lot of information has to be memorized to do well on the tests. Don't get her name wrong.

Dr. Daniel was a great professor! She's one of those profs who gives a lot but also expects a lot in return. The course load is heavier than most but very do-able and there's always people available to help when you're lost. I'd recommend this course. Ps. she's really funny

material is not so hard, after you understand it. but you wont understand it in class too much cause she just flies by her material. 3hr class is compressed into 1hr 1/2. critique is a pain in the butt to do, but theres no final!! presentation is easy. to do well, must go 2 class, and make sure you memorize everything b/c test is pure regurgitation

Worst prof I have ever had in university. Her tests are extremely hard, and the material is very dry. She is also self absorbed and rude, reads off the lecture slides, and doesnt bother explaining the material. She needs to go back to Queens.

Daniel goes through the material very fast, the testing is from her lecture material but the marking scheme is very specific. I did well but only because of the essay and presentation. Material is not too difficult but is challenging, going to class is a MUST

Not very good at lecturing, she reads from lecture notes. Her grad student Kevin Kelly is very good though. Her notes are good and you should study everything on them. Very particular and specific on test answers. Lots of students had many of issues in regards to marking.

dr. daniel is a terrible lecturer...she covers the material quickly...acts annoyed when people ask questions...she has a very uptight and sour personality...she is very defensive when she makes a mistake...very hard marker on her tests...she kept changing her expectations for our project...avoid taking classes with her if you can...shes a terror!!

Although I ended up doing quite well in this class, I was very unimpressed with Dr. Daniel. I found her to be very condescending, with a touch of narcissism. She needs to work on her rapport with students. The material was difficult but very interesting and useful if you are studying genetics. Do not rely on Dr. Daniel to teach you the material.

not the best lecturer - just reads off of the slides. she pauses to ask whether everyone understands what was just said and it is up to  the students to interject.  if a student asks a question, she is ALWAYS willing to spend time to answer it thoroughly since lecture material short.  hard class but possible to do well. very nice in person, though.

daniel is a terrible teacher, and shows no interest in improving her teaching stylewhatsoever. she is EXTREMELY inclear with her expectations in the class esp in our 50 percent project. she tries to excuse this by saying she does not want to baby us which is total crap. she doesn't care about her students at all

I would not recommend this course to anyone. Dr. Daniel presents the material in a complicated and uninteresting manner. When students ask questions in class she is condescending and will even make fun of them. Her midterm was extremely picky and she did not allow enough time (but did nothing to correct for the poor marks). Overall, a poor teacher.

fast and monotone in class. clear she'd rather be working on kaiso than lecturing. 2 hr test in 50 min slot. tells students not to bother her because she's busy entertaining a guest or working on a grant. really unclear in guidelines for 50% project. admitted to attempting to filter med/law/grad students from others. disorganized, unhelpful, bad!
such clear explanations and expectations
Her insecurities as a researcher are apparent in her teaching.  She would rather ramble on about her marginal accolades rather than educate eager students.
Dr. Daniel is willing to help clarify lectures at any time. She knows the lecture material very well.  Furthermore, she gives great adivce in regards to career planning.
She has a habit of explaining things wrong. She also seems like she is interested in helping you, but she really isn't.

This class was way better than what I had expected.  Half of the classes were cancelled due to our inquiry group meetings, and the tests were fairly good.  Her lecturing may be a bit boring at times, but her notes for this class were generally sufficient to do well without a textbook.
She is willing to repeat if there is difficulties with the material even tho she talks fast, but she is willing to help.  she want to help us to understand the material
Repeats way too much, makes class boring, likes to have an easy midterm but a final that will kill you!!

Good prof. Last of 3 profs to teach this class (& the best of the 3). Talks VERY fast but if needed, she will go over a point until it haunts your dreams. She could have made the exam MUCH worse than it was.

Not much personality...has a chip on her shoulder.  Her content was supposed to be interesting...instead she made it torture.  Her powerpoint notes are frighteningly sparse in content...add to that a completely horrendous textbook = nightmare exam!
No Comments

comments: She is very passionate about the material she teaches. Although sometimes the lectures can amble away from point, and sometimes things can be a bit confusing, she's an overall good prof. She loves when students show initiative and have discussions about the readings.
Super helpful! Very understanding and always willing to assist with assignments.

she's a great prof. not only did she make the material enjoyable, but she also made it easier to understand and work with. i also really liked that she makes a point to get to know her students and is understanding to our problems and helpful in any way she can be. easily one of the most understanding, helpful and concise profs i had at Mac.

Best prof. ever ! She is amazing and always there to talk to, she is capable of being on the same level as the students and can have a normal conversation with you. She is fair and does her best to help you where you need it.
Best Prof.
She's an amazing professor and is extremely helpful and knowledgeable!

I ended up in Dr. Grise's class by mistake when the class I was in didn't work out. The course was scary alien to me (Visionary Women - lots of Christianity and Sci-fi in the same room). This class became my favourite class. We laughed together and what should have been mindnumbingly difficult content became stuff I wanted to read. Go Grise!
One of the best profs I have ever had.
No Comment.

Prof. Grise is an amazing professor! I've learned so much from her and she's such a nice person as well. So approachable! If you try hard in her course, she will be very accommodating. I would definitely take a course again offered by her, if only I wasn't done this year!

Very passionate about teaching, but unfortunately her methods don't align with the modern student. Case in point: trying to break down our large lecture into smaller groups only alienates students who prefer to be lectured to. If class sizes were smaller, these ideas would work better!

Absolutely fantastic prof!  I had a bit of a hard time in her class, but she is super patient, approachable and very willing to help.  She helped me through writing one of my toughest essays yet.  Super nice person.  Take a course of her's if you get the chance!
No Comments

Kind of boring and comes off a bit scatter-brained.  She was repetitive, but I didn't find it helpful for the test.  She is helpful, which makes me think she'd be better for a high school class (not an insult).
Great class, love the lectures, tends to be slightly repetitive but gets the point across. Great prof :)
In a word: unstimulating. She talks down, teaches down, runs lectures like grade 9 english class.

Much better at classics than currents, and is a bit of a favoritist. Try her Shakespeare course. Tends to synopsise plots, but gives excellent essay critique when pressed. Simply a very busy woman, but an excellent prof.

Horrible. Badly organized, a horrible lecturer, and just ruined a class that should have been amazing. You know how some profs overanalyze, but it still makes sense? She would overanalyze, but her analysis wouldn't even fit with the work we were studying. HOOOOORRRIBLE.

Took a vastly interesting subject and turned it into torture.  Within the first 2 weeks many people had elected to stop attending.  The remainder who still did had difficulty paying attention through cell phones, games, and things being thrown (class completely out of control). Can't blame them--hugely boring. Her marking is also remarkably unjust.

I know sci fi isn't her thing, so despite her well-planned and thorough lectures, she came off a little boring. But she has all the sweetness of a kindergarten teacher - fantastic. She tends to do a lot of plot synopsis in her lectures, which gets a bit irritating.

excellent professor! She's repetitive, but that helps to emphasize key points, def. helps w/ studying. Go to lecture, do the readings, and you should be fine. So approchable, loves teaching. A pleasure to have been in her class.

Could you be more vague?! Very unclear, reuined what could have been an awesome course.  Cannot analyze fiction, and when she does, its errroneous. REPEATATIVE.  All in all, avoid all large lectures from her.
Outstanding job. Lectures are engaging, helpful, interesting. She prepares students very well and always encourages us to do our best. Always available and willing to help. Simply the best!

A very creative, engaging professor.  Very kind as well...evoked some interest in even Shakespeare's comedies, which was previously thought impossible... Come on, Macbeth/tragedies are so much better...Still, great class.
Such a great professor! Thought provoking, intelligent, sweet, kind, helpful...a pleasure to have as an instructor.
Intelligent and kind.  An absolute angel.  Never boring or mean.

Absolutely wonderful prof! She plans her lectures in advance, allows plenty of time for class discussion, and gently guides her students to achieve more than they thought possible. Refreshing. A true pleasure.
Fantastic woman! Brilliant!

Not an easy marker, but is more than willing to help her students achieve success. She is the nicest person I have had the pleasure to meet.  Her lectures are well planned and successful in helping students to understand content. Amazing prof!
the sweetest, most lovely teacher: she gives me hope in the education system

comments: Garrett has the nasty habit of interrogating students and is therefore somewhat of a bully to them.  Oh, and he talks too fast so that it's hard to take notes of off him.

Extremely rude to students. Can't argue without shouting his opponent down and dismissing all of their ideas as trivial. My TA wasn't very bright either, after questioning the grade I received on my first assignment, all of my later assignments were given very high marks with very, very little commentary.

I know that he is a philosopher, but after having a meeting with him, I have to say that he is overly opinionated and rigid to the point of arrogance.  Do not recommend him, please stay away from his classes.

Brian Garrett is an interesting character, to say the least. He has a very dynamic personality but can very often come off as patronizing. The material for this course is quite difficult to grasp, especially if you are not particularly interested in it. The assignments are pretty fair if you have a TA who is an easy marker (unlikely).
Best Philosophy professor on the planet, hands down!  This guy opened my mind and changed my life.  If you are reading this, Brian, THANK YOU!

Garrett treats his 4th year seminar the way he treats his first year philosophy students: poorly, arrogantly, with bias and an overt hatred for anything unfriendly to his laughably small tradition of analytic determinism in metaphysics. A christian by any other name...

Do not let this ridiculous professor ruin philosophy for you; he's the exception to McMaster's otherwise rather able department. Garret is arrogant and biased. He lusts after analytic nonsense and treats any imaginative or interesting ideas with the weary mind of a nay-saying sophist. His "metaphysics" is laughably narrow. The man cannot teach.

Lectures are engaging and interesting, but he's utterly arrogant and rude during an argument. Tries to talk over you when you present a rebuttal to his point. Seems to be only able to win arguments by bullying and interrupting his opponent in order to make them forget their points. Terrible at listening and very disrespectful during a debate.

Brilliant man, engaging lectures, governed by logic and reason (to a reasonable point). any unclear topics/ interests can be brought to him at the end of class for discussion, always resulting in talks of great substance. garrett is God. AND he exists.
Alot of the religious students didnt like him because he didnt cower to them. He said if its not within reason dont write it. Its philosophy...that makes sense. I love this man.

Prof knew his subject very well. Qualified. Uses logic and reason instead of emotion and other biases for answering questions. Brings to light issues with society.Some dislike him due to pure reason and lack of emotion (pussies). Answers questions with clarity; has a good sense of humour. Good intellect and moral standing. Insightful.

Great professor for 1E03. The lectures were very informative and helped understand the textbook readings. Greatly encouraged ideas and comments from the class. Assignments fairly easy, entire final exam given before hand. Always stayed back to answer questions. Amazing lecturer. Take the course if you're able to think critically with an open mind.
Terrible lectures. Almost ruined philosophy for me.
Delightful professor.  Engaging, funny and thought provoking.  He doesn't let students be intellectually lazy.  Cute when he cuts his hair.

Rude, rude, rude.  I did very well in the class, but I can't stand his pedagogy. I know he is knowledgeable in his field, but there is a reason he has been having trouble getting tenure - because his students hate him.

Vaguely remember him cutting people off and being somewhat snide. This class was difficult. If anything, he was confusing and did nothing to clarify the concepts. Definitely too narrow-minded. Never brought his dog to class when I was there. Too bad, the dog may have been more of a help!
I strongly disliked every aspect of this course. I will never take another philosophy course.

Dr. Garrett as a lecturer makes philosophy very interesting indeed by posing philosophy as rather cut and dry, (by the end, I felt as though philosophy was totally opposed to my own convictions).  I had him as a supervisor for a summer research project and was delightfully surprised at how different he was.  He was an excellent one-on-one educator.

say what you will about his personality, his biggest flaw in terms of teaching is a complete inapproachability. people were too scared to takl in his class, we wouldn't allow himself to be challenged. instead of learning, and sharing knowledge, we had to adopt all of his general thoughts and quote them on the exam.

Problems with Phil was course- MEAN TEACHER. Used raping women and killing babies for all examples during class and didn't realised that it could affect females in class. Whenever someone made a good rebuttal during lecture he would pretend not to hear it or just say that's stupid (in some form) & continue uninterrupted. Bad teacher although easy.

Most illogical and frustrating lectures I've ever attended. Uses bad examples and is often contradictory in his justifications for opinions. He's rude and cuts people off too. EXTREMELY obviously biased; doesn't even get you to read textbook sections that disagree with his position, and often doesn't even give them a fair chance. : /

I've been in many of Professor Garrett's lectures and would say that he's one of the finest profs McMaster has on the faculty. He's extremely fair when marking and always willing to take the time to explain things to you outside class. His lecture style is straight forward and unhurried. Also, he's a riot! A very funny man! Also has a nice dog!

I've had Garrett for 5 back to back terms now, and I can't think of a prof I've liked better!  Apart from his excellent lecturing style, he is demanding when it comes to papers and discussion, really makes you think and you writing will be way better after one of his classes.  Can by scary sometimes, but well worth it!  Oh Dr. G, you rock my world!
Amazing, simply great Prof. Tends to clarify ideas extremly well and explain concepts with entreme interest. Dr.Garrett has developed my interest in philosophy. Drives a car aswell

Great prof!  Simplifies complex ideas.  Next to Spiro, he is my favorite.  Can't wait to take another one of his classes.  Go to classes, especially a week before exams.  Gave out exam questions ahead of time.
i love this man. he is hilarious and intelligent. and i agree on the accent.. its hot. i also love when people ask dumb questions and he responds and makes everyone laugh.
k

His classes are always entertaining. His frank opinions about whether miracles are real or not are always fun to listen to. His clear shut-downs are also cool. It is enjoyable when he enters the class with his shirt untucked. Even better, is when his hair is messed around. The best, is a fresh hair cut. Ohh Dr. Garrett, your classes are awesome!

He is an incredible prof,extremely intelligent! I have learned a lot from him this term...he is a great inspiration.He is very helpful and approachable, and extended our first essay assignment by a week. He is awesome. Good job Garret!!! Oh - and totally hot..yeah...he's hot. (loving the accent...)
No Comments

Funny AND smart. Can never ABSOLUTELY know for sure what he thinks about a subject (other than the word ABSOLUTE). Marks fair depending on how much work you put into it. Should cut his hair more often though. Or go bald. Bald is sexy.
No Comments

Cool guy. sometimes brings his dog to class and seems intimidating when students ask questions. In reality an easy going and kind fellow, doesn't like lazy philosophy students taking advantage- werd! Is hot when he gets his haircuts.
No Comments

A great guy who really knows his stuff.Easy to talk to after class and quite nice if you don't ask too many dumb questions.Plays devils advocate a lot which make some think he's a jerk but he's not necessarily defending his own beliefs. Good at making hard material easier.Really pushes his students.

Nice relaxed form of lecturing, tries to enage class, extra points for putting up with some of the stupid questions people ask, breaks down teh course fairly though doesn't always stick right to the schedule. Interesting class. Cool accent
Great prof. Very engaging with the class and makes you think. Breaks down difficult concepts to make them easier to understand.  Pretty funny, and a cool accent.

comments: Probably the best lecturer at Mac; made waking up for 8:30 worth it.  My saviour
Very very amazingly good. You can tell she really puts so much effort into teaching so you want to put effort into learning.
THE BEST THING TO HAPPEN TO CHEMISTRY
The lady is a saint.
I really enjoyed this course mostly due to professor Lock

Lock is very clear when she teaches and she makes sure that every single person in the room understands before she moves on which can be repetitive if it's a simple concept or if you already understand. She's very enthusiastic when she teaches. Overall a good first year chem prof.

Pippa Lock is honestly one of the most amazing professors at mcmaster. She is very smart, and keeps things simple. She takes you step by step through concepts in chemistry and moves very slowly. and she is very interactive with the class. She also jokes a lot. She also Doesn't proceed until everyone in the room understands. Her passion is teaching.

Absolutely amazing. She made my first year chemistry experience totally worth it. There were like 300 people in that class, and she ran the class so that faster learners weren't held back and slower learners weren't left behind. Absolutely brilliant in chem and teaching.

She's such a wonderful person! I regret not dropping in for her office hours because she seemed like a person you just want to get to know. Aside from that, she definitely knows the material inside & out, and doesn't carry on until she feels all 360 students in the room know the content. Her exam was challenging, but fair. So lucky to have had her!
Amazing professor and an amazing person. Always ready to help you  no mattter what and teaches wonderfully too. If you have the option, take her class and make the time to go to her office hours!!

It really doesn't get any better than Dr. Lock.  In lectures, she is extremely kind, engaging, intelligent and receptive to questions.  She explains everything perfectly and makes me love chemistry.  She genuinely cares about her students and seems like such a sweet person.  I feel so blessed to have her teaching my core!
Fantastic! She has lots of office hours and is always willing to give extra help or clarify things.
OK. BEST PROF EVER. She is the reason why I started to love chemistry after hating it for so long. She is amazing!!
Fantastic prof. She encourages questions and seems to genuinely care if her students do well. Great teacher and is good at explaining difficult concepts.

Amazing prof! Explains everything very well, very approachable and wants everyone to succeed. I approached her many times after class for clarification and it helped so much! Even though she is very monotone, if you pay attention it will be worthwhile!
Amazing professor, explains concepts really well, and makes sure everyone in the class understands!

An outstanding chemistry professor who really does want you to succeed. She goes a little slower than other professors which is great and is great at explaining complicated concepts. She also answers A LOT of questions which helps you understand the concepts even better. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
she's an ok prof
super nice prof, baby feeds you like a high school teacher. very approachable

Wonderful professor, very clear and approachable. Makes chemistry non-intimidating. Provides lots of helpful hints. Engages with the class and asks (and answers) lots of questions. Makes an effort to learn students' names. Clear, concise.
Very approachable prof. Definitely wants you to succeed. Teaches concepts well.
She was incredible. made even the toughest concepts manageable, very funny, sincere. Highly recommended.
Very helpful prof, really wants students to understand and succeed. Difficult course material but she does a good job simplifying it for students.
She is super inspiring. I love chemistry now. The course is very hard, and she expects a lot from students.
She is awesome! She is very encouraging and really enthusiastic about chemistry. Great Prof!
One of the best at Mac. Totally approachable, and very passionate about her work. Would recommend her to ANYONE, even if you hate science.
She's amazing.
She was great!
Very good prof.
Great prof! Very approachable and enthusiastic!!

She is amazing!!! , really amazing. She makes chemistry really easy and fun to study and explains everything clearly.... am taking this course for the second time, and comparing to the first time, oh god the first time was horrible but now it's realy fun because our prof is fun...

Excellent instructor. Unlike many instructors, Pippa is a teacher first. She communicates difficult concepts clearly. She stays away from unnecessary and distracting technologies (ie. PowerPoint). Her lectures are paced well--she moves at a measured pace and includes many examples for students to work through in class. She is enthusiastic!
She is the most helpful prof I've had so far! She really takes the time to get to know students, and there are no 'dumb' questions with her!
No Comments
i love her. she is indeed the best prof. in mcmaster university.
1aa3 - really hard course, but an amazing prof who can make you understand anything. really nice person.

Lock ROCKS MY SOCKS!! I loved the fact that when we had questions she would open it up to the entire lecture hall to answer as opposed to only herself answering the questions most of the time. I also loved the concept of "Review by Demo" *2 thumbs up* and I thoroughly enjoyed myself in Chem this term. Looking forward to 1AA3 with her again!!!
She is awesome
LOCK IS THE CHEM GODDESS! She is very helpful and an amazing teacher. Her tests are not easy, but with her you have a chance of doing well.

Fabulous prof. Helpful, caring, and doesn't put you to sleep at 8 30 am. Actually tries to learn the names of atleast some of the 500+ ppl in our class. Call me crazy, but I think this one actually cares...(atelast more than the others)
Absolutely phenomenal professor! Always incredibly helpful to all her students (even makes frequent appearences in labs!). Explains things in a way that's clear and concise. My favourite by far...
Awesome, awesome, awesome.  So helpful and nice.  Top-notch, she could teach anything to anyone.
Friendly, helpful and clear.  One of my favourites.
She is simply the best!
she makes transition from high school to uni real nice and easy

AMAZING PROF. She's genuinely caring, extremely knowledgable and always willing to help. She's not snobby or pretentious like some other profs, and truly cares about the progress of students. Great at explaining concepts and her test questions are generally very fair.
Pippa is amazing she makes an effort to know peoples names, and she knows them without you ever telling her formally! She is tought but fair and runs an awsome class!
Dr. Lock is an exceptional teacher, they really don't get any better than her.  Lectures are very easy to follow.  The class is hard, despite not having labs.
The best prof I've had yet... extremely helpful and bright, if all profs were this good the world would be a better place.
Awesome

AWESOME prof! I've had her for all of my first year chemistry and she teaches very similar to a high school teacher, so the transition to the new material isn't as drastic! She explains concepts thoroughly and gives excellent notes
I didn't regularly go to her lectures but her Final exam review helped me out a lot. Explains very clearly and quite helpful.
excellent professor

Great prof!! I had another chem prof in the beginning of 1AO3 and changed to Pippa's lecture and have never regreted it. She explains well, has well-paced lectures, is fair and is always there to help! She made chem fun and enjoyable!
average prof. Oversimplifies at times and during answering of questions fails to accomadate everyones questions since oversimplistically explains for a prolonged period of time.

An engaging lecturer. Very tough course, but knows when tests are not fair. A great prof who will help any way she can. The course had a lot of material, but her lectures and assignments will help you do well (as it should be!).
No Comments

'hot' as in attractive. Her writing is very clear and her notes are well organized, she posts it online which is helpful. She gives us time to write the notes and speaks slow and fluently. However, she's too demanding for participation and her excersizes are not helpful, she should go through it.
Lock is amazing, I started going to her lectures instead of my normal prof. Great teaching skills.
too cool
One of the best profs in first year.
AMAZING prof!!
nice lady.  Tough course
great prof, but hard course
Feels like I'm still in highschool, but at least going to chemistry now makes me feel smart. I love how she gives us examples. Prof of the year!
Good prof, Interesting course
Dr.Lock is an excellent teacher, very dedicated and caring. She makes the material easy to comprehend and is willing to aid students whenever possible.
actually enjoyed lectures
great prof, verry clear and enthusiastic she makes u want to do chem....pipa u rule.
She filled in for my prof today and did an amazing job.  I understood her completely.  Very nice person too.
she is very clear in her lectures and very helpful.  one of the best chem teachers i've ever had.
No Comments
good
very overrated.  very patronizing.  she doesn't always answer questions; instead, she promises to answer them on webct and then doesn't.  not cool.  mac needs some new chm profs.

I found pippa to be very condescending.  She insults her students' intelligence.  I think the reason so many people like her is because she reminds them of their preschool teachers. You aren't a 'young adult' anymore pippa, stop trying to act like one.
Best chem teacher I've ever had. Incredibly patient and thorough.
Great lady. very helpful, intresting and there to teach.
she's great. helpful and interested in you doing well
pippa u r #1
Pippa, you are the best prof ever!
GGREEATEST PROFF!!!!!!
pippa rules
Very nice, interested in students doing well
AWESOME!!!
Absolutely Awesome Teaching Style!!!
fabulous! ~ explains everything really well!
pippa you are the best, funny, nice, approchable.
She puts my mind into a state of equilibrium.
PIPPA ROCKS
Best prof ever! I can do chemistry now.
Extremely good professor. Very funny and informative
Great Prof.  Lectures always full.
She teaches as if we're in highschool...which is a good thing!
Very kind and helpful!
awesome prof
Best prof! Make chemistry very interesting...she is super helpful..thanks prof!
Great prof.  Made chemistry seem easy.  Very clear teaching style.
Great teacher. A little slow at times, but it's better for overall understanding
really awesome
She is helpful during office hours and interacts well with students.

comments: Egan is a good professor, and is an interesting guy. However, he doesnt give clear instructions for assignments. His explanations for assignments are usually in class and can be vague. If you need clear instructions to do well then this might be difficult. Lots of timed collaborative projects as well.

Obviously very passionate about his topic and this enthusiasm is infectious. Lectures are engaging and in depth even at 8.30 on a Wednesday morning. Shows the actual science experiments which his is describing a historical context in class which is brilliant. Overall great professor who gives interesting and engaging courses.

The lectures have a lot of information and his gives long examples, but this really help with understanding. Tutorials are great as long as you have read at least one of the articles. Very passionate lectures and every thing is online in case you miss something.

Egan is a young environmentalist with a PHD. He talks a mile a minute and runs with his amazing slide shows, knowledge and charisma. Tedious off the wall assignments will ruin the momentum. Online group projects collecting hundreds of newspaper clippings with unknown software will be a too good to be true revelation. Essay instructions are vague

One of my favourite profs. That being said his assignments are unconventional which makes the difficult. But his lectures well make you take a step back and reevaluate the world you thought you live in.

In lecture it sounds like hes lecturing less and reading off speech cards he made at home the night before. Feels like story time with a couple of big words thrown in. His assignment instructions are very unorganized and it seems as though he always has to send mass emails constantly explaining them. Would not recommend taking this course.

I had Egan in both undergrad and graduate school. He's a really nice guy, and clear on what he expects- until he flips the table on you. All his courses are packed with great learning, but sometimes his ambitions exceed realistic outcomes, especially in his seminars. I'd say if you're a motivated, detail-oriented learner, his courses are for you.

Very smart man, nice guy too.  Lectures were great and informative.  He can get a little too ideological at times (very left-wing) but isn't pretentious at all.  Would definitely recommend him to anyone.

Such a great professor! He's very passionate about what he teaches and is helpful and approachable. The lectures are really interesting and the little jokes he throws in make it that much more enjoyable. The books were good reads and inexpensive. I will definitely be takeing his other classes in the future!
A great professor. Makes everything clear and coherent. Very helpful and approachable. He adds humour in his lectures which makes them more interesting.

I actually have no recollection of the course code - it was a third year seminar style class on the history of science and its relation to social responsibility. Egan runs an incredible seminar, not pretentious, makes you feel heard and that your ideas are worthwhile. You definitely need to be on top of course material on a weekly basis.

Probably the coolest professor you'll meet, just talk to him if you're having any problems and he'll help you out.  Great teaching philosophy - his lectures aren't about scribbling down each detail, you just need to get a grip on the main concepts and the material he provides takes it from there.
Overall a good professor.  Seems to enjoy what he does.  Go to class, it makes understanding the material easier.
Very Clear on his expectations. If you follow them, you will do really well

If you dig his humour and have an interest in fantastic discussion on nearly any topic, Eagan is your man. He is definitely one of my favourite profs, I do believe he could make even the most mundane of topics a joy to discuss.

interesting discussions. very intelligent and knowledgeable about course content.  however, assignment outlines could have been much clearer. if you have difficultly without clear guidelines on assignments, dr. egan would be difficult as your professor.

Love Dr. Egan, he's a pretty cool guy and is incredibly passionate about his material.  The text and coursewear this year were really reasonably priced, under $60 for the two.  Sometimes his lectures are a little bit out there but overall they're really good.

I can't say enough about Dr. Egan. His classes are a challenge but completely worthwhile. His lectures are fast and extensive, but he puts it all online. It's really easy to contact him, and you'll want to--cause he's the coolest guy. His humour, and the interest he applies to his lectures make you love his class. Seriously, hard--but worth it.

Course materials over $300. I would NEVER take another course with him based on that. That is ridiculous. He is kind of funny, but his classes are very hard. I thought it was WAY too hard for second year. Too many little assignments, too much reading. Helpful if you need him, but doesn't seem too approachable. Lectures very clear.
egostistical crowd pleaser, his self-depreciating humour that he thinks is funny is annoying and i actually tend to believe the open criticisms he makes about himself.

-passionate about material -cares about student progress - very approachable - informative - too many readings and assignments worth too little - discussions tended to digress from material making you wonder why you're paying 900$ all in - should be better next year as a lecture instead of discussion class - be interested or don't take it
Very well-informed prof. Easy to approach, easy to talk to, lectures quite well. However, in this course there are TOO MANY LITTLE ASSIGNMENTS. And the courseware cost over 400 dollars all told!
he talks to fast
Such a great teacher, just so much to learn in the class
Talks way to fast. Doesn't allow students to keep up with his teaching.

Way too much info for a 3 unit course.  If your strengths are conducting your own research and writing intelligent term papers, don't take this class.  Assignments are pointless 2-page "discussion papers", which are a complete waste of time.

very interesting, dynamic lecturer. definately not a boring class! far too many readings, lots of small assignments. the class was a challenge, but the professor was great. approachable, funny, interested in students' success.

This class was alrite, if you are really interested in the topic. It is easy to do well in this class if you hand stuff in and go to tutorial.  Powerpoint is helpful-BECAUSE IT IS ON-LINE(thank-God) He puts too much info in the lecture, and not enough of whats very important.  BE INTERESTED IN THE TOPIC or else lectures get boring.

I enjoyed his class, he is pretty enthusiastic and he covers different material than you would expect, but still keeps it relevant and informative.  The assignments were challenging, the second one more so than the first, but it is still possible to do well on them.  Exam was straight forward an easy.  Makes use of WebCT which is nice to see.

His lectures force you to draw your own conclusions, as opposed to just handing them out. I understand why some people won't like that, but I found it refreshing to have to think and listen at the same time. He is definitely passionate about the material he teaches. Combine that with his low tech skills, and you have an old school lecturer.
ridiculous reading assignments for essays - lectures don't match readings - hard to understand --> they tell us in our essay's to answer the "so what" question; for this course, i'm still wondering.
I find it hard to follow his lecture along with his slides, which somewhat disinterests me in the material. Originally there was a large amount of reading for tutorial which he later reduced.
Seems nice, funny, and wants to teach you alot.  Not a bad guy at all!
So far so good, seems lik e afunny and down to earth guy

comments: Dr. Rowe is a saint. One of the best professors in Mac for sure!

I took his Asian religion course as a filler with literally no interest in it and now I look foreword to going to lectures. He genuinely cares about the material and wants his students to succeed. His lectures include more of stories and hilarious antics then actual lecture notes. My favourite prof in uni so far.

A great professor who knows what he's talking about. He really cares about the quality of his lectures and discussions and doesn't waste anybody's time like most profs. The class was REALLY easy because he made the coursework exceptionally interesting. I never missed a lecture because everything he said was on fleek, or on point, ya'know?

He is an amazing lecturer, and usually communicated the material clearly. You have to come to class to do well, but I wish the criteria for the assignments was more clear-cut other than that, he was great!

Aside from his hottness, he is an amazing lecturer. I went to every lecture because of his interesting lecture style and personal experiences directly relating to the course material. This is one of my favourite classes I have ever taken at McMaster and I feel like I have learned a lot. I feel very inspired by him.

Entertaining lectures but SUPER full of himself. Be prepared for loads of memorization; you basically have to remember every single date he discusses about in class and every single title and article in the course pack. Probably won't ever take a class with him again because of how tedious the studying is.
One of my favorite professors at McMaster. Gives interesting lectures and is very friendly and helpful. Was willing to proof read our papers before we handed them in for marking.
Best teacher I had this term. If there's a reason I think I'll stay at McMaster it's for him. I learned a lot thanks to him.

His lecturing style is very entertaining, adds personal experiences to make the otherwise dry material come alive. However, not too clear on explanations and rushed the material a bit toward the end of the term. Overall, he's a very influential speaker and does well to encourage the students, not only a good professor, but also a good teacher.
this man is by far the hottest prof I have ever had in my university career. Thumbs up to this man! Ps. he is also an amazing teacher.
I was never really interested in the Asian religions until Dr Rowe's class. He is the best prof I've had in 4 years. He makes you actually WANT to go to class, even if just for the jokes and antics.
Great Prof. Material is more specific than what was covered in 2tt3 and 2P03. Material is extremely interesting.

Without a word of a lie, the best prof I have ever had. Very entertaining, good material, makes you want to come to class. Material is easy, but you will have a hard time if you are not interested (just like any class).

He was my Hot Prof. All lectures were very interesting and i never missed one. Have taken one other course taught by him and loved it. If ppl didn't do well on the tests it's because they didn't go to class. He teaches clearly and well. I used all the information he taught about Japan for my trip there.

Includes tons of stuff in lecture that will never be on tests.Tests on material that was glossed over in class or not brought at all.Some classes were nothing more than him showing off and had nothing to do with religion,like that stupid video of him on a Japanese game show.The lectures and readings are identical to his 3E03 class.

Great prof! Very interesting and I learned a lot. Definitely pay attention, though, because there's lots to memorize and it's key to doing well. Don't know why people didn't do well on his tests - he clearly stated his expectations and what to study, so DO listen to these hints.

Took his Japanese Religion and Pop Culture course and it was really fun and informative! Lectures were set up well, the subject matter was always connected to modern day and Dr. Rowe was great to listen to. Didn't miss a class because I didn't want to! Didn't do many of the readings but still managed to get by with a B because I went to every class

I thought this would be an easy course, but it wasn't. A lot of people did poorly on the midterm, so much so that it was announced in class. The lectures were interesting but the tests were not the easiest.
Very good use of materials and personal experience. Entertaining and easy to approach.
Besides his good looks.....Dr. Rowe is very knowledgeable about Eastern/Japanese religion and has a very creative approach to teaching.
Great Prof! Very Cute!
No Comments
Awesome prof! Interesting lectures and very funny. You should take any class you can with him.

comments: Ms. Salisbury was an accomplished professor. She was thorough in teaching. She definitely has a higher standard when it comes to performance and grading. She made her students to read the text and go deep down in seeking knowledge. Her assignments were thoughtful and created a positive learning experience.

In a course that seeks to teach efficiency maximization, it is taught in the most inefficient method - lessons on Excel functions are taught using transparent slides with screen shots. Tiina is unapproachable, immovable when it comes to student requests, an unforgiving marker and provides low return on investment.
Very helpful and enthusiastic about helping students.
Doesn't know her material very well. Not helpful. Does not prepare you for exam.
You have been warned.  Tricky exams, with low practical application.  Lots of useless momorization; pretty lame for a masters program.
not an mba level professor, should stick to commerce courses. she does not have the background to teach at this level.

Very Very BAD professor. She only has an MBA and has not a degree in Stat, just reads from her slides, unfair marking, NOT helpful at all, a crazy WINO, I hope I won't see her again in my entire life. If you want to know how much she knows just ask her a little twisted question, they you realize how good she is, KNOWS NOTHING of Stat.
Clear, detailed instruction (requires full attention) via methodical delivery, complete with practical application.  Requires an honest dilligence that will result in decent retention.

Her classes are boring but she is a great teacher in preparing you for exams.  Her exams are fair and very similar to practice q's and exams.  However, she's not that helpful or understanding if you ask for help or disagree with a mark
No Comments
Tiiiiiiiiiinnnnnnnnnnaaaaaaaaaa              (no point in going to class though)
she's a great prof!  makes sure class understands the material and is clear in her teaching.  very organized and competent.
Always available to help students out. Very straightforward in everything.
she is a good prof.  Well organized and helpful.  Sometimes she can get boring but tries her best.  Don't miss her classes, they're important.
No Comments
Come on guys. You get formula sheets for both her classes, you just have to go to class and know when to use which formula. It's not rocket science.

The material in this class is easy enough, that you should be able to get buy on the text.  Although lectures can be boring, they are useful, and straight to the point.  If you do go to class, and read the book, then you should score an A.
Extremely bad  professor.. Marks unfair in her midterms and cannot teach if her life depended on it. Does not know her material, just reads from slides.
Good Prof. very understanding and easy to understand.
Doesn't post notes on Web.  Not a great prof.  Too bad the classes she teaches are required.
very helpful.  actually cares about students and how they do in the course.
Generally a good prof with a well organized course.  Seems to take pleasure in giving tricky exams.
Completely useless, one of the laziest people I've ever met.  Is unavailable and goes out of her way to avoid being of use to students. Refuses to provide extra help.

Doesn't post lecture notes on website. Goes too fast in lectures...you really have to follow every class to know what she's talking about. Stupid multiple choice format for all tests/exam. Doesn't care if students understand or not, just plows through.
the final was a bloodbath.  2 hours given for a 3 hour exam....  booooourns.
final exam was written with the intent to lower overall grades.  What should have been a 3 hour exam was given to us to complete in only two.
Midterms are fair, the final is killer
Emphasises MRP math in chapter 12....and then show nothing on the final?  2 hours was not enough
she cannot answer a question - why should we learn it if she doesn't know it
sucks
What the Hell was that final exam?!?  2 HOURS MY ASS!  We needed more like 2 days!  Unfair finals is Salisbury's favourite thing...  I would say more, but this will be censored.   !@#!@$%^$#@
Final Exam Really Tough
tricky but fair
no surprises, very fair
No Comments

don't ask any questions you won't get an good answer if you get one at all

comments: See the rating underneath mine.  If the course was spread out over a full year, it would fix a lot of the problems.  McDonald herself is great.

Dr. McDonald is approachable, knowledgable, and helpful.  The course content was interesting and the assignments and grading schemes were fair. My two main gripes are that her lectures were very disorganized, and the exam was a 5-hour exam crammed into 2 hours.
Very passionate, but awful at conveying information. Had incredible difficultly following lectures.
Very heavy coursework but one of the most interesting classes I've taken.

Yes, there's alot of work, but that's university. If it got much easier, our degrees would be worthless. Dr. McDonald went above and beyond to help me when I needed it, and was also very inspiring as an academic. She knows alot about Russian history and if you're interested in the subject, you will learn much by taking her courses. Very reasonable.
AMAZING!

Dr. McDonald is an amazing professor. Extremely approachable, willing to assist students when needed, and passionate about her work. Do not take her classes if you are looking to just 'get by.' Her lectures and readings are intense, but if you put in the work, you will succeed and learn in the process.

Wonderful woman clearly passionate about her subjects. But does not pass that onto students. Lectures/work load impossible to keep up with. WAY too intense and challenging, definitely does not teach at the appropriate grade level. If you take this class with a medium-heavy course load, you will NOT succeed.
Dr. McDonald lectures quickly but only because she's so passionate. She's willing to explain anything, very approachable and easy to talk to. It doesn't hurt that she's smokin' hot.

definitely a woman who commands respect. however her lectures were too intense and difficult to comprehend. thoroughly interesting course matter, but too intense of study considering this was one of many classes for history majors. way to difficult for second year, too demanding, and all together unpleasent. but she was definitely passionate.
Interesting class to take.  It was better than I thought.  She knows what she is talking about...which is always a plus.

While her lectures were very interesting, she went through material much too fast. Doesn't seem to care about the progress of undergrad students, leaves everything in the hands of the unhelpful TAs. She had unrealistic expectations for student performance on a difficult exam. I'll avoid her courses in the future.

She lectures way to fast, so many Russian names, it was easy to get lost.  Assumes way to much prior knowledge, especially  when there's no required text book.  The readings were mostly primary sources and articles that didn't always relate to what was going on in class.  And the exam looks brutal. =
too overwhelming. Could not follow lectures.
It seemed like she just read an essay to us every class.

man, all those comments sound the same. Same rater perhaps? She seems nice, but scatterbrained and out of touch with undergrad teaching. "Forgot" to put up our tutorial questions one week, then had an assignment that gave some tutorials 4 days more to complete than others. Generally mediocre.

Wonderful and approachable professor. She makes the seemingly impossible quite possible to understand. Willing to explain herself and includes a wonderful sense of humour into her lectures. I will take every possible class with her.
DR MCDONALD ROCKS!

Amaaaaazing prof. Soooo helpful.  She only wants you to do well.  But she does lecture very quickly, and does assume some prior knowledge.  BUT if you ask her about things, she'll be more than happy to explain them and discuss them with you. Just go talk to her!! She lectures really well, and keeps you very interested. TAKE HER CLASSES!
No Comments

I hated the first term of this course, but had a complete change of heart after taking the Soviet half. Amazing prof, very nice, more than willing to help, knows so much. I could listen to her tell stories for all of tutorial. Readings are fantastic, explains them well in tutorial, novels are always interesting. Will slow down in lecture if asked.

Amazing prof! Does talk very fast but will slow down or repeat herslf when asked. Gives great detail in lecture, and assigns interesting primary sources to read. Excellent as a tutorial leader as well. Has much knowledge and experience in the field, and great stories to tell about her time in Russia. Very approachable. Would have her as a prof agai

Ok so nice lady, very approachable but her lectures are BRUTAL wayyy too fast, assumes prior knowlege veryyy confusing!A! 2 original document analyses (Russian novles)a huge research paper and an exam...NOT WORTH IT!!

AMAZING PROF! Talks very quickly, but don't be afraid to ask her to slow down as she's very nice and approachable. Makes Russian history fun and easy to remember. Uses overheads and maps. Two small assignments, very fair marking, and gets you started on the big historical research essay very early. GO TO CLASS, THOUGH!

comments: An awesome, entertaining lecturer.  Made Plato's Republic accessible and comprehesible.  He said that he re-reads The Republic every decade and finds new stuff in it.  I still remember his stories, vocal delivery and timing to this day, 8 years later. "Cats are very good... with mustard."  "I think what Plato is trying to say here is..."

This guy is truly hilarious. Easiest marker I have ever encountered. He pretty much tells you exactly what will be on the exam to the point where he is actually giving you the exam questions. He doesn't lecture all that well though but I didn't care. "I don't want to lose my train of thought because I would be loosing a lot of trains." - Spiro
Biased, and unaccepting of contrary opinions, wich is quite unfortunate considering he is a philosophy prof. Go to class if you enjoy being preached to, otherwise I would not recomend this prof.

Its almost as if sumone woke spiro up and told him to teach a class! dopey and mellow, yet simotaneously smart and insightful.  spiro is the****.                      "that was a curious sneeze"                                                           "the guardians had procreation festivals...which sounds very delightful"

I hated this course... my T.A. was a prick and a hard marker... but Panagiotou made it liveable!  I brought my mark issues to him, and he reevaluated me without any complaint.  Very helpful, and very nice.
Spiro is awesome all around, most interesting, down to earth and fun prof ever

great prof, extremly approachable and funny to top it all of. I love the comical approaches and real life examples he uses in his lectures. Simply worth expieriencing it for yourself. I hear hes got an amazing dog aswell
This was the best prof I've had this term.  He's hilarious and easy to listen to.  I really love the guy, and he's loves to fish.
Best philosophy prof. I have ever had.  After taking 2A06 last year with another prof. I almost quit philosophy. Glad I took it again with Spiro.  Love the class!
This guy is awesome! definitely not a morning person...best accent ever, when he says justice its just hilarious. great teacher, however tends to repeat one fact over and over again.

The man is a genius in his own right. His political and personal analogies to the philosophers' concepts are great. "Her dog shat on my lawn, I kindly asked her to pick it up, she said no, so I told her to **** off"-Spiro

Absolutely hilarious! If it wasn't for this professor I can't see any reason why I'd go to an 8:30 lecture. His lectures are also interesting and very funny.He is also realy helpful if you have an issues or concerns. I would recommend this prof to anyone interested in philosophy. With him teaching you are guaranteed to enjoy youself.
Great guy.  Really funny.  Not at all pretentious. Loves throwing sex references into lectures...not a morning person though.  Take his class if it is in the afternoon.
Generally Speaking, he's a pretty down to earth guy with a good sense of humour.
Great Professor, doesn't have any of that I'm a PHD Pretentiousness. Knows his material but teaches philosophy as it should be, the last of the true liberal arts! Grrrreeaaat Spiro!

This guy HATES his mother-in-law.  Once he gave an analogy about Aristotles use of the "mean," and related it to carving his mother-in-law like a turkey (it was around Thanksgiving).  Ha! He is absent-minded and dopey..yet smart.  "is something dripping on me..."-Spiro Panagiotou
Relaxation incarnate.  That he confessed confusion at certain points while attempting to render 'Republic' clear, elicited my respect.  A modest (dare I say humble?) academic of the highest order.

Always seems sleepy when entering the class. He's slow in speech, but that gives people (like me) enough time to type every word he says. He makes such honest mistakes and gives good examples. His personal stories are hilarious. Good lectures if you can stay awake.
No Comments
He actually made me understand Plato's Republic WELL...sure he is a slow speaker, but at least he makes sure to stress important points.  I still remember it 3 years later.
No Comments
Should rant more, i don't care if it is useless
i love spiro...he's funny and nice and pretty hot
hey Thressamacus.  hey Polymaccus.  The guy is a riot and lazy as can be.  Easy class, fun jokes.
Love the accent.

Spiro! He's pretty cool if you can stay awake in lecture. He really REALLY likes Plato and the republic so it's cool to see an enthusiastic prof.  He just has slow speech and a heavy Greek accent which can cause sleepiness.
Sooooo slooooooooooooow... soooooo booooooring
No Comments
