comments: She was pretty easy for testing purposes, but refused to answer questions regarding material from the other professor that teaches the course, even though she should know the material too. She was really dry, and although I initially planned to attend all classes, I ended up skipping a bunch a still doing well.
Answer questions ok. Very unclear on lecture material. Don't even know what to expect on tests. Nightmares.

I don't even know where to start with her. She knows absolutely NOTHING about genetics. And she keeps saying things like, "I'm an ecologist, I don't know how this works on a molecular basis." That does NOT excuse her! She doesn't use her own slides. It's clear she doesn't even go over the slides prior to the lesson.

Why on Earth is a plant ecologist teaching genetics??? Her answer to every question so far this term has been 'I don't know'.  She's not confident with the material.  I really don't mind her as a prof for other courses (like 2D03), but not genetics...I actually feel sorry for her teaching this course!!

She is a bit disorganized, and that just makes the concepts harder to grasp, and everyone sits in the class clueless due to it. But her posted notes are excellent, so fear not. They have everything she says and that you need to know. Her  tests are straight forward and you can do well in her courses.
BORING!!

Horrible in 1aa3, better in 2d03 probly coz shes more comfortable with the subject.easy course if u attend lectures and labs and pay attention, got an easy 12, hardly ever read the text. i'd call it a bird course.

A bit disorganized and doesn't follow the textbook at all. Classes are necessary since it's hard to grasp the concepts from her notes alone. The exam questions are easy as long as you know definitions and are familiar with the experiments discussed in lecture.
Her appearance can be described as frumpy, and her use of teaching aids is questionable.  MUST attend classes, as her test questions are solely based on these.
I learned a lot from taking 2D03. I found that if you studied, you did well. plus, with all the bonous questions, how can you not do well?
focuses more on her hair than the class!
I had her last year for BIO 1AA3 last year. for all you 1st years, sh's a combination of Jacobs and Wilson:(. So watch out for her teaching and her test. HORRIBLEEEEEEEEE
Very unorganized prof. lectures wern't useful and her test were not realted to the lectures.
Very boring cl****!!! make sure you pay attention to everything in the lab!! DONT take pictures just draw everything out!! lab tests were very hard!! exam was fair!!

Like one of the previous posters, I hated her in 1AA3 but I actually think she did a decent job with 2D03, maybe because she feels more comfortable with the subject matter or for some other reason. I didn't love the class (it's plants!) but I did finally appreciate plants. She is disorganized in lecture but it's something I got used to.
Very disorganized and does not make the course very exciting.  Avoid the course if possible

when i had her in 1aa3, i really really disliked her... because she was unorganized. i took 2d03, and my opinions of her have changed. she's a really nice person. i know it might sound weird, but she made me appreciate plants... and i also think most first yrs dislike her because she is fed up with the lazy ones that do nothing.
very unorganized prof, i have no idea what shes talking about half the time. bad jokes too
Her notes are aweful and she isnt even organized. The way she teaches is all wrong.
the most ridiculous test questions

I listened to music in this class just to stay awake. She bored me to sleep 'cause her notes were so random and she was ALWAYS jumping from one topic to another and they weren't really connected to one another. And I agree with previous comments about very random tests.
Her handwriting is terrible..it is better to listen to what she is saying rather than copying her notes which are not organized and go over the place. Very boring class
Nice lady but miserably bad professor, worst I've had so far.  Watch out for her incredibly random tests.
Hands down, worst prof ive had so far....randomness in her lectures, and terrible notes. Then we get tested on random stuff not covered in lecture.

She is a nice enough lady, and I'm sure has the best intentions in teaching us..but is the worst university prof I've experienced so far. Her lectures are a random jumbled mess of thoughts that jump all over the place. Her posted notes don't make sense even if you attend lecture. Her writing is incomprehensible. I can't stand attending her class.

Only downfall would be her notes, otherwise I think she's a very nice prof. And if you approach her she's willing to help you out. I only took the course for the bio requirement, but in the end I'm glad I took it.

Write what she says, not what she writes, this is the key to success in her class.  Otherwise, your notes will be a disconnected jumble of random words.  Not very helpful and seems incapable of answering a question concisely. Likes making generalizations WAAY too much.
Having to take lecture notes is a good tactic. Unless the lectures could be half empty!

The worst prof I have ever had. The's just not stupid and incompetent, she also doesn't care about teaching. Her lectures are all over the place. Nobody knows what she is writing or even talking about. She just plain SUCKS!! Do not take any course with her and Thelma Leech as a combo. HORRIBLE!!!
random...notes typed or not were terrible for studying. A lot of it was not in the text book either, yet we were still tested on some textbook material. I'm sure she must have been a nice person.

Appears to be an intelligent lady who truly loves her work, but this isn't evident in her lectures where no effort appears to be made to catch the attention of her students.  She should definitely consider typing her notes PRIOR to lectures instead of scribbling.

Despite some of the comments here, she's really not a bad prof.  I think if people were more open to learning about plants they would actually enjoy the lectures. Yes, her in-class notes were messy, but she posted typed notes later that were quite helpfull.
ha ha ha ha horrible. Random lectures...did anyone know what was going on?

She isn't interesting, and her notes are horrible. Sometimes she doesn't even write in subjects for the sentences! She doesn't seem to have very much organization in her notes. She says her tests are conceptual, but they aren't. Dr. Quinn's questions are what I would call conceptual.We have to know every detail for her section.

Dr. Dudley is NOT a good professor. She lacks the ability to teach. Her test questions are easy (she hints at the types of questions to expect), but overall, needs to learn to write, and should just stick with research. Teaching is not her thing

Dr. Dudley cannot teach at all! She may be an intelligent person, but you would never know it from her lectures. She scribbles notes onto overheads, and then half the class is taken up with people asking what her notes say. I would not recommend taking any course with her teaching it.

Her lecture outlines tell you what to expect, but much of it is not in the text book so write like crazy in her lectures. Handwriting and spelling atrocious, and sometimes has a bad handle on the class

The material she teaches is excrutiatingly boring, and her notes and handwriting aren't spectacular, but overall she did a pretty thorough job of covering all of the bases in jsut the right amount of depth. She responds quickly to emails and her test questions are very fair.
IS a nice person. Terrible handwriting. Given, the material she teaches isn't entirely interesting to begin with (plants), she doesnt do a bad job of it.
nice lady, fair tester, but should consider typing her notes
Good notes! Terrible handwriting!
No Comments

comments: very fun class, I was laughing 70% of the time! he has a way of making students feel comfortable and relaxed, but I still feel like I learned a lot.
This guys is hilarious! His lectures were always interesting and relevant
The guy is a bloody riot.  Couldn't get enough of this class.  I was actually laughing when I wrote his tests - I kid you not.  Such a relaxing, happy-mood course.  I'd take anything of his.
Good prof overall, very approachable and helpful.  Needs to focus more on class material and be more clear when he's lecturing.  Needs to be less abrasive with "quieter" students.

This course was unbelievably interesting; every class seemed to have an argument about the thing I never thought I would care about -- musicals.  He brought in famous composers and musical directors to speak to us.  It was just the best course imaginable.
Not helpful at all. Very unorganized.
soo handsome and soo funny:)

He tells a lot of stories, but he eventually gets to the point.  He can usually explain it well and to the point which may be why there is so much room for stories... we do get some practicing done. *good mood raiser

Sandy is the best prof that I have ever had! He makes learning amazing, and you actually remember things. He is brilliant and I could honestly listen to him play piano for hours. The guy has the best humor ever, all i do is laugh! Sandy is my hero!
a very wicked teacher. He could be the funniest, smartest teacher at mac by far.
Sandy is an AMAZING prof; not to mention, he's pretty damn good-looking too!  Love the undone shirts-- he needs to wear them more often! :)
A fun class. I HATE sining and some how it is not as bad to do in class.
Sandy's amazing. Even when it was "pick on me[the writer]" day, it was funny not insulting. I don't understand how you couldn't find him funny. All i do all class is laugh, its great

His lectures are all over the place but entertaining, and he has a definite way with words. I consistently write down his witty comments. A definite joker who doesn't take himself too seriously, and whose humour is really witty and sophisticated. I think most of the class doesn't get it. haha.

Sandy was great! I really enjoyed his jokes and sense of humor. I would arrange my schedule to have him as a prof again. He was helpful and he was always happy to be in class, making an awesome environment for learning.
Greqat
an ****, does not konw how to teach at all.
Funny, so funny! Except when we have to sing - it's hilarious!

Sandy is an awesome prof.  He made ancient Greek music sound like something other than noise.  While his humour may certainly offend some, I do believe his intentions are not to hurt anyone. He made school tolerable! (and he's cute, heehee)
great teacher
umm??  he's crazy!

He has a definite style; you either love it or hate it, and I really enjoyed his classes.  He's also nice to look at.  Most importantly he has a great sense of humour and really does know what he's talking about.  But his jokes aren't for the slow-witted!
Will spend half of class time telling jokes and stroking his own ego.  If you're into that kind of thing, this guy is the right prof for you.
Lol! hehe
The hottest person nevermind prof in all of McMaster!!! Great Class!!! I love this guy, he is the funniest and most brilliantly opinionated man i have ever had the pleasure to meet.
what a joke!  He's a total hack.  I think he writes his own hottie ratings.
He was my first professor of my first class in University and his classes are the BEST!!! He gave me a great impression of what lectures could be like.
was funny but not always clear
He is the best professor out there. I have never laughed so much in a class. Also, this is the only history class I have ever enjoyed.
What a great prof! Super funny, super interesting, can't wait to take another course with him!

I think Sandy is not just aesthetically pleasing to look at, but one of the finest profs I've had to date.  His lectures are always well-prepared, thought out, and above all, interesting.  I really like his style of humour.
Definatly a great teacher!  I never thought that music history could be so fun.
Funny guy. Makes learning fun!
No Comments
Hottie! yells alot...I always laugh in his class...the randomness is funny
No Comments

comments: Lectures can be all over the place at times. Doesn't seem to have time for his students. He is very unclear when it comes informing the class about what content will be on assessments. He only taught about 4-5 chapters fully, but the exam covered 8. His tests are fine if you are strong in math. The exam was harder than the tests, in my opinion.
Ineffective teacher, poor at responding to emails and problems. Impossible tests and exam review terrible
The worst professor I have ever had in University. Doesn't explain topics that are on the tests. Test are hard and includes things you haven't learned.

Amazing, great guy!  it's the easiest thing i've done at mac so far. don't believe the hype, if you focus you'll do amazing. mac kids just have a tendency to whine sometimes :P if you're willing to go to calss you'll be fine. GREAT lecturer and GREAT inclass examples. love it. vneat

You can get a good grade in the end up there are many presentations, proposals, and papers to write. The instructions are very unclear and when he tries to clear them up he takes an easy concept and complicates it. But still, you can get a good grade in this course.
one of the worst prof's i have ever had

one of the most useless profs i have ever had. You can get a good mark in the class if you know what you are doing, but you will probably have to provide the proper answers to him for the tests, because he always makes mistakes. Very frustrating to learn from, so I recommend not taking his classes

Imagine your grandpa teaching you a course. Good intensions but just too old and confused. He literally falls asleep in classes when students are up doing practice problems. Its a real shame because if departments didnt give tenure to profs that were old and outdated this class might actually be as great as it should be.

Absolutely useless professor. Whatever you learn in his course will be forgotten within a week of the final. Doesn't offer practice questions and seems to have a hard time grasping the material himself. Class average was about 60% so good luck.

He is useless! Has a great knowledge of theory, but provides no mathematical examples, which is what the tests are on...yeaaaa. He cuts marks so you do ok, but on average, everyone feels the same way about him. Super nice guy, i feel bad, but constant errors, no math for a math based exam, and slow lectures make this an utter waste of your time.

His lecturing is VERY slow. Every class spends 30min. reviewing previous class. Similar to text, but not really. Have to use notes 1st, then text. Tests are decent, questions based on class examples. BUT, will use variables instead of numbers. Exam is MC while tests were short answer. Exam was easy, still, he didn't do any review for the exam.
He was a good teacher, and was willing to help clarify after class if there were problems

If you want to take Game theory then be ready to face the worst textbook out there. The book is terrible, and the thing with McCabe is that he is very nice guy, but if someone asks a question during the lectures then he will not respond properly.  He will go on talking for 20 minutes and then you wonder: what's the answer to the question?
DO NOT TAKE 3M03 , you will regret it, hes a nice guy, his tests are impossible, lectures make perfect sense until you pick up the textbook and write his tests, i repeat, do not take this class.

McCabe is honestly crazy. I mean, looney. He is an extremely well-intentioned man and very nice. However, he is very approachable...but approaching him is absolutely useless. It will take him 1 hour (no joke) to answer any question you ask him during his office hours..and in the end you actually won't even have an answer.
Unclear lecture notes.
Class is fairly easy if you understand how to apply the concepts
cann't be any better

Game Theory: Either you get it or you don't. McCabe did an excellent job teaching the class. He had us participate in mini experiments which really helped to explain the material. I got an A with ALOT of work. Very helpful man. Class avg was low though. Course gets much tougher as you progress. Attend class and get bonus marks by participating.

Unclear lectures, tests are difficult and usually are on material that isnt covered until the next unit. Uses theory examples and not numbers, but expects you know numbers on the tests (he flipped on someone for asking for a numbers question)
I liked this class - just go to lecture, do the practice tests, and it's an easy 10.  None of the math is difficult - I didn't go to lecture all the time and I still got a 10.
He is evry nice, and helpful. Enjoy the lecture, and just follow him, and the test is fair.
No Comments
Humour is very dry and at times rude. Is very tough. Exams are very unfair, tricky and hard. Does not really care for his students.

I don't know what everyone's complaining about.The course is easy, and he'll answer any questions you have if you talk to him on a one-to-one basis.I got a 12 without studying; just had to attend his lectures and write the sample tests.Easy to talk to and understand the material.Overall, a good prof
Guy is alright. Tries to be funny but his jokes are a little dry. Course is fairly easy if you study and do assignments. Got an A- w/o too much trouble.
This is really nice guy if your mature and do your work. He hates first year students and doesn't like teaching them but in the upper year courses he's more attentive and helpful.

Class was a breeze, but his lectures arent worth attending...he pretty much repeats the same minor topic over and over again, then when you read the book you see he only covered one paragraph in a weeks worth of lectures. Tests had no marking scheme, making it really hard to get full marks. bad prof

A nice guy, but is a VERY ineffective teacher.  He has sloppy handwriting, refuses to use any teching method other than a blackboard, and consistently makes mistakes while lecturing.  His tests are difficult (averages of 45 are normal), much too long, and poorly marked.  Avoid him if you can.

Sort of scary looking but he has this strange knack for making economics make a lot of sense.  Very good with giving examples to backup the material and when asked questions by the class is always able to respond in a useful way.
he is a good professor but sometimes the test is too hard and don't have enough time to finish it!

Horrible lectures. Goes too fast, illegible writing, goes off track. Horrible textbook. Tests are marked crazy hard and not enough time. BUT extremely easy assignments and pretty easy exam. Plenty of bonus marks. End result is actually a decent mark.
A really good teacher but the tests are rediculously hard and impossible to finish on time.
Very nice guy, funny, good teacher but tests are IMPOSSIBLE.  He's extremely difficult.  Switch out if you can b/c thers no chance your passing.
Good teacher with personality.
Perhaps the hardest and toughest prof... Try switching from his class as soon as u can... cuz he'll kill u in his test....

Very enthusiastic, approachable, fun, and easy going prof. TA doesn't let people into the testing centre any earlier, so you have exactly 50 mins to settledown, fill in your info, and go through 20 to 24 extremely wordy Questions.
He's such a personable guy, but confusing in his methods of teaching.  Textbook has no solutions.  The only reason to study is so that you can finish his long, tricky tests.
Has funny jokes...relating beer to marginal utility...drugs and alcohol to substitutes and complements...
His section is 100X harder than the other profs, and I'll bet that the other classes learn more too.
No Comments
Poor orator, interesting subject, bad class. No answers avail. to textbk qu's!
His test sucks often not realted to lectures, likes complicated questions
Nice guy, enjoying teaching,
The worst class ever. Really confusing and the tests are ridiculously hard
This guy is really really bad!
Nice guy, good prof, teaches well. Tests were a little long, but fair.
No Comments
No Comments
The textbook sucks and the tests do not relate to the textbook or lectures.. boo
No Comments
Nice guy.. good prof...
don't ever walk out of his class early
easy playschool lectures but phD test, Boooo. Retire
from a different era, needs to retire
Great guy, his tests are a little confusing tho

comments: Dr. Balcom is a great professor and an all around amazing person. I was going through a really hard time during the middle of the term and she helped me through my problem and was very accommodating. She genuinely cares for her students and wants you to succeed, so if you're having issues, TALK TO HER. Would definitely take a class of hers again!

Balcom was decent, but lectures felt somewhat unorganized, and she was often all over the place.  If you study hard for the exams, you'll be rewarded.  Workload similar to any other history class.  My main issue was that I felt Balcom did not give us a general 'survey' of US history, as she often focused solely on minority groups.  Class was a 710

I've taken three classes with Dr.B.  She is passionate about what she teaches and has her own unique teaching style. In her classes she provides a lot of help with research and defines her assignments and expectations clearly. She is VERY approachable and always helps students. she's amazing. You should take her classes, but you will work.
Dr. Balcom was ok. I never got my marks for my last assignment. She said she would email me them, but they ended up going to another student.

She is one of the most approachable people. I found most professors I've had socially awkward, but Dr. Balcom is young and a cool person. She's just friendly; yes it's true, she's a hard marker, but what do you expect people to have things handed to you? I think she pushes us to the best of our ability. She's highly intelligent and a great person.

She is amazing, best professor I have EVER had. If I could recommend one thing to any student it would be TAKE DR BALCOM'S CLASSES. She's easy to get along with, she's super nice and adorable. If I walk into a lecture and see Karen as my professor again, I'll be the happiest person at Mac!

Very caring when it comes to her students and their success. Made it clear on several occasions that her office hours are open for any students with any questions! Seems very passionate about her career choice and does a great job at it! Young, enthusiastic, extremely nice lady, and someone who truly deserves being called Doctor! Loved her!

Dr. Balcom is one of my favourite professors in the history department. She goes out of her way to help students understand material and point them in the direction or lend students to research material. Her marking was a little slow this year, but her material was interesting and you could clearly tell she is passionate about what she teaches.

I found Dr. B to be very unprofessional. She would emailed each of us our feedback on assignments...except she sometimes sent us someone else's. I was not impressed by this at all. Our marks are confidential and McMaster has email policies for this exact reason. I will never take her class again because I can't trust her to act professionally.
hard to talk to without being looked down on
Dr. B keeps things interested but is very slow on getting marks back and has extremely high expectations for her 1st year courses.

My experience with Balcom was not a good one. Avoid being in close quarters with her. Her personality seemed very closed off. She was always trying to turn her students into leaders, whatever that means. The world is not lacking in people trying to create a cult of followers Balcom! Very aristocratic attitude in my opinion.

She is excellent.So impressive it kind of brings tears to my eyes.Karen really goes out of her way to help the students that need her.She has her hands in what seems like everything around the city but she still makes time to help you progress.She's charming and lively as a lecturer.Members of last year's 2hi3 still reminisce over our time with her

I happened to once overhear Dr. Balcom speaking with a student in her office. He seemed to have little clue about the work but Dr. Balcom spoke with respect, utilizing a problem-solving approach. This is the same kind of experience I had with her. She went way beyond the call of duty to be helpful and generous. She is also exceptionally organized.

Dr. Balcom was not a great prof. Maybe it was the 9/8:30 lectures, but it was tough keeping up with her: she jumped around a lot, and always assumed you had read the text book. She was fond of selecting obscure topics for her exam-essays.
She was ok sometimes i did not understand her leaching its not very clear but still ok

Class was definately difficult, but she was a good prof. Hard to keep up in her lectures sometimes, but very clear and friendly. Goes out of her way to help her students. Put all textbooks on 2 hour reserve in library so you didn't have to buy them - I love her for that. Very approachable, cares about the students.
I absolutely refuse to take another class with her as professor.

Dr. Balcom is one of the best, if the not best professor within McMaster's Department of History. Although she is quite difficult and challenging, Dr. Balcom goes out of her way to ensure that students succeed. She is extremely approachable and frequently lends out her personal books or meets with students outside of office hours.
She's very nice and cares about her students. Her lectures are good but I found she tended to let her own biases/interests dominate the subject material.
Don't take a seminar with this prof. She picks favourites and is a total *****.

I thought Karen was a fanatstic prof! Her lectures were interesting and straightforward.  She's very approachable and seems to genuinely enjoy engaging with students. She went out of her way to help me with the major essay. I would definitely take another class with her!
Seems like a nice lady, but her lectures are incredibly dry and boring. She's better than Dr. Frager though.

The worst professor I have ever had and I am in third year. Boring lecturer (reads the notes she posts online and calls it a 'lecture'). Not approachable, kicked me out of her office twice so she could do prep work for the class. HELLO! OFFICE HOURS ARE FOR ME TO ASK QUESTIONS AND YOU TO EXPLAIN AND ANSWER! I didn't learn anything unfortunately.

Great lecturer - bit of a **** one on one though. Maybe it was just a clash of personalities but we actually had a rather heated arguement in her office once, and she was very rude! I'm sorry, aren't you supposed to be above verbally abusing 2nd years? I'm only 20, for christs sake!

Balcom is a likeable, enthusiastic prof who is very effective at reaching her students.  She is young, endearing, intelligent, and got me interested in US History - something I thought impossible.  Her interest in social history is infectious!

Dr. Balcom is a wonderful prof and an excellent lecturer. The only criticism I have for her is that she makes an effort to learn the names of some of her students leaving other students feeling left out
Young, energetic, inspiring, a model prof - I wish all my profs were like her!
Too concerned with common people who never did anything worth reading about
At times, her feminism is irritating yet is very helpful and considerate
She keeps you on your feet and makes you want to learn more! I learned a lot!

comments: A very good lecturer for this course, stochastic processes is his area of research so he knows it better than most people. He has this demeanour that it is all about intuition and understand as opposed to getting the grade. He is very fair when he tests but you have to attend lecturer if you want to pass the course.
I'll never forget the day I was in his office and he looked up at me and said, "hahaha See you in the summer"

Would have been a harder statistics course, but Feng made it very fair to someone with a weak background in real analysis. Everything was open book (exams and tests), but you have to understand everything he says in lecture as well as everything on tests/assignments to do well. Exam was very fair. You'd rather have him teach than another prof tbh.
See you in the summer

Not a cake walk course, they only way to do well is to study hard. He's a nice guy but the course itself requires you to study hard by always doing problems. Midterms were relatively easy, but exam was hard which he compensated by curving since pretty sure everyone did badly. Always double check your work.

- Professor is a clear and charismatic lecturer  - Attendance is strongly recommended because no notes are posted - Reasonable mid-terms (2x, 10% each), but unfortunately there's a 70% final which is designed to be easy to decent (75%) but difficult to do very well (90%+) - Course provides fundamental background. For applications, look at 2B03
This guy really knows statistics. He is smart, but also funny. final was worth 70% so it was a bit of stress but overall great course.
great professor, not that hard if you go to lectures
Handsome prof. Go on a date with him if you have a chance. Don't worry, if it doesn't go well he'll just arrange a make-up date. LOL!!!

He was terrible. He will FORCE students that you must write the make up test if you missed it for emergency reasons. His make up test will kill you because they are really hard. Very bad prof. Only prof in the math department who forces people to write make up tests. He needs to put the weight to the final. It is a better idea
The worst professor I have ever had. His lectures are so boring and his tests are so hard. Dont believe any good comments he is a really tough prof.
He thinks stats is a very important subject. His tests are so unfair and his markers are so tough. Dont be fooled by this prof. He is not easy okay.
Best prof Ever
Best Prof Ever for Statistics
He is really difficult professor. He should give sample tests ateast
Very tough prof
Great Teaching style. I'm going to nominate him for best 3rd Year prof award. His tests and assignments are a bit tough.
aMAZING
Most Good Looking Professor In McMaster Math Department
his make up test is very hard
He is really tough!!!
He was a good prof. His assignments were easy to do well on and worth alot of your mark. Tests and exam were fair. Lectures sometimes boring, but generally enjoyed having him as a prof.
HE IS THE BEST STATISTICS PROFESSOR IN THE MATHEMATICS AND STATS DEPARTMENT HE IS VERY SMART AND KNOWLEDGEABLE AND HE IS REASONABLE WITH HIS FINAL EXAM
He is the BEST PROF EVER

His make up tests will kill you. He is the worst prof ever. In the math department if any student misses a test, the prof will simply add the weight to the final exam. This prof says NO you have to write the make up test. He will make a new make-up test for every single student who missed the test. You will cry if you take his course. Be careful.
He is a tough prof but I am glad I walked out with a decent grade although I know nothing in his course!!!
make up test ? do you have a life? He will create an individualized make up test for every single student. How sad is that ? He really needs to get a hobby

He says like this "Some students have not written the test yet. Come and talk to me after class so we can make arrangements for make up test" his make up test will destroy you. His Assignments are also very tough, unless you get them off some smart person.
I didn't like him. He was tough.

He forces students to write the make up test if you miss his midterm for any valid reason. Make up test is a very bad idea. He needs to just add the weight to the final!!!! No other professor in the math department makes students write make up test. Be careful if you take this prof's course, his make up tests are way harder!!!
Nice accent
Outstanding. One of the best statistics professors in our department.
Good teacher. Final exam was fair.
Excelllent professor
Alright I guess. Midterms were kind of tricky though. Still okay prof overall.
Wonderful prof
No Comments
Funny guy! Teaches what you need to know and his love for Mathematics is contagious.
He is very nice... the assignments and tests are easy~~ ^u^

comments: The organization of powerpoint material is confusing and her "assessments" are unfairly marked. Coming from a double major student with a great average in her courses, I had a horrible time getting through this course. If anthro isn't your program and you care about your average, I would not suggest this course. Brought down my gpa.

Her midterms aren't that bad as others have claimed.  I managed to go 80%, then 93% on her midterms.  However, her exam was brutal.  I guess I just didn't study enough but found it much harder than the midterms. A little boring to listen to but knows her diseases inside and out!

Fun lectures. Horrible testing. Honour student and I got a 65% in the course. Tests are unfairly marked, very subjective. She expects you to know every little detail eventhough they aren't neccesarily relevant. Lectures aren't clear. Take my advice- get out of her class now!

Innovative and really cares about her students.  There is no free ride here but who wants one.  After taking a class with Dr. Herring you will know your stuff and she will help you better yourself as a scholar.  If you are looking for an easy A maybe you should not have chosen university. If you are looking to learn look for Dr. Herring
I liked her, great class.
By far the worst class I have ever taken!!! Dull and boring lectures.  Totally turned me off from Anthropology!  Read the text book inside out, cover to cover.  Tests and exams are hard if you don't.
Very interesting course, learned a lot, she is a good lecturer.  Tests are not super-easy; she does cover the readings quite in-depth so don't think you can just skim the readings and do really well.

Speaking as a student who got a 95% average in high school, I found this course REALLY difficult. It didn't seem to matter that I studied for several hours many days before each test.  The problem with the tests is that Dr. Herring expects you to know the textbook inside and out on the tests. If you care about your average, do NOT take this course.

Ok, so the class wann't exactly what I expected, but in the end, it was more useful than any other class I have taken. Required use of several media was very helpful and a fantastic intro to real anthropological applications.

Wicked course... was hoping for a bird, but instead learned a whole lot that I still talk about with people almost 10 years later.  Learned more about writing good essays than I ever did in English class, partly due to a great TA... wish I could remember her name.

Loved the class! More challenging then I expected, but not killer. Hint: Study her notes, the textbook and the CD. The tests aren't hard, they just cover alot of stuff she doesn't teach, yet expects you to read.

Dr. Herring is a great prof, with a sense of humour.  Some criticize her tests for being too difficult, perhaps thinking her introductory courses would be "bird" courses.  It's good to learn, and to be challenged.  Is that not why we're going to university?

Best professor ever.  She really knows her stuff and really makes you grasp the complexity of infectious disease.  People who said she made easy stuff hard must know nothing about the disease process.  If you want to learn take her class, if you don’t wha
She presented the material very well, and made course expectations very clear. Although the tests were difficult, overall it was fair. I enjoyed it!
Terrible course.  Late in returning papers.  No constructive comments given on work.

She made a very easy course really hard. Her powerpoint lectures were unclear and boring. I found it difficult to combine all of the info from the lectures, text and the CD. Her exams were very hard. I don't recommend this course.
could u make such a simple class any harder??
Great prof., really knows her stuff, a pleasure to take her course.

Enthusiastic and enjoys her job very much... too bad she deserves to be fired and working at Micky D's.  The course was relativly simplistic and not at all difficult to comprehend but the manner in which the exams were created and marked made it nearly im
55% average and 30% failing rate on the midterm of a first year anthropology class?  Come on...
Great class made fun and interesting by Dr. Herring!
Very interesting course!! Loved it!
Enthusiasm helped make the lectures interesting.

comments: I had Eva for my very first class at university-- her observations about the habits of students in lecture halls totally put me at ease for the rest of that first day. Wonderfully enthusiastic, really important and interesting material, and extremely fair tests.

The best prof I've ever had at Mac.  Her lectures are helpful, very clear, and extremely interesting. She does go off with her lectures but the are always relevant to what she's talking about. I love her videos, they are very helpful to what you're learning at the time. Excellent job :)

It is extremely obvious the lack of work she wants to put in by her pointlessly simple readings, lectures, and exams.  Don't even show up to class.  It is excrutiating to watch her pander to the class idiots with obvious comments. (Open dicussions in a class of 420!? come on!)  If you can spell "anthropology", you can get an "A" in this class.

BY far my favourite professor at Mac...absolutely engaging and uses lots of movies to reinforce her material..go to the lectures because she does test on the numerous movies and because she is really interesting!!!

An excellent prof who makes the material very easy to understand. I do not understand what the other people are talking about on here - she really is a very good teacher and has an excellent personality.
A tad off topic of a lecturer. She can start a lecture talking about a tribe in africa and end it talking about her chocolate chip cookies
Great professor. Knows her stuff and has an excellent style of teaching. If you do your readings, you'll be fine. I found her class to be one of the only courses worth my tuition $$.
So unorganized, and couldnt work a computer or projector to save her life. Great lady, poor presenter
good
Lectures were completely irrelevant, she went off topic a lot and it wasn’t worth my tuition money.
Easily sidetracked and poor lectures. How she is a prof is beyond my reckoning. Shame on you, shame on you!

Fun lectures! Mackey gets you thinking about the material with excellent examples for understanding. Makes you work in the course and it's worth it. Usually runs out of time in lectures, but it's worth it.
Does not offer as much as she expects.
Gets off topic alot, but has very interesting things to say.  Teaches things that many others neglect, such as the harsh treatments of the aboriginals faced from Europeans. Great job!
Easily sidetracked.  Expects too much from students for her exam.  The class should be about learning concepts, not memorizing examples.
She has to learn how to lecture in the time alotted; she is VERY disorganized.
Very personable and well-liked prof. There is never enough time to get through the material, because there is alot of class discussion.  This is by far my favorite, and most fun class so far.
very approachable, but really disorganized lectures.  ALWAYS ends late, and then gets annoyed at students for leaving.  lecture notes are also disorganized, but lectures are pretty helpful.

Eva is one of the most caring profs at MAC.  She wants the best for her students, and will do anything she can to help.  She is sincere, keeps it interesting, and inspires me to do an M.A.! Thank you, Eva, for making my last year the best!! - H.V.

Fabulous professor. Makes you think. She doesn't tell you the answers outright. Very flamboyant and discussions are always lively. She's there all the time for her students. I recommend her class to all anthropology students.

Eva is a wonderful teacher, her style may be more informal than students are used to, but she actually TEACHES you things about life, our country, the world. She has a lot to offer. And she's a real person, friendly, understanding....4I03 will miss you!
totally amazing. real issues are discussed.  Fabulous teacher - passes on her enthusiasm to al her students.  Totally inspiring!
Disorganized lectures, eccentric woman.  Got an A+ with having done little work so I can't complain
No Comments
awesome course.. she made it so fun.. her lectures are   kinda disorganized. Very interesting course
very interesting prof. very enthousiastic about what she teaches.  funny stories. an enjoyable class.
disorganized lectures but easy
Learn how to use computer and mic, don't do class discussions with 400 students
lectures unorganized, never took notes-got an A!
No Comments
Nice woman, very odd and not so well organized
very cool but needs to focus more on course topics
lectures are difficult to follow; somewhat rushed and unorganized
the bomb diggidy

comments: He definitely knows his stuff but I feel like a lot of it kind of flies over our heads. He uses slides in lecture compared to writing on the board so you have to really pay attention to what he's saying otherwise you miss everything. Assignments are way too long. Tests are long given that you only get 50 minutes. Kind of intimidating/condescending

This course was actually very useful to understand the Monte Carlo method & applications, but it's probably the hardest undergraduate statistics course offered at Mac. Assignments: very hard, time consuming. Midterms: very tricky, hard to do well. Had like 20 people at the beginning, ended with around 8. It's basically a grad level course. Audit.
4ci3 should be easy, but canty made it really hard. And why do we have to prove R code???
I regret taking this course for credit. Why so many reviews about this professor are about how handsome he is? That's not what people normally write when they come to rate a professor.

Canty's test are long and tough. And for some reasons, it's only 45 mins. He uses unclear notations for linear regression so the lecture notes dont really help. 3A3 is a starting course for linear regression so it's easy to get confused by his notations. Canty is a serious tough grader. And his TA for this course has a strong accent.
Okay teaching, bad personality, not really approachable, arbitrary expectations especially with R code, long and tough assignments. He does know his statistics though.
Awesome... He's excellent and explains everything with example with R computing.... One of the best in Computational Statistics.....

I agree with all the positive comments this prof receives. Socializing with this prof is better than being at the Play boy mansion surrounded by hundreds of beautiful women. With Angelo Canty, it's a match made in heaven. What a wonderful person.

Canty is the best statistics professor in the entire Universe. He is a true statistician. People who complain they don't like him or his tests being too lengthy should drop out of University. He is the most fair and caring prof on campus. Plus if you smoke with him outside of Hamilton Hall, you can easily become his friend. He is my best friend.

I had this prof for Stats 1CC3 some time ago and I have to give him credit for  making me love that course. I continued on and took second year stats courses this year, but the quality of profs I had for 2D03 and 2MB3 was not upto the level that Canty is. I am so excited to be in his stats 3D03 class next year! He has so much office hours for help.
My all time favourite professor.
I agree. He is very handsome. He is a chick magnet.
I think he is the best looking prof at Mac. In fact, he's probably the sexiest man alive! Just look at that picture of him. Isn't he gorgeous?!
He was the most superior prof of stats. His teaching is applicable to real life and he is the only fair prof stats prof I have ever seen.
Among all the profs I had at mcmaster, he's the one and only prof who ACTUALLY CARES about the students
He was tough but fair. His old exams are available on reserve in Thode Library. Easy to do well on his final exam if you practice the old final exams. One of the most fair stats profs I had.
One of the most fair profs I've come across till now. He also is easy on the eyes :)
Amazing prof. Takes a very practical approach to teaching. Makes you think on Assignments. Exams were similar to homework problems.
He is awesome!!!!
Great person
best prof. ever.
I had him for 2MB3 many years ago. He likes to challenge students but is a fair prof with regard to marks.
He is the most fair prof in the department of Math and sttats
Best prof in the history of teaching and BEST prof in the whole Universe. He holds so many office hours to HELP students YET nobody goes to his office hours!!
Good stuff
Everybody should take Dr.Canty as their supervisor for grad school. He is the most knowledgeable and best prof ever, but his Assignments will be very tough.

VeRy Very Very Very Very HELPFUL PROF. Cares for students so much that even your own parents wont care for you, as much as he cares for his students. Unbelievably good attitude towards teaching and students. The only complaint is tests were a bit long but assignments is easy 30% and final exam is long but very fair. Outstanding Professor.
I heard he is going to be the chair of math and stats very soon. I hope the rumours are true because he deserves it.
He looks like Ron Jeremy. Amazing prof with HUGE PASSION for statistics
HE WAS AMAZING
Good prof but the tests were too long for 50 minutes. Final was fair.
AMAZING PROF
Outstanding in terms of teaching and lecturing. The coolest prof at MAC! He has a pony tail which is awesome. Also looks cute in his picture on this site.

Most well organized and best dressed prof I had. He is great. He has a great sense of humour!! People who write bad things about him and complain of him being too difficult should not be studying at University and have low I.Q and don't deserve to do University level studies, because he is one of the easiest and most fair instructors. Keep it up.

In my opinion he is the ONLY  prof at McMaster who actually thinks the success of his students and generating interest in stats is his responsibility. He puts a lot of effort into teaching and his lecture notes are proof of this fact. Great prof. Wish there were more like him!!!

He is very kind and very fair. Very under-rated prof. He deserves a huge raise. I hope that in the near future he becomes the chair of Mathematics and Statistics department, and eventually, president of McMaster. I will nominate him for President of McMaster or even better Prime Minister of Canada. He has leadership qualities and deserves the best.

Great prof, but more then that, an exceptional human being, which is a more important quality. Has genuine concern about your education, your future, and your interest in his course. Will do everything he can to help students. Prompty replies to emails and is more then happy to meet with students to discuss stats problems. A gem of a professor.

He is such a great prof I cannot explain in words how awesome he is. if you want to take a statistic course I recommend you take ONLY WITH DR.CANTY AND NOBODY ELSE...switch your sections to his class, if you have the chance, he will make you love stats he is really that good he is very kind heart human being who cares for his students so much. A+++
He is the best. 30% Assignments in his courses! What more do you want ?
He has huge passion for teaching stats and thats why this prof rocks. McMaster would be an awesome place if there were more profs like him!!! A+++ for Dr. Canty

Greatest instructor that has stepped foot on mcmaster campus ever since this University was born. He is not a professor, he is a STATISTICS ANGEL. His lectures give me motivation to become like him one day. He has so much passion for statistics that it rubs on, on students, makes you want to do stats homework 24/7 just because of this super prof!!

Greatest teacher I have met in my first year at McMaster. I hope one day I will be like him! I wish him a successful career at mac. Wish there were more good profs like him. He is much better than Dr. Childs for sure.
Dr. Canty should be promoted to head of the math and stats department!

He is a good prof and a beautiful person with a heart of gold. He types up all his Assignment solutions and tests, shows how much hard work and effort he puts into teaching. Takes his job very seriously and strives to be fair in all aspects. Sometimes tests are a bit long. Has lot of office hours available for students, but people never show up =)
All around good prof, I would love to take any course taught by him when I get to upper year courses.

He is my favourite statistics professor. My love for stats and inspiration to take more stats courses stemmed from his class. Really he has motivated and sparkled my interest in stats. I saw him smoking outside Hamilton Hall few days back and today I saw him in the student center near Tim Hortons hahaha lol
He teaches so well - other professors should take an example from him.

It seems that he is less hostile and self-centre this year (you can compare the rating history), may be it is time for his tenure track position review, so it is very likely that he has changed just for a purpose. If he really decided to treat his students better, I hope he will continue this change in attitude even after he got his tenure.
OUTSTANDING
Great lecturer, nice lecture slides.
A difficult person to deal with ... very unpredictable.

He is not professor, he is really an angel professor. I dont know how anybody can give him bad ratings or bad comments, he is the BEST statistics professor. I strongly encourage everybody to enroll in canty's course. VERY VERY VERY FAIR PROFESSOR
Excellent professor till now. His lecture notes are as good as gold and his teaching is very effective and very very clear. He really knows statistics upside down

Very helpful professor. Most students are intimidated to see him during office hours because they are scared he will get angry. He has provided sample tests for practice, and the actual test was exact same level of difficulty. Has genuine concern for his students. Class average was quiet high for the Stats2Mb3 course. He is very well organized.
greatttt guy

Excellent prof. His tests were more than fair in this course. They were reasonable in length and medium level of difficulty. He provides sample tests and even provided a sample final exam with solutions to help us prepare. His course notes are excellent and so much easier than the textbook. His Assignments were long and hard, but still doable.
Best prof I have ever had. Really makes the students think but the exams are similar to practice questions assigned.
tests were so hard
Toughest professor in the history of the math dept. His tests are the worst nightmare.

Well, he seemed quite abrasive at first but the key with Dr. Canty is persistence. The more you show up at his dorr, the less snippy he gets. The course would've been great if it weren't for the ridiculous tests. If the tests were going to be that hard then we should have gotten more time.

This prof is the most unreasonable prof i have ever met. first his midterms are incredibly hard, i mean they are 40x harder than the one from last year, and the one from the year before. no time to do them in the time he allows, and he wont curve the mark. take this course in summer, AVOID him at all costs.
hes the most messed up prof EVER !
His assignments are extremely difficult, and his tests are insanely hard and unreasonably long for finishing in 50 minutes. He is the most unfair and unreasonable prof you will ever find.

This prof is super hard. I was taking his class this term and then i realize i'm not taking in anything. His assignments are ridiculously hard, and help from him is pretty much no help at all. Even if you tried to get help, the feeling u get when u ask a question..u will feel intimidated. I dropped it and hopefully i get a different one for summer.

This professor is definitely one of the worst.  He is not helpful and responsible to his students.  He gave very hard and infeasible tasks to all levels (both undergrad and graduate students).  He is a selfish guy and always not available, don't take his course or get him as your supervisor if you have a choice.
difficult to understand
Brutal prof. Probably the toughest math prof ever.
VERY VERY VERY hard professor. Never take any course he teaches. Absolutely brutal.

Worst prof in Canada (and Canada is a big country!) not approachable inside AND outside of class; seems to be depressed. can't explain things at all. He loves to give hard tests. The only time I've seen him smile is during our exam, on which he killed us! He thinks he's the smartest guy out there and can't accept criticism. who gave him his PH.D???
Worst prof ever, super hard, never smiles, utterly boaring, CANT TEACH - dosn't even assign homework problems, exam was...was HARD, has high expectations, is NOT hot... the list goes on...
Long assignments!!
He is pretty boring, but he is a good teacher. Knows what he is talking about and his tests are fair.
Couldn't make it through his classes. Either fell asleep or left. Useless.
Slightly unapproachable. Felt like I had climbed Mt. Everest when I got him to smile!
Very condescending. Unapproachable.
notes on the web,not point to go to class and a bit boring
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Moves at the speed of light. Slow down buddy.

Are we all talking about the same person here? I can always go to him during office hours and even the first time when I went with my friend he was so easy to ask questions. He definitely doesn't seem arrogant and asking questions during lectures is so easy, and I can tell everyone thinks the same. He's very clear and knows his stuff, so great prof

Dr. Landry was very knowledgeable but at the same time unapproachable. I thought that it was unfair that practice midterms and tests for the course were much easier than the ones my year had to write, and so were not proper preparation to write midterms/ exams.
Very bad to talk to out side of class

Explains concepts very clearly. Explains tricks. Going to class helps a lot for tests. Concepts of trick questions are sometimes explained in class, which helps a lot for tests. Looks scary to approach but is a  very nice prof.

So useless... couldnt ask him a question without him putting his stupid two cents in.  Basically told me that i didnt understand "fundamental skills", meanwhile im currently doing relatively well in the course (compared to class average)... I guess some profs are just full of themselves.. we get it! YOU WENT TO SKOOL FOR 10ys.. no need to be a d*ck
woah Landry, SLOW DOWN!

This was Dr. Landry's first time teaching a summer course AND Organic Chemistry. He did a pretty good job; kept the lectures concise and straight to the point, but sometimes deviates from the lesson (he loves talking about NMRs). He didn't really go into detail about stuff; brushed the surface of each topic, but it's reflected on the midterm/exam.

Helpful to students outside of the lecture hall, but when teaching a class, he rushes way too much and assumes too much prior knowledge. He can be a little condescending and can come off as unapproachable, but he tries to connect with his students. He did a lot of cool demo's too.
dayumm!

Very knowledgeable; rather unapproachable and condescending, especially if you ask him a question. His lectures are all right; does make jokes; and gives away free chocolates and cookies if you answer questions correctly (always good!). I'd recommend his core, but if you have a question, go to another prof's office hours.

Excellent professor! Very clear, and "to the point" in his explanations. The classes had a good mix of lecturing and chem demonstrations. Great at keeping your attention - who doesn't like chem humour? He will do classes just for review before tests, which are really helpful!
very good teacher
Awesome teacher... He is funny, really clear in his explanation.
Great prof, Great guy, he funny and he knows his chemistry.

He's awesome!! I LOL'd in almost every class so you know he's funny! And he told us that if we came to his office to talk chemistry, he'd take us out for a coffee and a donut at Timmies (seriously!). Need I say more?? :D

I found Landry to be a great prof for chem 1a03. He went through material super quickly and taught most concepts pretty well. The concepts were quite straight forward so the mistakes he made in class did not hinder my understanding of course material. Overall, awesome prof for review chem, probably not so much for any other chem.

I love this prof! He made chem class interesting and funny. Even if you don't like him at first, he definitely grows on you. He genuinely cares about students and gives tips on how to do questions efficiently. You can tell he has a passion for chemistry :)

He's nice & helpful(contrary to rumours) and his lectures are usually very interesting. He's funny, involves the class in demos, and gives time for practice questions. Believes in practise rather than textbook readings. He gets confused sometimes, but corrects himself. Powerpts are online anyways. Doesn't baby/spoon-feed. Always attend class!
Great class, he's an excellent teacher and will also be able to push you in the right direction, very approachable if you respect the fact that he has to deal with several hundred whiny students
Very rude person, extremely unapproachable.....had him as a lab cooridinator....Never want to see that man again.. He should understand that not everyone has a Phd in Chem..I have no respect for him

When you ask him a question he answers clearly. Seems a bit mean but when you actually go up to him and ask, he's very helpful.  During his lecture he keeps your attention on him.  I found chemistry slightly boring before his class but now I like it.  His tests are very fair. Those who complain about them didn't study the right way.
Landry is awesome ! he knows his stuff well and is also a good teacher..would recommend taking his class.

Everyone's hating on this dude, Landry is legit. He knows his stuff and he teaches you through getting questions wrong and making mistakes. Also goes at a blazing pace, good for doing questions after. If you participate in class and go to every single lecture and review for 10 mins after, guaranteed 10.
He's nearly as good at teaching as he is at squash, and that's saying a lot.

Harsh reviews! Dr. Landry might come off as unapproachable but he's actually a very nice man when you need something. He doesn't lecture in 1AA3 normally but he covers sometimes and I didn't have any problem with his explanations.

Dr. Landry is extremely unapproachable. He's unfriendly in person, and not a very strong prof in class, either. Knows his stuff but teaches it way too fast and simply expects students to understand his stuff without actually explaining it. Take another 1A03 prof, trust me.

try to avoid landry as much as possible. Compared to the other profs who taught chemistry 1a03.... he is probably the worst. He rushes through material and expects the students to know the course material before hand. He also confuses himself and thus the class too often. He just reads off the slides and his voice is annoying

Horrible professor. I agree with the people who say he is condescending. He is unfriendly and unapproachable. He should NOT be teaching a first year course, as he does not explain the basic concepts well and excepts you to magically know everything for the exam. His lectures are extremely BORING! You'd do yourself a favour by avoiding him.

Condescending and at times outright rude. Lectures were incomprehensible... I didn't think it was possible to make chemistry MORE boring. If you're pro at chemistry Landry is fine but otherwise I'd strongly recommend Hatala...

Races through course material, doesnt explain concepts well at all.. expects students to just magically know everything. VERY hard tests, doesnt talk about important things for the test.  avoid if you can
Landry goes through information really quick, and doesn't explain it in a way that someone without a PhD in chemistry would understand.
Let be know that four students passed away due to his pure skill in squash
He must say "like" or "okay" fifty + times per lecture. It was distracting!
No Comments
