comments: -She talks way too fast when it comes to specfic explanations and concepts we have to know for tests. -She only has like 3 TAs and the class is packed. She should at least have more! -She doesn't post everything she shows on the slides -GPA killer in my opinion

Going into Dr. O's class I was pretty skeptical of how the semester was going to go based on what I've heard about her, and I was pleasantly surprised. Honestly, as long as you go to class and do your work, it's not a challenging course. I found her tests to be pretty fair with no surprise content, and she was engaging and interesting in lecture.

Shes a great prof! Loved her in both of the classes she taught, but the midterms were SO hard, and I studied more for them than I have for anything else. You absolutely need to go to class if you want to pass!!

Really hard because it is not taught well. This class needs a tutorial and has only 3 ta's for over 300 students. The TA's often have to ask each other for answers. The exams are like two part riddles, very easy theories but they need to be applied and I found not well explained. There is no review. The textbook is secondary to lecture. Useless.
Unapproachable and not helpful

SUCKS. Abrupt and sometimes rude, you cannot miss 1 class. No support in the class at all, she says in the first class that if you email her she will delete it. If you have the chance to skip this class, do.

Dr. Ostovich somehow manages to make the most boring-sounding course interesting. Shes organized, clear, funny, and always willing to help students. I love her testing style  it actually forces you to understand the material, not just memorize it.

Genuinely enjoyed her lecture style, found it very easy to remember content thanks to her many examples. Big focus on experiments in Social Psych. Havent taken a course with her that required short answers so found tests very fair and not overly difficult if you understood the content and attended lectures.
Only graded by two tests and the exam, nothign to boost your mark. Her tests were much harder than everyone expected and brought down a lot of averages

She is a good lecturer but, when she grades you... :(  she is one of the hardest marking professors I have had in my 4 years at McMaster. Let's just say there is a reason why she is known as the GPA killer.

Really good at teaching, she is funny and teaches in a conversational tone. Easy to follow slides and examples. Really tough tester, it's almost all short answer and looking for very specific answers.

I think Dr. O is a great prof. She explains things really well and is always engaging. With that said, she is easily the hardest marker I've ever had. I would study so much and get 50's and 60's. I understood the content too, it's just that her questions are way too specific. Don't take her classes if you need a good GPA.

Poor Dr. O! I think she's an amazing lecturer, and this is the second class I've taken with her. I think she cares about her students doing well and she's hella funny and interesting but i have to agree and say her marking scheme is too specific. So much so, that even if you understand the concept, you might not do well. Love you Dr. O but help us!

Dr. O is a great person and approachable after lecture. She makes lectures interesting & funny!! BUT can often be unclear/confusing. Tests are difficult to do well on bc of precision required in the short answers. You need to read textbook for m/c and lecture notes for the s/a. All grades were not released going into the exam which sucked.

Exams were very tricky. Really poor wording/structure of questions on exams. Also, lectures were not structured very well either, I found them to be all over the place and my notes were hard to follow.

Dr. O made us work but I learned more in her class than any other undergraduate courses! To be honest, I am only realizing now that I am in my first year Masters that Dr. O had prepared me for this... If you are serious about learning and succeeding in graduate studies later, Dr. O is the real prof for that.

Very condescending and unapproachable. Seems to genuinely make an effort to make testing overly difficult for students by creating vague, open-ended questions that require an unbelievably specific response. Lectures were fairly organized, but it seemed like testing was just designed to set you up for failure, which she almost seems to enjoy.
If you hate textbook readings or skip lectures, this class is not for you. Tests were difficult and the workload compared to other classes is very heavy.
This prof is a good teacher and explains things well, but the way that she tests sets everyone up to fail.

Not a fan of this prof. The way she teaches is extremely disorganized and there is no structure to anything. In addition, her tests are brutal and ask solely for definitions of random words. Also, she has such a rude attitude towards students/teaching. Avoid taking a class with this prof if you can.

She is very unnaproachable, unflexible, unwilling to meet with students, rude, condescending, and her evaluations solely test your ability to memorize information. I thought PNB was an amazing program until I took this course. It needs a new prof to teach it.

Honestly, I don't think Dr. Ostovich has the compassion that is required of a teacher. She constantly makes condesending and demeaning remarks, and is extremely unnaproachable. In addition, she doesn't make the time to address students' questions (through office hours). If you're looking for a mentor, look somewhere else.

Record the lectures. She says the definitions once and very quickly, and they are not in the slides or anywhere else. You will need to use the key words on the tests, and the bulk of the marks rely on you having these memorized. The key to the tests is having the definitions memorized. She lacks humility, so she is difficult to approach.

Dr. Ostovich teaches Research Methods in an interesting and engaging manner. However, her testing is quite difficult. She only takes specific answers, and memorization is a huge component of the course. It is difficult to approach her, and she is often very busy and does not make time to go over tests with students.

You need to attend lecture to do well, textbook is supplementary but M/C taken from there. Dr. O has been really great at answering emails and is very approachable in class. The content itself is not especially difficult, but Dr. O has designed the course to be challenging. Often has to repeat her definitions many times in class bc they are unclear

Not a fan of this prof. Her attitude seemed rude towards students, which made the lecture unpleasant to attend. Also midterms were very harshly marked, even though I studied extremely hard and thought I knew most of what was being asked.

I've taken three courses with Dr. Ostovich and I can confidently say she is one of the best professors I've had. Her lectures are extremely well-organized, are easy to understand, and have great flow. Her teaching style makes the content interesting and engaging. Would definitely recommend any course taught by her; truly great prof.

Don't like her rude attitude, demeanour, and condescending treatment of students. Material itself was fairly straightforward. Tests a lot of detail from textbook readings as well. Seems cynical and hates her teaching life because she didn't make being a real physician or lawyer. Not accommodating. Very unapproachable and strict with marks. Too bad.

Very lecture heavy. But really fascinating topics! Just her rude demeanour, attitude, cynical tone, and condescending manners made this course unenjoyable. Material is okay to grasp, but her midterms can be hit or miss, need some deciphering. Take this course if you have some wiggle room in your GPA. Is unrelenting and unforgiving for your concerns

Tests are killer, but easily one of the best profs I have ever had! I have learned so much from her, and still remember what she taught long after the class was finished. I always looked forward to coming to her lectures, she's super funny and always engaging

I have taken several classes with Dr. O & she's the best prof I've had at Mac. The tests aren't difficult if you understand the material - I've gotten an 11 or 12 in every class of hers I've taken without putting in any crazy amount of effort. Her classes are always interesting & I feel like I've actually learned things, rather than just memorizing

Dr. O was possibly the best prof i've had at mac. amazing and interesting lectures, reminds me why i like psychology. very approachable. only time i've ever experienced meaningful class discussion/participation. i would take any class she offers. both her second yr courses were amazing, so interesting, and i loved listening to her

This is my lowest mark going into exams. I took it as an elective i thought would be interesting and relatively easy. While it is interesting material, the multiple choice midterms are ridiculous. I have read 95% of assigned readings and gone to every class have a 71 going into the final - I'm usually a 83-88% student

I adore Dr. Ostovich. Yes, her tests are hard if you are only able to regurgitate material; she wants you to really understand and think critically, which I like. She is an excellent lecturer. I have taken three classes with her now and have loved all of them.
She's very passionate about what she's teaching and her lectures are great but her tests are kinda difficult. I ended up with a decent mark but definitely had to work for it.

If I could turn back time and avoid this class I would. Her lack of clarity on exams is frightening and stressful. She tells her students she amends her marking schemes as to almost imply that "pretty much every student will do poorly". It really is a set up for failure, especially when your prof explicitly mentions this to you the first day.

3RM3 was the first class I had with Dr O.  I enjoyed her lectures, but the midterms were awful: most people ran out of time and the questions were vague. These vague questions required very specific answers. If you put something that was valid, but not in the answer key, you were out of luck. I tried really hard to do well, but it felt impossible.
if you don't have to DON'T.

Overly difficult, her mid terms are a large guessing game, along with her short answer. If you can't get inside her head to figure out exactly what she wants and what she's thinking you won't do well at all.  The feel i get from this prof is "I suffered to get my degree, so you shall too", a slight cynical view on academia and doing well.

Most difficult class I have taken, not because of the material, but because of the grading. The first exam, overly difficult, more of a riddle to figure out what she wants on the exam. MC hard because each question is the length of the page to read and has to much information to make a fast choice for the time given. You will struggle regardless.

IF YOU CAN, AVOID HER CLASSES. I've taken a few classes with her, & I find she's a very polarizing prof. Many other students I've talked to absolutely dislike her, her demeanor, & her material. Personally, although I got decent grades in her courses, I found her extremely condescending to students at times & not helpful. Hard marker too.

If you read the textbook and go to class you'll do well. She's the best lecturer I've ever had. Her courses are well worth taking. She even made child development interesting. Her tests are challenging but not impossible if you learn the material rather than memorize it.

Loved her lectures, they were always very interesting. However, her testing style was not familiar to me. I got 50's on the two midterms, BUT- I created a new studying style in which I wrote a "fake" exam in order to prepare the exam and it worked wonders! I got a 72! Thank god. If you know how to properly study you'll do super well!

Definitely one of the more interesting lecturers at Mac. She's funny and makes the material easy to understand, especially by using tons of examples of experiments. Tests are pretty difficult, but not impossible to do well if you study properly.

Her classes are always super interesting because she seems to be passionate about the material. Some people find her tests difficult, but in my opinion they're not so bad - as long as you know the theories presented in class (along with relevant experiments) and have read the textbook (~25% of questions are text based I believe).

great prof but tests are ridiculous. its not that theyre hard, the questions are just stupid. The questions are always extremely vague, which allows you to kinda ramble about everything you know, then she complains that people are specific in their answers. claims we have to try to figure out what 'the question is asking' like some kind of riddle
one of the best professors at Mac, works really hard to make sure students understand the material. Is really good a teaching material and makes questions that actually get you thinking!
very clear teaching; fair but challenging tests
She was the best prof ever! i enjoyed her lectures. However, her exams were HARD. It wasnt an easy course but i bet you would like the lectures.
interesting class and a good prof. tests were not easy but no means hard. i finished with a decent grade w/o buying the text book. just attend lectures and you can get around mid 70s with ease.
Best lecturer I've ever had! I always looked forward to going to her class. Not a bird course, but a very interesting one. If you pay attention and attend every lecture, you will do well.
Amazing and engaging lecturer, but can definitely be blunt.  Encourages higher level thinking.  LOVED her testing style, one of my best university marks!

Dr. O is a great prof :) Her lecture is every interesting and entertaining. It's a fun class but it's not so easy. YOU MUST MUST MUST GO TO CLASS. She tests mainly on lecture materials. Her tests are not easy, but fair.
Incredible lecturer, I willingly attended every single class. She makes the material so interesting it just sticks naturally. Funny, engaging with her audience. Attendance is a must to do well.**

Most people scared me by saying she was a tough prof but she was a really good lecturer! If you pay attention and understand the experiments and their significance from her lectures you will do well!! Her final exam had me rushing to finish, and had some very confusing question. Fair but not and easy class. and attendance is mandatory!!
Hated this course as well as her teaching style. Tests are impossibly hard and she's a really fake person. I've seen and heard it first hand. By far my worse prof at Mac and that's saying a lot.

Great prof; Class attendance is a must. One of my favourite profs at Mac. Classes are challenging, but she makes the material super interesting. Great lecturer. Classes are not for the weak willed or for slackers of any kind. No nonsense! Loved her.

I think she is a very good lecturer, she makes the information interesting. Her tests can be difficult, but she provides tips on how to do well in her courses which I found helpful. As long as, you review the material regulary and think outside the box, you'll do well.
Tests hard. Need to really know your stuff, memorization WILL NOT HELP YOU. That being said, Ostovich courses have been my favourite of all my psych courses.
Good lectures, but impossible tests. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. It's not worth the aggravation.

Just told our class that we all failed the written part of our exam. If answers are not identical to her understanding of concepts then you will fail the class. Needs to understand that each student has their own way of identifying, understanding and communicating the material

This is a course for those who are committed to a real university education: Dr. O is not going to baby you by testing exactly what she put on the power point. You must synthesize information from lecture, make good notes, read the textbook, and think critically about the material. If you are invested, you will have no trouble doing well.
Great lecturer. She made the content very enjoyable and interesting. She's also very funny. Tests were difficult, but fair. Definitely need to attend lectures to do well

Such  a great prof. so helpful/funny. However tests were so hard! i attended every lecture made study notes read the textbook and ended up with a 60 on the midterm. really really difficult. also her method of teaching was talk about the experiment and then extrapolate info rather than heres the concept and heres an experiment for evidence.

Also took Psych 3AC3 with her. She is a great prof but her tests are brutal! The first midterm average was high 50s and she said that WE were doing something wrong. Second midterm average was only a few percent better.  It is VERY hard to get a good mark in her class. Try to avoid taking her class.
Take this class if you want to fail!

Extremely hard tests! Don not take this class unless you can make every single lecture. You can study for days for her tests and still end up with a mediocre mark. Not a bird course whatsoever, only enroll in this class if you are interested & committed in/to social psych. If not, your GPA will plummet.

I loved her, she taught very good and her classes were extremely interesting. However, tests were impossible. I read all the material and attended every class and studied for weeks, and this was the only class I failed.
in order to do well in her course you have to think like her and how she would answer the questions
She's absolutely AMAZING! LOVED HER! She made me love Social Psychology and before that I had absolutely no interest in Social Psychology so that's saying something!

An excellent and engaging lecturer who uses mostly experimental examples to teach the concepts. YOU MUST GO TO CLASS! All the valuable material is in what she says, not her powerpoints. Tests are very hard but not unfair; you can do well if you study and take an interest in the material.

very interesting and I loved going to lectures. U HAVE TO ATTEND CLASS to get good notes otherwise youll be completely lost... her ppt's dont help at all if u dont attend class. her SA is hard and you have a v limited amount of time to write it all out. have to work very hard to get a 10! shes the only prof i can actually listen 2 w/out tuning out
Enjoyed the class. I feel like I learn the most out of her lectures. Great prof.
To date, this has to be my weirdest class. I studied the most and didn't do well. However, I love her lectures, and actually take classes she teaches because of her.
Great teacher! Hard tests-you must know the exact words that is looking for to get marks!

Tough.  Tricky, demanding tests.  She is a good prof in that she is organized, to the point, and knows what she's talking about.  She's tough, though.  I didn't enjoy her classes because I found her dry and felt that she glazed over certain things and did't assess them.  Not very receptive to questions.

Worst class ever! The tests were far too long-nobody completed the first midterm. The marking was brutal-a C was a 'good' mark. If you didn't write exactly what the master answer was, you LOST marks. Very much 'my way or the highway' kind of prof-doesn't want to know what you know, wants to know how well you memorize what SHE knows.
excellent prof. not very hard tests. awesome subject matter. loved the class :)
Excellent Prof, lectures very well and she is very engaging. Tests are extremely fair. I would definitely recommend taking any of her classes
Dr. O is awesome. Her explanations are crystal clear. Going to class is a must - and she keeps classes HIGHLY enjoyable. Her tests are a bit tricky if you're not used to it but shes great! :)

Jennifer is an excellent prof! Honestly one of my favorites at McMaster and she does not deserve the negative ratings. I honestly didn't find her condescending once and the material was vary well taught. She was very helpful, went at a good pace, and her tests WERE NOT hard. If you go to class you'll do great! Don't be afraid of her!

Extremely condescending. Midterm and exam questions are marked according to a rigid master answer which leave little to no room for variation. Tends to stray off topic during lecture. Marking, done by T.A.s, is extremely subjective and mark allocation does vary between similar answers graded by the same person.

she's condescending, wastes class time with irrelevant stories, always assumes that students are wrong due to 'human error', doesn't take the initiative to create her own questions for quizzes and resorts to using questions from test banks and don't let me get started with her tests...I'm never taking another class from her!

She def doesn't deserve all these negative ratings. Yeh, she doesn't cover the content well and expects too much from her students but then again she tries to make things as fair as poss... I liked her eventhough I didn't end up with a 10-or-12 in the course :(
OMG...she takes hours on one topic, never covers content properly and then you have to memorize her words for the exams and also the book!!! what does she expect from us??!!

Best course ever! She is always available on the boards answering MANY questions with such detail, she puts so much time helping her students out!! AMAZING. For the tests, memorize exp details like IV, DVs (make sure to operationalize your variables), Methods, Results, Discussion. You need to be specific in order to get the marks.

Oh my god, I wanted to shoot myself. This professor definitely deserves all the negative ratings here. Someone needs to report her!  - When a student asks for help through email or by appt. she does not answer the questions properly. Honestly, she is the reason why I wanted to quit school. Sounds emo? Best believe it, she does this to many of us...

Really interesting class and material, but you really do have to go to class, take notes, and study hard. You can definitely do well, and if you're interested, take the class. I learnt a lot, but I had to work for it. (and remember to write everything you can for the short answers!)
Not a good prof at all!
She likes telling students she is using her sense of fairness when giving grades, which is absolutely nonsense. She thinks she is fair, but actually she is not even close.
Way high expectations for students, extrmely hard marker, and so full of herself. She is one of the worst prof I have ever had in my life.

Extremely demanding. For midterms she asks students to write a 6 pages essay in 50 mins. If we suffer from that and complain there is no enough time, she blames that we are not prepared enough, because she and her TAs have written time-presured tests in the past. Not all of us are aiming for grad school. She needs to take it easy on students.

Absolutely terrible.  PPt's were weak and very dry...not all of us love stats, Dr. O.  Minimal reference to the text.  Loved to show off her'age'.  If I heard how old she was and how her cultural references were outdated one more time I would have been sick.  Not all of Dr. O's students are just out of highschool.
Not a very good prof at all. She looks for exact points/answers when marking. Does not clearly explain material in class.
She is a great lecturere, she cares about her students, she does want her students to get good marks. But the problem is...she is soooooo TOUGH!
Not about content all about her.

great explanations and very interesting!! take notes during lectures and memorize experiments given and you'll be fine (at least for the short answer part of the test). tip: answer the short answer q's in detail!

awesome prof, love love love her lectures, but her exams r kinda hard, for the SA part, u have to be right on the point, or u'll loss marks, but still I would take her class again juz because she's such a good lecturer

perfect example of a prof who got lucky and landed a career in teaching while coasting through her own studies. She's mastered the art of talking about meaningless drivel and making it sound like there is any sense to what she says, and being repetitive without sounding like it is. In reality, she doesn't know what she's talking about. Sadly.

Just presents a bunch of reseach on the topic without much of a theme. When you approach her to clarify she is very condecending and treats you like imbecile. On the test she wants you to know all the little detalils of the experiments through which research material was accumulated.

Somehow Ostovich manages to offend at least one minority during each lecture. She tends to pack a lot of information into each class. She has the teaching part of her course down but her exams are killer. Read the textbook for the multiple choice questions. Her "short" answer questions are straight from lecture. Good luck!
This professor wants you to shoot for a C+.  Enough said.

Extremely clear in lecture, and if not, answers questions to clarify anything (in class and very well on webct). You shouldn't miss lecture, not only because everything is explained so well but because she makes every topic very interesting. Use the textbook to back up lecture and you're set! Fair, not easy per se, but a very good prof.

Her quizzes test your ability to memorize the words out of her mouth rather than the concept underlying the question and she seems to be more of a "my way or the highway" kind of teacher, wasn't a fan at all
Extremely helfpul. Really cares students understand the material and do well on the course. One of the best prof I hace ever met in McMaster.
Really fair and to the point. If you attend class and understand the general idea behind the concepts she teaches you will be just fine.

comments: Much consideration put into into her powerpoints and lectures. She definitely comes prepared. I would prefer more interactions in lecture though. She's great with 1-on-1 meetings. The essay topics are only 1 option, so be prepared to do a close reading She gives ample time for essays and anticipates thorough analysis of the material. She's kind
Hard to follow... Pretty easy marker though

Brilliant, and passionate about what she teaches. You should hear her lecture at least once in your life. Easy going too. However, she is condescending, unorganized and she can appear to be cold. She has no patience if you struggle.  If you lack confidence avoid her.  I could not excel under her pedagogical method.  I need structure. Tread wisely!

I find Savage to be the ideal professor you would image yourself having when you enter university! She is one of the most intelligent people I have encountered! Her clarity is not bad, the course is just a tad confusing. Walking into her lecture is like walking into a room full of intellectual capacity. She's extremely astonishing!

I don't mind solely oral lectures, but she would always go off on tangents and bring up irrelevant works for comparison. I finished term one with a 75 (due to the exam consisting of 7 mandatory essay questions to be completed in 3 hours) and brought it up to an 89 at the end of term two (thankfully due to Dr. Walmsley, who is a superior lecturer).

This professor was not my favourite.  Although she could be very interesting and at times captivating in lecture, she seemed as if she was reading an essay, occasionally offering her own comments.  And a 7 essay exam?  Really?  That was an arbitrary move.  Nice lady, but a 7 essay exam does not prove my ability to do anything.  It shows I can rush.

Such a sweetheart! The course material is difficult but she does her best to be as supportive and available as possible. Very responsive to questions and has an insane amount of knowledge in Anglo-saxon, hearing her speak fluently is quite impressive!

One of the sweetest most personable profs I have ever encountered. This being said I HATE linguistics. With a passion. It's like math, but it's English. But Savage herself, just a lovely person with a GREAT love of animals and a passion for literature. Very approachable and kind.

Dr Savage is a real down to earth teacher. She made me feel very comfortable in asking any questions and coming to her outside of class time. She really has this "mom" type quality that makes you feel like she is more than just a prof, she actually cares about her students.

Professor Savage is an amazing professor. I also had her for a fourth year seminar and both courses were superb. She's ridiculously intelligent and willing to pass that on to students who work hard and engage with the material. You WILL work VERY hard, but it is worth the effort.
she is really interesting to listen to. not a fan of the subject but i like her as a prof.
I adore this woman! Helpful, engaging and really into her teaching. I had a blast in her class.

Although Savage is very enthusiastic about the Middle Ages - she is one of the worst profs. i've encountered yet. Extremely vague with assignments, not very approachable, and has a high expectation of what you should know before entering her classroom. I unfortunately had her twice.  Two big thumbs down. Way down.

Love her! If you put effort into your work, you will be rewarded and if you are having difficulties, she is more than willing to find a time, or set up private "lessons" to help you out. She generally wants everyone to be successful in their acadmeic years as well as in their future careers.

Totally awesome prof.  Treats you like an equal and tries to create a relaxed class room environment.  Obviously knows her stuff.  Assignments are often free form which seems to intimidate some, but you will do well if you put an honest effort in.  People who speak ill of her were probably hoping for a bird class
I can't say much for her teaching ability.  But she's really really hot.  Like amazing.  She could go into modelling.  And that old english is really sexy.

Without a doubt the worse professor I've had thus far into my undergraduate. Totally unclear about what shes expects and wants. Not to mention the fact that shes isn't helpful in the slighest and even at times implies that some people are stupid! I would suggest everyone avoids her at all cost, even if it means not taking a particular class. I'm no
She is a great teacher. She's always willing to take questions and to explain something further. She is also funny.
Great prof; she's funny, smart, interesting and very passionate about literature. She's also very approachable and helpful!
Very interesting and super personable!  She's helpful and an easy marker.  A great class!
Interesting prof, strays sometimes from the syllabus, but it allowed us to keep going with a discussion. Friendly and intelligent.

TOTALLY UNRELIABLE, unorganized. Absolutely disrespectful to students and inappropriate.  Unbelievably unclear. Discourages independent views. NEVER STOPS TALKING. Never even gave us a syllabus. Clearly refused to put any effort into the course. AVOID HER

the best teacher iv had ever!
Awesome prof! Made courses fun, interesting and interactive! This guy is the best.
Best prof by far! Classes were so interesting and he always made it fun with his videos and guest lecturers!
m really very inspired from the way of his teaching.
Best prof I've had so far. Very knowledgeable, interactive and makes class enjoyable. I wish I had attended more of his lectures :P
Really funny and interesting! Tests aren't that predictable, but know his powerpoints. He is very enthusiastic and brings in the best speakers :)
great prof!! he makes it interesting to go to class
I look forward to his class. it's filled with funny comments and super interesting facts.  Best prof! He's super cool.
Hilarious! Simon Cowell of Biology. Overall, great prof.
Funniest teacher I have ever met. He really needs to stop making fun of students though, especially when they are trying to participate and get the answer wrong.
Interesting and easy class, just difficult to contact if there are any questions
Amazing prof. Make sure to attend his class. Midterms/exams get their questions from the minute details from his notes - memorize his notes! Overall, a funny and intelligent professor!
hands down the best prof i have had since i have been at mac!!!
Awesome prof!
boreham makes bio fun! :)

tests on midterms are very easy, just listen to what he hints on what is very important for the midterm. He brings in a lot of guest speakers, some of them were great some of them were boring. He goes beyond the textbook and really applies the material to real life. Overall interesting, charismatic, and easy!
Nice guest speakers!
Awesome guy!
Enthusiastic... interested... personable... passionate... After taking one of this guys classes, you would take a bullet for this guy!
Not very approachable
Interesting to listen too.  HArd to find to ask a question and to get a direct answere off
No Comment
Undoubtably the best teacher at McMaster.  Very personable and respectable.
Very kind and helpful!!

He is McMaster's best kept secret.  Wholly passionate about what he teaches and in life too.  We love him!  I used to hate physics, but he has a way of teaching the material that really draws your attention.

comments: Hes THE BEST! He truly cares about his students and is the funniest pro ive ever had. However, the midterms and exam were a little challenging but you can definitely get a double digit without putting too much effort. Also, if youre ever confused with anything, you can just email him and he gets back to you in less than a day. Amazing prof.
A breath of fresh air. Truly understanding prof and lectures are amazing. Gives specific pages for readings. He is abs great! Midterms are easy

THE REAL DEAL. Great man, great prof. Sometimes he repeats stories he already told (I'm guessing he forgot he already told them) and it's so cute and funny, if a little flustering. He's so versed and knowledgeable and truly loves what he teaches. One of McMaster's gems.

Simon Wood is extremely engaging, every class is fun to be in. Its definitely such an enjoyable elective. And every now and then, he blows your mind with cool facts. Textbook readings are given before every test and only questions from the pages he says show up on the test, so its not reading heavy. Definitely recommend this course and Music 2F03!
One of the best classes I have ever taken! You DO not have to know anything about music to take this class. Prof is amazing.
Amazing prof! He cares about all his students, and goes through every test again to make sure there was no mistakes. Lectures are very entertaining and you don't notice the time go by.
VERY GOOD PROF

he's hilarious, really passionate about what he teaches, and is very clear and concise. He wants students to learn and grow from this class, and you can tell he really enjoys teaching. 100% would recommend taking any class with him! doesn't post any lecture notes however so class attendance is pretty much mandatory
I love this man! He's a great prof

A true lecturer, knows his material inside out.  Really cares for his students, and lectures are so engaging you will never want to skip. Textbook is a bit dry but it follows his lecture material closely. Overall a great professor, you will not be disappointed.
Lectures were electric
One of my favourite profs at Mac so far. He's a funny guy and the class was very interesting.
Simon is super funny & his lectures are very informative! Readily answers questions given by the class & clarifies his information when asked :)

Simon is phenomenal instructor. If you have the chance to attend one of his classes or be enrolled in his course I would highly recommend it. As an instructor you can really tell how passionate he is about this study. Simon is very intelligent and his teaching skills are far from boring. Lectures are mandatory but I guarantee you wont want to miss.

Dr. Wood is an amazing professor. He is funny, respectful, knows his stuff and really teaches you what will be on the tests. He doesn't add in trick questions that he only touched on for a second. This was the second time taking this course as I failed the first time with a different prof, and thanks to Dr. Wood I passed and actually understood.

One of the best professors at McMaster. I had the pleasure of taking Music 2II3 and loved the course. Then this term I took Music 2F03 (theatre and film) and didn't know who the prof was... when I saw him standing there, I cannot explain to you how happy I was to see him! Honestly, the best..

Simon is a great teacher. The content was so interesting, i really learned a lot. He is a great story teller and just an all around great guy. He's so funny too, every week he had our entire night class cracking up (a difficult feat too, night classes are awful!). Will miss him!!

This guy isn't a lecturer. He is a TEACHER! You actually leave class knowing the material instead of writing a bunch of stuff down. Best instructor I've ever had. Super nice guy and is hilarious. Very knowledgeable of course material.

I would say he's an okay teacher, but his tests are not easy. Lots of textbook questions and lots of (A, A&C, B&C, all) type questions. He spent way too much time pre-WW2. The first test was basically all race & hillbilly music. The last class was the first time he talked about Zeppelin, which was a shame. I wouldn't take it again, and I love music

A 350 word limit is not enough to explain how awesome this prof is! I am in my fourth year at Mac and I only wish that he could have taught all my classes! I learned so much from this one class. He is the true example of what a professor should be! He loves what he talks about and he will definitely make you love learning! Rock on Mr. Wood!

In my 4 year university career, he is the only professor who taught me anything. Makes the whole course in to a story and effectively ties history and social movement into music. He is amazing. I wish the course was a full year class.

Amazing! Interesting prof, hilarious, lectures appealing to ALL faculties. Easy assignment structure, genuinely cared about everyone. If you had a bad day, he told you to come talk to him, even if it had nothing to do with the class. Ignore older negative comments, as he openly struggled with depression. BEST PROF AT MAC, HANDS DOWN.
LOVED DR. WOOD! Best man ever to teach at Mac!
Best prof I ever had. Only class I went to all semester.

Best prof I've had at Mac. Not only was he a phenomenal teacher but he took the time to give us advice about how to do well in university in general as well. Sometimes, he'd end his lectures with a little "stay strong, my friends" or "use the force, trust your feelings" in a joking kind of way but I would remember that for the rest of the day :)
Best Prof. Best class.

Take this class! It was at 930 in the morn, and I had no trouble getting to class. I was excited about what I would hear in music each day. Simon Wood is an amazing individual, he is so intelligent and really cares about his students. You come out learning SO much about how music influences society. Best class ever, you will not regret taking it.
The best course I have had in mcmaster. His lectures are actually so fun it makes you want to attend the class!
This prof is amazing. He makes every lecture fun and makes you want to attend class.

Best prof out there! This class was so interesting and he knows so much about the music that you really want to attend just so you can hear all the extra tidbits. He is a cool guy too and it shows. I would totally sign up for any other class he teaches....in fact I started looking for one! He's got a great sense of humor too. Excellent!

Very passionate about what he teaches and VERY interesting. His classes are ALWAYS fun and filled with anecdotes that get more than their fair share of laughs. His exams are a little more intense than expected. Attention is required in lecture and it shows on the exams. Overall, a wonderful course and worth the 3 hours of night class!

The fact that this is my first time doing one of these ratings is a testament to how absolutely brilliant Simon Wood really is. Seriously, this man was born to teach- he lectures as if he is telling you a story, and his charm and wit ensure that you hang on to every word he utters. In a perfect world, he would be teaching every course at Mac.
LOVE THIS GUY! =D
AMAZING. One of the best profs at McMaster
DOes anyone know what Dr. Wood's mcmaster email is? please let me know! does he teach summer? this summer?

This class is amazing! Dr. Wood is probably one of the best lecturers at McMaster. Very interesting material. The tests/exams were all M/C and a bit tricky but if you study you'll do well. Also, you have to go to every class as he doesn't post notes but you honestly don't want to miss it anyway. This guy can teach his pants off!

Best professor and class i've had at McMaster. He is an funny, engaging, amazing professor who makes the material come to life. I found myself interested in going to lectures (for the first time) just to hear his stories. And to top it off, he can actually sing!
ROCK ON SIMON!!!
Awesome prof, super fun and funny lectures. Definitely recommend the class. Sexy, too
he is really good, hes very funny makes lectures fun, does not use the Text book as much, however you HAVE to attend class
The man is phenomenal...!
Awesome class, he is soooo funny and sooo entertaining and a little bit sexy too.
favourite prof ever

Favorite prof at MAC. his classes are a much needed break from required classes. took two classes of his now and loved both. you do need to study for his exams but he is fair overall. 3 hour lectures can be brutal but he makes it interesting.  NICE SHORTS!!
awesome professor! favourite this year by far. keep up the great work (and jokes)
AMAZING. BEST LECTURES EVER
Good lecturer but HORRIBLE testing methods.  Multiple choice and unnecessary "a or c, none of the above" options that just trick you.  And the text is useless

Awesome. Extremely knowledgeable, clear, and helpful. He takes time and goes through every step to make sure everyone gets it. Gives interesting and helpful feedback on assigments. I learned a lot in this class. Highly recommended.
One of the best profs I have EVER had. Smart, funny, and just plain enjoyable. Sorry to hear he is leaving us.
He gave a new outlook to movie watcing. He was funny and always happy.
This course changed my life. It introduced me to new musics and made me more receptive to new kinds of music. If you are a music lover, then this is the class for you.
Best class I have ever taken. He makes the material easy and fun to learn! I find myself wanting to go to class to hear how the history of popular music progresses!
the best class ever!!!!!!!
incredibly interesting lectures for material that isn't that interesting to begin with. Really helps you learn the material if you go to class
No Comments
simon was such a great prof! the class was so fun and interesting, wish i could take it again!  simon's lectures were very clear and organized....overall, an amazing class
Good lectures, very engaging... Likes people who are opinionated.
Simply awesome !...Music 2ii3 with simon is not just a class....its an experience !

This prof is jus superb !!! no words to describe how awesome his lectures were. I am really really gonna miss his classes..Guys Simon wood is extremely good and one must be blessed enough to get to be in his course.

I am going to miss Music 2ii3! Dr. Woods is the best prof EVER!!!! So funny, and so smart! I loved the occasional "BOOM GAH's" and the obsession with KISS haha. What a great guy. I wish he could teach all of my classes!
Thank you for making the class interesting and funny. I learnt so much, more than I did in my boring required classes.
Most interesting class I have ever taken.  Simon made it actually enjoyable to attend lecture
All and all he's alright...  A well-needed break from your average lecturer...
Simon is an easygoing guy who tells it like it is; he makes class fun, despite all of the assignments that taking this course entails.  I hope to have him again next year!

Best prof on campus. I took one of his courses, and every week I counted down the days until his next lecture. The following year, I took a course just because I knew he was teaching, and I had no clue about multi media stuff. Through how interesting he makes his lectures I came out with an A! Best prof of all time.

Used to be cool, but something happened within the last year, and now he just doesn't care.  Never comes to class prepared, and don't even think about asking for help, because Dr. Ignoro Von Makes You Feel Crap (p.s. not actually a doctor), will do nothing but anger you and make you cry.  They even got rid of MIDI because he became useless.
he was extremely annoying
BEST PROF AT MAC!!! funny, incredibly intelligent, cares about his students, and will help you if you are in a bind.  If you are at mac, definitely take one of his classes.  You will never regret it.

WHAT AN AWESOME TEACHER!Simon is by far the best prof I've encountered thus far. He inspires and captivates his students like no other. I would recommend everyone to take his course, music lover or not, b/c by the end of his class you will be more appreciative of music and it deep roots in culture.

WHAT AN AWESOME TEACHER!Simon is by far the best prof I've encountered thus far. He inspires and captivates his students like no other. I would recommend everyone to take his course, music lover or not, b/c by the end of his class you will be more appreciative of music and it deep roots in culture.

One of the best profs I've ever had, genuinely cares about his students and will give constructive criticism when needed.  More than willing to help out any student in need and has a great love of the atomic chicken noises...  Just take a S.Wood class and you'll see why people dig his material!

Started out as the best prof ever in 2G03.  When I took 3C03 a year later Simon was the most apathetic person I'd ever met.  He rarely came to class prepared and didn't help anyone at all.  Very close minded and useless.  Stay clear.
SIMON  WOOOD ROCKS!!!!!
Is amazing, best lecturer i have had in my 5 years at Mac.  Learned alot and had fun doing it. oh yeah and just for kicks, so HOT!!!
Wood is frikin'hilarious!!  He is one of the only profs, where I can sit through 3 hours of lectures and not get bored.  Two thumbs up!!

I have never seen a classroom so full before this class- you have to come at least 10 min early to get a good seat. Everyone loves Simon! How could you not? He's incredibly knowledgeable, articulate, hilarious and easy on the eyes. Love the hair! He'll have no problem getting his PHD.
Awesome prof. They should clone this guy and have him teach every course!
Amazing lectures...Brilliant man, actually made class worth attending. Totally hot and funny!

FANTASTIC PROF & PERSON! I loved this class b/c of him. He's soo fun, entertaining & still manages to teach you something about history through music. I loved this class.  Tests were fair. Simon just ROCKS!

Simon actually cares whether or not you're learning the material, and will take whatever time is needed to help. Just a phenomenal person and a great professor. Beware though, his tests might be harder then they seem!

Incredibly smart, nice and helpful prof, but the material is just *BRUTAL* sometimes (i.e. so boring). Only take his courses if you have a serious interest in the field of audio recording and production.
Simon rocks my world!  Funniest, most caring prof I've ever had.. and soooo sexy!!!

Has a gift for connecting extremely well with students, AND doesn't take any bullsh|t. :) Easily one of my most favourite classes at University thus far. Too bad students need a comedy routine to enjoy a class. (Although, his Steven Wright material rocks)
Excellent prof. Funny. Keeps course interesting. Fair. Knows a lot about Popular Music.
Nice Prof, always makes me laugh in lecuture. Tests are little bit hard, other than that he is the top 10 greatest prof in Mac..:D
fun lectures, lots of video clips, great impersonations, always makes me laugh...but dont be fooled...his multiple choice tests are tricky :(
Loves KISS, fantastic wardrobe, possibly most interesting lectures ever!
nice shorts!

comments: Good prof. Good explanations and easy to talk to
IN ALL HONESTY, THE WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER SEEN IN MY LIFE.  AVOID HIM AS MUCH AS YOU CAN!!!

Great Prof. He really cares about his students and the test questions are very straight forward as long as you've done sufficient practice. He has gotten easier so his exams are not as hard as the sample tests/exams he posts. Has a perfect understanding of material and an equally perfect way of conveying it to students. I'd def take again.

Dr. Haddara is an excellent professor. I took 2EI5 online - I think he is one of the most passionate and caring profs that I have met. However, his tests are very difficult.  The course concepts are integral to ECE so work hard in this course. Also, try your very best to not MSAF/defer/do an early/late write:his deferred tests/exams  killer.

Great guy, really cares about students. Currently sitting in an exam review session he is personally holding at 7pm on a Saturday night just to help his students out . Tough tests. He expects you to grasp very complicated circuits quickly. Lectures are very helpful as he does many examples very clearly.
Good professor
worst prof i have ever met
Overall FANTASTIC.

Excellent lectures that have all the information required for the exam. Very specific and provides enough details. Labs were not very straight forward but he is willing to help. Overall, the course (2EI5) was great and I'd love to have him as my prof again!

Dr. Haddara is an amazing addition to McMaster. He is passionate about this course and it really shows through the effort he put into the online lectures, a format I'd like to see for other classes. However, he is actually one professor I'd love to have in a live class format. Dedicated  to his students. Thanks Haddara for a great semester.
Made this course online in 2015, made it a joke almost. Exams much easier than previous years. Great teacher though, explains material very well.
very smart guy. always available and willing to help. challenging midterm/exam. cares about how well a student does in class. love him
extremely helpful prof. very smart. cares about how well a student does in his class. always available. knows what his talking about. challenging midterm/ exam, but fair. love him
He is  a very clear prof, easy to understand, and encourages questions. Overall very happy with his teaching
very smart and helpful.LOVE HIM FOR THE REST OF MY LIFE!!

Very good professor. Tries hard to explain everything, good pace, very clear, helpful and fair. Often runs into classroom minute or two late since he is last minute kind a guy. Stick with lectures, do practice problems and you will be fine. You will not pass without deserving it.
good prof. very clear and helpful. Extremely smart at teaching.
Average prof, nothing special, easy lab and "coursebook" marks, midterms and exams are somewhat hard but no too bad. Should be able to get B- or higher with him.

This the worse prof I have come across in my schooling so far.... He doest post anything online till like 2 to 3 days before the midterm...doesnot return our marks to us so we have no idea where do we stand and doesnt TEACH PROPERLY does the easiest problem in class and expects students to do the hardest problems on the midterms and exams.

This guy is a charachter and a half. He spends so much time telling anti-american jokes, if he wants to be anti-american he should teach politics or something. Hes unorganized and acts like he cares about students, its just an ACT! We respect you for being a hard prof, but you should be fair at the same time.
He is the worst prof i'v ever seen until now.

Am NOT looking forward to his EJ4 class. Comes off as a nice person, but as time passes, you learn that he is not a person of his word, which is really dissapointing considering what he says in his first class presentation. He is not usually available during office hours and his website is updated a couple times per term max.
Not a good prof at all. Says he will be there at office hours, but he never is. He wastes a lot of time with telling jokes, and then rushes in the end. Didnt end up covering all the material at all.

Not a good prof at all. They say we spend $25/lecture-we should be getting back $10 each time since he wastes a lot of time. No one cares about jokes - we just want to learn! Wierd methods of solving problems - does not follow logic:just tries to take the easy way out. Also, the website is never updated, and marks arent returned on time.

Well, may be he is nice person, thats good.But i am not interested in him being nice or not. All i care is how he teaches, and to be honest with you, he is a disappointment. But he is lucky that the TA's are awesome. I think they should replace him with TAs, coz he just cant teach. Thanks u TAs.good job
So how about we tell jokes in the class and take up much of the time? Really entertaining prof, not the best teacher

A good lecturer, but one thing that irrates all his students is when he says he will do something right away - simply put, it doesn't. Prime example: "I'll post the problems/solutions tonight"...Better give him a week before it's done.

A good lecturer, but one thing that irrates all his students is when he says he will do something right away - simply put, it doesn't. Prime example: "I'll post the problems/solutions tonight"...Better give him a week before it's done.

very hippocritical prof, very hard, does not teach anything but tests you on material that is not taught in class. the only reason ppl manage to pass barely is because his TAs are good. he tells us to use one textbook but he himself uses another textbook to post questions and stuff. he cannot organise time and is very lazy.very harsh on marking.
rather than scheduling make-up lectures for missed/cancelled class, we are being rushed through the material. why? who knows...

Dr. Haddara is a very nice person, however, he is extremley hypacritical. His website is updated probably once a month, problem sets/solutions, which he says he will post, do not get posted and he rarely responds to e-mails. I give him credit for trying to be a dynamic lecture, but a lot of teaching is wasted and as a result, the course is rushed.

Really nice GUY. A cool prof who would treat you really nice. Will talk to you outside the class. Will remeber your name forever. BUT he isn't a good teacher. His class is entetaining. But he wastes way too much time. And expects way too much from the students.

Very hard professor, His class is fun and interesting to attend, but this distracts you from the fact hat EE @EI5 is extremely hard with him as the prof. he will teach u basics about a topic BUT WILL TEST U ON ADVANCED STUFF THAT IS NO WHERE TO BE FOUND IN THE TEXT BOOK. also does not follow textbook but will say taht he does
hard marking. his TA's are really messed up and not helpful at all. marking is really hard
He is also one the library's desktop series. Cool prof.
Absolutly ammmazing prof!!! Really helpfull.

Great teaching methods, but really wastes time, AND I MEAN REALLY wastes time. Spent a WHOLE week doing a stupid course refinement, course material is taught at a very slow pace. Otherwise really helpful, remembers names, quizzes/labs aren't too hard.

Simply put, he tries to hard to be a good teacher. I'll give him points for enthusiasm & motivation. Tests are challenging. Good layout of labs/quizzes. Disorganized with the web-page (late getting things up, and late with announcements)
Remember names. Barely covers any material, kinda screws you up for future courses. Overrated
Amazing Prof. But his exams are challenging. Always willing to help
Great prof, clear lectures and always there to help.  Tests are fair, but not easy.
EXCELLENT
Amazing prof. Cared about how well students did in the class. If someone needed help, he'd take time out of his day to make sure you understood.
No Comments
Amazing Prof. Extremely helpful and cares a lot about the students.More power to Haddara!
he cares about student.this is true that is why he makes the quizes, midterms and exams so hard. don't think that he is there to help.
No Comments
dont know what the point is .
Amazing prof. Truly cares about students. Even remembers names!

comments: Does his job
He's a homie. He's a great teacher and funny in class. Sometimes answers even decently legitimate questions in the tone of "are you kidding me" but whatever.

He follows the lecture slides which you can get online however he solves all the example problems during lecture and does not post the solutions so attending lecture is important. He is very serious about physics but only because he is very passionate about physics.

Traditional equation-heavy lecture type of prof, a big mirror to Karen's methods. Makes very savage jokes, even towards his students. Really good lectures and he makes a lot of references to astronomy. His first midterm was pretty hard (no bellcurve), second midterm pretty straight forward, final exam was meh, but I'm 99% sure it got bell curved.
Okon is a great prof for introductory mechanics. He is very thorough in lecture when he goes through examples and is very approachable. Watch out though, he roasts people alot (but its too funny).
Great prof. Does a good job of explaining the concepts and doing examples in class
He knows what he's talking about. Hard to talk to him via e-mails.
Okon is a very funny teacher if you have satire based humor. The lectures make sense and he will answer all of your questions if you word them right.
Makes plenty of "savage" jokes about arts students that us engineers just love.
He is really educated and knows what he's talking about, but tests are a nightmare, you need to work at least 2 hours a day for physics.
Harsh Physics Tests  but man knows his stuff. Thoroughly explains what is happening with no apparent prep on his side, and will shoot downexplain any question thats asked. Has alot of funny moments

My favourite prof of first year. He explains concepts well, and is also hilarious. He is intimidating in class, but easy to talk to afterwards. The demonstrations are fantastic. Don't get too comfortable, though, because the first midterm will be tough. Always jokes about people dropping out. Go to his website.
Funny guy, makes fun of students a lot. He may seem intimidating, but is great help in person. What makes him a great prof are his examples that he does in lectures. 10/10
Funny prof, yet a bit intimidating. Flies through lectures, causing them to end approximately 20 minutes early every time. However, he's very helpful one-on-one.
Okay teacher, has funny jokes which makes him likeable, however he rarely fully goes through the examples he does.
Amazing prof- always helpful! I will be sure to attend his classes again next semester. Beautiful Polish man!
Great prof
Such a great prof!
Really great explanations and analogies. Really funny.

Very good prof, lectures are fun, and keeps you interested. Has a random sense of humor that if you pay attention in class you will pick up, very helpfull during office hours. Remembers students faces. Very nice person

He's pretty awesome and I really enjoy going to his lectures even though they're at 9:30, definitely keeps you interested in physics and the problems he does in class are perfect for learning concepts.
Awesome prof. He's very fast-paced but will definetely keep you awake in class. His midterm/exam reviews are super helpful and if you're able to solve the in-class problems, you'll fine on the tests.
Great teacher so far. Couldn't be clearer. He also keeps a subtle humour for those paying attention.

every girls says the same thing "he's kinda cute!" wierd.  Anyways he has a funny accent that does not hamper his ability to speak, he is quite funny, with cool backgrounds on his computer.  the class average speaks for itself.  Across the board people in okons class scored 5% higher on all tests TAKE HIM!!
Awesome prof, personal fav. Class was pretty hard, but Okon made it interesting and funny. Also has some awesome t-shirts. Exam was hard but that was expected.
Awesome Prof!

A great prof. he prepares you well and his class is interesting. he knows his stuff well. if you disturb the class he will stop and tell you to shut up :D before the exam he also gives you hints what is more important. I havent got the final mark yet, but i estimated i got a B or B+
the only reason i go to class is because of him..he is a really great prof..very helpful..he is very sweet..and hot too..;)
Amazing Prof!
Amazing prof. Can't say anything more then that
best physics prof! friendly, willing to help. explanations and examples are clear and understandable.

good prof! always has clear relevant examples that appear on the tests or assignments, and really explains everything to the point where you really can't say anything more about it. i love his lectures! they really make everything super clear. just go to class and you'll be really good.
Good professor.  He taught me physics pretty well.
great prof, super helpful, he has a kinda morbid humor
Fantastic! Always brought up questions found on the tests and only assigned questions that were relevant to the tested knowledge. Very easy to understand and usually pretty funny.
No Comments
No Comments
He is a really good teacher, sumtimes funny

comments: Rude and irrational, doesn't care to listen to her students. Slow response times via email

The good: she seems to have insight. The bad: The class is basically her speaking to everyone from a pedestal in a very dry manner. Leaves no room for discussion and shoots down questions. Tutorials are pointless because classmates are not engaged with the material. She does not seem to actually want to be teaching the class.

Dr. Ostovich is a wonderful Prof who (in a huge class)noticed that I was struggling and offered assistance without me having to say a word. Although she is tough, she truly cares about the students who care about the class and is passionate about what she teaches! I assume she focuses on drama because Shakespeare wrote PLAYS!!

HORRIBLE. WORST instructor I've ever had. I'm an 'A' English student, and I've never been so frustrated with the marking methods of a prof before. Terribly rude, unwilling to help (I sent her an e-mail and she responded rudely without actually answering my question) and she's terrible at lecturing. Just heed my words - don't take her courses.

Worst Professor Ever. Do not take any class that has her listed as a professor. She passes around attendance sheets, makes you do a scene performance with memorized lines in front of the WHOLE CLASS worth 30%, is not open to opinions other than her own.... just trust me, drop her class ASAP.

Had her for 3K and 2B06.  She's tough if you have her as a marker.  Not open to discussion or ideas. Not approachable.  You have to get on her good side otherwise she wont be helpful in the least.  Her lectures will seem to go off the point. You have to know what she's talking about ahead of time. That said, she isn't the worst. Organized. insight.

Absolutely positively the worst professor I've had at McMaster in my 5 years here. If you can afford to take 3K06 on a rotation with Dr. Grise instead, do it - this woman is a nightmare. Even unaccomodating to CSD students.

worst class ever! Ostovich is the worst prof that ever happened! rude not helpful at all and that dumb disgusted looks she gives when you say anything that isn't exactly her opinion is hideous. very close minded, she is the total opposite of what university is about, DISCUSSION!

WORST PROF EVER! I haven't rated anyone else, but I feel like I HAVE to warn everyone! Don't take any of her classes. You will come out bitter, overworked, and questioning "Why God? Why?" Avoid at all costs!

It's pretty much all been said... If you're failing, then you really have no hope of doing well in this class. Dr. O has insane expectations and sucks when it comes to helping students... or lecturing... or teaching for that matter... and she's one of the rudest profs i've ever had...it's beyond me why Mac still has her around...

She is very rude! She is the worst professor I have had out of my four years at McMaster. Her marking is very tough, sort of unfair really. She is not helpful at all, is you ask questions, she looks at you as if you were an idiot. Her opinion is the only opinion that matters! Only take her class is you need it to graduate!!!
Dr. Ostovich is an amazing professor. She is highly knowledgable and is completely willing to help anyone who asks. You do need to work hard though, she does expect you to bring your best to class!
Dr. Ostovich is a great prof!!  Her lectures may be a bit dry but they are clear and informative.  You have to work or you will do crappy.  She is very willing to spend time helping ANYONE who asks.

Loves Shakespeare, but not people in general. She summarizes his plays which is unecessary...we all know how to read and comprehend. She never gave an in depth reading or critical viewpoint of Shakespearean plays. She is also just not a nice and approachable prof. Avoid her at all costs!!

After reading these comments I had second thoughts about taking her class.  But If I had dropped her course based on these comments it would've been a huge mistake.  Dr. Ostovich is incredibly insightful and asks very interesting questions that make you think.  She gives alot of work, but a challenge is a good thing.
Not approachable if you are struggling.
Dr. Ostovich is a very nice lady, but I found some of her teachings of the plays lacked depth-lots of synopses, etc. The film clips shown in class were great, but the fickle-marking TAs were not.
One of my favourite English profs ever. learned so much from her.  Be prepared to work hard!
No Comments
No Comments

She is very knowledgable in her field, but in no way does she encourage student discussion.  In a graduate class with three students and mandatory attendance, (with three two hour presentations) it is unreasonable to award a B- for participation. She considers her opinions to be absolute fact; she is entirely unwilling to entertain any other ideas.

I used to love Shakespeare, her class ruined it. Sure she knows her stuff and all, but the presentation was boring and she made us act in an English class, then told us it was horrible and essentially useless. Worst english class ever.

Don't take her classes if you aren't prepared to work hard.  Unlike many people have said about her she isn't a wicked witch...she really knows/loves drama and gets pissed off when people aren't reading the plays.  If you listen to what she has to say, and do the work you will learn a lot from her.  She is very respected in the drama community.

She is the wicked witch, (Ostowitch)of the Englilish department, and possibly all of McMaster! She chooses favorites, is ALWAYS right and never shuts her trap about her stupid plays and projects! Watch out if you're not on her goodside, she is a nightmare!

She's is horrific, screwing up her face and giving dirty looks to students as they present in their 4th year seminars???!!! It's supposed to be a place where we can talk about ideas and not feel uncomfortable. It's all about her and her plays and projects! Her English class is like a theatre class, and not a good one.It's Ostawitch for a reason!

You people who are hatin' on Ostovich need a wake up call. THIS IS UNIVERSITY. Not highschool! Grow up and do your work. Babies. No one is gonna spoon feed you an education. Too often people want to know what high learning can do for them How about trying to figure out what you can do WITH IT! Suck it up or give it up

No one has "grudges". She's a very confusing prof. Her explainations are confusing and she is unable to express her ideas clearly to the class. Her ENGLISH classes are too film based and her topics all revolve around staging and theatres. She likes to pic favourites and is not helpful at all.
Ughhh...all i'm saying is, it's a good thing Shakespeare is dead....
an interesting and exciting professor - she brings new interpretations to canonical elements of english. i really enjoyed her class - the previous two posters have grudges. she's smart and cool!
incompetent, unhelpful, irritating...a waste and time as a prof.

Ostovich is judgemental, and extremly unhelpful.  This Professor is not out to help her students, she is out for herself only.Also, don't try and write too well for her, or you will be accused of plagarism and given an F.She is the worst example of higher learning one will ever encounter.

An excellent prof, if given a chance. Has a bad reputation, but if you try to work with her you will see she is a brilliant and helpful prof. Don't judge her by the comments here, she really is a great prof.

Terrible class. Lectures consist mainly of plot summary. Proof of her craptacularness (yeah, I'm an English major)? The majority of the class escapes at the break. Furthermore - - Dr. O seems to emphasize performance over the texts. I don't feel she's taught me anything substantial.

OK, so yes, Dr. O's reception is bad, and I agree with most ppls comments.  She is untolerable of any sort of absence, even when essential or unavoidable. Unforgiving, stubborn, and misleading.  She lets you think that she agrees with your ideas, and then s***s all over your mark! Awful!
The worst professor at Mac. Now I know why this was one of the required courses needed to major in English... because if it wasn't, no one would take it. Ever. She's a horrible, horrible woman.

All I can say is that this woman has made my year completely miserable.  I do all of the readings, and I always hand my stuff in on time...show up to all of the lectures, and understand fairly well-yet I am pulling of c's and c+ on everything. I am also disapointed about the lectures.Don't take her!
Good Prof. I suspect the people who are ****ing about her just didnt do well in her class. Smart, funny and a lot of fun. Open to new ideas.

I consider myself a fairly strong writer, yet end up with 60's on every 'short' paper--plus the comments are not helpful.  She seems to know a lot about drama but, has a hard teaching it.  All she ever lectures on is a sumary of the play-and those who read them before lecture are left frusterated!
totally, completely unorganized!!!
If you take this course be prepared to hate your life for an entire school year -- and hate her for life
Oh c'mon!  Dr. Ostovich is, first, a leader in her field and it shows (edits Jonson for The Oxford).  She's also a great communicator if you make it clear what needs knowing.

A terrible person and even worse prof. Made me hate the class and the entire English department. She's a very hard marker that tends to discourage creativity and free thinking. Way too focussed on performance. I don't think I learned a single thing.
Go to hell and

If you don't agree with her, and your short papers don't reflect what she thinks is right, you will get crap grades. Go to Lectures and listen to what she thinks to be right and then repeat information on exam, and you should get a decent grade.

This woman is a horrible person.  She is unorganized and inconsistent in her grading.  Only cares about a select few and all others should drop her course because you will not achieve a satisfactory grade.  Don't learn the hard way - DROP HER COURSE!

Cruel lady, unfriendly, unhelpful.  Don't expect to get very far in her class unless by some miracle she actually likes you (how unprofessional).  It's too bad someone with authority at McMaster can't realize how awful she is.
Has favourite students and grades them that way.  Her favourite number is 68 so be prepared to get 68% on most of your essays.
No Comments
great class! she's interesting and has good ideas.  she does read from her notes tho...
Difficult, but fair. Only minus is that she treated dumb students as such.
All over the place. An extremely confused lady.....
very unorganized!

comments: I like her
Helpful and kind, and very, very knowledgable. I learned so much from her.

She is one of the best profs I've had at MAC in four years. Had her twice, and both were some of the best classes I ever had. I went in hating literature, but left absolutely loving it thanks to her! Super helpful and accommodating as well. It's irrelevant, but stunningly-gorgeous, goddess-like, as someone said earlier. Beautiful person overall!
A pseudo-intellectual phony with a pretty face. She can teach basic language classes well enough but her thoughts on literature are forgettable.
She's a nice teacher. She isn't mean and tries her best to help when you need it. Overall I like her. Now I just need to do well in her class...
A Really awesome and nice teacher :-)
Very nice and interesting.  However, she was an extremely hard marker and I found it hard to know what she expected!
she teaches material really well, but the tests can really****you :S

After having had innumerable French classes with old and bitter profs, Dr. Rosner was a breath of fresh air. And, because French is innately boring, it is made SO much more tolerable when the person teaching it to you is goddess-like in her hotness. She is just insanely gorgeous. Oh, and smart and nice and all that other important stuff, too.
Um, beautiful...French is A LOT more fun when you can ogle the prof teaching it to you.

Dr. Rosner is really nice and is an excellent teacher.  In addition to being an awesome French prof she also taught me why never to wear white after labour day. I would suggest switching into her section.  You make French really fun, God bless.
i love this womyn. she is beautiful and an amazing teacher. thanks to her i can speak french about 10 times better than before. did i mention she is gorgeous?!?

Dr. Rosner is just lovely - so sweet and accommodating and eager for her students to understand and care about what they're learning about. She really knows what she's talking about, too, which helps. She has high standards but they are not unreasonable. She's hot to the point of it almost being a little distracting.
She is a great prof, really knows her stuff... Very helpful and so easy to talk to!
Super-nice and always willing to help; very friendly and approachable. I love her fashion style.
seems nice
She couldn't be hotter; but maybe if she were just a little easier...

As someone commented earlier, she is super-sweet!  The class environment she promotes is conducive to learning and, more than that, to participation, which is important in French classes for students at the intermediate level.  Overall, she's an A+!
Dr.Rosner is super sweet and very willing to help.
HOT....wants you to really understand the material and will halp you with problems. genuinely a nice perosn. Great fashion sense!
Best prof ever!!!
