comments: Marvin Gunderman is literally an angel sent from above. The best professor I have ever had. Not only did he inspire his students in all areas of life but he had an ability to make us feel at home. He taught me so much in such a short time. He is incredibly kind and generous and I recommend him to anyone and everyone. 10/10 would poot. 3

Best professor at McMaster hands down! The most supportive, kind, knowledgeable professor you will ever come across. DEFINITELY take 3R03 and/or 4J03 if you can with Marvin, he is the hidden gem of this school. Anyone who comes across him will not only have an amazing undergraduate experience, but a friend and mentor for life!

Marvin is one of the most passionate instructors I have ever had. I took his field biology course over the summer and him and Dave (the TA) make such a dynamic duo! His passion for entomology was infectious and got everybody in the course motivated to do work and learn more about insects.

In addition to opening my eyes to the world of insects, Marvin and Daves entomology field course reignited my diminished passion for Biology. Fueled on caffeine, their devotion for teaching makes the interactive lessons fly by - and before you know it youll turn into a bug guru! Highly recommend taking this course to students from all backgrounds

Sup. Marvin is one of the best profs McMaster has to offer. His field course on entomology is an incredible experience. He is very approachable and creates a comfortable atmosphere optimal for learning. Couldn't recommend this course more. Dave Cheung was our TA, and only added to the best qualities of Marvin and this course. Jenn was the bomb too.
AMAZING PROF really makes everything exciting and easy to understand. His excitement is contagious

Marvin is an incredible Professor. He is very knowledgeable, approachable, understanding, funny, and passionate about entomology. This is likely the only course where you can learn a lot and have fun at the same time. Definitely the best course I have taken in my undergrad. Also if you are lucky enough to have Dave as a TA then its a huge plus!

MARVIN is one of the best profs out there. He will convert you into an insect-loving naturalist. Marv and Dave (TA) are a golden team. Not only do you learn SO MUCH about insects, but Marvin also makes the course so fun and enjoyable. If you're looking for a field course to take, look no more, because Marvin's Insect Taxonomy is your ANSWERRR.

Marvin is the best, and it's not even close.  His enthusiasm and love for insects and teaching is second to none.  I would highly recommend anyone even considering an insect or photography course to take his field course!  You will not regret one second of it.

Marvin Gunderman rocks! He is fantastically inspiring, his devout interest in insects reflects his personal values and complements his aspiration to teach.  Such a thrill to have been a student. A pulchritudinous example of a individual you will not forget.

This course will stir up quite a buzz. No more worrying about profs trying to sting your GPA or enthusiasm. No more TAs bugging you about pointless quizzes or assignments. Marvin and his TA Dave did an amazing job in this course. This would definitely be one of my favourite courses I have taken. I highly recommend it, especially if you love nature.

Had a fantastic time on the insect field course with Marvin. He is extremely approachable and brought a certain levity to every scenario. His personable character allowed for all students to learn a great deal from him. His enthusiasm was for life was contagious, and I feel privileged to have spent 2 weeks getting to know him

An awesome course.  Dave (the TA) was awesome, Marvin was great!  Both of them were very inspiring.  Marvin truly makes you want to become an entomologist.  Dave is the best photographer that I have ever known.  Both of them are great!I recommend the course to anyone who has any care about nature.  The course will blow your MIND!!!!!!!
Field course with Marvin is a must! Satisfaction guaranteed :)

Marvin was an insightful and encouraging professor for the insect field course. Always interested in the students, what we brought to the table and interacting with us. Definitely one of my favourite professors so far in my studies; highly recommended if you are looking for a socially engaging, intellectual and helpful teacher!!

What a great field course! It was everything I thought it would be, with one exception: Marvin Gunderman. He goes above and beyond, is caring and passionate, and has some pretty good taste in music! You'll come away from his course with not just some new knowledge but a new friend too.

Took Insect Taxonomy at QUBS in 2010 - what a great class! Marvin is clear, and passionate. It was easy to forget I was at school, yet I walked away from the class knowing so much more about insects! Marvin and his TA (Dave) are so helpful! I wish I could take more courses with them!

Marvin (and Dave) are so passionate and their love for bugs is quite infectious. The field course for Insect Taxonomy has been the best memory of my whole University experience. Marvin is one those few rare teachers that inspire you. Thanks to him, I now know my calling.

I took Marvin's Instect Taxonomy and Ecology field course at QUBS through OUPFB.  What an amazing experience!   Marvin (and Dave Cheung) have contagious love for their work and the field course should not be missed!  I'm not a died-in-the-wool entomologist, but I love photography and the field course expanded my knowledge of both subjects.
You can not find a more passionate, energetic and genuinely supportive teacher.  I hope to be like him when I grow up!
You couldn't ask for are more passionate, genuine and motivating teacher. Consider yourself lucky to be in his class.
Marvin is a such a sweet guy and lecturer. he loves his subject, has a great attitude and is always pleasant to be arround. ps if you show an interest in bugs he'll love you

comments: She is very kind and cares about her students. Can tell she is very into the topic she speaks about, and is very helpful when you need. Class is sometimes boring and you feel like she isn't teaching much material. TA's are AWESOME! i suggest going to tutorial, as the readings WILL be on the exam. isn't too hard if you put somewhat effort.

she is a sweet lady. very smart and does interesting research and also brings up interesting studies in class. she often uses direct quotes from individuals which is super helpful in understanding other perspectives of people. you can ask her any question and she will help you! some of the textbook readings she assigns is also part of the lecture

I've taken a few of her courses. Soc2c6 was the first.  She is my favorite prof from Mac because she is a fantastic person, and is passionate about teaching & research. Rearrange your courses so you take a course of hers.
Very interesting class (especially the case studies). She is very helpful and the test questions for the multiple choice are fair.
Awesome prof! Really well spoken and clear and teaches on very interesting topics! Loved her course!
good prof, easy, helpful.  lectures tend to be all over the place and can be difficult to take notes.  overall really good
Dr. Pawluch is a great professor. Her lectures are interesting, she is wonderful at helping students and things make sense when she teaches them.
A great prof. who shows legitimate interest in her students.
Good teacher. I loved the course.
To be very honest this professor is not very helpful to students. She gave me the wrong mark on my final exam when I asked her by email.
DOROTHY ANNA CARLA PAWLUCH IS ONE OF THE MOST FAIR PROFS IN SOCIOLOGY. VERY FAIR EXAMS. BUT BETTER WATCH OUT BECAUSE SOME OF HER TA'S CAN BE HARD MARKERS ON THE ESSAY.
Shes a really nice lady, and really effective at teaching. It should be a crime not to be in her class.

I found her exams to be really easy. If you did your readings in a timely manner, and not leave everything right before the exam, there is no reason, one should get less than 80%. A lot of people get low marks on her exams, but I think it's because people don't keep up with the readings. She never tricks you on the multiple choice. Very fair prof.
Great use of overheads.  Assignments were interesing to complete...not the typical essay more reflective.  Very caring and approachable. Fair marker
What a fantastic teacher. She's so nice too!! If you ever get a chance, have a chat with her!
Dorthy was a great prof. She really did a fantastic job of teaching the class!!

Course content is very interesting.  Very nice and approachable.  However, her instructions are very vague and then marks a bit hard if you don't include everything she wants.  Would take a course again with her.
I LOOOOVED this class and the prof.  shes an amazing person, very willing to interact with her students. very positive person.
CLASS IS INTERESTING. SHE IS STRAIGHTFORWARD AND REALLY NICE! and her TESTS ARE FAIR. IF YOU CAN MEMORIZE.. you're on ur way to an A+ with her.
Awesome prof. Best class I had since I started. I actually wanted to go to class. I was sorry when the year ended. A first for me!
Very interesting lectures as well as reading material. Very friendly:)

She's a GREAT prof! The class is very interesting and she communicates the material very effectively. Hands down best prof I've had so far. When you need help with the assignments shes very easy to talk to. Also tests are very fair :) If your thinking about taking 2C06, trust me, take it!!
Her exams are hard if you're stupid. It's called reading the text and studying...most people did very well.

Dr. Pawluch is really nice and sweet, and the course material isn't bad at all. Just keep up with the readings, because if you leave all the readings till few days before the exam, then you will not do well.
The best. I love going to this class. Always interesting. She explains things in a way that helps me in my other soc courses.
Her exams are tough...didn't do as well as I had hoped
She is the nicest lady and one of the best profs I've had till now. Wish I had studied harder for the midterm!
AMAZING PROF! WIKID CLASS
I agree. Prof has good teaching style and makes even theory interesting.
Great course and even better with Dr. Pawluch. Best prof I've had at MAC. If copying overheads is your thing, look for another course. If you want to learn about deviants, TAKE THIS COURSE!

Great Prof! Very caring and involved. You can tell that she is interested in the material and makes it interesting to learn about. She even made theory interesting! I would recommend taking her class to anyone.

Sooo boring.  She spends so much time (practically the entire hour) on 1/2 a page of notes.  The exams were harder than the assignments.  So it's not a hard class.  It's just so boring.  Take 2U06.  Much more interesting.
She seems to be truely interested in the topics as well as the students and seems like a really great person (inside as well as outside of class.) She makes lecture enjoyable and easy-going.
Great prof, and EXTREMELY nice person!  2C06 is a great class.
Phenomenal course! Incredible professor!
Wonderful person and engaging speaker. Very clear expectations. Highly recommend a class with her!!
She is a great professor, very clear and helpful, very approachable. I wouldn't mind taking her classes for all sociology classes!
FABULOUS...what a nice person!
Great professor.  Topics explained very clearly...class was very interesting!  Take this course!  It's cool!
She's a really great lecturer and amiable person.  Enjoyed this class a lot.

comments: I thought he was very interesting for a bio class and a great professor. i like how he includes examples of his own. I would take this class again.

Test questions were rather strange and inconsistent with what we were supposed to be tested on (i.e. said there would be no lab questions, first 4 questions are about the labs). I found him boring during lecture and usually had a hard time paying attention.

He always handled questions really well in lecture, and didn't mind explaining difficult concepts slowly or several times for the physics-challenged. Lots of people complained about his exams but I personally saw no issues.

Second time I've had this prof, very much enjoyed his class. It was hard, but extremely interesting, and his class had a friendly, open atmosphere. I should mention though that there were less than 30 of us in the room. He was harder to connect to in a giant lecture hall back in 2nd year.

His lecture notes do not prepare at all for the questions he asks on his tests. The wording on the multiple choice tests is subjective and falls under severe scrutiny. The textbook is impossible to understand, yet you have to MEMORIZE every detail. I came into this class with high expectations and I'm in danger of failing. And I'm on Honour Roll.

This course has the potential to be half descent if it weren't taught by a monotone that instead of teaching something useful goes on and on about formula's that really aren't important and then rambles about his own interests, which NOBODY CARES ABOUT! His tests consist of the most subjective questions that are impossible to answer.
No Comments

Very nice prof,his test/quizes questions can be ambigous at times,and lots of tricky m/c questions. so make sure you study and UNDERSTAND lectures. this is the only 2nd yr bio that tested on understanding.and make sure you get your hands on old tests, doesnt matter how old they are,his questions are usually similar.lab marks really helped grades
Anim phys has probably been one of my favourite biology courses taken at MAC. Great prof, great course material. Attend lectures, spend some good quality time on labs, and you will be just fine. :)
He's a very boring prof to listen to but the course is interesting.
Awesome Prof.  LOTS of information, so keep urself updated, ie. slackers won't prosper.  The labs were tedious and pointless.  This class takes TIME.  Understand the material and you'll be fine.

i really liked his method of teaching, where he gives guideline slides and you fill them in.  writing it down helps you to remember.  unlike most mac bio profs, his lectures are actually worth attending!  the labs are a lot of work, but they are useful and relevant.
His lectures are worth attending. He makes blunders sometimes, but overall he is all right.

The material could be interesting, and yet he makes it seem more complicated than it actually is. Ok, he has a nice voice, but he's not that great a lecturer. Not to mention that some of the MC on quizzes and such are downright random.

This was an extremely interesting class. His lecture notes were clear and his voice made the information stay in your mind. The tests were fair but a heads up on the labs which can either make you or break you.
This man was the most boring prof, monotone voice, and did nothing but read off his lecture slides. Awful lecturer.

He was an excellent professor and a very clear lecturer. His notes were straightforward as was his quiz. I wish he had taught longer then the quarter of the semester that he did teach. I highly recommend the course as well as the professor!
He is hot and that voice!!!
Very clear lecturing, excellent notes. Prepares you well for tests. Also very hot!
Good lecturing style but random pictures.  Tricky exam...KNOW YOUR STUFF WELL.
One of the most interesting courses I've taken

comments: Good lectures and fair assignments though it is a challenging course. Attending lecture is a must
Very good professor. Excellent lectures and is fair and reasonable with her expectations (though her courses are not easy)

An excellent professor- one of my favourites. I'm always so happy to see that Igneski is teaching a course I've signed up for. She is extremely approachable and friendly, and the organization of her material is always on point. She is clear in regards to expectations and is open to revision if necessary. A wonderful woman!
She could answer any question that you threw her way!
average prof. review class was less than useless. spent half of it asking for feedback of the course.

Great prof. Gives interesting lectures, is consistently clear in assignment/midterm instructions and very helpful. She puts the textbook material into terms you can actually understand. Made communication theory interesting. I would definitely take another course of hers again.
completely unreasonable with marking - lots of complaints, unclear with expectations on midterms, tests.
BEST PROF EVER... she was great fun, interesting. and made the course fun and easy to understand the material!
This is the best class I've had in my four years at Mac.  She is a great prof and makes philosophy interesting.
Simply amazing.  So smart and funny!!
Excellent!  Have no idea what the others are saying.  She is amazing and she is a prof!!
Nice person, but needed to reign in and direct the discussion big time.  Too many hacks saying whatever they felt like.  Made it a mickey mouse course but with super picky marking.
Nice prof, but holy moly is she stiff with her marking sometimes. Don't go in looking for an easy A, otherwise you'll leave terribly disappointed.
Please pass that 10 lb hammer so I can hit myself in the face a few times
not advisable
She is generally a nice person to deal with, but her lectures lack structure. I learned more from the textbook than her lectures; overall, her class was alright.
for cmst best teacher ever!!!
wonder y is she still at mac....? Horrible ...and not even a prof...atleast not yet
Worst PHL course ever. Prof seemed unclear most of the time and I had trouble understanding her subject matter.  Frustrating. I enjoy PHL but would not take a course with this professor again.
Not bad...prof had interesting ideas but had trouble justifying them - too many excuses.  Clearly inexperienced and lacked common sense.
What gutter? Dr. Igneski is smart and beautiful and classy? What's wrong with saying that? Stop being such a prude.

Take you minds out of the gutters!! In actuality she's pretty cool, fairly easy to talk to and whatnot but she's a little green and at times tends to dance around issues or drop excuses rather than giving you some solid, straight up answers.
So interesting and smart!!! And so pretty (great hair). I love this class - favorite professor ever!!
I wish all the profs look like Dr. Igneski.
She's cute and sexy.
Clear at explaining and good discussing, but can't really apply the knowledge
No Comments

comments: It's an easy class as long as you keep up with the short readings and attend most classes. His lectures are pretty good but are mostly discussion-based and can be a little boring if you don't really care. Assignments are clear and pretty simple, Exam gives you lots of choices so you choose the questions you want to answer (ie. 5/10 Short Answers)
Really bizarre but brilliant. He never fails to wear the exact same thing every day and he's the funniest prof ever. Great class, really easy and interesting.
Not a great teacher, doesn't tend to explain things.  Sometimes funny, but not enough to keep my attention in class.  If his quizzes are so ****ing hard I don't want to take the midterm.
Mark is such an amazing prof! Especially if you love philosophy! Very clear in expectations, great speaker, and he keeps the class engaged. You do not want to miss taking one of Mark's classes!

Dr. Walker taught ArtSci logic last year. I wasn't expecting to find it particularly interesting, but it ended up being my favourite course. He was very funny and engaging, and there was a ton of class participation. Also very helpful if you see him outside of class and he answered all our WebCT questions very promptly. A cool guy.
Dr. Walker is amazing. He is hilarious and very easy-going. If you go to his office, he is very approachable and helpful.
unclear explanation. the tests are difficult.

superb job for such an abstract course. i only took this because it was mandatory for my degree at one point, but it was enjoyable. Mark is a funny guy who makes it interesting by his jokes and his sample questions. you need to be able to wrap your head around the concepts though - some will find the class easy, some will find it brutal.
Ambiguous explanation

This is by far the easiest class I've ever taken in my 4 years of university. Easy to understand, extremely low workload, interesting, and even useful. Dr. Walker is very entertaining and he explains the concepts so well that you don't even need the textbook to get an A+. I wish he taught in my faculty.
No Comments
a very interesting lecturer

Don't be fooled by these poor ratings! Dr. Walker is a great prof! He's very funny and smart. He comes up with all kinds of crazy examples and situations that really get you thinking. Generates great class discussion and always has something to add (without ever disclosing his own opinion). He always wears black, it's very mysterious. I'm intrigued
Nothing too special, but not terrible.

Taken as a summer course. Quizzes came up really fast (the first coming at the beginning of the third class) despite no lecturing. Quizzes and final never actually did link up with lecture topics, and reading materials were never discussed in class. Nice guy, interesting, but class was a waste of time.

I enjoyed having Mark as my professor and as a TA.  Bright, approachable, and very funny. Always willing to communicate with students, excellent at generating discussion in tutorials.  Hum 2C03 marred not by his lecture style, but by the vast number of inconsiderate students using cell phones while attending. Found he was amazingly patient with the

Worst prof I've ever had.  Not did most our class fail his way too hard tests, but he changed the whole testing process the next semester to make it easier!  People switched out of his class because he made no sense.  I wish I had
A terrible lecturer, as well as a mean individual.  I got NOTHING from the course, wish I had received my money back.  Who hires these people?

I only took the course because it's required, but I did learn a lot.  Unfortunately, everything I learned was from reading the text. Went to 4 lectures all semester and I'm still managing 80's with ease. Needs to ease up on the cheesy jokes and drug references, they don't make lectures interesting.

Fair prof.  I found him very funny and amazed at the number of students that simply don't get his humour. I've gotten over 80% on everything so far.  I don't find him particularly difficult.  Just go to lecture and listen and stop chatting with your friends.
Terrible professor. Simply talks/mumbles to himself during lectures. Also does not have any control over the class. The TA was way better.
Yes, the class is boring, and yes Mark is a mundane lecturer... but for those who actually LISTEN and pay attention in class, he is quite helpful. Tests are not easy, but he IS very fair.
No Comments
Mark was a cool guy, but this class was absolutely terrible. I did rather well in it, but having to sit through it 3 times a week killed me. Boring, boring, boring.
No Comments

poor public speaker, lessons straight out of text but harder to comprehend, never gave a straight answer to a question therefore leaving you more confused than ever, I did better in the class when I avoided the lectures and learned instead from the book and web exercises, very frustrating prof/class
Mark's always available if you need help, he's a better teacher when he's teaching one on one.
No Comments
No Comments

I think that Walker is really not suitable for this course. You can tell that it is not his area of passion. His nonchalant attitude in addition to the ultra boring content of the class are not a good combination. I would be interested to see how he teaches something that he actually cares about.
sarcasm sarcasm

I expected this class to be fairly easy, but it isn't. You will understand the lessons but the tests will confuse you. I was expecting a 90+ and ended up with a 65 on the first mid-term. Teaches about easy examples, not so much important ones that are tricky. Reminds me of Hugh Grant for some reason
i find Professor Walker very monotonous.  His lessons are unclear and he cannot back up his statments, which is ironic because he teached a class about arguments

comments: below average
I found him very interesting. He presented introductory concepts in ways that made me want to continue learning about them in detail. Exam breakdown was great and assignments were easy.

really nice guy...very approachable...seems very sweet. concise notes, w/good examples. Generally teaches course content so that it is interesting to learn. amazing exam breakdown!! Amazing web notes!! Recommend taking a course with him!
You can tell he loves his job and what he's talking about.

Dr, Knight is an excellent prof.  His explanations of concepts are very clear.  There was only one test second term, and one essay.  I found the essay easy to write and very interesting.  Makes me want to continue in sociology.

i was an arts & sci students years ago when i took his "media inquiry" class. a fantastic and erudite professor who inspires you to move beyond conventional thinking about social structures and media discourse. one of the best.
he is an amazing professor who is able to explain the concepts so well and then explain them again with an example...dont miss lectures because it remvoes the need for using the textbook!
Very nice man, approachable. Always an engaging class to go to. Plus hes got a soothing Aussie accent
Great prof!  Humorous and he does a good job applying material to every day life. Web notes were an excellent studying aid!  Favourite saying must be "part n parcel".
Good guy. Uses examples that make concepts easy to understand.
Excellent prof....very interesting and approachable...friendly and cares for his students...plus a good accent

GREAT PROF, makes you visualize the lectures in terms of your daily life. Great inspiration and very approachable. He Does say Sh*t alot, generally funny guy. You need to study quite a bit for his tests, but there really is no reason why you cant do well...very clear, and very interesting lectures.
Horrible, boring lectures. Least favourite prof of last semester
Great easy-going teaching style. Very approachable and fair. Excellent web-notes, HUGE help on the exams.
Very easy going and approachable. Passionate aboust subject area and seems to really care about students well-being. Great notes posted on the web- helpful on exams.
I found a little brutal to listen to the lectures, however he is a VERY fair man.  A very good prof!
Inspiring man. Hates sweatshops.
Prof Knight is a good guy.  I enjoyed his lectures. He says  part n parcel  alot. I enjoyed his course.  Great accent. Kinda cute.
Good guy, says the word  right  way too much, very repetitive!
most boring man alive... steer clear!
Great prof. Great guy. Great inspiration.
he rocks!
Friendly and approachable, but he is too repetative with easy material
Easy going guy accepts students opinions

comments: wonderful prof. one of the best lectures in the soc department. very VERY approachable and extremely interesting. takes the time to help you and really discuss your ideas with him

Hathaway was a great Prof.  He was always readily available in his office, and open to feedback.  His open-forum style of classes encouraged debate, and thus a lot of interaction occured.  The clarity yet flexible nature of his final papers was also awesome.
best prof ever.  he knows what he's talking about and is very knowledgable.  i am so sad he is leaving, and really jealous of his future students.
amazing guy, knows exactly what he is talking about and is a true prof. he doesnt spoon feed you the answers but he does point you to the right direction and makes sure u get there
He's a good lecturer; interesting and humourous. But I found him to be a horrible marker in 2C06. Stats on the otherhand was good, but math is not as subjective. Like him, not his essay marking.
Very helpful, i hate any type of math but he made stats interesting and not as hard as i thought it would be...great prof!!
I hate stats but he makes it ok! It really helps that he's hot..it turns boring material into excitement..because we can look at him. Very helpful prof!!
Good prof
He's a pretty laid back guy. Very unlike most profs I've ever encountered. Very interesting lectures...ones that you would attend even if you didn't have to.
Very interesting class and made it work for students because it was a summer class...oh yeah, the dude is HOT!!!  Finally some hot professors are showing up in the Sociology department
Good guy! Very interested in what he's teaching.

Professor Hathaway is an amazing professor!!!!  He is soooo hot that it is really hard to concentrate and he is soooo huge!!!!  You can totally tell that he works out a lot!!!!  He is a great teacher and every Sociology student should take his course!!!!
awesome!!!!
Great prof. Knows the material well and is very approachable.

Excellent! Very informative and down to earth prof. If you are willing to do the work, he will help you and point you in the right direction. Makes you come up with the answers yourself instead of spoon-feeding, but will direct you as best he can.
He is a really good professor.  Someone who can relate to people's dislike towards taking a full-year stats course and actually make it interesting and really easy to understand.
Likes to engage in the material through discussion which some people may dislike. Especially, if all they want are answers they can memorize, and then spit out.
No Comments

he can't lecture, poor personality, unfair, bad hair, square.
No Comments
Likes to do research, should never lecture.
One of the few professors on campus who actively encourages original thought

comments: without a doubt, the WORST professor i've ever had. lectures were long winded, and lacked any kind of interest. His adamant refusal to adapt to webct or post notes prove that he's ancient. loves the sound of his own voice, and no one elses. I had him his last semester teaching--he won't be missed.

Completely pompous ass. Loves the sound of his own voice. Needs to realize his course isn't the only one people are taking. Not clear or concise at all, goes off on random topics that don't relate at all. The only time I learned anything was when the TAs lectured. Complete waste of my time and money. Makes me hate a topic I used to be interested in

lectures are boring and incomprehensible. i never thought i would hate learning about early modern britain but he has made it possible. and a 5% test on the entire textbook? give me a break. when the TAs lecture you will actually learn something.

Wonderful, helpful and inspiring,  if you do your work and try he will recognize this.  If you are another faceless student who comes in late and doesn't give a**** about the class your low expectations will be met with low marks.  If you try, you will love the class.  Dr. Alsop is wonderful and is a treasure for the history department at Mac.

Hands down my favourite prof and course ever.  I can't say I was interested in his course at all before attending, but he changed my mind completely! He's clear, extremely helpful, a fair marker, and he obviously loves his line of research!  Take 4AA6 if you can, it's a great course with a great prof.

Sure, he's tough on people who don't care about the material.  But if you show an interest, he is extremely helpful, makes time to talk outside of class or by e-mail, and is very friendly.  I liked him and his class a lot.  He is so fun to listen to and enthusiastic about his topic.  I didn't find him mean or rude at all.

The absolute worse professor that I know of.  I have attended five universities and he is quite frankly the worst.  He is rude.  He shows no interest in the students.  He ignores those who are not his favourites.
I feel that he is pompous and rude. I think that he was a terrible professor and I regret having ever taken his class. I think he is an odd little man.

Perhaps he is unaware that walking out of the room, reading other material and appearing otherwise disinterested while students are speaking is rude.  He knows his material cold and is a good prof for those who work well under his teaching method.  "Throw you in - sink or swim".  If this method does not work for you don't take a course with him.

What a terrible prof. He would ramble on about meaningless material that didn't even pertain to the topic. The only time that was valuable was his own. He showed no regard for other students time at all. He was not clear or consise. He was completely unorganized.  And I'm sure he didn't complete the required material he was required to teach.

Dr. Alsop tends to live in his own little world. He tends to go on rants in the middle of a lecture. He also is an idalist who does not realize that with all the other work students are facing, its not possible to spend as much time on his course as he would like. I fortunatly was able to drop the course before it seriously damaged my marks.
awesome class, Dr.Alsop is the nicest guy and one of the best profs I've had so far. He is very approachable and nice. The content of the course is a bit to be desired though.

tried to take a seminar with him.  Absolutely terrible.  he likes listening to the sound of his own voice, goes off on tangents that don't relate to anything of the course and is completely useless.  I'm glad i dropped it when i did.
Good direction in topic choice, research areas
Awesome professor.

I took a British Social History course with Alsop back in '93, and I never understood why, of all my courses, I performed the worst in his (and I won two scholarships in History).  He has some interesting things to say, but, pedagogically, he needs to be clearer about what is required to succeed.

He is the inquiry MAN.  Throughout the term, it was THE MOST frustrating course.  It was always interesting, but sometimes overwhelming, but he was always a fun guy.  And now that it's all done, it was one of the best courses ever.

What a waste of time.  Alsop is the single worst prof I have ever had.  I'm not sure if I'm upset about the 400 dollars I paid for the class or the 30 hours of my live i'm never getting back!!!! A useless teacher.
A waste of time!
I liked him for the inquiry course.  I am glad that I had the opportunity to be in his class.
Don't know about his other classes but he in an excellent seminar teacher, makes the class fun, a hard thing to do when it is 2 hours long.
A semester of my life I'll never get back; worse than useless class

comments: The most surprising and interesting part of this class was the fact that some of the kids actually liked this man??? I swear this generation is down the drain and dushoff is leading the charge. He doesnt know how to pronounce niche and it was super annoying. But most importantly his midterm was hilariously unreasonable. Worse course ever, drop out.

i love him he's amazing. super straightforward, everything you need to know is laid out for you. clear, concise notes. lectures are fun just bc he's so funny (a kind of dry humour that I love). his tests are straightforward, honestly easy if you know your stuff.

He's kinda quirky but I like that about him. His notes are all very clear cut and his tests and exams are straight forward and to the point. His resources for testable content and exam review were literally on the exam as well. Fill in the blanks, read the outlines, do the reviews, and you will get at least an 80%. Trust me, I barely did a thing.
Hes there to help, but his lectures are so boring Midterm was f hard, nothing like what you would expect

Clear lectures and notes that are structured to help you succeed. Such a great prof, really entertaining. The only issue is that he gives long-winded answers to questions in class because he doesn't want to mislead you with an oversimplified answer.

Somewhat awkward prof, but that's what makes him interesting. The material is pretty straightforward and his lectures notes are very complete. Assignments are pretty easy if you know your material. Tutorials are optional and I found them to be quite useless. Study his notes and do the practice problems and this course should be an easy A+.
I am an engineering student who used to just sit in his lectures because I didn't want to walk to the library. Dushoff really made me consider switching into bio!

I took this course like 2 years ago and he was a funny prof but there were some really weird moments. For example, in one of the lectures, nobody could understand what he was saying and he was very frustrated so he ended the class like 20 min early lol. The course itself is boring though.
Great guy, very fair with his tests/marking, but his explanations leave me more confused than when I entered the class. Also his social awkwardness is hard to watch... he's just not meant to lecture.

Best prof I've had so far (I'm in third year now). What I liked best were his simple, short, and clear notes and how he only tested from them. His tests took just a couple hours to study for (including the exam)!

I used to love ecology, hated it after this class. Horrible at explaining concepts... I don't think the material would be difficult if he taught properly. And its not like I'm stupid, I have close to an 11 average and found it really difficult to understand his lectures. The TA's taught me everything.
Honestly, he's one of the funniest and most interesting profs i've met. Keeps classes entertaining and will help you out if you need it! Great Prof! Loved going to his lectures
Most interesting prof I've ever had in biology!
He was so cool! Great sense of humour & entertaining way of teaching. So loveable & his classes were always packed! You learned so much because he made the material interesting. Great notes.
really funny, not overly difficult, but definitely not an easy teacher.
awesome!

He is just a lovable adorable nerd. He doesn't complicate things. The material he taught was about the fungi, which was interesting itself, but he made it interesting. His tests are straight forward and from his notes, and he follows the textbook.
Great prof, very funny and he teaches class very well. You can always tell when a prof is bad because half the class will be missing but for Dr.Dushoff's classes, they were packed.
Simplifies information very well, makes classes funny and interresting even if the material is not too exciting to begin with. Excellent prof for a first year class.
very logical.. if your into that sorta stuff..
very laid-back

I really liked him as a prof. He doesnt expect you to read the textbook, but tells everyone to read it just becasue its cool. Is really laid back and has class games sometimes to get people involved. Good notes
He is definitely a very cool prof., addresses us with a Yo! The material isn't that interesting, but he gives us good notes and the textbook is barely used.

comments: Dr. Clark loves teaching and its very evident! But he is a really hard prof, his quizzes and exam was not easy but if you stay on top off your work, it shouldn't be too bad. I wouldn't recommend this course as an elective unless you really love english and are willing to dedicate a lot of time to it!

Dr. Clark is extremely engaging and for lack of a better word, truly inspirational.  Although he can be extremely wordy and off-track, even dodging his main point, his lectures feel more like life lessons than anything.  He will stare into your eyes and it seems as if he's seeing your soul.  Interesting man that is very knowledgeable.

Absolutely phenomenal professor. Hilarious and stirring. I missed his lecture once because of unforeseen reasons, and I was pissed. Although, I do wish he opened the floor and asked questions in-lecture.

If the English department was a political TV drama like House of Cards, Dr. Clark would killl it. He talks about his friendship with Henry Giroux, he wears a suit everyday. He looks into your eyes when he lectures and stirs something deep within your subconscious. Please don't take this lightly, the politics are deadly and the stakes high. Uh-ohhh.

Dr. Clark was very intimidating the first few lectures, but I secretly suspect it's a strategy to weed out the slackers; people who are afraid of his high standards will likely drop the class early, leaving only the people who are serious.  If you're struggling,  go to his office hours (prepared and caught-up) and he'll offer good guidance.

It's been several years since I've taken a class with Dr. Clark and he still stands out to me as one of THE most engaging professors I have ever encountered. He's not easy but he sure is worth the work.

He is honestly one of the most engaging professors I've ever had. While he has high expectations of his students it's totally worth it, believe me the hard work pays off! Incredibly passionate about what he teaches and provides clear/helpful guidelines about what he is looking for in order to succeed.
Suuuuuuch an awesome professor!! Clark is my favourite prof I've ever had... definitely recommend his course... but his classes are definitely ones you HAVE to attend - take one of his courses!!

Dr. Clark has been by far my favourite English prof at Mac. His interpretations of texts are so alive and engaging, it really shows how much passion he has for the subjects he teaches. He's very helpful outside of class, and so long as you do the readings, attend class and make use of the extra material he offers online you should have no problems.

Dr. Clark is the kind of professor you suspect writes favourable reviews of himself on ratemyprofs.com. If there was ever a word that summed up a man so succinctly, that word is "unctuous" for Dr. Clark.

He was the hardest English prof I have had, but I respect him for it. On the first day he told the class that he expected us to be on top of things, and that he would be hard. Very passionate professor who, although I struggled with the course, I loved his teaching. I never met a professor who seemed to care as much as he does.

Very demanding and intimidating...expect that every point you make will be challenged. That said he was a very interesting prof who changed the way I think about many issues...and he marks much more easily then you'd expect based on his demeanor in class. Overall a fantastic, but slightly terrifying, prof.

Love this man. If you are in English because you really love ENGLISH, then this is the course for you. This is the prof that inspires you, the one you'll remember. He's not an easy marker, but it ain't all easy.
No Comments

I took four different classes with Clark, and he really made me think; his critical theory courses are tremendously stimulating.  That said, I am not crazy about him.  He has a mysterious chip on his shoulder, and his self-righteousness is incredibly alienating.  Even so, I recommend his classes.

I loved the class; Clarks passion for the material was inspiring.What I didn't appreciate was the arbitrary marking schemes,his attempts to intimidate.i think i have a love/hate relationship to this man.while i am perhaps a more critical thinker because of him, my selfesteem took quite a blow:( haha

After a decade, this is still my favourite prof. H knows so much, you feel like you're getting your tuition's worth.He's not an easy marker, but he makes up for it by making lectures interesting, inspiring and worthwhile.
Arrogant, silly man. Too full of himself to really know anything. Likes to use big words to hide lack of knowledge. Does not answer questions.
Arrogant, self-important attitude, not very approachable.
you guys crazy?  David Clark was rude, intimidating, and condescending.  I've never seen such student antipathy towards a prof as I did (and felt) in this class.
fabulous professor - intimidating yet inspirational. makes you want to put in the effort. makes you aspire to be a better, smarter person. TAKE HIS CLASSES - they'll change you for the better.
The most important class I've ever taken.   Good prof  fails to do justice to this brilliant man.  (Though I know what he would say about these ratings things.)
Each course of his should be mandatory.
Clark is an amazing prof but EXTREMELY intimidating!  You'll learn alot from him
Very encouraging prof.  He expects a lot from you, but gives everything!
Intense, meaningful course.  Never intimidating. (My classmates are whiners...)
NOT intimidating, but inspiring. So glad I took this course!
Plenty of hard work will often get you nowhere, too intimidating to be effective
Phenomenol Intelligence and sexy eyes
Scary, challenging, exciting.  Will I ever be this smart?  Thanks Dr. Clark!
Best prof ever! (Why aren't the rest of my profs this good?)
Extremely talented teacher.  Beautiful eyes.
Full of wisdom; beautifully crafted lectures.  Wow.
My big fat theory course!  Clark is the best prof ever!
Never had a prof as dedicated or passionate as this guy.  Take this course!
Best Prof at Mac!!  If you work hard you can learn tons from this guy!
Compelling and complex thinker.  Energetic and engaging teacher.
Absolutely fabulous
Remarkable teacher
animated, narcissistic, egotistical, and generally an overachiever
Brilliant Prof....and considerate of students.
A demanding but extraordinarily talented professor.  Expect to be challenged!
Demands the best from you as any good professor should. Thanks for everything.
Very theatrical; lectures interesting; talks too much at times
One of those few people you meet who actually makes a difference in your life
Seems to be forwarding his  hidden agenda ...just look at the course material.
Ego matched only by his ability to be less comprehensible than his subject matte
unimaginative overachiever who believes hygiene will conceal his mediocrity

comments: Lectures were clear and organized. Textbook material was very similar to lectures. Exams were tough but straightforward.
This was a very interesting class. The lectures were very clear. It was evident that the prof enjoyed the material.
Great prof!
He is a great professor. Very helpful and knowledgeable about the subject - always answers questions effectively. Really awesome and interesting class!
He is a great professor. Very helpful and knowledgeable about the subject - always answers questions effectively. Really awesome and interesting class!
I believe Dr. Rutherford changed her name to Mel, and is actually identified as a male now. I know.. The entire class was confused too.
Very bad prof. I dont recommend her at all. Her lectures are pretty good, but her exams are very very hard, esp the midterms.
I agree. Water under the bridge.
Interesting Material.
Dude, Social Psychology was 4 years ago. You got a bad mark. Get over it. Move on.
She was really tough. The course sounds so easy. "Social Psychology". Her exams were B.R.U.T.A.L.

SHE IS THE WORSTEST PROFESSOR IN THE WHOLE WORLD. She thinks Social Psychology is a Science. She is FAR from reality. She lives on another planet if she thinks that nuisance called Social Psychology is a science!!!
The worst psychology professor I have ever had. She was very unfair.

I totally agree with some of the previous comments made for this prof. Her tests are extremely difficult. Worded tricky and she makes things harder then necessary. A psychology degree gets a student nowhere in life so she needs to realize that. My other friend graduated from Psych and she works at B Rail all day.

She is the most unfair prof in Psych. If you study honestly you will get a poor grade most certainly if you are not a genius. If you cheat you will do well. She is a terrible prof overall who writes unreasonably hard tests for students. Psych is PURE garbage. A psych degree gets you a job at Macdonalds or Burger King for 8 dollars/hr, nothing more.
Great class. Great Prof. Fun and funny and interesting.
Awesome Prof. Very friendly. Great lecturer. Tests aren't easy, but straight forward. Study and you'll do well.

As a lecturer, she is very good. She involves the class, and the lectures are pretty interesting. She gives examples in class that aren't in the textbook. Unfortunately, the exam didn't really reflect the main concepts. There were obscure references to the text (like a question on an intro section about aliens) rather than focusing on main ideas.

Ridiculous. Too lazy to write her own tests, questions are clearly out of teacher's guide. Doesn't test understanding; rather tests memorizing. Insult to teachers everywhere. Advice: to be good at Psych 2C03, memorize every meaningless statistic and other arbitrary phrases in textbook. They will definitely be tested.

She is a really good prof in terms of lecturing. Her slides are very not detailed, so you have to come to lecture to understand them. Her tests on the other hand are a different story- I found them way to detailed and hard, extremely based on the book. Class average was in the low 60's. Interesting course- but hard to get a good mark.

Hard, extremely unfair tests, brutal beyond words, the textbok is a breeze, but the tests are something else--watch out for the 2nd midterm particularly. prof has no office hours, doesnt give her email addres on the course outline. it's social psych--a stupid dumb arts course, lame lame stuff, not a science course. She thinks psych is a science LOL
Best Prof ever.
You must attend class to pass the tests. Very misleading because the material seems easy but is not tested 'easy.' Very difficult to get a 10.

oh maan she is SOO tough...her midterms are killer...it's such a lame course "SOCIAL PSYCH" ewwwww.....it's not a science type of course. Avoid this prof if you can. Her final exam is straighforward though, I'm gonna be honest here. Brutal tests, fair final exam.

omg slowwwwww down plz!!! the rate at which she was speaking at was incompresensible and the review provided by the student t.a's was also very hard to comprehend..the prof is hard, and doesn't make the course easy...the midterm and final, i suggest u study, otherwise you'll fail she makes the questions very closely related so pay attention!
Really great class. Really great prof. Take it if you get a chance!!
Interesting material but not always presented in the most interesting fashion. Very helpful teacher with a genuine interest in helping you do well. Would recommend.
hard class, but great teacher

Thought the course was really interesting and enjoyed every class! She was very clear in lecture and gave many examples! I would recommend this class with Dr. Rutherford to anyone! Midterms were also fair and tested the material well.
Awesome. Clear. Interesting. Great Demos.

Not helpful and not very nice when you send her email. Never writes Hi, Bye, nothing. When I emailed her, I got the impression like she didn't want me to email her. Her lectures were quiet interesting so I must give her 5 for clarity.

Fairly interesting course. Final exam is easier than the tests as long as you did the readings and went to all lectures. Prof never offered to help at all so it's hard to rate her on helpfulnes. The start of every lecture is like this "Paul's office hours" "Elliott's office hours" What about profs?

She gives you a cumulative final exam containing the whole damn book and it's only worth 32% of the final mark. She lacks basic logic. Why does she have to give the whole book on the exam if it's only worth equal to a test? She never even posted solutions to the midterms.
not a bad prof, but there was lots of reading to do. You have to remember an awful lot of information which is the whole book.
She made me want to switch majors!  Great prof!
She was hard, but clear.  Good lecturer.

I found this prof to be quiet boring. This course is certainly not easy, even though it looks easy. Everything looks like common sense, but the tests and exams are quiet hard. I think Elliott Beaton (the guy who was TA last semester and prof this semester) can do a better job teaching it.

She was by far one of the best profs I've had so far.  Her lectures were always interesting and her examples helped ALOT.  I think the people complaining are the people who didn't show up to class.  She favours the people who go to class.  Seriously, she was a great prof! Clear, fair, and funny too.
Nice lady. Very good lecturer.

1. Terrible experience 2. She gives boring and useless handouts everyday and gives you like couple of minutes to finish them 3. She never gave her e-mail add to the class (not listed on the course handout) and no office hours  4. Brutally hard tests/exams. This course is SUPPOSED TO BE VERY EASY!

Here's how it goes: The first midterm was mediocre in level of difficulty (still towards the harder side) The second midterm was VERY hard and most people's marks dropped big time. Her exams are MUCH harder than the practice questions on the course textbook website. She lectures a bit fast as well.

What are people on?! Her midterms have been EASY so far.  Ambiguous?  Just ask the T.A.s to clarify for you and they will!  She is a great prof! I don't read the text before class yet I still understand everything!
Her tests are challenging.

Her exams are incredibly difficult, with very few questions and they are worth so much. Most of the questions are worded very ambigously, the exam has very few straightforward questions. She doesn't even have office hours. Always tells you to go to the TA's Paul or Elliot if you need help.
Some of the questions were worded in a tricky manner
Hard mid-term...Focusses on very specific details from the text.
The exams should be longer than just 40 multiple choice!
Awesome Prof - supplementary info every class!  Tons of examples - attend lecture and you'll do great!!!
Really, really fun class. Great lectures. Entertaining Prof.
Hurray! Loved the class. Loved the Prof
Very good lecturer, gives clear answers to questions, tests are straight from the text.
Really funny and creative teacher. Snappy dresser too!

comments: This is the guy you think of when you first thought of a university professor; arrogant, loud mouthed, cuts you off constantly, and has impossibly high essay standards.  But man was he great.
Amazing lecturer!
Horn was my boy.   Talked about swamp donkeys.  Marty was the man.

Dr. Horn has great lectures, which he is definitely known for. He's so knowledgeable and that definitely shows in class. He's a very tough grader.  My issue with Dr. Horn was that he was very unapproachable. I am a student with a disability and he seemed very annoyed to accommodate and was doing so bc Mac forces profs to. I didn't feel respected.

Good storyteller, but you can't expect less from a prof who teaches the same thing every year. Does minimal work as a lecturer. Very unapproachable outside of class and doesn't provide lecture notes. Automatically gives out zeroes without reading 12 page essays by referring to ambiguous citation rules that he does not care  to elaborate on.
Fantastic lecturer who made War in the West one of the most interesting, informative courses I have taken. Each class was like he was telling a story. Very charismatic.

Dr. Horn is extremely knowledgeable in history and is a good teacher, but this has made him very arrogant. He regularly insults the class without appearing to notice it. His lectures are good, but they are very fast paced so it is best to use a laptop to take notes in his class. He is also a hard marker and his handwriting is incomprehensible.

Excellent lecturer, old-school style and doesn't try getting students involved (will answer questions, but leaves discussions for tutorial.) Take thorough notes, attend class, and you'll succeed.  Not an easy marks class, but marks are fair and supported.  Very approachable during office hours.

Dr Horn is a great lecturer, and a very talented orator. He is very passionate about what he teaches, and imparts his knowledge and his perspective in his field while in lecture. He doesn't use avenue to learn, so lectures are mandatory. Great course, high marks in this course are hard to attain due to his standards. Still learned a lot

I absolutely love Dr. Horn! Very passionate lecturer, knowledgeable, and inspiring. I looked forward to his class every week! Attendance was mandatory if you wanted to do well, but it was well worth it! Amazing prof, simply amazing. He makes McMaster proud!

Dr. Horn is one of the best professors at McMaster. Attendance is mandatory if you want to do remotely well but by the end of the course you will walk away with a so much amazing knowledge about the topic.
Best professor I've ever had! Fascinating, highly intelligent, and very good looking :)
Amazing prof!! He inspired me to major in history! Great lecturer and very passionate.
Very good lecturer. Tough marker, but pretty fair
I wish I got my degree in history, or a at least a minor
extremely intelligent, easy to follow, detail oriented and hot :)
Great lecturer!  A bit intimidating to talk to face to face, but great class overall!

Friendly, organized, helpful, intelligent. Knows what hes talking about and lectures are extremely clear. Marks were too much determined by TAs, which is frustrating because they are often hard markers. Wish he would have told us a little more about the exam prior to writing it. But he is so friendly, helpful and clear -would love to have him again
very good and very interesting
AWESOME Lecturer! Easy to follow along. Keeps class interesting. Never once did i look at the time to see when class was over!
He totally knows what he's talking about.

He knows what he's talking about and it comes through in his lectures. He's entertaining and funny but still manages to end at just the right time, leaving you with a feeling of knowing and understanding everything he has talked about.
interesting, prof, great speaker, doens't use power point.
Exceptionally organized lectures (50 min on the dot) and never boring. He seems intimidating but 1 on 1 he's very nice and helpful. His TAs are ruthless, however.

The man is jovial, and energetic. Unfortunately, that energy tends to result in him going off on tangents or spending 15 minutes on a concept that could be dealt with in 5. Everyone complaining about him being a hard marker should know that a) his TAs mark the majority of the papers, and b) a competent argument/grammar will yield an easy A-.
If you want a professor who is going to challenge you, then take a course with Prof. Horn.  I was never bored during his lectures.

The most interesting prof, but exams are hard, and essays are ripped apart.  He does seem to have this WAY about him...that can keep you listing with undivided attention for 50 minutes...He is serious, but knows when to throw in a joke or two...You can't NOT take a Horn class or three...
Any class with Dr.Horn will screw you over. He's a great lecturer, but he is not helpful and he has the worst TAs ever! Beware!

Easily the most interesting history course i have taken at mac and it was all because of him. He is so knowledgable but at the same time knows how to have fun with jokes, off topic conversations when need to. he is a phenomenal lecturer and i wish i could have taken more of his courses.
why do you think we call him Dr. Horney? He is the love of my life, he's really funny and he actually makes me interested in history. TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM!

Horn is the greatest gift known to man since Prometheus stole the flames from the gods of Mount Olympus for pathetic mortals. Perhaps, Martin Horn IS a god, gracing us with his divine presence. I do not know, yet I know this, his methos is legendary, the blitzkrieg of of intellectual force that will dawn upon you will likely cause intense histeria.
Horn is hands down the best hitory prof I've ever had. I take classes I don't even care about, just because he's teaching them. He knows everything! Greatest prof ever.
I hated his class. He is extremely arrogant and does not care at all about first years.

Best history prof ever. Super nice. Great lecturer. I never skip a class. He's always easy to talk to and more than willing to help. He loaned me a bunch of articles and recommended a bunch of books for a paper I had to write for his class. You really have to deserve your A's from him.
Horn was one of the best history teachers i had! He was clear and had interesting lectures. I absolutly loved the sweaters he wore! He was like Bill Cosby. A very cool dude.

His lectures do not correlate with the readings very well. His explanations can be vague. He's not very approachable. I don't know if he is a ard marker because I had a TA. Overall, i didn't think he cared too much about his first year lectures.

The man is brilliant.  His style is perfect.  He knows everything.  Generally, the people who don't like him are simply complaining because of their marks.  He's one of the reasons I love my programme as much as I do :)

Never appreciated him until now.  He has deadlines for his undergrads AND his grad student TAs to mark assignments.  We could always expect our assignments back in two weeks. Grad students weren't given preferential treatment just because they were grad students that had a lot of work to do.
thank god someone else sees reality.  a very smug, self-satisfied instructor.
a pompous boob.  if he's handsome, mike harris is a socialist.
A good class and a good lecture. I too never missed a class.
HORN IS THE FREAKING MAN. If you like his style check out Leeson and Swett. They are all amazing profs.

Hot but hard.  Oh and for the record, I DID like history before 2S03 and I did attend every lecture. Don't put down people just because they don't share your views. Dr. Horn is a very demanding prof and I have no clue why so many people place him on a pedestal.  He's a fast and average lecturer.

Anyone who says dr.horn is a bad prof obviously a)doesnt like history or b)doesnt go to class.  Albeit he gives people a lot of bad marks, but in many cases, they deserve it.  He believes strongly in writing and i think this will help many people later on.  Incredible lectures and very helpful!
Horn is hot! whew, no one can deny that. He's also one of the most intelligent beings i've come across EVER. i didn't know one mind could hold so much knowledge. Amazing.
Amazing lectures. His style & content are unmatched in the History Department at Mcmaster. He makes class very interesting, so I look forward to going. It also helps that he is quite handsome, too.
Best lecturer in the university but also the hardest. The first day of class hearing the comment "a C is a good mark in my class" made me soil myself

Great Prof, one of the best in the history department! Very helpful to his students, sometimes seems intimidating by others but once you talk to him, you don't want to stop!!!! And...well, he's just plain gorgeous!!!!
Amazing lectures, presents information well, speaks well and without knows.  He's also very approachable, and helpful.
Great prof.  Dense lectures, worthwhile class. Carries himself well.  Knows stuff.
Dr. Horn is an amazing lecturer.  He knows his stuff so well and i always have at least 4 pages of notes!  Horn rules!
let's not lie, he's just freaking HOT! great teacher too, amazing knowledge of history : )

WOW...how can one person contain so much knowledge?! Its amazing what he knows. Makes lectures interesting but your hand starts to hurt from taking so many damn notes! Up side: very easy on the eyes ;)

Dr. Horn is one of the most compelling lecturers that I have heard. I look forward to going to his class because of the way he lectures. Unlike many of my other classes you never once look at the clock...you don't have time.
No Comments
Horn is one of the best professors ever.  Solid guy, really knowledgable about every single aspect of European History and his lectures are really compelling.

By far one of the best Profs that i have ever had.  He is clear and intelligent and knows what he is teaching.  His ability to hold ones interest is staggering and thus i would say that whatever class he is teaching is well worth the time to be in.
One of the best lecturers I've had thus far. He speaks with such a passion, it's hard to see where the work ends and the man begins. His lecturing is captivating.

Now this is uni.My commerce classes are so boring &this class is AMAZING.I love the way he knows so much.He makes quick connections & explains history with such a passion that it is the only class that I dont fall asleep in.I wish all classes were like th
Speaks way too fast.  Gives too much to read.  Other than that... I guess he's not that bad.  Hard though.

If you like this guy's lectures you're a huge nerd who loves writing notes for an hour straight.  He is probably the most knowledgeable prof in the school, but marks far too hard and is super boring.  I will no longer take history b/c of him.

Dr. Horn is by far the most organized, knowledgable, and interesting professor I've ever had. I agree with the swashbuckling person - and he is a very intense guy. I will take history classes next year as long as he teaches them!
No Comments
I would not be at all surprised if Dr. Horn where in fact some sort of immortal being and was both present and partially responsible for every watershed event in history.
An amazing proff, seems to be someone who does not belong in this century.  Seems he would fit better as a swashbuckling privateer, raiding the enemies of the English Empire.
swashbuckling ****
Amazing Prof.  A little intimadating, but is very passionate and knows so much about history its almost scary.
I take 5 pages of notes for every Horn lecture. He covers SO MUCH MATERIAL I found the readings to be pointless, my notes covered more. He DOES speak quickly, but after a few minutes you adapt.
By far my favourite professor - engaging lectures that are well organized and very well delivered. The level of difficulty is balanced out by his amazingness.
By far the best prof I've had at Mac. Amazing lecturer, kept me 100% interested in every lecture and I didn't find the speed a problem. Horn is the reason to take History at Mac!
Goes through the material a bit too fast.  Not a bad teacher though.
Talks too fast. Uses huge words, otherwise, he works well with the material he has to teach.
110% MAN

Marking is a bit on the tough side. His side stories and discussion are not to be missed. His concentration on tactics and strategy are a refreshing change from the standard direction of such courses. His skills as an orator keep one transfixed!Just great
So enjoyable.  An amazing lecturer and a fair marker -- you just gotta know your stuff and work hard.  Absolutely one of the BEST!!
Speaks way too fast, yet is very passionate about history.  A great Prof.

My favourite proff from first year.  Well him, and one other who I can't remember.  Anyway, Dr. Horn had the most entertaining and most comprehensive lectures all year, and I loved how comfortable he was. Although a hard marker, you either learn, or fail.
Best speaker, lectures are hard to keep up with, but organized tightly, best dressed, a bit cockey, hard marker...only class I attended without fail..nuff said.
Good teacher, very knowledgable and clear, enthiuastic speaker.  Sign up for his class, best history prof at mac.
Great speaker, favorite class of the term, kinda cute too
Meh  at best. Overly obsessed with war and money.
No Comments
Dr.Horn is a very good speaker. I actually listened to his lectures and enjoyed going to class. Essay time is stressful...He is very tough. Good luck getting an A in this class.
Notice he gets apprehensive when instructor evaluation sheets go around?
Lectures are packed with good info.  However, the marking is a bit rough.
very condescending/smug and a hard marker but sorta funny,good speaker
good lectures, essay grading rough in class
Bases work/exam on textbook facts while lectures consist of bizarre anecdotes.
Professor is godlike.  Smartest professor around.  Tough, but fair.
technicalities over content
No Comments
Fabulous lectures-the only class I could stay awake in!!
Inspiring lectures that were both informative and spectacular.
Great lecture style!  Very cute!
very good looking .....
No Comments
Excellent lecure style
Good lectures, kept it interesting. ... good looking man =P
Excellent lecturer, well organized, very hard marker
No Comments
No Comments
Excellent professor, great orator, lots of knowledge
No Comments
Horn can talk the talk and walk the walk. He is a walking textbook. Cute too!
He was the only man who could get me up for a 9am lecture

comments: He was tough but I have respect for him because he treated students with courtesy and tried to be fair

He rocked! Too bad he has moved. His lectures were very interesting! He sometimes would rush through the lectures but his slides were detailed. Memorizing the slides and attending lectures was good enough to do well although the material was really interesting and I ended up learning a lot more then I expected. Wish he was still at mac!
Great teacher, caring and very very fair. Approachable and extremely helpful. Friendly guy and motivated students to do well and never stop learning.

he makes the course interesting,very helpful,wants students to think,exams are tough like most psych courses,study the lecture notes thoroughly u will do fine.gives away alot of exam questions and free marks.he has a passion for what he teaches.i would have loved to have him as a prof again but too bad he is moving:(

VERY interesting course...however don't expect a good mark unless you go to class and read the text..Test involve multiple choice,short answer,and short essay questions. Very enthusiastic prof and keeps the class fun..he does tend to go off on a tangent at times..

really interesting course if you are into neuroscience. Elliott is really funny and enthusiastic, and cares about what he is doing and his students. His tests are hard but fair- just need to study in detail. If I could, I'd love to have him again.

This course is a little bit more science based than other psych courses, but for those who enjoy that, its a great course. Elliott is very enthusiastic and has a great sense of humour, he warns his students that the test will be detailed. So come to lecture, read the text book, study in detail, and you'll do great.

This guy reallly sucks. DONOT take any course taught by him ever. Run far from him. He teaches way more extensively than the regular prof Dr.Decatanzaro, he is wayyy tougher..He says you are responsible for everything in the book regardless of whether he mentioned it in clas. Get a life u loser, it's only psych, a lame ARTS program, not a science
GET TO THE POINT. WE BEG YOU.

In 5 years time,  he'll be next Dick Day - Elliott's brilliant, but definitely does love to ramble off on tangents; if you can stick with him you learn a lot more than you'd expect. He made a neuroendocrinology class exciting. It's difficult subject matter, but you CAN do well if you work hard. I thought I'd hate this class but wound up loving it.
Nice guy, good prof, puts lot of effort into teaching.
One of the best professors I have come across till now. If you work hard you'll do well in his class.
Helpful and friendly prof. Gives interesting lectures.
i can't stand sitting in this class for 3 hrs, he is so vain and loves to talk way too much. material is really easy and fairly interesting.
Excellent
meh.  Nothing special.  Girls just think he's hot.

I had him as a TA last semester.  He sucked.  He had way too many notes, got off track ALOT, and people would literally groan when he would lecture so fast! He got side tracked alot and I remember he een gave someone the wrong definition once! Dr. Rutherford kicked ass and MANY people would agree.
No Comments
No Comments
He is much tougher than Dr. DeCatanzaro
He's a really good lookin guy and he explains stuff very clearly
No Comments
Amazing prof. Most good looking prof I've ever had. His class was a lot of fun. Took his course in the summer. Exams were fair

Elliot seems nice and all, but he says Social Psych is tough if you talk to him. HOW WRONG! He should say that the PROF is tough, her exams are harder than necessary. I wish Elliot taught the whole course. I enjoyed his lecture on Culture, Reproduction, and Evolution the most in the entire course.
Elliot ur hot
Very enthusiastic teacher. Great class.
Very nice and cares about students success.
No Comments

comments: An absolutely wonderful professor! I openly admitted to her that the 17th Century was my least favourite time period to study and she swore I would want to read more by the end of the course. I am already enjoying the readings! The course demands attendance and participation to understand the content and she is very helpful to those who try!

What a joke this class is. She has favorites and they all put up their hands and she talks to them only. It feels like highschool. Hard to believe this is a University class. She's really really nice, but she comes across as really naive and her class, lets be honest.. is a huge joke. You know when your mom tries to be cool and witty, but fails? he
Smart, funny, invites discussion, helpful if you approach her. One of best profs in department.

You know when your mom tries to be cool and witty, but it really just sort of annoying and embarrassingly unfunny -  That's her class...  She'll help if you ask, but otherwise she sticks to her favourties and ignores the rest.

Very pleasent to be around. I think she really understood her students, and encouraged paying attention to her discussions rather then scrambling to take word for word notes. However classes became dull and repetitive, and we quickly fell behind schedule. All in all a great woman and an adequate prof.

Professor Silcox is great! She makes her lectures fun, and ensures that everyone in attendance has a very thorough understanding of the plays. She's a little scattered, but I think it stems from her passion for the subject. I genuinely enjoyed her teaching.

Dr. Silcox is an amazing prof. It is well worth your while to take any class she is teaching. She is hilarious, and super approachable. She's very witty and often puts a modern twist on some of her Shakespearean references, which is very helpful. She's great!

She's a great prof! Great sense of humour, excellent rapport with students. She's very into the course materials and class discussion which makes her fall behind schedule, but you'll love her for it b/c you'll know Henry IV like the back of your hand (and, more importantly, enjoy it).

She's really nice and approachable, BUT her lectures can be dull because she goes line by line and asks superficial questions.  You can easily get a good mark in her class, but if you want to learn, be stimulated and think deeper about literature, take another course.

Participation mark forces students to make uninformed pithy comments each lecture simply for the sake of receiving a mark. Shakespeare's plays are not analyzed, students are simply told exactly what is occuring in each scene, as if she is reading from Coles Notes.

Her sarcasm is stupendous and she's got a quirky sense of humour.  She makes sure you understand absolutely every detail of the texts.  She's very helpful, approachable and friendly, and shows a genuine affection for her students.  Great at creating an atmosphere where you feel comfortable expressing your ideas.
I think people are mistaking her wit for her craziness.  Great with students, but a hard marker.  I've got my lowest marks in her classes.
Take any class she offers. It's worthwhile. Funny, excellent lecturer, sarcastic enough to scare off people willing to be scared. Overall an incredible teacher.

Once she warms up to the class, Dr. Silcox will give you the best learning experience available at Mac.  She is funny and incredably intelligent.  She makes sure you understand everything, and questions are always encouraged.  Take any course she is teaching!

I adore her as a prof. She makes the topics we cover undeniably interesting, making cute jokes once in while for comic relief. In addition, she constantly challenges her students to better themselves both intellectually and academically. Thanks for being so great!

A smart prof, with effective teaching styles and good covering of course materials.  Very approachable.  She has a sarcastic wit which may scare some people off, but should be taken as it is - a way of creating humour even when dealing with tough material.  Good times.
Dr. Silcox is one of my fav profs at Mac thus far. She's able to make 16th century lit interesting!  Wow!
Excellent professors and a very nice person...makes cute jokes...has a tendancy to fall behind schedule, and have to rush some things, but overall she is great!
This is my second class with Professor Silcox, and she is one of my favourites. She's brilliant, ironic and sassy! Extremely approachable, and loves to hear the opinions of students.
I love this women!!!!  So intelligent, so kind and so funny.  She can make anything interesting!!!
Best prof I've had as of yet. Complete package...wit and interesting.
who cares whether the rolling stone gathering moss is good or bad.  useless
Wish I took her earlier on! The best Mac has to offer!
she is helpful
I have a total mind-crush on this professor - brutal and benevolent all at once!
