comments: Great lecturer. The only class I really looked forward to. Course itself was also pretty easy. If you ever have a question you can easily just ask her and she'll clarify everything.

She was an incredible professor! Every single one of her lectures were clear and easy to follow. She also goes slow in order to ensure that everyone can keep up. Finally she's incredibly caring and always willing to answer questions and clarify concepts. Would definitely recommend!

Her lectures are amazing. She is very friendly and I really enjoy being in her class. She prepares you for the midterms and tries her best to answer all the questions in tutorials. 10/10 would take again (actually, I am taking a course with her again!!!)
Soooo Goooooddd

Erin is an extremely sweet and friendly prof, and super accessible outside class. I would end up having wholesome conversations about life and university in general in her office hours. She really cares about her students and inspired me to go for a minor in Math. Her grading criteria is very fair and clear. 3 tests (worst one dropped) and 1 final.

Great course and apt professor... very knowledgeable and loves to pull some jokes too  " when preparing for tests, know your limits and study in definite intervals" ... would definitely love to take future courses with her ! TIP: do your assignments and old practice tests ! they truly help and if you abandon doing them altogether- then good luck..

She seemed like a nice person, but I did not find her to be a great prof. She was good because she tried to make students do well. I did not like the weekly assignments because they were very hard to keep up with doing 3-4 each week, and I found the exam/assignment questions to be 9000x harder than lecture content

Erin Clements is great. She really knows her stuff and can make even the most boring aspects of math fun, especially for scared first year students. Her grading is very fair and she will do everything she can to ensure you get a great mark. 1F03 is a lot easier than 1LS3, but having her as a prof for both made the transition very easy.

Dr Clements is a very good professor. She knows a lot about mathematics and makes things easy to understand, especially for first year students who might be nervous about moving up to university level. She is very kind in her grading, giving multiple grading scheme options to get the best mark possible. Her lectures are lively and fun.
Dr. Clements is a great prof who is very approachable. Her lectures were never boring (even though its math), and she explains concepts very well.

Did alot of examples in class , don't skip class ! Make sure to do all the Assignments, Lecture Examples because they will be very similar to the questions given on the Midterms and Final Exam. Great Prof !

Awesome teacher, very friendly and approachable.  If you ever don't understand or need to work an idea out in your head you can bounce ideas off her.  She likes talking with students, and she likes to help out when she can.  If you can take a course with her, probably worth it.

She was fantastic. She works at a manageable pace in class and allows one to take great notes to refer back to when studying for tests. 2 midterms were easy, 1 was tough but doable, exam was a bit weird with a lot of application. Overall, she boosted my confidence in my ability to do well in math. Ended up with an A+ in the course.
My advice to you is to attend the lectures and to pay attention during them. You literally will not pass the course if you do not.
Only professor I've ever had that always knew the answer to every question asked by students.

Great prof, always very clear and able to answer questions. Funny and laid-back. Makes all the content understandable. Tests are tough - make sure you study lots. Definitely reasonable to get a 10+ in the course if you try.

She's such a great prof. If you take the time to go to her office hours, you can see how much she genuinely cares for her students. She helped me get my mark higher by going over any concepts I did not understand. She is also a great person overall, she was my first ever prof in University and by far my favourite. Thanks for everything Clements !
What an amazing human being. Despite not getting the best mark, she truly cares about each one of her students and will do whatever it takes to help you get your desired mark.
Amazing lectures geared towards learning (and even enjoying) basic calculus! Hated math in high school... love it now - might take more math courses in the future.

Dr Clements is an excellent teacher! She *does* teach for understanding, she tells you exactly how to think about something rather than just memorize it. Now that I'm taking other math courses, I see how good her lectures were. Some things in math are techniques and rules, but still you need to understand what they are about.

I personally don't like her as a professor. She's a really nice person. However, she does not know how to teach. She teaches is a style that is more memorization she never explains her math, and when she does she explains it more this is the way is it method. Piece of advice for future students, Im not the only one that felt this way.

She's energetic, and her smiles make class enjoyable. She's super kind and helpful with even the most simple of questions (which sometimes got annoying, since she would make SURE the person who asked understood before moving on). The exam was worth either 40 or 90%, whatever gave you a higher mark. She's also hilarious with tech (pen, anyone?).

other than my self esteem because she's so frigggin hot this prof helped me solo much in this course her lectures were very clear and she's such sweetheart. VERY clear about what will be on tests and VERY understanding

Math 1F03 is a class for those who have not completed grade 12 calculus. I am NOT a math person, but Clements made me enjoy AND do well in math. She's sweet, funny, and always willing to clarify concepts. Her lecture slides are fill-in-the-blank style and crystal clear. If you have to complete the grade 12 equivalent, I highly recommend her.

i loved erin!! she is so sweet and understanding of the fact that not everyone is a "math person." her lectures move at a good pace and she is very clear. she is willing to accommodate students and genuinely wants to see students succeed
Best Prof at Mac, also the best looking, hard 9
She's one of the nicest and prettiest professors at McMaster. I've only been in the class for 3 weeks, and I love her.
best prof at mac, make sure you take her for 1st year calc, the most amazing prof i have ever had, seriously, learned alot, and good marks
Favourite math course I've ever taken.
great prof! made me love math
Definitely the best math prof ever! Super kind and understanding and all her notes are extremely clear...even if you aren't a math person, you can do well

She was the sweetest! Definitely was a surprise walking into my first lecture and seeing such a young professor teaching math. And don't let her age fool you, because she definitely knows the material. She's so kind and answered questions well. Although sometimes she did move very quickly, if you asked, she would slow down the pace. Wonderful prof!

Her class was my absolute favorite last semester. She was very nice and often had a joke or two. While being cheerful and nice, she's also determined to see you do well and does an excellent job at teaching concepts, clarifying misconceptions, and is extremely relatable on a youthful level. She's young and loves her job, love her passion for math!
best prof i had in 1st year, every math prof should be like her

I absolutely love Erin- she's such an amazing teacher and really cares about her students. Her lectures are great and she does lots of examples. She's also very honest about what is important to study for tests, so that was very helpful!
She was awesome! Very clear, very good prof. No tricks on the tests/exam - very fair. I suck at calc but I did fairly well because of her
awesome! so sweet too! best prof.
Awesome prof to listen to, makes the course really easy to understand. It also doesn't hurt that she's easily the hottest prof at Mac.

Erin is an absolutely amazing instructor. She doesn't even compare to others I've had. I went to every lecture and found them very helpful. Also reading the textbook helps a lot. She is SO helpful and understanding.. out of this world!

Great prof. She's so young, it seems only fitting to call her Erin. She's very good at explaining topics and engaging the class, yet she has no control. She never told people to keep it down until one girl exploded during class about the noise. Otherwise she'll just thank you for shushing people. Long midterms and easy exam. 90% exam was my saviour
Nice, midterms were too long, but the exam was easy.
Understanding, caring, smart, reaches out to students, agree with last comment: unreal.
Unreal
She is SOOOO great! I love her teaching style and she can make everything clear and easy than any other profs! very friendly!!

Awesome prof! Love her teaching so much. She is not all full of herself expecting students to know everything. VERRRRY helpful and very friendly. It's like she is too good to be true (for university). LOL. I love Math so I loved the course. Do your assignments and textbook Qs if you buy one. I didn't
Great teacher who really knows her stuff and does her best to keep to explain concepts in ways that the students can understand.
I am in love with this girl, honestly she is the perfect woman! I'm going to be devastated when the term is over! Goodbye my looooooooooooove!!!!
excellent instructor, knows her stuff

Very detailed in topics.  will answer and explain even the easiest question during lecture if you get lost.  Has a high school feel which is great transitioning to university classes.  Very nice too.  Doesn't teach over your head.  lots of examples.

Dont know why everyone finds her easy i found her tests kind of hard. If you do the sample test and get everything, that means nothing also not alot of time to do her tests. I only did 2 tests so far so have to see how it goes. Also she isn't that clear but still better then a few other teachers.
Her presence made 8:30s worthwhile.

Overall quite clear in her teaching and made class enjoyable. Tests pretty easy. I just wish she would go a bit faster, one time Lovric substituted for her and it was clear to me he was a much better lecturer overall. However she is young and new so it's not her fault
very helpful and direct with her teaching. explains concepts well and clearly. also very pretty ;)

Clements was an overall good teacher. Sometimes she would go a little too slow, make a few errors, and you could tell she was new to using the smart board. The tests were easy if you studied for them, the exam was okay. You didn't really need to go to class since the notes had everything except solutions to problems.
You are very lucky if you had her as a prof. I hope that she teaches upper year math courses and that would be heaven - just being in her class is already heaven

She's adorable when she gets embarrassed because the technology isn't working. :) Her history as a high school teacher shows in her straightforwardness and desire to have students understand what's going on. Made 8:30 classes tolerable.
One of the best profs I have ever had. If you have her, you are very lucky!
Great prof and easy on the eyes ;)
amazing prof (summer school)
No Comments
No Comments

comments: By far one of the best lecturers in business. With actual experience to back up his teaching's. Easily one of the most worthwhile classes to actually attend.
Great lecturer
This professor was amazing, take him if you have the chance. He is a very good lecturer, and also was really focused on preparing you for work. Easily one of the best professors I have had
Vilks is by far the most applicable prof to the real world.
The best prof ever!!!!!!!
An amazing professor with a detailed background and experience in business. A MUST have for 4PA3

Brilliant! Makes the class very enjoyable and helps you to understand how the tools you learn about can be applied in the real world. Doesn't waste your time and will always be there to help. Consistently wins student voted teaching awards.

Without a doubt the most dedicated and approachable prof at DeGroote. Always willing to help and defends the interests of his students. Midterms are tricky but he provides great direction as to what to study. Doesn't waste your time.
Prof Vilks is incredible. He keeps lectures interesting, and is genuinely funny. He very explicitly drops hints about exams and assignments, so pay attention and you'll do fine. Thanks Vilksy!

Great Professor and a genuine person. If you ever needed some of his time weather it was after class or during office hours he was always very accommodating.  He is one of the best teachers I have ever had, his stories and professional experiences really made the course interesting. I highly recommend him.

He is by far the nicest and most helpful prof I've ever had at Mac.  His lectures are both practical and theoretical.  When you leave the class, you feel that you got something extra that will help you in the real world.  He respects his students, values their insights and will go out his way to help them.  I highly recommend him as a prof!

Possibly one of (if not) the BEST teachers at Mac. Vilks knows exactly what he is talking about and relates it to you in a way you can really understand. Very easy going and is willing to put in the extra effort to know you by name and make sure you get the grade you want. He should get a few awards for his teaching ability.
Awesome prof. Funny, tries to make the class interesting. Probably one of the best profs at DeGroote.
Great guy excepts says "no seriously" a little too much.

Vilks is a legend. His 4PA3 classes are packed because everybody wants a ticket to see this guy. Unfortunately you SUFFER in particapation becuz of this. But the guy is hilarious and a sage with all his experience stories. A **** Vilks adds to his legend as perhaps the most enjoyable prof in all of MDG.
Nicest prof at Mac.  You don't really learn too much from him, but he makes the class enjoyable.

One the best Prof.'s in commerce. He makes his lectures super interesting with class discussions. Is easy going, super nice, and genuinely gets involved with class. Highly recomended, if you have a choice between professors in your marketing courses.
What a great prof! He sometimes digresses and goes off topic, but overall, he's a very personable prof. Vilks is my reference into Grad School. He loves me =D
awesome prof...really nice, funny and interesting. makes class worth while
Great prof. Easy going, great stories. Fair in marking.  Highly recommeded.
No Comments

Such a great prof!  He's a genuine nice guy, in class and at his office hours.  He makes every lecture enjoyable and also useful.  He's fair on tests, and more importantly, reports (overrules the arrogant TAs).  Has tons of experience in his field.  Overall, great prof.
Nice guy, easy tests. Reports are a lot of work but he's more fair with the marking than the TA's.  Seems to be getting sick of students begging for extra marks.

His tests are easy, and better yet he's actually an engineer, so he doesn't care about all the commerce formatting BS on your reports and will give you all the marks back your TA's robbed you of for no reason. Plus his stories are great.
Great professor.  He's very approachable, very likeable, and actually makes you want to learn more about the subject.  It's too bad there aren't more profs like him.

Supernice, easy-going and relaxed...while I am sure that I could have learned much more in this class then what I took out, it was nice to deal with such an easy professor.  Take this class if you want a break, but prepare to be bored!

This guy is cool, has clear lectures, and is very approachable (he's a nice guy even outside the office). Plus he tells stories about his drinking games as a university student in class, I mean how cool is that?
awesome teacher and a great man.  love just talking to him!

comments: One of the best professors at McMaster. There was a comic on her door in which she basically structured the exam. "Work on small problems so you can tackle bigger ones". This was the basis for her exam this year, as the harder questions were designed to be understood from results of easier ones. Go to office hours, ask questions, make learning fun.
Super unclear and confusing. Just learn it yourself from the textbook.
Great prof. The lectures were very good and clear. The tests were easy and fair. Just study and you are guaranteed a really good grade with this prof.

TERRIBLE handwriting. Can't read it at all. Very confusing to listen to. Tests were difficult as the marking scheme used led to silly mark deductions. Overall OK prof. Going to class isn't mandatory as she simply regurgitates the textbook on the board.

Very nice and caring person. Always wants the best for her students. I went into the course with a negative mind and came out with a positive one. Do the practice problems and go to office hours, she is very helpful.

She's been a very fair prof. Very organized with her lectures, fair midterms, if you pay attention and know what's important then you will do well. She's entertaining and very nice. I was worried about the class after reading her reviews but I think that for this class she was a dream!

I *ALMOST* switched out of the Honours math program after I had this prof. I am a very good student but due to Dr. Bronsard's RIDICULOUS marking style, I earned a C+ in this course even though my mathematics and statistics grades in all other courses range from B+ to A+. I was horribly disappointed. She is not a very fair prof, I am sorry to say.

She was my PHD supervisor years ago and since then I have despised math. Her explanations were poor, she was never available when I had questions and she constantly insulted me. I can understand why so many students have problems and discouraging comments about her. I guess she hasn't changed her negative attitude at all over the years.
This prof likes to fail people. Watch out. Beware if you take her course. She will make your life a living nightmare by the way she marks your exams. 100% AWFUL lady.
very mean prof with no common sense. I suggest that nobody take a course with her, unless you want a semester full of sadness and suffering.
Dr Bronsard is very helpful and smiles alot! Tests are fair!
Dr. Bronsard is a very nice and helpful prof!! My friend and I both enjoyed this course and think her accent is cute.

I agree. This professor is a waste of class time. There are so many better ways to spend your time than listening to "errrrr, any questions, any questions? If not, let's start ... blah blah blah." Man, she gives me headaches.
Don't ever take a course taught by her. Her annoying voice, yucky face and negative attitude will turn you off math forever.

SHe never replies to emails. Ask anybody who has taken her courses. Even if you email her multiple times she will not reply to you. You will see her in her office sitting there and you will see her walking around in Hamilton Hall but she will never ever answer your email. Is that no rude and impolite? Why does she even have an email account?

What was this prof thinking choosing to teach real ANALysis? Did she actually think we even wanted her as a prof? I have never been more disappointed in a professor in my life as I am with this dude. Lectures were disorganized, marking was unfair and responsiveness to students' needs was minimal at best. Go work at Tim Horton's!
Mr Bronsard, may I ask why you are so mean to your students?

Sometimes I have no idea what she is saying during her lectures. They are supposed to be spoken in English, but I swear it sounds like she is speaking French. And why does she wine so much? Is that really necessary?

She thinks she is a good professor. She is the *W*O*R*S*T* Professor in the Whole Universe. Her knowledge is very poor, which explains why she has to copy everything from a piece of paper onto the blackboard. That is her teaching style!! She gives No Part Marks. If you give the wrong answer she will give you 0 out of 20. She has no human feelings!!
BLAH BLAH BLAH BLAH BLAH. That's all I got out of her mundane lectures.

I had this professor for first year calculus many many years ago. Her voice is so annoying. She speaks english with a thick french accent and is very cruel hearted. She thinks she is a fair prof, but she is very far from what a fair prof is. She lacks compassion and does not think what shock and trauma the student will get when they see her marking

Worst prof on campus. She expects students to answer according to what she thinks is correct. However, as a professor she has it so easy because all she does is read off a piece of paper and copy notes onto a blackboard. Clearly she doesn't know math, yet she grades so harshly on students. What a hypocrite.

Worst Professor I have ever had. I guess when she marks she does not take into account the feelings and consideration of the student's hard work. If you don't give the right answer she will give you very few IF AT ALL that is, part marks. She will basically nail your paper with no mercy and when you request more marks she will not give it to you.

I failed this course because of this prof. She loves to see students do poorly. Marks very hard on tests and the final exam. If you go to her proving you deserve more marks she squeals like a pig and throws you out of her office, demanding you never come back.  I learned that as awful as a professor as she is, she is an even worse human being.
Tough to get good mark from her course
Dr. Bronsard challenges her class to think rather than to simply plug in to an equation. Her style is effective and her ability to communicate is only surpassed by her kindness in the classroom.
she marks the final exam very meanly.

Her final exam was so hard especially the bifurcation question worth 20 marks, it had an absolute value to it, and was something extremely weird. She is a VERYYY mean marker, she does not mark in the favour of students and is not at all linent. I guess she is french that's why she's like that. No mercy whatsoever. Terrible prof!!
She is a VERY VERY mean marker
vERY TOUGH PROFESOR
She is very tough professor!!!

Very hard marker....she has one solution prepared...if your answer does not match the solution she created, she won't give you many part marks. Think about it before taking her course(s). She is really tough and gets booring.
She was a great prof
TOUGH!!!!!

Her final exam was toughhhh...there was a 20 marks bifurcation question which had an absolute value (something very tricky), second question was 24 marks repeated eigenvalue str8-forward, 3rd question something about lyapunov not too bad, 4th question about hamiltonian with an easy graph, last question 12 marks True/False- PUT FALSE for all of them
IF YOU WANT TO LOWER YOUR GPA TAKE A COURSE TAUGHT BY HER

I was soo tired of hearing the word "Any questions, any questions" that she says at the end of class. If your Assignment or test solution is not similar to what she prepared as a template, she will just assign u a very low mark. Her TA was a very decent marker still, that's why I bull-shiiitttted on the tests and still got by with a decent grade.
Tough marker fo suree......
Very mean spirited when it comes to marking. Does not even have the courtesy to answer student's emails. That is rude and impolite.

Very mean and unfair marker. Has no consideration of other's feelings. Just Unfair and awful. Stay away from this prof or you will regret it. You could pass with a low grade, but getting good marks is another thing.
She is really terrible and super hard for the 4th Year course

This woman is an extremely mean marker. She reuses all her homework questions from last years so save it from the course website or get it off someone and free 10% for you. She does'nt like giving too many part marks. On the tests she does not specify which question is worth how much. Avoid her. The bifurcation question on the final exam was BRUTAL

Good prof; but the textbook was very poor. Confusing. All over the place. Her lecture notes are nice and if you study them daily you can do well. The tests are easy if you studied a lot, but the final exam is hard. Overall, it is a difficult course.

I was very interested in this class, but the phase portraits are generally very difficult and confusing. Most of the marks on her tests come from graphing the phase portrait correctly. The numerical calculation has very little marks attached. I dont recommend this course to anybody!!!!
her teachings are fine but she's a really really mean marker... if you make a small error, she'll give you 3/10. To her a mistake is a mistake, whether it'd be wrong logic or missing a negative sign.

For math 3F03, she's really good. She teaches well and most of all her notes are the best!! Read her notes & textbook will not be necessary. One advice, go to the lectures because the textbook is the worst one out there. I'm telling you it's just a terrible book but she's great and approchable...cares about you like a mom does.
Worst textbook I have ever seen for math that we are using in this course. Totally NOT clear book, hard to figure out everything.
That class is brutal. Lots of graphing phase portraits which is tuff.. If you think this course is easy, you will be surprised since it is not..
Great professor! More profs should teach like she does. Insightful, helpful and approachable. Hope to have her again.
Excellent prof!

Good class... although her choice on the textbook was HORRIBLE. Worstmath textbook i've ever had. Besides that, her class notes are good and its best you study off of that.... and if you dont get a concept, see her cuz the text book I used doesnt help at all.
Awesome

Really thick (French?) accent, a lot of people didn't like her teaching style but I really enjoyed it. She taught the material clearly, quickly (and efficiently) and had great examples. Math was easy anyways even with/without Bronsard.

Dr. Bronsard was the absolute best professor I had my at Mac.  She made the hardest course in undergrad math and so clear and understandable that I did so extremely well in it.  She also go me to start liking math again, which I thought could NEVER happen since I was going to transfer out that year!
dont listen to ne of the below posts. thats what i did n didnt switch. REGRET. shes SUPER unclear in teaching n have no clue how to speak. 110% guarantee, ur new best friend=textbook with her
Clear, approachable, good lectures, cute accent...
Great prof! One of the best at Mac! Very very smart and nice. She knows how to take a surface integral of a doughnut to maximize the amount of icening. She is really cute.
The nicest teacher I ever had. One of the Best at McMaster!!

comments: One of the best professors within the Software Engineering program because of his passion for the field. He isn't too tied down to old software engineering ideologies and tries his best to make the content more exciting. If we had more professors like this Software eng here might've been a decent program. Also, Parnas, Parnas, Parnas.

Your knowledge of coding is useless in this class.Test questions have little to do with tutorials.The prof is not bad and willing to help, but sometimes unreliable and won't post necessary things until asked to.The lectures and tutorials are useless.The whole course is just book reading.Hard to believe that such inconsistent course worth 4 units.

He's a very passionate prof, going the extra mile in his lectures. However, IMO he lacks the ability to keep his audience interested. Most people fell asleep. Despite this I loved this class. Labs and tutorials were my favorite. The tests however were nowhere as good as I'd hoped. Some very random questions. Textbook=very IMP
hes awesome
great prof

Dr. Smith is a very easy going guy, and tries really hard to make everything as clear as possible. He's open to suggestion on his teaching style (practical -> theoretical examples, etc) and really takes everything step by step to make sure you get it. Does a very good job considering the material.
He likes to write a lot on the board and confuse the hell out of you.  But assignments/tests were fair.  MATLAB is fun.
This is one of the more nerdy professors you'll meet.  In some countries, it's a criminal to be this interested in the finer points of C syntax.  Very good at explaining himself to a class.
Truly awesome. He's so hot. Nice professor. I find his classes interesting

Excellent prof... teaches you everything needed for assignments and exams.  Very organized and great style of teaching.  I like the whole... question was... thing.  Clear.  There is no reason you shouldn't get a 10+ in this course if you attend his lectur

This Prof likes Star Trek and prank phone calls..He just doesn't compile
He knows stuff and that's all you need from your prof, less boredom would b nice
got some nerdy jokes! been programming C-code too much, needs to get OUT!
the C-code classes are much better than pseudo code. ie enjoy his class
man, thinkin you're Bill Gates or what ??
I hear he has good taste in picture frames.
He is the scientist guy from the Simpsons!

comments: don't take this guy's courses if you're lazy or stupid, he's way ahead of his time

Nice Guy, Awful Prof. Lectures were disorganized and useless. The final exam was extremely hard for everyone I talked to. Only mark I had below a 10 and it was a 6 including a 12 in math 1m03. Lucky commerce students.... (this isn't a required course anymore.)

He's an entertaining guy, but a sub-par professor.  Easily gets off topic and tries to hard to crack jokes. He only taught half the material he should have in lecture, and made the final insanely difficult in an attempt to lower the class average.  Majority of the finals questions were topics he never discussed once.

I think Hurst should completely clarify what will be on the test because a lot of people were not prepared for the second midterm.  Looking back I realize my mistakes were  not writing down every word that came out of his mouth. I ended up with a B+ in the course after writing down everything he said in lecture for the final. TExtbook is a must.
I found him very entertaining.

Nice professor, good at teaching the content required for the course. His tests are quite difficult and requires a lot of studying on intricate pointless details.  Although he can be entertaining with joking around, his lectures end up quite boring based on the content and the heavy reliance on slides.  Textbook reading is mandatory for this course
Very nice teacher, can get boring at times. Tells funny jokes here and there. Is genuinely interested in teaching students the required level of material.

1B3-Uncle Tony is the best prof i've had up to this point. Although his tests are a little bit hard, you actually leave the class having LEARNT a lot. His lectures sometimes can be boring but for the most part interesting..the course is dull at first but picks up with databases and computers (internal parts & external)..very nice educated guy!!
most lectures were super boring, tests were crazy hard..95 in calc and 70 in this class
Nice enough...likes the female students in the front rows.
No Comments
carzy prof that i have never seen in my life. He wants the whole class to get zero average.
This guy actually taught something, he doesn't just read out of the textbook.  So he isn't a full professor, big deal, that doesn't affect his capability to teach.
one of those people that you just want to swear and curse at. this guy is another one to throw out
He is not a prof, he's only a lecturer, he is not qualifed to teach us!!

comments: The best prof I ever had in my 4 years at Mac.

He was a joke. Did not know how to teach at all. And furthermore, this class was basically a right off. We learned nothing. If you want to study a Thomas Hardy novel for NINE WEEKS, take this course (when he was teaching it). And he cancels classes all the time.  Thank god he is gone from MAC.  Worst porf in the history of teaching; he's an idiot
Great Prof. Enjoys teaching and is always considerate of students needs in terms of deadlines, extensions, etc. Makes class as interesting as possible.

Tim taught me a few times.  He was the only prof who required us to put our theories into PRACTICE - something I feel that is very important. Interesting, relevant material too.  He also went out of his way to help me with my master's applications.  An all around good prof.
So wonderful and teachy.
BLAH BLAH BLAH, is all i learned from this course. Serioulsy get over yourself, i mean you're hot but there's no need to be an egocentric maniac!
Tim Walters makes us laugh... thereby distracting us from the fact that he has taught us nothing.
He's one of those 'cool'professors you know, like you see in the movies.

A good prof is passionate about the material, a great prof is passionate about empowering the students.  Tim Walters is passionate about both of these things.  He is the only person at McMaster that made me feel like I was more than a number.  Best prof and teacher I have ever had.
Best Prof EVER!
Interesting, Engaging, and he cares about the student
No Comments
He's compelling, and interesting...what's not to like...for those whiners...it's a 3rd yr course.  BUCK UP.

I'd give Walter's a perfect score if I took courses to be entertained. However, I don't. I take them to learn. And the thing is, while Walter's is pretty entertaining, I don't learn jack. And his multiple choice are just flat out stupid.

Awesome prof. Tends to be a little wordy, so go to his class expecting to listen and take notes.  Don't be bitter if you took his course as a bird course and found out otherwise. Great examples, and very insightful. One of the only profs I've had who takes suggestions from his class about how to make it better.  And last but not least, EYE CANDY!!
Super smart and accessible...and hot.
Modern Countercultures sucks. It is Nov. 22 and he still hasn't lectured. I have learned nothing. On the plus side, he marks super easy. Whatever.

He's an excellent prof.  This course was educational, fun, thought provoking, and philosophical.  Really made me reflect upon society and my stance within it.  He is very educated and passionate about what he's teaching, and presents class material in a fun way.  You will not be disappointed...

Too many of you talk about Tim as though he's an entertainer instead of someone who's teaching us to think hard. Understanding pop. culture is NOT easy or simple. Far from it. Smarten up, do the reading (even if it's 'no fun,' poor babies) and come to class ready to think. I am, and this is a really stimulating class that I'm learning lots from.
HE SUCKS SO MUCH. NEVER TAKE THIS COURSE. WALTERS... MORE LIKE FAULTERS.

Tim is a good prof overall, he likes to throw in some jokes to liven things up. I think he does a good job at being approachable, he is not intimidating at all. Unlike many profs at Mac. Anyway, overall thumbs up!
Walters seems to have no real direction. and talks only about what he intends to talk about in the future.
tough teacher very unclear lectures because he reads from a paper...no excitement and his book choices arent very good and fun to read...i wouldnt take this course unless necessary

Tim Walters lacks expression when he speaks.  His monotone voice bores me and he does nothing in his class to counteract his lack of excitement.  Dr. Hunter's ENG 1B03 class was far more visually and intelectually stimulating.  Though the material in Tim's class was worthy of studying, Tim made the class a bore.

Plays down to his audience; this isn't a class for the heavyweights of cultural theory, it's more a survey of what's going on. Great for introductions to the basics of consumerism, rebellion, etc., but... he just seems to want to be too cool. And it's really irritating.
Tim is approchable and helpful with material. He uses visual examples and movies that make the material understandable and easy to relate to.
Dr Walters is the best!  I really enjoyed his lecture style.  Be careful though - soon you'll hate the establishment too.  Vive la revolution!
Wow!  Tim is the most approachable prof ever.  He really wants you to enjoy his class, and the understand the subject matter.  Not to mention that he's dreamy!
Although lectures were at times dry Tim's jokes made up for them. Always willing to help. Material was interesting and provoked thought.

I found Tim fun and very smart.  His classes didn't give me much incentive to go, since there were so many presentations I could skip it without consequence, but I REALLY didn't mind.  He brought cookies to the exam dude...you can't go wrong with a guy that awesome.  And 6'6"?  Oh my yes.

Pop Culture and Modernity/Postmodernity. Classes tend to blend together and a few readings were the same. Teaches what he knows. Where Tim excels is working with and engaging his students. Did everything possible to get people interested and involved, and constantly had an open door for anyone. For this, 2J03 one of the best classes I've ever taken

Anyone who says stuff like "waste of my money" about a prof like Tim is a bellend. Walters is by far the best prof at MAC, and actually makes you interested in whats going on. Doorknobs like you people are what makes MAC humanities the joke that it is.

Definitely makes an effort to break down the barrier between student and prof. Assignments involve practical application, which helps learning immensely. Best exam I've ever taken too. The only class I've taken where I've made an effort to be at every lecture. Unthinking consumers beware...

What a joke. This professor is more concerned about getting his students to like him so he'll get re-hired than he is about teaching the material thoroughly and comprehensively. Teaches two classes exactly the same, gives the most ridiculous exam I've ever experienced. Waste of my time and money.
i hate this class.
Great prof. Best evaluation methods ever.
horrible. better at acting than teaching.

Boring... and doesn't explain the readings well at all.  I understand his lectures but he rarely relates it back to the text which makes it very difficult to understand parts of the course. I feel like he takes more time to crack jokes than actually teach the course well.

he rambles far too much and spends far too much time to trying to be entertaining. i learned more from my TA.his assignments were a joke and website participation is a joke. AND he uses the SAME readings for different classes, how about actually creating two different courses? horrible prof.

Really cool guy, funny, interesting when asked questions, pushes you to think independently, he should be a bit more explanatory of his material, and be a little bit more theory orientated, but I had the BEST CLASS at mac with this prof so far.  Keep it up dude!
Tim is one of the best Profs around. I love going to his class, and he's friggin hilarious.
Awesome guy.
A good class with a good looking Prof! :P (I'm so bad--but there are so few good looking profs out there!!!)
A relaxed teacher, never makes students feel dumb for asking questions. Fairly marks and very fair with assignments. Talks a little to fast for everything he's saying sometimes, but knows his stuff.
good class.  much more interesting than i had previously thought.  classes at 8:30=shitty.  however, going to them made it easier to start the day with a little hilarity
Lovin Tim, loving the course... hilarious and makes lectures very interesting and fun to go to - love how he approaches the material (a bit more structure, though, maybe...)
has great passion for subject matter and seems to care about students - bothers to make lectures interesting.
seems to get lost in his notes during the lectures, but the classes are always fun to go to
the greatest guy...inspired me to no end and pretty easy on the eyes. take his class if you have a chance. interesting course material that breaks the normal boundries

big english soccer fan who always had an interesting way of looking at the world with his insights.  always looked forward to going to his class.  also a little afraid of marriage it seems?  very good prof., wign up for his course if you get a chance.
could stand to be a little more professional with his students
Should stop being afraid of offending people.
nothing but love for this hot, young thing.
Funny and helpful guy, but has a tendency not to care much about the course in general.  Expectations were high from the students yet he only met half way with his enthusiasm.

comments: Dr. Dumont is really nice... but his voice is so magic to make us fall asleep. The notes and textbook he wrote are great, but his explanation is sometimes unclear.

The class begins and a sleeping pill walks into the classroom. His intention is great but he just cannot explain things well. I feel like he is making chemistry a very tough course because he complicates some concepts though he tries to make us understand. Can't help but sleeping in his class. I am sorry but I cannot control my eyes being closed.

He's really passionate about the subject but mostly teaches to the front row of students and doesn't explain concepts very thoroughly. Goes on a lot of unnecessary tangents when you ask questions and teaches things that aren't in the curriculum. He's a nice guy but not a good prof for engineering chem.

I understand why his rating is so low - he's an extremely disorganized prof and often gets confused by his own lecture notes. However, his intentions are good; he will try his best to get you to understand and holds lots of extra-help sessions. He's also really funny and his grading scheme is EXTREMELY fair. An easy 11/12 if you study old tests.
Potentially the worst prof at mac. Skips stuff that he later tells you is important, rarely gives solid feedback, and isn't great at taking student concerns into account.
Randall's so cool he makes the boiling point of nitrogen look hot. Now that's cool.

Randy's a very nice and charismatic guy. His lectures often come out confusing due to negligible preparation. His exams are very similar to the previous ones he uploads. I've taken 2 courses with Randy ... and both times you can get a great mark without really understanding the course content. You simply need to learn how to solve the problems.
Randy was a very nice guy and I wanted to like him all semester, but he was very confusing. He clearly loved chemistry but I couldn't grasp the concepts and really struggled in the course

Randy's a nice guy, but he cant articulate any concepts. He'll attempt to explain a concept, stutter, realize he can't explain it, and then move onto the next slide. Often goes off topic unrelated to chem. Didn't go for the last month. Read the textbook and practice past tests/exams and you should be fine.
If you need a nap,  go to class.  If you want to know about adcanced 4th year chem in first year engineering,  go to class. If you know the concept,  don't go to class,  it will just confuse you.

terrible. I had to teach myself chemistry. Thankfully the course is very similar to Grade 12 Chemistry. The textbook was 10 times more clear than him. Many just stopped going to his lectures because they were so useless they were no help at all.
he is way to into chemistry and goes off on rants about topics of chemistry (NOT RELATED TO WHAT WE HAVE TO KNOW) all class!

Agreed with the other comments. He could not control the class so it was hard to hear him. Which made class go behind schedule compared to the other classes because noise levels would interrupt his lessons. This being said, at the end of class he would rush to get things done.

Agree with the other comment that he couldn't control his class. He seems very passionate about chemistry, which is good, but he isn't the best teacher - he was slow in terms of covering the material. A very nice man though.
Couldn't control the class, constant noise. Didn't know how to work powerpoint/technology. he is a very nice man though.
Such a nice man, Very helpful !- test are decent but assignment are killers - but overall he's a super nice guy and very willing to help !

What a nice man! He is so passionate about chemistry and wants to instill that same passion into all of his students. He does some great demos and is a GREAT performer in front of an audience. Makes chemistry interesting :)  And if you get the chance to meet his wife... it's amazing. She is JUST like him. You can tell why they are married!
he is a great prof, very helpful
inclass experiments are good. fun, interactive prof. knows his****. good prof overall.

Hes a good guy, he may sound a little funny in his lectures but hes a good prof, consdiering his notes were better than most prof's and his demo's were interesting, Id say it was worth goin to his class.
difficult course to follow, nice professor but course was quite uninteresting
A very smart man, and a very bad lecturer.
Way to teach the textbook, literally. Would've been nice if we had some more examples, like on the test. Could've prepared us for the exam better!

haha, what a funny little man. He's not that bad.. but he's not all that amazing a prof. He says "okay" WAY WAY too much.. after every sentence, okay? chemistry, okay? i counted 84 in one half lecture, okay?
Hes just so amazingly at the right pace
His teaching is not too great.  I had to teach myself the book from his notes and the textbook.
He looks like the Crocodile hunter!  Should consider doing that as a profession...cannot be a prof..TRUST ME!!
Probably very smart....but not cut out to teach.  Keep researching, Randall.
There are people who should NEVER, EVER, teach... He is one of them! Screws you up to the point of depression!
No Comments
He....simply....can't teach....
Nice guy, pretty good lectures.
No Comments

comments: Haskell is very knowledgeable in mathematics. With that said, her lectures were confusing at times and did not cover what we needed to know for the exams. She is helpful at her office hours though,

DEIRDRE is a goddess of the mathematical kind! She is respectful and encourages a higher level of thinking than what most people expect. She is extremely bright and passionate! She made math 1c03, one of my favourite courses! (University professors are here to present information and not hold your hand through every test or exam like elementary)
I really liked Dr. Haskell. She's definitely the best professor in my opinion. She helped me how to think better mathematically. She's truly inspiring.  Hope to have her again!
Terrible lectures could never hear or understand what she wrote. Unable to explain answers to simple questions without making it overly confusing.

This prof is brilliant, she's smart as hell and makes you understand the basic concepts before really getting into the hard stuff. One problem is that the practise midterms are way easier than the actual ones so watch out with your confidence levels

When I went to her office hours to ask for clarification on a topic and she insisted that I go to ANY other TA because she didn't feel like talking to me. Isn't providing assistance what office hours are for? Not just being brushed off and asked to go somewhere else?
She's a nice prof and her lessons were clear.
Good prof, helpful when approached after class.
Not very helpful, doesn't prepare well for the examinations.
She just went over examples and proofs, all of which you can find in the textbook. Midterms and exam were EXTREMELY fair though.
I still remember the horrors of MATH 1AA3 to this very day. Terrible prof.
lmao ya right!! she was my second least favourite professor of my university career!! thanks for destroying my passion for calculus!!

She is the best teacher for MATH 1A03. VERY helpful and sympathetic, she is the sort of prof. that cares about her students. Not to mention that the lady is smart as hell! Try to get her for 1st year... you won't regret it!
The course was tough. Tests were fair although lectures were quite dry. The assignments were nearly impossible.

Overall, she was okay. Brilliant lady, lectures a little boring at times, test and exam were fair, assignments crazy hard - only doable when working in groups. Overall she really pushed for working with others and getting help. Do that and you're fine

I really enjoyed Professor Haskell as a teacher. I think especially for 2R03, you need to use your resources effectively to do well, and you need to study hard. She is extrememely helpful and knowledgable and I think people should see this side in her. It's easy to blame a challenging course on the prof. It's most likely the students fault
I was in her 1b03 class in my first year, she did great and the projects were interesting. But in 2R03, you gotta watch out and think again, very low average in 2r03 and projects were hard

I dont know where the negative comments are coming from. She is really nice lady, she sits down with students and spends so much time helping them with course selection and advice. I found her flexible and accomodating and she was never ever rude or sarcastic or arrogant. She is more fair than most other profs teaching math 2R03

Assignments were, in general, terrible. She asked us about things we'd never heard about in our lives, and expected us to use them. Tests were straightforward, fairly graded. I found it hard to learn from Dr. Haskell, just because it doesn't seem like her heart is in the material. Sadly, she has effectively killed my interest in Linear Algebra.
She is 100% helpful and she cares about students
I wouldn't be surprised if the comment "excellent prof" was entered by herself!!  how sad.
awesome prof
No Comments
excellent prof
VERY VERY difficult prof. for our calc 2 course, the class average was a failing average :( for the second midterm. DONOT take her EVER EVER!!

She is worst prof anyone can EVER have!! I'm not joking about this. She doesn't know how to test her students' knowledge. They are way too long and her averages are always less than 55%...is that clear enough? In class, not sure what other people are talking about. She doesn't concentrate on the important stuff which is what comes up on her tests
Terrible. Just terrible

she's by far the worst prof I've had in all my life. she's selfish and self-centered. and inconsiderate. and she acts like she cares bout u when she really is worried about herself. she teaches horrible. she puts things on the test/assignments that she never really talked about. overall: WORST prof ever.
very good instructor!
Worst prof ever had!
i was in her 1b03 class in my first year.. she is definitely a decent teacher, excellent prof... go to her lectures, study her notes, you will easily get a A
She is really nice
Good prof, but nothing truly enthralling with her. A lot of time is spent on proofs but thats ok.  Sometimes sleep can come over you very quickly in her class.

Most people complain that she does too many proofs...I think there's no such thing. What good is learning math if you have no idea where in the heck it comes from? Who cares if you don't need to reproduce it on the test...that doesn't mean you can't be shown the logic behind it. I think that is more a problem with students than it is with the prof.
spent a lot of time on proofs
Fell asleep everyday. She spends too much time on whats not important. She needs to answer questions better and give more examples.

Had her in the morning and fell asleep each and every class. She is nice and approachable, but spend too much time on proofs and theory and not enough on actual examples. I stopped going to her lectures and went to Taylor's class. He did examples for the duration of the whole class and on the board, not on an overhead. Lovric is great too!

Helpful and nice prof.  She definitely spends too much time on proofs that we don't have to know for tests to the detriment of teaching us things we actually do have to know...but she tries.  If you have a question, she's more than willing to help you out, which is great.

What a terrible teacher. Not to be rude or anything, but spending 3 days on pointless proofs (when we are in calculus) is very tedious, especially when we later learn that they are not on the test!!! I fall asleep for class, wake up, and all we have done is de^x/dx is just de^x.  If i was bad at calculus, id be failing.
I had her for Math 3E03 and Hans Boden for Math 3EE3. Deirdre's better -- MUCH better.
simply one of the best profs i have ever had. incredibly aware of how the class is learning and explains material extremely well. always enthusiatically helps students who have many questions.
very good teacher! repeats proofs from the book a bit too much, but nevertheless, regardless of what first year students say, she is a good mentor.
She's a decent prof.  Lin Alg is a confusing course, so it's not totally her fault.  Didn't understand all the material until night before exam.
A very good math prof, and my only first year class that I (found worthwhile and) attended.
I did well, 'cuz I'm kind of a math geek...so maybe that's why I thought she was a decent prof.  She certainly was very nice, approachable...go to her lectures, they're helpful.
BORING!!!!
She was actually a great Prof!  Way better than that other guy *cough*Hurd*cough*.
Excellent professor. Lectures were fun to attend and very interesting. Answered questions very well. Was able to exlain the topics so that the students can understand them.
not bad!
No Comments
Great prof. Helpful, to the point, simple, approachable. Actually teaches during lecture. Go to class!!
She's a total text book teacher! But a nice lady all the same.
She is good at algebra and she knows what she's doing.
No Comments
she will not belt the curve, even the class average is low!!!! Watch out man!!!
Very Patient. Open to new ideas

comments: Teal was amazing. Truly changed my life for the better.

Teal is another level of professor. Her real world experience is top notch (she runs a consulting firm while she teaches) and is an expert on anything you could ask her. Always comes to class with amazing energy and you will not see people skip her class. She feeds you an A if you follow her instructions and the most fair exams you could ask for

I literally have no idea in the world why Dr. Teal Mcateer is not the number 1 rated prof on this page.  I have been at mac for 3 years and teal is handsdow the greatest prof at the mcmaster entirely. If you take her class, you'll see the lectures will never be missing ppl and not because of participation marks, but because her lectures are amazing
awesome prof, loved all her lectures, she doesn't care much about testing more about teaching
talks fast but best 1BA3 prof and cares about her students
Awesome
My favourite professor at McMaster. She is incredibly caring and is an amazing teacher! Great class :)
Amazing lecturer. Insightful, caring and passionate.

Very passionate prof. She cares about her students and wants them to succeed. BUT, she talks way to fast, focuses on unimportant things and can be super confusing in lectures. It doesn't help that the material is extremely boring.

Teal is a very funny. caring and concise person. Her lectures are informative and if you attend them you will not have to read the textbook unlike many other courses. The highlight of Teal is her industry and personal experience which bring real-life examples to the classroom.

Fave class by far. She really cares about her students and makes her lectures as interesting as she can. Uses real-life examples to help students understand course material. Be aware that you do need to read the textbook for midterms and exams but she does great reviews and gives a lot of hints! The only 8:30 class I haven't skipped.
She's awesome.
Great Prof, she always grabs your attention and is easy to follow along with. Her test reviews are thorough and she prepares you well.

She loves her job and students and she'll tell you that! She has good stories that she uses to relate to the concepts and theories learnt in class. There were 3 group projects, and they were very simple if you read the textbook! READ WHAT SHE SPECIFICALLY TELLS YOU TO! The exam was NOT cumulative which was blessed. Hands down my fav prof!
her course is actually really interesting and i would definitely recommend taking courses with her. i would take another course in HR with her again.

Dr. McAteer really cares about her students.  Her lectures are very detailed and engaging.  Dr. McAteer wants you to get a great mark in her courses; however, that does not mean that her courses is easy.  Great professor!
Very passionate

Going into her lectures I was always extremely excited about what she would teach. She has a way of engaging the entire class, and making the information a lot easier to understand. I really hope I can take a course with her sometime in the future!

My favourite professor who is enthusiastic and passionate about the course she is teaching now, and totally love her students! Go to her office hour and talk with her! You can learn a lot from her lectures which is beneficial for your future even if human resource is not your intersr . I hope I can still choose her class in my upper years! :)

Teal is simply the best professor at McMaster University, I have only been in her class for a short amount of time, and I already feel the need to come a review her. She is also one of the nicest people you will meet, she genuinely cares about you as a student, but doesn't treat you like a student, she will treat you like an equal and respectfully.
She was an amazingly inspirational prof. who's main goal was to help us do well in the course and learn things that we could use in our daily lives.
Amazing professor. Really knows her stuff.

So far in my 3 years at McMaster, I have yet to have a prof that tops Teal. She is so fantastic and passionate, it's infectious. Even if HR isn't what you're into, she makes it interesting and makes you see the value in it. Go to lecture, take good notes, put in the effort, and you'll do well in this class.
Each lecture is just an act, and she's horrible to listen to.

Teal is one of the most creative profs. She challenges you by her in depth lectures that exclude filler material. She shows you the ropes for real life. She speaks to you not at you. Her hilarious one-liners make you understand what she's talking about when giving real life examples. You are given all the tools needed for an A. (Very stylish too)

Really cares about her students.  Wants everyone to do well and succeed.  Is extremely enthusiastic about all the course content which makes the lectures very captivating.  The tests and assignments are fair.  If you listen and take notes in class it will be very clear what content you should focus on for the tests and assignments.

Great professor! She offers her students to mark your resume, and provides awesome feedback. Passionate, wants to see students succeed. For the in class assignments, divide your group into questions - but be sure to review all questions, it helps with the time crunch if someone can't finishgets stuck. Very fair assignments! Great class,learn lots!

Extremely knowledgable and passionate professor. She is excellent at conveying the course material to the class as well as providing examples and class activities to help solidify the knowledge.  Her tests and assignments are very fair and all her questions are extremely applicable to the topics discussed in lecture and in the textbook.

All round, a great professor! She genuinely cares about seeing students succeed, and relates concepts to her career. Very passionate professor and great with giving feedback. Content is interesting, if you follow along in lecture, and review concepts in the textbook you are unclear for, you will do well! Good luck!

Talks all class without putting most of the relevant information (ie. definitions) on lecture slides. Its extremely hard to keep up in lecture. Never really sure what content is relevant or not. She has made it a point to indirectly say that every lecture slide will be on the exam.

poor teaching skills with speedy lectures making it  impossible for students to take all notes down. Her lecture is more likely a typing contest instead of learning something useful. please slow down your talking!!
Great professor all around. Cares about her students, is adaptable to the class at hand, and a very good communicator. Favourite prof at the school.
great prof, hard tests but very doable if you study she really wants you to succeed

Such an amazing professor. I've never met a professor so obsessed with helping students to success. She's a blessing to the Commerce Department at Mac. In Class Assignments/Group Work is straightforward. Her midterm is tough, so study hard.

By far the best prof I've had at Mac. She is one of the few professors who actually follows through with helping the students whether it's putting a star beside important info, reading through countless resumes or telling us exactly what to study for an upcoming assignment. The profs at Mac i've had have been pretty bad, Teal is an exception.

Taking Teal's class has completely transformed me in a way that no other class I have ever taken has been able to. She is genuinely interested in helping her students succeed and is willing to go out of her way to do so. The best business professor at Mac!

Great prof ! Very engaging and made a rather boring class interesting. Thoroughly explain concepts. She has her own consulting business and offers to edit her students resumes for free. She is overall such a great lady. Everyone should take her class at some point. Commerce student or not !
very interested and charismatic in what she teaches but it is a very memorization-based course. Literally memorize the textbook for a good mark.

Teal is the best professor I had at Mac.She is just awesome! the most interesting, engaging lectures; her passion about all the material makes you want to be in every single class; I wish we had more professors like her!
Fantastic lecturer, super charismatic, super attractive, incredibly interesting. She genuinely cares about her students, and will take her own time to go to bat for them at the drop of a hat.
the most amazing teacher i have ever had in my life! She loves being a prof and is great at it! Love you Dr. T
Great professor. Very knowledgeable from real world. Gives relevant examples. Makes class fun. One of the best teachers I've ever had!
What happened to Teal? Its as if she has menopause/mid-life crisis. She used to be a better prof a year ago and now she is going down the tube.

Best lecturer I've had so far at McMaster! She makes class pass by really fast and no one gets up to leave until she is totally done. She's that good. Textbook was useful for preparing for the in-class assignments. Sometimes she has weird handouts and jumps btwn material but I would definitely take a class with her if I had the chance.

Amazing prof!! She's the most charismatic lecturer i've seen. Makes the course material seem like a piece of cake. Her assignments are fairly easy, given that you know your stuff. Gives great exam reviews before the mid term and final. As long as you attend class and listen to her, getting 80+ is easy! :) take both 2ba3 and 2bc3 with her!
GREAT!!!
All I got to say that she is an amazing prof! Delivers the messages right across and does those ice breaker games that I love! It's a fun, enjoyable class and u also learn a lot:)

Teal was a great prof! Her tests and assignments were fair, she explained everything in detail in class and still managed to make it interesting. Its important to go to class. Would go out of her way to help anyone that needed it. I hope to have her again!

Delighted to be in class and explains everything very clearly. Can make do without textbook but difficult. Midterms & exams' practioner qu's are hard, assignments easy and meant to do well. Makes learning fun :) however guest speakers & TAs teaching the course are terrible at times.

comments: 'dumbed down'? I don't think so, she just used so many real-world examples, clear overheads, and straighforward language that the material became easier to understand.

Definitely entertaining...however, very controversial in her delivery at times...and I felt that she "dumbed" things down a bit too much. Tough to take much she said seriously. But, you can tell she loves her job.
Ms. Owens was the best prof I've had at McMaster. She is beautiful and very nice. I wish she would teach more courses here. She's really interesting to listen to. Simply the best prof.
Profs don't get any better than you
Owens is awesome.  She is so funny and she makes her lectures very interesting.  She was one of my first Psychology profs who actually gave me the confidence that I needed to get an A- in the class.
Great prof -super easy but interesting and hilarious.
Good course if you like memorizing!
Super awesome prof

Katherine was AWSOME - plain and simple! Super clear, all notes on overhead, essay questions in advance and on webpage, exams and papers back lightning fast, marking criteria very detailed and objective, also on webpage. She funny, sexy, and smart. Cares about the class and making it interesting!
Made the class very intersting to attend.  I could tell it was a great class because I never complained to my family...and I do that all the time in other classes.  Thanks.
cool
Excellent
Best prof I've ever had. Really clear and fair..
Great person and great professor.  She made the class worth it's money, and she was very straight foward.

Nice lady but lazy TA's. They were never in class and obviously did not read the term papers because no comments were made. Just an enduring mark! She made it easy for them but difficult for us. Memorize the class notes exactly and don't add text facts. The TA's won't know where they came from!
Great professor, excellent attitude toward students! However, there was a great paper injustice!!!

Tried to make it interesting. Was often funny. But tests are bad. Don´t think, just write exactly her phrases down. Essay extremely bad because it was not clear what she expected. Doesn´t give out a real marking scheme and doesn´t want to talk about marking. Yes, very objective...
Check your definition for incidence. Dead wrong. (Oh yeah, and the course should be changed to "Memorizing 3N03")
Regina is really missing her! Katherine is one of the best!
No Comments
Indeed one of the best profs I've had.  She's hilarious, makes lectures interesting, she's clear and you know what to expect for exams.  Her lecture notes are excellent!
She is an awesome prof and you would be lucky to get her again!
She makes night class worth going to.  Good sense of humour, organized notes and helpful examples.  One downside is she takes too many questions during lecture time.

One of the best profs I've had! She keeps everyone interested by her humour and she's very charismatic. At first I was disappointed that she wasn't going to post the lecture notes, but it turned out to be better that way because I wouldn't want to miss any of her lectures... they're great!
All around excellent prof!!!

Probably the best teacher I've had. Genuinely cares that her students do well. Makes the class one that I actually want to attend every week,not many teachers can keep the attention of a class for 3 hrs. Great example of how different teachers r b4 their PhD(they care bout somethin other than the $)
Beautiful!!!
She is the most interesting prof at school and too bad she isn't staying to teach some other psych classes
She's great! she makes everything really clear, and she's hilarious!
Great teacher! Keeps me interested, smiling, and learning for the full 3 hour class. Class is a breeze because of her and the material a lot more interesting.

Awesome prof, best I have had in my years at MAC for sure, uses great examples that stick in your mind, very approachable and funny.  Makes this course alot more fun that I thought it was going to be for sure.

She is an excellent teacher and is genuinely concerned for her students so that they may understand and do well.  Unfortunately this also encourages questions from people who just want to hear themselves speak.  Shut them down! it wastes everyone's time.
She is an absolutely wonderful teacher who is able to incorporate humour, and wit into her lectures to assist with learning. I look forward to the rest of the semester.
Awesome, awesome prof.  The only night class I actually go to :)

My favorite prof by far in my university career.  Knows the material well and is very passionate about it.  Very interesting to listen too and is loads of fun.  I look forward to attending class and I'm a little sad when its over.
One of the BEST profs I have ever had. Really funny and explains everything clearly.  One class that Look forward going to every week. KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK DR. OWENS !!!!!
Excellent role model those interested in clin. psych. She is very clever, and makes the lecture fun and interesting. Thank goodness SHE is the one teaching a three-hour night class!

One of the best profs i've ever had. Funny, intelligent and an excellent teacher. Her use of humor really helps to complement the lecutre material , so students don't have a prof droning on for 3 hours. Awsome prof.
Lots of fun...
One of the best profs I have ever had. Lots of fun, uses hillarious examples and really makes the students understand the material.
Great use of examples and analogy to illustrate points.  Personality and humor are conveyed very well to the class.  Makes learning the material enjoyable and vivid.
Screamingly hilarious chick.  Knows her stuff.  Great prof
Awesome
Great overheads, no tricks, and yes funny examples just in case everything else wasn't clear enough (which it usually is). I love going to this class!
Fantastic prof!  Not only interesting and clear BUT super funny as well... doesn't get much better than that!
No Comments
Awesome!  Great sense of humour.  Love her.
No Comments

comments: I didn't think his short answers were hard at all.. actually i got perfect on those. The tests were very fair.  He was fine prof who taught an interesting class.
I donot recommend his course

His tests are very hard especially the so called "short answer questions" very lenghty tests, and i notice he is trying to very cool by writing on the FAQ of the course website for every single question "You don't need to do anything" What the F***?...He's trying too hard to look cool. You're not buddy. Your short answer questions SUCK!!!!!
Very nice prof.  Uses things his kids have done and said for examples, which makes the course very applicable to real life.  Fair tests.

He pretty much reads out from his lecture notes.  Cant answer questions for beans...you ask him something, and he makes a lame joke about it.  The tests are fair, material's easy, but he seems quite disinterested and like he doesnt want to be there...even came 15 minutes late to a 50 minute class.

Two midterm exams each worth 30% and one final worth 40%. Atleast one assignment would have been helplful. I heard you had two easy assignments when you taught this course for the first time, but why not this year ?
Took his class like 2 years back, night class was very interesting. He is a nice guy
Very interesting material and great prof.  However, lectures tended to be dry and he seemed nervous a lot.  Testing was difficult, as per usual in psych!

I really liked him when I had him as a prof for sensory processes, but didn't like him for developmental psych. His Tests are fair, but his abstract assignments are so stupid, hard, and useless. His TAs (MAYU and PAUL) were both awful and hurt my feelings by marking so brutal on the assts and SA q/s. He thinks that stupid asst is 'Very Important'
Course was o.k. He never seemed to answer questions directly.

Good lecturer.  Really funny at times too.  But he doesn't seem too confident in his answers and when you ask him a question out of interest, he doesn't really answer it with authoriy, making you rethink yourself.  Nice guy though!

Good pacing of material, clear lecture notes, fair tests.  Sometimes seems a lil' nervous when lecturing. Provides cute stories about his kids, and gives lots of examples when explaining concepts.  Overall, a great professor.
one of my favorite psych profs!! does anyone else think he's like Ross from Friends? (cheeeeesy jokes)
Nice person. I liked the twin stories. He's so funny when he said 'bibba bibba babbi babbi'

Nice guy, good prof, means well but short answer questions on the midterms did suck. The ones on final exam were much easier. He's cool and generous. Made lot of adjustments to our midterm grades b/c they were so low, and even let us drop our assignment with the lower mark. Very helpful. I'm confident in a few years he'll be one of the best profs

Nicholas Smith is very nice but his "Short Answer" questions are not very nice. Many people hate his short answer questions, but he likes giving short answer questions. He would be better off giving a cumulative final with the whole book and all multiple choice questions. That would be a more fair assessment.
He is a great teacher. Very approachable and caring. His exams are also fair. I really enjoyed his class.
goooood
Yes he's soooo cute, and he looks super cute when he smiles :P Great professor. He's funny sometimes. Take the course if he's teaching. Interesting lectures.

He's the sweetest guy ever. He looks very cute and tells cute stories. His overhead slides are also very good. Study his notes throroughly and read the corresponding sections of the text, and most of the questions on tests are from overhead slides only. Very nice prof.
He was awesome for psych 2E03
I found this class extremely boring and he seemed almost nervous, which did not bode well for learning the material.
Tough
He's a great prof and the TA's for the course were extremely helpful.
Awesome prof!!
Dr. Smith is HOT! Possibly the most good looking professor in the Psychology department. I didn't think his exams were too easy. He likes the unit on Audition.
No Comments

I totally agree that there were some parts of the textbook which were tested on the exam, but the TA's mentioned that we were not responsible for it. We were told by the TA's that most of the exam is from the class notes, but there were lots of things (with very specific details) from the textbook.

he's adorable to look at, and he does tend to be unclear at times although i think he's relatively new at teaching - HOWEVER, his TA's provided incorrect information regarding the final exam and info that was said NOT to be on it, was in fact covered on the exam - very dissapointing
The exam was hard. Definitely harder than what I had expected.
