comments: Dukas is a pretty terrible professor but an awesome supervisor. He has an accent and speaks very quietly, but it very passionate about his work. He comes across as rude sometimes because he doesn't really care if you're interested/engaged or not. You only need the textbook for pre-lecture quizzes and the occasional test question.

The content of the class was not very difficult, however, very textbook heavy. A lot of his test questions come from graphs in the textbook, but also included bonus questions. Cares a lot about his research and not as much about teaching. He included an exam question on a topic he said would not be covered. Beware of Bayes' theorem.
Dr. Dukas is fantastic! He is very funny and super passionate about his field. I had him for night class and you really don't get bored with him. Amazing course and relatively easy.
Tests are super easy, likes to show funny videos, very approachable, makes a lot of jokes. Definitely one of the better profs at Mac. Content is easy.
He's alright. He is extremely monotone and goes way too quickly over important information. He is obsessed with graphs, which is annoying. He is sometimes funny though.
Dr. Dukas was awesome, his tests were fair, his lectures were entertaining, and you could tell that he really cared about his students.

Dukas is one of the better profs at Mac, I thorougly enjoyed his classes because he has a good sense of humour. His slides are clear, he likes posting videos that are more entertaining than actually testable material, and his tests are straightforward. He's not trying to get you like some other profs...

This class was awesome - if you expect to memorize and reguritate material then its definitely not for you. But if you have a brain and you like to use it, you'll learn some amazing stuff. Plus he does resemble Mick Jagger!

HORRIBLE PROF! He is very UNHELPFUL and because of the fact that he talks in a very low voice and has an accent, it is often extremely difficult to decipher what he is saying. Course seems easy but he makes it extremely tough. Test material seemed very unfair. DO NOT TAKE THE COURSE WITH HIM!!!

Dr. Dukas is very funny, very clever and very pleasant to listen to. The lectures were well organized and his focus was actually on our learning. If you just go to every lecture and listen, you will do well in 2tt3. Highly recommended prof.

It was a great class with interesting lectures.  His questions were tricky if you aren't used to be asked application questions.  Instead of it being just memorization, he expected you to think.. which is good for an upper year course.  Highly recommended!
Definitely a course I would recommend. While he did not seem very nice, he is very funny. The material is highly interesting and course attendance is ABSOLUTELY necessary. Textbook was barely used.

true, his accent made him unclear at times, but he was overall a good prof who was enthusiastic about teaching and about the course material. his tests were meant to test your ability to apply the information instead of just regurgitation, which is why some found them hard. one downside was the final exam was 60 ques and worth 60% of your mark.
He was horrible.  Really horrible.  SUPER HARD exam q's.  His questions are really messed up.
No Comments

HORRIBLE PROF!! He just reads everything off the slides, which are totally unclear. His questions are so hard & irrelevant....as if we've done a PhD in evolution or something! Whether you read his lecture notes or the book, nothing helps cause his questions are just outta the blue : (

He is definately NOT hot.  I felt he was unfair on what he tested, as some of it seemed to be out of the blue.  He really expected you to have memorized every little detail in the textbook and lecture.  I still don't know the answer to the treefrog question was.
HORRIBLE CLASS DO NOT TAKE...  EXAM WAS UNCLEAR AND THEY LIED ABOUT WHAT MATERIAL WAS GOING TO BE ON THE EXAM.  I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT
don't take it....
Very hard course
horible class...did not explain what he expected on the exams. The material he covers in class is not at all represented by what is tested. Second half was MUCH better

This class is much more difficult than I had anticipated however, Dukas is the better of the two profs for this course. His lecture notes are great, plus he resembles Mick Jagger, has a cool accent and really tries hard!
I took his class last year. Loved the accent. He's pretty hot too. Great class. His section was a little easier than Siegal's. Great overall.
Accent takes a while to get used to, but overall good prof and good attitude towards students.
not helpful, doesn't explain what is expected, and does not return emails.
accent hard to understand
Animal Learning is a tough course
Not willing to elp out of class, wouldnt take a course with him again.
Good prof, but only taught 1st half of course. I liked his method of testing. Knows his stuff, but sometimes he's hard to hear. Fun class overall.
He is a very understanding, nice guy.
excellent prof

comments: Her lecture compares to Dr Howarth's lecture, I think her lecture a little bit boring. She explains materials well, but some of the test questions are so tricky. She wants the students to know the stuff in detail. Also, I am strongly recommend that you sit at the front of the lecture hall in order to hear her well.

Overall, a poor professor. Highly enjoyed the lecture material, just not the person delivering it. She was unengaging, dry, boring, monotone, and had a raging ego. Very difficult to reach and talk to her if you had questions - had a very condescending attitude and tone of voice. Loses patience like a light switch. Take this course, but avoid her.

Teaching style is lack-lustre. Iclicker were a waste of time. Was unhelpful & unattentive in answering questions. Class is dull and not very engaging. Lectures did not follow the required textbook at all. Very hard to get a hold of. Overall, would not recommend it.
great prof, she was very well organized and moved from topic to topic smoothly. the way she teaches is very helpful and she is very understandable!
She can get a little boring but most of the time she is interesting. The class demos always help on quizzes and on the exam!
She really enthusiastic and gives good explanations. She tries to make class fun, but at times it can feel like she's treating you like one of her children.

She explains things VERY well and is very enthusiastic about what she teaches.  When you go to class, don't focus on overheads or w/e, but actually listen and understand what she's saying.  She focuses highly on understanding which is the best way to truly learn something.  She's very approachable and nice.
soo boring :(she old and hagarded
Great prof. Breaks down concepts and makes them easy to understand. Her WebCt notes are amazing. Tests are fair (and based off her notes).
Very clear and organized. Sometimes I found she moved a little quickly in the lectures, but she is always willing to speak to you afterwards to clear up any confusion. Very approachable.
Excellent
She is really clear, has awesome notes posted on WedCT and tells you what is important and whats not. My favourite prof.
She is an excellent prof.  Very clear, very informative, and she makes class enjoyable.

Wow! I'm really surprised to see all of the horrible comments about this excellent prof! She is very clear in lectures and has always been very approachable, in my opinion. I think that people have to understand that A&P is a REALLY tough course. You have to commit yourself to the work, and then the course really isn't that awful. Great prof, imo.
very good teacher explains everything perfectly
Clear, tells you which pages to study from the book instead of saying just read the whole lengthy chapter, tests are ok if you study for them...

best prof ever! clear and interesting. cares about students questions and takes an extra effort to make us understand the concepts. For those who complain about lack of help: she is very helpful and may not be in her office all day because she also does interesting research. unlike most profs just sit in their offices all day

She has an arrogance, i mean for god sake you dont have the take the term office "hour" so damn literally. I know 1ao6 wasnt on the top of her proirity list but she taught it well, and was helpful in class, just dont show up at her office she can be moody.
Great teacher.  She was super approachable and willing to help about anything.  This is a tough course, but she is a great prof and really wants everyone to get a great mark.

For all those complainers out there, the course isn't easy, it takes EFFORT. But Dr. MacDonald is EXCELLENT, she makes the concepts really easy to understand.  Don't give her a bad rap, just because you did poorly in the class.
please retire!
I don't understand how people can say she's a good prof.  All she ever did was talk about her kids, went through things way too fast, and made the test questions far too specific.
absolutely awful
Terrible, arrogant prof...very unapproachable....almost ruined my first year of university
Awesome Prof!
Awesome prof!  Fair tests, VERY approachable.  Her class was mine and all my friends favourite.  I hope I have her again in the future.
You're the best prof in the world!
Thank god she had to do research in term 2 so we had an excellent teacher, who was nice to us and taught us more then whats in the text.  Calvert should teach the class not Ronald McDonald
horrible prof. not approachable atall. very hard tests and marking. very bad course structure.
excellent prof.  explains the concepts very well, especially for a tough course like anatomy.
Excellent prof.  I agree with the person who said that she does a great job at explaining the difficult concepts.
Does a wonderful job at teaching a very challenging course
Crappiest prof ever- go back to teacher's college!

comments: Amazing professor, so interesting and so intelligent!

Lectures are very difficult to follow because of the lack of titles, overheads, powerpoints, etc. He just starts talking randomly about a topic. Often drifts off point. No direction at all on papers and assignments but he is very helpful if you ask for some guidance. Definitely one of the harder sociology profs.

Very difficult to follow in class, speaks off topic too often. Does not use overheads to direct and give lectures a solid foundation. Speaks too quietly without microphone. Assignments had very little direction and structure. Very nice person, helpful when needed; which usually was often.
If he is teaching it, DO NOT TAKE IT

i've had him before, but boy was i wrong to take his class again. he is absolute incompetent as a professor. he needs to retire and stay there.his lectures are disorgaized. i know more about his dog and wife than about material we are supposed to learn!gives unreasonable/unexplained grades, rude and hard to talk to!

I was really nervous about having him after reading this, but found that he was actually enjoyable as a professor.  He was always friendly with me and very helpful whenever I had any questions.  My suggestion would be to buy the novels she suggests, but skip on the text books, and always attend lectures.

I have no idea how, but I got the highest mark in my class in this course. To be honest, I had no idea what he was talking about 95% of the time, however, I always attended lecture so that may be why. I didn't really do the readings because there was a ridiculous amount. He's not unapproachable but can be rude even if unintentional.
To hard to follow, unnapproachable. even though i did well in his class it was overly stressful and not interesting!
No Comments

RUN AWAY AS FAST AS YOU CAN! Very hard prof, he is not out to make you learn about the subject but rather HIS ideas ON the subject. Not at all helpful, mean, boring, talks down to students, trust me...switch classes!

At first I was not impressed at all with this course, or the teaching.  The lectures were quite difficlut to follow and I felt stupid in the class.  As time went on I noticed a definite change in Dr. Archibald's lecturing and mannerism towards the students.  He put forth an effort to change his teaching, and was flexible with our assignments!
Really did not like this guys or his class
Worst prof ever, doesn't know how to teach, could have been such a good class otherwise

This is the worst professor I have ever had in my University career!  He was sooooo boring, and dull! His overheads were all over the place, and when I tried going into talk to him he was soooo judgmental and unhelpful....made me feel so dumb for having a question! It was an awful class!
Do not take a class with him. He might be a good person but he sucks at being a teacher. His storys are interesting but that is not enough to carry you though the class...learnt nothing!

Although his stories were entertaining at times, this course should have given me a better grasp of SIT,SET theories but i didn't learn a thing.Overheads had too many confusing short forms, no summarization and uneffective lecturing style.Don't take 2D06!

He is a horrible lecturer.  He has no idea how to keep student's interest, or how to stay on track with the material.  He also tells student's one thing one day, then changes his mind when he is marking your paper/essay. AWFUL!

Definitely needs to update the notes and be clearer with regard to teaching. I found myself confused throughout the duration of the course and it was hard to pay attention in class as EVERY CLASS WAS THE SAME. Absolutely no variation.

When he lectures he just talks to you.  The lectures have no overarching theme to them and he just picks up where he left off last lecture with no summary.  He is a *very* nice man but sorry.. you cant teach very well :)  Updated his lecture overheads but
Horrible class, Peter is horribly condescending towards students!  Unapproachable, but got an amazing mark in the class...

Social Psychology, ah Milgram et all, fascinating explanations about how the Nazi's got so many nice people to do so many naughty things... I still owe Peter a paper from when I took this course, a long, long, long time ago. Caught up with him by email. 1

I'll come to bat for Peter.  Yes there are tangents about treehouses, fishing and his marriage, but life is good when someone draws in experiences.  Peter is one brilliant guy and I'm speaking from 1998.  He is genuine and cares which deserves respect.

The worst instructor i have ever encountered! THe course appeared to be interesting but ended being dull and rather difficult as a result of his horrible teaching techniques and lack of clarity that he provided.  WARNING: DO NOT TAKE soc 2D06
Totally needs to update and clarify and stop going off on tangents.  Seems like a nice person but honey revise your teaching style.
I have bad dreams about this class...stay away! Kudos to the person who advised him to update his notes.
what a silly peter
Scrap those 70's notes and update. Trying summarizing before overheads.

comments: Extremely boring lecturer. The worst kind of prof, as it's clear the only reason she teaches is to fulfill the criteria required to continue her research. While a brilliant anthropologist, a terrible professor.

Best class I have taken at Mac and it completely changed my life. I am a Science student and so may have had an advantage, but I loved her as a teacher and every minute of her class. I learned so much about the world and haven't forgotten anything. The questions on her exams and tests were easy to predict. Its a shame that she has left McMaster=(

This class was absolutely ridiculous. She tests things that are not even relevant to the material discussed in lecture (solely based on text, even though she says the exams will not be). NEVER TAKE THIS COURSE.

I have and continue to take as many courses as possible with Dr. Padiak. She is FANTASTIC! You DO have to attend her lectures, but it's worth it! Her testing style is detailed but relevant to the course material. She is extremely helpful, always available for questions and converstation in class, lab, office hours and your own time. AMAZING!

I think she's a nice lady but it's hard to say anything positive about her other than she's prompt to class. Apart from her lecturing style completely sucking the life out of the subject matter her tests (both in length and difficulty)seem ridiculous for a first year class and test peripheral knowledge rather than the central facts.
This class was the only class where i actually had to read the text.  She asked questions from the text her questions: either you know it or u dont.  You actually have to work for the grade here
Don't rely solely on the notes she posts...

Her testing style is ridiculous. She asks the most extraneous questions with details that DO relate to the material that she has covered, but don't actually have much to do with the subject. She asks about famous persons perisheing from diseases that she's covered, but she may have mentioned them offhandedly between 'umm' and 'uhh'. She is testing

Favourite professor at Mac, I have taken every class with her that I can and plan to take as many more as I can, her best class is Anthro 2FF3 because she is better with small groups, she has some difficulty speaking but she is always willing to correct herself.  Always helpful, Fair tests, Very interesting, Great attitude towards students
Nice lady.  Gets lost sometimes, but answers your questions and addresses concerns.  Make sure you take notes in class.
Great prof - nice to her students and responsive.  It's a difficult course, but it's taught well.

She seems to get distracted and lose track of material all the time. You really have to make a personal attempt to make the course interesting because her voice drowns out all initial interest I brought into the course.
I failed by 2 % and no help!
Took this Fall/04.  Dr. Padniak was a very good lecturer.  Interesting lecture material.  Nice prof.  Very helpful.
Interesting material, but ineffective prof
Nice teacher, says umm to much in lecture.. waaay too much but overall a nice, fair  teacher

Yeah, pretty much horrible at lecturing. She should NOT be paid to talk in front of people, let alone students. Half the time she doesn't remember the point she's trying to make, and if she doesn't have the slides in lecture, she's LOST as to how to lecture. I like the slides, but she's just horrible with public speaking.
Absolutely terrible at lecturing. This class *should* be amazing, but is stale and filled to the brim with "uhm"s.
uhhh...uhh well uhh she needs to uhh stop saying UHHH!
CAN'T TEACH

The material covered in the class was interesting, but it was her lectures that were very confusing, she'd just talk about it in a monotoned voice, rather than actually explaining and what not. Marking wise, the exam was fair except for the multiple choice, her mc's screwed people over for final/midterm..but a helpful prof always willing to explain
I agree, interesting material made unbarable by her stale lectures and bad marking on the midterm/exam.  Take one of the other interesting anthro classes such as 2p03 or 2x03
She made 2u03 my favourite elective! Very organized lectures, very helpful, and great attitude towards the students.

Dr. Padiak was great, her powerpoint slides were super easy to follow. She was helpful and approachable. The course was extremely interesting and she was a very fair marker IF YOU DID THE WORK! (Even took questions off the mid term that the class didn't do well on)
She marked unfairly and her lectures were unorganized and difficult to follow... overall the content of the class was interesting but she made it unbearable.

comments: bruh his exam was a literally cancer lmao

His test and exam breakdowns are misleading, and do not fully reflect what was learned in the course. Most exam material came from lectures (which were one hour per week) instead of the plentiful of modules that were assigned. His lecturing style is very difficult to comprehend, as he does not articulate well. Material is decently interesting tho..

The breakdown of the course is different due to the past complaints from previous years. This year, the midterm was worth 25% while tutorial and a group project were worth 10 each, online quizzes in total added to 10% making the final exam 45%. This prof is passionate about what he teaches, you're going to be in trouble if you already hate cell Bio

I am thankful to have had this guy. Honestly. Explains well and marks fair.  Might wanna watch out for the course coordinator Alison.  She is as beautiful on the inside as she is on the outside if you catch my drift.
The course is hard but he weighs the final exam more to compensate for the midterm. He's not a bad guy- seems to care about the wellbeing of students but rushes through the content.
really good teacher. He seems to really care about students. Tutorials are not well organized,

Not going to lie--yes, it's difficult IF you don't plan your time right and don't give time to absorb the information. The in-class lectures help put perspective on WHY we are learning  this and he's really passionate about his work and wants to share his knowledge. Hang in there, give time and it'll be rewarding. MAKE CONCEPT MAPS-it HELPS!

Biology 2B03 was poorly organized - incomprehensible professor and TAs, pointless tutorials, and unethically tested (cumulative final exam worth 50%). My TA couldn't speak English, and we were taught tutorial content in less than 15 minutes, and were given in-tutorial quizzes that were contradictory to textbook material and made zero sense.

one midterm and one final exam, a few tutorial marks... overall a bad course set up. Prof is hard to understand, Tells us to watch modules that he has never watched made by previous profs. He tells us to study modules and lecture content and on the midterm he tests us on lecture content and textbook....
Amazing professor. I enjoyed going to this class. One of the best courses I have ever taken. Learned a lot.

He is a great guy, knows what he is talking about. But the methods of testing was not fair I think. Yes the papers seemed usless at the time, but they came in handy for 3rd year. As for the midterms, could of tested on course materical. Final = no relation to course content. Just enzymes, molecules, or kinases...no application.
cant believe he took off the discussion forums cause people were complaining!
I enjoyed this course. I disagree with the comments below. Claerly some did not attend classes. I think most students would agree that Igdoura is a great professor who really cares about his students

The structure he implemented was a massive failure. 20% based on writing papers on concepts loosely tied to the material, 20% based on memorizing hundreds of multiple choice questions and their answers - that the students created! And 60% on a final based on lecture material we had never been tested on before that was extremely nitpicky with detail

Never taking this prof again!! Very unfair way of testing our knowledge...we had two midterms, that were on very complex journal articles where we basically got 400 questions to memorize. Then the exam was 60%, on stuff never tested on during the term. And whoever wrote that comment about the students just being lazy is probably not a student.

Awful course, I regret taking it. Way too much workload (1000 word essay every other week) and the only time you're tested on lecture material is the final exam; all the midterms are based on 6 complicated journal articles you have to read and memorize. Probably one of the worst courses I've taken.

Don't be deceived by the previous comment. Dr. Igdoura wrote that. Igdoura doesn't structure his course well which makes it much more difficult for students. 40% of mark is for reviews barely related to course material. Other 60% is the exam. Cause of this the workload is very high since assignments dont contribute to exam study.
Actually I was in class, and everything I said in the review was true.

Terrible prof, mumbled to himself so you can't hear the last half of his sentences. The tests were based on review articles we had to summarize in tutorial and not on class material, while there was a 60% exam at the end. Not helpful towards students, even ignored one student who went to his office for help.
he is an amazing proffesor. very clear, very helpful. i love going to his class.
he is a very good prof the best of the best
the best of the best
No Comments

i find him VERY helpful and i could understand very well from him. his midterm was very well written. it covered most that we had learned. he is a very good prof. compared to all the other professors. very good at making us understand. i learned very much. at 1st i wasnt intrested in ur class but then after i started & u made me very interested.
excellent Prof!

a very nice prof. doesnt rush through the class. notes are very clear, and the midterm was acceptable too. very interactive with the class. veven brought coffee for the class. Just make sure u never sleep in his class, otherwise he will point u out for everyone. a little sarcastic tho.
*sigh* boring lectures, rambled a lot. Extremely unhelpful when asked questions, particularly one-on-one.

regradless of what people said here, I find him a fantastic prof.  There are a lot of people that ask dumb questions and they should be given a condesending reply. He tries to imcorporate the lab into his lectures which makes them much more interesting. GREAT PROf, HE BROUGHT US COFFEE!!!.

Likes to ramble, responds to student questions in an unhelpful condescending manner (ie. student - How does this work? prof - You tell me, how DOES it work?), was consistently 3-4 lectures behind the other prof's section (due to rambling)...

Ok prof. His test was ridiculous (ie:asked about stuff we hadn't learned) and still did nothing to help us out when almost the whole class complained. Note: When he says "only study from your notes," don't listen USE THE TEXT!
Umm...hmm...didn't leave much of an impression either way.  I do know he wasn't much help.  Bioware was far more effective!
No Comments
If you fall aslepp in the back of the lecture hall, he'llnotice....believe me.
Yeah, how *does* that guy know his midterm mark?
i just find it interesting that the person before me can boast about their midterm mark before the final midterm marks have even been posted....
Total jerk. makes students feel dumb in class. stopped going to lecture after 2 weeks got an A on the midterm, useless
No Comments
was the better of the two profs

comments: Dr. Colarusso is without doubt one of the smartest people I've ever met. His CV is insane (Ivy League school educated and an ex-White House advisor to name a few things), and he's unconventionally hilarious. That being said, he's about 10 minutes late to class every day. Lots of reading and coursepack annotating, but if you do that you're solid.
Excellent professor. Tests are very straightforward.
The easiest class i've taken in my life.

Very impressive and inspirational, his work interested me as I went to find more of his classes, I very much enjoyed the mythology and comparisons as well as learning a lot from this professor. Though it's a tough class it'll be easier just keep up with the readings since to follow along in lectures. Just have or buy all the books, its worth it!

Get Ready to Read, when you do you'll enjoy his amazing lectures even more. Although if you aren't interested in mythology it'll be tough. He is accessible outside of class & he is respectful, caring & gives great feedback in addition to being really funny. Overall, a very good professor, tons to read. He does very impressive work and knows a lot

give him any word out there ad he KNOWS its origins. Linguistics mastermind. HILARIOUS and entertaining, and you wouldn't guess he's about 75. He's super helpful and gives OPEN BOOK tests. The upper year classes are by nature difficult though. Thats why he once raised the whole classes average by 10% !!!
Difficult to follow in lecture, but very wise and kind to talk to. Very helpful when spoken to in office hours. Open book tests!

Dr. Colarusso is brilliant. If you do the work and readings then class notes and lectures will be a refresher of what you should already know, and thus should not be confusing. Best professor I ever had (graduated now)
Genius!!! Was able to list the background and origin of any word.
Amazing teacher. Tests are fairly easy and only require at least a day of studying. Really impressed with this course great elective

This guy is badass. His knowledge is deep, and he will often give more information than needed, but it's so interesting that it enriches the experience. Coursepack and tests are straightforward. Some texts only for interest (like Rig Veda). Seems a bit intimidating b/c of how much he knows, but talk to him. He's pretty chill. Take this class!
AWESOME PROF!!! really funny! cracks jokes all the time!!!
Utterly charming, brilliant, and wonderful to talk to if you know your stuff.
He knows an incredible amount but often doesn't speak or write clearly. He is often very late for class and misses quite a few.

Colarusso is an extremely intelligent man, who knows way more than many professors I've had. BUT, he is a terrible teacher, and is very inconsistent with his notes and lectures. He doesn't so much teach as he just talks and makes scribbles on the board. And as mentionned above, he is always late/misses a lot of class which makes the class suffer.

Clear lectures, all notes in coursepack, tries to make it entertaining - but VERY unreliable. Misses a lot of class. Was 15 mins late on 20% test day. Always tells us "test results will be up by [this date]" or "new notes will be on webct by [this date]" and they never are. Took 2 WEEKS for results of a scantron test and never updated us.
Nice guy, funny. LOVE that he put all the lecture notes in a coursepack. Rest of the books are kind of pricey though. Lectures are very clear. Sounds EXACTLY like Robin Williams !!
Absolutely amazing! Very helpful with any questions you might have. Knows way too much for a regular human being. Many believe him to be a spy. It would not surprise me at all.
He's a pretty intelligent guy. If he made his lectures more coherent he would be an amazing professor.
To all of those that were complaining that he missed alot of classes- That is because his Dad passed away- who lived in the states.

Incredibly intelligent, the class was interesting, he's a great lecturer... when he has class. He was about 15 minutes late to every class, and cancelled at least 8 classes... he obviously loves the subject but doesn't seem to value the class.
He goes on a lot of conferences so he is pretty much never there and when he does show up to class it is usually 20 mins late. Anthro 2G03 easy, 3G03 confusing and not a bird
A good prof. Very smart. I went to his office and he talked trash about other profs... that made me uncomfortable. I had some of those other profs and thought that they are okay.
Wow...don't know what to say about this course...however...take Anthrop 2G03 with him...easy as pie!
Colorusso is the best prof EVER!!!  He's hilarious and his tangents make the course!  He's super intelligent (knows way too much) and helpful if you ask for help.  Recommend this class to everyone!!

Colarusso is the man! His humour sells the class no matter how confusing the myth may be. Runs an excellent elective since he knows it's an elective (thus, easy tests if you study). Knows so much it blows my mind.

Okay, everyoneted phonetics, and Dr. C. is pretty chaotic with his       approach.  But what a great prof.  For phonology he is already awesome, so knowledgeable and such a great sense of humour.  You can tell how passionate he is about learning.
this class was so much fun,,,the myths are really entertaining to read,,,a good elective
Dr. C is awesome. As someone mentioned, the dry humor is fantastic. And he knows what he's talking about, he always knows ridiculous amounts about everything. He rocks my little world.

Dr. Colarusso is wickedly witty, in the driest possible way (I happen to like dry wit).  I really enjoy the linguistic snippets he includes with the mythology material.  It adds depth and context to the tales of the past.
Awsome class and the prof is very knowledgable and at ease in lecturing.
He's great at doing what he does; very enthusiastic about myth and very intelligent.  Everyone must take this class.
He's very enthusiastic and knowledgeable.  And the subject manner is great.  He also knows how to make it clear and can make it very amusing.

First off, his classes are not hard...however, 3G03 is definitely a great deal harder than 2G03.  He's always late for class, very Jekyll & Hyde with his behaviour (as someone mentioned, don't talk when he is).  Go for the class/content, not for the prof!

Fantastic!  Did go off sometimes, but can't blame him, he knows so much!!  very interesting topic, take the class, especially if youre into myths..brilliant man (but don't talk while he's teaching......I warned you!!!!)
go to 2g3 for laughs and fun, avoid 3g3 to save yourself a bunch of stress trying to figure out what he's talking about...knows way too much info.
such an interesting prof...really good course
Way too smart to be teaching the likes of us. An inspiring guy though. Especially when he talks about politics.
More than fair with marks. Colarussian Tangents keep subject matter interesting.
Loved him!Not for every1.Doesn't suffer fools.Brilliant, funny, goes on tangents
Dr. Colarusso is very demanding and doesn't like students who ask questions.
The man is a genius. Invented voice recognition, Circassian, and the deathray.
He's not a bad prof, but he does tend to go off on tangents a bit.
avoid at all costs

comments: Great prof, fun to listen to !
if u go to all the classes and read the material and attend tutorials its a guaranteed A- However u should know how to write good essays and discussions.

Dr. Rodman is fantastic and reaffirmed my choice to take on a second major in anthropology. I am now in third year anthro&artsci and continue to reference the information Rodman taught in 1A03 in all of my classes. Extremely helpful and encouraging, and surprisingly engaging for large class sizes. Wonderful!

Dr. Rodman is pretty much the reason why I chose anthropology as a major. He's an effective speaker and all around interesting individual when he tells you about Vanuatu. His Monday 9:30 class was the one morning class I did not dread going to.

Course was boring.  Tutorials were boring and a complete waste of time.  Text was expensive and not useful, and it's an edited version so you can't sell it back.  Final paper was about a topic never discussed in lecture.  Talked too much about his own personal fieldwork.  If I hear Vanuatu one more time......

super prof! so interesting and engaging. you MUST ATTEND LECTURES!! you'd have to have half a brain to attend lectures and still fail the exams! SO easy to pick up the concepts in class. makes even an early morning class good, with very interesting and eyeopening lectures. Highly recommended prof if you're willing to put in a little effort!
well-structured lectures, provides clear expectations for lectures, did not give a heavy workload, relevant readings and packages, interesting content, very fun guy.
Not very helpfull more supportive of female students than male.  Does not support open classroom discussions. Ivory tower prof!

He is super friendly and I learned a lot from him. Where else can you watch Survivor in class? Amazing. You have never been so well prepared for an assignment or test in your life unless you've been in one of his classes. I'd take a class with him any day. Sets somewhat high standards but makes them achievable with plenty of help.

he is the nicest prof i think i have met at Mac. he is soo sweet and nice and so smart. his lectures are so interesting. nothing like you will ever see at mac. he doesnt lecture but more tell stories and his experiences. a really eye opener. hes so great. one of the best i have had. test are kinda hard tho.. KNOW YOUR LECTURES IN DETAIL!!!

His lectures are by far the easiest to sit through and remember. No lecture notes posted, same format for every course (midterm with 3 essay Q's), Essay for assignment, essay final exam. This class was a cooler version of Anthro 1A03 and more intimate. For the person who was upset that he told you shut up - who cares? youre in university shut up.

I found this professor arrogant and unreasonable.  Refused to consider a doctor's note for an assignment that was one day overdue.  Forced to drop the class.  Unpleasant experience, and have avoided him ever since.

I felt like he was talking to himself a lot because he was very focused on his fond memories of his fieldwork and little else.  Seemed arrogant. I had hoped this first year course would have been a lot more than it ended up being, because he didn't delve into a lot, there were very few topics really.  But the lecture about AIDS in africa was good.

Interesting lectures as he speaks about topics with conviction.However, alittle too much talk about his fieldwork.I really disliked when he told students to "shut up" during lectures! An educated man such as himself should be able to think of more appropriate ways to ask for silence!
ok....boring....could be better....pay more attention to T.A. selection
BOOOOORing!!!!!!!!!
He talks too much about himself and then goes around in circles. I was waiting for like 25 mins for him to come to a simple conclusion. The course could be SOOO much better. But his voice is calming!

If you don't know how to write and essay ASK.  The tests are fine just attend lecture.  I really enjoyed his lectures, and he seems like a great guy.  His stories regarding topics and personal anecdotes are great and useful for remembering the material.
Great story teller, tends to be a little self-obsessed with his fieldwork, sooooothing voice but nice man overall
Although stories are occassionally interesting, 90% of course is essays... if you like that kind of stuff.
the best lectures to go to by far... his lectures are like telling a story... so great, its interesting and I have NEVER fallen asleep in lecture, as he talks so passionately about the topics...
Good teacher, lectures are interesting, not enough time for the midterm though, talks ALOT about his own fieldwork.
I like Dr. Rodman because he reminds me of my dad!
My favourite class this term "Storytime with Rodman" I wouldn't miss this class for anything just because it's so good.  He has a very soothing voice... sometimes makes me sleepy.
very interesting, enthusiastic. voice makes you sleepy though
horrible, not approachable, annoying, rude, self-absorbed, highly conceited, ****.
Easily one of the best profs ever. He really organizes his lectures well and knows a lot about the issues he discusses.  This was one of my favourite classes all because of him.
He's passionate about what he does... but he has the ability to make you fall asleep.
No Comments
No Comments
One of the best profs i've had!!
most 'prepared for class' prof I've ever had, very interesting, crystal clear
He's really interesting, best teacher in the department.
No Comments
scariest man alive
Great class
Very Passionate about his job!
Religion, Magic & Witchcraft... a great elective course!

comments: I took this class online, and it was awful. If you ask for help or guidance, he makes you feel like you're being disrespectful if you say his directions aren't clear to you. Skip this class. Skip anything he teaches, unless you like professors that tell you to "google it" when you ask for help.  Never had a professor at ODU that's so disappointing.
Didn't look at the text book. I enjoyed his lectures because he made them funny. Overall, I liked him, but not the class.

While I don't agree with all of his ardently left-wing views, he made many good points. He gives the marks people deserve. His lectures are lively, but he is  distant and almost unapproachable in person. He seems to be a polarizing figure. I happened to like him. It's unfortunate that he has to leave this school.

Awful prof. Horrible class. Dreaded going.Lecture is incredibly pointless, all you need is his ?list of words? and you?re good to go.  Class consisted of words that were not even relevant to the material, his life, the thrift store, and how none of us are individuals. Also, the text book was opened a few times to look at the glossary. Enough said.
ENG 1BB3: Lectures are difficult to follow, little connections to the readings, and rants a lot. Very high expectations for first a year course, not easy to approach or talk with.
Horrible professor. I did my readings and did not attend class and still managed a good mark though. All he did was talk about himself. His lectures were a waste of time

Marc is horrible! All he talks about was himself and his cheap deals.. like his hugo coat he got at the Goodwill. During the CSCT class I had he went on and on about Walmart and the same topics everyday. I'm glad he's no longer at McMaster, him leaving made room for a meaningful professor.

I took four of his classes and can't get enough, his anecdotes, images, and examples help you to apply critical thinking to everyday life. He is one of the few FAIR teacher at McMaster, acknowledging hard work and effort. It is best to get to know this professor you'll learn a lot from him.
Approachable, Somewhat of a hard marker but will help you 100% if youre in need. Great guy.

Anti-intellectual.  Seems more interested in confirming his existing half digested ideas and building a posse of mindless followers than doing real research. Thinks he's subversive for his bargain-bin wedding (which he'll show slides of in class).  This isn't subversive, it's shopping around.

Honestly, I'd have to say that if students weren't 'getting anything' from his lectures, they were too put off by his manner to actually absorb anything. Personally, I think he's just trying to get students to mean what they say, and to stand behind it. Engage the material, participate in class, and do you work. It's that simple. (Or is it?)
... Marc*

March is overwhelming! I could only get the best out of this class by dropping everything else and, since that wasn't an option, I had to drop the class. However, I still attended lecture - his lectures are THAT GOOD. The courseware was a tough read. If you aren't CSCT background, you'll cry (while simultaneously worshiping Ouellette).

I've had this prof a total of 3 times.  Each time my experience with him got worse and worse.  He is the most conceited professor ever.  Attending his classes (which he makes attendance mandatory) was not only a waste of your time, but also your money.  All he does is talk about himself and rambles on about things that are completely unrelated
Great prof, just stay ontop of your work!
Talks too much about himself. The articles are not connected to the learnings of the course. Felt like I hardly learned a thing in this subjectively taught class

Very intelligent man with great lectures and anecdotes. Every student is able to succeed if they're willing to do what's required of them, and yes, sometimes that means asking the professor for help. He rewards hard work with high marks and punishes laziness with low marks. Makes sense to me!

I have taken 2 classes with Dr. Ouellette and I did find him intimidating the first time.  I had trouble with exam writing and as a result my final grade sucked.  The second time I took his class however, I worked up the courage to ask for help and found him genuinely interested in helping me to overcome my problems. Overall, great prof!
I found him interesting to listen to, and he uses a lot of media clips etc. in his lectures. The guidelines for assignments are a little vague, but beyond that he seems to be quite entertaining.

Completely pretentious, arrogant, and self-centred. Although he is an interesting prof that makes you want to attend class, you get little out of it. You'll find yourself learning more about his life then your course--and then end up screwed on assignments and exams. If you can put up with him, he's a cool guy--but a bad prof.

completely pretentious. I constantly run into people who consider him one of the worst english profs. was obsessed with himself and was constantly talking about his own life. Its clear that he thinks he is a young, cool, hip prof when hes the complete opposite. He clearly likes what he does, but he is really whats wrong with eng profs.

Love him or hate him, he was interesting to listen to. He could have been more clear in his essay guidelines as to what we're expected to write, however his essay writing methods changed how I write/view essays. I've taken to living out the lifestyle that this course represents and it has made me happier as a person. So despite u all, I liked him.

Very interesting and, although some find this to be his downfall, uses various examples in his slides to make reference to the assigned readings and key words/concepts. Dare I say it? Those who did poorly or thought he made no sense, were most likely not thinking critically enough.

horrible prof. arrogrant, and self righteous. plays clear favourites in class. lecture slides need to be decoded before anyone can comprehend. goes on and on about how much better waterloo is over mac, how easily he forgets exactly whom is paying him thousands of dollars to teach. lies to students. i've nothing good to say about this prof.

Passionate about what he's teaching but goes off on huge tangents about his own personal opinions (which he tries hard to get us to take at face value). He seems pretentious, and judgemental against those whom he considers "trendy". P.S. tries too hard to seem laid-back, cool, and funny.

Prof has clear favourites, no clear guideline of expectations. Textbook has no support for his lectures. His lectures have nothing to do with the terms he gives you, often goes on tangents and you wonder what you did in class that day. Course was somewhat interesting, not recommended as a 'bird' course.

Great lecturer, Loved it. Assignments were very vague, "if someone asks what i want on an essay, i tell them... I don't know" his lecture notes don't relate to the text book ideally, his key concepts and terms are undefined. (could be clearer with that). Assuming ridiculously difficult examination, even if i did know how to write a test.
cocky, rude, and arrogant.  very unapporachable and critical...i didn't learn anything for a whole semester.

I can see what some might object to his teaching style, but frankly, why bother being in school if you can't stand to have your opinions questioned?  Either way, can't be denied that he's one of the hardest working profs at mac, gives you more feedback on each assignment then some profs will give you all year. Not to mention briliant lectures
Very arrogant and goes on a lot of tangents.

A veritable broken record; once he taught us the same lecture twice. Nobody said anything because he is THAT unapproachable. Frankly, I can't decide if I'm offended by or OK with him talking about Otherness like he owns it. What do you know, you privileged white male (risking ad hominem)?. But that one's a tricky. Enjoyed reading selection, though.

Complain complain complain.  Completely pretentious, and has clear favourites.  Has no problem with singling out people who come in late to class.  Has a sick phobia of laptops, constantly thinking people are looking at eBay or Facebook rather than paying attention to his repetitive lectures.  So far left, that avid liberals would hate him.

The only thing he truly taught us is that his way of doing things is the best and that "everything sucks". The class had potential, but I couldnt stand his cockiness. And the exam was impossible to complete in 2h.

Professor Ouellette made bad movies palitable, he is a prof that is not only good in his field but is a good teacher. Not many profs seem to be interested in teaching or passing on thier knowledge. Mark stands out, but be prepared to work for him, since he works so hard for you.

He's very challenging and he does have clear favourites.  I found him interesting and engaging, but it seemed like we went off on tangents a lot.  The material was super and I enjoyed the class overall though.  The exam was brutal - most of us felt he didn't give us enough time to finish.  However, I loved the cultural issues we addressed.

felt like the class had so much potential to be interesting,inspiring and informative...but i felt like we never acheived anything... lectures are constantly hearing people tell personal (and unrelated stories)and like someone else said, he has clear favourites and if you want good marks you'd better be one of them. readings & films were great.

Marc is a great prof, perhaps one of the best! Unlike some CSCT profs @ Mac, Marc realizes that his students don't have a lot of prior knowledge in the field and breaks down theoretical issues into understandable terms. He makes you see both sides of the picture and is very helpful during office hours. It'll be sad to see him go.

One of the most amazing profs Mac has to offer...really cares about what he is teaching and it shows.  His classes will change the way you look at the world.  Tough, but fair marker.  I admire his teaching style, which engages discussion and forces you to actually think. He lives his teachings,and after taking his class you will probably want to to
No Comments
Marc is a god among men. One of the greatest and most influential people I have ever met in my life. Thanks for opening my eyes.
Probably the funniest and nicest prof ever. Makes me laugh

You guys can say what you want about Marc but trust me you'll miss him when he's gone. You can't expect to get another CSCT prof like this in your lifetime. Not only does he know his**** but he actually lives it and I honestly can't say that about all the other CSCT profs here at Mac.

"In the serious play of questions and answers... the rights of each person are in some sense immanent in the discussion... The polemicist , on the other hand, proceeds encased in privileges that he possesses in advance and will never agree to question." - Michel Foucault. According to Foucault's definition, Dr. Ouellette is definitely a polemicist.

I'm split between these comments. On one hand, Marc can be a very accepting professor. On the other, he can be very elitist and harps being a professor (which seems to go against the grain of the Cultural Studies field). He's fair though, and all in all, I do respect him.

Marc's a very intelligent man,and he'll always listen to you point of veiw, regardless of whether or not is supports his own. He doesn't just take your words for they're worth, he likes to challenege his students to think about factors that they may not have otherwise. If you're not use to that,then it can come across as condescending.And He's hot!

At first I enjoyed the lectures. However, after visiting Dr. Ouellette in his office the only way I can characterize him is elitist jerk. He makes people feel inadequate despite his all accepting appearance. He may know text book, but he needs to learn social skills.

Excellent prof! Fair marker and by no means a closed-minded person. No one said you had to "blindly" believe everything a prof says but what he teaches makes sense and it's up to you whether to believe it our not. He answers your questions w/ questions to make you think for yourself, which is good!  AMAZING an very INTERESTING prof!  Excellent!!!!!

Stubborn, closed-minded, extreme, condescending, aggresive, unfair...he is exactly what universities should do without. To the student that said that anyone who thinks he's not brilliant is a "closed-minded hypocrite"...at the university level anyone should know better than to believe (blindly) in every single thing the prof says.
Brilliant brilliant brilliant...and not too hard on the eyes either ;)
marc is an amazingly intelligent man and incredibly hot to boot.
No Comments

The only way you can find Marc not brilliant is if you are one of the closed minded hypocrites he is trying to open up. His willingness to help students is incredible and despite previous comments, he is not condescending, but he forces you to think for yourself instead of giving you all of the answers. He is exactly what universities need more of.

I loved listening to his lectures b/c he's a very smart prof & has very interesting points to make. But the class overall made me feel stupid b/c I didn't understand a lot of the overall concepts. And his exam was the hardest exam I've ever written. He uses words & phrases that are waaaay too complicated. He needs to learn what simplicity means.

A very enthusiastic, passionate guy. Yes, he's opinionated, but I really think he tries to respect everyone else's thoughts (and in a counter cultures class, we did have a lot of people who loved the Gap). He can get a bit off topic but lectures are always a good time and he'll stretch your mind.

He seems like a fun guy in class, but is not very nice in one-on-one situations. The class was interesting, but it was hard to get past his know-it-all demeanor. Also,the exam questions were ridiculous. I'm not a fan...

Hardest exam ever!! don't even bother studying...but that being said, he knows his stuff inside and out..has examples of EVERYTHING and presents the material in an appealing way but if you are looking for an easy course, this isn't for you, esp if he's the prof..2 essays & 1 exam seems easy but bewa

He's a little intimidating at first, but his method of lecturing is absolutely perfect for cultural studies! He is engaging, entertaining, & life changing. Please, to be fair, you must put as much effort into the course as he does. Do not go into a class of his expecting an EZ ride! A brilliant man!

His class was very intresting and I learned alot from the class. But, seems a little condesending to anyone who disagreed with him. Also, found it hard to understand some things that were explained in lecture. It would be good to read the textbook since most of the stuff he talks about is in there.
Very random... dunno the point

Very narrow minded/hypocritical. In a class that encourages free thought, he really doesn't value the thought of the students (b/c it's oppositional to what he believes). Assignments are ludacris, very unclear objectives. Also, a very convoluted lecturer. This class was a waste of time and money.

Marc cares about his students and giving them their money's worth! He's passionate, incredibly intelligent and absolutely hilarious- which makes going to class fun. The course material is always interesting but challenging- be prepared to study hard when taking his classes!
No Comments

K enough with the "in your grill" comment Marc!Even if you paid me to be in his grill i wouldn't be there. His material is confusing and all he talks about his is own "counter cultural" life yet he is just like everyone else! He wants us to believe that he is superior but thats just not the case!!!

1 on 1 Marc is great, But as a prof he makes students outside of his ‘cliche’ feel uncomfortable in class. A lot of the material is taken right out of the readings and very repetitive, as well the assignment outlines are vague. Course content had the potential to be good but I was disappointed!
This prof cares. Knows his subject inside and out. Recommended readings and strategies that helped me thru a family crisis related to the course topic. Incredible!!!

Funniest prof, incredibly accessible. Stays after calls til every question answered. Incredibly patient, even with the narrow-minded, homophobes, bigots and cellphones. Makes you think and won't hold your hand.

If I had to take another one of his courses, I would seriously change schools. He is a biased, horrible, petty, small minded prof. I love cultural studies, and he almost ruined the entire discipline for me. If you don't agree with him, watch out, you will be penalized.
No Comments

One of the worst (probably the worst) teachers I have ever had.  "Get up in my grill about it" he'll say, then when you do, he cries like a baby.  Looks too hard for examples to back things up..when you look to hard..you find what isn't there.
Knows the material inside and out - really makes you think. Can pull examples out of anywhere!

Hated...penalized my friend and I on marks because we did not participate...gave dirty looks when we entered the class.  I felt like I was unwelcome to even go to my class that I paid for! He also relied on student presentations and corrected the info.
Wicked Prof!!  He knows his stuff, and considering the tough subject matter he teaches (gender and sex) he proves to be even more stellar!
It was a great class.  I learned alot...especially considering it was a second year class.  If it wasn't my final year...I'd take another class with you!  Thanks for a great term!
No Comments
he's great - interesting, witty and approachable.  Also pretty cute ;)
Marc, you have made me consider majoring in Cultural Studies. You have incredible life and you have such a strong passion for the subject matter. Thanks! BM

Readings a bit convoluted, but the course is not dependent on thorough understanding of them as compared to ability to discuss the issues raised in class.  Ouellette runs a good discussion and keeps it interesting.
the guy could do stand up AND he's brilliant
readings are tough, but lectures are kewl

comments: Knowledgable prof, teaches what's necessary. You don't really need to go to class for this course because tutorial/lab/group project account for most of your grade but whenever I went I didn't regret going.
Classes were taught well and grading was very fair. There was nothing that would catch you off guard if you attended lecture/tutorial.
Take the time to do the bonuses and you could be walking into the exam only requiring 75% to get an A+

Great teacher very clearly wants to take the time so that everyone understands whats going on. Often does lengthy problems in class so its good to go to them. Tutorials were incredibly helpful in understanding the lecture material. Great teacher,great labs, papa johns.

Great course, loved the material, Doyle gets alot of flak but I feel like hes an amazing teacher. He obviously cares about us learning and really goes deep with the material. The Labs are really hard but nothing un-managable.
Had him for 2di4 and 2dp4 and I'm sad that he isn't teaching  upper year courses.  He kept it professional and his notes were great even if the lectures were a little bland.

Great guy! He's really helpful if you dont understand things. His exam and his midterms are crazy easy. As long as you go to class and just pay attention, you will do well. I took bare minimum of notes in his lectures. Just listened and everything made sense.

I had Dr. Doyle for both 2DI4 and 2DP4.  He is a great Professor who has a very fair system of assessments. Lecture attendance is highly recommended - his midterm and exam questions are mainly from lectures, tutorials and labs. I'd also recommend going to tutorials or at least following them on your own as they provide substantial help in labs.
Makes digital logic very easy to understand. Crystal clear during lectures. Study lecture notes and labs and its an enjoyable course. Textbook is a must.

You gotta attend lectures and pay attention if you wanna get a 12. The exam was extremely easy and the questions were the EXACT SAME as the practice questions done in the lectures. Labs took a lot of time, but they are a lot of fun. Amazing course!
As long as you go to class, pay attention to what he says, take good notes and do the lab properly this class is an easy class. Also the tutorials were very well done by Omar.

The final project is a lot of work. He was very confusing as to what was required in the project. His lectures are very dry. The lab portion of this course requires practice to do well, and the tutorial tests portion also take some practice. Put some work in this course and you can do well.
You had to make an appointment to see him, and it never fit into any of my group's schedule.  The material is boring and wasn't explained fully. The TA's are good though.
He has a very soft voice--lulls you to sleep. But he knows what he's talking about and he teaches it pretty decently.

Dr. Doyle gave us a fantastic 'cap-stone' project for first year Engineering. We used 3D printers to do prototyping... Problem was if you didn't go and talk to the TAs frequently about the details of the project, I'm sure you would be totally lost. Very exciting, although very confusing.
He doesn't put everything clearly. some problems are not responded until last minute. marking scheme is weird too. he even doesn't tell students there is bonus mark and attendance mark.

He is a nice in person, but his class is terrible. You pay big buck to learn something you could learn in autoshop back in school, and from textbook. Attendance is marked. Labs are easy. Tutorials are ok. Practice available - none. Textbooks - useless, only cover first half of the course. Dc. Doyle does provide a lot of help with TAs and in person.
Very helpful. Favourite prof/class first year engineering.. He makes everything crystal clear with course and assignment guidelines. He's a pretty nice guy too!

Didn't care too much for him.  Lectures are almost pointless but he takes marks off for not attending.  Most of the material is learned in labs and tutorials.  All in all a very nice and smart guy though!
he needs to be louder and more engaging

Was a very easy prof when it came down to giving info about tests and such. Clear, understandable but would always come off as a rude guy when talking to him one on one. Would be happy to have him as my prof for other courses

he is a great prof. the course was a joke, i loved it. its a loc of drawing thats true but labs are very interesting. i found lecture a bit boring cause i knew all the material since i had done a similar course in high school. at the end of the course you will have a very interesting project, but its a lot of work.
This course is horrible. Ruined by average.

Awesome course!  Extremely organised, clear and concise.  Lots of work but kind of necessary, and enjoyable.  I learned so much about visualisation through those assignments.  Lectures where crystal and to the point.  Labs a bit of a pain.  Definitely time consuming tutorial assignments, but so rewarding.  Great Job!

A very bad professor I had in first year. I remember I had d04 in first term and at the 2nd of term 60% of my class had dropped the course. Assumes a lot of prior knowlege. Does not help new programers. Cannot teach programming properly. PROS:- marking scheme makes it not as tuf for students to fail course.
His learning curve was way too steep for beginners, and the tutorial assignments were a huge waste of time, not even relevant to what we were studying!
Nice guy but in class he i the biggest ****! Couldn't stand that class...and the labs were garbage.
No Comments
Not bad, but went too fast at the beginning for those of us new to programming.  Way too much work, between assignments and lab reports.
Crappy prof

Lol.. i never noticed his great collection of sweaters.. but i noticed that he assumes WAYYY to much prior knowledge. The labs and assignments just killed me.. and i died of laughter every time he answered a question with.. it's in the lab manual. lol! But somehow i managed to understand everything.. and appreciate him. he wasn't that bad actually!
i spent so much time on those labs...just killer

I met this teacher and he was very nice, and very helpful.  This was totally the opposite in the lectures... he went so fast that he barely had time to explain anything unless people asked him.  THIS CLASS ISNT HARD BUT IT TOOK THE LIFE OUT OF ME WITH ALL THOSE ASSIGNMENTS AND 10+ hour LABS AND WORTHLESS LAB REPORTS...

Utter piece of garbage. Don't know how he is as a guy, but as a professor, he SUCKS! He overcomplicates almost every concept like how to convert numbers into different bases. Advice: glance at this lecture notes, then find some other source on a website and read the WEBSITE to study.
not good
good prof!! assumed way too much prior knowledge.  should start more basic for us newbies.  has the greatest collection of sweaters ever. labs are challenging, but there are too many assignments
Best short form ever.  When assing (Short for assigning) variables, be sure it is clear what they represent.
Tough class.  Prof knew his stuff, but with such a large class it's hard to reach everyone.  Did a good job considering.
very boring, got in a few good naps, smart guy with potential to be a good prof, just has to make things less boring and monotone so the information can be absorbed

people who don't appreciate programming shouldn't rate this prof. He's cool. knows his stuff. tries his best to invoke interest in course. labs and assignments are challenging, but not impossible. Workload is definitely a bit too much.
Easy class. Doyle even posts msgs on the board at like 2am for help with labs. I think the problem is that he thinks the work is so easy that he can't imagine people needing help with it.

Not bad. Did the best he could given the situation he was put in (nobody likes that course...except me I guess). Looks almost identical to this guy on my res floor, who is ironcially in 2nd year Software Eng.
I think I might like programming if I had had a better professor.  It would be helpful if he was to post practice exams.
HE IS EVIL! tests on the friday NIGHT b4 reading week the test made NEEDLESLY long and no places open for food after the test! ( HE WANTS TO STARVE US ALL!)...Exam on EASTER MONDAY!
Post your damn notes on webct, instead of having us to frantically copy it during lecture.
Cannot teach.
A professor that don't even know how to spell word right, what can you expect from him???
-Assumes too much prior experience, assignments too lengthy/difficult for average skill level
He is a pretty good prof...he taught the course as good as was possible...unfortunately class was full of people who did not like programming so they complained a lot.
gotta learn how to teach, notes dont write code, code writes code. other than that, no complaints
He's not a bad prof, he just got stuck teaching a bad class that not many people liked.  It was a good class if you actually worked at it.

This class was clear, easy and logical. And the prof made it even easier. It's not his fault that his assignment is due when other assignments are due too. Why don't you complain about the other classes? I liked the class. He's a nice guy.
he is ok, just has some problem on teaching method. put notes online!
No Comments

comments: Her lectures very much lack any form of sources cited and are poorly represented, her "prezi" are basically run-on arguments about gender stereotypes and proceeded to tell the class to google the sources for her research. Its a shame this woman is allowed to teach at all considering her the quality of her work meets at best a high school level.

Course is a nightmare. Essay's responses are title is vague, don't summarize conclusion, need new content in conclusion. No suggestion on improvement just try harder. A lot of readings and videos and when doing the quiz's the questions require further research. However you have 20 mins, 10 questions and can't go back to past questions. wont respond

TL:DR -- She linked us Anita Sarkeesian videos. With a straight face.  The start of the course was alright, the beginning material was interesting and progressive. Ken Robinson's TED talks were excellent. Then the Male Hate Club started. This class degenerated into Anita Sarkessian being shoved in our faces and telling us to take her seriously.

Although she is not everyone's cup of tea, Latham is a professor who seems to genuinely enjoy teaching. She loves in-class group work and is very passionate about poetry. She always comes to class full of energy and full of passion, making 8am lectures on a Monday morning much more bearable (and maybe even enjoyable!)

I won't argue she is intelligent....but she is emotional and irrational as well..she can be tolerated if you agree with everything she says ...she twists all topics to focus on the injustices of men in society...probably a great women's studies teacher but it didn't transfer well into my class...

Had her at Mohawk College for an  online communications class. She gave unclear instructions and was very vague with her comments. Gave little justification for marks given and takes her time responding to emails making it impossible to get in contact with her.

By far the WORST teacher I've had. More results from Mohawk need to appear, as clearly results are different from Mac Uni. Hard marker but doesn't offer any suggestions, just critiques with comments like "cliche". Doesn't provide proper guidance/instructions. It's an unrelated but mandatory class and she is making the whole class fail. HORRIBLE.

Definately the best prof Ive ever had. She's incredibly intellegent and very passionate about teaching. She is a feminist which is a good thing, especially for this course. She looks at and teaches everything from a left wing perspective. Take her class if you can. Its mind boggling.
Made me actually enjoy going to lecture on friday afternoons. very dynamic and intelligent.
She's my new hero! Incredibly smart, passionate and inspiring. I'm so glad I took this course.
Amazing teacher. Incredibly smart woman.

Dr. Hunter's ratings used to be in the U of Western Ontario section (and may I add that they were very low).  It's depressing to see a professional unable to face the fact that she might have some flaws in her teaching method.  Rather than destroy the evidence of her shortcomings, perhaps Hunter would be better served to try and correct them.
No Comments
amazing!!!

without a doubt the best professor i've encountered. I'll be pursuing cultural studies because of the amazing lessons she taught. Her passion and ability to convey her ideas are amazing. Take her class, it will be one of the best you will ever take.
Had her for summer school and I actually looked forward to class! She is so hilarious yet gets her lectures across easily.  Amazing prof.. Probably one of the best in Mac.
very good prof, i treated the classes more like sermons than lectures, she is SO funny! also very intelligent, explaining the concepts very well using really good examples, shes awesome!
This prof is excellent. She is funny, witty and interesting to listen to. She has many great ideas and makes classes interesting. Best prof I have ever had!

This woman is mind blowing. I mean, where does she get all those ideas from? She speaks with so much confidence and her style of dressing really suits her personlity. This lady deserves an award for teaching. LOVE YOU dR. Hunter:)
She is the bestEnglish Professor in the world!!!!
awwwsome prof------she makes a night class soooooooooooo enjoyable. Very good explanations of concepts.

Probably one of the best classes I've taken at Mac, I usually am not a big fan of english, however, this class is unlike any english class I've taken, extremly enjoyable...She made me hate watch tv...so if you are adicit be warned...
Latham made going back to school as a mature student an experience worth going for.  Enjoyable, and fun, she made it worth going back for.  Now if only the other English profs could do the same
Obviously loves the subject she teaches, really into poetry and gives a lot to read, but spaces it out nicely. Great lectures-she really likes to get teh class involved
Best course I took at university hands down.  If you want to really learn about other forces controlling you...and learn to think critically, take any course you can with this fabulous woman.
Her knowledge of the course is incredible. She makes every lecture interesting. Nice lady too.
awesome prof, makes class worth going to, very interested in her work and has discussion based on her life and is an awesome prof
awesome prof. very passionate about the course and actually makes it interesting. makes people want to go to class.
Latham is fantastic! How can you not love a woman who brings her dog to class. Latham is very smart, helpful and cares about her students success.
No Comments

comments: If your looking for an easy grade without learning anything, then your at the wrong place. But if you want a fair prof who cares about his students and respects your ability to actually learn, then this is the prof!

This prof was amazing! He really knows his stuff and is more than willing to help you out if you are confused. Don't be afraid to go to his office hours because despite looking kinda intimidating he's actually really funny and nice! He's also really understanding and helpful to those with accommodations!

Dr. Jacobs if an amazing prof! He is very clear during his expectations in class and really wants his students to do well. He's more than willing to help although he seems intimidating. A fair warning though, he wants to make sure you actually learn the material and he's willing to make your work for your grades.

This Prof is amazing. He really cares about the material and is more than willing to help students out. He is a clear and pretty funny teacher which made coming to his classes a joy. You have to work for your grades but he is a fair marker. As long as to put in the effort the course deserves you'll do well. He's also very approachable!

A great and knowledgable professor. Explains concepts well and is helpful to students. Although assignments are challenging, Dr. Jacobs pushes students in the right direction and allows them to see concepts from a different angle.  Amazing Professor!!

He was a great prof for 2L03 (experimental design). He  cared for the students, taught us what he found interesting and important, and wanted us to think for ourselves (which becomes extremely important in upper year science courses). He seems a bit intimidating but he's actually a nice guy who wants you to do well.

where do I start? what a horrible prof. Thinks he is teaching phd students.His notes are terrible and don't include the stuff he spends the whole class talking about. U basically have to write down everything he says in class if u want to have a chance at a good great.. even then u'll be screwed by the tests
Extremely confusing way of teaching. Leads you astray while he talks abt influenza virus :S

Uses "Influenza Virus" as a vehicle for teaching course material.. leads you to believe the extra random information on the virus isn't testable when he then proceed to ask extremely difficult questions on this material. And none of it is in the courseware.
Not clear as to what information needs to be known, poor notes. Test questions unfair.
His tests were very hard!! He is a very intelligent man, but needs to make his tests easier.
terrible. the sole reason why i failed his test.

Dr. Jacobs was the worst professor I have had during my 3 years at McMaster, He would often show up to class unkept and unshaven and then begin class with a monotone voice. I once tried to approach him for help during office hours but he turned me away saying he was busy. If you need help in his class, use the TAs and the textbook.

This "teacher" is by far the worst I've had in 4 years of post secondary education. He makes simple things very complicated and speaks extremely fast. You will have to make your own notes using the textbook as your resource and attend every lecture to try and understand what he is teaching in regards to the virus information.
Very monotone. Video lectures are poor. Ineffective teaching methods. Shows up to class unkept.
*ugh* Randomly names transcription factors all class.  I hope it makes sense in his head.

despite the reviews, jacobs is actually a good prof. The material he teaches is very interesting, but it is a must to read the textbook before you get to class. Or else you'd be lost.  Make sure to write down everything he says in class as his notes aren;t great and will def. turn up in a midterm. Midterms are challenging and are application based.

A very intelligent man who has high expectations of his students. Notes are scattered and difficult to follow and he doesn't always explain things clearly, but a lot of the material is covered in the textbook. Read his exam questions carefully, they can be tricky.

I had him when it was his first time teaching first years. It seemed like it too. That being said, if you take very good notes, and are able to connect the concepts you will be fine. His questions make you think, are application based and are similar to the ones he asks at the begininng of class. He was effective, I still remember the material now.
Terribel
GOOD LUCK...THAS ALL I CAN SAY....ULL NEED IT...WERD COMPLICATED PROF...HARDTO UNDERSTAND NETHING...MAKES SIMPLE THINGS SOUND HARD...

I personally think that he is very well prepared and very smart. Him being smart is a problem because he makes questions for people that have an IQ much higher than the average, and also for students who study regularly. to new students:take a lot of noted and study every single day since the first, with this prof particularly and you'll do well ;)

Jacobs ran a tough program.  However, I enjoyed it immensely. He asked his students to understand concepts and systems; he used his own research matieral to illustrate. He was exactly what I was expecting in university, and I was disappointed by his successor.  I hope I am given the opportunity to study under him again.
No Comments

The lectures were very disorganized and many of the test concepts were based on lectures rather than his notes (which often consisted of  a few pictures and a word). There was too much emphasis on virus material - our peer mentors even stated that they were covering this material in their 4th year classes.  He talks very quickly.

Dr. Jacobs knew his stuff. I didn't attend a lot of classes, and suffered because of it, however he waws always open to questions when I didn't understand a concept and he spent time clarifying concepts. He is used to teaching upper years & first year bio is difficult to get used to. I found lectures interesting because they were in depth and new.

Very smart yet, doesn't have prof qualities, or even teacher's qualities. I think he should be rather teaching medschool students since he assumes that we know everything.Goes through material very fast, and text book did not help much

Seems like a very smart guy but he assumes too much prior knowledge, i personally didnt understand anything on attending his lectures and you cannot study his material from the textbook and he doesnt exactly have the greatest notes so u have to research the stuff urself and learn it basically....

Jacobs is a pretty bad prof... he puts all of these virus crap in and his notes are AWFUL. his tests are insanely difficult, i don't know how first year students are expected to answer them. so happy we have kajiura now.
No Comments

Terrible prof.  This could have been an interesting class if the prof seemed interested in the material at all.  His only redeming quality is that he attends all the labs and is willing to answer questions.  He assumes way to much prior knowledge.  Some introductory lectures first to teach background information would have been helpful.
