comments: McKay is a nice and brilliant man. He can sometimes be confusing or unclear, however, if you pay close attention and give him your full attention, the content is much easier to comprehend. The lon capa assignment are brutal, but beneficial even though they're only worth 3%. I found McKay to be better for 1E03(term 2 physics course) than this course

Attendance isn't really mandatory, but you can get up to 5% bonus for going and answering questions.  You will need that bonus. The lectures are alright, and some of the demonstrations are fun, but if you don't study a lot you still won't pass
Clear explanations to concepts and solutions to questions.  Really knows his stuff.
One of my favorite professors. He does have a slight lisp so try to sit a little closer in his class.

Very monotone. Difficult to understand and hear if you're sitting near the back of class. Often mumbles while writing solutions on the board, making it difficult to hear him. Tests typically followed sample test format.
explains everything well, if you ask him questions he explains it until you understand. I really enjoy his lectures.
He is an awesome prof, if you have a question, he will explain it until you understand it. Great demo's, funny.
mainly a nice guy. cool demos, very approachable and willing to answer Q

A decent prof, but can be difficult to understand. His demonstrations are good, but he has few available office hours.Tends to teach right from the text book, but posts his lecture slides online. Our class always seemed to be a few lectures behind the other lecture sections taught by other profs.
i cant understand anything this guy talk about
This course is lot harder than any other course.But mckay is nice guy if u read on ur own before going to class.He explain any topic very nicely.
Decent teacher. Pretty engaging and explains concepts good.  Demonstrations are neat.

Good prof, teaches a lot better with a blackboard than with powerpoint in ABB 102.  But that is probably true for all teachers. Things are usually clear when you focus on what he is saying.  If you don't understand, he is easily approachable and you can ask for clarification.
Don't even take physics, but after sitting in on a lecture even I understood what was going on. If you pay attention, you will understand.
He is extremely helpful... Even if u are not interested in the subject he makes u lk it
the worst professor of my entire university career.he made me hate physics for life. the WORSE professor ever.

Dr. McKay is usually very clear in his explanations, and often breaks it down to simple mathematical concepts. However, he's not very "exciting" (read: Monotone with a capital "M"), so it's easy to fall asleep in his class unless you have coffee handy. Tests were too difficult; required too much thinking for the amount of time we were given.
he makes print out slides online, but adds to them in lectures..sometimes he gets carried away and goes fast, and doesnt explain what hes doing, which can be hard to follow along
Extremely un-helpful and unresponsive to questions.  Tests were difficult, but I would consider them to be fair (test averages were all below 50%)
SAFARI. HAT.  Also happy.

Boring, not willing to write up better solutions, very little examples so there was nothing to work from, lots of mistakes in his notes and solutions, too much material covered that wasn't important so there wasn't much time to understand the material he was actually going to test, he was nice though, and one should try to go to his office hours
Brutal Class, Really hard tests and not helpful at all.  Not good at explanations, but you have to take it so what can you do, get our assignements and test
worst prof ever. transfer out of his section. youll thank me later.

Wow.. never met someone soooooo montone in my entire life.. there's something about his voice that you just can't keep up with! Assumes wayyyy too much prior knowledge.. and just NOT helpful... and tests.. what are you pple talking about.. they were horrific! class average was 40% for both of them! HE'S HORRIBLE! but not THAT bad! LOL!
The worst prof I have ever had.  Extremely unhelpful, and does not care about the students.
not the most clear prof and not very approachable. He seems to think this couse material is way to easy and expects students to get it right away. His quizzes and tests were pretty easy though
a brilliant man, horrible prof. often gets very off topic and forgets the class is waiting for him to lecture. i wish i had just gone straight into 1B03 rather than wasting my time in his course.
Good teacher, knows the math behind it all.  Not a bad lad.
hatee himm. will fall asleep in class. cant do well unless u r just good at physics anyways.

I had a couple of friends transfer out of his class because of his slight lisp.  After a few days, you don't even notice it anymore.  He's an amazing prof who knows his stuff better than any of the others.  Very glad I stayed.  Very good at teaching.
He's a nice guy, but boring and sometimes hard to understand. He's friendly and helpful.

He was kinda boring, and I slept through most of his lectures until I gave up and came to Sills' lectures instead.  I like the way he works through examples slowly, letting us think, instead of showing us how to do them.
Brilliant man, but unfortunately the brilliance seems to be contained within his head and not explained to the class. Knowing what was going on would've been a perk ...
Not approachable, not helpful, not a good prof, he's just there to research and meet his teaching requirement (and the $$$)
poor clarity

Smart guy. Very good conceptual questions in lectures. Proofs and explanations on black board confusing, all over the place and usually trails off before done explaining. Does good demos, could use some more however. Overall nice guy and not bad prof.
he's really smart but has a hard time transferring his knowledge to his students! does not review before tests and often goes too fast in his lectures.
Super awesome prof, helpful, good teacher, everything about him! FROSHIES!!! U WANT THIS PROF
Can't understand him!
nice guy, but can't teach
I am sure he is a very intelligent being, but not a good teacher. Made tests hard and exam easy. Pretty fair with that.
Confusing at times and kinda sounds like Kermit the Frog.  Does know his stuff though.
Fairly good, but sometimes confusing
he is very unclear in his way of teaching
Easy material if only if you know basic physics. Lots of exercise to practice.
Great prof...very helpful...very intelligent
Good teacher, but hard to understand (he doesn't use a mic)
very nice and helpful .. hard to understand sometimes ..
Good guy, good prof....class sucks tho...
No Comments
No Comments
Dr. McKay teaches well.  One of the best teaching profs I've encounterd so far.
He's decent, and lets remember he's working with a FREAKIN HORRIBLE class
good prof, bad lisp
He teaches good physics, I wish I had him for 1E03
Good prof, keeps it real
Easy to understand, actually bothers to teach... unlike my 1E03 prof

comments: She's great explains things clearly and tells you exactly what you need to study for her exams. The exams are also very fair without any tricks. Loved having her as a teacher.

I actually really liked her lecture style with the overheads, kept a pace that you could actually follow along with (unlike computer slides) and she had legible writing (unlike dudley). I thought she was funny, and her test questions were usually pretty fair
I passed her class (because exams were all multiple choice).....Thanks!
I enjoyed her as a professor...an she made biology interesting.Would definitely take a class with her again.The midterm was a bit of a doozy, but s*** happens!!

She doesn't respond to her emails even though she may say she does.  A syllabus would have been nice.  She does listen to student feedback which is GREAT because then she'll continue to improve!  I hate Bio before, but actually, Dr. Ellis made it bearable and I got a pretty decent mark.

excellent, knowledgable prof. clearly explains course material and is quite approachable. always posts outlines of material needed to know for the upcoming tests. tests were quite easy too; not sure why so many people did poorly. one of my highest marks this past semester.

Very tough prof. Her second midterm was a killer. Something like 62% class average and about 25% of the students failed. She told on webct that she would see the overall class average and make adjustements, when people were ****ing about how hard the 2nd midterm was. But she did not do anything!!!! She likes application type questions. Boring too!

Good prof, really cares about her students.  She always posts "what you need to know" sheets which is extremely helpful when studying.  Tests were moderate, even though alot say they are too difficult.  Overall, a good class and a good prof.

She is a very good prof., wants her students to get the highest possible marks by posting on the website "what you need to know" sheets. I think, with no offence, that those ,who didn't like the course, were thinking, prior to taking it, that they would spend the whole semester writing essays and papers, it is a science course after all!
Good prof
I could never understand Biology until I took her class. Her tests were challenging, but it is a science course.
Great Prof. First time I've ever found biology interesting. Tests and midterms are pretty easy. I highly recommend bio 1k03 with her.

She messed up everyone's marks. She didn't add some parts of the exam and gave people the wrong grades. This lady is a nightmare, simply terrible. People were arguing and insulting one another on webct because of her exam. She rarely answers webct. Makes me hate Biology. "DONOT ENROLL IN HER COURSE"

Awesome prof! Midterms were not too bad, exam was kinda difficult, posts all notes on WebCT, has a section called "what you need to know" that tells you exactly what you need to know for the midterms, and exams
Great Prof! Specified exactly what was going to be on the midterns. Posted overheads of notes on WebcT. Even reduced total for midtermd
This is a "Biology course" for "Humanities students", but her exam was so hard as if we are majoring in 4th Year Honours Biology. Very tricky and ambigious questions.

She is clear, goes over what you need to know and is very exact in telling you what you need to know for the exam.  If you read her notes filed on web ct telling you exactly what she is testing, there are no surprises and it is easy to do well.

If only writing overhead slides in front of the class is called good teaching, then yeah, she is a great prof. All she does is write on the overhead, the same information that is there in the textbook. Toooooooo boring. She does however, show some good videos once in a while.
very good prof A+

She's very boring, especially in the way she presents the material, i mean all she does is write overheads, and tell you the jist of what there is to know, which seems helpful, but if you're confused, GOODLUCK! She makes the class alllot more boring than it should be.
unhelpful

Awful. Impossible to stay awake in her class. All she does is write notes on the overhead. She does not respond to most of the threads/queries that people post on webct, but she does read it. She is NOT good! what an awful class this is. Course has become a lot tougher after the first midterm!!!

She is really boring. Her class will put you to sleep. Her exams are mostly writing questions (which sucks) I don't recommend this prof or this course to anyone. She is not helpful, but in the beginning of the course you might think she is. Only later on you will find out. Second half course is hard
No Comments
No Comments

comments: Very interesting course, Dr. McLean is a very talented orator and makes the content in the course very interesting and easy to understand. Unfortunately, Dr. McLean is leaving McMaster after this year which is a shame, as he was one of my most memorable professors.
Most amazing prof I have ever had. He made me interested in Classics. Honestly can't be beat .

This is honestly the best class I've had so far! Its not even in my interest area but the professor is so funny he makes the material super fun! Its almost like watching a comedy show...but your learning at the same time! LOVE THIS CLASS! Jaspers adorable

McLean was possible the greatest prof I had first year. He's funny, approachable and genuinely wants his students to succeed. Lectures were clear and the exams were very fair. Jasper's adorable as well!

Absoloutly amazing prof! Very laid back, and makes jokes throughout lectures,which makes them entertaining. His passion for the material was inspiring, and the readings were covered very well in lectures. Easy to approach, and willing to help of jsut chat whenever needed. It was the only class I never missed! Take all his classes! I Loved Jasper :)

Absoloutly amazing prof! Very laid back, and makes jokes throughout lectures,which makes them entertaining. His passion for the material was inspiring, and the readings were covered very well in lectures. Easy to approach, and willing to help of jsut chat whenever needed. It was the only class I never missed! Take all his classes! I Loved Jasper :)
Great prof - laid back, hilarious, knowledgeable, very approachable. PowerPoint slides could be better but overall, Classics 1B03 - Intro to Myth & Lit with him was great. Loved Jasper!
Awesome!
He's amazing, I love his class the best and always enjoying going there to see what else he has to say!
Professor McLean was fantastic, super dry, super funny, super knowledgeable. Doesn't hurt that he's young and hot. and his dog is adorable! I can't wait to take another class with him.
Absolutely awesome prof

He is a fantastic professor. Of all my classes I enjoy his the most. The way he teaches is awesome and crystal clear to me. I think those who were saying he was late or frustrated, well, yea he was late but he always got through most of what he had set out to do. Also,a frustrated guy cant exactly crack BOB jokes can he?I personally found enjoyable
Awesome
absolutely entertaining and amazing!
Just about the best prof around. Very entertaining, while at the same time making very clear what you need to know. Learned a lot, and had a great time at it.

Dr. McLean is awesome and one of the funniest profs I've ever had. He brings his dog to class everyday, who is cooler than most people in the class. Yay Jasper. McLean stays up crazy late at night making wicked handouts and charts to help students. He genuinely wants everyone to do well in his classes, and he is one of the best Classics profs at Ma
Amazing Prof.
super funny and makes class worth going to
he's awesome. he makes class so fun.
He sucked.  Knows his stuff, but like he should.  He just can't teach it.  I've had better Greek instructors
Professor was a very clear instructor. He went through the effort of creating information sheets explaining all myths and other information very clearly.
Wonderful professor
Dr. McLean is a fantastic prof. He made Greek fun to learn!

I agree with the previous comment. He could arrive on class ON TIME. He is just angry and frustrated ALL THE TIME. Who could blame him, its Mac! Lectures can be funny but sometimes pointless. If he was more relaxed things would be better.

Relies a little too much on the laptop. He could swear a little bit less and control his frustration a bit better. The last thing someone wants to hear on Monday morning at 9:30 is "Goddammit!" He could use a bit of work on arriving at class on time as well. Slightly unapproachable. From afar, in the lecture hall he's easy to listen to and funny =)

Dr. McLean was very helpful with anything and everything. He is a valuable and needed member of the Classics department.  We are happy and lucky to have him.  He never had set office hours so whenever I wanted to speak with him he never said he was busy. If your reading this: Thank-you Dr. McLean for your patience and understanding, all year!!!

He is one of my favourites.  Although sometimes he seems scatterbrained, he keeps lectures lively and entertaining.  He has an excellent sense of humour, and does great monologues (Can I mention "the black bile of self-loathing"?).  It wasn't difficult to do well if you came to class and did the reading.  Great professor... and great paisley shirt.

McLean was ok, Greek takes ALOT of your time, time is of the essence, and McLean didn't really make effective use of time, especially in the second half of the course.  I think he will get better with time, (at least I hope)

AMAZING prof. Exams are based on lectures, and he makes clear what passages are important in the reading. You can do well just from lectures, but if you do the reading too what he has to say really throws light on it. The one thing to watch out for is that participation in tutorial counts a lot but he's really funny so easy to stay focused.

Indeed Greek is really hard, If you were a kiss *** in this class and a keener you did well. You could put in all the effort you wanted and you still didn't get an A. Variety is the spice of life-thank god he isn't the only prof that can teach greek. THIS IS NOT AN ELECTIVE COURSE!!!!!!!!!

Greek is really hard, but Prof McLean made it as fun and comprehensible as possible, and I wouldn't have stuck with it without him teaching it. He doesn't expect you to get it right, just to make an effort. not everybody could do that, and it looks like those are the ones posting the reviews.

I had McLean for both first year Greek classes and lets just say...I'm glad it's over. He knows his stuff inside out, but seems annoyed when people don't get the material. He could have been better. I hope he gets better. He needs to get better! Some people are meant to research and some are meant to teach.... he should stick to the research.

Dr. McLean was ok. I think he will get better with time, (I hope) Stay on top of things in the class, and hold him to things when he says he will do them otherwise he won't. (eg. WebCt posts) I'm still waiting for that 20% from the "mid-term" that we never had. A Laid back attitude, and it shows in his teaching style.

McLean is ok if you "get" his humor. This half of the class sucked. Even tutorial The lessons went down hill and he left everything to the last minute.Including reviews,we didn't even have a second mid-term,the 20% was "applied to our grades"  Be prepared to do alot of nagging and pleading because if you are not on top of him things don't get done

It's a good thing he knows his stuff inside out. He got better since last term because there were less ppl in the class.  You have to be on top of him, especially near the end of the course. He posted the answers for the review at 9:30 p.m on the nite b4 the exam and is never in his office,unless he absolutely needs to be.GOOD LUCK in this course!

Dr. McLean is awesome, and hilarious! His comedy is enough reason to attend lectures, besides, his information is really interesting. Read all of the plays & go to class, but it's not too hard. His tests are fairly easy if you've done the above. Very approachable, responds to emails quickly. More than willing to help clarify & hear opinions.
Dr. McLean is awesome, very good eye candy!

At first Dr. McLean was intimidating. Once you got to know him and understand his personality it became easier to ask him questions. He does his best to help you understand the material, he never lost his patience considering our class.  In short, he was good!

I thoroughly enjoyed this class. Although sometimes lectures seemed pointless, the course material was interesting and fun. Prof always answered emails timely and in great detail. Marks were fair and class was enjoyable. And who doesn't like a prof that gives a bonus question like that?
He created an uncomfortable atmosphere for students to ask questions and he made it clear that his time was more important. Condescending, arrogant and unapproachable.....what more is there to say?
Dr. McLean is fantastic so far.  He is very approachable and is always willing to help.  Funny too!

comments: Dr. Quinn is amazing. The Biology 1M03 course isn't. Unless you really want Dr. Quinn as an instructor do not take this course.

Great professor! He's very passionate about the environment and REALLY loves birds. He occasionally gets side-tracked talking about a specific bird, and will even start doing their calls during lecture! He's a very engaging and funny professor. I would definitely recommend taking his classes. The workload is light enough if you study decently.
great prof! he saved all our marks that dr evans screwed up,funny knowlegable dude, def reccomend him, and no tricky quetions on his midterm, just read the textbook and watch his pordcasts
Amazing Prof! Passionate about the environment and always makes you engaged. Hands down the best evolution prof at Mac.
Sweetest professor! Cares so much about the environment :') Midterms are fair and his lectures are enjoyable
Very approachable professor, reasonable questions asked on midterm, I enjoyed his lectures a lot, made jokes in class, and incorporated cool examples besides the textbook in class.
his exams and test m.c are no longer one page long, their straight and to the point. good prof made lectures interesting. bird calls in class...priceless.

I really don't understand why some ratings are poor for Dr. Quinn. I've never liked bio but I always went to his lectures because he was so enthusiastic about teaching; the bird calls are funny, as are most of his comments. His questions are easy if you've studied and attended class as you should be. Also very kind and approachable after class.

worst prof I ever had. He's nice and approachable but his multiple choice questions consist of reading longs paragraphs and most of the time the questions are unreasonably difficult. Our class average for the first midterm was almost 30% lower than the avg for the previous semester's because they had kajiura
excellent teacher, some find his style of comprehension questions difficult.
he is good, teaches very well. But his exams are really brutal. he sometimes makes multiple choice question that is 1 page  long. i felt like i am doing comprehension and not mcq...
this guy is horrible, he cannot teach and his powerpoint slides are useless. jesus.
he was good at getting his information through but he was a horribible prof..his test were very difficult!!!
Makes 1M03 harder than it needs to be. You're better off markwise by having Dushoff/Kolasa/Kajiura.
Very effective and friendly prof, but his test had very difficult questions and was tough to complete on time. Loved how he dyed his hair green for our last lecture!

Amazing prof, best bio prof at Mac! Classes are interesting, he gives real life examples and often  has a slide show from his own work/places he's travelled. Went to every sing one of his classes. Tests make you think, but are fair. If you know the concepts you will do well. Great great prof!
Great guy! Really friendly, approachable, and smart.... so make sure you watch out for his tests. They're tricky and application-based, and sometimes, seem unreasonably complex
wonderful prof! funny, engaging and approachable. he explains things very well and uses a ton of examples to make the concepts concrete. one of the two bio profs i actually enjoyed.
Quinn was great.  Tough concept based learning, not this straight pnemonic crap.  He made that course enjoyable and challenging
Oh my! The Caspien Turns!

best bio prof ever!! his lectures were so interesting, and i definitely paid attention to every part of them, unlike the other two profs we had this semester. he is so great, and makes material appealing and alive. i hope to have him again in later years!!...thanks!
QUINN IS SO INTERESTING!!!! I REALLY ENJOYED HAVING HIM. BEST BIO PROF YET!
The best bio prof I've ever had.

The best of the 3 bio profs for this course. He totally reminded me of Einstein...I loved the random stories about his life and the slide pictures he would put up. Very funny, and he made the evolution unit interesting. I also liked the discussions we would have in lecture sometimes, and I thought his test questions were fair.
Overrated but still pretty good.

Excellent prof...he doesn't limit himself to the textbook, and instead uses any info that he thinks will help ppl understand the concepts.  And I like how he asks conceptual questions on tests instead of forcing u to regurgetate material from the text like a lot of other profs.
Useless
Great guy, funny stories on the side in lectures that are relevent!
Wicked prof! Easy to understand and his lectures were not boring at all. He is very smart and sexiest santa lookalike.
Great prof.  You'll love the part of the course that he teaches.  He isn't totally unapproachable, despite some of the comments here, but he can be a bit intimidating because he's such a smart guy.
Great prof, probably the most interesting all year, you will be very motivated to go to his class, but he is not very approachable outside of class
My favourite first year prof, his where the only courses that I was actually motivated to attend.
Great guy. Great stories. Very interesting classes. His test questions are all concept-bassed, which is different from most other profs. you have to know the material, not just have it memorized.
great prof, wish he'd taught the whole course!
Interesting lectures! Not very friendly!

The best 1st year prof.  Pretty much the only class I was motivated enough to go to by the end of the year.  Yes, his tests were hard, but welcome to univerity!!  Highly contageous enthusiasm.  Go JSQ!!!
my favourite bio prof ever, very passionate about what he is talking about, and knows his stuff!

Horendous. Does not prepare students for the ridonkulous evaluations he gives. Uninteresting, monotone, a bore all the way. Good luck to anyone taking 1AA3... the entire course (labs, classes, tests) is messed up and they won't do anything to change it.

My favourite bio prof, and not just because he's a hippie with Brother Tom anecdotes and Caspian Tern stories. I found the tests really easy, but I guess opinion differs. I wish he taught more classes.
How can you not love a prof that sounds like Kermit the Frog? (Seriously, close your eyes and try it)
he's okay, i guess. definitely not the best prof i've ever had.

By far the best first year bio prof.  His lectures are interesting, and he is obviously passionate about biology.  He actually made me want to come to class (Unlike some profs.. *cough*Kajiura*cough*).  His tests aren't that bad, either. He's great!
No Comments
how can u say his tests are hard? they are quite possibly the easiest tests in university, read his lecture notes for a few hours and you're set.
his tests was brutal and buddy and i learned more about birds than bio in this course....

He's a great prof in lecture, but his tests are insane. The questions are so random and irrelevant. And they're worded to be almost as vague as his study questions, which needless to say don't help at all.
No Comments
He is by far the best first year bio prof.
No Comments
GREATEST PROF! Interesting, with lots of examples and stories from own experience.              *****Leave your pillow at home for this class*****
Best bio prof ever, love the hippie hair and clothes, lots of birds :-)
No Comments
one word .... HIPPIE!!!
my best prof so far, his stories rock, love the music on the last day of class:)
No Comments
Quinn quotes of the day!! He rocks...best bio prof ever. Awesome bird sounds!
actualy LOOKS like a Caspian Tern
Awsome Prof! Interesting and lots of enthusiasm!!! : )
He's a great teacher, who loves what he teaches, and helps us out all the time.
Wicked prof...cut the hair
No Comments
No Comments
Highly overated...went off on tangents too often
Best prof ever in science.  Actually wants to teach and help you learn.
No Comments

comments: He is one of the best professors that I've had. He is so great and passionate about what he teaches. If you have the opportunity, please take his class, you need to go to lectures to understand and he makes you work within the class. It really helped me to understand many concepts. He is super approachable and very funny. He also cares for students
Shehata is an awesome prof. He loves to teach, and really cares about the students. Take him seriously when he says beware of the 2AB3 final though..

A wonderful individual who cares about students and their ability to understand the material. I took this course in the Winter 2013 term. Final exam was a bit lengthy (only given 2 hours to do it). Textbook was not required. His notes are comprehensive. Attend Classes!! Easy to do well in if you put in effort.

Student survival requires keeping on or ahead of schedule, being persistent with question after question to keep concepts clear, and most importantly much practise with homework questions with emphasis on Professor-authored material.
Enthusiastic delivery with good attitude and extra assistance marred by uneven pace, gaps in details, and typos.
He's a really nice guy and dedicated to his job.  Great because he spoonfeeds the material so you don't have to use the text.  Exams can be tough.

Professor Shehata is an awesome prof, and really cares that his students understand the material. He breaks up every method into the most simplest steps so you understand how to do the problems. Although the tests can be tricky, they are not impossible to do. He's very helpful and clear, compared to the other 2AB3 prof.

Best professor ever. He is the most amazing teacher. If you attend his lecture, you will never have to open the book. Just take notes in the class and read them and you will be fine and amazingly, you will actually know all the concepts. Simply, superb!

Good prof. Easy to understand. Tests were unbelievable. Too Hard! I took some of the sample tests to an actual accountant. He said that its the stuff they do in 4th year... this is and introductory course!!
If you found this hard you shouldnt be in accounting.

Anyone rating this guy low either had trouble with english or couldn't write tests- sure some of the material was hard, but he taught it well, was really helpful, and would curve tests or give back marks on questions if the class as a whole did poorly
he's a great teacher.  his lecture notes are really helpful and his exams are pretty fair.  he's a nice guy to talk to if you have a problem too.

Not as hard as people suggest. Helpful notes on website. Adjusts marks sometimes if average is low. Really wants students to do well. There's a lot of stuff to cover in the course and it doesn't get any easier if you still want to learn anything.
Course is hard, but he is one of the best profs! He is very fair, but exams are hard
VERY NICE PROF IN MAC. CLEAR LECTURE. FAIR EXAM AND FINAL MARK.
Great prof, very helpful, funny, and interesting.  ASK FOR HELP IF YOU NEED IT!!
very bad prof, I really don't like his lectures, test MC questions easy, written question crazy hard.
really tries to help students. clear expectations. well taught. very approachable and helpful. exams were a little tough, BUT fair (and I HATE accounting). just do your work and you will be fine.
People here just complain too much. The class wasn't too hard, he's VERY helpful
Exams are way too hard!!!!!
No Comments
No Comments
This class was easy....everyone needs to stop crying so much
No Comments
No Comments
He tries to help his students as much as he can
expects too much, exams way too hard
No Comments
Expect to work your a$$ off just got a B.
Exams are unclear and hard!!
No Comments

comments: Self-indulgent, deferred all marking responsibility onto a single TA who did not speak English to the extent that they could fairly mark assignments. Not as funny as he thinks he is.

Personally, I enjoyed having Dr. Mussio as a prof. Was his class easy? No. Was the content always exciting and clear? No. However, Dr. Mussio tries so hard to make history interesting (a tough task for anyone) and truly cares about his students. I also think he's hilarious.

I've had multiple classes with Dr. Mussio, and he is helpful, knowledgeable, understanding, and really cares about his students and what they're learning. His assignments and exams aren't based around regurgitating the textbook, he cares more about his students' understanding of society and concepts- he actually understands the point of university.
kind of monotone
He is funny but boring

Helpful prof, boring class content and too many jokes, found himself funnier than what he was. 3 hours is too much for the content you're supposed to retain. There's a lot of material to cover and he doesn't present themes that he expects you to know for the exam. Lectures lack content.

Not a very good prof, very rude to students that don't do things a month before they're due. Don't email him a week before something is due, he'll tell you that you're going to fail out of University.
Very effective prof - he really cares about his students. His jokes are dynamite and add flavor to the (often dull) course material.

For a three hour night class, he had no respect for the students time. In opening lecture, he spoke for 90 minutes and covered some ten of course material. The rest involved his attempts at humor, mumbling his activities and musings, going off on tangents, and making fun of the people in his class. Were it not mandatory, I'd drop it in an instant.
You better not like typing your notes on your laptop in lecture... He will call you out and assume you're not paying attention.

He IS funny, but it's unnecessary. The material is extremely boring and his lectures are irrelevant to the texts. Reading a chapter and listening to his lecture are 2 very different things. He openly makes fun of his students and picks on them. He tries to make things more interesting with his wit, but I'd appreciate more guidance with the material

seriously...enough with the jokes. just the material please. nothing is more annoying than a prof who finds himself absolutely hilarious...nothing except a prof who loves himself AND presents material poorly. ouch.
Lame jokes aside, he does a good job at presenting the material.
Nonstop hilarity. I can see why a lot of people would find his jokes lame, but that's because they are morons and don't get the subtle genius of Mussio's humour.
Very professional and knows a lot. I enjoyed his sense of humour and found his lectures useful. I cannot imagine anyone doing a better job with this kind of material.

I give him credit, the content is terriable, but give us a break with the jokes. Once in a while is okay, but not every other statement and for 10 minutes at the start of lecture. Seriously, I timed it today, for 9 minutes he talked about NOTHING. Let us go early if you don't have enough material, instead of making us feel bad for not laughing,EVER
I attended his first lecture, found it extremely boring, uselss and decided to skip the rest of the semester. Great decision on my part got an A. HAHA

I took CMST from him in first year before transferring to Western for the MIT program. I got an A+ in his course, and still can't understand why anyone enjoyed him.He spoke too quickly, his lectures were overly prepared(he seemed to have more of an avid interestin his use of overly flowerly adjectives than truly educating his class)smart but so BAD
Very helpful and knowledgeable. Good sense of humour and high standards. I learned a lot:)
He´s so boring... he thinks he´s funny but he is not. ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ...
Definately very witty.  Material was boring though.

We love your jokes, Dr. Mussio--especially the ones about the National Post.  he really knows his stuff and gets it across effectively.  And as aforementioned, his humour is very dry and not for the slow-witted, just the way I like it!

One of funniest men I have ever listened too.  Not many students got his clever jokes, but I pity them.  The material is dry, but he livens it up with the humour.  Take the course, it gives you a great background to communications AND you can see a great wit at work!
The material sucked, not the prof.
I don't understand how anybody likes this guy.
Too many corny jokes. Just stick to the material (which was so boring) but not annoying like his incredibly unfunny jokes. One of the only classes I absolutely hated in first year
yeah funny at times, but sometimes i laugh because his jokes are soooooo lame. LOL cool class i went to all the lectures and sat way at the back. sometimes it was dreaful and sometimes interesting.
it's a fabulous course.  Dr. Mussio explains very well with a really enjoyable lecture.  I really enjoy the course.  He's one of the best profs. @ Mac that I've met so far
GEHHHHH....
really funny prof.  enjoy listing to him in lectures.  His lectures are fabulous
a little boring...spice it up a little.
Laurence is a fabulous prof! He is so smart and actually really cool underneath the slightly geeky exterior. Always friendly. Very encouraging. Loves his subject. Passionate guy.
An excellent professor. Funny, smart and very professional. Smiles all the time. Good sense of humour.
Very funny and approachable, even said hi to me in the bathroom. Lectures are well organized but can be boring at times.
so boring.. i tend to sleep more than learn
BORING!!!
No Comments
This man drones on like there's no tomorrow. Smart, but boring to listen to.
lectures are quite irrelevant to text
helpful - approachable. lots of reading!
excellent sense of humour, lots of enthusiasm, very knowledgable
interesting subjects good prep
great prof
tough course but you learn a lot
cool prof - well organized
has no inner monologue, uses too many big words to sound smart
No Comments
No Comments
Monotone, with the occasional joke. Average.

comments: he is so sweet
Such a good prof! Would recommend taking any economics course with him! He has written the most clear and concise textbook I have read thus far in university!
Made me love econ. Best professor, nicest man, adorable sweaters. Fair, and wants everyone to succeed!
2ez, I mean he tells up to skip all the hard stuff in favor of the tards. If you did the practice problems and understand the material you should collect an a+
Great Prof. Really helpful and really knows macro.
patient, intelligent, effective, helpful, happy  porfessor. He provide many perspectives on macroeconomics. He is very encouraging. I will miss him!
Too fast and WAY over my head.

The best professor i have ever had at McMaster. This course isn't hard if you have some math background. He is a genuine, totally devoted professor. Watching him ramble on happily about growth theory makes studying economics all the more enjoyable. I will miss this class so much.
Dr Scarth is extremely patient with student's comprehension and is the most intelligent (both academically and socially) professor I've ever met.

NOw this guy is awesome. He's the most intelligent and helpful prof. i've come across so far at McMaster. The only problem is that he is so smart that his mind processes things way faster than the students, so obviously by the time we comprehend what he has just said he has already moved on.
When I was at MAC I took all the classes that Bill taught, and I can safely say that he is the reason why anyone would take economics.....
Very enthusiastic professor
best teacher i've ever seen! let us see the beauty of economics.
great prof, very helpful and energetic
Great Teacher, clear examples. He is one of the few teachers that really get excited when teaching and still has passion. Friendly and very helpful
Nice instructor. He provides lots of explanation for his course.  Really good prof
a super nice prof willin to help students and with a warm heart!!!!!!!!
Dr. Scarth is awesome.  He's so cute and he eats/sleeps/breathes econ!  You will not regret taking his classes.
No Comments
Easily the best Prof at Mac
Great guy--wants students to do well. Knows material. Talks really fast, though!
No Comments
smartest man ever...no doubt.
Sweet

comments: Fleisg takes himself a little too seriously, even though 1P03 is a joke. It shouldn't be joke -- this is real engineering stuff he is teaching, and it's applicable to all design jobs and even most outside of design. Yet still, he can't effectively explain the difference between an objective, constraint, and requirement.
If you attend the lectures you pretty much know everything for midterm and final exam. The project is worth 60% of the grade which is amazing actually.

Fairly easy class. There is a group project worth a good portion of your mark which is a pain. Lectures are pretty boring. I had 8:30 lecture with him.. I can still here his voice yelling "GOOOODD MORNING" ringing in my ears. Tutorials for this class can be really dry, but the project can be rewarding in the end if you worked well with your group.
He's so good at conveying things and keeping the class interesting.
The lectures are long, boring and for the most part useless. But Fleising is great and the assignments aren't too bad. The easiest class you'll take in first year eng.
He will teach you how to even grammar And make morph charts seriously
Tries to be simple, but complicates things with specific definitions (although that's the nature of the course)
If you're really lucky, he'll accidentally give out the final exam answers

I always found his lectures interesting. He's got a lot of real-world engineering experience and it shows through.  I think the worst part of the course was the actual material we had to know; it wasn't very interesting and the multitude of definitions we needed to keep track of got a little bit ridiculous.
good professor,very helpful and very clam in speaking to person,respond to each and every mail posted by student which is very is very helpful for communication
He would be a very good prof but the course he's teaching is just super boring.
I found this class was a complete waste of time. He expected a lot of work to be put into a class about nothing, when engineers have more important classes to worry about
def my fave class
Worst Course EVER!!!!!!

Quick to answer discussion board posts, and always available during office hours. Course project and assignments were far to vague, but this isn't the profs fault. Tries to make lectures interesting with videos and photos in the lecture slides. A very engaging speaker.
Fleisig = awesome!

Worst class in first year engineering. Not hard, just the worst material ever. Exam asked "How much is this test worth". Group project was boring. Don't really blame flesig because he has the worst material, but the tests were just ridiculous.
He is really good at discussion board.He helped a lot and very quickly through discussion board.Just exam was hard.but He tried 100% to make this course More and more interesting.

He was an okay prof.. The lectures were pretty boring, but you could tell he tried to make it more interesting. The project expectations were very poorly explained. A bunch of these contradicted eachother, and things kept changing!

He put some pathetic questions on the exam.   The class was incredibly boring and I rarely stayed awake when I attended.  The project was worth 40% of our final mark and it was extremely unclear as to what was expected of us.  Besides that the project was extremly boring.  Probably the worst course of first year engineering.

he is pretty good, lectures are somewhat interesting. the course co-ordination is very bad though, and we had a project which was worth 40% of the final mark. the objectives of the project werent so clear. the exmas and essays are pretty easy. he is obsessed with copyright so be carefull
Totalitarion style teacher. Specifies type of fonts for report for different sections. Makes an easy course difficult. Uses big words to dazzle.

Good prof, opinion of him from undergrad -> grad prof soared. Very personable, friendly, helpful. Enthusiastic about design and proud of the program. Jokes around with students and has good knowledge regarding realistic engineering goals and ideal design work.

Dr. Fleisig is the most unprepared prof at Mac by far. He had no idea what he was teaching, screwed up our exam to the point where he had to make us write a second exam second term, and made our term long project worth half as much. He has no idea what hes doing. Our major project had no clarity and was basically a worthless. Worst class ever
I want to be just like him when I grow up!

me and my freinds have a saying that goes like this: "flesig is a ****bag". the course material isnt hard, so luckily you dont have to go o his lectures, but unfortunately you sill have to deal with his marking schemes and rules (ie. 25% of the midterm was 3 fill in the blank questions, worth 5 marks each - yes, 5 marks per blank.)
Didnt go to to many lectures because material is very easy, just show up to labs and tutorials and put some effort in the final project and you can come out with a 12 like me
An overall good professor. He is a very well educated man (PEng, PhD) who can teach fairly well. Any overall easy class that demands an exorbent amount of time.
Didn't teach, tried to dazzle students instead.  Terrible lecturer.

Very clear in class.  Never had to go to him for help, but he provided assistance to those who needed it (wrt. remarkings, etc).  His actual demonstrations of drafting techniques in front of the class on top of an overhead projector were a great idea.

easiest course ever... no thanks to Fleisig though. Kinda stuck up with a "look at me i can use Solid Edge better than you" attitude, so i never attended lectures but the program was easy to use. Tutorial was a bore too. Lab was awesome!
Easiest class ever. Go to lectures if you want to know how to do something but otherwise everything is easy, common sense and anything difficult, just post a message and he replies quickly.
He's a good guy. The course is kind of overloaded with work though. BIG forehead...

He really seems to care about us.  He replies to posts on WebCT, and always goes through the previous week's lab stuff with us in lecture. He would be a great high school teacher, but just doesn't cut it as a uni. prof.
cool cat
pretty good prof...his laugh is kinda freaky though

He is a very good teacher. Very good at explaining things and also very concerned about students. The extra help sessions and offer to remark midterms where instruments were used were both very thoughtful and helpful.
First time teaching, and not good at it. He teaches like a robot. Has a bad stutter and an evil laugh. He is a good guy though, and I do feel bad for him.
No Comments
He's good. People just hate the class and use him as the excuse for their mark
He tries, it IS his first time teaching
talks down to us...
Very smart man
No Comments
O GOD!!! such an easy course but he tries to make it so hard
This guy is cool... but he's lost in his own world most of the times

comments: Grodek is an overall great person, with a passion for French literature specifically, and she honestly cares about her students, wanting them to do well.  BUT, she is a TOUGH grader, especially when it comes to essays... she is also a frazzle lecturer with incredibly messy writing and no lesson plans (ever!!)

Dr. Grodek is fantastic! She is so easy to talk and cares very much about her students. She gets to know each one individually and will know your name by the end of the term. She assigns fair amounts of work and explains herself very well. I had her in first year and I am taking 3P03 and 3C03 with her again because I enjoyed her teaching so much.
Very easy to talk to and helpful when needed. Don't be afraid to ask questions because she's always willing to help.
I love her !! She is so nice and caring :) if you are taking a french course at MAC I recommend trying to be in her class !!! Such an amazing person!

Great prof - funny, intelligent and clearly knows her subject matter. But her midterms and exams are ridiculous! She asks irrelevant questions not covered in class and makes you memorize so much for nothing. Great class but tough to get a good mark
Excellent teacher and a wonderful human being.

Such a great prof!  A lot of people seemed to be intimidated to take this class, because it requires a lot of effort.  But you will get a great mark if you do the work!  She's super nice and funny.  She really wants you to do well.  I want her to be my thesis professor!
THE BEST :) Very good and helpful prof.

She is very knowledge in so many categories which makes this course very interesting. She has a high standard which is put there to make you work. And that you do. However, the wealth of knowledge that you accumulate is rewarding at the end and your level of french definitely improves as well. Amazing prof.

really nice and helpful. if u took gr.12 fr and understand fr you should be fine. fair marker. u need to go to class, she takes marks off if u dont. tests & final were easy, quizs u need to study there are alot. lit is easy, she goes through it all.

She is one of my favourite profs. I have her for a 3 hour night course and she is great at keeping it interesting. She is hilarious and passionate about teaching us and the seems to really care how we do. She is very approachable and sensitive to the needs of people who come from various different types of french speaking backgrounds.
One of the best profs I've had at Mac. You can tell she is passionate about what she teaches. Very approachable. You may find this course difficult as a Core French student.
THE BEST!
excellent! prof, best class ever
Amazing teacher, very understanding of all levels of humour and marks equally content as does grammer. Total bonus for those francophones who suck at grammer!!!
No Comments
Top quality professor, I really enjoyed her 20th century french lit course.  She is passionate about her teaching and she cares deeply about her students.  Awesome!
No Comments
No Comments
great prof
Awesome prof, very helpful, and friendly

comments: One of the finest professors in my 9 years of post-secondary.  Exactly as described by others, he was smart, great wit, unafraid to use it.  Now, 19 years later, I still remember the majority of what he taught. Kudos.
Most enjoyable professor in my university career.  Tough, fair, sharp-tongued, and funny.  A genuine pleasure and the reason that professors emeritus are important to a university.

amazing prof! his lectures were very interesting and his notes very helpful. he's pretty serious about his work so DO NOT chat/ask stupid questions in his class or you will be mocked. i really enjoyed having him as my prof.
Davidson is a professor that will expect you to know the material like the back of your hand.  He's writes difficult tests, so this is definately not a section you can study the day prior for.
hard test, but fair (wacth out for details) a thrill to listen to in lecture -- more a conversational style, very enthusiastic but doesn't suffer any fools (I love that)

He was the stereotypical elderly British man and although he wasn't always so receptive in class, when you talked to him outside of class he was hilarious! I loved his lecture notes the best, they were very detailed and clear. I also wish we didn't have to switch profs twice during the term, I would have rather had Davidson all term.
I love Dr. Davidson.. he is a great prof and he is so cute.
Awesome, awesome, awesome.  This is a real professor.  Great explanations that still force you to think on your own, REALLY great lecture notes, test questions that make you think.  Thanks!

Great prof, his lecture notes are the greatest. There's absolutely no need to even read the textbook, his notes are like a textbook, just way more condensed. I wish this dude taught the whole course, instead of just a third of it. IMO, I think it's stupid to switch professors every month just to teach one course.
Great Prof!

Based on the comments below, I would say he mellowed with age.  I took his course about 14 years ago and it was the single worst experience in my education!  I was intensely interested in biology when I started the course, by the end I hated it, and even changed my career choice because I had no interest in Biology at McMaster.
Excellent professor. Very charming, witty, knowledgeable, available, fair, etc. etc. My favourite 1st yr prof. THANKS.
No Comments
No Comments
awesome prof!
He has an enormous personality, and is passionate about biology. He may be old, but many people have intellectual crushes on him, just because of the knowledge and experience he conveys.

He's awesome. Yep. If you're one of those people who ask questions for the sake of asking questions, don't ask questions. Davidson also doesn't like people who pretend to know answers. He's funny and AMAZINGLY intelligent.
He was enjoyable to watch to say the least.  That said, I wouldn't dream of speaking up in class for fear of being shot down...he can be brutally honest..but that's his charm!

I love this guy.  Thank goodness he puts people who ask stupid questions in their place.  Of course, they then rear their ugly heads when Kajiura takes over... but just enjoy him while he lasts.  Great lecturer too!
I love his sarcasm, keep up with the negative, destructive comments. It's awesome that he comes in and scares the first year students. I loved his exam questions.
OMG!! he was soooooooooo damn funny!! loved the way he just put down stupid questions! most enjoyable classes EVER!!

Whats your stereotype of a prof.  English accent, well cut suit, 60ish and a scarcastic sob.  That in short is Dr. D.  Talk to him in person and you'll realize he loves what he does and teaching first year science.  Brings alot of atmoshphere to 1st year.
People with stupid questions are definitly put in their place. I like his honesty
He made the class worthwhile.  Plus he made fun of the ppl who ask stupid questions, theyre running wild without him to put them down every step of the way.
god im glad someone told all those kids with stupid questions where to go, if you like bio and can folllow it well, youll like the class

He's brutal most of the time (i.e. when telling a girl to switch to social science, as she isn't smart enough for science), but he's witty and amusing once or twice a month.  Exactly what I expected and feared in a prof.

Dr. Davidson was exactly what I was expecting from a university prof. Just like what you see in the movies. I liked him, but his style is not for everyone. I did well in his course, he makes you think.
suffers from a god complex.  unnecessarily condescending.  difficult & unusual exams.  makes a moderately difficult course very tough.  thousands of students can't be wrong!
I like him (even though many didn't)...a 'to the point' guy...good prof. First years...PLEASE don't ask him stupid questions...he WILL be brutal.
He drills info @ U as if U've been in Univ. for 4 yrs. Not very approachable. Makes fun of U in class...so don't say dumb stuff.
just bad
Great prof - funny! Don't ask stupid questions, though, he'll make fun of you for everyone's enjoyment!
Great prof, but extremely critical (don't say a word in his class)
Quite a unique character, I will never forget the ghecko story!
Great professor, very interesting, but will target stupid questions brutally
Great guy - gotta get a new hat though
Really liked his teaching, found him hilarious!!!!
Hard, criticizes students too much.
Goes through his notes waaay too fast, altho he does give good notes on the web
luvs laughing at the students when u get something wrong
tough prof...If you're not being picked on, he's hilarious
bad prof... not interested in students becoming involved in bio at all
writing giberish during tests just to finish in time is not my idea of learning
I liked his style, but it's not for everyone, understandably.
ASKS VAGUE QUESTIONS, THEN RIPS ON YOU FOR NOT ANSWERING THE WAY HE WANTS YOU TO
You know theres something wrong when the class avg. on a test is F!!!
evil man, made me hate first year university
Evil, Evil, guy.  Smart but loves insulting his students
understood lots
meanie
i hate him

comments: Dr. Allen is a really passionate prof and you can tell he really enjoys his field. Lectures were always interesting, informative, and engaging. He answers questions thoroughly and really makes this intro to historical philosophy fun to learn.
Great prof, easy to understand and engaging. Even though some of the topics can get quite boring at times I had a great time during this course.

Has a deep love and knowledge of the material that shows through in the depth of insight given to the (relatively short) reading passages assigned. Engages with the class and loves to discuss questions asked whether during class or afterwards. Has one or two slides with points and discusses for the lecture. Miss a class? Get notes from a friend!

I took this class because Dr. Allen really is a persona. He's such a big deal in the philosophy department. While lecturing about Zarathustra, Dr. Allen's voice took on an embodied character, and he told us how Zarathustra came to town to spill his giant load of wisdom on the people. This is serious business. I'd never learn this in science class.

Barry Allen is my favourite prof. His lectures are incredible and he really knows what he is talking about. This was hands down my most interesting course and if you don't like Barry Allen... I don't think we're going to have anything in common because this man is incredible.

Dr Allen is amazing. He keeps you so intrigued during lectures, that you almost don't want to stop to take notes, you just want to listen. Also loved that he didn't stop to take questions in the middle of lecture; it always annoys me when profs go into "discussion" mode and take useless questions from students who just want a reason to talk.

Dr. Allen is a formidable lecturer.  In just a few classes his intellectualism is very evident.  I found myself writing down so many useful and worthwhile ideas, I couldn't keep up with all of them.  There is still one particular lecture in which a few good ideas weren't jotted down, and I still wish I was able to have transcribed everything.

Utterly amazing during a lecture. Dr. Allen has an amazing ability to present potentially confusing ideas in an extremely clear manner. He's actually so good at condensing the course material that I didn't have to do a single reading (aside from using references in essays). Very calm and humble disposition as well, takes interest student questions.
McMaster's philosophy department is nothing without Allen. He simply is the only reason why anyone should consider philosophy at this school.
Dr. Allen is an amazing lecturer. This class was what got me interested in philosophy. I have yet to have a better prof.

Every Mac students must have the Barry Allen experience at some point. Fantastic lecturer with such a great personality. Very helpful to students. The class was great and I'm sad he doesn't teach more courses on the subject.

What a pleasure it is to have the blessed sense of hearing - one comes to appreciate this after attending just one lecture with Dr. Allen. What a pleasure indeed! Very composed, passionate, well-versed, knowledgeable and authentic in his personality. I was very sincerely saddened on the last day of class. May you continue teaching for years to come

Picks very interesting topics for his lectures and courses. I recommend taking any one of them. Brilliant orator. Very fair assignments and exams. it is easy to succeed in his classes if you put in the time and effort.

Had him for philosophical psychology. He was by far the best lecturer in Philosophy; it was like he was composing a book on Freud in class. I got 5-10 pages of notes in each 1-hour lecture! Apparently in person he's a horrid troll, but his lectures are amazing. Go to every lecture, take notes in detail, and read the texts, and you'll do well.
Wow, loved this prof. Lectures were a pleasure to attend. I would say attendance is mandatory, esp if you have never taken philos before.
Great teacher, great speaker. My favorite teacher in four years at Mac.

The first time I took a class with Dr. Allen someone told me: "He's the best speaker in the Philosophy department."  That's him in a nutshell.  He's an absolutely fantastic orator; he makes philosophy fun and extremely interesting.  His lectures are long and intense, but deeply satisfying.  Got me interested in Philosophy & Nietzsche in particular.
No Comments
Very nice prof.I like him so much...Take a course with him and you don't wanna graduate at all, you would want to take every possible and available course with him..trust me.

He's so gorgous, I'm just speechless about the way he teaches. Once you take a course with him, he'll always remain in your mind. The saddest thing that I heard was that he is going to China next year...Whereever you are Dr. Allen I wish you ALL THE BEST>
This prof inspired me to go into philosophy. He's one of the smartest I've ever encountered and this University needs more like him.
Don't take this class as an elective! If you don't LOVE philosophy like this guy- then you will suffer! He is an excellent speaker but NEVER talk to him one on one or he will make you cry!

All i can say is that was INDUBABILY the hardest course I've ever taken.  Can a prof say INDUBABLE enough?  Interesting course, but you really have to be interested in philosophy in the first place.  Don't take it as an elective!  I learned my lesson.
FYI, the profs don't pick the TAs.  Excellent professor and lecturer.
Picks his TAs VERY VERY badly.  I have never had a worse TA...EVER!
Allen is an absolutely brilliant orator. If you ever get an opportunity to take one of his classes, give it a shot - you'll learn plenty, and if you do the readings you'll get a good mark as well.
i worship dr. allen...he is beyond brilliant and his lectures are riveting
Picks his TA's VERY BADLY

comments: Dr. Gough was the greatest prof I have ever encountered at McMaster. She is very fair with grading and she gives you many opportunities to improve yourself and your mark. Amazing professor who actually cares about her students and their abilities. If you can take her Shakespeare course, DO NOT HESITATE TO DO SO.
Fair assignments and midterm. Classes are kind of interesting. Not a bird course at all, exam is beyond difficult.

Monotone and dry. The classes are basically just going over the readings in minute detail (which we already do in tutorial). Maybe that works for her english courses, but it makes for a very boring women's studies class!

Loved her! She taught me so much that I never in a million years would have thought to be interesting. She has inspired me to maybe go back to school one day just to pursue studies around Swetnam the Woman Hater! Amazing prof who really cares about her students and about her teachings.

Melinda is by far one of my favourite professors from McMaster and the reason why I changed my major to Women's Studies. She was an amazing support whenever I needed it and made me feel comfortable to approach her. I walked away from her course with a wealth of knowledge and a thirst to challenge myself and my beliefs. Amazing woman.

This professor is not clear about guidelines and expectations, especially for tests and assignments. She does everything in her power to keep her marks low. She is a monotone speaker who makes even the most interesting of topics uninteresting.  Avoid this course at all costs it will be nothing but a headache and hours of frustration.

She is an eloquent speaker who knows how to get the message across to her students. She is open to discussion and constructive criticism. Her lectures were very organized and thought provoking too. She is a very traditional professor though, and finds it disrespectful when people are not paying attention in class (reasonable!). Great instructor!
Really amazing professor, really cares about her students success. Very approachable and very understanding.
I love this woman. She is by far my favourite professor. She makes me really think about the material and how I can use it well after the class is over and done with.

Melinda is one of those profs that stands out in my mind as being extremely caring & passionate about her teaching. She's always willing to go that extra mile to help out her students and ensures that everyone has reached a high level of understanding of the texts. Her course was beautifully organized & she was always open to constructive criticism

I loved Dr. Gough so helpful and soo much fun..Her class was friday morning full year and I was glad for it...She was helpful very thorough..fair marker...and always wanted her students to do well..She was personable as well and always made an effort to know our names..fantastic :D

Despite the fact that she's a really nice person and attempts (and succeeds) to learn her students' names, her lectures are always engaging & interesting. I would say that the marking is tough but fair. If you don't get a stellar mark in this class you'll surely take away a level of understanding of texts that was well worth your time in the course

This prof is not very understanding, she does not budge. I handed my paper in late by one day and she chose not to read it giving me my first failing grade. I guess she had to take her vacation. I had everything deferred and I went to the English department just after they closed at 4 and dropped it in the box but I guess itcounted for the next day
Very interesting and organized professor. Very approachable and understanding. Not the easiest marker, but very fair. Takes interest in her students both inside and outside of class.
Annoying prof, her voice was so static, it'd go too high then too low...yea no matter how hard I tried I just didn't cut it. Hated that class, ruined first year.

No matter how hard I tried in this course, I could never do anything right.  I sure wish I was friends with the person who said that the exams were easy if you paid attention in lecture - I did pay attention, but it sure didn't seem to help.
Absolutely fascinating lectures. Very fair assignments that challenged the class. Midterm was super easy if you paid attention during lecture.
SOOOOOOOOOOOOOO BORING!
An excellent prof. I would take any class with her teaching.
Fun class, interesting topics, was dry @first,now it's realy neat, and educational.
She rocks! I enjoy this class very much because the things we read are interesting and Dr. Gough opens up my mind to ideas I had never considered.
excellent prof, puts in a lot of time and effort in her material, very concerned

comments: hard to understand. random questions in readings. DOES NOT FOSTER AN ENVIRONMENT FOR UNDERSTANDING COURSE MATERIAL. I met with him personally and he was very rude, so be very understanding that the class is very packed and your questions may go unanswered.
No assignments or labs made this a great course.

DR. ZHOROV is a great professor. Sometimes he can be boring, but most of his classes are entertainig. Writing his tests is like running away form the tiger. He makes some funny analogies like that. He likes to drink Vodka in a Nestle Pure Life bottle occasionally. The material isn't too hard. Study and you'll do well. Good Luck.

Boris has difficulty with the english language. He tends to make mistakes on his midterms and then assigns these questions as a bonus mark (which is the fair thing to do). However, he does test on random yet specific points from his lecture. In addition, his examples used in class are not helpful (i.e. the hand in glove). Well done Boris!
no comment
Boris is the man. The material taught was very interesting and the tests were fair. Study hard and you should do fine.

tests were poorly designed in that everyone was stuffed into one room and sitting together.  I personally saw three separate groups of people cheating and none of them were caught, makes for unfair grading.
If you are able to completely understand his words and at the same time atay awake, you may be able to make a use of his lectures!

SUPER EASY CLASS - if you want to do good just memorize the slides ...don't even have to read the book too much. Would have liked to see him walk around or move away from the podium at least ONCE. But he was pretty funny with all his stories and analogies "what would u do if a tiger jumped in through the door??" ya...worth taking for an easy A
Classes were sooooo boring, and tests were ok.  Exam was really easy!  Lecture notes are direct and pretty much all you need to do well in the course.

He's nice enough, but sounds like Billy Crystal in "When Harry Met Sally" when he's talking crazy and saying "Would you like to partake in my pecan pie..." Ya, he's hard to understand, but the tests are very fair in my opinion.  Notes are so easy to follow that you don't have to go to class really.

He has lost his vim for teaching the course unfortunately. He recites far too much from his notes and was far better when he stood away from the podium and just talked as he did one class when the projector broke. He can be funny and the course is interesting at times but also quite dull.

Ok this guy is retro russian, he has done this so many times hes just reciting the lectures from memory, the accent is kinda funny, i mean for god sake cant someone tell him we dont pronounce the "ed" after every word! unwilling to help, and donsnt believe students know anything about biochemisty.
Boring
accent is way too thick, can't understand
nice guy, but GOOD GOD!  Sir, you seriously need to learn how to use the overhead projector properly!
I love Boris. He's an amzing teacher, and I love the tiger anecdotes. Come on, guys, the material may be boring, but that's the nature of the course. I'd take anything he teaches.
doesnt at all test on overall knowledge simply memeorization of tiny facts, such as enzymes name in a specific cycle really cute though, hard to understand at first
This prof tries very hard to ensure fairness in testing. The student comes first to him. Lectures are at times tedious and and other times interesting.
True Renaissance man, very diligent and helpful
What the heck is this guy saying?  His sounds like he's speaking Russian...
No Comments
terrible lecturer, unapproachable, but tests easy
tests on what he says he will... just memorization
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Intelligent, interesting and patient.
No Comments
Powerpoint slides were too detailed and irrelevant!!

comments: Hitchcock is an awful professor. His lectures were useless and I learned nothing from him. He is a nice person but his teaching skills need some work. The only reason you should go to class is for the iClickers. If you're taking Chem 1A03 with Hitchcock, get ready to learn everything yourself.

People seem to have a negative opinion on dr. Hitchcock, but I don't get it. He is a very nice man, super smart and always willing to help his students. He is so passionate about philosophy and is trying to share it with his students. The workload was intense but in the end I learned so much! Highly recommend.

He's nice, but I can't understand him in lecture. His voice is very low and he mumbles a lot. Plus, it's an ancient Greek Philosophy course, and he focuses more on logic than anything else. He really made me hate Plato and Aristotle.

Yet another prof attached to the meticulous analysis of logic and its systems as expected of those belonging to the dead tradition of Western Analytical thought. Of students he presumes a lot of former knowledge of his field. Readings are grossly heavy and not selective enough. Lectures are neither thorough nor clear, but evasive and vague.

he's a very very nice guy and is very open to helping you. BUT...his class is ridiculously boring and hard for some unknown reason. He's always open to ways in which he can teach better, but he just doesn't get better!

exam review was extremely vague and tedious. Website examples and notes are somewhat helpful, however his lectures are incomprehensible and he is unable to convey and explain the overall significance.  Instead he simply regurgitates things in an even more boring manner than the texts.  Avoid Hitchcock at all costs!!

Unable to coherently organize his thoughts.  He doesn't give you the overall picture, and significance. Monotone voice, makes interesting philosophy very very boring.  Hitchcock knows a lot, but just doesn't seem to be able to teach it to a young audience.
A very nice and helpful prof. The midterm was tricky but fair I guess. Lectures are on the boring side but hey..how can you make critical thinking enjoyable?

Almost quit philosophy after this class.  Hitchcock is difficult to understand and a very hard marker.  Yes, he did make Plato boring!  Hate to say it, but I will never take another class of his, but he is a nice guy.
This guy is one of the most boring professors I've ever had. His class sucks the life out of me. Not to mention that he's obsessed with logic, although this isn't a logic course.

Knows his stuff but makes Plato boring. I didn't think that was possible. Looks far to deep into issues for a second year class. Too critical.  Hard marker. Really boring, hard to stick with, monotone voice. Genuinely nice outside of class, just too dull to make the class good or worth taking.
Tries very hard to be clear and helpful, but I found the material to be very dense and his lectures to be sleep inducing. He sure knows his stuff, though. A for effort....

Did know his stuff, and taught the course better than anyone else since, but he didnt exacly make critical thinking "come alive." Actually he was boring as hell, but i did learn the material and do well.  But if i hear about Snub noses one more friggin time... :@
Very boring! I actually fell asleep in his class!! And very confusing--if you ask a question, you'll just end up with more!!!

Excellent prof. Extremely intelligent. One needs to keep up with the work in order to keep up with him. One of the best prof. of all time. Truely dedicated to his craft. Honoured to have had the oppertunity to be in his class.

Would have been a great course, if I had a master's degree to understand it with! Hitchcock was knowledgeable and great to talk to 1 on 1 but the material was way too dense for a 2nd year course, and the lectures were sometimes monotonous and long drawn..
He is kind, helpful, and smart. My favourite professor of all time. Incredibly adept at recognizing the nuance of arguments.
The unexamined 2A06 class is definitely worth living - Socrates
His life is critical thinking.  He does not try to get students to enjoy lecture, he just talks, and talks, and talks!
A horrible professor.  He only looks at one side of the issue, without giving notice to any other view points.  He is **** and occassionally rude.
Monotone voice makes the boring content even more agonizing
Brilliant man...but boring to the point of sterility. Better speak to him 1on1.
willing to help u but very dry and boring
A brilliant prof; separates the wheat from the chaff.
nice guy, but a tad disorganized
No Comments
