comments: Most amazing professor.  Outstanding lecturer. Practical business advice.  Career mentor.  Best teacher on campus. Plus a soccer player :)
Only prof worth connecting with.  The rest are posers.  Bontis is legit and connected.

Clearly a business expert in and outside of the classroom.  Fantastic lectures.  Lots of actual business stories.  High expectations for participation.  Personable and funny, and down to earth. Best prof at MAC.
Teaches the Diamond-E drill better than anyone!
Arrogant and was hiding on me
One of the best profs at Mac, hands down!
This guy is my hero ... hands-down best prof at MAC.

Took his course a few years ago.  I still use much of the intellectual capital and knowledge management frameworks and concepts he taught us back then.  His high quality instruction is more evident as the years go by.  His assignment on human capital measurement still remains among the top tools I learned in my MBA program.
He helped me negotiate my starting salary after graduation. Wonderful help. Was and still is an awesome prof.
Arrogant and pompous. Bontis added absolutely nothing to my university experience.
Nick Bontis was very hard and unreasonable. Never picked on me in class for participation resulting in 0/25

Nick conducted a 3 hour executive education seminar in Ottawa today that was simply outstanding.  Best session I have ever attended as a government employee.  Definitely worth your while to attend his courses.

Took 5 Executive Education courses at Ron Joyce Centre.  Dr. Nick Bontis was heads and shoulders above every other faculty member in terms instructor effectiveness and quality of content.  A definite ROI from his course.  Would highly recommend it.
Dynamic teacher. Nice guy too. Uses Ivey cases.

You will enjoy his 3 hour classes each week. To get an A+ you need to participate with high quality contributions, get into a good group, know the Diamond-E like the back of your hand, and talk to him about soccer every chance you get. Easy.

Bontis is the nicest guy and extremely approachable.  He is always willing to help students out.  Goes out of his way to make a difference at the school.  The best faculty member they have at DeGroote.
nice Lamborghini...did my tuition pay for that?
So much charisma. Deserving of such a high rating.
This guy is everything but a good professor. Full of himself to the max, it's disgusting how much people suck up to this guy and the sad thing is he loves every second of it.Keep Away!
Awesome professor!
The best MBA prof at DeGroote hands down.
BONTIS IS BRILLIANT.  He just won 3M NATIONAL TEACHING AWARD.  There are 35,000 professors in Canada.  He is now recognized as among the best.  WAY TO GO McMASTER.
Professor Bontis helped me out with negotiating a job offer with RIM.  He was great and insightful.  I was encouraged to seek his input from another student that he helped out last term.  Great guy.

The reason why Dr. Bontis is an outstanding professor is because his strategy class is by far the most challenging yet everyone loves being there for the full 3 hours each week.  He forces you to work hard and by doing so you end up learning tons.  Although he's committed to teaching theoretical tools within the Diamond-E, he lives for application!
PROS: Nick Bontis is a fantastic speaker, insightful case studies, great class discussions. CONS: assignments are demanding, participation is evaluated in every class, final exam is 5 hours long!
an awesome instructor! tried making the class applicable to real strategic situations, multiple choice exam was difficult, case exam moderate, participation marks are graded by TA

Bontis is extremely intense!!! You MUST be prepared for each class.  You MUST participate.  Guaranteed ... you will learn more in his class than any other.  His style is "in your face" but his delivery is outstanding.  If all DeGroote's profs were like him, this would be the top MBA program in the world!
Congratulations to Dr. Bontis for winning OUSA Award (Ontario's top undergraduate professor).  He's the bomb!

Brutal. Textbook definition of "pompous" and self centred. I don't understand how people eat his stuff up- hes FAKE. Hes plastic and malleable- changes shapes to suit the audience. Not an honest bone in his body. FAKE, POMPOUS, FAKE and INSINCERE. Decent orator though, with lots of fluff and very little real content. Good attempt, keep trying sir.
Great prof. Makes class fun and entertaining. Doesn't pick on students or embarass anyone but is able to get everyone involved. Fantastic professor!
Top 10 finalist for TVO Ontario's top prof!  Dr. Bontis is my hero.  Funny, entertaining, outstanding presenter and riveting speaker.
outstanding!!!
he is HOT!! definetly the best proff I ever had! others should learn from him

Dr. Bontis is the best professor I have ever had at university.  He is outstanding in the classroom but more importantly, he is genuinely nice and caring to students.  He is very down to earth and approachable.  I received great career advice from him and he even personally edited my résumé.
Semi-finalist for TVO Best Lecturer in Ontario.  Congratulations to Bontis.

The final case exam was a killer 5 hour ordeal.  But Bontis is by far the best MBA professor at DeGroote.  He is definitely high energy and you will learn all about knowledge management and intellectual capital.  If you get a chance, take the course, don't miss out.  He's da man!

Nicky B looked good in the Santa Claus outfit today ...  His strategy class was intense each week.  Definitely worth switching into his section.  He is a fantastic instructor.  Goes out of his way to make an impact.
Congats sir on winning 2007 MBA prof of the year.  Saw you at the formal.
DeGroote's best prof hands down.
self promoter

Teaching awards aplenty! Undergraduate, MBA, President's teaching awards all in the same year.  This prof is legit and worth every penny of tuition.  If you get into his section, consider yourself lucky.

Nice car.  Bontis is a world-wide respected professional speaker and researcher.  Hir oratory skills are infamous.  I just wanted to sit and listen for 3 hours every week.  BUT, he is very challenging.  Participation is serious business in his class.  You must prepare because he "cold calls".  You will learn a ton.  He really cares for students.
Very intelligent and witty.  Really cares that students learn and perform at their best.  Responsible as Director for the whole program.  Best teacher at DeGroote!
best prof at MAC, fantastic speaker
Finally, a prof that cares and goes the extra mile to teach you well.
Best Donald Trump ever!
Rather full of himself.
Only one in our school who should not get fired!
No Comments
He plays a great Trump!
Dr. Bontis is a fantastic professor.  This is a great course and I learned a lot.
Excellent prof. Makes you wake up at 8:30 in the morning without the coffee.  Stimulates your brain.
The best professor in the business school!
Quite possibly the ONLY good prof in the entire faculty, in the only class that is not just dumb commie theory/memorization.  Good speaker too.
No Comments
No Comments
Can you say arrogant??

Wow.  This guy is the cockiest person i have ever met.  Go to his website (which students HAVE to visit for course information) - www.bontis.com, where he shows off his trophy wife and numerous accomplishments...a true gem!!!
No Comments
He did a good job teaching...  how to be a cocky jerk.  Tries to be a little intimidating and cool with the students but it's pretty weak.
Super prof makes boring class interesting.
maybe it was the course...
good class. a breath of fresh air in an otherwise boring program
Too full of himself.. check his website out !! good guy though ...
love his class
Absolutely best prof at McMaster.
probably the best prof at the school
a bit of attitude on ya, Mr B
Knowledge Management guru

comments: Such a nice guy- means well

Absolute worst prof I've had. Lectures consist of watching useless YouTube videos. Guy has no clue what he is even teaching and should not be teaching a university class. Very unhelpful and overall course was disorganized. Not to mention the exam was a disaster, half the class failed.

This guy is one of the most arrogant and falsely opinionated person I've ever met. Mocks students in the most dim-witted ways. Can't believe I'm paying to witness his incredibly loose grasp on the art he is teaching - which is exemplified in his own work. Intellectual light-weight holding absolute no ability in teaching a University level class.

He was an absolutely amazing professor. He used rubrics for all of his assignments and was clear as to what he expected for each assignment, providing examples of poor and exceptional quality with explanations. There were no surprises and the exam was exactly as he defined it. I would take any course with him again.
Biggest joke at McMaster. The man does not even know how to make a website, yet grades students on their skills. I consistently wonder where he found his degrees

His marking is terrible. It is entirely opinion based, and he gives no criticism of value. He does not deserve to teach at any institution. His lectures are filled with watching YouTube videos that are not relevant to anything.

Prof is straight forward about his expectations. On one assignment I got carried away and didn't pay much attention to his advice..I didn't end up with a great mark although I thought I did an excellent job. My point is - pay attention to his expectations. If you do, its an easy 80+ on assignments.
Overall, Professor Hamilton was a very easy person to get along with, and was very helpful when i reached out for it

Extremely opinionated, not willing to give help when you ask and doesn't seem to care about his students. He will act like a kind, understanding person in class, but if you go talk to him personally, he is cold, insensitive and uninterested in whatever you have to say. I hope I never have him as a prof again - 2 classes was more than enough.

Dumbest class I've ever taken doesn't have any marking scheme and gives good marks to whatever he thinks looks nice. Also doesn't explain how we are marked, as he told us at the beginning of the term 20% would be marked on tutorial attendance. Went to every class and still finished with only 75% of the tutorial mark without any explanation
terrible

Students get to caught up in his wittyness, and forget the fact that he is a poor instructor. He seems to have no understanding of others creativity and claims not to have a bias against others work. but its whatever. Ok person, but poor professor

A less than mediocre instructor, and an intellectual light-weight. He gives very aimless lectures. He is inconsistent with marking and his criticisms are highly invalid. When you look at the work he's done, any credibility for his artistic sensibilities you may have had go right out the window. That said, his classes are fairly easy.
Terrible professor. Doesn't help you, is vague with instructions and has no patience whatsoever. He is also extremely opinionated and doesn't ever give you the mark you deserve.

Somewhat lacking in confidence, and very inconsistent.  Uses no rubric of any kind.  Course book was a great coffeetable book, but we never used half of it, and it barely related to the assignments.  He knows a fair bit about animation, but is weaker at leading a class or relating to his students.  Failed to live up to my expectations.

Wish he could make his lectures more interesting and go in depth on how to use certain software. Final test was easy. He tells you what will be on the test so it is important to show up to every class. >Take notes!!

I took both 2a03 and 2h03 with Hamilton. To start, I'll say that I did very well in both classes. Classes were for the most part interesting and fun, however, his criticism was problematic. It seemed to be based on personal taste and not at all academically grounded-NOT constructive and very unclear. I will avoid his classes in the future.

He has no idea what he's talking about. He plays favourites and does really come down harder on people who know what they're doing. His taste levels are pretty questionable, and he doesn't use a rubric of any kind when marking. As the previous commenter said, arc the quality of your work to avoid getting crapped on at the end of the semester.

This guy has absolutely no idea regarding what he is talking about nor what he wants. Often says one thing then contradicts himself.  In addition, he is very awkward and is unable to justify the BS that comes out of his mouth. At the end of the semester, he showed his work to the class and it was dreadful making his teaching hard to take seriously.

Ignore the people saying negative things about Hamilton; they're just angry that they didn't do good in his class (because they aren't any good themselves), and are taking it out on him. These are second and third year courses, you're expected to have some prior knowledge to the stuff he teaches us. He's not gonna hold your hand the whole course.
Very direction was given to students in regards to final project and presentation. Changed his mind often and played favourites with some students.

He plays favourites to the MAX.  YOu can tell who he loves and their marks show it.  Moreover, he DOES NOT KNOW WHAT HE IS TALKING ABOUT.  I think his very limited artistic background has made him very closed-minded and UNacademic.

This guy has some incredible graphic design and multimedia experience... I think I cought his CV online and it was full of amazing things he's done and schools he has attended. Yes, HE IS CRITICAL, but at least he's honest and wants good work unlike some profs in multimedia who continually accept mediocere work. Sometimes he's off the mark tho.

Useless!  Thinks it is funny when your grandmother dies.  Most unorganized person I've ever met.  If I would have had him in first year I would've dropped right out of multimedia and saved my money... and then I would've dropped out of life knowing that a reputable university employs such a useless and careless individual.
Great Prof, helped me get a job in multimedia. Passionate and a funny guy
No Comments

I'm torn on what to say about him.  I have had him for so many classes and some have been AWESOME and some have been mediocure.  He can be right on the mark...and other days he can be completely condesending.  He plays favorites so its hard to compete.
A wonderful, understanding prof who's very passionate about what he teaches. Wacky, lots of fun, yet serious about Mmedia--makes classes enjoyable!
He's funny, helpful and the videos are great. Good class.
No Comments

Ole' Scamilton pulls grades from his arse, and comes down harder on students who know what they're doing. (in a completely condescending, ignorant way that doesn't challenge the student)Do yourself a favor and arc the quality of your work over the term.
he is such a great prof. SO down to earth. he is willing to help you with everything and anything! way to go hamilton!
he is really funny especially with his kids
this is a self-taught class.  why doesn't he just stay at home?
Rock On Hamilton the only person who should be allowed in multimedia
No Comments
Animation is a really cool class!

comments: Hate this prof so much she doesn't teach at all you literally have to teach everything yourself

If you enjoy teaching yourself and have previous experience with Economics, you will do well in this course. If not, you may suffer. I recommend reading the textbook and then using her videos for clarification.

You really don't need a textbook for econ courses! She was a decent professor but the tests were worded very strangely! The concepts of the course were really easy, but they required a lot of time, which I found were not necessary.
her lectures suck and you need to watch the videos and read the book to actually understand whats going on
She didn't talk much during lectures and wanted us to learn from her videos only. Also forced us to buy her useless textbook. I learned next to nothing from her.
Tests/Exam are weighted heavily. She does a good job preparing students and is aware of the concepts students struggle with.
everything is online, one class a week. tutorial is useful! midterms are hard, exam was easy  READ READ READ. watch all her videos

I personally found this class easy but I also took Econ in high school (IB). Aplia is basically free marks and is easy if you do the readings. If you do the readings and take your own THOROUGH notes/study your own notes you'll ace this class. Her powerpoints  and vids don't have everything, use just those and you'll be fine but not amazing

She can be rude at times in class (i.e. do NOT walk through the front doors in MDCL after lecture begins or she will literally sneer at you). In-class lectures were mainly iclicker questions, very little in terms of new material. Some questions are on midterms so make  sure to copy them down. Just make sure to watch the videos and you'll be fine.

She is the worst teacher. One lecture a week and is behind the class. You are a week ahead and most of her lecture is spent answering questions and not  covering material.  Her online videos are nice, but she you cant get your questions answered usually. Tracks if you watch her videos. If you dont your questions will be met with rude replies.
I HATED her flipped classroom situation for macro 1bb3.
Lectures are pretty useless, one a week the rest online. Easy 12 if you watch her online videos and do the aplia homework. If you have any basic math skills, the algebra in this course is trivial.
Loved the online lectures that she posted before the weekly online quizzes.  Was great to be able to pause and rewind while taking notes.  She knows her stuff and is thorough in her lecturing.

Great class. Easy enough to receive a good grade if you put a little bit of time in. I'd suggest doing the optional online homework. Lecture podcasts are very convenient if you happen to miss a lecture (at 8:30, this might happen every once in a while).

Very clear about what she expects from students, and the format of her lectures is really efficient as each lecture consists of only 4-6 slides each. O'Shaughnessy knows what students find hard and spends extra time on the material, she also reviews test questions that people did poorly on. Great prof overall, though slightly scary

She's a great prof, would definitely take again.  If you go to the lectures you'll do well.  Her tests aren't particularly easy, but if you do the assigned work you'll do fine.  Great lecturer, so don't skip!

as a person she's really nice, however her course was difficult because i felt lectures were confusing...  she knows her students very well and often spent extra time on topics she knew students typically had difficulty with. enjoyed course content but it was quite difficult. read the textbook!!!
Honestly enjoyed her class, the tests were fair and the lectures always had something interesting involved with them.

Her macroecon class was such a stark contrast compared to micro. She is very clear and makes going to her lectures very worthwhile. If you attend every lecture, there is no way you shouldn't be able to get 10 or more.

Professor O'Shaughnessy is an excellent lecturer and makes it worthwhile for students to come to class by explaining the course content in easy to understand ways and sometimes giving away bonus questions. She is also very thorough, understandable, and reasonable. Highly recommend both attending her lectures and reading the course textbook.
I found this class even easier than econ 1b03 mainly due to the fact the material made more sense. Pretty easy to get over a 10 if you study.
Shes a good prof, seems like it all makes sense in lecture. If only she'd make her tests a bit easier, she'd be an outstanding prof.
tough course but not impossible
very helpful and clear when it comes to explaining the conent
Mean, terrible teacher, if you have a choice, avoid her.
Great lecturer. Loves to teach.

Really great prof! Very fair, offers many resources for you to do well such as easy online homework to keep you in check, answers questions well. Always had organized lectures and slideshows. Do the readings and the homework and you should get a great mark easily.

She is such an awesome lecturer. So many times near the end of the course I didn't understand the textbook and she explains it perfectly in lecture. Her tests aren't easy but if you go to class and do the readings, you'll definitely be fine.
I've had her twice and I found her very approachable and clear. One of my favorite profs at Mac!
She was an excellent prof! She was engaging and taught the material effectively.
She's knows her stuff, and can communicate it to you really well.
evil,mean,doesnt even post notes on avenue, tests are hard as hell, hannahs a way better lecturer than her as least she puts up lecture slides on avenue so that we dont have to buy the textbook
Speaks very clear and grabs your attention, one of my best profs so far.Aplia and the textbook are very helpful
Such a great prof!
Get her lecture notes and do Aplia. It helps. Pretty fair all around.
My favourite prof of first year hands down :)
She is smart. Enjoys her area of work.
A great professor, easy to listen to and very clear on explaining concepts learned in class.
The best prof I've had at mac... it was my first experience with econ and she really changed the way I see things.

Hands down, my favourite prof so far. Her explanations are crystal, she's concise and makes great connections to current events. I will advise you to NEVER use your cell phone in class because she'll call you out infront of everyone in MDCL 1305. WAY better than micro (econ 1B03).

She is a great prof! She explains the material very well in class, provides good practice material and is useful in clarifying questions. She is also concise in her lectures not adding worthless filler material, which is a bonus.
Easy class, wasn't a fan of her lectures though, didn't teach much and just went on tangents. Eventually didn't end up going, she has her podcasts online so you can just watch them.
Not hot, first of all. Lectures are useless and teach at best 3 concepts from each chapter.
Good teacher, notes well organized and fully online.
Hot!
Fantastic prof! Her explanations are really clear and she seems to actually care about the well-being of her students. :)

She is a great prof.  I've had her for 2 different classes.  Her tests are challenging, but they are fair.  Don't try to cram the night before or you'll be in trouble.  I didn't do so hot on the first test, and I went to her for help and she was very good about telling how to improve, and I finished the course with an A-.

Well organized lectures and she explains the material well. She's very snarly though and not very approachable. God help you if your cell phone goes off in class. Her jokes are really lame but hilarious. Overall good teacher but kinda scary.

She is middle of the road on helpfulness (not great).  She is very articulate and clear. Even though her classes are difficult she does a good job of explaining.  Her personality is a little snarly.  She is a bit grumpy and gets frustrated if people don't respond to her class questions.
Interesting class, assignments were all written - by they were quite easily and preferable to multiple choice.
She really cares about what she teaches and it shows. I really enjoyed this course and I had not expectex that I would. she made it accessible and interesting.
Keeps me awake in class
Awesome teacher, she knows her stuff!!!
No Comments
A very good teacher; her lectures are clear and go at a good pace, so you are never worried about missing something that she's said
love her, makes things understandable.

comments: He was a good prof: engaging, funny and enthusiastic. His demos were really interesting and made summer class bearable. Too bad he won't be teaching anymore, he was pretty cool for a physics professor. He was also really really cute.
AWESOME prof! he shows tons of demos so you really understand the concepts!
Great prof! No complaints, excited to attend his class! Fun and relate-able, brought his electric guitar to class! Funny and very intelligent.
Great prof! Would take this class again in a minute
very nice and understanding prof... however the course is DEADLY boring if you have any background knowledge of physics because it moves very slow hes a really good prof overall though.
Ken was one of the best profs I had in my first year-very helpful, and very patient!
Best professor, I've ever had
awesome lecturer. Google Ken Sills for more info! he's so smart and i love the demos he brings to class!

amazzingg proff!!! hes currently teaching me phys 1bo3 E for idiots who didnt take physics in highschool THANKS TO UR LOVELY HIGHSCHOOL COUNSELLOURS... but anywais although the classs moves at a sppeeed of A SEVERLY **** SNAIL i love his lectures!!!! lots of demos, funny, reallys  nice prof,explains, spood feeds u! yea, two thumbs up for him

He's a good prof but he's very very condescending. I went with my friend once to get her test back from his office and she didn't do very well and all he could tell her is how bad she was gona fail BUT she ended up passing the class...he could be A LOT nicer.
he looks like bill nye the sceince guy!!
He says the "you will get ZERO..." phrase way too many times! Other than that, he's good.
No Comments
No Comments
he has an interesting class, but he thinks he's some sort of physiscs god! Which is kind of sad. I think he's just a lonely little man that gets off on other peoples unhappyness!
good prof in the sense that he is easy to listen to.  bad prof in the sense that he can mean and jerkish and really condescending.  not cool!!!  anyways he is overall pretty good.  be nicer!
Great prof, and i'm sad summer is over. No more short shorts
Excellent prof.  Knows stuff.  Interesting to students, interesting lecturer.  Approachable.  Gifted teacher of the concepts.  Two Thumbs up!  Love the waterbottle and sweaters.
good guy!  changed my entire 2nd term schedule so i could be in his lecture.  demos are are awesome and really apply what he is talking about.  havent missed a lecture!
Wicked, wicked teacher!
AWESOME. Sills keeps sticking it to the man.
ken sills - owns
yey!
sills is a champ. best prof EVER

Sills I gotta say you made my physics day.  The demos were great and the only time you totally confused me you admitted it confused you too (maybe you were just doing that to make me feel warm and fuzzy).  Keep up the great work, you sexy beast! :-O
Sills has got to be the wackiest professor ever.  He'll cheat in physics just to astound us -- like that disc that rolled _up_ the ramp, or the strange bicycle wheel of doom.
Entertaining, informative, enthusiastic, helpful, and knowledgeable.
very nice,good guy.
very nice professor, humorous, close to students, etc. VERY FUN LECTURES EVEN AT 8:30 IN THE MORNING

comments: Henderson is a renowned hottie whose classes often feature a leftist, outsider perspective on Canadian History. Is young and hip, and his focus is often on Toronto in his personal works. Offers a lot of readings, but usually not too many textbooks. Fun moderator in his seminars, where he isn't afraid to make his stance known and challenge arguments

I found Henderson was successful in providing important, relevant, and compelling information which he presented during lectures in interesting ways. Henderson is a cultural historian, thus his lecturing engages in a cultural understanding of historical events. Fair grader and has clear expectations for assignments. Well organized/delivered course.

Dr. Henderson is a very knowledgeable prof. He tries to make his lectures interesting (as interesting as Canadian history gets) and is clear about his expectations for tests/assignments. His tests are pretty easy and deal with key terms so you have the ability to elaborate. Over-all a very good prof and would recommend.

His lectures are very dry, he doesnt project his voice, and is very unreasonable with planning his midterms and finals. Makes you study way more than what will be on the exam. Thats what makes the class hard. I wouldnt recommend a class with him.

Amazing prof and really interesting content. His lectures are very clear and I really liked how he incorporated movie and music clips. He's also a very fair marker- you need to actually go to class and do the readings but he makes it so interesting I don't understand why anyone would skip. He also relates really well to students and is very funny.
Makes Canadian history not boring. If you put in the effort you get a good grade in return. He is a fair grader.

I love love LOVE this man! This is the first time I've ever enjoyed a Canadian history class--he actually engages issues in a meaningful and realistic way. You need to actually put forth effort to get a good grade, but he's by no means a "hard" professor. Very available and helpful. Also pretty!
I think he's a really great prof. Kind of dry, especially considering it's a night class, but overall he's a lot better than most of the history teachers at Mac.

History 3J03. Stuart is a condescending arrogant man. He is EXTREMELY unhelpful (only reachable by phone, no office hours, leaves class right away), assignments are very unclear. I regret taking his class very much and would NEVER take another.
Prof's style of teaching is great, easy to follow and very informative. One of the best professors I've had thus far.
A fine professor, but extremely opinionated and very leftist. His lectures can get a little dry and he does not put much text on his slides, so you really need to listen to what he is saying.
Boss
Dr. Henderson is a great professor. I highly recommend taking any class he is teaching. Unfortunately, I only discovered this rare gem in my last year at mac.

His lectures were fun and entertaining. He tended to focus more on concepts, culture, and ideas rather than details so reading the textbook was essential for understanding the course fully. his lectures were very clearly organized, allowing me to take good notes for the final.
amazing prof .. kept lectures interesting, and course readings were always interesting.

He's a cultural historian, and so did not focus his lectures on detail, which takes away from the typical approach to history. More thematic and concept orientated. Didn't learn much as it seemed to me a self taught course :(

Amazing prof! He's a cultural historian, so his lectures focus more on the development of ideas, which I think is more interesting than just the straight facts. The class actually helped me understand Canada so much better and I loved attending lectures.

This prof is absolutely amazing. Great guy, really clear, very helpful, makes the material very interesting. He's engaging and passionate. Requires solid work ethic, but when you put in the effort, you get the good grade.
This man is a boss.

Stuart Henderson was great, he's extremely helpful and funny. I thought this class was great. he put all the books on reserve, aware that as a "book club" this would be a costly course. Very open and engaging.

Dr. Henderson is really great. I don't often find lectures engaging, especially history lectures, but find that with this class I actually enjoy the material because of the interesting presentation. Pictures and films help make the material less dry. He's funny and interactive and although he lectures quickly he makes important points clear.
Both Canadian History classes I took with Henderson were amazing! Usually Canadian History is pretty dry but he made it really enjoyable!
awesome
Good professor, enjoyed his class
Stewie ROCKS!!He suits up, Barney Stinson styles

Dr. Henderson took material that would have otherwise been very dry and tried to put an interesting spin on it very effectively. At times, his lecturing was too quick but he followed the text pretty closely and if you read that you were pretty good.

I was dreading taking this class, but found it throughly enjoyable thanks to Dr. Henderson. He knows his stuff and makes the content fun. The readings did suck, but apparently that wasn't his fault?  Either way, he is an awesome prof :)
Nice guy.Funny.Lectures too fast.Can't take constructive criticism. Failed to give any sort of exam review.

His lectures are a bit fast-paced, but good. He's clear in teaching, and does make it very interesting. Even the boring subject matter seems cool. The only problem is he gives too many readings per week.

Prof Henderson is by far the best professor I have ever had. He is so nice, really funny, and very helpful. He makes the class so interesting! He has such a body of knowledge and I think I speak for everyone when I say we love him
Brilliant lecturer and impressive scholar.  His course was one of the most enjoyable and informative courses I have ever taken.  He is the very definition of a committed intellectual.
No Comments
